Sense.DEF: a photograph taken quickly and often not very skilfully

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a snapshot of his girlfriend
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张他女友的快照

Sense.DEF: a piece of information that quickly gives you an idea of what the situation is like at a particular time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The book gives us a snapshot of life in the Middle Ages.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书向我们简要介绍了中世纪的生活。

Sense.DEF: a trap for catching an animal, especially one that uses a wire or rope to catch the animal by its foot
Sense.EXAMPLE: A rabbit was caught in the snare.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一只兔子被套索套住了。

Sense.DEF: something that is intended to trick someone and get them into a difficult situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t want to fall into the same snare again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可不想再落入同样的圈套。

Sense.DEF: to catch an animal by using a snare
to get something or someone you want in a clever way, often by deceiving other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s hoping to snare a wealthy husband.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她希望能钓到一个金龟婿。

Sense.DEF: a small flat drum that makes a hard continuous sound when you hit it
to eat something quickly, especially in an untidy or noisy way
Sense.EXAMPLE: workers snarfing lunch at their desks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在办公桌前狼吞虎咽地吃午餐的员工

Sense.DEF:
annoyed, or saying rude things in an annoyed or
sarcastic
way
Sense.TRAN: 讽刺挖苦的﹐出言不逊的

Sense.DEF: if an animal snarls, it makes a low angry sound and shows its teeth
Sense.TRAN: 〔动物龇牙咧嘴低声地〕咆哮﹐吼

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dog growled and snarled at me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条狗对着我龇牙咧嘴地狂嗥。

Sense.DEF: to speak or say something in a nasty, angry way
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Shut up,’ he snarled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “住口。”他怒吼道。

Sense.DEF: to prevent traffic from moving
Sense.EXAMPLE: Traffic snarled up on both sides of the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 路上双向的交通都堵塞了。

Sense.DEF: a confused situation that prevents work from continuing
a situation in which traffic is prevented from moving
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a big snarl-up on the M1.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一号高速公路上交通严重堵塞。

Sense.DEF: to take something away from someone with a quick, often violent, movement
Sense.EXAMPLE: The thief snatched her purse and ran.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小偷抢了她的钱包就跑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Keith snatches toys away from the other children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 基思把玩具从其他小孩那里抢走。

Sense.DEF: to take someone away from a person or place, especially by force
Sense.EXAMPLE: Vargas was snatched from his home by two armed men.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瓦尔加斯被两名持枪男子从家中抓走。

Sense.DEF: to quickly get something, especially sleep or rest, because you do not have very much time
Sense.TRAN: 抓紧时间〔做某事﹐尤指睡觉或休息〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I managed to snatch an hour’s sleep on the train.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在火车上抓紧时间睡了一小时。

Sense.DEF: to quickly put out your hand to try to take or hold something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jessie snatched at the bag but I pulled it away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰西伸手去抓袋子﹐但我给拿开了。

Sense.DEF: a short part of a conversation, song etc that you hear
Sense.TRAN: 谈话/音乐/歌曲等的片段
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could hear snatches of the conversation from across the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能听到房间那头传来的只言片语。

Sense.DEF: for short periods
Sense.EXAMPLE: I only slept in snatches during the night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我夜里只是断断续续地睡了几觉。

Sense.DEF: when someone quickly takes or steals something
Sense.EXAMPLE: reports of a bag snatch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抢夺手提包的报道

Sense.DEF: a very offensive word for a woman’s sex organ. Do not use this word.
a group of police officers or soldiers who go quickly into a crowd, in order to catch people who are causing trouble
Sense.TRAN: 〔在人群中抓闹事者的〕特别搜 捕队

Sense.DEF: bright, fashionable, and attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: a snazzy red jacket
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件鲜艳夺目的红色外套

Sense.DEF: to go somewhere secretly and quietly in order to avoid being seen or heard

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They sneaked off without paying!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们没付钱就溜了！
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She snuck out of the house once her parents were asleep.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她父母刚一睡着她就溜出了家门。

Sense.DEF: to hide something and take it somewhere or give it to someone secretly
Sense.EXAMPLE: I snuck her a note.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我偷偷塞给她一张纸条。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Douglas had sneaked his camera into the show.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 道格拉斯偷偷把照相机带进了展览会。

Sense.DEF: to look at something quickly and secretly, especially something that you are not supposed to see
Sense.TRAN: 偷看一眼〔尤指不该看的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sneaked a look at her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他偷偷地看了她一眼。

Sense.DEF: to quickly and secretly steal something unimportant or of little value
Sense.TRAN: 偷﹐偷拿〔不重要或不太值钱的东西〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We used to sneak cigarettes from Dad.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们以前老是从爸爸那里偷香烟。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone such as a parent or teacher about something that another person has done wrong, because you want to cause trouble for that person
Sense.TRAN: 〔向家长或老师〕告发﹐打…的小报告
Sense.EXAMPLE: A little brat named Oliver sneaked on me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个叫奥利弗的小子告了我的状。

Sense.DEF: to come near someone very quietly, so that they do not see you until you reach them
Sense.TRAN: 偷偷地走近﹐蹑手蹑脚地靠近

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wish you wouldn’t sneak up on me like that!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不要这样偷偷摸摸地走过来好不好！

Sense.DEF: a child who other children dislike, because they tell adults about bad things that the other children have done
Sense.TRAN: 打小报告的孩子﹐告状的小孩
Sense.EXAMPLE: You little sneak!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这个打小报告的家伙！

Sense.DEF: someone who is not liked because they do things secretly and cannot be trusted
Sense.TRAN: 鬼鬼祟祟的人﹐偷偷摸摸的人

Sense.DEF: doing things very secretly and quickly, so that people do not notice you or cannot stop you
Sense.TRAN: 偷偷的﹐令人猝不及防的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sneak attack
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 偷袭
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sneak thief
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人猝不及防的小偷

Sense.DEF:
a type of light soft shoe with a rubber
sole bottom
, used for sports
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pair of white sneakers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一双白色的运动鞋

Sense.DEF: to have a feeling about something or someone, but to not say anything about it because you are not sure or you might be embarrassed
Sense.TRAN: 隐隐觉得/暗中怀疑/暗地钦佩
Sense.EXAMPLE: I always had a sneaking admiration for him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直暗暗地钦佩他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had a sneaking suspicion that he was lying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她暗中怀疑他在说谎。

Sense.DEF: an occasion when you can see a film, play, product etc before it is shown to people in general
Sense.EXAMPLE: In this week’s show, we’ll be giving you a sneak preview of Steven Spielberg’s latest film.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本周的节目中﹐我们将为大家预映史蒂文•斯皮尔伯格的最新影片。

Sense.DEF: doing things in a secret and often dishonest or unfair way
Sense.TRAN: 偷偷摸摸的﹐鬼鬼祟祟的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sneaky little trick
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鬼鬼祟祟的小把戏

Sense.DEF: to smile or speak in a very unkind way that shows you have no respect for someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Is that your best outfit?’ he sneered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那就是你最好的衣服了？”他讥笑道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She sneered at Tom’s musical tastes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她嘲笑汤姆的音乐品位。

Sense.DEF: an unkind smile or remark that shows you have no respect for something or someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You probably wouldn’t understand,’ he said with a sneer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你可能明白不了。”他冷笑了一声说道。

Sense.DEF: if you sneeze, air suddenly comes from your nose, making a noise, for example when you have a cold
Sense.EXAMPLE: She started coughing and sneezing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她开始咳嗽﹑打喷嚏。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dust was making him sneeze .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 灰尘使他打起了喷嚏。

Sense.DEF: used about an offer, especially of money, that is very good, and which you should consider carefully
Sense.TRAN: 不可轻视﹐值得认真考虑
Sense.EXAMPLE: In those days, £5 an hour was not to be sneezed at.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时候﹐每小时五英镑可小看不得。

Sense.DEF: the act or sound of sneezing
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a loud sneeze from someone in the back of the audience.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 后面的观众中有人大声打了个喷嚏。

Sense.DEF: to laugh quietly and in a way that is not nice at something which is not supposed to be funny

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The other students snickered at Steve.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他学生都偷偷地笑史蒂夫。

Sense.DEF: if you say something snide, you say something unkind, often in a clever, indirect way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a snide remark about her clothes
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对她穿着的嘲讽

Sense.DEF: to breathe air into your nose noisily, for example when you are crying or have a cold
Sense.TRAN: 〔因哭泣﹑感冒等大声地〕以鼻吸气﹔抽鼻子
Sense.EXAMPLE: Margaret sniffed miserably and nodded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛格丽特可怜地抽泣着点了点头。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop sniffing and blow your nose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别抽鼻子了﹐擤一擤鼻涕。

Sense.DEF: to breathe air in through your nose in order to smell something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He opened the milk and sniffed it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打开牛奶闻了闻。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dog was sniffing at the carpet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条狗在嗅地毯。

Sense.DEF: to say something in a way that shows you think something is not good enough
Sense.TRAN: 嗤之以鼻地说﹐轻蔑地说
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Is that all?’ she sniffed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “就那些？”她不屑地说道。

Sense.DEF: to take a harmful drug by breathing it up your nose
Sense.EXAMPLE: kids who sniff glue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸胶毒的孩子

Sense.LEXUNIT: sth is not to be sniffed at
Sense.DEF: used to say that something is good enough to be accepted or considered seriously
Sense.TRAN: 某事值得接受[认真考虑]﹐某事不可轻视
Sense.EXAMPLE: An 8% salary increase is not to be sniffed at. 8%
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 的加薪不可不考虑呀。

Sense.DEF: to refuse something in a proud way, or behave as if something is not good enough for you
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sniffed at my choice of restaurants and suggested his own favorite.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对我挑选的餐馆不以为然﹐提出去他喜欢的那家。

Sense.DEF: to discover or find something by its smell
Sense.EXAMPLE: A customs officer came round with a dog to sniff out drugs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名海关官员带了一条狗过来嗅探毒品。

Sense.DEF: to find out or discover something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Vic’s been trying to sniff out where you went last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 维克一直在打听昨晚你去了什么地方。

Sense.DEF: when you breathe in air noisily through your nose, for example in order to smell something, because you have a cold, or in order to show your disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sniff of disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哼一声表示反对
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave a loud sniff .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很响地抽了一下鼻子。

Sense.DEF: a small amount or sign of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He got us into this mess, and then left at the first sniff of trouble !
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给我们惹了这样的麻烦﹐然后一看情况不妙就溜之大吉了！

Sense.DEF: to examine a place carefully

Sense.LEXUNIT: not get a sniff of sth
Sense.DEF: to not have any chance of getting something or being successful
Sense.TRAN: 毫无希望得到某物﹔毫无〔成功〕的希望
Sense.EXAMPLE: He never even got a sniff of the target.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他根本连这个目标的边儿都没沾上。

Sense.DEF: a dog that has been trained to find drugs or explosives by using its sense of smell
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于探查毒品和炸药的〕嗅探犬

Sense.DEF: to keep sniffing in order to stop liquid from running out of your nose, especially when you are crying or you have a cold
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在哭泣或感冒时〕不停地抽鼻子
Sense.EXAMPLE: For goodness’ sake, stop sniffling!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看在老天爷面上﹐别再抽鼻子了！

Sense.DEF: if you have the sniffles, you keep sniffing, especially because you have a cold
having a disapproving attitude towards something or someone, especially because you think they are not good enough for you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Well, don’t get sniffy about it!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐别这么不屑一顾的样子！

Sense.DEF:
a special large glass for drinking
brandy
a small amount of an alcoholic drink
to laugh quietly in a way that is not nice at something which is not supposed to be funny

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What are you sniggering at? This is a serious poem.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你偷笑什么？ 这是一首严肃的诗。

Sense.DEF: to cut something by making quick cuts with scissors
Sense.EXAMPLE: I snipped the string and untied the parcel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我剪断绳子﹐解开包裹。

GramExa.GLOSS: remove it by snipping
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Snip the ends of the beans off before you cook them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 先把菜豆两头剪掉然后再煮。

Sense.DEF: a quick small cut with scissors
to be surprisingly cheap
Sense.EXAMPLE: At £20 for a dozen, they’re a snip.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20 英镑一打﹐真便宜。

Sense.DEF: to shoot from a hidden position at people who are not protected

GramExa.EXAMPLE: soldiers sniping at civilians
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 朝平民打冷枪的士兵

Sense.DEF: to criticize someone in a nasty way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His former associates have been sniping at him in the press.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从前的合伙人在报上诽谤他。

Sense.DEF: a bird with a very long thin beak that lives in wet areas
Sense.TRAN: 沙锥〔嘴细长﹑栖于湿地的一种鸟〕

Sense.DEF: someone who shoots at people from a hidden position
a small piece of news, information, or conversation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: snippets of information
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条条信息

Sense.DEF: quick to show that you are angry or offended, or that you will not obey someone
Sense.TRAN: 脾气急躁的﹔目中无人的

Sense.DEF: to be very annoyed about something, especially in a way that other people think is unreasonable
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s been in a snit ever since the party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那次聚会之后她就一直怄着气。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone in authority about something that another person has done wrong, because you want to cause trouble for that person

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Somebody snitched on me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人打了我的小报告。

Sense.DEF: to quickly steal something unimportant or of little value
Sense.TRAN: 偷﹐偷窃〔不重要或不太值钱的东西〕

Sense.DEF: someone who is not liked because they tell people in authority when other people do things that are wrong or against the rules
Sense.EXAMPLE: He didn’t want to be a snitch, and besides, Kevin was his friend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不想当告密者﹐再说凯文是他的朋友。

Sense.DEF: annoyed, or rude to someone because you are annoyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: I get snitty about bad service in restaurants.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 饭店服务不好﹐我就来火。

Sense.DEF: to behave or speak in a weak complaining way, especially when you are crying
Sense.EXAMPLE: A small boy was sniveling on a chair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个小男孩在椅子上抽泣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a snivelling coward
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个哭哭啼啼的胆小鬼

Sense.DEF: someone who thinks they are better than people from a lower social class – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop being such a snob.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别这么势利眼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to sound like a snob, but I thought she was vulgar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想像个势利小人﹐但我觉得她就是庸俗。

Sense.DEF: someone who thinks they are better than other people because they know more about something – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 自以为学识渊博的人﹐自命不凡的人〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bunch of intellectual snobs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群自命不凡的知识分子

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 因为懂音乐/会品葡萄酒而自命不凡的人

Sense.DEF: something that has snob value is liked by people who think they are better than other people
Sense.TRAN: 满足虚荣心的价值/吸引力
Sense.EXAMPLE: That kind of car has real snob appeal .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那种汽车很合贪慕虚荣者的口味。

Sense.DEF: behaviour or attitudes which show that you think you are better than other people, because you belong to a higher social class or know much more than they do – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 势利 行为[态度]﹐自命不凡〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 知识分子的自命不凡

Sense.DEF: behaving in a way that shows you think you are better than other people because you are from a higher social class or know more than they do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her family seems snobbish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她家里人好像挺势利的。

Sense.DEF: if two people snog, they kiss each other, especially for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: I saw them snogging in the corner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到他们在角落里长吻。

Sense.DEF: a game played especially in Britain on a special table covered in green cloth, in which two people use long sticks to hit coloured balls into holes at the sides and corners of the table
Sense.EXAMPLE: They meet up every Friday to play snooker .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们每周五碰头打斯诺克台球。

Sense.DEF: to make it impossible for someone to do what they want to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the council refuses our planning application, we’re snookered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果政务委员会不批准我们的规划申请﹐我们就完了。

Sense.DEF: to try to find out about someone’s private affairs by secretly looking in their house, examining their possessions etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I caught him snooping around in my office.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我撞见他在我的办公室里鬼鬼祟祟的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: reporters snooping on celebrities
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 窥探名人隐私的记者

Sense.DEF: rude and unfriendly, because you think you are better than other people
Sense.TRAN: 傲慢的﹐目中无人的﹐妄自尊大的
Sense.EXAMPLE: snooty neighbours
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目中无人的邻居

Sense.DEF: to sleep lightly for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dad was snoozing in his armchair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸在扶手椅里打盹。

Sense.DEF:
part of an
alarm clock
that you press to turn off the
alarm
for a short period of time, so that you can sleep a little longer
Sense.TRAN: 〔闹钟上的〕间歇按钮﹐贪睡键﹐小睡催醒按钮

Sense.DEF: something that is very boring
to breathe in a noisy way through your mouth and nose while you are asleep
Sense.EXAMPLE: He could hear the old man snoring.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他听到老人在打鼾。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I heard a snore and knew he’d fallen asleep.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听见鼾声﹐就知道他已经睡着了。

Sense.DEF: a tube that allows someone who is swimming to breathe air under water
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is the best snorkel at that price.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是那个价钱的呼吸管中最好的。

Sense.DEF: when you swim under water using a snorkel
Sense.TRAN: 使用水下呼吸管潜水﹐浮潜
Sense.EXAMPLE: We went snorkeling in Hawaii.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们去夏威夷潜水了。

Sense.DEF: to breathe air in a noisy way out through your nose, especially to show that you are annoyed or amused
Sense.TRAN: 发哼声﹔哼着鼻子〔尤表示被惹恼或逗乐〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Certainly not,’ he snorted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “当然不是。”他哼了一声说。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She snorted with laughter .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她扑哧一笑。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The horse snorted and stamped its hoof impatiently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那匹马不耐烦地又打响鼻又用蹄子刨地。

Sense.DEF: to take drugs by breathing them in through your nose
Sense.EXAMPLE: snorting cocaine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸食可卡因

Sense.DEF: a loud sound made by breathing out through your nose, especially to show that you are annoyed or amused
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤表示被惹恼或逗乐的〕哼声﹐喷鼻息声
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave a loud snort .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他大声地哼了一下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were snorts of laughter from the audience.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 观众中发出哧哧的笑声。

Sense.DEF: a small amount of a drug that is breathed in through the nose
Sense.EXAMPLE: a snort of cocaine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用鼻吸入的一点可卡因

Sense.DEF:
an impolite word for the thick
mucus liquid
produced in your nose

someone who is
snotty
Sense.EXAMPLE: the little snot
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个妄自尊大的小人

Sense.DEF: someone who is snotty is rude and annoying, especially because they think that they are more important than other people - used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 高傲的﹐妄自尊大的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: some snotty little clerk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 某个自大的小职员

Sense.DEF:
wet and dirty with
mucus
Sense.TRAN: 满是湿乎乎的脏鼻涕的

Sense.DEF: used about an annoying child
Sense.EXAMPLE: a snotty-nosed little kid
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个讨厌的小孩

Sense.DEF: the long nose of some kinds of animals, such as pigs
a criminal who gives information about other crimi-nals to the police
Sense.TRAN: 向警方告发其同伙的罪犯

Sense.DEF: soft white pieces of frozen water that fall from the sky in cold weather and cover the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: Snow was falling heavily as we entered the village.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们进村的时候雪下得正大。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could see footprints in the snow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到雪地里有脚印。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The town was buried under three feet of snow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小镇被三英尺厚的积雪覆盖着。

Sense.DEF: a period of time in which snow falls
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of the heaviest snows this winter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年冬天最大的几场雪之一

Sense.DEF: a large amount of snow that has fallen at different times during the winter
Sense.EXAMPLE: the melting of the winter snows
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冬雪的融化

Sense.DEF: small white spots on a television picture, caused by bad weather conditions, weak television signals etc
Sense.TRAN: “雪花”（干扰）〔指电视画面中的白色小点﹐由天气不好﹑电视信号弱等原因造成〕

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Outside in the dark, snow was falling silently.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 外面漆黑一片,雪静静地飘落。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The snow was beginning to settle.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 雪开始积起来了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The snow had drifted up against the hedge.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 风把雪吹得堆积在树篱边。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The ground was covered with snow.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 大地被白雪覆盖。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The snow was quite deep in places.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些地方积雪很深。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when a lot of snow falls
Collocate.EXAMPLE: France has been expecting heavy snow all week.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国预报整周都有大雪。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I had watched the tracks I’d made disappear under fresh snow.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到我的脚印被刚落下的雪盖没了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The powdery snow flies up as I walk through it.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我走过时粉状雪纷纷扬起。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He cleared the wet snow from the car windscreen.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他除去汽车挡风玻璃上的湿雪。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when only a small amount falls

Collocate.EXAMPLE: More than eight inches of snow fell in 48 hours.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 48 小时内降雪超过了八英寸。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Within an hour, Bucharest was buried under a blanket of snow.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 不到一个小时,布加勒斯特就复上了一层厚厚的积雪。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A few flakes of snow started to fall.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 稀稀拉拉的雪花开始飘落。

Collocate.COLLOC: a flurry of snow/a snow flurry
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when a small amount of snow blows around in the wind

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We had our first fall of snow in mid-November.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 11 月中旬,我们迎来了第一场雪。

Sense.DEF: if it snows, snow falls from the sky
Sense.EXAMPLE: It snowed all night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下了一整夜雪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It started snowing around five.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 5 点钟左右天下起了雪。

Sense.DEF: to be unable to travel from a place because so much snow has fallen there
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were snowed in for three days last winter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年冬天我们被大雪困了三天。

Subsense.DEF: to have more work than you can deal with
Subsense.TRAN: 被…压得透不过气来﹐〔工作多得〕忙不过来﹐穷于应付

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I found myself snowed under with work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发觉自己工作忙不过来。

Subsense.DEF: if an area is snowed under, a lot of snow has fallen there so that people are not able to travel

Sense.DEF: to persuade someone to believe or support something, especially by lying to them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Millions of readers were snowed into believing it was a true story.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 无数读者上当﹐以为那是一个真实的故事。

Sense.DEF: a ball of snow that children make and throw at each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had a massive snowball fight .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们打了一场大雪仗。

Sense.DEF: if something has a snowball effect, it starts a series of events or changes that all happen because of each other

Sense.LEXUNIT: not have a snowball’s chance in hell
Sense.DEF: to have no chance at all
if a plan, problem, business etc snow-balls, it grows bigger at a faster and faster rate
Sense.TRAN: 〔计划﹑问题﹑生意等〕滚雪球似的迅速增大
Sense.EXAMPLE: Interest in the sport is snowballing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们对这项运动的兴趣越来越大。

Sense.DEF: someone, especially an old person, who every year leaves their home in a cold part of the US to go and live in a warm part of the US for the winter
Sense.TRAN: 〔每年迁往温暖地方过冬的〕“候鸟”老人

Sense.DEF:
a type of short
ski
that people use without the poles that are usually used with longer skis

the sport of
skiing
on snow, using snowblades
eye pain and difficulty in seeing things, caused by looking at snow in bright light from the sun
a machine that clears snow from roads, paths etc by sucking it up and blowing it away
a long wide board made of plastic, which people stand on to go down snow-covered hills as a sport
the sport of going down snow-covered hills on a snowboard

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a group of skiers and snowboarders
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群滑雪者和单板滑雪运动者

Sense.DEF: blocked or prevented from leaving a place by large amounts of snow
Sense.EXAMPLE: travelers who are snowbound at the airport
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被大雪困在机场的旅客

Sense.DEF: snow-capped mountains are covered in snow at the top
a set of chains that are fastened around the wheels of a car so that it can drive over snow without slipping

crushed ice with a coloured sweet liquid poured over it, served in a
cone
-shaped paper cup
Sense.TRAN: 〔装在圆锥形纸杯中的〕果味沙冰

Sense.DEF: a day when schools and businesses are closed because there is too much snow for people to travel
Sense.TRAN: 雪假〔指学校和企业因大雪而放假的一天〕

Sense.DEF: a deep mass of snow formed by the wind
a European plant with a small white flower which appears in early spring
an occasion when snow falls from the sky, or the amount that falls in a particular period of time
Sense.TRAN: 降雪﹔〔某一时期的〕降雪量
Sense.EXAMPLE: Heavy snowfalls are forecast.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气预报说将有大雪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an average snowfall of eight inches a year
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年平均八英寸的降雪量

Sense.DEF: an area of land that is covered in snow
a small soft flat piece of frozen water that falls as snow
a round glass object containing water, small models of people, animals etc, and very small white pieces. When you shake it, the white pieces move about and then fall like snow.
Sense.TRAN: 雪景球〔里面装有水﹑人和动物等的小模型以及白色碎片的玻璃球﹐摇一摇﹐白色碎片就会动起来﹐像下雪般飘落〕

Sense.DEF: an act of making someone believe something that is not true
the level above which snow on a mountain never melts
a simple figure of a person made of snow, made especially by children
a small vehicle with a motor that moves over snow or ice easily

a type of
pea
whose outer part is eaten as well as its seeds
a vehicle, or piece of equipment on the front of a vehicle, that is used to push snow off roads, railways etc

a position in
skiing
in which you have the fronts of your
skis
together and the backs of your skis apart. It is used to slow down and to turn.
Sense.TRAN: 〔滑雪时的〕制动滑降﹐犁式滑降
Sense.EXAMPLE: a snow plough turn
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 犁式制动转弯

Sense.DEF: an important road in a city that cars must be removed from when it snows, so that the snow can be cleared away from it
Sense.TRAN: 雪天要道〔在下雪天不准停放车辆以便扫雪的交通要道〕

Sense.DEF: a special wide flat frame that you attach to your shoe so that you can walk on deep snow without sinking
Sense.TRAN: 雪鞋〔平面框形结构﹐可固定在鞋上﹐用于在深雪中行走〕

Sense.DEF: a storm with strong winds and a lot of snow

a
snow globe
a special car tyre with a pattern of deep lines, used when driving on snow or ice
pure white
with a lot of snow
Sense.EXAMPLE: the snowy fields
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被雪覆盖的田野
Sense.EXAMPLE: one snowy January day
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1月里大雪纷飞的一天

Sense.DEF: pure white, like snow
Sense.EXAMPLE: snowy hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雪白的头发

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= senior, used after someone’s name 年纪较大的﹐老〔用于人名之后〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: James Taylor, Snr
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老詹姆斯•泰勒

Sense.DEF: to treat someone rudely, especially by ignoring them when you meet
Sense.EXAMPLE: the boys who had snubbed her in high school
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在中学里曾经冷落她的那些男孩

Sense.DEF: an act of snubbing someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eisenhower saw the action as a deliberate snub.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾森豪威尔认为这种行为就是故意怠慢。

Sense.DEF: a snub nose is short and flat and points slightly upwards
Sense.TRAN: 短平且微微上翘的鼻子

Sense.DEF: having a snub nose
Sense.TRAN: 鼻子短平且微微上翘的﹐翘鼻子的

Sense.DEF:
a small gun with a very short
barrel tube where the bullets come out

a past tense and past participle of
sneak
Sense.TRAN: sneak 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF:
to stop a
candle
burning by pressing the burning part with your fingers or by covering it
to die
if an animal snuffs, it breathes air into its nose in a noisy way, especially in order to smell something

to stop a
candle
burning by pressing the burning part with your fingers or by covering it
to stop or end something in a sudden way
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rebellion that will snuff out democracy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将会扼杀民主的一场叛乱

Sense.DEF: to kill someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: a young woman snuffed out by an unknown killer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被身份不明的凶手杀死的年轻女子

Sense.DEF: a type of tobacco in powder form, which people breathe in through their noses
Sense.EXAMPLE: He took a pinch of snuff .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他吸了一撮鼻烟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a snuff box a small box used to keep snuff in
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鼻烟盒

Sense.DEF: good enough for a particular purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of money was spent to bring the building up to snuff .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为改善这幢楼的状况花了很多钱。

Sense.DEF: to breathe noisily through your nose, sometimes because you are crying
Sense.TRAN: 呼哧呼哧地呼吸﹐抽鼻子
Sense.EXAMPLE: The little boys snuffled in their sleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小男孩们睡着了还在抽鼻子。

Sense.DEF: a room, building, or space that is snug is small, warm, and comfortable, and makes you feel protected
Sense.TRAN: 〔房间﹑建筑或空间〕小而温暖舒适的﹐安适的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wished she were back in her snug little house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她希望自己还在她那温暖而舒适的小屋里。

Sense.DEF: someone who is snug feels comfortable, happy, and warm
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kids were warm and snug in their beds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们睡在床上﹐又暖和又舒服。

Sense.DEF: clothes that are snug fit closely
Sense.EXAMPLE: snug jeans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 紧身牛仔裤

Sense.DEF:
a small comfortable room in a
pub
to settle into a warm comfortable position

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She snuggled up in Lea’s lap to listen to the story.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她依偎在李的腿上听故事。

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize how great a feeling or quality is, or how large an amount is
Subsense.TRAN: 这么﹐如此〔用于形容情感或品质的程度﹐或者形容数量之大〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It was so embarrassing!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多么尴尬！
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Why didn’t you call? We were so worried.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么不打个电话？我们非常担心。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I love her so much.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我那么爱她。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’re being ever so quiet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们非常安静。

Subsense.DEF: as great, nice, many etc as this
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Why are you being so horrible to me?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你干吗对我这么凶？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ve never seen so many people here before!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以前从未见过这里有这么多人！
Subsense.EXAMPLE: How had they achieved it in so short a time?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这么短的时间里他们是怎么做到的？

Subsense.DEF: used when emphasizing the degree or amount of something by saying what the result is
Subsense.TRAN: 这么﹐如此〔用导致的结果来强调程度之深或数量之大〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was so weak that he could hardly stand up.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他身体虚弱得几乎站不起来了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was so much smoke that they couldn’t see across the hallway.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 烟雾浓得他们连门厅的对面都看不到。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Everything happened so quickly I hadn’t time to think.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一切都发生得这么快﹐我都来不及去思考。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The particles are so small as to be almost invisible.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些微粒小得几乎看不见。

Subsense.DEF: used before or after a verb to emphasize that someone does something a lot or to a great degree
Subsense.TRAN: 这么﹐如此〔用于动词之前或之后以强调程度〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I wish you wouldn’t fuss so as much as you do. It makes me nervous.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你别那么大惊小怪﹐弄得我很紧张。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He does so enjoy reading your letters.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他真的非常喜欢读你的信。

Subsense.DEF: used before a noun phrase to emphasize what you are saying - used especially by young people
Subsense.TRAN: 完全﹐绝对〔用于名词短语前强调所说内容﹔尤为年轻人使用〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He is just so not the right person for her.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他根本就不是适合她的那种人。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use so before an adjective and noun. Instead, it is usual to use such . Put such before ‘a’ if the noun is singular.
F2NBox.TRAN: 形容词加名词的结构之前不用 so ,一般用 such 。如名词为单数,则把 such 放在 a 之前
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Such a big increase (NOT 不说 A so big increase) in tax would be very damaging.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么大幅度的增税会带来非常坏的影响。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: a world in which such terrible things could not happen
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 不应该发生如此恶劣之事的世界
F2NBox.EXPL: In formal English, so and an adjective can be used before ‘a’ and a noun.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在正式英语中, so 加形容词可以用于 a 加名词之前
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He had never spoken to so large a crowd before.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从来没有在这么多的听众面前讲过话。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people often prefer to use extremely rather than so to emphasize an adjective or adverb, because it sounds more formal.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中,人们更喜欢用 extremely 强调形容词或副词,而不用 so ,因为前者听上去更加正式
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: These schools are extremely difficult to get into.

Sense.DEF: not very big, good etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid the news is not so good.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕不是个很好的消息。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Of course I’d like to help, but things aren’t so simple.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我当然是愿意帮忙的﹐但事情没那么简单。

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 不与带否定意义的动词连用
Sense.DEF: used to add that what has just been said is also true about someone or something else
Sense.TRAN: 也﹐同样〔用于表示刚说过的情况也适用于某人或某物〕

GramExa.PROPFORM: so do I/so is he/so would Peter etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Joe was a little upset, and so was I.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔有点难过﹐我也一样。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s been ill, and so has his wife.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他病了﹐他妻子也病了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: As the demand rises, so do prices.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 需求增加﹐价格也会上涨。

Sense.DEF: used to refer back to an idea, action, quality, situation etc that has just been mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 如此﹐如是〔指代刚提到过的想法﹑行动﹑品质﹑情况等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Will I need my umbrella?’ ‘I don’t think so.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “我需要带雨伞吗？”“我想不需要。”
GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you want to go home, just say so.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你想回家﹐就说出来。

GramExa.PROPFORM: be more so/less so/too much so
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The band is popular and likely to become more so.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这支乐队很受欢迎﹐而且可能还会更受欢迎。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jerry is very honest, perhaps too much so.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰里很诚实﹐也许太诚实了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The troops will not advance until ordered to do so .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在接到命令之前﹐部队不会前进。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did Luke sell them? And, if so , what happened to the money?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卢克把它们卖了吗？如果是这样的话﹐那钱到哪里去了？
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Has he lost a fortune?’ ‘ So they say .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他输掉了一大笔钱吗？”“他们是这么说的。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Look – I’ve even cleaned the windows.’ ‘ So I see .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “瞧﹐我把窗子也擦干净了。”“我看到了。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: Parents can withdraw their child from school if they so wish .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家长要是愿意﹐可以让孩子退学。

Sense.DEF: to be true or correct
Sense.TRAN: 是真实的﹐是这样的﹐是对的
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘It belongs to my father.’ ‘ Is that so ?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “这是我爸爸的。”“真的吗？”
Sense.EXAMPLE: Morton says his parents kicked him out, but his brothers say this isn’t so .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫顿说他父母把他赶出了家门﹐但他弟弟说并不是这样。

Sense.DEF: used when you cannot be exact about a number, amount, or period of time and you think it may be a little more than the figure you are mentioning …
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have to leave in five minutes or so.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过五分钟左右我们就得走了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I stopped reading after thirty or so pages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我读了30页左右就不读了。

Sense.DEF: used to get someone’s attention, especially in order to ask them a question
Sense.TRAN: 噢﹐那么〔尤用于在提问前引起别人的注意〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: So, how was school today?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐今天上学怎么样？

Sense.DEF: used to check that you have understood something
Sense.TRAN: 这么说〔用于核实自己的理解是否正确〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: So this is just a copy?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么说来这只是一份复印件？

Sense.DEF: used when asking a question about what has just been said
Sense.TRAN: 那么〔用于对刚说过的话提出问题〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘He’s going to Paris on business.’ ‘So when is he coming back?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他要去巴黎出差。”“那么他什么时候回来？”

Sense.DEF: used to say that one description of someone or something is less suitable or correct than another
Sense.EXAMPLE: The details are not so much wrong as they are incomplete.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些细节谈不上错误﹐就是不完整。

Sense.DEF: used when you are surprised or annoyed that someone did not do something
Sense.TRAN: 甚至连…都没有﹐甚至不…〔用于对某人没做某事表示吃惊或气愤〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He left without so much as a goodbye.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他甚至没说一声再见就走了。

Sense.DEF: used to say goodbye
used in comparisons to say that something or someone has less of a particular quality than another person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bed was not so comfortable as his own.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张床没有他自己的床舒服。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use so in comparisons without 'not'. Use as .
F2NBox.TRAN: 表示比较时如没有 not 则不要用 so, 用 as
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Your handwriting is as bad as mine (NOT 不说 so bad as mine).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的字写得和我一样差。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a particular action, idea, statement etc was not useful or did not produce the result that was hoped for
Sense.TRAN: 原来某人/某物不过如此
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s late again. So much for good intentions!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他又迟到了﹐什么一片好意﹐算了吧！

Sense.DEF: used to say that there is only a limited quantity of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s only so much that anybody’s brain can handle at any one time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人脑一次也就只能应付这么多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are only so many hours in the working day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上班一天也就这么几个小时。

Sense.DEF: used with a movement of your hand to show how big, high etc something or someone is
Sense.TRAN: 这么﹐这样〔用于配合手势表示有多大﹑多高等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh, he’s about so tall, with brown hair and eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐他有这么高﹐头发和眼睛都是棕色的。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you have found something out about someone
Sense.TRAN: 哟﹐哦〔用于表示发现了某人的某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: So! You’ve got a new girlfriend?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哟！ 你有新女朋友了？

Sense.DEF: used when you are showing someone how to do something
Sense.TRAN: 像这样〔用于教某人怎么做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Then turn the paper over and fold it, like so.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 然后把纸翻过来折一折﹐就像这样。

Sense.DEF: used at the end of a list to show that you could continue it in a similar way
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can do things for your health in the way of diet, exercise, good lifestyle, not smoking and so on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保持身体健康有多种办法﹐包括注意饮食﹑做运动﹑保持良好的生活习惯﹑不抽烟等等。

Sense.DEF: in the way that is described
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dorothy and Sarah continued to write to each other, and so began a lifelong friendship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多萝西和萨拉继续保持通信﹐就这样开始了一段持续终生的友谊。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The furniture is so arranged that the interviewee and the interviewer are not physically separated by a desk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 家具的布置使受访者和采访者之间没有被桌子隔开。

Sense.DEF: and therefore
Sense.EXAMPLE: Madeira has an ideal climate, and so it is not surprising that it has become a tourist paradise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马德拉岛气候宜人﹐成为游客的天堂也就不足为怪了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This was considered to be a religious issue and so to be a matter for the church courts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一事件被认为是一个宗教问题﹐因此归教会法庭处理。

Sense.LEXUNIT: so she is/so there are etc
Sense.DEF: used to show that you agree with something that has just been mentioned, especially something that you had not noticed or had forgotten
Sense.TRAN: 她果真/果然等〔用于表示同意刚提到的事﹐尤其是你未注意到的或忘掉的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Look, she’s wearing a hat just like yours.’ ‘So she is.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你看﹐她戴的帽子和你的很像。”“真的是。”

Sense.DEF: to be arranged tidily, with everything in the right place
Sense.TRAN: 安排妥贴﹐整理得井井有条
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everything had to be just so, or Edna would make us do it again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每一样东西都得井井有条﹐不然埃德娜就会让我们重新来过。

Sense.DEF: used to show you do not like or agree with something, but you will accept it
Sense.TRAN: 就那样吧﹐只好如此〔用于表示勉强同意某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If that means delaying the trip, so be it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果那样要推迟行程﹐那也只好如此了。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that a person’s behaviour or action is typical of that person
Subsense.TRAN: 一向如此﹐就是如此〔用于表示某人的行为或行动是他的典型特点〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘He was about half an hour late.’ ‘That is just so Chris.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他迟到了半个小时左右。”“那就是克里斯的一贯作风。”

Subsense.DEF: used to say that something suits someone or is the type of thing they like
Subsense.TRAN: 〔用于表示某物很适合某人﹐或是某人喜欢的类型〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You must buy that jacket – it’s so you!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一定要买那件夹克﹐太适合你了！

Sense.LEXUNIT: I do so/it is so etc
Sense.DEF: used especially by children to say that something is true, can be done etc when someone else says that it is not, cannot etc
Sense.TRAN: 我会的/它是真的等〔尤为小孩用于否定别人的陈述〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You can’t swim.’ ‘I can so.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你不会游泳。”“我会。”

Sense.DEF: used to introduce the next part of a story you are telling someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: So anyway, he goes in and his boots get stuck in the mud.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就这样﹐他进去了﹐靴子陷进了泥里。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that something does not matter
Sense.EXAMPLE: So what if we’re a little late?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们迟到一会儿那又怎样？
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘She might tell someone.’ ‘So? No one will believe her.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “她可能会告诉什么人。”“那又怎样？没人会相信她。”

Crossrefto.REFLEX: so far as sth is concerned
so far as I know/I can remember/I can tell etc

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone does something because of the reason just stated
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was feeling hungry, so I made myself a sandwich.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感到饿了﹐所以就做了个三明治吃。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In written English, people often prefer to use therefore or consequently rather than so , because they sound more formal.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在书面英语中﹐人们往往更喜欢用 therefore 或 consequently ﹐因为这两个词听上去更正式﹐而不用so
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She had previous experience, therefore she seemed the best candidate.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有过相关经验﹐因此看来是最佳人选。

Subsense.DEF: in order to make something happen, make something possible etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He lowered his voice so Doris couldn’t hear.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他压低了声音﹐这样多丽丝就不会听到了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you start out early so that you don’t have to hurry?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你干吗不早点出发？这样就不用急匆匆的了。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that something happens or is true as a result of the situation you have just stated
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There are no buses, so you’ll have to walk.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有公共汽车﹐所以你只能步行。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The gravestones were covered with moss, so that it was impossible to read the names on them.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墓碑上长满了青苔﹐因此看不清上面的人名。

Sense.DEF: in order to do something
Sense.TRAN: 为了做某事﹐以便做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: I drove at a steady 50 mph so as to save fuel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了省油﹐我把车速保持在每小时 50 英里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We went along silently on tiptoe so as not to disturb anyone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们踮着脚悄无声息地走﹐免得打扰别人。

Sense.DEF: used to compare two people or things, when they are similar
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just as the French love their wine, so the English love their beer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正如法国人喜欢本国葡萄酒﹐英国人也喜欢本国啤酒。

Sense.DEF:
the fifth note in a musical
scale
according to the
sol-fa
system
if you soak something, or if you let it soak, you keep it covered with a liquid for a period of time, especially in order to make it softer or easier to clean
Sense.EXAMPLE: Soak the clothes in cold water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把衣服浸泡在冷水里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let the pans soak; I’ll wash them later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把锅泡着吧﹐我过一会儿再洗。

GramExa.GLOSS: remove it by soaking
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Put the bottle in soapy water to soak the label off.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把瓶子放到肥皂水里﹐把商标泡掉。

Sense.DEF: to make something completely wet
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某物〕湿透﹐把〔某物〕浸湿
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police aimed water hoses at the marchers, soaking them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察把水龙带对准游行示威者﹐把他们冲得浑身湿透。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The blood soaked through the bandage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 血浸透了绷带。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a rag soaked with oil
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 浸满了油的抹布

Sense.DEF: to spend a long time taking a bath
Sense.EXAMPLE: Soak in a warm bath to relax.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 泡一个热水澡﹐放松一下。

Sense.DEF: to make someone pay too much money in prices or taxes
Sense.EXAMPLE: taxes that soak the middle classes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 向中产阶级征的重税

Sense.DEF: if something soaks up a liquid, it takes the liquid into itself
Sense.EXAMPLE: He used a towel to soak up the blood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用毛巾把血吸掉。

Sense.DEF: to sit outside for a long time enjoying the sun
to enjoy a place by watching it or becoming involved in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Go to a sidewalk café, order coffee, and soak up the atmosphere .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 找一家街头咖啡馆﹐点上一杯咖啡﹐享受那里的气氛。

Sense.DEF: to learn something quickly and easily
Sense.TRAN: 〔迅速而轻松地〕吸 收﹐学会
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children soak up language incredibly quickly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子学语言快得让人难以置信。

Sense.DEF: a long and enjoyable time spent taking a bath
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had a good long soak in the bath.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在浴缸里舒舒服服地泡了很长时间。

Sense.DEF: when you soak something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Give the towels a good soak , they’re very dirty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把毛巾好好泡一泡﹐太脏了。

Sense.DEF: someone who is often drunk – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 酒鬼﹐经常喝醉的人〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: very wet or wearing very wet clothes
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was soaked and very cold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我浑身湿透了﹐很冷。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was raining so hard we were quickly soaked through completely wet .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨下得很大﹐我们很快就湿透了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He came in from the barn, soaked to the skin .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从谷仓回来﹐浑身湿透了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her shoes got soaked as she walked through the wet grass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她走过湿草地﹐鞋子全湿了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his blood-soaked clothes
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那染满鲜血的衣服

Sense.DEF: to be full of a particular quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: a city soaked in history
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 历史悠久的城市

Sense.DEF: very wet
Sense.EXAMPLE: a soaking wet towel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 湿透的毛巾

Sense.DEF: if someone or something gets a soaking, they get very wet
used to refer to a particular person or thing when you do not give a specific name
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d find myself thinking, ‘I wonder what so-and-so is doing?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会发觉自己在想:“不知道某某人正在干什么呢？”

Sense.DEF: a very unpleasant or unreasonable person – used when you want to avoid using a swear word
Sense.TRAN: 讨厌[无理]的人〔用以代替某个咒骂语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Peter can be a real so-and-so at times.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼得有时候讨厌得很。

Sense.DEF: the substance that you use to wash your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wash thoroughly with soap and water .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用肥皂和水彻底洗一洗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bar of soap
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块肥皂

Sense.DEF:
a
soap opera
to rub soap on or over someone or something
if someone is on their soapbox, they are telling people their opinions about something in a loud and forceful way
Sense.TRAN: 〔人们发表激烈言论时用的〕临时演讲台

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Environmental activists have climbed on their soapboxes to protest the president’s action.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 环保分子严词抗议总统的行为。

Sense.DEF: small thin pieces of soap used for washing delicate clothes
a television or radio story about the daily lives and relationships of the same group of people, which is broadcast regularly
a powder that is made from soap and other chemicals, used for washing clothes
a soft stone that feels like soap
the mass of small bubbles that form on top of water with soap in it
containing soap
Sense.EXAMPLE: hot soapy water
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热肥皂水

Sense.DEF: like soap
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rock with a soapy feel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摸上去像肥皂的一种岩石

Sense.DEF: to increase quickly to a high level
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her temperature soared.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的体温骤然升高。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The price of petrol has soared in recent weeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近几个星期汽油价格猛涨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: soaring unemployment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 急剧上升的失业率

Subsense.DEF: to fly, especially very high up in the sky, floating on air currents
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She watched the dove soar above the chestnut trees.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看着鸽子在栗子树的上空展翅飞翔。

Subsense.DEF: to go quickly upwards to a great height
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The ball soared to left field.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那球腾空而起﹐飞到了左外场。

Sense.DEF:
if your
spirits the way you are feeling, for example happy, sad etc
or hopes soar, you begin to feel very happy or hopeful
Sense.EXAMPLE: Adam’s smile sent her spirits soaring .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚当的微笑让她飘飘然了。

Sense.DEF: if buildings, trees, towers etc soar, they look very tall and impressive
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here the cliffs soar a hundred feet above the sea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里峭壁耸立﹐高出海面100英尺。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a soaring skyscraper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高耸入云的摩天大厦

Sense.DEF: to cry noisily while breathing in short sudden bursts
Sense.EXAMPLE: He began sobbing uncontrollably .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不由自主地抽噎起来。

Sense.DEF: to say something while you are sobbing
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘It’s too late,’ she sobbed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “太晚了。”她呜咽道。

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写= son of a bitch 杂种

Sense.DEF: not drunk
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a nice guy when he’s sober.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没喝醉时是个不错的家伙。

Sense.DEF: serious, and thinking or making you think carefully about things
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sober, hard-working young man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个态度认真﹑工作努力的青年
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sober reminder of the difficulties we face
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对我们所面临的困难的严正提醒

Sense.DEF: plain and not at all brightly coloured
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sober grey suit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朴素的灰色套装

Sense.DEF: to become more serious in behaviour or attitude, or to make someone become more serious
Sense.EXAMPLE: His expression sobered instantly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的表情立刻严肃起来。

Sense.DEF: to gradually become less drunk, or to make someone become less drunk
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had sobered up by now and felt terrible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这时候我酒醒了﹐感觉很糟。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some coffee should sober you up.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 喝点咖啡能帮助你醒酒。

Sense.DEF: making you feel very serious
Sense.TRAN: 使人警醒的﹐使人清醒的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a sobering thought .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一个令人警醒的想法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The news had a sobering effect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这消息发人深省。

Sense.DEF: when someone is not drunk
Sense.EXAMPLE: John had periods of sobriety, but always went back to drinking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰也有清醒的时候﹐但总是重拾酗酒的老习惯。

Sense.DEF: behaviour that shows a serious attitude to life
a place in the road where the police stop vehicles so they can test drivers to see if they have drunk too much alcohol or used illegal drugs
Sense.TRAN: 醉酒驾驶检查站〔公路上警察将车辆拦下检查司机是否饮酒过量或使用过毒品的站点〕

Sense.DEF: an unofficial title or name
a story, especially one that is not true, that someone tells you in order to make you feel sorry for them
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指不真实的〕为了博取同情的故事﹐伤感故事
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sob story about how she lost all her money
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 讲她如何失去所有钱财的悲伤故事

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= society 社团﹐协会

Sense.DEF:
a style of Caribbean music that is a mixture of
soul
and
calypso
Sense.TRAN: 索卡乐〔灵乐和卡利普索民歌混合的加勒比海地区音乐风格〕

Sense.DEF: used to describe someone or something that has been given a name that you think is wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: The so-called experts couldn’t tell us what was wrong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些所谓的专家说不出问题出在哪里。

Sense.DEF: used to show that something or someone is usually called a particular name
Sense.EXAMPLE: the health threats posed by so-called ‘mad cow disease’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所谓的“疯牛病”对健康构成的威胁

Sense.DEF:
a sport played by two teams of 11 players, who try to kick a round ball into their opponents’
goal
a mother who spends a lot of time driving her children to sports practice, music lessons etc, considered as a typical example of women from the middle to upper classes in US society
Sense.TRAN: 足球妈妈〔花很多时间开车送子女去参加体育训练﹑上音乐课等的母亲﹐被认为是美国中产阶级至上层社会妇女的典型〕

Sense.DEF: someone who is sociable is friendly and enjoys being with other people
Sense.TRAN: 好交际的﹐喜欢与人交往的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pleasant, sociable couple
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一对和善且喜欢与人交往的夫妇

Sense.DEF: relating to human society and its organization, or the quality of people’s lives
Sense.EXAMPLE: social issues, such as unemployment and education
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业和教育之类的社会问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: the country’s serious social problems
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国严重的社会问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: a challenge to the social order how a particular society is organized
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对社会秩序的一个挑战

Sense.DEF: relating to your position in society, according to your job, family, wealth etc
Sense.TRAN: 社会地位的﹐社会阶层的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The students come from a variety of social classes groups of people that have the same social position .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些学生来自各个社会阶层。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the social status of her family
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她家的社会地位

Sense.DEF: relating to meeting people, forming relationships with them, and spending time with them
Sense.EXAMPLE: social interaction
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会交往
Sense.EXAMPLE: a club with lots of social events
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社交活动丰富的俱乐部
Sense.EXAMPLE: Exercise classes are a good way to keep fit and improve your social life .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上健身课是保持身体健康和改善社交生活的好办法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Group play helps children develop social skills ability to deal with people easily .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小组游戏有助于儿童发展交际能力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He lacked social graces good and polite behaviour towards other people .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他缺乏社交礼仪。

Sense.DEF: someone who is social enjoys meeting and talking to other people
forming groups or living together in their natural state
Sense.EXAMPLE: Elephants are social animals .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大象是群居动物。

Sense.DEF: a party for the members of a group, club, or church
Sense.TRAN: 社交聚会﹔联谊会﹔联欢会

Sense.DEF: an official examination of how well a company behaves, for example how it treats its workers, the environment etc
Sense.TRAN: 社会审计﹐社会审核〔对公司在员工待遇﹑环保问题等方面的一种官方审核〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a social audit of Ben & Jerry’s Ice Cream
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对 Ben & Jerry 冰激凌公司的社会审核

Sense.DEF: someone who tries to get accepted into a higher social class by becoming friendly with people who belong to that class – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 结交权贵向上爬的人﹐设法挤进上流社会的人〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: a club where its members can go to spend time, talk, drink etc with other members
if someone has a social conscience, they know about and want to help people who have problems in society, for example people who are poor or have family problems
an arrangement by which people in a society accept that they all have rights and duties, and give up some freedoms so that they are protected by the state

a political and economic system based on some ideas of
socialism
combined with
democratic
principles, such as personal freedom and government by elected representatives
a country with a government based on social democracy
the practice of making changes to laws in order to change society according to a political idea
Sense.TRAN: 社会工程〔指通过修改法律使社会按照某一政治主张实行变革的做法〕

Sense.DEF:
the situation that results when people suffer the effects of a combination of problems such as unemployment, crime, and bad
housing
, and have very little chance of being able to improve their lives
Sense.TRAN: 社会排斥〔指人们受失业﹑犯罪和住房条件差等多种问题困扰﹐而且几乎没有希望改善生活所造成的局面〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: efforts to combat poverty and social exclusion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与贫穷及社会排斥抗争的努力

Sense.DEF: money that is used to help people with social problems, such as family problems or money problems
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于帮助有家庭问题或经济困难者的〕社会基金

Sense.DEF: houses or apartments that the local government provides, which can be rented for a small amount of money
Sense.TRAN: 社会福利住房〔地方政府提供的低租金住房〕

Sense.DEF: an economic and political system in which large industries are owned by the government, and taxes are used to take some wealth away from richer citizens and give it to poorer citizens
based on socialism or relating to a political party that supports socialism
Sense.EXAMPLE: socialist principles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会主义原则

Sense.DEF: a socialist country or government has a political system based on socialism
Sense.TRAN: 社会主义国家的﹐社会主义政府的

Sense.DEF: someone who believes in socialism, or who is a member of a political party that supports socialism
Sense.TRAN: 社会主义者﹔社会党党员

Sense.DEF: based on socialism – usually used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 带社会主义倾向的﹐有社会主义特点的〔一般含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: socialistic ideas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带社会主义倾向的观点

Sense.DEF: someone who is well known for going to many fashionable parties, and who is often rich
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Washington socialite
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位华盛顿的社会名流

Sense.DEF: the process by which people, especially children, are made to behave in a way that is acceptable in their society
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指儿童的〕社会化﹐适应社会的过程
Sense.EXAMPLE: Schools play an important part in the socialization of our children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校对儿童适应社会的过程起着重要的作用。

Sense.DEF:
the process of making something work according to
socialist
ideas
Sense.EXAMPLE: the socialization of medicine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医疗的社会主义化

Sense.DEF: to spend time with other people in a friendly way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: People don’t socialize with their neighbours as much as they used to.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 邻里间的交往没有过去多了。

Sense.DEF: to train someone to behave in a way that is acceptable in the society they are living in

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Girls are socialized into appropriate ‘feminine’ behavior.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女孩们被教育要具有得体的“女性”举止。

Sense.DEF: medical care provided by a government and paid for through taxes
Sense.TRAN: 〔由政府提供﹑靠税收支付的〕公费医疗

Sense.DEF: the use of the Internet to make information about yourself available to other people, especially people you share an interest or connection with, and to send messages to them
a website where people put information about themselves and can send messages to other people
the study of people in society

a particular subject relating to the study of people in society, such as history, politics,
sociology
, or
anthropology
Sense.TRAN: 社会科学学科〔包括历史﹑政治﹑社会学﹑人类学等〕

Sense.DEF: government money that is paid to people who are unemployed, old, ill etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔政府发给失业者﹑老人﹑病人等的〕社会保障金
Sense.EXAMPLE: social security benefits
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会保障救济金

GramExa.GLOSS: be receiving money from the government

Sense.DEF: a US government programme into which workers must make regular payments, and which pays money regularly to old people and people who are unable to work
Sense.TRAN: 社会保障（制度）〔美国政府的社会保险计划﹐由在职者定期缴纳钱款﹐向老人和无劳动能力者定期支付保障金〕

Sense.DEF: the government department that helps people with problems, for example family or money problems, or the services it provides
Sense.TRAN: 〔向在家庭﹑经济等方面存在问题的人提供帮助的〕社会福利部门
Sense.EXAMPLE: Contact social services for help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和社会福利部门联系以寻求帮助。
Sense.EXAMPLE: social service workers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会福利工作者
Sense.EXAMPLE: the provision of social services
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会福利的提供

Sense.DEF: a service that helps society work properly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The country railways provided a vital social service.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乡村的铁路提供了重要的社会服务。

Sense.DEF: the study of people in society
work done by government or private organizations to improve bad social conditions and help people who are poor, have family problems, are unable to find a job etc
someone who is trained to help people who are poor, have family problems etc
relating to a particular society
Sense.EXAMPLE: societal attitudes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会态度

Sense.DEF: people in general, considered in relation to the laws, organizations etc that make it possible for them to live together
Sense.EXAMPLE: technology and its effects on modern society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科技及其对现代社会的影响
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children are the most vulnerable members of society .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童是最脆弱的社会成员。

Sense.DEF: a particular large group of people who share laws, organizations, customs etc
Sense.TRAN: 社会〔指有共同的法律﹑组织﹑习俗等的特定群体〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Britain is now a multiracial society.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国现在是一个多种族社会。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the capitalist societies of the West
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西方资本主义社会
Sense.EXAMPLE: the conservative segment of American society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国社会中的保守派

Sense.DEF: an organization or club with members who share similar interests, aims etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: the university film society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学电影协会
Sense.EXAMPLE: the American Cancer Society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国癌症学会

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Society of Black Lawyers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑人律师协会

Sense.DEF: the fashionable group of people who are rich and powerful
Sense.EXAMPLE: a society wedding
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上层社会的婚礼

GramExa.GLOSS: the richest, most fashionable etc people

Sense.DEF: when you are together with other people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Holidays are a time to enjoy the society of your family.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 假日是享受天伦之乐的时刻。

Sense.DEF: middle- or upper-class people who behave correctly in social situations

GramExa.GLOSS: among middle- or upper-class people
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The subject was rarely mentioned in polite society.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个话题在上流社会很少提起。

Sense.DEF: relating to society
Sense.EXAMPLE: sociology the study of society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会学

Sense.DEF: social and something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: sociopolitical
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会政治的
Sense.EXAMPLE: sociolinguistics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会语言学

Sense.DEF: based on a combination of social and economic conditions
the scientific study of societies and the behaviour of people in groups
someone whose behaviour towards other people is considered unacceptable, strange, and possibly dangerous
Sense.TRAN: 反社会者〔对待他人的行为让人感到难以接受﹑怪异或可能有危险的人〕

Sense.DEF: a piece of clothing made of soft material that you wear on your foot inside your shoe
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pair of socks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一双短袜
Sense.EXAMPLE: white ankle socks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白色的齐踝短袜

Sense.DEF: to surprise and excite someone very much
Sense.TRAN: 使某人大吃一惊﹐使某人兴奋
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new band that will knock your socks off
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将会给你带来惊喜的一支新乐队

Sense.DEF: to make an effort to improve your behaviour or your work
Sense.EXAMPLE: If they want promotion, United have got to pull their socks up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果联队想要升级﹐那就得好好努力。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone in a joking way to stop talking or making a noise
Sense.TRAN: 闭嘴﹐住口〔以开玩笑的方式叫某人不要说话或出声〕

Sense.DEF: a hard hit, especially with your hand closed
Sense.TRAN: 猛力的一击﹔〔尤指〕狠狠的一拳
Sense.EXAMPLE: Larry gave him a sock on the arm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉里在他手臂上狠狠地打了一拳。

Sense.DEF: to hit someone very hard, especially with your hand closed
Sense.EXAMPLE: He socked her in the face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他猛地一拳打在她脸上。

Sense.DEF: if someone is socked with something bad, they are suddenly affected by it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I got socked with a big car repair bill.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很惨﹐付了一大笔修车费。

Sense.DEF:
if an airport, road, or area is socked in, it is very difficult to see far and no one can travel because of bad
fog
, snow, or rain
Sense.TRAN: 〔机场﹑道路或地区因大雾﹑大雪或大雨〕被封住﹐被困住

Sense.DEF: to tell someone to do something in a direct and forceful way
Sense.TRAN: 强硬地让某人做某事﹐直截了当地要某人做某事

Sense.DEF: to save money by putting it in a safe place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Roger socked away more than $1 million a year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗杰一年存一百多万 美元。

Sense.DEF: a place in a wall where you can connect electrical equipment to the supply of electricity

the place on a piece of electrical equipment that you put a
plug
or a
light bulb
into
Sense.EXAMPLE: a headphone socket
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 耳机插口

Sense.DEF: a hollow part of a structure into which something fits
Sense.EXAMPLE: the eye sockets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼窝

Sense.DEF: a very offensive word for someone, especially a man, who you think is stupid or annoying
Sense.EXAMPLE: Get up, you lazy sod!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 起来﹐你这个懒鬼！

Sense.DEF: to be very difficult to do or deal with
Sense.EXAMPLE: That door’s a sod to open.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那扇门难开死了。

Sense.DEF: used to refer to a person
Sense.EXAMPLE: The poor sod ’s wife left him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个可怜的家伙被老婆甩了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You lucky sod!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这个幸运的家伙！

Sense.DEF: to not care at all about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t give a sod who it is!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我才不管是谁呢！

Sense.DEF: a piece of earth or the layer of earth with grass and roots growing in it
used to rudely express anger or annoyance at something or someone
Sense.TRAN: 该死﹐真糟糕〔用于粗鲁地对某人或某事表示生气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sod it, I’ve missed the train.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 见鬼﹐我误了火车。

Sense.GRAM: T only in imperative or infinitive
Sense.GRAMTRAN: 仅用于祈使句或不定式
Sense.DEF: used to say rudely that something is not important
Sense.TRAN: 去他妈的〔用于粗鲁地表示某事并不重要〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sod the job, I’m going home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去他妈的工作﹐我要回家了。

Sense.DEF: an offensive way of telling someone to go away
water that contains bubbles and is often added to alcoholic drinks
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Scotch and soda
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一杯加苏打水的苏格兰威士忌

Sense.DEF: a sweet drink containing bubbles, or a can or bottle of this drink
Sense.EXAMPLE: a can of orange soda
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一罐橘子汽水
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cooler full of sodas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 装满汽水的冷藏箱

Sense.DEF:
an
ice-cream soda
Sense.EXAMPLE: a strawberry soda
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 草莓冰激凌苏打

Sense.DEF:
a substance in the form of a powder containing
sodium
, that is used for cooking or cleaning
Sense.TRAN: 〔烹饪或清洁用的〕苏打﹐碳酸钠
Sense.EXAMPLE: baking soda
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小苏打

Sense.DEF: a place in a shop at which drinks, ice cream etc were served in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时商店中的〕冷饮柜台﹐冷饮部

Sense.DEF: nothing at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got sod all from the deal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔交易我什么好处也没得到。

Sense.DEF: a sweet drink containing bubbles

a special type of bottle from which
soda water
is forced out in a fast stream
water that contains bubbles and is often added to alcoholic drinks
Sense.TRAN: 苏打水〔常掺在酒精饮料中〕

Sense.DEF: very wet and heavy
Sense.TRAN: 湿漉漉沉甸甸的﹐湿透的﹐湿淋淋的
Sense.EXAMPLE: sodden clothes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 湿漉漉的衣服
Sense.EXAMPLE: The earth was sodden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 土地湿透了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: rain-sodden hair
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 被雨淋湿的头发

Sense.DEF: said when someone is angry or annoyed, or to emphasize what they are saying
Sense.TRAN: 倒霉的﹐他妈的〔用于强调愤怒〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sodding computer’s crashed!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这台倒霉的电脑坏掉了！

Sense.DEF: a common silver-white metal that usually exists in combination with other substances, for example in salt. It is a chemical element: symbol Na
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钠〔一种化学元素﹐符号为 Na〕

Sense.DEF:
a white powder used in baking to make cakes,
biscuits
etc lighter, or for cleaning things
the type of salt that is used in cooking

a place or situation where people’s sexual behaviour is regarded as very shocking. These are the names of two ancient cities in the Middle East which, according to the Bible, were destroyed by God as a punishment for the immoral sexual behaviour of their people.
Sense.TRAN: 所多玛和蛾摩拉〔指淫乱的地方或情形。 据《圣经》记载﹐这两座中东古城因为其市民淫荡而被上帝毁灭〕

Sense.DEF: someone who practises sodomy

a sexual act in which a man puts his sex organ into someone’s
anus
, especially that of another man
the natural tendency for things to go wrong whenever possible – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 索德定律﹐要出坏事总逃不掉〔一种认为凡有可能出差错的事终将出差错的论断﹔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s Sod’s law that the car breaks down when you need it most.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在你最需要的时候汽车偏偏会坏掉——这就是索德 定律。

Sense.DEF: a comfortable seat with raised arms and a back, that is wide enough for two or three people to sit on
a sofa that has a bed inside that can be folded out

Subsense.DEF: not hard, firm, or stiff, but easy to press
Subsense.EXAMPLE: My feet sank into the soft ground.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的双脚陷进了松软的地里。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the softest sofa and pillows
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最柔软的沙发和枕头
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Cook the onions until they go soft .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把洋葱煮至变软。

Subsense.DEF: less hard than average
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a soft lead pencil
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 软芯铅笔
Subsense.EXAMPLE: soft cheese
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 软干酪

Sense.DEF: having a surface that is smooth and pleasant to touch
Sense.EXAMPLE: a baby’s soft skin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婴儿细嫩的皮肤
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fur was soft to the touch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这皮毛摸起来很柔滑。

Sense.DEF: a soft sound or voice, or soft music, is quiet and pleasant to listen to
Sense.TRAN: 〔声音﹑嗓音或音乐〕轻柔的﹐柔和的
Sense.EXAMPLE: soft music
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轻柔的音乐
Sense.EXAMPLE: His voice was softer now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的语气现在柔和些了。

Sense.DEF: soft colours or lights are pleasant and relaxing because they are not too bright
Sense.TRAN: 〔颜色或灯光〕柔和的﹐不刺眼的
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the stores will be re-fitted with softer lighting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有这些商店都将重新安装光照更为柔和的照明设备。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a soft shade of peach
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种柔和的桃红色

Sense.DEF: not having any hard edges or sharp angles
Sense.EXAMPLE: soft curves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 柔和的 弧线

Sense.DEF: gentle and without much force
Sense.EXAMPLE: a soft breeze
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 微风
Sense.EXAMPLE: soft rain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 细雨

Sense.DEF: someone who is soft seems weak because they are not strict enough with other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you appear to be soft, people take advantage of you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你显得软弱﹐别人就会占你的便宜。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: No politician wants to seem soft on crime .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有一个政客愿意在犯罪问题上显得心慈手软。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Courts have been taking a soft line not being strict enough with young offenders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭一直对少年犯从 轻处理。

Sense.DEF: kind, gentle, and sympathetic to other people
Sense.TRAN: 仁厚的﹐温和的﹐富有同情心的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has a soft heart beneath that cold exterior.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他冷漠的外表下面有一颗温柔的心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a soft kiss
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 温柔的一吻

Sense.DEF: not very brave and not having a strong character
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be soft – just jump!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别畏首畏尾的﹐跳呀！

Sense.DEF: decreasing in price, value, or the amount sold
Sense.TRAN: 〔价格﹑价值或销售量〕下降的﹐疲软 的﹐不景气的
Sense.EXAMPLE: soft oil prices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 疲软的油价

Sense.DEF: money that is lent at a lower interest rate than usual, because it will be used to help people in some way

money that people, companies, or organizations give to political parties, rather than to a particular
candidate
Sense.TRAN: 软钱﹐软捐款〔个人﹑公司或机构捐给政党而非某个候选人的竞选资金〕

Sense.DEF: a soft job, life etc is too easy and does not involve much work or hard physical work
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mike’s found himself a soft job in the stores.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克在商店里找到一份轻松的活儿。

GramExa.GLOSS: a choice that allows you to avoid difficulties or hard work
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Taking the soft option won’t help your career to develop.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 走捷径对你事业的发展没好处。

Sense.DEF: having a body that is not in a strong physical condition, because you do not do enough exercise
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’d got soft after all those years in a desk job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他干了这么多年的案头工作﹐身体变得虚弱了。

Sense.DEF: soft water does not contain many minerals, so that it forms bubbles from soap easily

Sense.LEXUNIT: have a soft spot for sb
Sense.DEF: to continue to like someone even when they do not behave well
Sense.TRAN: 偏爱某人﹐对某人有好感
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s always had a soft spot for Grant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对格兰特一向心软。

Sense.DEF: someone from whom you can easily get what you want, because they are kind or easy to deceive
very stupid or crazy
stupid or silly
Sense.EXAMPLE: You must be soft if you think I’ll give you fifty quid!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你以为我会给你50英镑﹐那就太傻了！

Sense.DEF: to be sexually attracted to someone
not sounding hard
Sense.EXAMPLE: a soft g
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发软音的 g

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Music played softly in the background.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 背景里播放着柔和的音乐。

Exponent.DEF: not hard, firm, or stiff, but easy to press
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a soft mattress
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 柔软的床垫
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her skin was lovely and soft.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的皮肤非常柔嫩动人。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: soft ground
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 柔软的地面

Exponent.DEF: used about meat or vegetables that are soft and easy to cut, especially because they have been well cooked
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The beef was very tender.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛肉非常嫩。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Cook the carrots until tender.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 把胡萝卜煮到变软。

Exponent.DEF: very wet and too soft, in a way that seems unpleasant – used about bread, vegetables, and the ground
Exponent.EXAMPLE: soggy cabbage
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 稀烂的卷心菜
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a piece of soggy bread
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块软塌塌的面包
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The ground was too soggy to walk on.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 地上泥泞不好走。

Exponent.DEF: soft and easy to press – used especially about fruit that is too soft, and about soft wet ground which makes a noise when you walk on it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: squishy tomatoes
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 软乎乎的番茄
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The leaves were squishy under our feet.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 树叶在我们脚底下嘎吱作响。

Exponent.DEF: soft and easy to press – used especially about fruit that is too soft, and about chairs that are soft and comfortable
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指水果和椅子〕柔软的,易压扁的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The peaches have gone all squashy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 桃子都变软了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a big squashy sofa
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张软塌塌的大沙发

Exponent.DEF: used about fruit or vegetables that are very soft, wet, and unpleasant, because they are not fresh or have been cooked for too long
Exponent.TRAN: 〔水果或蔬菜因不新鲜或煮得太久而〕烂糊的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: mushy pieces of banana
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 烂乎乎的香蕉
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a few mushy carrots
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 几根烂乎乎的胡萝卜

Exponent.DEF: soft and full of holes that contain air or liquid like a sponge
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a spongy foam
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 海绵似的泡沫
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a spongy loaf
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 海绵般柔软的面包
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His boots sank into the spongy soil.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的靴子陷进了松软的土里。

Sense.DEF: a game similar to baseball but played on a smaller field with a slightly larger and softer ball
the special ball used to play this game
an egg that is soft-boiled is boiled long enough for the white part to become solid, but the yellow part in the centre is still liquid
information stored in a computer’s memory or shown on a screen rather than printed on paper
money of a particular country that may fall in value and is difficult to exchange for the money of a country that is economically stronger
Sense.TRAN: 软通 货﹐软货币〔指币值不够稳定并且难以和经济实力较强国家的货币相兑换的通货〕

Sense.DEF: a cold drink that does not contain alcohol
Sense.TRAN: 软饮料〔指不含酒精的饮料〕

Sense.DEF:
an illegal drug, such as
marijuana
, that is not considered to be very harmful
to become less hard or rough, or make something less hard or rough
Sense.EXAMPLE: Use moisturizer to soften your skin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使用润肤霜让你的肌肤变柔滑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cook until the onion softens.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把洋葱煮到变软。

Sense.DEF: if your attitude softens, or if something softens it, it becomes less strict and more sympathetic
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has softened its stance on public spending.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府对公共开支问题的态度软化了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I felt that he was beginning to soften towards me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感觉到他开始对我变温和了。

Sense.DEF: to make the effect of something seem less unpleasant or severe, or to become less unpleasant or severe

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The impact of the tax was softened by large tax-free allowances.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个税项的影响因为免税额大而得到了缓和。

Sense.DEF: if your expression or voice softens, or if something softens it, you look or sound kinder and more gentle
Sense.TRAN: （使）〔表情或声音〕变温 和﹐（使）变柔和
Sense.EXAMPLE: His voice softened as he spoke to her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对她说话时声音变温和了。

Sense.DEF: to make the shape or colour of something look less severe
Sense.EXAMPLE: Climbing plants soften the outline of a fence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 攀缘植物可以使围栏的轮廓变得柔和。

Sense.DEF: to be nice to someone before you ask them to do something, so that they will agree to help you
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was just softening me up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她就是要叫我心软。

Sense.DEF: to make an enemy weaker so that they are easier to attack
Sense.EXAMPLE: Use artillery to soften up the enemy forces.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用大炮来削弱敌军。

Sense.DEF: to make something less hard or rough
a substance that you add to water to make clothes feel soft after washing
Sense.EXAMPLE: fabric softener
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 织物柔软剂

Sense.DEF: a way of photographing or filming things so that the edges of the objects in the photograph are not sharp or clear
Sense.TRAN: 〔摄影的〕软聚焦﹐模糊焦点〔使影像周边模糊不清的聚焦〕

Sense.DEF:
small fruits, such as
strawberries
, that you can eat that do not have a hard skin or large seed
Sense.TRAN: 软水果〔指草莓等无硬皮﹑无大核的水果〕

Sense.DEF: things such as curtains, chair covers etc that are made of cloth and are used in decorating a room
Sense.TRAN: 软装饰〔指窗帘﹑椅子套等用布料做的室内装饰品〕

Sense.DEF: easily affected by feelings of pity or sympathy for other people
Sense.TRAN: 心肠软的﹐好心的﹐仁慈的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a soft-hearted woman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个心肠软的女人

Sense.DEF: someone who is easily affected by feelings of pity or sympathy, or who is easily persuaded
Sense.TRAN: 心肠软的人﹐易被说服的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a real softie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他这人心肠很软。

Sense.DEF:
a situation in which a
spacecraft
comes down onto the ground gently and without any damage

if the
economy
of a country has a soft landing, it does not experience bad effects after an attempt to control increases in the
cost of living
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hopes for a soft landing have faded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济软着陆已经没有希望。

Sense.DEF: a way of dealing with something or someone which involves being very patient and careful
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to adopt a softly-softly approach with Mike.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对迈克要采取耐心谨慎的方法。

Sense.DEF:
another form of the word
soft-spoken
the soft part at the back of the top of your mouth
to make something seem less important or less urgent than it really is
Sense.TRAN: 使显得不那么重要[紧迫]﹐淡化

Sense.DEF: magazines, pictures etc that show people wearing no clothes or sexual activity, but that do not show sexual activity completely clearly or in a violent way
Sense.TRAN: 软性色情作品〔指性的表现不是十分露骨的杂志﹑图片等〕

Sense.DEF: a way of advertising or selling things that involves gently persuading people to buy something
Sense.TRAN: 软推销〔指用温和诱导的方法进行的广告宣传或推销〕

Sense.DEF: the edge of a road, when this edge is made of dirt rather than a hard material
to say nice things to someone in order to persuade them to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t think you can soft-soap me!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别以为你能用好话来说服我！

Sense.DEF: having a pleasant quiet voice
Sense.TRAN: 声音柔和的﹐说话温柔的

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个说话温柔的男人

Sense.DEF: a person or thing that is easy to attack or criticize
Sense.TRAN: 容易受到攻击[批评]的人[物]

Sense.DEF: a car with a cloth roof that you can fold back or remove
a toy for young children that is made of cloth and filled with soft material
Sense.TRAN: 〔用布和软质填塞物做成的〕软玩具

Sense.DEF: the sets of programs that tell a computer how to do a particular job

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她给电脑装上新的软件。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: word-processing software
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 文字处理软件

Sense.EXAMPLE: a software company
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 软件公司

Sense.DEF:
wood from trees such as
pine
and
fir
that is cheap and easy to cut, or a tree with this type of wood

another spelling of
softie
unpleasantly wet and soft
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ground was soggy from the rain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨后地面湿透了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sandwiches have gone all soggy .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些三明治全都变得湿乎乎软塌塌的。

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
so3 a musical note

an area in central London famous for its
sex shops
and
gay
bars, and also as a place where there are many shops and restaurants selling foreign food, especially Chinese and Italian food
Sense.TRAN: 苏活区〔伦敦市中心一地区﹐以性用品商店和同性恋酒吧闻名﹐那里还有许多商店和餐馆售卖外国食品﹐尤其是中国和意大利食品〕
苏荷区〔纽约曼哈顿一地区﹐汇集了许多画廊﹑餐馆和时髦的小商店〕

the abbreviation of 缩写=
small office
/
home office
小型家庭办公室

Sense.DEF: dressed fashionably and with care
Sense.TRAN: 衣着讲究的﹐穿戴时髦的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a soignée woman politician
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位穿戴讲究的女政治家

Sense.DEF: the top layer of the earth in which plants grow

GramExa.GLOSS: good for growing crops

Sense.EXAMPLE: The soil here is very poor not good for growing crops .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里的土壤很贫瘠。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Roses grow well in a clay soil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蔷薇适宜在黏质土中生长。

Sense.DEF: in Britain, France etc
Sense.TRAN: 在英国/法国/外国等的土地上
Sense.EXAMPLE: The crime was committed on American soil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这桩罪案发生在美国。

Sense.DEF: a place or situation where something can develop
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eastern Europe provided fertile soil for political activists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 东欧为政治活跃分子提供了肥沃的土壤。

Sense.DEF: your own country
farming as a job or way of life
Sense.EXAMPLE: They make their living from the soil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们以务农为生。

Sense.DEF: to make something dirty, especially with waste from your body
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指用人的排泄物〕弄脏﹐弄污

Sense.DEF: to not do something because you consider it too unpleasant or dishonest
Sense.TRAN: 不玷污双手〔指不做令人不快或不诚实的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep your money – I wouldn’t soil my hands with it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你的钱留着吧﹐我可不愿意被它玷污了双手。

Sense.DEF: a formal or fashionable evening party
a short period of time that you stay in a place that is not your home
Sense.EXAMPLE: a brief sojourn in Europe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在欧洲小住

Sense.DEF: a feeling of emotional comfort at a time of great sadness or disappointment

GramExa.EXAMPLE: After the death of her son, Val found solace in the church.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿子死后﹐瓦尔在教会找到了慰藉。

Sense.DEF: to bring a feeling of comfort and calmness to someone, when they are sad or disappointed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mary was a great solace to me after Arthur died.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿瑟死后﹐玛丽就是我最大的安慰。

Sense.DEF: relating to the sun
Sense.EXAMPLE: a solar eclipse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日食

Sense.DEF: using the power of the sun’s light and heat
