Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太阳能

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment for producing electric power from sunlight

a place with
sunbeds beds with special lamps
, where you can get a
suntan
Sense.TRAN: 日光浴室〔设有日光浴床﹐让人把皮肤晒黑〕

Sense.DEF: a room, usually enclosed by glass, where you can sit in bright sunlight
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常用玻璃建的〕阳光房﹐日光室

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment, usually kept on a roof, that collects and uses the sun’s energy to heat water or make electricity
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常放在房顶的〕太阳能电池板

Sense.DEF:
the front part of your body just below your
ribs
Sense.EXAMPLE: a blow to the solar plexus
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打在心口上的一击

Sense.DEF:
the Sun and the
planets
that go around it
this kind of system around another star

Sense.DEF: the period of time in which the Earth travels once around the Sun, equal to just over 365 days
Sense.TRAN: 太阳年〔地球绕太阳运行一周的时间﹐稍稍超过 365 天〕

the past tense and past participle of
sell
Sense.TRAN: sell 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF:
a soft metal, usually a mixture of
lead
and
tin
, which can be melted and used to join two metal surfaces, wires etc
Sense.TRAN: 焊料﹐焊锡〔通常为铅与锡的合金〕

Sense.DEF: to join or repair metal surfaces with solder
a tool which is heated, usually by electricity, and used for melting solder and putting it on surfaces
a member of the army of a country, especially someone who is not an officer
Sense.EXAMPLE: A British soldier was wounded in the fighting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战斗中﹐有一名英国士兵受了伤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an enemy soldier
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 敌兵

Sense.DEF: to continue working in spite of difficulties
Sense.TRAN: 〔不畏困难地〕继续干下去﹐坚持下去
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll just have to soldier on without him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有他﹐我们还得坚持下去。

Sense.DEF: the life or job of a soldier
typical of a good soldier
Sense.TRAN: 像军人的﹐有军人风度的

Sense.DEF: someone who works as a soldier for anyone who will pay them
soldiers
if a concert, performance etc is sold out, all the tickets for that show have been sold
Sense.TRAN: 〔音乐会﹑表演等〕票已售完的﹐满座的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The group will play three sold-out shows at Wembley Stadium.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个组合将在温布利体育场举行三场音乐会﹐门票已告售罄。

Sense.DEF: if a shop or store is sold out of a particular product, it has sold all of that product
Sense.TRAN: 〔商店里某种商品〕销售一空的﹐售完的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The store was completely sold out of tuna fish.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家商店里的金枪鱼已销售一空。

Sense.DEF: the sole person, thing etc is the only one
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sole American in the room
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间里唯一的美国人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Griffiths is the sole survivor of the crash.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格里菲思是此次撞车事故唯一的幸存者。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The story was published with the sole purpose of selling newspapers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刊登这则报道的目的纯粹是为了推销报纸。

Sense.DEF: not shared with anyone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Derek has sole responsibility for sales in Dublin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 德里克单独负责都柏林地区的销售。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company has the sole rights to market Elton John’s records.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司拥有埃尔顿•约翰唱片的独家销售权。

Sense.DEF: the bottom surface of your foot, especially the part you walk or stand on
Sense.EXAMPLE: The soles of his feet were caked in mud.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的脚掌上沾满了泥巴。

Sense.DEF: flat bottom part of a shoe, not including the heel
Sense.EXAMPLE: the soles of her shoes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她鞋子的鞋底

Sense.DEF: a flat fish that is often used for food
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dover sole
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太平洋油鲽﹐龙脷

Sense.DEF:
to put a new
sole
on a shoe

GramExa.GLOSS: having soles that are thick, made of leather etc

Sense.DEF: a mistake in the use of written or spoken language
something that is not considered polite behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: a social solecism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社交上的失礼

Sense.DEF: not involving anything or anyone else
Sense.TRAN: 唯一地﹐仅仅﹐独一无二地
Sense.EXAMPLE: Scholarships are given solely on the basis of financial need.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奖学金完全是根据经济需要发放的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I shall hold you solely responsible for anything that goes wrong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出现任何差错的话﹐我唯你是问。

Sense.DEF: very serious and not happy, for example because something bad has happened or because you are at an important occasion
Sense.EXAMPLE: a solemn expression
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 严肃的表情
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their faces suddenly grew solemn.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的脸突然变得严肃起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a solemn procession of mourners
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 庄重的送葬队伍

Sense.DEF: a solemn promise is one that is made very seriously and with no intention of breaking it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a solemn vow
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 郑重的誓约
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll never be unfaithful again. I give you my solemn word .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我再也不会对你不忠了﹐我郑重向你保证。

Sense.DEF: performed in a very serious way
the quality of being serious in behaviour or manner
Sense.EXAMPLE: the solemnity of a great religious occasion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重大宗教场合的庄严肃穆

Sense.DEF: the ceremonies of an important and serious occasion
to perform a wedding ceremony in a church

the system in which the notes of the musical
scale
are represented by seven short words,
do
,
re
,
mi
,
fa
,
so
,
la
,
ti
, which are used especially in singing
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指声乐中的〕首调唱名法﹐全音阶唱名法

Sense.DEF: to offer to have sex with someone in exchange for money
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was arrested for soliciting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因拉客卖淫被逮捕。

Sense.DEF: to ask someone for money, help, or information
Sense.EXAMPLE: Morgan is accused of illegally soliciting campaign contributions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摩根被指控非法征募竞选捐款。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The governor sent two officials to Mexico City to solicit aid from the President.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 州长派出两名官员去墨西哥城向总统求助。

Sense.DEF: to try to sell a product or service by taking it to homes or businesses and showing it to the people there
Sense.EXAMPLE: No soliciting on company premises is allowed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司场地内禁止推销。

Sense.DEF: the act of asking someone for money, help, or information
Sense.TRAN: 乞求﹔恳求﹐请求﹔〔信息的〕征求

Sense.DEF: a type of lawyer in Britain who gives legal advice, prepares the necessary documents when property is bought or sold, and defends people, especially in the lower courts of law
Sense.TRAN: 事务律师〔英国的一种律师﹐其职责为提供咨询﹑办理房地产买卖手续﹑在下级法庭出庭替人辩护等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need to see a solicitor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你需要找个律师。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a small firm of solicitors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家小型律师事务所

Sense.DEF: someone who goes from place to place trying to sell goods or services
Sense.EXAMPLE: A sign on the door read, ‘No Solicitors.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门上有块牌子写着:“谢绝推销”。

Sense.DEF:
the government law officer next in rank below the
attorney general
Sense.TRAN: 副检察长﹔〔美国的〕司法部副部长

Sense.DEF: very concerned about someone’s safety, health, or comfort
care and concern for someone’s health, safety etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was grateful to him for his solicitude.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她十分感激他的关切。

Sense.DEF: hard or firm, with a fixed shape, and not a liquid or gas
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lake was frozen solid .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 湖水冻得结结实实。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was good to be back on solid ground again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 又能踏上坚实的土地感觉真好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is the baby eating solid food bread, meat etc yet?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宝宝吃固体食物了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ship’s sonar can detect the presence of solid objects in the water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船上的声呐能够探测出水中的固体物。

Sense.DEF: consisting completely of one type of material

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a solid gold cup
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 纯金奖杯

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a chest made of solid oak
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 纯橡木做的箱子

Sense.DEF: having no holes or spaces inside
Sense.EXAMPLE: a solid rubber ball
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实心皮球
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shrine carved out of solid rock
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用实心岩石凿成的神龛

Sense.DEF: continuous, without any spaces or breaks
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s not safe to pass when the lines in the middle of the road are solid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 路中间如果是实线的话﹐超车就不安全。

Sense.DEF: strong and well made
Sense.EXAMPLE: a solid piece of furniture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件结实的家具
Sense.EXAMPLE: The frame is as solid as a rock extremely solid .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个框架十分坚固。

Sense.DEF: a solid achievement or solid work is of real, practical, and continuing value
Sense.TRAN: 〔成就或工作〕相当好的﹐经得起时间考验的
Sense.EXAMPLE: five years of solid achievement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五年实实在在的成绩
Sense.EXAMPLE: The first two years provide a solid foundation in the basics of computing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 头两年为电脑应用的基础方面打下坚实的根基。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is solid can be depended on or trusted
Sense.EXAMPLE: a solid reputation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可靠的声誉
Sense.EXAMPLE: The prosecution in this case has no solid evidence .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此案的原告缺乏可靠的证据。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can rely on Wylie for good solid advice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以放心地从怀利那里得到可靠的建议。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a solid Labour stronghold where people always vote for this party
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工党的一个坚固据点

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something continues for a long time without any pauses
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lecture lasted two solid hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这堂课上了整整两个小时。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: On Saturday I went to bed and slept fourteen hours solid.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期六我上床整整睡了14个小时。

Sense.DEF: if shops, trains, buses etc are packed solid, they are full of people
Sense.TRAN: 〔商店﹑火车﹑公共汽车等〕挤得水泄不通的

Sense.DEF: confident because you are dealing with a subject you are sure about, or because you are in a safe situation
Sense.TRAN: 有十分的把握﹐完全放心
Sense.EXAMPLE: To make sure that he was on solid ground, he confirmed his findings with others.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了确保有十分的把握﹐他把自己的研究结果向其他人作了核实。

Sense.DEF: good
very difficult
Sense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t do any of the maths last night – it was solid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚那些数学题我一道也做不出﹐太难了。

Sense.DEF: having length, width, and height
Sense.EXAMPLE: A sphere is a solid figure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球体是立体图形。

Sense.DEF: to be in complete agreement
Sense.EXAMPLE: The workers are 100% solid on this issue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人们在这个问题上是百分之百地一致。

Sense.DEF: a firm object or substance that has a fixed shape, not a gas or liquid
Sense.EXAMPLE: the properties of liquids and solids
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 液体和固体的特性

Sense.DEF: foods that are not liquid
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s still too ill to eat solids.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他仍病得很重﹐不能吃固体食物。

Sense.DEF:
the part of a liquid which has the qualities of a solid when it is separated from the
solvent watery part

a shape which has length, width, and height, such as a
sphere
or
cylinder
loyalty and general agreement between all the people in a group, or between different groups, because they all have a shared aim
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gesture of solidarity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 团结的表示
Sense.EXAMPLE: an appeal for worker solidarity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 呼吁工人们团结

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I come before you today to express my solidarity with the people of New York.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天我来到你们大家面前﹐是为了表示我对纽约人民的支持。

Sense.DEF: a solid substance such as coal that is burnt to produce heat or power
to become solid or make something solid
Sense.EXAMPLE: The volcanic lava solidifies as it cools.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火山熔岩冷却后变成固体。
Sense.EXAMPLE: solidified cream
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凝固的奶油

Sense.DEF: to make an agreement, plan, attitude etc more definite and less likely to change
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two countries signed a treaty to solidify their alliance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两国签订了条约以巩固双方的联盟。

Sense.DEF: the strength or hardness of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the solidity of the stone walls
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 石墙的坚固性

Sense.DEF: the quality of something that is permanent and can be depended on
Sense.EXAMPLE: the solidity of middle-class institutions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中产阶级制度的稳固性

Sense.DEF:
solid-state electrical equipment contains electronic parts, such as
silicon chips
, rather than moving
mechanical
parts
Sense.TRAN: 〔电子装置〕固态的﹐全晶体管的

Sense.DEF:
solid-state
physics
is concerned with the qualities of solid substances, especially the way in which they
conduct
electricity
Sense.TRAN: 〔物理学〕固态的〔固态物理学研究固态物质的性质﹐特别是其导电方式〕

Sense.DEF:
an
oblique2

a speech in a play in which a character, usually alone on the stage, talks to himself or herself so that the
audience
knows their thoughts

the idea in
philosophy
that only the
self
exists or can be known
Sense.TRAN: 唯我论〔认为只有自我存在并可知〕

Sense.DEF: interested only in yourself and the things that affect you

relating to the view in
philosophy
that only the
self
exists or can be known
a game played by one person with small wooden or plastic pieces on a board
a single jewel, or a piece of jewellery with a single jewel in it, especially a large diamond
Sense.TRAN: 独粒宝石〔尤指大粒钻石〕﹔镶有独粒宝石的饰物
Sense.EXAMPLE: a diamond solitaire
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 独粒钻石

Sense.DEF: a game of cards for one person
used to emphasize that there is only one of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the solitary goal of the match
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场比赛的唯一入球
Sense.EXAMPLE: The benches were empty except for a single solitary figure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了一个孤零零的身影﹐这些长凳上没有其他人了。

Sense.DEF: doing something without anyone else with you
Sense.EXAMPLE: a long, solitary walk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 独自一人的长距离散步

Sense.DEF: spending a lot of time alone, usually because you like being alone
Sense.TRAN: 喜欢独处的﹐不喜与人接触的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a solitary man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个孤僻的男子
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pandas are solitary creatures.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 熊猫是喜欢独处的动物。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He led a rather solitary existence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他过着形单影只的生活。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that there is not even one
Sense.EXAMPLE: He followed her round without a solitary word.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他跟着她﹐一句话也不说。

Sense.DEF: solitary confinement
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spent two weeks in solitary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被单独监禁了两周。

Sense.DEF: someone who lives completely alone
a punishment in which a prisoner is kept alone and is not allowed to see anyone else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He spent more than half his time in prison in solitary confinement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在狱中多半时间是被单独监禁的。

Sense.DEF: when you are alone, especially when this is what you enjoy

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Carl spent the morning in solitude.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天早上卡尔一个人很清静。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the solitude of her house on the lake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她湖边那所房子的清静

Sense.DEF: done alone without anyone else helping you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ridgeway’s solo voyage across the Atlantic
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 里奇韦独自横渡大西洋的航行
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the first solo ascent of Qomolangma
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 首次单独登上珠穆朗玛峰

Sense.EXAMPLE: a solo effort
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 独自的努力

Sense.DEF: relating to a record or piece of music that is performed by a single musician, not a group
Sense.EXAMPLE: a solo album
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 独唱专辑
Sense.EXAMPLE: a solo passage for viola
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中提琴的独奏段落

RunOn.EXAMPLE: When did you first fly solo?
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 你第一次单独飞行是什么时候？
RunOn.EXAMPLE: Amos quit the company, determined to go solo work for himself .
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿莫斯离开了公司﹐决定自己干。

Sense.DEF: a piece of music for one performer
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gorgeous piano solo
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一首极其美妙的钢琴独奏曲

Sense.DEF: when someone flies or does an activity alone
Sense.EXAMPLE: his first solo
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的首次单独飞行

Sense.DEF: to perform a solo in a piece of music
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brokaw solos brilliantly on this album.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布罗考在这张专辑中的独唱非常出色。

Sense.DEF: to fly an aircraft alone
a musician who performs alone or plays an instrument alone
Sense.EXAMPLE: cello soloist Yo Yo Ma
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大提琴独奏家马友友

Sense.DEF: (10th century BC) a king of Israel, the son of King David, who built the temple in Jerusalem, and is known for being extremely wise. Someone with ‘the wisdom of Solomon’ has a very special ability to make the right decision in situations where it is extremely difficult to know what to do.
Sense.TRAN: 所罗门〔（公元前10世纪）﹐以色列国王﹐大衞王之子﹐耶路撒冷圣殿的建造者﹐以拥有极高的智慧著称。 如果说某人具有“所罗门的智慧”﹐就是指此人具有非常特殊的才干﹐在面对艰难选择时能够作出明智的决断〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The chairman of the peace talks is going to need the wisdom of Solomon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次和平会谈的主持者必须拥有所罗门之智。

Sense.DEF:
the time when the sun is furthest north or south of the
equator

GramExa.GLOSS: the longest or shortest day of the year

Sense.DEF:
a soluble substance can be
dissolved
in a liquid
Sense.EXAMPLE: soluble aspirin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可溶性阿司匹林

GramExa.GLOSS: that can be dissolved in water

Sense.DEF: a problem that is soluble can be solved
a way of solving a problem or dealing with a difficult situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔对问题或困难局面的〕解决﹐解决方法
Sense.EXAMPLE: The best solution would be for them to separate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最好的解决方法是他们分开。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are no simple solutions to the problem of overpopulation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人口过多问题没有简单的解决方法。

Sense.DEF: the correct answer to a problem in an exercise or competition

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The solution to last week’s puzzle is on page 12.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 上星期字谜的谜底在第 12 页。

Sense.DEF: a liquid in which a solid or gas has been mixed
Sense.EXAMPLE: a weak sugar solution
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 淡淡的糖溶液
Sense.EXAMPLE: saline solution
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盐溶液

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A good solution is to harvest the crop early in September.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 上选之策是在9月初收割庄稼。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 最好的/完美的/理想的解决办法
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Locking people in prison is not necessarily the ideal solution.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 把人关进监狱未必是理想的对策。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The government has failed to come up with an effective solution.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府没有想出有效的解决办法。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We will not rest until a satisfactory solution is found.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要一直到找到满意的解决办法为止。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The only solution is to greatly reduce our use of water.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 唯一的办法是大量减少用水。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The real solution to the waste problem is to produce much less waste.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 解决垃圾问题的真正办法是减少垃圾的产生。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There are three possible solutions to this problem.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题有三种可行的解决办法。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that will be effective for a long time
one that solves a problem for a short time only
one that does not involve fighting

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We are working together to find the best solution we can.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正在共同努力,尽可能找到最好的解决办法。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The company is still seeking a solution to its financial problems.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司仍然在想办法解决财务问题。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I don't think that tourism will provide a long-term solution to rural employment problems.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为旅游业无法为农村地区的就业问题提供长期有效的解决办法。

Sense.DEF: to find or provide a way of dealing with a problem
Sense.EXAMPLE: Charlie thinks money will solve all his problems.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查理认为钱能解决他所有的问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the best way of solving our dilemma
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 解决我们两难处境的最佳办法

Sense.DEF: to find the correct answer to a problem or the explanation for something that is difficult to understand

GramExa.EXAMPLE: More than 70% of murder cases were solved last year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年有 70% 以上的谋杀案被侦破。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: attempts to solve a mathematical equation
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 解数学方程式的尝试

Sense.DEF: having enough money to pay your debts

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t know how we managed to remain solvent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道我们当时是怎么维持下来没有欠债的。

Sense.DEF:
a chemical that is used to
dissolve
another substance
when someone breathes in gases from glues or similar substances in order to get a pleasant feeling, especially when they become dependent on doing this
sad and serious
Sense.EXAMPLE: They sat in sombre silence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们闷闷不乐地坐着﹐一声不吭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were all in a somber mood that night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天晚上我们所有人都心情沉重。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sombre expression
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 忧郁的表情
Sense.EXAMPLE: on the sombre occasion of his mother’s funeral
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在他母亲葬礼的那种严肃场合

Sense.DEF: dark and without any bright colours
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sombre grey suit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暗色调的灰色套装

Sense.DEF:
a Mexican hat for men that is tall with a wide, round
brim1
turned up at the edges
a number of people or things, or an amount of some-thing, when the exact number or amount is not stated
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need some apples for this recipe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做这道菜我需要一些苹果。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My mother has inherited some land.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我母亲继承了一些土地。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re looking for someone with some experience.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在找有些经验的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctor gave her some medicine for her cough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生给她配了一些咳嗽药。

Sense.DEF: a number of people or things or an amount of something, but not all
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some people believe in life after death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人相信死后还有来生。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s been so depressed that some days she can’t get out of bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她非常抑郁﹐有几天她都起不了床。

Sense.DEF: a fairly large number of people or things or a fairly large amount of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was some time before they managed to turn the alarm off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过了很久他们总算关掉了警报器。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The donation went some way toward paying for the damage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔捐款很大一部分用于补偿损失。

Sense.DEF: used to mean a person or thing, when you do not know or say exactly which
Sense.TRAN: 某个﹐某种〔用于表示不知道确切是哪个人或物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: There must be some reason for her behaviour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的行为一定是有什么原因的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you give me some idea of the cost?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能告诉我大概是多少费用吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We can hopefully reach some kind of agreement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有望达成某种协议。

Sense.DEF: used when you are talking about a person or thing that you do not know, remember, or understand, or when you think it does not matter
Sense.TRAN: 某个﹐有个 〔用于谈到不认识﹑不记得或不明白的人或事物﹐或用于表示是谁﹑是什么无所谓〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some guy called for you while you were gone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你走了以后有个人打电话找你。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Just give him some excuse or other.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 随便给他个理由吧。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something was very good or very impressive
Sense.EXAMPLE: That was some party last night!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚的聚会真是棒极了！

Sense.LEXUNIT: some friend you are/some help she was etc
Sense.DEF: used, especially when you are annoyed, to mean someone or something has disappointed you by not behaving in the way you think they should
Sense.TRAN: 你也算朋友/她有什么帮助等〔说某人或某事让你失望的气话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You won’t lend me the money? Some friend you are!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不肯借钱给我？你真够朋友的！

Sense.DEF: a number of people or things or an amount of something, when the exact number or amount is not stated
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve just made a pot of coffee. Would you like some?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我刚煮了一壶咖啡﹐你想喝点吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you know where the screws are?’ ‘There are some in the garage.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你知道螺丝钉在哪儿吗？”“车库里有一些。”

Sense.DEF: a number of people or things or an amount of something, but not all
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many local businesses are having difficulties, and some have even gone bankrupt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多当地的企业陷入困境﹐有些甚至破产了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some say it was an accident, but I don’t believe it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人说那是一个意外﹐但我不相信。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many of the exhibits were damaged in the fire, and some were totally destroyed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多展品在那场大火中遭到损坏﹐一部分则被完全焚毁了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some of his jokes were very rude.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的有些玩笑非常粗鲁。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can I have some of your cake?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以吃一点你的蛋糕吗？

Sense.DEF: used to say that the actual amount is probably a lot more than what someone has just said
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘They say he earns $2.5 million a season.’ ‘And then some.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他们说他一季要赚 250 万美金。”“还不止呢。”

Sense.DEF: an additional number or amount of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you like some more cake?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要再来点蛋糕吗？

Sense.DEF: a little
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Are you feeling better today?’ ‘Some, I guess.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你今天感觉好点了吗？” “我觉得是稍好些了。”

Sense.DEF: an expression meaning about 500 people, 50%, £100 etc - used especially when this seems a large number or amount
Sense.TRAN: 大约 500 人/50%/100 英镑等〔尤用于表示数量大〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gained some 25 pounds in weight during pregnancy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在怀孕期间体重差不多增加了 25 磅。

Sense.DEF: a fairly large number or amount of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We travelled some little way before noticing that Bradley wasn’t with us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们走了相当一段路才发现布拉德利没跟我们在一起。

Sense.DEF: tending to behave in a particular way, or having a particular quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: a troublesome boy who causes trouble
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烦人的男孩
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bothersome back injury that bothers you
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 讨厌的背伤

Sense.DEF: a group of a particular number, for example in a game
Sense.EXAMPLE: a golf foursome four people playing golf together
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高尔夫四人赛

Sense.DEF: used to mean a person, when you do not know, or do not say who the person is
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s somebody waiting to see you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人等着要见你。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Somebody’s car alarm kept me awake all night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不知谁的汽车警报器吵得我整晚都无法入睡。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We need somebody neutral to sort this out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要个中立的人来解决这个问题。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you can’t make it Friday, we can invite somebody else a different person .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你星期五不行的话﹐我们可以邀请别人。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Who can we get to babysit?’ ‘I’ll call Suzie or somebody .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们能请谁来看小孩呢？”“我会叫苏齐或别的什么人。”

Sense.DEF: to be or feel important
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was the first teacher who’d made Paul feel like he was somebody.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是第一位让保罗觉得自己还有所作为的老师。

Sense.DEF: at an unknown time in the future, especially a long time in the future
Sense.TRAN: 将来会有一天﹐有朝一日
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to visit Japan someday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想将来有一天去日本。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He hopes, someday, to have his own business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他希望有一天能够拥有自己的公司。

Sense.DEF: in some way, or by some means, although you do not know how
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry, we’ll get the money back somehow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心﹐我们总会把那些钱拿回来的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Somehow, I managed to lose my keys.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知怎的竟然把钥匙弄丢了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maybe we could glue it together somehow or other .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许我们可以想什么办法把它粘起来。

Sense.DEF: for some reason that is not clear to you or that you do not understand
Sense.TRAN: 由于某种不明原因﹐不知为什么
Sense.EXAMPLE: Somehow, I just don’t think it’ll work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不知为什么﹐我总觉得那样行不通。

Sense.DEF: used to mean a person, when you do not know or do not say who the person is
Sense.EXAMPLE: What would you do if someone tried to rob you in the street?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是有人在街上抢劫你﹐你会怎么办？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will someone please explain what’s going on?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁能说说是怎么回事？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘When are you planning to hire someone?’ ‘As soon as we find someone suitable.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “你打算什么时候雇个人？”“等我们找到了合适的人选时。”
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you ask someone else a different person to help you? I’m really busy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能否请别人来帮你？我实在很忙。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Have Brooks or someone fax this to New York right away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叫布鲁克斯或谁立刻把这个发传真到纽约。

Sense.DEF: to be or feel important
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gerber was determined to be someone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格伯一心要出人头地。

Head.GRAM: not usually in questions or negatives
Head.GRAMTRAN: 一般不用于疑问句或否定句

Sense.DEF: somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: I must have left my jacket someplace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一定是把夹克衫落在什么地方了。

Sense.DEF: a movement in which someone rolls or jumps forwards or backwards so that their feet go over their head before they stand up again
Sense.TRAN: 筋斗﹐跟头﹐〔向前或向后的〕滚翻

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lana turned a somersault in midair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉娜在半空中翻了个筋斗。

Sense.DEF:
a
forward roll

Tail.EXAMPLE: He crashed into the table, somersaulted over it and landed on the carpet.
Tail.EXAMPLETRAN: 他撞到桌子上﹐翻了个筋斗落在地毯上。

Sense.DEF: used to mean a particular thing when you do not know its name or do not know exactly what it is
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s something in my eye.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我眼睛里有什么东西。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sarah said something about coming over later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉说她等一会儿过来什么的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s a good car but I’m looking for something newer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆车不错﹐但我想找辆更新的。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The house was too small, so they decided to look for something else a different one .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那房子太小﹐因此他们决定再另外找找。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I think there’s something wrong a problem with the phone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得这电话有问题。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know what he does exactly, but I know it has something to do with computers is related to them in some way .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道他具体是干什么的﹐只知道和电脑有关。

Sense.DEF: some food, a drink, a book, an activity etc
Sense.TRAN: 吃的/喝的/读的/做的东西等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you like something to drink?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想喝点什么吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I should take something to read on the plane.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我应该带点东西在飞机上读。

Sense.DEF: to do something in order to deal with a problem or difficult situation
Sense.TRAN: 动手去解决问题﹐做点什么
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t just stand there - do something!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要光站在那里——做点什么呀！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you do something about that noise?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能想想办法让那噪音消失吗？

Sense.DEF: used to say that a person, situation etc has a quality or feature that you recognize but you cannot say exactly what it is

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was something rather odd about him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他这人有点奇怪。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s something about her voice that I find really sexy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她声音里有种东西让我觉得非常性感。

Sense.DEF: used when you cannot remember, or do not think it is necessary to give, another example of something you are mentioning
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her name was Judith, or Julie, or something.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的名字叫朱迪丝或朱莉什么的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here’s some money. Get yourself a sandwich or something.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给你点钱﹐你去买个三明治什么的吃吧。

Sense.DEF: close to but not exactly a large amount such as 100, 2,000 etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Something like 50,000 homes are without power.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约有5万户人家没有电。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is aged between 30 and 39, between 40 and 49 etc when you do not know exactly
used to say that something is very good and impressive
Sense.EXAMPLE: Running your own company at 21 is really something.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你 21 岁就经营自己的公司﹐真了不起。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That was really something, wasn’t it?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那真是了不起﹐对不对？

Sense.DEF: to be unusual or funny to other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: You really are something else!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真有意思！

Sense.DEF: used to admit that someone’s words are true or their ideas are successful etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had to concede that there was something in his teaching methods.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不得不承认他的教学方法确实有一套。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you think there’s something to the rumours about Larry and Sue?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关拉里和休的传闻﹐你认为是不是真的？

Sense.DEF: to have a few of the same features or qualities that someone else has
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was clear that Jenkins had something of his father’s brilliance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很明显﹐詹金斯也有些他父亲的才华。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be something of a gardener/an expert etc
Sense.DEF: to know a lot about something or to be very good at something
Sense.TRAN: 算得上是园艺家/专家等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Charlie’s always been something of an expert on architecture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查理一直可以算得上是建筑方面的专家。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is a shock, surprise etc, but not completely or not in a strong or severe way
Sense.TRAN: 某事有点令人吃惊/意外等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The news came as something of a surprise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这消息让人感到有点意外。

Sense.DEF: used when you are telling someone that you have bought them a present
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got you a little something for your birthday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给你买了件小小的生日礼物。

Sense.DEF: used when you cannot remember the rest of a number or name
Sense.TRAN: 六十多/约翰什么的等〔表示记不起尾数或某人的全名〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How much did you spend on groceries?’ ‘A hundred and twenty something.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你买食品杂货用了多少钱？”“超过120 块吧。”

Sense.DEF: to become successful
used to say that there is one thing that you should be glad about
Sense.TRAN: 那还算不错〔表示某事可以聊以自慰〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: At least we have some money left. That’s something, isn’t it?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 至少我们还剩一点钱。 还算不错﹐是不是？

Sense.DEF: at a time in the future or in the past, although you do not know exactly when
Sense.TRAN: 在〔将来或过去的〕某个时候

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ll take a vacation sometime in September.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将在 9 月份的某个时候休假。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our house was built sometime around 1900.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的房子建于 1900 年左右。

Sense.DEF: former
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sir Richard Marsh, the sometime chairman of British Rail
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 理查德•马什爵士﹐英国铁路公司前董事长

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone does or has a particular job part of the time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Grimm, a sometime delivery driver, lives with his elderly mother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格里姆﹐有时开车送送货﹐和他年迈的母亲住在一起。

Sense.DEF: on some occasions but not always
Sense.EXAMPLE: I sometimes have to work late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有时得工作到很晚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sometimes, Grandma would tell us stories about her childhood in Italy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候﹐祖母会跟我们讲讲她儿时在意大利的经历。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you ever wish you were back in Japan?’ ‘Sometimes. Not very often.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你有没有想过希望回到日本？”“有时候吧﹐但不经常这么想。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: The journey takes an hour, sometimes even longer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 路上需要一小时﹐有时甚至更长。

Exponent.DEF: on some occasions but not always
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Sometimes, I wish I was still living in Tokyo.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些时候,我希望自己还住在东京。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He sometimes plays football with my brother.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有时候和我哥哥一起踢足球。

Exponent.DEF: used about something that only happens a few times. Occasionally is used when something happens more rarely than sometimes .
Exponent.TRAN: 偶尔〔指某事发生频率少于sometimes〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I prefer trousers but I do wear skirts occasionally.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢穿裤子,但是偶尔也会穿穿裙子。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Occasionally, operations have to be cancelled.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 偶尔几次,行动不得不取消。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: On occasion, prisoners were allowed visits from their families.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 偶尔也允许犯人接受家属探访。

Exponent.DEF: sometimes but not often or regularly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We still call each other every now and then.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们仍然时不时互通电话。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Every now and again, an invention comes along which changes people’s lives completely.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 时不时会出现一项发明彻底改变人们的生活。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Even experienced doctors make mistakes from time to time.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 即便经验丰富的医生有时也会出错。

Exponent.DEF: sometimes at fairly regular periods
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He looked up from his book every so often.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他每隔一段时间就从书本上抬起头来看一下。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Every so often, a train whizzed past.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 每隔一段时间就有一列火车呼啸而过。

Exponent.DEF: if something happens at times, it happens sometimes but is not what usually happens
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The job can be frustrating at times.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个工作有时令人沮丧。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: At times I’ve wondered whether I made the right decision in moving here.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时我会怀疑搬到这里是不是一个正确的决定。

Exponent.DEF: sometimes but very rarely
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We only see each other every once in a while.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只是偶尔见一面。

Sense.DEF: more than a little but not very

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The price is somewhat higher than I expected.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 价格比我预料的高了一点。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Things have changed somewhat since then.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从那时候起﹐情况就有些不一样了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: To say that I was surprised is somewhat of an understatement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 说我感到意外还是有点保留的说法。

Sense.DEF: in or to a place, but you do not say or know exactly where
Sense.EXAMPLE: My wallet must be around here somewhere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的钱包肯定是在这里的什么地方。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There must be somewhere to eat cheaply in this town.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 镇上肯定有吃饭便宜的地方。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Is there somewhere safe where I can leave my bike?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里有什么安全的地方可以放我的自行车吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Go and play somewhere else in a different place – I’m trying to work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 到别的地方去玩——我要工作。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We could meet for dinner at Giorgio’s or somewhere or a similar place .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以在乔治家或别的什么地方一起吃饭。

Sense.DEF: a little more or a little less than a particular number or amount, especially a large one
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have somewhere in the region of 500 firefighters in this area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这个地区﹐我们有大约 500 名消防队员。

Sense.DEF: to be making progress
Sense.EXAMPLE: At last I feel we’re getting somewhere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我终于觉得我们有进展了。

Sense.DEF: someone who walks while they are asleep
almost starting to sleep
Sense.EXAMPLE: He lay quiet, somnolent after the day’s exertions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他静静地躺着﹐劳累了一天之后感到十分困倦。

Sense.DEF: making you want to sleep
Sense.EXAMPLE: a somnolent summer’s afternoon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人昏昏欲睡的夏日午后

Sense.DEF: someone’s male child
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her son Sean was born in 1983.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的儿子肖恩出生于 1983 年。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They have three sons and a daughter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们有三个儿子和一个女儿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In those days, the property went to the oldest son.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时候﹐财产由长子继承。
Sense.EXAMPLE: their youngest son, George
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们最小的儿子乔治

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the son of a poor farmer
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个穷苦农民的儿子

Sense.DEF: used by an older person as a way to address a boy or young man
Sense.TRAN: 孩子〔年长者对男孩或年轻男子的称呼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s your name, son?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你叫什么名 字﹐孩子？

Sense.DEF: Jesus Christ, the second member of the group from the Christian religion that also includes the Father and the Holy Spirit
Sense.TRAN: 圣子〔指耶稣基督﹐圣父﹑圣子﹑圣灵三位一体中的第二位〕

Sense.DEF: a man, especially a famous man, from a particular place or country
Sense.TRAN: 〔来自某个地方或国家的﹐尤指有名望的〕男士﹐人士
Sense.EXAMPLE: Frank Sinatra, New Jersey’s most famous son
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗兰克•西纳特拉﹐新泽西州最著名的人士

Sense.DEF: used by a priest to address a man or boy
Sense.TRAN: 我的孩子〔神父对男子或男孩的称呼〕

Sense.DEF:
equipment on a ship or
submarine
that uses
sound waves
to find out the position of objects under the water
Sense.TRAN: 声呐（设备）〔船上或潜艇上利用声波探测水下目标位置的仪器〕

Sense.DEF: a piece of music with three or four parts that is written for a piano, or for a piano and another instrument
Sense.EXAMPLE: a piano sonata
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钢琴奏鸣曲

Sense.DEF: a performance that tells the story of a historical place or event using lights and recorded sound
Sense.TRAN: 〔配以声光效果的〕实地历史剧﹔声光表演

Subsense.DEF: a short piece of music with words that you sing
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We used to listen to pop songs on the radio.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们以前常常听收音机里播放的流行歌曲。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They sat round with guitars, singing folk songs.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们弹着吉他围坐在一起唱民歌。

Subsense.DEF: songs in general
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The bravery of past warriors was celebrated in song.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以歌曲颂扬了昔日武士的英勇事迹。

Sense.DEF:
the musical sounds made by birds and some other animals such as
whales
Sense.EXAMPLE: the song of the lark
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 云雀的鸣唱

Sense.DEF: very cheaply
Sense.EXAMPLE: He bought the house for a song five years ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在五年前以极低的价格买下那栋房子。

Subsense.DEF: if you make a song and dance about something, you behave as if it was worse, more important, more difficult etc than it really is
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Suzy was there, making a song and dance about her aching feet.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏济在那里大呼小叫地说脚疼。

Subsense.DEF: an explanation or excuse that is too long and complicated
Subsense.TRAN: 冗长的解释﹔长而复杂的借口
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She gave us a long song and dance about why she was late.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她向我们长篇大论地解释她为什么迟到。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He started singing a little song.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始唱一首短歌。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The band played a lot of their old songs.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐队演唱了他们的许多老歌。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He doesn’t like performing his songs live.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不喜欢现场演唱他的歌曲。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Do they write their own songs?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们是自己写歌吗？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: onto a CD so that it can be sold

Collocate.EXAMPLE: That’s a great song!
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这歌很棒！

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Are any of the songs on the album new?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 专辑里有什么新歌吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: People always want to hear their old songs.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们总是想听自己那个时代的老歌。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used mainly of songs written before the 1960s
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 〔多指20世纪60年代前的〕流行歌曲

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The crowd spontaneously burst into song.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群不由自主地放声歌唱。

Sense.DEF: a bird that can make musical sounds
a book with the words and music of many songs
a singer – used in newspapers
a songbird
a female singer – used in newspapers
someone who writes the words and usually the music of songs
the process of writing songs
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s some excellent songwriting on this album.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张专辑中有些创作非常出色。

Sense.DEF:
relating to sound,
sound waves
, or the speed of sound
the loud sound like an explosion that an aircraft makes when it starts to travel faster than the speed of sound
Sense.TRAN: 声爆﹐声震〔飞机开始以超音速飞行时所发出的像爆炸般的巨响〕

Sense.DEF: the husband of your daughter

a poem with 14 lines which
rhyme
with each other in a fixed pattern
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shakespeare’s sonnets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莎士比亚的十四行诗

Sense.DEF: used when speaking to a boy or young man who is much younger than you
Sense.TRAN: 孩子﹐小伙子〔用于称呼男孩或比自己年轻得多的男子〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now you listen to me, sonny.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喂﹐你听我说﹐年轻人。

Sense.DEF: used when speaking to a man or boy, especially when you are telling him that he has done something wrong
Sense.TRAN: 老 兄﹐好小子﹐家伙〔对男子或男孩的称呼﹐尤用于告诉他做错 了事〕

Sense.DEF: an offensive expression for a man that you are very angry with
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a filthy lying son of a bitch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个狗娘养的下流骗子。

Sense.DEF: used when you are annoyed or surprised
Sense.TRAN: 他妈的！ 真见鬼！〔表示生气或吃惊〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Son of a bitch! You did it!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 臭小子！ 是你干的好事！

Sense.LEXUNIT: be a son of a bitch
Sense.DEF: to be very difficult
Sense.EXAMPLE: Getting the new tire on was a real son of a bitch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上新轮胎真他妈的费劲。

Sense.DEF: a man you like or admire – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 老兄﹐家 伙﹐好小子〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Duke, you old son of a gun, how are you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杜克﹐你这老家伙﹐你好吗？

Sense.DEF: a man that you are annoyed with
Sense.TRAN: 流氓﹐恶棍﹐坏家伙〔表示生气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Somebody go tell that son of a gun we’re all waiting here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁去告诉那个家伙﹐我们全都在这里等着呢。

Sense.DEF: an object that is difficult to deal with – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 难对付的东西﹐鬼东西〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: used to express surprise
Sense.TRAN: 他妈的！ 真见鬼！〔表示惊讶〕

Sense.DEF: used by Christians to mean Jesus Christ
Sense.TRAN: 圣子〔基督徒对耶稣基督的称呼〕

Sense.DEF: an image, for example of an unborn baby inside its mother’s body, that is produced by a special machine
having a pleasantly deep loud sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sonorous voice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洪亮的嗓音

Sense.DEF: in a short time from now, or a short time after something else happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: It will be dark soon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天很快就要黑了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: David arrived sooner than I expected.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维到得比我预料的快。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Paula became pregnant soon after they were married.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们结婚后不久﹐葆拉就怀孕了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Who?’ ‘You’ll find out soon enough fairly soon .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “谁？”“你很快就会知道的。”

Sense.DEF: quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: How soon can you finish the report?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最快几时能写完报告？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try and get the car fixed as soon as possible .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想办法尽快把车修好。

Sense.DEF: immediately after something happens, without delay
Sense.EXAMPLE: As soon as she entered the room, she knew there was something wrong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一踏进房间就知道有什么不对劲了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll come over to your place as soon as I can.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会尽快到你这里来。

Sense.DEF: used to say that it is important that something should happen very soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sooner we get this job finished the better.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这工作我们越快完成越好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s get out of here! The sooner the better!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们离开这里吧！越快越好！

Sense.DEF: used to say that you want something to happen soon, so that something else can then happen …
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sooner I get this work done, the sooner I can go home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我越快做完这件工作﹐就可以越早 回家。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something happened almost immediately after something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: No sooner had he sat down than the phone rang.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他刚坐下﹐电话铃就响了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is certain to happen at some time in the future, though you cannot be sure exactly when
Sense.EXAMPLE: His wife’s bound to find out sooner or later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他妻子迟早会发现。

Sense.DEF: too early

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s still too soon to say whether the operation was a success.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在说手术是否成功还为时过早。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The holidays were over all too soon much earlier than you would like .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 假期结束得太快了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you will do something immediately

Sense.LEXUNIT: not a moment too soon/none too soon
Sense.DEF: almost too late
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘The doctor’s here!’ ‘And not a moment too soon!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “医生来了！”“差点就晚了！”

Sense.DEF: if you would sooner do something, you would much prefer to do it, especially instead of something that seems unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d sooner die than marry you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我宁可死也不和你结婚！

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone would prefer to do something or would prefer something to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d just as soon you didn’t drive the car while I’m gone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望我不在的时候你不要开车。

Exponent.DEF: in a short time from now, or a short time after something else happens
Exponent.EXAMPLE: See you soon!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 回头见！
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It seemed difficult at first, but I soon got used to it.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 开始很难,但我很快就适应了。

Exponent.DEF: in the next few weeks or months. In the near future is more formal than soon .
Exponent.TRAN: 在不久的将来,不久〔比soon正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The book will be on sale in the near future.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书不久就会降价出售。

Exponent.DEF: very soon – used to talk about something good happening
Exponent.TRAN: 马上,很快〔用于指好事发生〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You’ll be feeling better in no time at all.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你马上就会好起来的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In no time at all, her son was starting to speak Japanese.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 没多久,她儿子就开始说日语了。

Exponent.DEF: used to say that you will do something or something will happen within a few minutes
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ll be ready in a minute.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我马上就好。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The film’s going to start in a minute.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 电影马上开始。

Exponent.DEF: used to say that something will or may happen very soon, but you do not know exactly when
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They should be here any minute now.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们应该很快就到这里。

Exponent.DEF: used to say that something will or may happen in the next few days, but you do not know exactly when
Exponent.TRAN: 不久,很快〔表示以后几天,但不知哪一天〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m hoping to hear from her any day now.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望很快就能收到她的来信。

Exponent.DEF: a short time from now
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They will be with us shortly.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们马上就到我们这里。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the new laws that will shortly be coming into effect
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 即将生效的新法律

Exponent.DEF: soon – used especially when something happens which you expected to happen
Exponent.TRAN: 不久以后〔尤用于预期会发生的事发生了〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They got married, and before long Anna was expecting a baby.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们结婚了,不久安娜就怀了孩子。

Exponent.DEF: used when saying that something will happen soon
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It won’t be long before everything is back to normal.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 很快一切就会恢复正常。

Sense.DEF: black powder that is produced when something is burned
to make someone feel calmer and less anxious, upset, or angry
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lucy soothed the baby by rocking it in her arms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 露西把宝宝抱在怀里摇晃着﹐让他安静下来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She made a cup of tea to soothe her nerves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她泡了杯茶让自己平静下来。

Sense.DEF: to make a pain become less severe, or slowly disappear
Sense.EXAMPLE: I bought some lozenges to soothe my sore throat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我买了一些润喉糖来减轻喉咙痛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Massage can gently soothe away your aches and pains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按摩可以慢慢地缓解疼痛。

Sense.DEF: someone who is believed to be able to say what will happen in the future
something not very important or valuable that a government or someone in authority offers to people to stop them from complaining or protesting – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔为息事宁人而给予的价值不高的〕抚慰的东西〔含贬义〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company agreed to inspect the river regularly, as a sop to the environmental lobby.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司同意定期对那条河进行检测﹐以敷衍环保团体。

Sense.DEF: to remove liquid from a surface by using a piece of cloth that takes the liquid into itself
someone who is sophisticated
having a lot of experience of life, and good judgment about socially important things such as art, fashion etc
Sense.TRAN: 见多识广的﹔练达的﹔有鉴赏力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sophisticated, witty American
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个见多识广﹑机智风趣的美国人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Clarissa’s hair was swept up into a sophisticated style.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克拉丽莎的头发向后梳成一个很老成的式样。

Sense.DEF: a sophisticated machine, system, method etc is very well designed and very advanced, and often works in a complicated way
Sense.TRAN: 〔机器﹑系统﹑方法等〕复杂的﹐精密的﹐尖端的
Sense.EXAMPLE: sophisticated software
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很先进的软件
Sense.EXAMPLE: a highly sophisticated weapons system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常精密的武器系统

Sense.DEF: having a lot of knowledge and experience of difficult or complicated subjects and therefore able to understand them well
Sense.TRAN: 富有经验的﹐老练的﹔精通的
Sense.EXAMPLE: British voters have become much more sophisticated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国的选民已经变得成熟多了。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a New York nightclub that was the height of sophistication very fashionable and expensive
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 纽约一家最为时髦豪华的夜总会

Sense.DEF: the clever use of reasons or explanations that seem correct but are really false, in order to deceive people

a student who is in their second year of study at a college or
high school
silly, and behaving in a way that is typical of someone much younger
Sense.EXAMPLE: sophomoric humor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幼稚的幽默

Sense.DEF: making you feel ready to sleep
Sense.TRAN: 使人昏昏欲睡的﹐催眠的
Sense.EXAMPLE: His voice had an almost soporific effect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的嗓音几乎有催眠作用。

Sense.DEF: very wet
Sense.EXAMPLE: My clothes were absolutely sopping!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的衣服都湿透了！

Sense.DEF: expressing love or emotions in a way that seems silly
Sense.TRAN: 多情得傻乎乎的﹐多愁善感的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a soppy film
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伤感的电影

Sense.DEF: to be very fond of someone or something, in a way that seems silly to other people
Sense.TRAN: 非常喜爱某人/某物﹐对某人/某物很痴迷〔在旁人看来显得有点傻〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s soppy about dogs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她爱狗如命。

Sense.DEF: a very high singing voice belonging to a woman or a boy, or a singer with a voice like this
Sense.TRAN: 女高音﹔男童声高音﹔女高音歌手﹔男童声高音歌手

Sense.DEF: the part of a musical work that is written for a soprano voice or instrument
Sense.TRAN: 〔音乐作品中的〕女高音声部﹔高音乐器
Sense.EXAMPLE: She sings soprano .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她唱女高音。

Sense.DEF: a soprano voice or instrument has the highest range of notes
a frozen sweet food made of fruit juice, sugar, and water
Sense.TRAN: 雪芭〔一种用果汁﹑糖和水制成的冰糕〕

Sense.DEF: a man in stories who uses magic and receives help from evil forces
a woman in stories who uses magic and receives help from evil forces
Sense.TRAN: 〔故事中的〕女巫﹐女术士﹐女魔法师

Sense.DEF: magic that uses the power of evil forces
involving immoral or dishonest behaviour

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The whole sordid affair came out in the press.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这桩龌龊的桃色事件见报了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She discovered the truth about his sordid past.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她发现了他不光彩的过去。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I want to hear all the sordid details !
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要听一听所有那些龌龊的细节！

Sense.DEF: very dirty and unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sordid little room
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肮脏的小房间

Sense.DEF: a part of your body that is sore is painful, because of infection or because you have used a muscle too much
Sense.TRAN: 〔身体部位〕疼痛的﹔〔肌肉〕酸痛的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had a sore throat and aching limbs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喉咙疼﹐四肢酸痛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My arms are sore from all the lifting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我搬东西搬到手臂酸痛。

Sense.DEF: something that is likely to make someone upset or angry when you talk about it
Sense.TRAN: 容易惹某人烦恼[生气]的话题
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just don’t mention it - it’s always been a sore point with him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 千万别提那件事﹐那一直是他的痛处。

Sense.DEF: upset, angry, and annoyed, especially because you have not been treated fairly
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因受到不公平对待而〕恼火的﹐气愤的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mac’s still sore because I didn’t invite him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克还在因为我没邀请他而生气呢。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t be sore at me - I just forgot to tell you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别生我的气﹐我只是忘记告诉你了。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how serious, difficult etc something is
Sense.EXAMPLE: Inner city schools are in sore need of extra funds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市中心贫民区的学校亟需增加经费。

Sense.DEF: someone who gets angry or upset when they lose a game or competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nobody likes a sore loser.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁都不喜欢输不起的人。

Sense.LEXUNIT: stick/stand out like a sore thumb
Sense.DEF: if someone or something sticks out like a sore thumb, they are very noticeable because they are different from everyone or everything else
Sense.EXAMPLE: You stick out like a sore thumb in that uniform.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你穿那套制服太扎眼了。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: be like a bear with a sore head

Sense.DEF: a painful, often red, place on your body caused by a wound or infection
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were starving and covered with sores.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在挨 饿﹐身上长满了疮。

Sense.DEF: someone who is unpleasant or angry in an unreasonable way
Sense.TRAN: 性情暴躁的人﹐动辄发怒的人

Sense.DEF: very much or very seriously
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jim will be sorely missed .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家会非常想念吉姆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sabine was sorely tempted to throw her drink in his face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拜因恨不得把她手中的饮料泼到他脸上去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your help is sorely needed .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很需要你的帮助。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Courage is a quality that is sorely lacking in world leaders today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 勇气是当今世界领导人极为欠缺的一种素质。

Sense.DEF: a type of grain that is grown in tropical areas
a club for women students at some American colleges and universities
a plant with leaves that taste bitter, sometimes used in cooking
Sense.TRAN: 酸模〔一种叶子酸苦﹑可用于烹调的植物〕

Sense.DEF: a feeling of great sadness, usually because someone has died or because something terrible has happened to you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a time of great sorrow
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 万分悲痛的时刻

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He expressed his sorrow at my father’s death.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对我父亲的去世表示悲痛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Claudia felt a deep pang of sorrow for the woman.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 克劳迪娅为这女人感到一阵深切的悲伤。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say sadness rather than sorrow .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们一般说 sadness ,而不说 sorrow
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She talked about her sadness after his death.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她谈起了他死后她的悲痛心情。

Sense.DEF: an event or situation that makes you feel great sadness
Sense.EXAMPLE: the family’s joys and sorrows
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家人的喜与悲

Sense.LEXUNIT: more in sorrow than in anger
Sense.DEF: in a way that shows you are sad or disappointed rather than angry about a particular situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: He said that his decision to resign was made more in sorrow than in anger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说他作出辞职的决定与其说是出于气愤﹐不如说是因为悲伤。

Sense.DEF: to feel or express sorrow

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her friend was sorrowing over the loss of a child.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的朋友在为失去孩子感到悲痛。

Sense.EXAMPLE: sorrowing parents
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 悲伤的父母

Sense.DEF: very sad
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sorrowful expression
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 悲伤的表情

RunOn.EXAMPLE: ‘A lot of damage has already been done,’ he said sorrowfully.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: “已经造成了许多损失。”他伤心地说。

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of the word sorry in spoken and written English. 单词 sorry 在英语口语和书面语中的使用频率。

Subsense.DEF: used to tell someone that you wish you had not done something that has affected them badly, hurt them etc
Subsense.TRAN: 对不起﹐很抱歉〔用于表示歉意〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m really sorry. I didn’t mean to hurt your feelings.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常抱歉﹐我不是有意要伤害你的感情。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Matt, stop doing that!’ ‘Sorry!’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “马特﹐别那么做！”“对不起！”
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry, did I step on your foot?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我踩到你的脚了吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry I’m late - the traffic was terrible.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很抱歉我迟到了﹐路上堵得厉害。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sorry about the mess - I’ll clean it up.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起弄得乱七八糟﹐我会打扫干净的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry for making such a fuss.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这样大惊小怪的﹐真是不好意思。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Sorry to bother you , but what was the address again?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起麻烦你了﹐再说一下那个地址好吗？

Subsense.DEF: used as a polite way of introducing disappointing information or a piece of bad news
Subsense.TRAN: 很遗憾﹐对不起〔用于礼貌地引出令人失望的信息或坏消息〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry, but all the flights to Athens are fully booked.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很遗憾﹐所有飞往雅典的航班都订满了。

Subsense.DEF: used when you have said something that is not correct, and want to say something that is correct
Subsense.TRAN: 对不起﹐应该是〔用于纠正自己说错的话〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Turn right - sorry left - at the traffic lights.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到红绿灯向右拐——对不起﹐是向左拐。

Subsense.DEF: used when you refuse an offer or request
Subsense.TRAN: 不好意思﹐对不起〔用于拒绝别人的提议或请求〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Are you coming to lunch?’ ‘Sorry, no. I’ve got to finish this work.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你来吃午饭吗？”“不好意思﹐不行﹐我得把这工作做完。”
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’ll give you $50 for it.’ ‘Sorry, no deal.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我出 50 美元买下它。” “对不起﹐不行。”

Subsense.DEF: used when you disagree with someone, or tell someone that they have done something wrong
Subsense.TRAN: 很遗憾﹐很抱歉〔用于表示不同意某人或告诉某人他们做错了某事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry, but I find that very hard to believe, Miss Brannigan.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐布兰尼根小姐﹐我觉得那令人难以置信。

Sense.DEF: feeling ashamed or unhappy about something bad you have done
Sense.TRAN: 〔因做了坏事而感到〕惭愧的﹐歉疚的﹐过意不去的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was genuinely sorry for what she had done.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她为自己所做的事真诚地感到歉疚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Casey was sorry he’d gotten so angry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯西为自己大发脾气而感到愧疚。

GramExa.GLOSS: tell someone that you feel bad about hurting them, causing problems etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was probably too late to say sorry, but she would try anyway.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 道歉也许太晚了﹐但不管怎样她还是想道个歉。

Sense.DEF: used to ask someone to repeat something that you have not heard properly
Sense.TRAN: 你说什么？〔用于请某人重复你没有听清楚的话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry? What was that again?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 什么？再说一遍好吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Want a drink?’ ‘Sorry?’ ‘I said, would you like a drink?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “想喝一杯吗？”“什么？”“我是说﹐你想不想喝一杯？”

Sense.DEF: to feel pity or sympathy for someone because something bad has happened to them or because they are in a bad situation
Sense.TRAN: 为某人难过﹐替某人感到惋惜
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got no sympathy for him, but I feel sorry for his wife.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我并不同情他﹐但我为他妻子感到惋惜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tina was sorry for her. She seemed so lonely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂娜为她感到难过﹐她看起来是那么孤独。

GramExa.GLOSS: feel unhappy and pity yourself
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s no good feeling sorry for yourself. It’s all your own fault.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你自怨自艾没有用﹐这都是你自己的过错。

Sense.DEF: feeling sad about a situation, and wishing it were different

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Brigid was always sorry she hadn’t kept up her piano lessons.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 布里吉德一直后悔没有坚持上钢琴课。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were sorry to miss your concert.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们很遗憾没有去听你的音乐会。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I won’t be sorry to leave this place.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不会后悔离开这个地方。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was sorry to hear about your accident.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 听到你出了事我感到很难过。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m so sorry about your father I am sorry something bad has happened to him .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我为你父亲感到难过。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that they will soon wish they had not done something, especially because someone will be angry or punish them
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll be sorry when your dad hears about this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等你爸知道这件事﹐你就要后悔了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are disappointed that something has happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wrote several times but they never replied, I’m sorry to say.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给他们写了好几封信﹐可是他们从不回信﹐真叫人失望。

Sense.DEF: very bad, especially in a way that makes you feel pity or disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sorry state of the environment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 糟糕的环境状况
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a sorry state of affairs when an old lady has to wait 12 hours to see a doctor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个老太太看病要等上12个小时﹐这情形很可悲。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sorry sight of so many dead animals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量动物尸体的悲惨景象
Sense.EXAMPLE: This whole sorry episode bad thing that happened shows just how incompetent the government has become.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一可悲事件反映出政府变得多么无能。

Tail.TailContent: Frequencies of the noun sort in spoken and written English. 名词 sort 在英语口语和书面语中的使用频率。

Sense.DEF: a group or class of people, things etc that have similar qualities or features

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What sort of shampoo do you use?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你用的是哪一种洗发剂？

GramExa.GLOSS: a lot of different types of things
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I like all sorts of food - I’m not fussy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 各种食物我都喜欢﹐我不挑剔。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: On expeditions of this sort, you have to be prepared for trouble.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 进行这种探险﹐你必须做好遇上麻烦的准备。

GramExa.PROPFORM: of some sort/some sort of sth
GramExa.GLOSS: used when you do not know exactly what type
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He wondered if Rosa was in some sort of trouble.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在想罗莎是否遇到什么麻烦了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a game of some sort going on inside.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里面正进行一种游戏。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of the victims developed psychological problems of one sort or another of various different types .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数受害者都出现了这样那样的心理问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They do burgers, pizzas, that sort of thing .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们供应汉堡包﹑比萨饼什么的。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that something is partly true but does not describe the exact situation
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I sort of like him, but I don’t know why.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有点喜欢他﹐但不知道为什么。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you know what I mean?’ ‘Sort of.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你知道我是什么意思吗？”“有点知道。”

Subsense.DEF: used when you are trying to describe something but it is difficult to find the right word or to be exact
Subsense.TRAN: 有点像﹐好像〔表示不肯定自己是不是用词恰当〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Then they started sort of chanting.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 然后他们像吟诵似的唱了起来。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The walls are a sort of greeny-blue colour.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙面有点蓝莹莹绿兮兮的。

GramExa.GLOSS: used very informally when searching for the right words
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was sort of like really strange and mysterious, walking round this empty building.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 走在这栋空空的大楼里﹐怎么说呢﹐有点神秘怪异的感觉。

Subsense.DEF: used to make what you are saying sound less strong or direct
Subsense.TRAN: 有一点﹐有几分 〔用于婉转语气〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Well, I sort of thought we could go out together sometime.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐我觉得我们什么时候可以一起出去。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It was sort of a shock when I found out.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发现的时候有点吃惊。

Subsense.DEF: a price etc that is not very exact, but could be slightly more or less
Subsense.TRAN: 大概的价格/时间/速度等
Subsense.EXAMPLE: That’s the sort of price I was hoping to pay.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望出的差不多就是那个价格。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What sort of time were you thinking of starting?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你大概想要什么时候开始？

Sense.DEF: used when something is not a good or typical example of its kind of thing
Sense.TRAN: 勉强称得上 的﹐勉强算的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had a conversation of sorts with a very drunk man at the bus stop.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在公共汽车站和一个喝得烂醉的人算是交谈了几句。

Sense.DEF: used when you are mentioning or describing something in a way that is not definite or exact
Sense.EXAMPLE: We could just stay here and pass the time, sort of thing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以就待在这里打发时间或什么的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She uses a wheelchair sort of thing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她用的是有点像轮椅之类的东西。

Sense.DEF: used when you are angry about what someone has said or done
Sense.TRAN: 那叫什么…？〔用于对某人的话或行为表示生气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What sort of time do you call this to come in?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 都什么时候了﹐你才来？

Sense.DEF: used to say angrily that something is not true or that someone should not do something
Sense.TRAN: 根本不是﹔绝对不行〔用于气愤地否认某事或不让某人做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m going to watch TV.’ ‘You’ll do nothing of the sort!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我要看电视。”“不行！”

Sense.DEF: someone who has a particular type of character, and is therefore likely to behave in a particular way
Sense.TRAN: 某一种人﹐某种性格的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Iain’s never even looked at another woman. He’s not the sort .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊恩从来对别的女人连看也不看一眼。 他不是那种人。

Sense.LEXUNIT: it takes all sorts (to make a world)
Sense.DEF: used to say that you think someone is behaving in a strange or crazy way
Sense.TRAN: 世上的人形形色色﹐世界上无奇不有〔用于表示某人行为古怪或疯狂〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He goes climbing up cliffs without ropes or anything? Oh well, it takes all sorts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他去攀岩不带绳子什么的？ 哇﹐真是什么人都有啊。

Sense.DEF: if a computer does a sort, it puts things in a particular order
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机操作的〕分类﹐ 排序

Sense.DEF: feeling a little ill or upset
Sense.EXAMPLE: Louise went back to work feeling rather out of sorts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 路易丝回去工作了﹐感觉不大舒服。

Sense.DEF: to put things in a particular order or arrange them in groups according to size, type etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The eggs are sorted according to size.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些鸡蛋是按大小分类的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let’s sort all the clothes into piles.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们来把所有这些衣服都整理好分成几堆。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: All the names on the list have been sorted into alphabetical order.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 名单上所有的名字已按字母顺序排列好。

Sense.DEF: to deal with a situation so that all the problems are solved and everything is organized
Sense.EXAMPLE: Right, I’ll leave this for Roger and Terry to sort, then.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好吧﹐那么我就把这件事交给罗杰和特里去处 理吧。

Sense.DEF: to arrange or organize something that is mixed up or untidy, so that it is ready to be used
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to sort out our camping gear before we go away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们出发前先要把露营装备整理好。

Sense.DEF: to separate one type of thing from another
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve sorted out the papers that can be thrown away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经把可以扔掉的文件拣出来了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: First, sort the white things out from the other clothes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 首先﹐把白色衣物挑出来和其他衣服分开。

Sense.DEF: to successfully deal with a problem or difficult situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: She went to a psychiatrist to try to sort out her problems .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她去找了一位精神科医生﹐想看看自己的毛病。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll be glad to get this misunderstanding sorted out .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果能消除误会﹐我会很高兴。

GramExa.PROPFORM: sort yourself out/get yourself sorted out
GramExa.GLOSS: deal with all your problems
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m staying with a friend until I manage to sort myself out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正暂住在一个朋友家里﹐直到我把自己的问题都解决了为止。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in making arrangements for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you sorted out where you’re going to live yet?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你打算好要住哪里了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: She is trying to sort out childcare.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在想办法安排好照顾孩子 的事。

Sense.DEF: if something sorts itself out, it stops being a problem without you having to do anything
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our financial problems should sort themselves out in a week or two.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的财政问题过一两个星期就会自行解决。

Sense.DEF: to stop someone from causing problems or annoying you, especially by attacking or punishing them
Sense.EXAMPLE: If he bothers you again, I’ll sort him out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果他再来烦你﹐我会收拾他。

Sense.DEF: to look for something among a lot of similar things, especially when you are arranging these things into an order
Sense.EXAMPLE: Vicky sat down and sorted through the files.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 维基坐下来整理文件。

Sense.DEF: properly arranged or planned
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good, that’s the accommodation sorted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好的﹐住宿就这么安排吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Calm down. It’s all sorted .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 放心﹐一切都安排妥当了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just want to get everything sorted before I go away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就是想在走之前把事情都安排好。

Sense.DEF: provided with the things that you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Can I get you anything?’ ‘We’re sorted, thanks.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “要我给你们拿点什么吗？”“我们都有了﹐谢谢。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are we sorted for alcohol for tonight?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们晚上的酒备好了吗？

Sense.DEF: a short flight made by a plane over enemy land, in order to bomb a city, military defences etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔飞机为轰炸敌方的〕出动架次﹐〔军机的〕出击
Sense.EXAMPLE: The US and its allies carried out 44,000 sorties during this period.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国及其盟友在这段时间里出动飞机 44,000 架次。

Sense.DEF: a short trip, especially to an unfamiliar place
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指到陌生地方的〕短程旅行
Sense.EXAMPLE: We made a sortie from our hotel to the open-air market.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们离开宾馆到露天市场走了一趟。

Sense.DEF: an attempt to do or take part in something new

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Australia’s first sortie into the wine trade
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 澳大利亚首次涉足葡萄酒行业

Sense.DEF: an attack in which an army leaves its position for a short time to attack the enemy
Sense.TRAN: 〔军队短时间离开阵地所作的〕出击

Sense.DEF: to make a short attack on an enemy position or a flight over enemy land
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was five months since the battleship had last sortied from home waters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这艘战列舰最近一次从领海出击﹐已经是五个月前的事了。

Sense.DEF: a place where letters and packages are put into groups according to where they have to be delivered
an occasion when you tidy a room, desk etc and get rid of the things you do not need
Sense.EXAMPLE: These cupboards need a good sort-out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些橱柜需要好好清理一下。

Sense.DEF: a signal or message that a ship or plane sends when it is in danger and needs help
Sense.TRAN: 〔遇险船只或飞机发出的〕紧急求救信号

Sense.DEF: an urgent message that someone is in trouble and needs help
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is an SOS for a Mr. Tucker, whose mother is seriously ill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 紧急寻找塔克先生﹐他的母亲病重。

Sense.DEF: neither very good nor very bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How was the party?’ ‘Oh. so-so.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “聚会怎么样？”“噢﹐还可以。”

Sense.DEF: someone who is drunk all the time
in a very quiet voice, so that other people cannot easily hear
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘No, it was Daniel,’ she continued, sotto voce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “不是的﹐是丹尼尔。”她继续说道﹐声音很轻。

Sense.DEF: a very small amount of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: He didn’t have a sou.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一点钱也没有。

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
sobriquet
a baked food made with eggs, flour, milk, and often cheese or fruit all mixed together until it is light and full of air

the past tense and past participle of
seek
Sense.TRAN: seek 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF: wanted by a lot of people but rare or difficult to get
Sense.TRAN: 广受欢迎的﹐吃香的〔但罕有或难以得到〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a much sought-after defense lawyer
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个很吃香的辩护律师

Sense.EXAMPLE: By the mid-1920s, she had become one of Broadway’s most sought-after actresses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了 20 世纪 20 年代中期﹐她已经成了百老汇最受欢迎的女演员之一。

Sense.DEF: a market in an Arab country
the part of a person that is not physical, and that contains their character, thoughts, and feelings. Many people believe that a person’s soul continues to exist after they have died.
Sense.EXAMPLE: the immortality of the soul
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 灵魂的不灭
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was as if those grey eyes could see into the very depths of her soul .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仿佛那双灰眼睛能看到她的灵魂深处。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the restlessness deep in his soul
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他灵魂深处的躁动不安

Sense.EXAMPLE: the souls of the dead
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亡灵

Sense.DEF: used in particular phrases to mean a person

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is really quite a sensitive soul.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个非常敏感的人。

GramExa.GLOSS: no one
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I promise I won’t tell a soul.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我保证不告诉任何人。

GramExa.PROPFORM: not a soul in sight/not a soul to be seen
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The night was dark and still, and there was not a soul in sight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜又黑又静﹐不见一个人影。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to show pity for someone
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The poor old soul had fallen and broken her hip.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位可怜的老太太跌了一跤﹐摔断了髋骨。

Sense.DEF: a type of popular music that often expresses deep emotions, usually performed by black singers and musicians
Sense.EXAMPLE: He listens to a lot of soul.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他经常听灵乐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a soul band
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 灵乐乐队

Subsense.DEF: the ability to be emotionally affected by art, music, literature etc
Subsense.TRAN: 〔对艺术﹑音乐﹑文学等的〕审美能力
Subsense.EXAMPLE: My brother thinks that anyone who doesn’t like poetry has no soul.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我哥哥认为﹐不喜欢诗的人都缺乏审美能力。

Subsense.DEF: the quality that affects people emotionally, that a painting, piece of music etc can have
Subsense.TRAN: 〔绘画﹑音乐作品等的〕灵魂﹐真情实感﹐内涵
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Her performance was technically perfect, but it lacked soul.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的表演在技巧上无懈可击﹐但缺乏真挚的情感。

Sense.DEF: the special quality or part that gives something its true character

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Matsuo Basho’s poems capture the true soul of old Japan.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 松尾芭蕉的诗歌抓住了古代日本的神髓。

Sense.DEF: to always be extremely careful to keep secrets
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leon is the very soul of discretion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利昂正是个谨守秘密的人。

Sense.DEF: if something is good for the soul, it is good for you and you should do it, even though it may seem unpleasant – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 对人有好处 [有益]〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They say that hardship is good for the soul.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 都说艰难困苦对人有好处。

Sense.DEF: used when you mention the name of someone who is dead
Sense.TRAN: 愿上帝保佑他/她的灵魂安息〔在提到已故者的名字时说的话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: My father, God rest his soul, died here at Vernison Hall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的父亲﹐愿上帝保佑他的灵魂安息﹐就是在这里——韦尔尼森庄园去世的。

Sense.DEF: the number of souls in a place is the number of people who live there
Sense.EXAMPLE: a village of two or three hundred souls
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个两三百人的村庄

Sense.DEF: used to express surprise
Sense.TRAN: 天哪/哎呀〔用于表示惊讶〕

Crossrefto.REFLEX: be the life and soul of the party

Sense.DEF: something that is soul-destroying is extremely boring or makes you feel very unhappy
Sense.TRAN: 消磨精神的﹐极枯燥乏味的﹐令人沮丧的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a soul-destroying experience
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消磨精神的经历

Sense.DEF: traditional foods that are cooked and eaten by African-Americans in the southern US
Sense.TRAN: 美国南方黑人常吃的食物

Sense.DEF: expressing deep, usually sad, emotions
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked up with those great soulful eyes .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他抬头望着﹐眼神非常忧郁。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his powerful, soulful voice
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那深情有力的嗓音

Sense.DEF:
a type of music that combines features of
soul music
and
jazz
lacking the attractive qualities that make people happy
Sense.TRAN: 没有灵魂的﹐没有生气的﹐无情的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a soulless city of grey concrete
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座毫无生气的灰色水泥城市

Sense.DEF: someone you have a very close relationship with because you share or understand the same emotions and interests
a small area of hair under a man’s lower lip
Sense.TRAN: 〔男子下唇下方的〕一小撮胡子

Sense.DEF: careful examination of your thoughts and feelings because you are very worried about whether or not it is right to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: After much soul-searching, I decided to resign.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过反复的自我反省﹐我决定辞职。

Sense.DEF: something that you hear, or what can be heard
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were strange sounds coming from the next room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 隔壁房间传来奇怪的声音。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She could hear the sound of voices.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她听到说话声。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a vowel sound
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 元音

Subsense.DEF: the sound produced by a television or radio programme, a film etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We apologize for the loss of sound during that report.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对刚才的报道出现声音中断表示抱歉。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a sound engineer
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位音响师

Subsense.DEF: the loudness of a television, radio, film etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Turn the sound down a little, will you?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把音量调低一点好吗？

Sense.DEF: the particular quality that a singer’s or group’s music has
Sense.TRAN: 〔某个歌手或乐队特有的〕嗓音﹐音乐风格
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re trying to develop a harder, funkier sound.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正尝试建立一种更硬朗的﹑节奏更强劲的音乐风格。

Sense.DEF: judging from what you have heard or read about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: By the sound of it, things are worse than we thought.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听起来﹐情况比我们原来想的还要糟。

Sense.LEXUNIT: not like the sound of sth
Sense.DEF: to feel worried by something that you have heard or read
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘There’s been a slight change in our plans.’ ‘I don’t like the sound of that.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们的计划有个小小的变动。”“这消息不大好啊。”

Sense.DEF:
songs or music that are on a record,
cd
, or tape
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need to buy some new sounds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要买些新歌了。

Sense.DEF: a narrow area of water that connects two larger areas of water

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There was a loud creaking sound and the branch snapped.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 咔嚓一声巨响,树枝断了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The sound was so faint I wasn’t sure what it was at first.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那声音非常微弱,起先我都不知道是什么。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The sound of the waterfall was deafening.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 瀑布的声音震耳欲聋。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Suddenly from below came the unmistakable sound of gunfire.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然,下面清清楚楚地传来了枪声。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I heard a strange sound coming from outside.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到外面传来一个奇怪的声音。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 砰砰/撕裂/咝咝等的声音

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She heard the sound of a car starting.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她听到汽车发动的声音。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The machine made a strange hissing sound.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 机器发出奇怪的咝咝声。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He lay still and didn’t make a sound.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他静静地躺着,没有发出一点声音。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The sounds seemed to be coming from the study below.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那声音好像是从下面的书房传来的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: can be heard some distance away

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 'a strong sound'. Say 而要说 a loud sound .

Section.SECHEADING: A HIGH SOUND 高的声音

Exponent.DEF: a very short high sound or cry
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I heard the squeak of his shoes on the tiled floor.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到他的鞋子踩在铺了地砖的地板上吱吱地响。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Annie gave a squeak of surpise.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 安妮惊讶地发出一声尖叫。

Exponent.DEF: a long high sound that something makes when someone opens it, walks on it etc - used especially about a door, wooden floor, bed, or stairs
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指门、木地板、床或楼梯等受力后发出的〕嘎吱声
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the creak of floorboards
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 木地板的嘎吱声
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The door opened with a creak.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 门吱呀一声开了。

Exponent.DEF: a loud, long, unplesantly high sound - used especially about someone's voice, or about brakes, tyres etc
Exponent.TRAN: 尖锐刺耳的声音〔尤指某人的嗓音、或刹车、轮胎等发出的声音〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There was a screech of tyres followed by a bang.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 轮胎发出吱的一声，紧接着砰地爆了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She let out a screech of horror.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她发出惊恐的尖叫。

Exponent.DEF: a high electronic sound that a machine sends out, especially in order to attract someone's attention
Exponent.TRAN: 〔电子设备或机器发出的〕哔哔声
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You'll hear a bleep when the photocopier's finished printing.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 复印机结束复印时会发出哔的一声。

Section.SECHEADING: A QUIET SOUND 轻的声音

Exponent.DEF: a quiet low continuous sound, especially from electrical equipment, traffic, an engine, or people's conversation
Exponent.TRAN: 嗡嗡声〔尤指电子设备、车流、发动机等发出的声音或谈话的声音〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The only sound was the faint hum of the air-conditioning unit.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 唯一的声音是空调细小的嗡嗡声。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He could hear the hum of distant traffic.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他听得到远处的车流声。

Exponent.DEF: a continuous quiet sound from papers, leaves, or clothes when they rub together
Exponent.TRAN: 〔纸张、树叶或衣服摩擦发出的〕沙沙声，窸窣声
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She heard the rustle of dried leaves behind her.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她听到身后干枯的树叶在沙沙作响。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the rustle of silk dresses
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 真丝礼服的窸窣声

Exponent.DEF: a quiet low continuous sound, especially from people's voices that are far away
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The murmur of voices died away.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 低语声渐渐消失。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They spoke in a low murmur.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们轻声低语。

Exponent.DEF: a series of long low sounds, especially from big guns, traffic, or thunder
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指大炮、车流或雷电的〕隆隆声
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I heard a rumble of thunder.
