Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到雷声隆隆。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the low rumble of a train approaching
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车开近时低沉的轰鸣声

Section.SECHEADING: MADE BY A LIQUID 液体的声音

Exponent.DEF: the sound that a liquid makes when something hits it, or when it hits against another thing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She jumped into the pool with a big splash.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她跳进了游泳池，发出很响的扑通一声。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the splash of the waves against the rocks
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 海浪拍打岩石的哗哗声

Exponent.DEF: the low sound that water makes when it flows gently over or through something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the gurgle of a stream
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 溪水的汩汩声
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She listened to the gurgle as the water drained out of the bath.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她听着水汩汩地从浴缸中流走。

Exponent.DEF: the sudden short sound when something is dropped into a liquid
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Kate dropped the ice into her glass with a plop.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯特扑通一声把冰块扔进她的杯子里。

Section.SECHEADING: MADE BY AIR OR GAS 空气或气体的声音

Exponent.DEF: a continuous high sound when air or gas comes out of something
Exponent.TRAN: 〔空气或气体泄出时发出的〕咝咝声
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There was a hiss of steam from the coffee machine.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 咖啡机咝咝地冒着蒸汽。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Workers reported hearing a loud hiss moments before the explosion.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人报告说爆炸之前听到了很响的咝咝声。

Section.SECHEADING: MADE BY AN EXPLOSION, GUN ETC 爆炸、枪炮等的声音

Exponent.DEF: a short sudden loud noise made by a gun, bomb etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There was a loud bang as the bomb exploded.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 砰的一声巨响，炸弹爆炸了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The firework went off with a bang.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 烟花砰的一声炸响了。

Exponent.DEF: a very loud sound from an explosion, which you can hear for several seconds after it begins
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The building exploded into rubble with a loud boom.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大楼随着轰然一声巨响被炸成了废墟。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The boom of artillery fire echoed in the distance.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 炮火的轰鸣声在远处回荡。

Exponent.DEF: a continunous very loud noise that gets louder and continues for a long time
Exponent.TRAN: 〔越来越响的持久〕轰鸣声，隆隆声
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The light was followed by the deafening roar of explosions.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 火光之后紧接着便是震耳欲聋的爆炸声。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the roar of the ship's guns
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 船上枪炮的轰鸣声

Section.SECHEADING: MADE BY THINGS HITTING OTHER THINGS 物体互相撞击的声音

Exponent.DEF: a loud sound caused especially when something hard or heavy hits something else
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指硬物或重物撞击其他物体时发出的〕巨响，砰
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I heard a loud bang and rushed out to see what had happened.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到砰的一声巨响，赶紧冲出去看看是怎么回事。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He slammed the door shut with a bang.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他砰的一声摔上门。

Exponent.DEF: a very loud sound caused when something hits something else, especially when damage is caused
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The tray of dishes fell to the floor with a crash.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那一托盘的碟子哗啦一声掉落在地上。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I heard an enormous crash outside our house, and I went to see what had happened.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到屋外砰的一声巨响，就出去看看发生了什么事。

Exponent.DEF: a quiet low sound made when a heavy object falls down onto surface
Exponent.TRAN: 〔重物落到地面上发出的〕闷响
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There was a dull thud as the box hit the floor
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 箱子落地时，发出一声闷响。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His head hit the ground with a sickening thud.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的头撞到地上，发出一声揪心的闷响。

Exponent.DEF: a dull loud sound made when a heavy object hits something else
Exponent.TRAN: 〔重物撞击其他物体时发出的〕闷响
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There was a loud thump as Eddie threw Luther back against the wall.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘭的一下，埃迪把卢瑟猛推回墙边。

Exponent.DEF: a short ringing sound made when two glass, metal, or china objects hit each other
Exponent.TRAN: 〔玻璃、金属或瓷器碰撞时发出的〕叮当声
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the clink of champagne glasses
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 香槟酒杯的叮叮当当
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The click of cutlery could be heard in the restaurant
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在饭店里，可以听到餐具相碰的叮当声。

Exponent.DEF: the pleasant sound that is made by light pieces of glass or metal hitting each other repeatedly
Exponent.TRAN: 〔轻巧的玻璃或金属物品互相撞击发出的〕丁零声，叮当声
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He listened to the faint thinkle of cow bells in the distance.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他听着远处传来依稀的牛铃声。

Exponent.DEF: the sound of small metal objects being shaken together
Exponent.TRAN: 〔小的金属物品晃动时发出的〕丁零声
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the jingle of her bracelets
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的手镯叮当作响
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the jingle of keys
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 钥匙的叮当声

Exponent.DEF: a short repeated sound made when things hit against each other - used especially when part of something is loose and is hitting against something
Exponent.TRAN: 〔物体互相碰撞时发出的〕咔嗒声〔尤指物体上松动的部件撞击某物的声音〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There was a strange rattle coming from the engine
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 引擎发出一种奇怪的咔咔声
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the rattle of the trolley
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有轨电车的咔嗒声

Sense.DEF: if something or someone sounds good, bad, strange etc, that is how they seem to you when you hear about them or read about them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Istanbul sounds really exciting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊斯坦布尔听起来真够刺激的。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The whole story sounded very odd.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个故事听起来很古怪。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: $80 sounds about right for a decent hotel room.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一间像样的酒店房间 80 美元好像差不多了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: That sounds a good idea.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那主意听起来很不错。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nick sounds like a nice guy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼克听上去是个不错的家伙。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It sounds to me as if he needs professional help.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得他似乎需要专业帮助。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It sounds like you had a good time on your trip.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 听起来你旅途很愉快。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll come over to Richmond and take you out for dinner. How does that sound ? used to ask someone what they think of your suggestion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我到里士满来﹐请你出去吃饭﹐怎么样？
Sense.EXAMPLE: faraway places with strange-sounding names
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 名字听起来怪怪的偏远地方

Sense.DEF: if a noise sounds like a particular thing, that is how it seems to you when you hear it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: To Thomas, her laugh sounded horribly like a growl.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对托马斯来说﹐她的笑声像吼叫﹐很吓人。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I heard what sounded like fireworks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到像是烟花的声音。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her breathing sounded very loud.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的呼吸声很响。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The banging sounded as if it was coming from next door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那砰的一声就像是从隔壁传来的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It sounds like the dog wants to be let out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 听起来那条狗想要出去。

Sense.DEF: if someone sounds tired, happy, sad etc, that is how they seem to you when you hear their voice

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are you okay? You sound tired.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你没事吧？听你的声音像是累了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Josie didn’t sound very keen when I spoke to her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我跟乔茜说的时候她好像兴趣不大。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her voice sounded very young.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的声音听上去很年轻。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You sound as if you’ve got a cold.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你听起来好像感冒了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She sounded like she’d been crying.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她听起来好像在哭。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You sound just like my mother the things you say, opinions you express etc are just like the things my mother says .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你说话听起来就像我母亲。

Sense.DEF: to publicly give a warning or tell people to be careful
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several earlier studies had sounded similar warnings .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早先的几次研究也提出过类似的警告。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I would, however, sound a note of caution.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 然而﹐我想提醒大家小心。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Now it is an American economist who is sounding the alarm .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在是一位美国的经济学家在提出警告。

Sense.DEF: if something such as a horn or bell sounds, or if you sound it, it makes a noise
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bell sounded for dinner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吃晚饭的铃声响了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sound your horn to warn other drivers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按喇叭提醒其他司机。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was unable to sound the alarm .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她无法拉响警报器。

Sense.DEF: to make the sound of a letter in a word
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ‘s’ in ‘island’ is not sounded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: island中的字母 s 是不发音的。

Sense.DEF: to measure the depth of the sea, a lake etc
to express strong opinions about something, especially when you complain angrily in a way that other people find rude or boring
Sense.TRAN: 高谈阔论﹐大发议论 〔以表达强烈的不满〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s always sounding off about too much sex in the media.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她经常大发议论﹐抱怨媒体上有太多的性内容。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He should check his facts before sounding off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他应该先弄清楚事实再发表高论。

Sense.DEF: if soldiers sound off, they shout out numbers or their names to show that they are there
Sense.TRAN: 〔士兵大声〕报数﹐报名字〔表示人在〕

Sense.DEF: to talk to someone in order to find out what they think about a plan or idea
Sense.TRAN: 试探…的意见﹐探听…的意图﹐探…的口气
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sounded people out and found the responses favourable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他探了大家的口气﹐发现反应良好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They want to sound out his opinion before they approach him formally.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们想先探一探他的看法﹐再正式和他接洽。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wanted to sound her out about a job that I’m thinking of applying for.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有份工作我在考虑去申请﹐我想听听她的意见。

Sense.DEF: sensible and likely to produce the right results
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book is full of sound advice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书中有许多合理的建议。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a man of great integrity and sound judgement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个非常正直﹑判断力强的人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: environmentally sound farming practices
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 环保的耕作方法

Sense.EXAMPLE: a sound investment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 合理的投资

Subsense.DEF: someone who is sound can be depended on to make good decisions and give good advice

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s very sound on matters of law.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在法律事务方面很有见地。

Subsense.DEF: someone who is sound is a good person and can be trusted – used especially by young people
Subsense.TRAN: 〔人〕好的﹐不错的 〔尤为年轻人使用〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: My mum’s sound. She’d never throw me out.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我妈妈很讲理﹐她是绝不会轰我走的。

Sense.DEF: complete and thorough
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sound understanding of money and banking systems
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对货币和银行业体制的透彻理解
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sound knowledge of English
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 扎实的英语知识
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has sound grasp of European history.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对欧洲历史有着透彻的理解。

Sense.DEF: in good condition and not damaged in any way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The floor was completely sound.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地板完好无损。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is the building structurally sound ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幢建筑的结构完好吗？

GramExa.GLOSS: in perfect condition

Sense.DEF: physically or mentally healthy

GramExa.GLOSS: not mentally ill
in perfect health

Sense.DEF: sound sleep is deep and peaceful

GramExa.GLOSS: someone who always sleeps well

Sense.DEF: deeply asleep
Sense.EXAMPLE: The baby was sound asleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宝宝在熟睡。

Sense.DEF: the sudden increase in air pressure against a vehicle, especially an aircraft, when it is travelling near the speed of sound

GramExa.GLOSS: travel faster than the speed of sound

Sense.DEF: a very short part of a speech or statement, especially one made by a politician, that is broadcast on a radio or television news programme
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指广播或电视中政治人物的〕讲话片段

Sense.DEF:
a
circuit board
that can be added to a computer so that it is able to produce sound
the process of checking that all the equipment needed for broadcasting or recording is working properly
Sense.TRAN: 〔广播或录音前对音响设备的〕效果检查﹐校音

Sense.DEF: sounds produced artificially for a radio or television programme, a film etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔广播﹑电视节目﹑电影等的〕音响效果

Sense.DEF: someone you discuss your ideas with in order to see if they think your ideas are good
Sense.TRAN: 被征询意见的人﹐决策咨询人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: John always used her as a sounding board for new ideas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰有新想法总是征询她的意见。

Sense.DEF: careful or secret questions that you ask someone to find out what they think about something
Sense.TRAN: 〔小心或秘密的〕试探﹐调查﹐探听
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re taking soundings to find out how people feel about the changes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在探听人们怎样看待这些变化。

Sense.DEF: measurements you make to find out how deep water is
without any sound

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Theo crept soundlessly into the room.

Sense.DEF: if you sleep soundly, you sleep deeply and peacefully
Sense.EXAMPLE: The baby slept soundly all night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宝宝整晚都睡得很香甜。

Sense.DEF: completely defeated or severely punished
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Republicans were soundly defeated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 共和党大败。

Sense.DEF: a soundproof wall, room etc is one that sound cannot pass through or into
to make something soundproof
someone who makes new music by electronically mixing the sounds from different musical instruments, songs etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ever-innovating soundsmiths known as Matmos
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不断创新的混音大师 Matmos 组合

Sense.DEF: a large room that has been specially made so that no sounds from outside the room can be heard, used for making films and television programmes
Sense.TRAN: 〔拍电影和电视节目的〕隔音场﹐隔音摄影棚

Sense.DEF: equipment for playing music, especially to people in a large space, for example at a rock concert or a club
the recorded music from a film

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the soundtrack to ‘Top Gun’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 《壮志凌云》的电影配乐

Sense.DEF: the form that sound takes when it travels
cooked liquid food, often containing small pieces of meat, fish, or vegetables
Sense.EXAMPLE: homemade tomato soup
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自制的番茄汤

Sense.DEF: to be in trouble
to improve something, especially a car, by making it more powerful
Sense.TRAN: 增大 〔尤指汽车的〕功率﹐升级﹐改装

Sense.DEF: a very small amount of something – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 微量﹐一丁点〔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a souped-up car has been made more powerful
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车〕升级的﹐改装过的﹐增大了马力的

Sense.DEF: a place where people with no money and no homes can get free food
a round spoon that is used for eating soup
having a thick liquid quality like soup

having a sharp acid taste, like the taste of a
lemon
or a fruit that is not ready to be eaten
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rachel sampled the wine. It was sour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷切尔尝了尝葡萄酒﹐是酸的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: sour cherries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酸樱桃

Sense.DEF: milk or other food that is sour is not fresh and has a bad taste
Sense.TRAN: 〔牛奶等〕馊的﹐有馊味的﹐酸臭的

GramExa.GLOSS: become sour

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say milk goes bad or, in British English, goes off , rather than goes sour .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,表示牛奶变酸, 人们一般不说 go sour, 而是说 go bad, 在英国英语中则说 go off 。

Sense.DEF: unfriendly or looking bad-tempered

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Eliza was tall and thin, with a rather sour face.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊丽莎又高又瘦﹐脸上阴沉沉的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a sour-faced old man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绷着脸的老人

Sense.DEF: if a relationship or plan turns or goes sour, it becomes less enjoyable, pleasant, or satisfactory
Sense.TRAN: 〔关系﹑计划等变得〕坏的﹐令人不快的
Sense.EXAMPLE: As time went by, their marriage turned sour .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着时间的流逝﹐他们的夫妻关系变差了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The meeting ended on a sour note with neither side able to reach agreement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双方未能取得一致意见﹐会议不欢而散。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is pretending that they dislike something because they want it but cannot have it – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 酸葡萄〔指某人其实想要某物﹐但因得不到而装作不喜欢的心态﹐含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: if a relationship or someone’s attitude sours, or if something sours it, it becomes unfriendly or unfavourable
Sense.TRAN: （使）〔关系或态度〕变坏﹐变得不友善
Sense.EXAMPLE: An unhappy childhood has soured her view of life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不幸的童年扭曲了她的人生观。

Sense.DEF: if milk sours, or if something sours it, it begins to have an unpleasant sharp taste
a thing, place, activity etc that you get something from
Sense.EXAMPLE: They get their money from various sources.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们从各种途径弄到钱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Beans are a very good source of protein.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 豆类是很好的蛋白质来源。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: For me, music is a great source of enjoyment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对我来说﹐音乐是快乐的重要源泉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Is your pension taxed at source before it is paid to you ?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的养老金是发放时扣税吗？

Sense.DEF: the cause of something, especially a problem, or the place where it starts
Sense.TRAN: 〔某事﹐尤指问题的〕原因﹐根源﹐起源

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ve found the source of the trouble.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已找出故障的原因。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The recent name change has been the source of some confusion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近的更名造成了一些混乱。

Sense.DEF: a person, book, or document that supplies you with information
Sense.EXAMPLE: List all your sources at the end of your essay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在论文末尾列出你所有资料的出处。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve heard from reliable sources that the company is in trouble.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从可靠的消息来源获知﹐那家公司遇上了麻烦。

Sense.DEF: the place where a stream or river starts
source code

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a source that provides a lot of something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Milk is a good source of calcium.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛奶是很好的钙质来源。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: People said television was their most useful source of local information.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们说,电视是他们获取当地信息最有用的来源。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The lead mines were once a major source of employment for the islanders.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些铅矿一度是岛上居民重要的就业来源。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: In times of stress, food can be a great source of comfort.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 在有压力的时候,食物可以成为极大的安慰。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It started as a hobby, but now it is his main source of income.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 开始那是个爱好,但现在是他主要的收入来源。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The university is exploring alternative funding sources.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校正在寻求其他的经费来源。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We hope to see increased usage of renewable energy sources.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们期望看到对再生能源更多的利用。

Sense.DEF: if goods are sourced from a particular place, they are obtained from that place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fish for the restaurant is sourced daily from British ports.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家餐馆的鱼是每天从英国的港口运来的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: locally sourced milk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 产自本地的牛奶

Sense.DEF: to find out where something can be obtained
Sense.EXAMPLE: We might be able to source the parts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许我们能找出哪里可以买到这些零部件。

Sense.DEF: the original form in which a computer program is written before it is changed into a form that a particular type of computer can read

cream which has been made thicker by adding
bacteria

uncooked
dough bread mixture
that is left to
ferment
before being used to make bread
someone who complains a lot and is never happy or satisfied
Sense.TRAN: 性情乖戾的人﹐满腹牢骚的人

Sense.DEF: the direction that is at the bottom of a map of the world, below the Equator. It is on the right if you are facing the rising sun.
Sense.EXAMPLE: Which way is south?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哪面是南？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: By now, the army was approaching from the south.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个时候军队正从南面逼近。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gatwick airport is a few miles to the south of London.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 盖特威克机场在伦敦以南数英里处。

Sense.DEF: the southern part of a country or area

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They lived in a small town in the South.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们住在南方的一座小镇上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the South of India
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 印度南部

Sense.DEF: in the south, or facing the south
Sense.TRAN: 在南方的﹔向南的﹐朝南的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a village on the south coast
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 南部海岸的一座村庄
Sense.EXAMPLE: I am currently teaching in south Texas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我目前在得克萨斯南部教书。

Sense.DEF: a south wind comes from the south
towards the south
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of the birds had already flown south.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分的鸟都已南飞。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a seaside town 99 km south of London
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦敦以南 99 公里的一座海滨城镇

Sense.EXAMPLE: a south-facing garden
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朝南的花园

Subsense.DEF: in or to the southern part of England
Subsense.TRAN: 在〔英格兰的〕南部﹔向〔英格兰的〕南部
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We moved down south about five years ago.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大约五年前我们迁居英格兰南部。

Subsense.DEF: in or to the southern US states
Subsense.TRAN: 在〔美国的〕南方（地区）﹔向〔美国的〕南方（地区）
Subsense.EXAMPLE: His sister lives down south.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他妹妹住在南方。

Sense.DEF: if a situation, organization, or set of standards goes south, it becomes very bad although it was once very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: It seems like all our moral standards have just gone south.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看来我们的道德标准都下降了。

Sense.DEF: travelling or leading towards the south
Sense.EXAMPLE: southbound traffic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 南行的车辆
Sense.EXAMPLE: The southbound lanes are closed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 南行车道被封闭了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car was last seen traveling southbound on I-35.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后看到这辆汽车时它是在 I-35 号州际公路上向南行驶。

Sense.DEF: the direction that is exactly between south and east
the southeastern part of a country

Tail.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们继续往东南方向走﹐到达凯尔斯。

Sense.DEF: a southeast wind comes from the southeast
in the southeast of a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: the southeast quarter of the city
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该市的东南部

Sense.DEF: a strong wind or storm coming from the southeast
towards or in the southeast
Sense.EXAMPLE: Snow will spread to southeasterly regions tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚降雪将蔓延到东南地区。

Sense.DEF: a southeasterly wind comes from the southeast
in or from the southeast part of a country or area
Sense.TRAN: 东南部的﹔来自东南方的
Sense.EXAMPLE: southeastern Europe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 东南欧

Sense.DEF: towards the southeast
towards or in the south
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tara walked in a southerly direction .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 塔拉朝南走去。

Sense.DEF: a southerly wind comes from the south
in or from the south of a country or area
Sense.EXAMPLE: a southern accent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 南部口音
Sense.EXAMPLE: Southern Italy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 意大利南部

Sense.DEF: an attractive young woman from the South of the US, who comes from an upper-class family. The expression is mostly used when talking about the past, and a typical example of a Southern belle is Scarlet O’Hara, the main character in the book and film Gone with the Wind.
Sense.TRAN: 南方美人﹐南方佳丽〔指美国南方出身上流社会的漂亮年轻女子。 主要用于谈论过去﹐最典型的南方美人是 《乱世佳人》里的主人公郝思嘉〕

Sense.DEF: someone from the southern part of a country
the half of the world that is south of the Equator
bands of coloured light that are seen in the night sky in the most southern parts of the world
furthest south
Sense.EXAMPLE: the southernmost tip of India
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 印度的最南端

Sense.DEF:
someone who uses their left hand more than their right hand, especially a
pitcher
in baseball or a
boxer
Sense.TRAN: 左撇子﹔ 〔尤指〕左撇子棒球投手[拳击手]

Sense.DEF: the most southern point on the surface of the Earth
towards the south
Sense.EXAMPLE: We followed the coast southwards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们沿海岸向南走。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 去查尔斯敦的南行路线

Sense.DEF: the direction that is exactly between south and west
the southwestern part of a country

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The plane flew southwest toward Egypt.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这架飞机朝西南方向飞往埃及。

Sense.DEF: a southwest wind comes from the southwest
in the southwest of a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: the southwest corner of France
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国的西南隅

Sense.DEF: towards or in the southwest
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane was flying in a southwesterly direction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这架飞机正飞往西南方向。

Sense.DEF: a southwesterly wind comes from the southwest
in or from the southwest part of a country or area
Sense.TRAN: 西南部的﹔来自西南方的
Sense.EXAMPLE: southwestern Colorado
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科罗拉多的西南部

Sense.DEF: towards the southwest
an object that you buy or keep to remind yourself of a special occasion or a place you have visited

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I bought a model of the Eiffel Tower as a souvenir of Paris.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我买了一个埃菲尔铁塔模型作为去过巴黎的纪念品。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a souvenir shop
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纪念品商店

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a souvenir programme from the Gala Concert
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 庆典音乐会的纪念节目单

Sense.DEF: a hat made of shiny material that keeps the rain off, with a wide piece at the back that covers your neck
a king or queen
a British gold coin used in the past that was worth
Sense.TRAN: £1 金镑〔英国旧时面值一英镑的金币〕

Sense.DEF: having the highest power in a country

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 至高无上的权力/控制权

Sense.DEF: a sovereign country or state is independent and governs itself
Sense.TRAN: 〔国家〕主权独立的﹐有主权的﹐独立自主的

Sense.DEF: complete freedom and power to govern
Sense.TRAN: 主权﹐最高统治权﹐最高权威
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sovereignty of Parliament
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 议会至高无上的权威

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Spain’s claim of sovereignty over the territory
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 西班牙对这块领地的主权要求

Sense.DEF: the power that an independent country has to govern itself
Sense.EXAMPLE: the defence of our national sovereignty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保卫我国的独立主权

Sense.DEF: an elected council in a Communist country
Sense.TRAN: 苏维埃〔共产主义国家中通过选举产生的委员会〕

Sense.DEF: relating to the former USSR (Soviet Union) or its people
to plant or scatter seeds on a piece of ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sow the seeds in late March.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三月底播种。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These fields used to be sown with oats.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些地里过去种的是燕麦。

Sense.DEF: to do something that will cause a bad situation in the future
Sense.TRAN: 散布﹐激起〔会在将来产生不良影响的事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: repressive laws that are sowing the seeds of future conflicts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给未来的冲突播下种子的高压法规

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an attempt to sow doubt among the jury members
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 让陪审团成员产生怀疑的企图

Sense.DEF: if a man sows his wild oats, he has sex with many different women, especially when he is young
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指男子年轻时〕生活放荡﹐滥交

Sense.DEF: a fully grown female pig

a past participle of
sow
an American spelling of ‘socks’, used especially in advertising
Sense.TRAN: 短袜〔socks 的一种美式拼法﹐尤用于广告中〕

Sense.DEF: soya beans

the bean of an Asian plant from which oil and food containing a lot of
protein
are produced
a dark brown liquid made from soya beans that is used especially in Japanese and Chinese cooking
drunk

Subsense.DEF: a place where the water has special minerals in it, and where people go to improve their health by drinking the water or swimming in it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a historic spa town
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座历史上有名的矿泉城镇

Subsense.DEF: a place where people go to improve their health and beauty, especially through swimming, exercise, beauty treatments etc

Sense.DEF: a bath or pool that sends currents of hot water around you
Sense.TRAN: 按摩浴缸﹐热水漩水式浴缸[浴池]

Sense.DEF: the amount of an area, room, container etc that is empty or available to be used

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s space for a table and two chairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 能放得下一张桌子和两把椅子。

Sense.EXAMPLE: How much space is there on each disk?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每张磁盘有多大容量？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Now that we’ve got three kids, it’d be nice to have a bit more space.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有三个孩子﹐地方能再大一点就好了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had plenty of space to study.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他学习的地方很大。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The hedge takes up too much space .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这树篱占了太多的地方。

GramExa.GLOSS: the feeling that a place is large and empty, so you can move around easily
GramExa.EXAMPLE: In small homes a single colour scheme can create a sense of space.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 面积小的住宅采用单一色彩﹐可以产生一种空间感。

Sense.DEF: an area, especially one used for a particular purpose
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指有特定用途的〕空位﹐处所
Sense.EXAMPLE: a supermarket with 700 free parking spaces
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有 700 个免费停车位的超级市场

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We really do need more storage space.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们确实需要更多的储存空间。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the factory’s floor space the size of the available floor area
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家工厂的楼层面积

Sense.DEF: an empty place between two things, or between two parts of something
Sense.TRAN: 〔两物或某物两部分之间的〕空当﹐空隙﹐空地方

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the space between the house and the garage
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房屋和车库之间的空地

Sense.EXAMPLE: There was an empty space where the flowers had been.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以前种花的地方有一块空地。

Sense.DEF:
the area beyond the Earth where the stars and
planets
are

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Who was the first American in space?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 第一个进入太空的美国人是谁？

Sense.EXAMPLE: creatures from outer space far away in space
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自外太空的生物

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the history of space travel
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 太空旅行的历史

Sense.DEF: all of the area in which everything exists, and in which everything has a position or direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: the exact point in space where two lines meet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两条线在空间中的确切交点
Sense.EXAMPLE: how people of other cultures think about time and space
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他文化背景下的人对时空的概念

Subsense.DEF: within a particular period of time
Subsense.TRAN: 在一段…的时间里﹐在…期间
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Mandy had four children in the space of four years.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 曼迪在四年的时间里生了四个孩子。

Subsense.DEF: a short period of time
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They achieved a lot in a short space of time.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在短短的时间里取得了很大的成就。

Sense.DEF: land, or an area of land that has not been built on
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pleasant town centre with plenty of open space
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开阔宜人的市中心
Sense.EXAMPLE: the wide open spaces of the prairies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大草原的辽阔
Sense.EXAMPLE: the loss of green space in cities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城市里绿色地带的减少

Sense.DEF: the freedom to do what you want or do things on your own, especially in a relationship with someone else
Sense.TRAN: 〔个人的〕生活空间﹐个人自由〔尤指在与别人的关系里〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We give each other space in our marriage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在婚姻生活中给予对方自由空间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She needed time and space to sort out her life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她需要时间和私人空间来理顺自己的生活。

Subsense.DEF: an empty area between written or printed words, lines etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Leave a space after each number.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个数字后面空一格。

Subsense.DEF:
the width of a
typed
letter of the alphabet
Subsense.TRAN: 〔打字机打出的〕一个字母的宽度﹐格
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The word ‘the’ takes up three spaces. the
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个词占三格。

Subsense.DEF: a place provided for you to write your name or other information on a document, piece of paper etc
Subsense.TRAN: 〔文件﹑纸张上等预留的〕空白处
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Please write any comments in the space provided.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请把意见写在预留的空白处。

Sense.DEF: the amount of space in a newspaper, magazine, or book that is used for a particular subject
Sense.TRAN: 〔报纸或书刊中某一主题占用的〕篇幅
Sense.EXAMPLE: The story got very little space in the national newspapers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这则报道在全国性报纸上所占的篇幅很小。

Sense.DEF: to look straight in front of you without looking at anything in particular, usually because you are thinking
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常因正在思考而〕凝视前方﹐茫然直视

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANING 义项 3

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There was only a small space between the car and the wall.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 车和墙之间只有很小的空间。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Nathan stood in the doorway, filling the narrow space.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 内森站立门道里,占满了狭小的空间。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It was difficult being together in such a confined space.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一起待在这么局促的空间里很难受。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Jack cleared a space for his newspaper on the table.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克在桌上清理出一块地方放他的报纸。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Leave a space for the title at the top.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 在页端留出空白写题目。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Decide what kind of table and chairs will fit best into the space.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 想好什么样的桌子和椅子放进这个空间最合适。

Sense.DEF: to arrange objects or events so that they have equal spaces or periods of time between them
Sense.EXAMPLE: They used three microphones spaced several yards apart .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们用了三个麦克风﹐相互间隔几码的距离。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try to space out your classes and study in between.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 设法将上课时间排开﹐插空进行温习。

GramExa.GLOSS: with equal spaces
GramExa.EXAMPLE: For security, use three evenly spaced bolts per post.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了安全起见﹐每根杆子上要间距均匀地使用三个螺栓。

Sense.DEF: to stop paying attention and just look in front of you without thinking, especially because you are bored or have taken drugs
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因无聊或吸毒后〕变得昏昏沉沉﹐瞪着眼发呆
Sense.EXAMPLE: I completely spaced out during the lecture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听讲座时完全处于精神恍惚的状态。

Sense.DEF: very modern
Sense.TRAN: 太空时代的﹐非常先进的
Sense.EXAMPLE: space-age technology
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极为先进的技术

Sense.DEF:
the wide key at the bottom of a computer
keyboard
or
typewriter
that you press to make a space
someone who forgets things, does not pay attention, and often behaves strangely
Sense.TRAN: 健忘且散漫的人﹐行为怪异者

Sense.DEF: the part of a spacecraft that carries people into space to obtain information and then comes back to Earth
a vehicle that is able to travel in space
not fully conscious of what is happening around you, especially because you are extremely tired or have taken drugs
Sense.TRAN: 〔因极度疲倦或吸毒后〕头脑不清醒的﹐迷迷糊糊的

Sense.DEF: a man who travels into space
someone in stories who visits the Earth from another world
a spacecraft without people in it, that is sent into space to collect information about the conditions there and send the information back to Earth
Sense.TRAN: 〔不载人的〕航天探测器﹐太空探测船

Sense.DEF: a vehicle for carrying people through space
a vehicle that is designed to go into space and return to Earth several times
a large spacecraft that stays above the Earth and is a base for people travelling in space or for scientific tests
a special protective suit that people wear in space, that covers the whole body and provides a supply of air
someone who pays to go on a journey into space on a spacecraft
the act of moving around outside a spacecraft while in space, or the time spent outside it
Sense.TRAN: 太空行走﹔太空行走的时间

Sense.DEF: behaving as though you are not fully conscious of what is happening around you
Sense.TRAN: 头脑不清醒的﹐迷迷糊糊的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt tired and kind of spacey.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感到很累﹐有点迷迷糊糊的。

Sense.DEF: the amount of space between the printed letters, words, or lines on a page
Sense.TRAN: 〔字母之间﹑单词之间或行之间的〕间距

GramExa.GLOSS: lines with no empty lines between them
lines with one empty line after each one

Sense.DEF: a spacious house, room etc is large and has plenty of space to move around in
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spacious living area
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宽敞的居住空间

Sense.DEF: a tool for digging that has a long handle and a broad metal blade that you push into the ground

a
playing card
belonging to the set of cards that have one or more black shapes that look like pointed leaves printed on them
Sense.EXAMPLE: the queen of spades
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑桃王后

Sense.DEF: to speak about things in a direct and honest way, even though it may be impolite to do this
to a great degree, or in large amounts
Sense.EXAMPLE: Beauty, intelligence, wealth - my mother had all of them in spades .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美貌﹑智慧﹑财富——这些在我母亲身上都有很好的体现。

Sense.DEF: a very offensive word for a black person. Do not use this word.
hard work that has to be done in preparation before something can happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of the spadework had been done by 1981.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些艰苦的前期工作到 1981 年已经大部分完成。

Sense.DEF:
a type of
pasta
in very long thin pieces, that is cooked in boiling water

GramExa.GLOSS: cooked spaghetti served with a meat and tomato sauce

Sense.DEF: a place in Birmingham in central England where a lot of roads meet and cross over each other
Sense.TRAN: 〔伯明翰的〕意大利面条路口﹐复式公路枢纽

Sense.DEF: a place where a lot of roads cross over each other

a film about American
cowboys
in the Wild West, especially one made in Europe by an Italian director
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指意大利导演在欧洲摄制的〕意大利式西部片

Sense.DEF:
a past tense of
speak
to send the same message to many different people using email or the Internet, usually as a way of advertising something – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔在网上〕滥发（垃圾电子邮件）〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: email messages that a computer user has not asked for and does not want to read, for example from someone who is advertising something
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can filter out spam with special software.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以使用专门的软件过滤掉滥发的垃圾电子邮件。

Sense.DEF:
a type of cheap
canned
meat made mainly from
pork
ways of stopping unwanted emails from being sent to you, for example by having a list of addresses from which you will not accept emails

the practice of repeating certain popular words on a
webpage
many times, so that the website appears near the top of a list produced when you type the word into a
search engine
Sense.TRAN: 垃圾索引〔在网页上多次重复某些热门词﹐因此当有人利用搜索引擎搜索这些词时﹐该网站就会出现在搜索结果的前端〕

Sense.DEF:
a past tense of
spin
a period of time between two dates or events
Sense.TRAN: 〔两个日期或事件之间的〕时距﹐期间

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Over a span of ten years, the company has made great progress.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在十年时间里﹐这家公司取得了很大进展。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’ll be difficult to hire that many new staff in such a short time span .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这么短的时间里要想招聘到那么多新员工是很难的。

Sense.DEF: the length of time over which someone’s life, ability to pay attention to something etc continues

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most two-year-olds have a very short attention span .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大部分两岁孩子的注意力持续时间都很短。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Captivity vastly reduces the life span of whales.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 捕获饲养会大大缩短鲸的寿命。

Sense.DEF:
the part of a bridge,
arch
etc that goes across from one support to another
the distance from one side of something to the other
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bird with a large wing span
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一只翼展宽大的鸟

Sense.DEF: to include all of a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: a career which spanned nearly 60 years
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 持续了差不多 60 年的职业生涯

Sense.DEF: to include all of a particular space or area
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Mongol Empire spanned much of Central Asia.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒙古帝国跨越中亚的许多地区。

Sense.DEF: if a bridge spans an area of water, especially a river, it goes from one side to the other
a material that stretches, used especially for making tight-fitting sports clothes
Sense.TRAN: 氨纶〔一种有弹性的材料﹐尤用于制作紧身运动服〕

Sense.DEF: to cover something with shiny points of light
Sense.TRAN: 用闪亮的斑点覆盖﹐使闪闪发亮

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The city skyline was spangled with lights.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 城市的天际线灯光闪耀。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿着闪亮紧身服的杂技演员

Sense.DEF: a small piece of shiny metal or plastic sewn onto clothes to give them a shining effect
Sense.TRAN: 〔装饰衣服的〕闪光金属片﹐闪光塑料片﹐闪光饰片

Sense.DEF: a mixture of Spanish and English, spoken especially in the US
Sense.TRAN: 西英混合语〔西班牙语和英语的混合语﹐尤在美国使用〕

Sense.DEF: someone from Spain
a type of dog with long ears that hang down
relating to Spain, its people, or its language
Sense.TRAN: 西班牙的﹔西班牙人的﹔西班牙 语的

Sense.DEF: the language used in Spain and parts of Latin America
people from Spain
to hit a child on their bottom with your open hand, as a punishment
the act of hitting a child on their bottom with your open hand, as a punishment
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you don’t stop that noise, you’ll get a spanking !
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你再弄出那种响声﹐就要打你屁股了！

Sense.DEF: very new and impressive
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spanking new shopping centre
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家簇新的购物中心

Sense.DEF: very clean
very fast
Sense.EXAMPLE: They started walking at a spanking rate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们开始疾走。

Sense.DEF:
a metal tool that fits over a
nut
, used for turning the nut to make it tight or to undo it

Sense.LEXUNIT: put/throw a spanner in the works
Sense.DEF: to unexpectedly do something that prevents a plan or process from succeeding

to practise
boxing
with someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He broke his nose while sparring with Vega.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和维加一起练拳击时给打断了鼻梁骨。

Sense.DEF: to argue with someone but not in an unpleasant way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Senators are sparring over the health bill.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 参议员们就医疗保健法案进行辩论。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s been sparring with the security guards.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在和保安人员争辩。

Sense.DEF: a thick pole, especially one used on a ship to support sails or ropes
Sense.TRAN: 圆材〔尤用作船舶的桅杆〕

Sense.DEF: a key etc that you keep in addition to the one you usually use, so that it is available if the one you usually use breaks, gets lost etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spare key
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一把备用钥匙
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bring a towel and some spare clothes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带一条毛巾和一些备用的衣服。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a supply of spare batteries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些备用电池
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spare tyre
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个备用轮胎

Sense.DEF: not being used or not needed at the present time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you got any spare boxes?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有没有多余的盒子？
Sense.EXAMPLE: You could sleep in the spare bedroom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以睡那间空着的客房。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you have any spare cash?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你手头有闲钱吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll go and see if there are any spare seats.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我去看看是否还有空余的座位。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A decline in beer sales had left the industry with spare capacity the ability to produce more than can be sold .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 啤酒销售量的下降使该行业出现产能闲置。

Sense.DEF: time when you are not working
Sense.EXAMPLE: What do you do in your spare time?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你空闲时间干些什么？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eric spent every spare moment he had in the library.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃里克一有空就泡在图书 馆里。

Sense.DEF: coins of little value that you do not need and can give to other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are beggars on every corner asking for spare change.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个拐角都有乞丐在讨零钱。

Sense.DEF: if something is going spare, it is available for you to have or use
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll have some of that cake if it’s going spare.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果那蛋糕没有人要﹐我就吃一点。

Sense.DEF: to become very angry or worried
Sense.TRAN: 非常生气﹐气急败坏﹔非常担心
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dad would go spare if he found out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸要是知道的话会气坏的。

Sense.DEF: a spare style of writing, painting etc is plain or basic and uses nothing unnecessary
Sense.TRAN: 〔写作﹑绘画等风格〕简朴的﹐不加渲染的

Sense.DEF: someone who is spare is tall and thin
to make something such as time, money, or workers available for someone, especially when this is difficult for you to do
Sense.TRAN: 拨出﹐抽出﹐腾出〔时间﹑金钱或人手等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry, I can’t spare the time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我抽不出时间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like you to come over when you can spare a couple of hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你在能空出几个钟头时过来一下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you spare £5?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能给我五英镑吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re too busy to spare anyone to help you right now.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们太忙了﹐现在腾不出人手来帮你。

GramExa.PROPFORM: spare sb ten minutes/an hour etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Could you possibly spare me a few moments in private used to ask someone if they have time to quickly talk to you ?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能抽出一点时间私下和我谈几句吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s very kind of you to spare me so much of your time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 感谢你为我抽出那么多时间。

Sense.DEF: if you have money, time etc to spare, you have some left in addition to what you have used or need
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anyone who has time to spare and would like to help can contact Moira.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁要是有时间愿意提供帮助﹐可以和莫伊拉联系。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They got to the airport with seconds to spare.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们到机场时只剩一点点时间了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They still have some money to spare.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们还有一些余钱。

Sense.LEXUNIT: spare sb the trouble/difficulty/pain etc (of doing sth)
Sense.DEF: to prevent someone from having to experience something difficult or unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 免除某人（做某事）的麻烦/困难/痛苦等
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wanted to spare them the trouble of buying me a present.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想让他们费事给我买礼物了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thankfully, she had been spared the ordeal of surgery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢天谢地﹐她无须忍受手术的痛苦了。

Sense.DEF: to not damage or harm someone or something, even though other people or things are being damaged, killed, or destroyed
Sense.TRAN: 使免受〔损坏或伤亡〕﹐幸免
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could not understand why I had been spared and they had not.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不明白为什么我得以幸免﹐而他们却没有。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the soldier who had spared his life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 饶他一命的那个士兵

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Today we will hear whether the school is to be spared from closure.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天﹐我们将会得知这所学校是否能够得以幸免不被关闭。

Sense.DEF: to think about another person who is in a worse situation than you are
Sense.TRAN: 想一想某人﹐为某人想想〔某人的处境比你要糟〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Spare a thought for Nick, who’s doing his exams right now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想想尼克吧﹐他现在正在考试呢。

Sense.DEF: to spend as much money or do everything necessary to make something really good or successful

GramExa.PROPFORM: spare no expense/effort to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: No expense was spared in developing the necessary technology.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在开发必需的技术方面是不惜工本的。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: No effort will be spared to bring the people responsible to justice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 将会尽一切努力把责任人绳之以法。

Sense.DEF: to not tell someone all the details about something, because it is unpleasant or boring
Sense.TRAN: 不对某人详谈（细节）〔以免使人不快或厌烦〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spared us the details, saying only that he had been injured in the war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没有告诉我们具体情况﹐只说他在战争中受了伤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘They own three houses. One in the country, one in …’ ‘ Spare me .’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他们拥有三处房子。 一处在乡下﹐一处在……”“别说了。”

Sense.DEF: to avoid doing something that would upset someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just tell me the truth. Don’t worry about sparing my feelings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你就告诉我实话﹐用不着怕我难过。

Sense.DEF: to look quickly at someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Before leaving the old town, spare another glance at the tower.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 离开这座古镇之前﹐再看一眼那座塔吧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a bored waitress who scarcely spared them a glance
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个看都不看他们一眼的不耐烦的女服务员

Sense.DEF: to avoid doing something that would embarrass someone
an additional thing, for example a key, that you keep so that it is available
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you forget the key, Mrs Jones over the road has a spare.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你忘了带钥匙﹐路对面的琼斯太太有一把备用的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The batteries are dead. Have you got any spares?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电池用完了。你有备用的吗？

Sense.DEF:
a
spare tyre

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a shortage of aircraft spares
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机零部件的短缺

Sense.DEF: a new part for a vehicle or machine, that is used to replace a part that is damaged or broken

the
ribs
of a pig and the meat on them, eaten as food
a bedroom in your house for guests
an additional wheel with a tyre on it, that you keep in a car to use if another tyre gets damaged
the fat around someone’s waist – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 腰间赘肉﹐肥胖的腰 〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: using or doing only a little of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Use the spices sparingly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种香料只要用一点点。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: We must be sparing with our resources.

Sense.DEF: a very small piece of burning material produced by a fire or by hitting or rubbing two hard objects together
Sense.EXAMPLE: sparks from the fire
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火里飞出的火星
Sense.EXAMPLE: The scrape of metal on metal sent up a shower of sparks .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金属之间互相摩擦﹐迸出一串火星。

Sense.DEF: a flash of light caused by electricity passing across a space
Sense.EXAMPLE: electric sparks from a broken wire
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一根破损电线迸出的电火花

Sense.DEF: a small amount of a feeling or quality
Sense.TRAN: 一点点兴趣/激动/怒气等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rachel looked at her and felt a spark of hope.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蕾切尔看着她﹐感到了一线希望。

Sense.DEF: a small action or event that causes something to happen, especially trouble or violence
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指骚乱或暴力的〕起因﹐导火线
Sense.EXAMPLE: The judge’s verdict provided the spark for the riots.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官的裁决是这场暴乱的导火线。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Interest rate cuts were the spark the market needed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 降低利率是市场所需要的刺激。

Sense.DEF: a quality of intelligence or energy that makes someone successful or fun to be with
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was tired, and lacked her usual spark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很累﹐没有了平时的活力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mc-Kellan’s performance gives the play its spark of life quality of energy .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦凯伦的演出给这出戏带来了亮点。

Sense.DEF: anger or angry arguments
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sparks were really flying people were arguing angrily at the meeting!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议上可真是唇枪舌剑！

Sense.DEF: to be the cause of something, especially trouble or violence
Sense.TRAN: 引起﹐导致〔尤指骚乱或暴力〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police response sparked outrage in the community.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方的反应激起了民愤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A discarded cigarette sparked a small brush fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个乱扔的烟头引起了一场小小的灌木丛火灾。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel interested, hopeful etc
Sense.TRAN: 激起某人的兴趣/希望/好奇心等
Sense.EXAMPLE: topics that spark children’s imaginations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 激发儿童想象力的话题

Sense.DEF: to produce sparks of fire or electricity

a
spark plug
to shine in small bright flashes
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sea sparkled in the sun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阳光下大海碧波闪耀。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The crystal chandelier sparkled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那水晶枝形吊灯闪闪发光。

Sense.DEF: if someone’s eyes sparkle, they seem to shine brightly, especially because the person is happy or excited
Sense.TRAN: 〔眼睛〕发亮﹐闪耀〔尤因快乐或兴奋〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ron’s eyes sparkled with excitement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗恩的眼睛里闪烁着激动的光芒。

Sense.DEF: a bright shiny appearance, with small points of flashing light
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sparkle of the diamonds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钻石的光芒

Sense.DEF: a quality that makes something or someone seem interesting and full of life
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sparkle and zest of a live performance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现场表演的活力和狂热

Sense.DEF: if someone has a sparkle in their eyes, their eyes seem to shine, and you can see a feeling in them, especially happiness or excitement
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a sparkle of fun in her brown eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那棕色的眼睛里闪烁着一丝顽皮的神情。

Sense.DEF:
a type of
firework
that you can hold in your hand, consisting of a thin stick that gives off sparks of fire
shining brightly with points of flashing light
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sparkling blue lake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 波光粼粼﹑湛蓝的湖面

Sense.DEF: very clean, and seeming to shine brightly
Sense.TRAN: 非常干净的﹔光洁闪亮的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sparkling white beach
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 闪亮的白色沙滩
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sparkling clean kitchen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常干净的厨房

Sense.DEF: a sparkling drink has bubbles of gas in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a glass of sparkling wine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一杯起泡葡萄酒

Sense.DEF: full of life and intelligence
Sense.TRAN: 充满生气的﹔才智焕发的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Claire’s sparkling personality
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克莱尔那才情横溢的魅力

Sense.DEF:
a part in a car engine that produces an electric
spark
to make the petrol mixture start burning
full of life and energy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why would a sparky girl like Nicola want to marry him?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 像妮古拉这样一个活泼的女孩子怎么会想嫁给他呢？

Sense.DEF:
someone you practise
boxing
with
someone you regularly have friendly arguments with
a small brown bird, very common in many parts of the world
existing only in small amounts
Sense.EXAMPLE: his sparse brown hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那稀疏的棕色头发
Sense.EXAMPLE: rural areas with sparse populations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人口稀少的农村地区

Sense.DEF: spartan conditions or ways of living are simple and without any comfort
Sense.TRAN: 〔生活条件或方式〕简朴而艰苦的﹐清苦的
Sense.EXAMPLE: spartan accommodation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简朴的住处
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spartan existence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 清苦的生活

Sense.DEF: an occasion when your muscles suddenly become tight, causing you pain
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maggie felt a muscle spasm in her back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛吉觉得背部肌肉一阵抽搐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tom’s jaw muscles had gone into spasm .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆的颌部肌肉开始抽搐。

Sense.DEF: a sudden strong feeling or reaction that you have for a short period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt a spasm of fear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感到一阵恐惧。

Sense.DEF: happening for short irregular periods, not continuously
Sense.TRAN: 间歇的﹐一阵阵的﹐断断续续的
Sense.EXAMPLE: spasmodic machine gun fire
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 断断续续的机关枪射击

Sense.DEF: of or relating to a muscle spasm
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spasmodic cough
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 痉挛性咳嗽

Sense.DEF:
having
cerebral palsy
, a disease that prevents control of the muscles
an insulting way of describing someone who drops things, falls easily, and is stupid – used especially by children
Sense.TRAN: 愚笨的﹐拙劣的〔尤为儿语〕

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and past participle of
spit1
Sense.TRAN: spit1 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF: a short unimportant quarrel
Sense.EXAMPLE: a marital spat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夫妻间的口角

Sense.DEF: special pieces of cloth that fasten with buttons on top of a man’s shoes, worn in the past
a large number of similar things that happen in a short period of time, especially bad things
Sense.TRAN: 一连串[接二连三]的某事〔尤指不好的事情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spate of burglaries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接连发生的入室盗窃案

Sense.DEF: a river, stream etc that is in spate is very full and flowing very fast
relating to the position, size, shape etc of things
if a liquid spatters, or if something spatters it, drops of it fall or are thrown all over a surface

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The walls were spattered with blood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙上溅满了血。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a sweatshirt with paint spattered over it
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 溅上了油漆的长袖运动衫

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The first drops of rain spattered on the stones.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨点开始噼里啪啦地打在石头上。

Sense.DEF: a kitchen tool with a wide flat blade, used for spreading, mixing, or lifting soft substances
Sense.TRAN: 抹刀﹔铲〔用于涂抹﹑拌和或盛起软质物的厨房用具〕

Sense.DEF: a small instrument with a flat surface, used by doctors to hold your tongue down so that they can examine your throat
to make a series of things happen or start to exist
Sense.TRAN: 使大量出现﹐使大量产生﹔酿成
Sense.EXAMPLE: New technology has spawned new business opportunities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新技术创造了大量新的商机。

Sense.DEF:
if a fish or
frog
spawns, it produces eggs in large quantities at the same time

the eggs of a fish or
frog
laid together in a soft mass
to remove part of the sex organs of a female animal so that it is not able to have babies
Sense.TRAN: 切除〔雌性动物〕的卵巢﹔阉割〔雌性动物〕

Sense.DEF: to talk to someone about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I spoke to her last Wednesday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 上星期三我和她谈过了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Hello, may I speak to Jim Smith?’ ‘Yes, speaking.’ used on the telephone
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “喂﹐请让吉姆·史密斯听电话好吗？”“对﹐我就是。”
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I know her by sight, but not to speak to not well enough to talk to her .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只是认得她﹐但没跟她说过话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I haven’t spoken to Steve about all this.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还没跟史蒂夫谈过这一切。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They did not want to speak with reporters.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不想和记者说话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was the first time she had ever spoken of marriage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是她头一次谈及婚姻。

Sense.DEF: to use your voice to produce words
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was so shocked I couldn’t speak.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我震惊得说不出话来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spoke very softly quietly .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说话声音非常轻柔。

Sense.DEF: to be able to talk in a particular language
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you speak English?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会说英语吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t speak a word of French do not speak any French at all .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一句法语也不会说。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Several children in the class can’t speak English.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 班上有几个小孩不会讲英语。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a German-speaking secretary
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 会说德语的秘书

Sense.DEF: to make a formal speech

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jones spoke at the teachers’ annual convention.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼斯在教师年会上发言。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She asked me to speak to her students about my work in marketing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她请我给她的学生讲讲我的市场营销工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Only one MP spoke against the bill.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有一位议员发言反对那项议案。

Sense.DEF: to say something that expresses your ideas or opinions

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He emphasized that he was speaking as a private citizen, not in any official capacity.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他强调﹐他是以公民身份﹐而不是以任何官方的身份在说话。

GramExa.GLOSS: say good or bad things about someone
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 说某人的好话/对某人评价很高/说某人的坏话
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her co-workers spoke highly of her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的同事对她评价很高。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s wrong to speak ill of the dead.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 说死者的坏话是不对的。

GramExa.GLOSS: used when expressing an idea that you think is exactly true, generally true etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 严格说来/一般说来/大致上说
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Strictly speaking, it’s my money, not yours. I earned it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 严格说来﹐这是我的钱﹐不是你的。 是我挣来的。

Sense.DEF: used when you are saying something in words that do not have their usual meaning
Sense.TRAN: 可以说〔用于所说的话不是平常的意思时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have to pull down the barriers, so to speak, of poverty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以说﹐我们必须摧毁贫困的障碍。

Sense.DEF: to tell people exactly what you think, even if it offends them
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a tough politician who wasn’t afraid to speak his mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是一个态度强硬﹑敢于直言的政治家。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be not speaking/not be on speaking terms
Sense.DEF: if two people are not speaking, they do not talk to each other, usually because they have argued
Sense.TRAN: 彼此不说话﹐互不理睬〔一般因为吵过架〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was not on speaking terms with his brother or sisters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和兄弟姐妹互不说话。

Sense.DEF: if something speaks volumes, it clearly shows the nature of something or the feelings of a person
Sense.TRAN: 充分证明﹐清楚表明（某事）
Sense.EXAMPLE: What you wear speaks volumes about you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 衣着显示你的内心。

Sense.DEF: if a group of people speak with one voice, they all express the same opinion
Sense.EXAMPLE: On this issue, the 12 organizations spoke with one voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这个问题上﹐这十二个组织的意见完全一致。

Sense.DEF: if two people or groups speak the same language, they have similar attitudes and opinions
Sense.TRAN: 有共同语言〔表示两个人或团体的态度意见相近〕

Sense.DEF: to say something when you do not have the right or authority to say it
Sense.TRAN: 说话鲁莽﹐讲话不合身份

Section.SECHEADING: TO SPEAK A LANGUAGE 说一种语言

Exponent.DEF: to be able to talk in a foreign language
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Do you speak German?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会说德语吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I learnt Spanish for years, but I still don’t speak it very well.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我西班牙语学了好多年,可是仍旧不是说得很好。

Exponent.DEF: to be very good at speaking and understanding a foreign language, so that you can speak it almost as well as your own language
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Applicants should be fluent in Cantonese.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 求职者应该会说流利的粤语。

Exponent.DEF: to speak enough of a language to be able to buy things, ask for help etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔用外语〕能够应付〔购物﹑求助等〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘What’s your Italian like?’ ‘Not great, but I can get by.’
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “你的意大利语怎么样？”“不是很好,但能应付。”
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ve just bought a book called ‘Get by in Portuguese'.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我刚买了一本《葡萄牙语点点通》。

Exponent.EXP: have/pick up a smattering of sth
Exponent.DEF: to speak or learn to speak a small but useful amount of a language
Exponent.EXAMPLE: While I was in Bali, I picked up a smattering of Indonesian.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在巴厘岛的时候学了点印度尼西亚语。

Sense.DEF: to express the feelings, thoughts, or beliefs of a person or group of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dan, speaking for the students, started the meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生代表丹宣布会议开始。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that you do not have the same opinion as they do, or that something that is true for them is not true for you
Sense.TRAN: 你只代表你自己说话﹐那是你的看法〔用于表示不同意对方的意见〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘We don’t want to go.’ ‘Speak for yourself!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们不想去。” “你是说你自己吧！”

Sense.DEF: if something or someone is spoken for, they have already been promised to someone else
Sense.TRAN: 已被预订﹔被应许给别人
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re all either married or spoken for.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们都要么结婚了﹐要么有对象了。

Sense.DEF: to show something very clearly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The results speak for themselves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 结果不言自明。

Sense.DEF: to show clearly that something happened or exists
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her skin spoke of warm summer days spent in the sun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的皮肤表明她是在太阳下度过了温暖的夏日。

Sense.DEF: very little of something or a very small thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s been no rain to speak of for several months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好几个月都没怎么下过雨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house had no garden to speak of.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这栋房子没有像样的花园。

Sense.DEF: to publicly speak in protest about something, especially when protesting could be dangerous
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指不顾危险〕公开反对﹐挺身抗议

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Five students who had spoken out against the regime were arrested.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公开反对该政权的五名学生遭逮捕。

Sense.DEF: to talk to someone who has done something wrong and tell them not to do it again
Sense.EXAMPLE: Joe was late again today. You’ll have to speak to him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔今天又迟到了﹐你得说说他。

Sense.DEF: if something such as a poem, painting, or piece of music speaks to you, you like it because it expresses a particular meaning, quality, or feeling to you
Sense.TRAN: 对…有感染力﹔对…有吸引力
Sense.EXAMPLE: Modern art just doesn’t speak to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代艺术实在引不起我的共鸣。

Sense.DEF: used to ask someone to speak louder
Sense.TRAN: 大声点说﹐提高嗓门说〔用于要求别人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could you speak up, please?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请你大声点说﹐好吗？

Sense.DEF: to say something, especially to express your opinion
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a brief silence, then Gerald spoke up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵短暂的沉默之后杰拉尔德发话了。

Sense.DEF: to speak in support of someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is willing to speak up for the rights of women.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他愿意为妇女权利辩护。

Sense.DEF: the special language or difficult words that are used in a particular business or activity …
Sense.EXAMPLE: computerspeak
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机术语

Sense.DEF: a place in the US in the 1920’s and 1930’s where you could buy alcohol illegally
Sense.TRAN: 〔20 世纪 20﹑30 年代美国的〕非法经营的售酒处

Sense.DEF: someone who makes a formal speech to a group of people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the guest speaker at the conference
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大会的特邀演讲者

Sense.EXAMPLE: The keynote speaker main or most important speaker was Robert Venturi, the architect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主要发言人是建筑师罗伯特·文图里。

GramExa.GLOSS: someone who makes a speech after a formal meal

Sense.DEF: someone who speaks a particular language

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 讲法语/西班牙语等的人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some English words are difficult for speakers of other languages.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些英语单词对说其他语言的人来说是很难的。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a native speaker of Chinese
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 以汉语为母语的人

Sense.DEF:
the part of a radio,
sound system
etc where the sound comes out
Sense.TRAN: 〔收音机﹑音响系统等的〕扬声器

Sense.DEF: someone who says something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pay attention to the body language of the speaker.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 注意说话者的肢体语言。

Sense.DEF: an official who controls discussions in a parliament
the politician who controls discussions in the House of Representatives in the US Congress

a telephone that contains a
microphone
and a
loudspeaker
, so that you can use it without holding it. Speakerphones are especially used in business meetings when groups of people in different places want to talk to each other.
Sense.TRAN: 免提电话〔内置麦克风和扬声器﹐使用时无需手持﹐尤用于商务会议〕

Sense.DEF: a pole with a sharp pointed blade at one end, used as a weapon in the past
a thin pointed stem of a plant
Sense.EXAMPLE: asparagus spears
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 芦笋嫩茎

Sense.DEF: to push or throw a spear into something, especially in order to kill it
to push a pointed object, usually a fork, into something, so that you can pick it up
to lead an attack or organized action
Sense.EXAMPLE: the troops who spearheaded the rescue mission
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在救援任务中充当先锋的部队

Sense.DEF: a person or group of people who lead an attack or organized action

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The group became the spearhead of the labor union movement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个团体成了工会运动的 先锋。

Sense.DEF:
a fresh
mint
taste, often used in sweets

a type of
mint
plant
a detailed instruction about how a building, car, piece of equipment etc should be made
Sense.TRAN: 〔制造房子﹑汽车﹑设备等的〕规格说明
Sense.EXAMPLE: the specs for the company’s new video games console
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司新的电子游戏操纵器的规格

Sense.DEF: if you do something on spec, you do it without being sure that you will get what you are hoping for
Sense.EXAMPLE: I sent in an application on spec.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我寄去一份申请书碰碰运气。

Sense.DEF: glasses that help you see
not ordinary or usual, but different in some way and often better or more important
Sense.EXAMPLE: a special place in the classroom for reading
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教室里的阅读专区
Sense.EXAMPLE: No one receives special treatment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有人享有特殊待遇。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maria’s special recipe for apple pie
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽亚的苹果馅饼秘方
Sense.EXAMPLE: The good china was used only on special occasions .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些精美瓷器只在特殊场合使用。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Each village has its own special charm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每一座村子都有其独特的魅力。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are you doing anything special for Christmas?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你过圣诞节有什么特别活动吗？

Sense.DEF: particularly important to someone and deserving attention, love etc
Sense.TRAN: 特别要好的﹐格外看重的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a party with a few special friends
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个特别要好的朋友来参加的派对
Sense.EXAMPLE: a teacher who made every child feel special
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让每个孩子都感觉自己受重视的教师
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her second son had a special place in her heart .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 次子在她心里占有特别重要的位置。

Sense.DEF: a special position or job has a particular purpose or aim, and continues only until that purpose or aim is achieved
Sense.TRAN: 〔身份或工作〕特设的﹔有专门作用[目的]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mitchell acted as a special envoy in the Northern Ireland peace talks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米切尔在北爱尔兰和平谈判中充当特使。

Sense.DEF: more than usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pay special attention to how you clean the wound.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要格外注意如何清洁伤口。

Sense.DEF: something that is not usual or ordinary, and is made or done for a special purpose
Sense.TRAN: 特别的东西﹐特殊的事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: a TV special on the election
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关大选的一档电视特别节目

Sense.DEF: a lower price than usual for a particular product for a short period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lunch special for $4.99
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 4.99 美元的特惠午餐

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Breyer’s ice cream is on special this week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 布瑞尔店的冰激凌本周特价。

Sense.DEF:
someone who works for the
fbi
Sense.TRAN: 〔联邦调查局的〕特工﹐特别调查员

Sense.DEF:
a department of the British police force that deals with political crimes or crimes affecting the safety of the government, for example
terrorism
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国警察部门的〕政治保安处

Sense.DEF: someone in Britain who sometimes works as a police officer without being paid, and who also has another main job
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国不领工资﹑另有正职的〕特种警察

Sense.DEF: a service that delivers a letter or package very quickly
the education of children who have physical problems or learning problems
an unusual image or sound that has been produced artificially to be used in a film or television programme
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影或电视节目里的〕特技效果

Sense.DEF:
soldiers who have been specially trained to fight against
guerrilla
or
terrorist
groups
Sense.TRAN: 〔从事反游击战或反恐怖主义的〕特种部队

Sense.DEF: a group of people who share the same political or business aims, and who try to influence the government to help them with those aims
special interest groups in general
Sense.EXAMPLE: Special interests donate millions of dollars to political campaigns.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特殊利益集团给政治活动捐赠了数百万美元。

Sense.DEF: a particular activity or subject that you know a lot about

GramExa.EXAMPLE: graduates with a specialism in Tourism and Leisure
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅游与休闲专业的毕业生

Sense.DEF: the practice of limiting your interests or activities to particular subjects
someone who knows a lot about a particular subject, or is very skilled at it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an attorney who is a specialist in banking law
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名专攻银行法的律师

Sense.DEF: a doctor who knows more about one particular type of illness or treatment than other doctors
Sense.EXAMPLE: a heart specialist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 心脏专科医生

Sense.DEF: a type of food that a person, restaurant, or area is well known for
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人﹑餐馆或地方的〕特色食品
Sense.EXAMPLE: The restaurant offers a wide variety of local specialities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家餐厅提供各种本地的特色菜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the region’s speciality cheese
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区的特色干酪

Sense.DEF: a subject or job that you know a lot about or have a lot of experience of
Sense.EXAMPLE: Preston’s speciality was night photography.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 普雷斯顿的专长是夜间摄影。

Sense.DEF: an activity or subject that you know a lot about
the practice of limiting your interests or activities to one particular subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: industrial specialization
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工业的专门化

Sense.DEF: to limit all or most of your study, business etc to a particular subject or activity
Sense.TRAN: 专门研究﹐专门从事﹐专攻

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Simmons specialized in contract law.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 西蒙斯专攻合同法。

Sense.DEF: trained, designed, or developed for a particular purpose, type of work, place etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: specialized training for specific jobs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为特定工作而进行的专门训练
Sense.EXAMPLE: the highly specialized plants that live in desert areas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生长在沙漠地区的高度特化的植物

Sense.DEF: special permission given by the Church of England for a marriage to take place at a time or place not usually allowed
Sense.TRAN: 结婚特许证〔英国教会颁发的特别许可证﹐允许人们在通常不准结婚的时间或地点办理结婚〕

Sense.DEF: for one particular purpose, and only for that purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: specially trained police dogs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过专门训练的警犬

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The boats are specially built for the disabled.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些船是专门为残疾人制造的。

Sense.DEF: much more than usual, or much more than other people or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: He specially liked the pie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他特别喜欢这种馅饼。

Sense.DEF: needs that someone has because they have mental or physical problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: children with special needs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有特殊需要的儿童

Sense.DEF: a low price charged for a product for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel has a special offer of five nights for the price of three.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒店有个特价活动﹐住五晚只需三晚的费用。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: special offers on dishwashers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 洗碗机的特价优惠

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The wine is currently on special offer at £2.69.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种葡萄酒现正特价销售﹐售价仅为2.69英镑。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的特价是 25.95 英镑。

Sense.DEF: when someone tries to persuade you to do something by giving you only those facts that support their argument
Sense.TRAN: 诡辩〔只列举支持自己观点的事实来说服某人〕

Sense.DEF: in the US, an independent lawyer who is chosen to examine the actions of a government official and find out if they have done anything wrong or illegal
Sense.TRAN: 特别检察官〔美国专门调查政府官员是否有舞弊行为的检察官〕

Sense.DEF: a school for children with physical problems or learning problems
Sense.TRAN: 〔为有身体缺陷或学习障碍的孩子开办的〕特殊学校

Sense.DEF: a type of food that a person, restaurant, or area is well known for
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人﹑餐馆或地方的〕特色食品
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our specialty is clam chowder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的特色菜是蛤肉汤。

Sense.DEF: a subject or job that you know a lot about or have a lot of experience of
Sense.EXAMPLE: Johnson’s specialty is medieval European history.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰逊的专业是中世纪欧洲史。

Sense.DEF: a particular product or business that has one purpose or sells one type of thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: an area with clothes retailers and specialty shops
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有服装零售店和特产商店的地区

Sense.DEF: a group of animals or plants whose members are similar and can breed together to produce young animals or plants
Sense.EXAMPLE: Seven species of birds of prey have been observed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已有七种猛禽被观察到。
Sense.EXAMPLE: pandas and other endangered species ones that may soon no longer exist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 熊猫以及其他濒危物种

Sense.DEF: a specific thing, person, or group is one particular thing, person, or group
Sense.EXAMPLE: games suitable for specific age groups
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 适合特定年龄组的游戏
Sense.EXAMPLE: a specific example of alcohol’s effect on the body
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒精对身体影响的具体例子

Sense.DEF: detailed and exact
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Howarth gave us very specific instructions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 豪沃思先生给了我们很明确的指示。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Could you be more specific about what you’re looking for?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能否更详细地说说你要找什么？

Sense.DEF: limited to or affecting only one particular thing
Sense.TRAN: 仅限于某事物的﹐只对某事物有影响的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a disease specific to horses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有马才会得的病

Sense.DEF: particular details

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the specifics of the lawsuit
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件诉讼案的细节

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Thurman was reluctant to go into specifics about the deal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 瑟曼不愿详谈交易的细节。

Sense.DEF: a drug that has an effect only on one particular disease
relating to or intended for one particular type of person or thing only
Sense.EXAMPLE: advertising that specifically targets children
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 专门针对儿童的广告

Sense.DEF: in a detailed or exact way
Sense.EXAMPLE: I specifically asked you not to do that!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我明确地要求过你不要那样做！

Sense.DEF: used when you are adding more exact information
Sense.EXAMPLE: Specifically, the department wanted answers to the following questions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 具体来说﹐部门里希望以下问题得到解决。

Sense.DEF: a detailed instruction about how a car, building, piece of equipment etc should be made
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车﹑建筑﹑设备等的〕规格说明﹐明细规范

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The airport building had been constructed to FAA specifications.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 机场大楼是按联邦航空局的设计规格建造的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The bolts met all the engineering specifications .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些螺栓符合所有的工程设计规格。

Sense.DEF: a clear statement of what is needed or wanted
Sense.EXAMPLE: a specification of what role each member will play
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每名成员担当什么角色的具体说明

GramExa.GLOSS: a detailed description of what a job involves

Sense.DEF: the weight of a substance divided by the weight of the amount of water that would fill the same space
to state something in an exact and detailed way
Sense.TRAN: 具体指明﹔明确说明﹔详述
Sense.EXAMPLE: Payments will be made for a specified number of months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 款项将在规定的几个月内支付。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Regulations specify how long maintenance crews can work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 条例明确规定了维修人员的工作时长。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rules clearly specify that competitors must not accept payment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 规则清楚地说明参赛者不得接受报酬。

Sense.DEF: a small amount or piece that is taken from something, so that it can be tested or examined
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于测试或检验的〕样品﹐样本﹔标本
Sense.EXAMPLE: a blood specimen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 血样

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a specimen of rock
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 岩石标本

Sense.DEF: a single example of something, often an animal or plant

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a very fine specimen of 12th century glass
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 12 世纪玻璃的极好实例

Sense.DEF: a person you are describing in a particular way – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 某种类型的人﹐…家伙〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her boyfriend is an impressive physical specimen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的男朋友是体型很健美的那种人。

Sense.DEF: seeming to be true or correct, but actually false
Sense.TRAN: 似是而非的﹐貌似正确的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a specious argument
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 貌似有理的 论据

Sense.DEF: a very small mark, spot, or piece of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a speck of dust
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一粒灰尘

Sense.DEF: covered with many small marks or spots
Sense.TRAN: 带有许多小斑点的﹐布满小斑点的
Sense.EXAMPLE: speckled eggs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛋壳上布满小斑点的鸡蛋

Sense.DEF: small marks or spots covering a background of a different colour
a very impressive show or scene
Sense.TRAN: 精彩的表演﹔壮观的场面[景象]
Sense.EXAMPLE: a multimedia dance and opera spectacle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盛大的多媒体舞蹈戏剧表演

Sense.DEF: an unusual or interesting thing or situation that you see or notice – used especially in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 不同寻常的事[现象]〔尤含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trial was turned into a public spectacle .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 审判变成了一场公开的闹剧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the spectacle of drunken young men on the streets
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 街上年轻醉汉的丑态

Sense.DEF: glasses that help you see
to behave in an embarrassing way that is likely to make other people notice you and laugh at you
very impressive
Sense.TRAN: 壮观的﹔精彩的﹔令人印象深刻的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mountainous area with spectacular scenery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 景色壮丽的山区
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spectacular success
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 辉煌的成就

Sense.DEF: very sudden, unexpected, or extreme
Sense.EXAMPLE: The news caused a spectacular fall in the stock market.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一消息引起了股市的暴跌。

Sense.DEF: an event or performance that is very large and impressive
Sense.TRAN: 盛况﹐壮观的场面﹔盛大的演出
Sense.EXAMPLE: a television spectacular
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 场面盛大的电视节目

Sense.DEF: to watch a sports event
someone who is watching an event or game
Sense.TRAN: 〔活动或体育比赛的〕观看者﹐观众
Sense.EXAMPLE: The match attracted over 40,000 spectators.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场比赛吸引了四万多名观众。

Sense.DEF: a sport that people go and watch
something that you watch rather than take part in – usually used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 只旁观不参加的事情〔一般为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Life is not a spectator sport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在生活中不能只做旁观者。

Sense.DEF:
the American spelling of
spectre

the plural of
spectrum
relating to or like a spectre
relating to or made by a spectrum
something that people are afraid of because it may affect them badly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The recession is again raising the spectre of unemployment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次经济衰退再次引起了人们对失业的恐惧。

Sense.DEF:
a
ghost
an instrument used for forming and looking at spectra
a complete range of opinions, people, situations etc, going from one extreme to its opposite

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the ethnic spectrum of America
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国的各种族

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bill drew support from across the political spectrum.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项议案得到了各个政治派别的支持。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a broad spectrum of environmental groups
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 各式各样的环境保护团体

Sense.EXAMPLE: The two articles here represent opposite ends of the spectrum .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里的两篇文章代表了两个极端的观点。

Sense.DEF:
the set of bands of coloured light into which a beam of light separates when it is passed through a
prism
a complete range of radio, sound etc waves
Sense.EXAMPLE: the electromagnetic spectrum
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电磁（波）谱

Sense.DEF: to guess about the possible causes or effects of something, without knowing all the facts or details
Sense.EXAMPLE: She refused to speculate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拒绝猜测。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jones refused to speculate about what might happen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼斯拒绝猜测可能会发生什么事情。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some analysts speculated that jobs will be lost.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些分析家推测工作职位将会减少。

Sense.DEF:
to buy goods, property,
shares
in a company etc, hoping that you will make a large profit when you sell them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He speculated in stocks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他炒股票。

Sense.DEF: when you guess about the possible causes or effects of something without knowing all the facts, or the guesses that you make

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is speculation that the president is ill.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人猜测总统病了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: speculation about the future
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对未来的推测

Sense.EXAMPLE: The witness’s statement was pure speculation not based on any facts .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这名证人的陈述纯粹是猜测。

GramExa.GLOSS: speculation that is unlikely to be true

Sense.DEF:
when you try to make a large profit by buying goods, property,
shares
etc and then selling them
Sense.EXAMPLE: property speculation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房地产投机买卖

Sense.DEF: based on guessing, not on information or facts

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a purely speculative theory about life on other planets
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于其他行星上存在生命的纯属猜测的理论

Sense.DEF: bought or done in the hope of making a profit later
Sense.EXAMPLE: speculative investments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 投机性的投资

Sense.DEF: if you give someone a speculative look, you look at them while trying to guess something about them

Tail.EXAMPLETRAN: 德莱尼用猜度的目光看看她。

Sense.DEF:
someone who buys goods, property,
shares
in a company etc, hoping that they will make a large profit when they sell them
Sense.EXAMPLE: a New York property speculator
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纽约的一名房地产投机者

Sense.DEF:
a past tense and past participle of
speed2
Sense.TRAN: speed2 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF: a talk, especially a formal one about a particular subject, given to a group of people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Each child had to give a short speech to the rest of the class.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个孩子都必须在全班同学面前作一个简短的演讲。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He has to make a lot of after-dinner speeches .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他经常要发表席后演说。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a major speech on relations with China
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于对华关系的一次重要讲话

Sense.EXAMPLE: Collins gave the keynote speech most important speech .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科林斯作了主题发言。

Sense.DEF: the ability to speak
Sense.EXAMPLE: Only humans are capable of speech.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有人类才具备说话能力。

Sense.DEF: spoken language rather than written language
Sense.EXAMPLE: In speech we use a smaller vocabulary than in writing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 口语使用的词汇量比书面语使用的少。

Sense.DEF: the particular way in which someone speaks
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bob’s speech was slurred, and he sounded drunk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲍勃说话含糊不清﹐听起来像是喝醉了酒。

Sense.DEF: a set of lines that an actor must say in a play
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hamlet’s longest speech
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈姆雷特最长的那段台词

Exponent.DEF: a talk, especially a formal one about a particular subject, given to a group of people
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指在众人面前发表的正式〕演说,演讲
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The bridegroom usually makes a speech after the wedding.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 新郎通常会在婚礼后讲话。
