Exponent.EXAMPLE: In her speech, she proposed major changes to the welfare system.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在演说中提议对福利制度进行重大改革。

Exponent.DEF: a speech that a very important person gives to a large group of people
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the President's address to the nation
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统向全国人民的致辞

Exponent.DEF: an occasion when someone speaks to a group of people giving them information about a particular subject or about their experiences
Exponent.TRAN: 〔关于某个主题或个人经历的〕讲话,讲座
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I went to an interesting talk on the wildlife of Antarctica.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我去听了一个有关南极洲野生动植物的有趣讲座。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He's been asked to give a talk about his trip to India.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被邀请去讲他的印度之行。

Exponent.DEF: a talk, especially on an academic subject and given to students in a university
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指大学里举办的学术方面的〕讲座
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a lecture on 17th century French literature
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 17 世纪法国文学讲座
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Professor Black is giving the lecture.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 讲座由布莱克教授主讲。

Exponent.DEF: a talk in which you describe or explain a new product or idea, especially one you give for your company
Exponent.TRAN: 〔新产品或观点等的〕说明,介绍,陈述
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I had to give a presentation to the board of directors.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不得不向董事会作了介绍。

Exponent.DEF: a talk given by a priest or a religious leader
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The vicar preached a sermon about the need for forgiveness.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 牧师布道宣讲了宽恕的重要性。

Exponent.DEF: a spoken or written announcement that someone makes in public, often to journalists
Exponent.TRAN: 〔常向新闻记者作的〕声明,陈述
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The minister issued a short statement in which he said he had no plans to resign.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 部长发表了一个简短声明,说他没有辞职打算。

Sense.DEF: an occasion held once a year in some British schools, when prizes are given to children and people give speeches
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国某些学校一年一度的〕授奖演讲日

Sense.DEF: to make speeches in a way that makes you seem important – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 高谈阔论﹐夸夸其谈〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: a physical or nervous problem that affects your speech
unable to speak because you feel very angry, upset etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔因愤怒﹑难过等〕说不出话的﹐哑口无言的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His comments left me speechless with rage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的那番话气得我说不出话来。

Sense.DEF: the marks (‘ ’) or (“ ”), that show when someone starts speaking and when they stop
a computer system that produces sounds like human speech
treatment that helps people who have difficulty in speaking properly
Sense.TRAN: 言语障碍矫治﹐言语治疗

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to write speeches for other people
the rate at which something moves or travels
Sense.EXAMPLE: The truck was travelling at a speed of 50 mph.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡车正以 50 英里的时速在行驶。
Sense.EXAMPLE: particles that travel at the speed of light
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以光速运动的粒子

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually talk about how fast something or someone is rather than using the noun speed .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中表示多快, 人们一般说 fast, 而不用名词 speed

Sense.DEF: the rate at which something happens or is done

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the speed of change within the industry
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该行业内部的变革速度

Sense.EXAMPLE: a high-speed computer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一台高速电脑
Sense.EXAMPLE: The population was growing at great speed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人口在快速增长。

Sense.DEF: the quality of being fast
Sense.EXAMPLE: The women’s basketball team has talent, speed, and power.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这支女子篮球队天赋﹑速度和力量兼备。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She acted with speed and efficiency.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的行动快速有效。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a van travelling at speed
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 快速行驶的小 货车

Subsense.DEF: the degree to which photographic film is sensitive to light

the time it takes for a camera
shutter
to open and close
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a shutter speed of 1/250 second
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1/250 秒的快门速度

Sense.DEF: an illegal drug that makes you very active
Sense.TRAN: 苯丙胺﹐脱氧麻黄碱﹐快速丸〔一种兴奋剂〕

Sense.DEF:
having five, ten etc
gears
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ten-speed bike
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十速自行车

Sense.DEF: having the latest information or knowledge about something
Sense.TRAN: 跟上形势﹐了解最新情况
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some school officials are only now getting up to speed regarding computers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些学校官员在计算机方面现在才刚刚跟上形势。
Sense.EXAMPLE: John will bring you up to speed tell you the latest information .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰将会为你介绍最新情况。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANINGS 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He increased his speed until he was running flat out.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不停加速,直到全速奔跑。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The Mercedes was gradually picking up speed.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那辆梅赛德斯逐渐加速。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The trains will reach speeds of 140 mph.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车时速将可以达到每小时140英里。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The aircraft is designed to maintain a steady speed.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机被设计得可以定速飞行。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She reduced speed as she approached the village.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她快到村子的时候放慢了速度。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Our average speed was 88 mph.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的平均速度是每小时88英里。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The disc revolves at a constant speed.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 光碟以恒定速度旋转。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The car has a top speed of 132 mph.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这车最高时速是132英里。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the speed of a plane in relation to the air around it

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The train was travelling at high speed.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 列车正在高速行驶。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Even at low speed, an accident could mean serious injury for a child.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使是低速行驶,交通事故也可能会使孩子受重伤。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: running, driving etc as fast as possible
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He ran past us at full speed.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他全速从我们身边跑过。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The speed limit is 40 mph here.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里限速每小时40英里。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: New speed restrictions have been introduced.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的速度限制已经推行。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: designed to photograph vehicles going too fast

Sense.DEF: to go quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car sped along the dusty highway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车在尘土飞扬的公路上疾驰。

Sense.DEF: to take someone or something somewhere very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: An ambulance sped her to the hospital.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆救护车把她快速送往医院。

Sense.DEF: to be driving faster than the legal limit
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got caught speeding on the A40 yesterday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天我在 A40 号干线公路上超速行驶被逮到。

Sense.DEF: to make something happen faster
Sense.EXAMPLE: This news should speed his recovery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个消息应该会加快他的康复速度。

Sense.DEF: if time speeds by, it seems to pass very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The weeks sped by and soon it was time to go back to school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个星期转眼过去﹐很快又要开学了。

Sense.DEF: to move or happen faster, or to make something move or happen faster
Sense.EXAMPLE: The truck speeded up going down the hill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡车在下山时加快了速度。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new system will speed up the registration process.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个新系统将加快注册过程。

Sense.DEF: a small boat with a powerful engine, designed to go fast
a narrow raised area put across a road to force traffic to go slowly
a special camera that takes photographs of cars that are travelling faster than the legal speed limit. The photographs are used as proof that drivers have broken the law.
Sense.TRAN: 〔拍摄超速车辆的〕测速照相机

Sense.DEF: an event at which you meet and talk to a lot of different people for only a few minutes at a time. People do this in order to try to meet someone and have a romantic relationship.
Sense.TRAN: 快速约会﹐速配约会〔为寻找恋爱对象的一种约会活动﹐和许多人交谈﹐但每人只交谈几分钟〕

Sense.DEF:
a special feature on a telephone that lets you
dial
someone’s telephone number very quickly by pressing one button
the offence of driving faster than the legal limit
Sense.EXAMPLE: a speeding ticket
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 超速驾驶罚单
Sense.EXAMPLE: She got stopped for speeding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因超速被拦下。

Sense.DEF: the fastest speed allowed by law on a particular piece of road
Sense.TRAN: 〔为特定路段设定的〕最高速度限制﹐速度极限
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 30 mph speed limit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每小时 30 英里的速度限制

Sense.DEF: an instrument in a vehicle that shows how fast it is going
the skill of reading very quickly

the sport of racing on ice wearing
ice skates
a place on a road where police wait to catch drivers who are going too fast
an increase in the speed of something or in the rate at which a process happens

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a speedup in population growth
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人口增长的加速

Sense.DEF:
the sport of racing
motorcycles
or cars on a special track
a special track for the sport of speedway
happening or done quickly or without delay
Sense.EXAMPLE: a speedy recovery from injury
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 受伤后的迅速康复

Sense.DEF: a speedy car, boat etc goes fast

the sport of walking and climbing in
caves

the scientific study of
caves
to form a word by writing or naming the letters in order
Sense.EXAMPLE: How do you spell ‘juice’?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: juice 怎么拼？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pupils should know how to spell commonly used words.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小学生应该知道常用词的拼法。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You’ve spelled my name wrong.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把我的名字拼错了。

Sense.DEF: if letters spell a word, they form it
Sense.EXAMPLE: B-O-O-K spells ‘book’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: B-O-O-K 拼成 book（书）。

Sense.DEF: if a situation or action spells trouble etc, it makes you expect trouble etc
Sense.TRAN: 招致[带来]麻烦/灾难/危险等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lack of rain could spell disaster for farmers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缺少雨水会给农民带来灾难。

Sense.DEF: to do someone else’s work for them for a short period so that they can rest
Sense.TRAN: 暂时代替〔某人工作﹐以便让他休息〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can spell you if you get tired.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你累了﹐我可以替你一会儿。

Sense.DEF: to explain something clearly and in detail
Sense.TRAN: 清楚地说明﹔详细地解释

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The report spelled out in detail what the implications were for teacher training.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份报告详细说明了教师培训的作用。

Sense.DEF: to show how a word is spelled by writing or saying the letters separately in order
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘W-E-I-R,’ she said, spelling it out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “W-E-I-R, ” 她一个字母一个字母地把它拼了出来。

Sense.DEF:
to write a word in its complete form instead of using an
abbreviation
Sense.TRAN: 全部拼出﹐全部写出〔某个单词﹐而不用缩写〕

Sense.DEF: a piece of magic that someone does, or the special words or ceremonies used in doing it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a magic spell
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 魔咒

GramExa.GLOSS: do a piece of magic to change someone

Sense.EXAMPLE: The kiss of the prince broke the spell stopped the magic from working .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 王子的吻解除了魔咒。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The whole town seemed to be under a spell.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个小镇都像中了魔法似的。

Sense.DEF: a period of a particular kind of activity, weather, illness etc, usually a short period
Sense.TRAN: 〔某种活动﹑天气﹑疾病等的〕一段时间〔通常时间较短〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: After a brief spell in the army, I returned to teaching.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在部队里待了一阵子﹐又回来教书了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a spell of bad luck
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一段倒霉的日子

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Water the young plants carefully during dry spells.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 干燥无雨的时候要细心地给幼苗浇水。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a day of sunny spells and scattered showers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 间晴且有零星阵雨的一天
Sense.EXAMPLE: He began to suffer from dizzy spells .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始一阵阵头晕。

Sense.DEF: a power that attracts, interests, and influences you very strongly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I fell under the spell of her charm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我被她的魅力迷倒了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: an ancient city that still casts its spell over travellers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对旅游者依然具有魔力的一座古城

Sense.DEF: to make someone stop paying all their attention to something, or to make a time stop feeling special
Sense.TRAN: （使）停止着魔状态﹐（使）走出入迷状态
Sense.EXAMPLE: He lay still, not wanting to break the spell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他静静地躺着﹐不想结束这魔幻般的美妙时刻。

Sense.DEF: extremely interesting and holding your attention completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spellbinding tale
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 引人入胜的故事

Sense.DEF: extremely interested in something you are listening to
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘King Lear’ still holds audiences spellbound .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《李尔王》依然能让听众着迷。

Sense.DEF: a computer program that tells you when you have spelled a word wrongly
someone who is good or bad at spelling words correctly
Sense.TRAN: 拼写能力好/不好/差等的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: words that confuse even good spellers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 甚至连拼写能力很好的人都弄错的单词

Sense.DEF: the act of spelling words correctly, or the ability to do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her spelling has improved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的拼写进步了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an essay full of spelling mistakes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一篇满是拼写错误的文章

Sense.DEF: the way in which a word is spelled
Sense.EXAMPLE: She quickly gave the correct spelling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很快就正确地拼了出来。

Sense.DEF: a competition in which the winner is the person who spells the most words correctly

a past tense and past participle of
spell1
Sense.TRAN: spell1 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF:
the sport of walking and climbing in
caves
to use your money to pay for goods or services
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t afford to spend any more money this week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这星期我没有能力花更多的钱了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I only want to spend about $20.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只想花 20 美元左右的钱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: More money should be spent on education.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在教育上应该投入更多的钱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mum never spends any money on herself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈从来都不在自己身上花钱。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The repairs cost a lot, but it’s money well spent a sensible way of spending money .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 修理费很高﹐但这是该花的钱。

Sense.DEF: to use time doing a particular thing or pass time in a particular place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I want to spend more time with my family.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想花更多的时间和家人在一起。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ll have to spend the night in a hotel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将不得不在宾馆过夜。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: His childhood was spent in Brazil.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的童年是在巴西度过的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stacey spends all her free time painting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯泰茜把所有的空余时间都用来绘画。

Subsense.DEF: to stay for the night and have sex with someone
Subsense.TRAN: 和某人过夜〔指发生性关系〕

Subsense.DEF: if someone spends the night at someone’s house, they sleep at that person’s house for a night
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She spent the night at a friend’s house.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在一位朋友家里过了一夜。

Sense.DEF: to use effort or energy to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I love to cook, but I don’t feel like spending the energy every evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢烹饪﹐但不愿意每天晚上都花精力去做。

Sense.DEF:
to
urinate
– used when you want to avoid saying this directly

Exponent.DEF: to use money to buy things
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I bought two skirts and a T-shirt and I only spent $50.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我买了两条裙子,一件T恤衫,只花了50美元。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: How much do you spend a week on food?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一个星期购买食物花多少钱？

Exponent.DEF: to spend all of an amount of money over a period of time – used especially when saying that someone spends a lot of money
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I got through all my money in less than a month, and had to get my parents to send me more.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不到一个月就花完了所有的钱,只得叫我父母再寄。

Exponent.DEF: to spend a lot of money in order to do something, because you think it is important or special
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因为某事重要或特别而〕花大钱
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The party was wonderful – they had obviously gone to great expense.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 派对办得非常好——他们肯定花了不少钱。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There’s no need to go to great expense.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有必要花大钱。

Exponent.DEF: to waste money on unnecessary things, instead of saving it or using it carefully
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His son had squandered the family fortune on gambling and women.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他儿子赌博﹑玩女人,把家财挥霍殆尽。

Exponent.DEF: to spend a lot of money on something you really want or will enjoy
Exponent.TRAN: 〔在非常想要或喜欢的东西上〕大手大脚地花钱
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Let’s splash out on a bottle of champagne.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们奢侈一回,来瓶香槟吧。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: People often splash out for Christmas and then regret it later.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们往往在圣诞节的时候不惜花费,事后又追悔莫及。

Exponent.DEF: to spend a lot of money on something, especially on something that you do not really need
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指在非必需的东西上〕乱花〔钱〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her husband blew all their savings on a new sports car.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她丈夫用他们的全部积蓄买了一辆新跑车。

Sense.DEF: someone who spends money
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new casino hopes to attract big spenders people who spend a lot of money .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家新开的赌场希望能够吸引大豪客前来。

Sense.DEF: the amount of money spent, especially by a government or organization
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指政府或组织的〕支出﹐开销﹐花费

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a plan to increase military spending
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 增加军费的计划

Sense.DEF: money that you have available to spend on the things you want rather than need
someone who spends money carelessly, even when they do not have a lot of it

the past tense and past participle of
spend
Sense.TRAN: spend 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF: already used, and now empty or useless
Sense.EXAMPLE: He tried to eject the spent cartridge and reload.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想弹出空弹夹﹐重新装子弹。
Sense.EXAMPLE: spent matches
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用过的火柴

Sense.DEF: if a political idea or organization is a spent force, it no longer has any power or influence
Sense.TRAN: 不再有影响力的思想﹔已经失势的集团
Sense.EXAMPLE: By the 1930s, the party was largely a spent force.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到20世纪30年代﹐该党派基本上成了一股没落的力量。

Sense.DEF: extremely tired
a cell produced by the sex organs of a male person or animal, which is able to join with the female egg to produce a new life
the liquid from the male sex organs that these cells swim in

a medical measurement of the number of sperm a man has, which shows if he is able to make a woman
pregnant
a sperm

a place where
semen
is kept to be used in medical operations that help women become
pregnant

a cream or liquid that kills
sperm
, used while having sex to prevent the woman from becoming
pregnant

a large
whale
sometimes hunted for its oil and fat
to flow out of something quickly in large quantities, or to make something flow out in this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Factory chimneys spewed fumes out into the sky.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工厂的烟囱向空中喷吐浓烟。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Brown water spewed from the tap.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 褐色的水从龙头里喷了出来。

Sense.DEF: to say a lot of bad or negative things very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Groups like these use the Internet to spew racial hatred.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 像这类团体会使用因特网来发泄种族仇恨。

Sense.DEF:
to
vomit
a number that shows you how much protection a special cream gives you from the sun
Sense.EXAMPLE: an SPF 25 cream
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 防晒系数 25 的防晒霜

Sense.DEF:
a type of
moss simple plant
that grows in wet places
a ball shape
a particular area of activity, work, knowledge etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔活动﹑工作﹑知识等的〕范围﹐领域

GramExa.EXAMPLE: television’s increasing role in the political sphere
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视在政治领域中越来越重要的作用

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Women have often been excluded from positions of power in the public sphere.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性常常被排除在公共领域的实权职位之外。

Sense.DEF: a person’s, country’s, organization’s etc sphere of influence is the area where they have power to change things
Sense.TRAN: 某人/某事物的势力范围﹐某人/某事物的影响所及的范围

Sense.DEF: relating to the air or gases surrounding the Earth
Sense.EXAMPLE: the atmosphere
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大气层

Sense.DEF: having the shape of a sphere
a shape that is similar to a ball, but not perfectly round
a muscle that surrounds an opening in your body, and can become tight in order to close the opening
an ancient Egyptian image of a lion with a human head, lying down
Sense.TRAN: 〔古埃及的〕狮身人面像﹐斯芬克斯（像）

Sense.DEF: a very offensive word for a Spanish-speaking person. Do not use this word.
Sense.TRAN: 西班牙佬〔指讲西班牙语的人〕

Sense.DEF: a type of powder or seed, taken from plants, that you put into food you are cooking to give it a special taste
Sense.TRAN: 〔从植物中提取用于烹调的〕香料
Sense.EXAMPLE: herbs and spices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 香草和香料

Sense.DEF: interest or excitement that is added to something
Sense.TRAN: 〔为某事增添的〕趣味﹐情趣﹐风味
Sense.EXAMPLE: Travel adds spice to your life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅行为生活增添情趣。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: variety is the spice of life

Sense.DEF: to add interest or excitement to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Millions have bought the book to spice up their sex lives.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许许多多的人都买了这本书为他们的性生活增添乐趣。

Sense.DEF: to add spice to food

GramExa.EXAMPLE: baked apples spiced with cinnamon
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 加了肉桂的烤苹果

Sense.DEF: a room, house etc that is spick and span is completely clean and tidy
Sense.TRAN: 〔房间﹑房子等〕干干净净的﹐整洁的

Sense.DEF: food that is spicy has a pleasantly strong taste, and gives you a pleasant burning feeling in your mouth
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spicy tomato sauce
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 辣番茄酱

Sense.DEF: a story or picture that is spicy is slightly shocking or rude because it tells about or shows something relating to sex
a small creature with eight legs, which catches insects using a fine network of sticky threads
a computer program that searches the Internet for the best websites with the information you want, so that you can find it quickly
a very fine network of sticky threads made by a spider to catch insects
covered with or made of lots of long thin uneven lines
Sense.EXAMPLE: spidery handwriting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 细长潦草的字迹

Sense.DEF: a quick speech that the speaker has used many times before, especially one that is intended to persuade people to buy something
Sense.TRAN: 〔推销商品用的〕长串的套话﹐油嘴滑舌的游说
Sense.EXAMPLE: A salesman started giving us a spiel about life insurance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名推销员开始夸夸其谈﹐向我们推销人寿保险。

Sense.DEF: very neat, attractive, and fashionable
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spiffy blue suit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一套漂亮又时髦的蓝色套装

Sense.DEF:
a
tap
in a large container that controls the flow of liquid from it

an outdoor
tap

another spelling of
spic
something long and thin with a sharp point, especially a pointed piece of metal
a sudden large increase in the number or rate of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a spike in interest rates
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 利率的大幅上调

Sense.DEF: shoes with metal points on the bottom, worn by people who run races, play golf etc
a pair of women’s shoes with very high thin heels
to secretly add strong alcohol or a drug to someone’s drink or food
Sense.TRAN: 在…里偷偷掺入〔烈酒或药物〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The orange juice had been spiked with gin.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这橙汁里掺了杜松子酒。

Sense.DEF: if the number or rate of something spikes, it increases quickly and by a large amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: New telephone orders have spiked in the last two years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新装电话订单在过去两年里激增。

Sense.DEF: to push a sharp tool or object into something
to prevent someone from saying something or printing something in a newspaper
Sense.TRAN: 阻止…在报纸上发表 〔言论〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a clumsy attempt to spike rumours of a cabinet split
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 企图阻止在报纸上传播内阁分裂谣言的笨拙做法

Subsense.DEF:
to powerfully throw an American football down on the ground to celebrate a
touchdown
Subsense.TRAN: 摔球触地 〔美式橄榄球中﹐触地得分后把球用力摔在地上表示庆贺〕

Subsense.DEF:
to powerfully hit a
volleyball
down over the net

Sense.DEF: to spoil an opponent’s plans
hair that is spiky is stiff and stands up on top of your head
Sense.EXAMPLE: short black spiky hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一根根竖起的黑色短发

Sense.DEF: having long sharp points
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spiky cactus
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带刺的仙人掌

Sense.DEF: easily offended or annoyed
if you spill a liquid, or if it spills, it accidentally flows over the edge of a container
Sense.EXAMPLE: Katie almost spilled her milk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯蒂差点把牛奶洒出来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Oh no! I’ve spilt coffee all down my shirt!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 糟糕﹐我把咖啡洒得满衬衫都是！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He slipped and the wine spilled all over the carpet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脚下一滑﹐酒洒了一地毯。

Sense.DEF: if people or things spill out of somewhere, they move or fall out in large numbers

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Crowds from the theatre were spilling onto the street.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群从戏院里出来﹐涌到街上。

Sense.DEF: to tell something that someone else wanted you to keep a secret
to tell someone all about your private life, or about a personal secret
Sense.TRAN: 把私生活[个人秘密]全部告诉某人

Sense.DEF: to kill or wound people
if light spills onto or into something, it shines through a window, door, hole etc onto something else
Sense.TRAN: 〔光线从窗﹑门﹑洞等处〕洒进﹐照进
Sense.EXAMPLE: The morning light spilled into the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晨光洒进了房间。

Sense.DEF: if a problem or bad situation spills over, it spreads and begins to affect other places, people etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The conflict might spill over into neighbouring towns.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场冲突可能会波及邻近城镇。

Sense.DEF: when you spill something, or an amount of something that is spilled
Sense.EXAMPLE: the enormous oil spill off the southern tip of the Shetland Islands
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 设得兰群岛南端附近海域大量的溢油

Sense.DEF: a fall from a horse, bicycle etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tyson broke a rib when he took a spill on his motorcycle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 泰森从摩托车上摔下来﹐断了一根肋骨。

Sense.DEF:
a
spill2 1
the effect that one situation or problem has on another situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔某一情况或问题所造成的〕影响﹐结果
Sense.EXAMPLE: Not all of the violence in Miami was spillover from the trial.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈阿密的暴力事件并非全是那次审判引起的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The weak European economy will have a spillover effect on the US dollar.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 疲软的欧洲经济会对美元带来影响。

Sense.DEF:
a past tense and past participle of
spill1
Sense.TRAN: spill1 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF:
email messages that someone has not asked for and does not want to read, which have been sent to a computer that has
instant messaging
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机收到的〕垃圾即时短信

Sense.DEF: to turn around and around very quickly, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane’s propellers were spinning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机的螺旋桨在快速旋转。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She grabbed Norm’s arm and spun him around to face her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她抓住诺姆的胳膊将他转过来面对她。

Sense.DEF:
if your head or the room is spinning, you feel as if you might
faint become unconscious
because you are shocked, excited, or drunk
Sense.TRAN: 〔因震惊﹑兴奋或醉酒〕某人头都晕了﹐某人感到天旋地转
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was pouring with sweat, and my head was spinning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我大汗淋漓﹐头晕目眩。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The room started to spin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间开始旋转。

Sense.DEF: to describe a situation or information in a way that is intended to influence the way people think about it – used especially about what politicians or business people do
Sense.TRAN: 有倾向地陈述〔尤用于指政客和商人所做的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Supporters attempted to spin the bill’s defeat to their advantage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 支持者试图用对自己有利的说法来解释议案被否决一事。

Sense.DEF: to tell a story, especially using a lot of imagination
Sense.EXAMPLE: She spun a story about a trip to Athens to meet one of the authors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她编了一个故事﹐说是去雅典见了其中的一位作者。

Sense.DEF: to make cotton, wool etc into thread by twisting it
Sense.TRAN: 将〔棉花﹑羊毛等〕纺成〔线〕﹐纺〔线〕

Sense.DEF: to drive or travel quickly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Barbara spun past in her new sports car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 芭芭拉开着她那辆新跑车飞驰而过。

Sense.DEF: to continue trying to do something without having any success
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt like I was just spinning my wheels trying to make him understand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感觉想要让他明白简直是在白费力气。

Sense.DEF: to get water out of clothes using a machine after you have washed them

if a
spider
or insect spins a
web
or
cocoon
, it produces thread to make it
Sense.TRAN: 〔蜘蛛〕吐丝结网﹔〔昆虫〕吐丝作茧

Sense.DEF: to make part of a company into a separate and partly independent company, or to become a separate company

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At the time of the merger, Loral spun off its space divisions into a separate firm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 合并时﹐洛雷尔公司让它的太空部脱离出去组成一家独立的公司。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lucent spun off from AT&T several years ago.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 几年前朗讯从美国电话电报公司分离出来。

Sense.DEF: to make something continue for longer than is necessary
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m paid by the hour, so I spin the work out as long as I can.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我拿计时工资﹐所以我就尽量把工作拖长。

Sense.DEF: to use money, food etc as carefully and slowly as possible, because you do not have very much of it
Sense.TRAN: 尽可能延长使用〔钱﹑食物等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve only got £10 left, so we’ll have to spin it out over the whole week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只剩 10 英镑﹐所以我们必须省着用﹐过完这一周。

Sense.DEF: if a car spins out, the driver loses control of it and the car spins around
an act of turning around quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Earth’s spin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地球的自转
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Russian skater finished her routine with a series of spins.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这名俄罗斯滑冰运动员以一连串的快速旋转结束了全套动作。

Sense.DEF: a short trip in a car for pleasure
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s go for a spin in the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们开车到乡下去兜兜风吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you want to take my car for a spin ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想开我的车去兜兜风吗？

Sense.DEF:
if you put spin on a ball in a game such as tennis or
cricket
, you deliberately make the ball turn very quickly so that it is difficult for your opponent to hit
the way someone, especially a politician or business person, talks about information or a situation, especially in order to influence the way people think about it
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指政客或商人的〕导向性陈述﹐带倾向性的说法
Sense.EXAMPLE: They tried to put a positive spin on the sales figures.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们试图美化销售数字。

Sense.DEF: if an aircraft goes into a spin, it falls suddenly, turning around and around
if you are in a spin, you are very confused and anxious
Sense.TRAN: 陷入恐慌﹐变得惊慌失措
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sudden fall on the stock market sent brokers into a spin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 股市突然下跌使经纪人惊慌失措。

Sense.DEF: to turn clothes around very fast in a machine to remove water from them
Sense.TRAN: 〔用机器〕给衣服脱水﹐把衣服甩干

Sense.DEF:
a serious condition in which a person’s
spine
does not develop correctly before they are born, so that their
spinal cord
is not protected
a vegetable with large dark green leaves

belonging to or affecting your
spine
Sense.EXAMPLE: spinal injuries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脊柱损伤

Sense.DEF:
your
spine

the thick string of nerves enclosed in your
spine
, by which messages are sent to and from your brain
a part of a machine shaped like a stick, around which something turns
a round pointed stick used for twisting the thread when you are spinning wool
long and thin in a way that looks weak
Sense.TRAN: 细长而不强壮的﹐纤弱的
Sense.EXAMPLE: spindly legs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 细长瘦弱的双腿

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to give information to the public in a way that gives the best possible advantage to a politician or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: White House spin doctors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白宫的舆论导向专家

Sense.DEF: a machine that removes most of the water from washed clothes by spinning them around and around very fast

the row of bones down the centre of your back that supports your body and protects your
spinal cord
a stiff sharp point on an animal or plant
Sense.EXAMPLE: cactus spines
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仙人掌的刺

Sense.DEF: the part of a book that the pages are fastened onto
courage or determination
a spine-chilling story or film is very frightening in a way that people enjoy
Sense.TRAN: 〔故事或电影〕令人毛骨悚然的

Sense.DEF: lacking courage and determination – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 没有骨气的﹐懦弱的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bunch of spineless politicians
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群怯弱的政客

Sense.DEF: without a spine
a musical instrument of the 16th and 17th centuries, which is played like a piano
Sense.TRAN: 斯皮内琴〔16﹑17 世纪类似钢琴的一种键琴〕

Sense.DEF:
a small
upright piano
making you feel very excited or frightened, in an enjoyable way
Sense.TRAN: 激动而惊险的﹐紧张刺激的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The festival opened with Nic Roeg’s latest spine-tingling film.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电影节以尼克•罗伊格最新的惊险刺激影片开幕。

Sense.DEF: a sail with three points at the front of a boat, used when the wind is directly behind
someone whose job is to make thread by twisting cotton, wool etc

a
bowler
in a game of
cricket
who throws the ball with a spinning action
a thing used for catching fish that spins when pulled through the water
a small area of trees and bushes

the activity of doing
aerobics
exercises on an
exercise bicycle
Sense.TRAN: 动感单车运动﹐健身单车运动

Sense.DEF: a simple machine consisting of a wheel on a frame that people used in their homes in the past for making cotton, wool etc into thread
a television programme involving characters that were previously in another programme or film
Sense.TRAN: 〔根据其他节目或电影中人物制作的〕衍生电视节目

Sense.DEF: a separate and partly independent company that is formed from parts of an existing company, or the action of forming a company in this way
an unexpected but useful result of something, that happens in addition to the intended result
Sense.TRAN: 〔意料之外的〕副产品﹐衍生产品﹔附带的结果
Sense.EXAMPLE: Laser research has had important spin-offs for eye surgery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 激光研究衍生出一些适用于眼科手术的重要成果。

Sense.DEF: an unmarried woman, usually one who is no longer young and seems unlikely to marry
Sense.TRAN: 〔看来不大可能会结婚的〕老姑娘﹐老处女

Sense.DEF: a spiny animal or plant has lots of stiff sharp points
Sense.EXAMPLE: spiny sea urchins
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多刺的海胆
Sense.EXAMPLE: spiny bushes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多刺的灌木丛

Sense.DEF: a line in the form of a curve that winds around a central point, moving further away from the centre all the time
a process, usually a harmful one, in which something gradually but continuously gets worse or better
Sense.TRAN: 螺旋式过程〔持续恶化或改善〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Unemployment rose and the city went into a spiral of decline.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业率上升﹐城市持续走下坡路。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company is in a downward spiral.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司越来越不景气。

Sense.DEF:
a situation in which wages and prices rise continuously because the level of
inflation
is high
to move in a continuous curve that gets nearer to or further from its central point as it goes round

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The damaged plane spiralled to the ground.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 受损的飞机盘旋坠地。

Sense.DEF: if a situation spirals, it gets worse, more violent etc in a way that cannot be controlled
Sense.EXAMPLE: Crime has spiraled out of control .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯罪活动激增﹐已经失控。

Sense.DEF: if debt or the cost of something spirals, it increases quickly in a way that cannot be controlled
Sense.TRAN: 〔债务或费用〕急剧而失控地上升

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the spiralling cost of legal services

Sense.DEF:
a spiral-bound book or
notebook
has pages that are attached together by a long wire that is twisted around and put through small holes in the sides of the pages
Sense.TRAN: 〔书或笔记本的纸页〕螺旋装订的

Sense.DEF: a book in which you write notes, made of pieces of paper that are attached to a wire spiral
a set of stairs arranged in a circular pattern so that they go around a central point as they get higher
a roof that rises steeply to a point on top of a tower, especially on a church
the qualities that make someone live the way they do, and make them different from other people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m 85, but I still feel young in spirit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我 85 岁了﹐但心依然感觉年轻。

GramExa.GLOSS: a person with a particular type of character
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She is a strong and independent spirit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是一个坚强独立的人。

Sense.DEF: the way someone feels at a particular time, for example if they are happy or sad

GramExa.GLOSS: be excited and happy
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Seb was still in high spirits after winning the race.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 塞巴依然处于比赛获胜后的高昂情绪中。

Sense.EXAMPLE: His spirits were so low he was so sad that he refused to answer his phone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他情绪非常低落﹐连电话也不愿接。

GramExa.GLOSS: make someone happier
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The warm morning sun lifted our spirits.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 早晨温暖的阳光使我们精神为之一振。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She wrote poetry while she was in the hospital to keep her spirits up keep happy .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她住院的时候写写诗﹐使自己保持愉快心情。

GramExa.GLOSS: they become more or less happy
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 某人高兴起来/情绪低落
GramExa.EXAMPLE: My spirits sank when I saw the mess they’d left.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看见他们留下的烂摊子﹐我的情绪一下子低落了。

Sense.DEF: the part of someone that you cannot see, that consists of the qualities that make up their character, which many people believe continues to live after the person has died
Sense.EXAMPLE: Although Laurie is dead, I can feel his spirit with me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳里虽然已经过世﹐但我还能感觉到他的灵魂和我在一起。

Sense.DEF:
a creature without a physical body that some people believe exists, such as an
angel
or a dead person, who has returned to this world and has strange or magical powers
Sense.EXAMPLE: an evil spirit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恶魔

Sense.DEF: courage, energy, and determination – used to show approval
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sandra is small, but she makes up for it with great spirit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桑德拉身材瘦小﹐但她巨大的勇气弥补了这点不足。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a young team with strong fighting spirit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一支斗志昂扬的年轻队伍
Sense.EXAMPLE: When they took away his freedom, they broke his spirit made him lose his courage .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们剥夺了他的人身自由就等于挫伤了他的锐气。

Sense.DEF: the attitude that you have towards something or while you are doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve got to approach this meeting in the right spirit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一定要以正确的态度来对待这次会议。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the spirit of cooperation between the two sides
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 双方的合作态度

Sense.DEF: a strong feeling of belonging to a particular group and wanting to help them
the set of ideas, beliefs, feelings etc that are typical of a particular period in history, a place, or a group of people
Sense.TRAN: 〔某一特定历史时期﹑地方或群体的〕精神﹐风气

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tourism has not destroyed the spirit of Bali.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 观光旅游还没有破坏巴厘岛的地方特色。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His beliefs conflicted with the spirit of the age.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的信念与当时的时代精神发生了冲突。

Sense.DEF: if you say you will be somewhere in spirit or with someone in spirit, you will not be with them but will be thinking about them
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t come to your wedding, but I’ll be there in spirit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能来参加你们的婚礼﹐但我的心将会和你们在一起。

Sense.DEF: to start to feel as happy, excited etc as the people around you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Judith couldn’t really enter into the spirit of the occasion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱迪思无法完全融入那欢乐气氛中去。

Sense.DEF: the meaning or qualities that someone intended something to have, especially the meaning that a law or rule was intended to have
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指法律或规则的〕精神﹐本质
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thoreau believed that his actions were in the spirit of American institutions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 梭罗相信他的行为是符合美国传统精神的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Miller’s actions may not be actually illegal, but they have violated the spirit of the law .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米勒的行为本身不一定犯法﹐但违反了法律的精神。

Sense.DEF:
the
holy spirit

Subsense.DEF:
a strong alcoholic drink such as
whisky
or
brandy
Subsense.TRAN: 烈酒〔如威士忌或白兰地〕

Subsense.DEF: liquid such as alcohol, used for cleaning

Sense.DEF: used to express approval of someone’s behaviour or attitude
Sense.TRAN: 这就对了﹐这种态度才对〔用于认可某人的行为或态度〕

Sense.DEF: when you feel that you want to do something
Sense.TRAN: 要是愿意的话﹐如果有兴趣

Sense.LEXUNIT: the spirit is willing (but the flesh is weak)
Sense.DEF: used when saying that you want to do something, but you are too tired or do not feel strong enough – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 心里固然愿意（身体却很羸弱）﹐心有余而力不足〔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: to take someone or something away quickly and secretly
Sense.EXAMPLE: After his speech, Jackson was spirited away through a back door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克逊一演讲完就被偷偷地从后门接走了。

Sense.DEF: having energy and determination – used to show approval
Sense.TRAN: 精神饱满的﹐生气勃勃的﹔有决心的〔含褒义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spirited and energetic girl
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个充满朝气﹑精力充沛的女孩

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 有力的辩护/激烈的辩论/热烈的讨论等

Sense.DEF: having a particular type of character
Sense.TRAN: 性格温顺的/坚强的/叛逆的等

Sense.DEF: having no energy or determination
Sense.TRAN: 没精打采的﹐无朝气的﹔没有决心的

Sense.DEF: not cheerful
Sense.TRAN: 情绪低落的﹐垂头丧气的

Sense.DEF: a tool used for testing whether a surface is level
relating to your spirit rather than to your body or mind
Sense.EXAMPLE: Painting helps fill a spiritual need for beauty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绘画可以满足对美的精神需求。
Sense.EXAMPLE: spiritual values
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精神价值

Sense.DEF: relating to religion
Sense.EXAMPLE: Islam was inspired by the teachings of the spiritual leader Mohammed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊斯兰教是受宗教领袖穆罕默德的教义影响产生的。

Sense.DEF: a place where you feel you belong because you share the ideas and attitudes of that society
Sense.TRAN: 某人的精神家园﹐某人的精神归宿〔指一个自己能认同其思想和态度的地方〕

Sense.DEF: a religious song of the type sung originally by African-Americans
Sense.TRAN: 灵歌〔一种原为美国黑人唱的宗教歌曲〕

Sense.DEF: the belief that dead people are able to send messages to living people
Sense.TRAN: 招魂说﹐降灵说〔认为死人可以向活人传递信息〕

Sense.DEF: the quality of being interested in religion or religious matters
Sense.TRAN: 灵性﹐对宗教（事务）的热衷

Sense.DEF:
to force a small amount of
saliva the liquid in your mouth
out of your mouth
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nick rolled down his window and spat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼克摇下窗子﹐啐了口唾沫。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A group of fans spat on the players as they left the field.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群球迷在球员离开球场时朝他们吐口水。

Sense.DEF: to force something out of your mouth
Sense.EXAMPLE: Billy stood up slowly, rubbed his jaw, and spat blood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比利慢慢站起来﹐揉揉下巴﹐吐了口血。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Diana tasted her martini and quickly spat it out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 黛安娜尝了一口马丁尼酒﹐马上就吐了出来。

Sense.DEF: to be raining very lightly
Sense.EXAMPLE: You don’t need an umbrella - it’s only spitting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不用带雨伞﹐只飘着一点小雨。

Sense.DEF: to say something quickly in a very angry way
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Shut up,’ spat Maria furiously.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “闭嘴。”玛丽亚怒叱道。

Sense.DEF: used to ask someone to tell you something that they seem too frightened or embarrassed to say
Sense.TRAN: 爽快地说出来〔用于叫人说其不敢或不愿说的话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on Jean, spit it out!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来吧﹐琼﹐一吐为快！

Sense.DEF: to send out small bits of something, for example fire or hot oil, into the air
Sense.EXAMPLE: A log fire was crackling and spitting in the hearth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圆木在壁炉里烧得噼啪作响﹐火星四溅。

Sense.DEF: if a cat spits, it makes short angry sounds
Sense.TRAN: 〔猫在愤怒时〕发出咕噜咕噜声

Sense.DEF: to be very close to someone or something
to react to something in a very angry way – used when suggesting that the person is behaving like a child and not reacting like an adult should
Sense.TRAN: 耍脾气﹐发脾气〔用于指某人生气时的行为像小孩子﹐而不像成人应该做的那样〕

Sense.DEF: if someone, especially a baby, spits up, they bring a small amount of food or drink up from their stomach out through their mouth

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was a difficult child, always crying and spitting up my food.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我小时候很难哄﹐老是哭闹﹑呕吐。

Sense.EXAMPLE: On one occasion, our daughter spat up all over him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一次﹐我们的女儿吐了他一身。

Sense.DEF: the watery liquid that is produced in your mouth
a long thin stick that you put through meat so that you can turn it when cooking it over a fire
a long narrow piece of land that sticks out into the sea, into a river etc
Sense.TRAN: 岬﹐沙嘴〔伸入水域中的狭长陆地〕

Sense.DEF: to look exactly like someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sam is the dead spit of his dad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆长得和他爸爸一模一样。

Sense.DEF: when something is thoroughly cleaned and polished
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was Christmas, so Ellen gave the dining room a little extra spit and polish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣诞节到了﹐埃伦把饭厅格外仔细地打扫了一遍。

Sense.DEF: a small piece of paper that children roll into a ball and then spit or throw at each other
Sense.TRAN: 〔儿童互相投掷的〕唾沫湿纸团

Sense.DEF: without being affected or prevented by something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We went out in spite of the rain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管下着雨﹐我们还是出去了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kelly loved her husband in spite of the fact that he drank too much.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然丈夫酗酒﹐凯莉仍然爱着他。

Sense.DEF:
a feeling of wanting to hurt or upset people, for example because you are
jealous
or think you have been unfairly treated

GramExa.GLOSS: because of spite
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She broke it just out of spite.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她就是出于恶意把它打破的。

GramExa.GLOSS: spite and nothing else

Sense.DEF: if you do something in spite of yourself, you do it although you did not expect or intend to do it
Sense.TRAN: 不由自主地﹐身不由己地
Sense.EXAMPLE: The picture made her laugh in spite of herself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幅画让她忍俊不禁。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately annoy or upset someone
Sense.TRAN: 故意与〔某人〕作对﹐恶意对待
Sense.EXAMPLE: The neighbours throw things over the garden wall just to spite us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 邻居把东西扔过花园围墙﹐故意和我们作对。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: cut off your nose to spite your face

Sense.DEF: deliberately nasty to someone in order to hurt or upset them
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was spiteful and unkind, both to Isabel and to her son.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她又恶毒又刻薄﹐对伊莎贝尔这样﹐对她的儿子也这样。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spiteful remark
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刻薄话

Sense.LEXUNIT: be the spitting image of sb
Sense.DEF: to look exactly like someone else
the liquid in your mouth

a container that people
spit
into
a man who gets money from small dishonest business deals
if a liquid splashes, it hits or falls on something and makes a noise
Sense.TRAN: 〔液体〕哗啦作响地溅泼﹐飞溅﹐溅落

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ocean splashed against the pier.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 海水哗啦哗啦地拍打着码头。

Sense.DEF: to make someone or something wet with a lot of small drops of water or other liquid

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He splashed cold water on his face.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他往自己脸上泼冷水。

Sense.DEF: to make water fly up in the air with a loud noise by hitting it or by moving around in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children were splashing about in the pool.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们在水池里戏水。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She ran up the drive, splashing through the puddles.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她冲上车道﹐踩得水洼里的水飞溅。

Sense.DEF: if a newspaper or television programme splashes a story or picture on the page or screen, it makes it large and easy to notice
Sense.TRAN: 以显著版面刊载﹐以大篇幅报道

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The gunman’s picture was splashed across the front page.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 持枪歹徒的照片大幅刊登在头 版上。

Sense.DEF: to spend a lot of money on something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We splashed out on a new kitchen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们花了一大笔钱装修新厨房。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Last year Roberts splashed out more than £1 million to buy a new home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年﹐罗伯茨花了一百多万英镑买了栋新房子。

Sense.DEF: the sound of a liquid hitting something or being moved around quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rachel fell into the river with a loud splash.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷切尔扑通一声掉进河里。

Sense.DEF: a mark made by a liquid splashing onto something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There were splashes of paint all over my clothes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我衣服上溅满了油漆斑点。

Sense.DEF: a small area of bright colour
to do something that gets a lot of public attention
Sense.EXAMPLE: Russell’s new show made a big splash in New York.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉塞尔的新节目在纽约引起很大的轰动。

Sense.DEF: a small amount of liquid added to a drink

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a cup of coffee with a splash of brandy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一杯加了少许白兰地的咖啡

Sense.DEF:
the area of a bathroom or kitchen wall that is behind the
taps
and covered in
tiles
Sense.TRAN: 〔浴室或厨房水龙头后面贴有瓷砖的〕防溅挡板

Sense.DEF: a landing by a spacecraft in the sea
a flat piece of rubber hanging behind the wheel of a vehicle to prevent mud being thrown up
big, bright, or very easy to notice
Sense.TRAN: 鲜艳显眼的﹔惹人注意的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a splashy orange shirt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件惹人注目的橘黄色衬衫

Sense.DEF: a noise like something wet hitting a surface hard
Sense.TRAN: 〔湿物击打表面时发出的〕啪嗒声

Sense.DEF: to make a noise like something wet hitting a surface, or to make something make this noise
Sense.EXAMPLE: Big raindrops splatted against the windscreen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大滴大滴的雨点啪嗒啪嗒地打在挡风玻璃上。

Sense.DEF: if liquid splatters somewhere, or if someone splatters it, it falls or is thrown onto a surface

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The room was splattered with blood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房间里血迹斑斑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Paint splattered all over the carpet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 油漆溅得地毯上到处都是。

Sense.DEF: to spread apart widely, or to make things do this, especially parts of the body
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sat with his legs splayed out in front of him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他叉开两腿坐着。

Sense.DEF: an organ near your stomach that controls the quality of your blood
anger, especially unreasonable or unfair anger
Sense.EXAMPLE: Obviously you’re annoyed, but that doesn’t give you the right to vent your spleen on me get angry with me .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很显然你心里不痛快﹐但你也不该把怒气发泄在我身上呀。

Sense.DEF: very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: a splendid idea
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很妙的主意
Sense.EXAMPLE: a splendid opportunity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绝佳的机会
Sense.EXAMPLE: The staff are doing a splendid job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工们干得非常棒。

Sense.DEF: beautiful and impressive
Sense.TRAN: 壮丽的﹐华丽的﹐辉煌的﹐灿烂的
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the rooms have splendid views.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的房间都能看到漂亮的景致。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a splendid cathedral
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宏伟的大教堂

Sense.DEF: used to show that you approve of or are pleased by something
Sense.TRAN: 好极了〔用于表示赞成某事或对其感到高兴〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’ll see you tomorrow then.’ ‘Splendid!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那么我明天和你见面。”“好极了！”

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is not with other things
Sense.TRAN: 岿然独立﹐傲然独立〔用于强调〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house sits in splendid isolation on top of a steep hill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这栋房子岿然独立于一座陡山的顶部。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a splendidly equipped new sports centre
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 设备极佳的新体育中心

Sense.DEF: impressive beauty, especially of a large building or large place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We marvelled at the splendour of the scenery.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对这壮丽的景色赞叹不已。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The palace has now been restored to its original splendour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宫殿如今已恢复了它昔日的辉煌。

Sense.DEF: impressive beautiful features, especially of a large building or place
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指大建筑物或地方的〕壮丽景色﹐恢宏气势

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the splendours of the imperial court
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座皇宫的恢宏气势

Sense.DEF: bad-tempered and often angry
to join the ends of two pieces of rope, film etc so that they form one continuous piece
Sense.TRAN: 连接﹐捻接﹐接合〔两条绳子﹑胶片等的两端〕

Sense.DEF: to get married
the act of joining the ends of two things together, or the place where this join has been made
Sense.TRAN: 连接﹐接合﹔连接处﹐接合点

Sense.DEF: a machine for joining pieces of film or recording tape neatly together
Sense.TRAN: 〔胶片或磁带的〕接合机﹐接片机

Sense.DEF:
a cigarette containing
cannabis
a flat piece of wood, metal etc used for keeping a broken bone in position while it mends
a small sharp piece of wood, glass, or metal, that has broken off a larger piece
Sense.TRAN: 〔木头﹑玻璃或金属的〕碎片﹐尖片
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got a splinter in my finger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的手指扎了一根刺。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: splinters of glass
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玻璃碎片

Sense.DEF: if something such as wood splinters, or if you splinter it, it breaks into thin sharp pieces
to separate into smaller groups or parts, or to make a group or organization do this, especially because of a disagreement
Sense.TRAN: （使）〔组织或团体〕分裂〔尤因意见不合〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The once-powerful party has splintered into hundreds of pieces.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个曾经势力强大的党派现在已经四分 五裂。

Sense.DEF: a group of people that have separated from a political or religious organization because they have different ideas
Sense.TRAN: 〔因意见分歧而从政治或宗教团体中分裂出来的〕小团体﹐小派别

Sense.DEF: if a group of people splits, or if it is split, people in the group disagree strongly with each other and the group sometimes divides into separate smaller groups
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was feared that the issue would split the church.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们担心这一问题会导致教会分裂。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The party is split over the issue of immigration.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该党在移民问题上意见有分歧。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government appears deeply split on this issue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府内部在这个问题上似乎有严重的分歧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Pan-Africanist Congress split from the ANC in 1959.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 泛非主义者大会在 1959 年脱离了非洲人国民大会。

GramExa.PROPFORM: split sth in two/down the middle
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The war has split the nation in two.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争使这个国家一分为二。

Sense.DEF: to divide or separate something into different parts or groups, or to be divided into different parts or groups
Sense.TRAN: 分割﹐把…分开〔成几部分〕﹔分成〔不同部分〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you split into groups of three now?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在你们分成三人一组好吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The book is split into six sections.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 本书共分六个部分。

Sense.DEF: if something splits, or if you split it, it tears or breaks along a straight line
Sense.EXAMPLE: The branch split under their weight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 树枝承受不住他们的重量断裂了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: One of the boxes had split open .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中一个盒子裂开了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The board had split in two.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 木板裂成了两块。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Split the pineapple down the middle .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把菠萝从中间切开。

Sense.DEF: to divide something into separate parts and share it between two or more people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Profits will be split between three major charities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 盈利将在三大慈善机构中间分配。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He agreed to sell the car and split the proceeds with his brother.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他同意把车卖掉﹐所得的钱和弟弟分。

GramExa.GLOSS: share something between three, four etc people or groups
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 将某物分成三份/四份等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The money will have to be split three ways.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔钱必须分成三份。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We agreed to split the cost .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们同意分摊这笔费用。

Sense.DEF: to make someone’s head or lip have a cut in it, as a result of a fall or hit
Sense.TRAN: 碰破〔头或嘴唇〕﹐把…碰得裂开
Sense.EXAMPLE: She fell against a table and split her lip .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她摔倒时撞到桌子﹐磕破了嘴唇。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The force of the blow nearly split his head open .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一击打得他脑袋都快裂开了。

Sense.DEF: if people split, they end a marriage or relationship with each other

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He split from his wife last year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年他和妻子离了婚。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The band split two years ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这支乐队两年前解散了。

Sense.DEF: to leave a place quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on – let’s split.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快﹐我们快走。

Sense.DEF: to argue that there is a difference between two things, when the difference is really too small to be important
Sense.TRAN: 纠缠于细枝末节﹐在琐细的问题上争辩
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is just splitting hairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这就太斤斤计较了。

Sense.DEF: to agree on an amount that is exactly between two amounts that have been mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 〔在数额上〕互相让步﹐折中﹐妥协
Sense.EXAMPLE: OK, let’s split the difference, and I’ll give you £20.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 行﹐我们各让一步﹐我给你 20 英镑。

Sense.DEF: to laugh a great deal
if one part of something splits off from the rest, it becomes completely separate from it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A huge lump of rock had split off from the cliff face.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大块岩石从崖面上脱落下来。

Sense.DEF: if a small group of people split off from a larger group, they become separate from it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The group split away from the Green Party and formed the Environmental Alliance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这批人脱离绿党﹐组成了环境联盟。

Sense.DEF: to separate one part of something and make it completely separate from the rest
Sense.TRAN: 使某物脱离出去﹐使某物分离出去

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This part of the business has now been split off from the main company.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部分业务现在已经从总公司独立出去了。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone in authority about something wrong that someone else has done
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t you dare split on us!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谅你不敢告发我们！

Sense.DEF: if people split up, or if someone splits them up, they end a marriage or relationship with each other
Sense.TRAN: 离婚﹔分手﹐断绝关系﹔拆散
Sense.EXAMPLE: Steve’s parents split up when he was four.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂夫四岁时父母离异。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I thought she’d split up with her boyfriend.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以为她已经和男朋友分手了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Why would she try to split us up?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她为什么要拆散我们？

Sense.DEF: to divide people into different groups, or to be divided into groups
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please don’t split up when we get to the museum.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到博物馆后请大家不要散开。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The teacher split up the class into three groups.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师把全班同学分成三组。

Sense.DEF: to divide something into different parts

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The house has now been split up into individual flats.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这栋房子现在被分隔成若干独立的套间。

Sense.DEF: a tear or crack in something made of cloth, wood etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a long split in the sleeve of his coat
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他外套袖子上一条长长的裂缝

Sense.DEF: a serious disagreement that divides an organization or group of people into smaller groups

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The argument could lead to a damaging split in the party.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场争吵可能会导致党内出现分裂﹐对该党产生不利影响。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a deep split within the government
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府内部很深的分歧

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a split between the radicals and the moderates within the group
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 团体内部激进派和温和派之间的分歧

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The union is desperate to avoid a split over this issue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会竭力避免在这一问题上发生分歧。

Sense.DEF: the end of a marriage or relationship - used especially in newspapers and magazines
Sense.TRAN: 离婚﹐分手〔尤用于报纸或杂志〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: rumours of a marriage split
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚姻破裂的传言

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She seems to be getting over her recent split with her fiancé.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不久前和未婚夫分手﹐现在似乎正在慢慢走出阴影。

Sense.DEF: the way in which something, especially money, is shared between several people
Sense.EXAMPLE: In a publishing deal, the average split used to be 50:50 between writer and publisher.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出版协议中﹐作者和出版商之间一般都是五五分成。

GramExa.GLOSS: when something is shared equally between three, four etc people
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a three-way split in the profits
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 利润三人均分

Sense.DEF: a clear separation or difference between two things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the traditional split between the state and church
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 传统上的政教分离

Sense.DEF: to spread your legs wide apart so that your legs touch the floor along their whole length
a condition of someone’s hair in which the ends have split into several parts
a phrase in which you put an adverb or other word between ‘to’ and a verb, as in ‘to easily win’. Some people think this is incorrect English.
Sense.TRAN: 分裂不定式〔指 to 和动词之间插入副词或其他单词的结构﹐有些人认为这是不正确的英语〕

Sense.DEF: a split-level house, room, or building has floors at different heights in different parts
Sense.TRAN: 〔房子﹑房间或建筑物〕错层式的

Sense.DEF: a condition in which someone has two very different ways of behaving
a method of showing different scenes or pieces of information at the same time on a film, television, or computer screen
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影﹑电视或计算机显示屏的〕分画面﹐分屏
Sense.EXAMPLE: a split-screen movie
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 分画面电影

Sense.DEF: an extremely short period of time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: For a split second the two men hesitated.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那两个人犹豫了片刻。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In that split second Graham knew he had won.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 就在那一瞬间﹐格雷厄姆知道自己赢了。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: It was a technique which required split-second timing.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是一种时间上要把握得分秒不差的技巧。

Sense.DEF: a period of work that is divided into two or more parts on the same day
Sense.TRAN: 间隔班〔一天的上班时间分成两段或几段的轮班〕

Sense.DEF:
a vote in US elections in which the voter has voted for some
candidates
of one party and some of the other party
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国选举中的〕分裂票〔一个选民同时投两党候选人的选票〕

Sense.DEF:
a very bad
headache
a large mark of mud, paint etc with an irregular shape
Sense.TRAN: 〔污泥﹑油漆等大面积的〕斑块﹐污渍

GramExa.EXAMPLE: splodges of colour
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 色块

Sense.DEF: to make a noise by falling into or moving through water
Sense.TRAN: 哗啦哗啦地溅水﹔〔在水里〕啪嗒啪嗒地移动
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sploshing sound
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 扑通一声

Sense.DEF:
a
splodge
to spend more money than you can usually afford

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Within a couple of months, I’d splurged about £2,500 on clothes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 就在几个月时间里﹐我买衣服花掉了 2,500 英镑。

Sense.DEF: to talk quickly in short confused phrases, especially because you are angry or surprised
Sense.TRAN: 气急败坏地说﹐急促而慌乱地说〔尤因生气或吃惊〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘But … but … I can’t believe … how could you?’ she spluttered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “可……可是……我不能相信……你怎么可以？”她语无伦次地说。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Katie was spluttering with rage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯蒂气得说话结结巴巴。

Sense.DEF: to make a series of short sharp noises
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bill started coughing and spluttering .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比尔开始又咳又喘。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The engine spluttered into life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 引擎突突地发动起来。

Sense.DEF: to have a bad effect on something so that it is no longer attractive, enjoyable, useful etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole park is spoiled by litter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个公园环境都给垃圾破坏了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We didn’t let the incident spoil our day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们没有让这件事破坏我们一整天的气氛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to spoil your fun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想扫你的兴。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why do you always have to spoil everything ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么老是要把一切都弄糟呢？

Sense.DEF: to give a child everything they want, or let them do whatever they want, often with the result that they behave badly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s an only child, but they didn’t really spoil her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是独生女﹐不过他们也没有娇惯她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His mother and sisters spoil him rotten spoil him very much .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他母亲和姐姐把他给宠坏了。

Sense.DEF: to look after someone in a way that is very kind or too kind
Sense.TRAN: 无微不至地关心﹔过分地照顾﹐纵容
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll have to let me spoil you on your birthday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你生日那天一定要让我好好待你。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Go on, spoil yourself. Have another piece of cake.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 来吧﹐善待自己﹐再来一块蛋糕吧。

Sense.DEF: to start to decay
Sense.EXAMPLE: Food will spoil if the temperature in your freezer rises above 8˚C.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果冰柜的温度上升到 8 摄氏度以上﹐食物就会变质。

Sense.DEF:
to mark a
ballot paper
wrongly so that your vote is not included
to be very eager to fight or argue with someone

Exponent.DEF: to have a bad effect on something so that it is much less attractive, enjoyable etc
Exponent.TRAN: 毁掉,糟蹋,破坏〔某事物的美或趣味等〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: New housing developments are spoiling the countryside.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 新住宅区破坏了乡村的景色。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The bad weather completely spoiled our holiday.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 恶劣的天气彻底毁了我们的假期。

Exponent.DEF: to spoil something completely and permanently
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Using harsh soap to wash your face can ruin your skin.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 用刺激性强的肥皂洗脸可能会损伤皮肤。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The argument ruined the evening for me.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那场争吵把我的那个晚上给毁了。

Exponent.DEF: to spoil something by making it less attractive or enjoyable
Exponent.TRAN: 破坏〔某事物的美或趣味〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His handsome Arab features were marred by a long scar across his face.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脸上有一道长长的疤痕,破坏了他那张俊美的阿拉伯人的面庞。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Outbreaks of fighting marred the New Year celebrations.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 战斗爆发破坏了新年的喜庆活动。

Exponent.DEF: to slightly spoil something that is generally very good, beautiful, or impressive
Exponent.TRAN: 减弱〔某事物的优点﹑美感等〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The huge number of tourists rather detracts from the city’s appeal.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量的游客一定程度上有损这个城市的魅力。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There were a few minor irritations, but this did not detract from our enjoyment of the holiday.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有过几次小小的不愉快,但是这并没有影响我们度假的兴致。

Exponent.DEF: to spoil something that you have been trying to achieve
Exponent.TRAN: 破坏,危害〔一直试图做成的事〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The bombings undermined several months of careful negotiations.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 轰炸破坏了谨慎进行了数月的谈判。

Exponent.DEF: to spoil a friendly relationship between people or countries
Exponent.TRAN: 使〔友好关系〕变得紧张,使变得不愉快
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The affair has soured relations between the UK and Russia.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一事件使英俄关系变得紧张起来。

Exponent.DEF: to spoil a close relationship completely, so that people can no longer trust each other
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Their marriage was poisoned by a terrible dark secret.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的婚姻被一个丑恶的秘密破坏了。

Exponent.DEF: to spoil something important or something that has been carefully planned
Exponent.TRAN: 打乱,毁掉〔重要的事情或精心的计划〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If there’s any delay, it will mess up our whole schedule.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 若有任何耽搁便会打乱我们整个计划。

Subsense.DEF: the things that someone gets by being successful
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They tried to take more than a fair share of the spoils.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们想拿更多的好处。

Subsense.DEF: things taken by an army from a defeated enemy, or things taken by thieves

Sense.DEF: waste material such as earth and stones from a mine or hole in the ground
Sense.TRAN: 〔矿井里或地下挖出的〕废石方﹐弃土
Sense.EXAMPLE: spoil heaps
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 废石方堆

Sense.DEF: waste resulting from something being spoiled
a spoiled person, especially a child, is rude and behaves badly because they have always been given what they want and allowed to do what they want
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ben was a spoilt brat a spoiled and unpleasant child .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本是个被宠坏的小恶魔。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their children were spoiled rotten very spoiled .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的孩子完全被宠坏了。

Sense.DEF: to have so many good things to choose from that you cannot decide which one to choose
a raised part on a racing car that prevents the car from lifting off the road at high speeds
part of an aircraft wing that can be lifted up to slow the plane down
someone or something that prevents another person or thing from being successful
a person or team that spoils another’s winning record
Sense.TRAN: 妨碍他人取胜者〔指个人或团队〕

Sense.DEF: a message or report that is intended to ruin the surprising part of a popular film, book etc by telling people about the surprise before they see or read it
someone who spoils other people’s fun
Sense.TRAN: 扫兴者﹐破坏别人兴致的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be such a spoilsport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别这么让人扫兴。

Sense.DEF:
a British form of the word
spoiled

a past tense and past participle of
spoil1
Sense.TRAN: spoil1 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
speak
one of the thin metal bars which connect the outer ring of a wheel to the centre, especially on a bicycle

Sense.LEXUNIT: put a spoke in sb’s wheel
Sense.DEF: to prevent someone from doing something they have planned

the past participle of
speak
the form of language that you speak rather than write
spoken language rather than written language or music
Sense.TRAN: 〔相对于书面语言或音乐而言的〕口头话语
Sense.EXAMPLE: pupils’ understanding of the spoken word
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小学生对口头话语的理解
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spoken-word CD
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 讲读版光碟

Sense.DEF: speaking in a quiet way
Sense.EXAMPLE: a softly-spoken young man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个说话温柔的年轻人

Subsense.DEF: if someone is spoken for, they are married or already have a serious relationship with someone
if something is spoken for, you cannot buy it because it is being kept for someone else

Sense.DEF: a man who has been chosen to speak officially for a group, organization, or government
Sense.TRAN: 〔团体﹑组织﹑政府的〕发言人﹔代言人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a White House spokesman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白宫发言人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a spokesman for the victims’ families
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 受害者家属发言人

Sense.DEF: a spokesman or spokeswoman
a woman who has been chosen to speak officially for a group, organization, or government
a piece of a soft natural or artificial substance full of small holes, which can suck up liquid and is used for washing
a simple sea creature from which natural sponge is produced
an act of washing something with a sponge
a light cake made from flour, sugar, butter, and eggs
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Victoria sponge
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 维多利亚海绵蛋糕

Sense.DEF:
a
sponger
to wash something with a wet cloth or sponge
Sense.EXAMPLE: Clean the rug by sponging it gently.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用湿布轻轻擦洗以清洁小地毯。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She stood on the bath mat and sponged herself down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她站在浴室踏脚垫上﹐用海绵擦身子。

Sense.DEF: to get money, free meals etc from other people, without doing anything for them – used to show disapproval

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These people are just sponging off the taxpayers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些人就是在白吃纳税人的钱粮。

Sense.DEF: to remove liquid or a mark with a wet cloth or sponge
Sense.TRAN: 用湿布[海绵]吸掉〔液体〕﹐用湿布[海绵]揩掉〔斑点〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll go and sponge this juice off my dress.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要去把我连衣裙上的果汁揩掉。

Sense.DEF: to put paint on a surface using a sponge

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Just sponge the paint on, like this.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用海绵把油漆涂上去﹐就像这样。

Sense.DEF: a small bag for carrying the things that you need to wash with
a light cake made from flour, sugar, butter, and eggs
a British food made from flour, sugar, eggs, and butter, that is eaten hot
someone who gets money, free meals etc from other people and does nothing for them – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 吃白食的人﹐揩油者 〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF:
soft and full of holes that contain air or liquid like a
sponge11
Sense.EXAMPLE: The earth was soft and spongy underfoot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脚下的泥土像海绵一样松软。

Subsense.DEF: a person or company that pays for a show, broadcast, sports event etc, especially in exchange for the right to advertise at that event
Subsense.TRAN: 〔表演﹑广播节目﹑体育赛事等的〕赞助者﹐赞助商

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Eastman Kodak is a major sponsor of the Olympics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊士曼柯达公司是奥运会的主要赞助商。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: corporate sponsors
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 企业赞助商

Subsense.DEF: a person or company that supports someone by paying for their training, education, living costs etc
Subsense.TRAN: 〔为某人支付培训费﹑教育费﹑生活费等的〕资助者

Sense.DEF:
someone who agrees to give someone else money for a
charity
if they walk, run etc a particular distance
Sense.TRAN: 〔慈善募捐活动的〕捐资者﹐捐款人

Sense.DEF: someone who officially introduces or supports a proposal for a new law
Sense.TRAN: 〔新法案的〕提案人﹐发起人﹐倡议者

Sense.DEF: someone who officially agrees to help someone else, or to be responsible for what they do
Sense.EXAMPLE: You cannot get a work visa without an American sponsor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果没有美国担保人就拿不到工作签证。

Sense.DEF:
a
godparent

Subsense.DEF: to give money to a sports event, theatre, institution etc, especially in exchange for the right to advertise
Subsense.TRAN: 赞助﹐资助〔体育赛事﹑演出﹑团体等〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The competition was sponsored by British Airways.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此项比赛由英国航空公司赞助。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: government-sponsored projects
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府资助的项目

Subsense.DEF: to support someone by paying for their training, education, living costs etc
Subsense.TRAN: 资助〔某人接受培训﹑教育等〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The bank had offered to sponsor him at university.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家银行表示愿意资助他上大学。

Sense.DEF: to officially support a proposal for a new law
to agree to help someone or be responsible for what they do

to agree to give someone money for
charity
if they walk, run etc a particular distance
Sense.TRAN: 为〔某人的慈善募捐活动〕捐款

Sense.DEF:
an event in which many people walk, swim etc a particular distance so that people will give them money for a
charity
Sense.TRAN: 慈善筹款徒步/游泳等活动

Sense.DEF: supported and encouraged by the UN, the US etc
Sense.TRAN: 由联合国促成的/美国安排的/政府支持的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: US-sponsored peace talks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国促成的和平谈判

Sense.DEF: financial support for an activity or event

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The expedition is looking for sponsorship from one of the major banks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 探险队正在向一家大银行寻求赞助。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a $5 million sponsorship deal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五百万美元的资助协议
Sense.EXAMPLE: commercial sponsorships
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 商业赞助

Sense.DEF: the act of sponsoring someone or something, or of being sponsored

GramExa.EXAMPLE: private sector sponsorship of sport
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 私营部门的体育赞助

Sense.DEF: something that is spontaneous has not been planned or organized, but happens by itself, or because you suddenly feel you want to do it
Sense.TRAN: 自发的﹐自然而生的﹔一时冲动的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The crowd gave a spontaneous cheer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群自发地欢呼起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My spontaneous reaction was to run away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的本能反应就是逃跑。

Sense.DEF: someone who is spontaneous does things without planning them first – used to show approval
Sense.TRAN: 天真率直的﹐率性的〔含褒义〕

Sense.DEF: burning caused by chemical changes inside something rather than by heat from outside
a funny book, play, or film that copies something serious or important and makes it seem silly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The play is a spoof on Shakespeare’s tragedy ‘Julius Caesar’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这出戏是对莎士比亚悲剧《尤利乌斯•恺撒》的滑稽模仿。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a spoof documentary
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 模仿纪实片的滑稽作品

Sense.DEF:
a
ghost

a
spy
to frighten someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not easily spooked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不是容易受惊吓的人。

Sense.DEF:
strange or frightening in a way that makes you think of
ghosts
Sense.TRAN: 阴森恐怖的﹐使人毛骨悚然的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spooky old house
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阴森恐怖的老房子
Sense.EXAMPLE: spooky stories
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怖故事
Sense.EXAMPLE: The candlelight created a rather spooky atmosphere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烛光营造出一种阴森森的气氛。

Sense.DEF: an object shaped like a wheel that you wind thread, wire etc around
an object that you use for eating, cooking, or serving food. It has a small bowl-shaped part and a long handle.

a
spoonful

GramExa.EXAMPLE: two spoons of sugar
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两匙糖

Crossrefto.REFLEX: be born with a silver spoon in your mouth

Sense.DEF: to move food with a spoon

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Spoon the mixture carefully into the bowls.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用匙小心地把混合料舀进碗里。

Sense.DEF: a phrase in which the speaker accidentally exchanges the first sounds of two words, with a funny result, for example ‘sew you to a sheet’ instead of ‘show you to a seat’
Sense.TRAN: 〔两个词的〕首音误置〔说话时误把两个单词的首音调换﹐造成滑稽效果﹐ 如把 show you to a seat 说成 sew you to a sheet〕

Sense.DEF: to give too much information and help to someone – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 填鸭式地给…灌输〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t believe in spoon-feeding students.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不赞成对学生进行填鸭式灌输。

Sense.DEF: to feed someone, especially a baby, with a spoon
the amount that a spoon will hold

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Two spoonfuls of sugar, please.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 请放两匙糖。

Sense.DEF: the track of footmarks or solid waste that a wild animal leaves as it moves along
Sense.TRAN: 〔野生动物留下的〕脚印﹐足迹﹔臭迹

Sense.DEF: happening fairly often, but not regularly
Sense.EXAMPLE: There has been sporadic violence downtown.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市中心时有暴力事件发生。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The fighting continued sporadically for several days.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 战斗零零星星地持续了好几天。

Sense.DEF:
a cell like a seed that is produced by some plants such as
mushrooms
and can develop into a new plant

a special bag made of leather or fur, that a Scotsman wears in front of a
kilt
Sense.TRAN: 〔苏格兰男子佩戴于短裙前面的〕毛皮袋

Subsense.DEF: a physical activity in which people compete against each other
Subsense.EXAMPLE: My favourite sports are tennis and swimming.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最喜欢的运动是网球和游泳。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a sports team
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 运动队
Subsense.EXAMPLE: All students are encouraged to take part in a sport.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鼓励所有的学生都要参加一项体育运动。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He picked up the newspaper and turned to the sports pages.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拿起报纸﹐翻到体育版。

Subsense.DEF: sports in general
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Why is there so much sport on TV?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么电视上的体育节目这么多？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I always hated sport at school.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上学时我一直讨厌体育运动。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: The uncountable use of sport is British English only.
F2NBox.TRAN: sport 仅在英国英语中作不可数名词用
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I’m not interested in sport.
F2NBox.EXPL: In American English, the plural sports is used.
F2NBox.TRAN: 美国英语中用复数 sports
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He likes watching sports on TV.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喜欢看电视里的体育节目。

Sense.DEF: an activity that people do in the countryside, especially hunting or fishing
Sense.TRAN: 野外运动〔尤指打猎或钓鱼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sport of falconry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 放鹰狩猎运动
Sense.EXAMPLE: a demonstration by people opposed to blood sports sports that involve killing animals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对猎杀动物运动的人士举行的示威游行

Sense.DEF: a helpful cheerful person who lets you enjoy yourself
Sense.TRAN: 乐于助人者﹐开朗大度的人

GramExa.GLOSS: used when asking someone to help you
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 大方一点〔用于向人求助时〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Be a sport and lend me your bike.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 行行好﹐把自行车借我用一下。

Sense.DEF: someone who does not get angry when they lose at a game or sport
Sense.TRAN: 输得起的人﹐输了不生气的人

Sense.DEF: someone who gets angry very easily when they lose at a game or sport
Sense.TRAN: 输不起的人﹐输后不服气的人

Subsense.DEF: used when speaking to someone, especially a man, in a friendly way
Subsense.TRAN: 老兄﹐朋友〔用作友好的称呼﹐尤用于男子〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: See you later, sport.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回头见﹐老兄。

Subsense.DEF: used when speaking to a boy in a friendly way
Subsense.TRAN: 小伙子﹐小朋友〔用作对男孩的友好称呼〕

Sense.DEF: fun or amusement
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did she torment him merely for sport?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她捉弄他就是为了好玩？

Sense.DEF: to joke about someone in a way that makes them seem stupid
Sense.TRAN: 开某人的玩笑﹐嘲笑某人

Collocate.EXAMPLE: My ambition was to play sport at the highest level.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的志向就是成为最高水平的运动员。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Students are encouraged to take part in a sport of some kind.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 鼓励学生参加某一类体育运动。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I did a lot of sport at school.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我上学的时候经常运动。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I took up the sport six years ago.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我六年前开始玩这项运动。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I liked playing team sports such as football and rugby.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢玩足球﹑橄榄球之类的团队运动项目。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: You have to be mentally tough to compete in individual sports.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你必须意志坚强才能参加个人体育项目的竞争。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Football is the most popular spectator sport.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 足球是人们最爱看的运动。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: in which people compete and try to win
one in which players have physical contact with each other
which people are paid to do

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A lot of schools have their own sports teams.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多学校有自己的运动队。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She joined her local sports club.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她加入了当地的体育俱乐部。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: someone who is famous for playing sport

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘make (a) sport’. Say 而要说 do (a) sport or 或 play (a) sport .

PIC.HEADING: SPORTS EQUIPMENT 运动器材
PIC.PICCONTENT: tennis ball 网球；hockey stick 曲棍球球棍；bat BrE 【英】/paddle AmE 【美】乒乓球球拍；cricket bat 板球球板；shin pad 护胫；knee pad 护膝；boxing gloves 拳击手套；helmet 头盔；golf clubs 高尔夫球杆；flippers 脚蹼；goggles 护目镜；mask 面罩；tennis racket 网球拍；snorkel 呼吸管；badminton racket 羽毛球球拍；shuttlecock/birdie AmE【美】 羽毛球；puck 冰球；hockey stick 冰球球棍；baseball bat 棒球球棍；baseball glove/mitt 棒球手套；catcher's mitt 接球手手套

Sense.DEF: to be wearing something or have something on your body and show it to people in a proud way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eric was sporting a new camelhair coat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃里克得意地穿了一件新的驼绒大衣。

Sense.DEF: to play together happily
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sight of dolphins sporting amidst the waves
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海豚戏浪的情景

Sense.DEF:
a
sports jacket
Sense.TRAN: 〔男子穿的〕便服外套﹐粗花呢夹克

Sense.DEF: relating to sports
Sense.EXAMPLE: The college offers a wide range of sporting activities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所大学提供多种多样的体育活动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of the major sporting events of the year
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该年度的重大体育赛事之一
Sense.EXAMPLE: a great sporting achievement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一项了不起的体育成就
Sense.EXAMPLE: Britain’s sporting heroes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国体育界的英雄

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a sporting goods store
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 体育用品商店

Sense.DEF: someone who is sporting behaves in a fair and generous way during a game or competition and does not try to win in an unfair way
Sense.TRAN: 有运动家风度的﹐有体育精神的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was very sporting of them to wait until the rest of our team had arrived.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们很有体育精神﹐一直等到我们球队的其他队员全部到齐。

Sense.DEF: a fairly good chance of succeeding or winning
Sense.TRAN: 相当大的成功[取胜]机会
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think we’ve got a sporting chance of winning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为我们取胜的机会相当大。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: They sportingly agreed to postpone the race until our boat was repaired.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们很有体育精神﹐同意把比赛推迟到我们的船修好之后。

Sense.DEF:
a
sports jacket

a special type of
bra a piece of underwear that supports a woman’s breasts
that is designed for women to wear while playing sports
Sense.TRAN: 〔专为女性参加体育运动设计的〕运动胸罩

Sense.DEF: a low fast car, often with a roof that can be folded back or removed
a television broadcast of a sports game
someone who describes a sports game as it is being broadcast on television
a building where people can go to play many different types of indoor sports

a
sports jacket
a day on which the children at a school have sports competitions
Sense.TRAN: 〔小学生参加体育比赛的〕运动（会）日

Sense.DEF:
a
sports shirt
a man’s jacket that is not part of a suit
a man who plays several different sports
Sense.TRAN: 运动员﹔参加体育运动者
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a very keen sportsman .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个非常喜爱运动的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a talented all-round sportsman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名有天赋的全能运动员

Sense.DEF: a man who enjoys outdoor activities such as hunting and fishing
Sense.TRAN: 户外运动爱好者〔如爱好打猎﹑钓鱼的人〕
