Sense.DEF: behaving in a fair, honest, and polite way when competing in sports
Sense.TRAN: 〔在体育比赛中〕有体育精神的﹐有运动家风度[品格]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a club, we try to encourage sportsmanlike behaviour .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为一家俱乐部﹐我们尽力鼓励具有体育精神的行为。

Sense.DEF: behaviour that is fair, honest, and polite in a game or sports competition
Sense.TRAN: 运动家风度[品格]﹐体育精神
Sense.EXAMPLE: His sportsmanship and style of play is refreshing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的体育精神和比赛风格令人耳目一新。

GramExa.GLOSS: good or bad behaviour in a sport
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 良好的/差劲的体育精神
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We try to teach the kids good sportsmanship.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们尽量教给孩子们良好的体育精神。

Sense.DEF: someone who takes part in sports or a sport
Sense.TRAN: 运动员﹔参加体育运动者

Sense.DEF: a shirt for men that is worn on informal occasions
clothes that you wear to play sports or when you are relaxing
clothes that are suitable for informal occasions
a woman who plays many different sports
Sense.TRAN: 女运动员﹔参加体育运动的女子
Sense.EXAMPLE: great all-round sportswoman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰出的全能女运动员

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to write about sports for a newspaper or magazine

an
suv
someone who is sporty likes sport and is good at it
Sense.TRAN: 爱好并擅长体育运动的

Sense.DEF: sporty clothes are designed to look attractive in a bright informal way
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sporty jacket and skirt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 花哨的外套和裙子

Sense.DEF: a sporty car is designed to look attractive and go fast
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new model is slightly more sporty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这款新车更靓更快一些。

Sense.DEF: a particular place or area, especially a pleasant place where you spend time
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nice quiet spot on the beach
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海滩上一个安静的好地方
Sense.EXAMPLE: I chose a spot well away from the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我选了一个远离马路的地点。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a small cottage in an idyllic spot
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 位于恬静宜人之处的一座小村舍

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Why do they want to build a house on this particular spot?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们为什么要在这个地方建一栋房子？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the exact spot where the king was executed
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 国王被处死的确切地点

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an ideal spot for a picnic
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 野餐的理想地点

Sense.DEF: a usually round area on a surface that is a different colour or is rougher, smoother etc than the rest
Sense.EXAMPLE: a white cat with brown spots
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带褐色斑点的白猫

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Two spots of colour appeared in Jill’s cheeks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉尔的脸颊上出现了两块色斑。

Sense.DEF: a small mark on something, especially one that is made by a liquid
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a big damp spot on the wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙上有一大块湿印。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a few spots of blood
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些血渍

Subsense.DEF: a small round red area on someone’s skin that shows that they are ill
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He had a high fever and was covered in spots.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他发着高烧﹐满身红斑。

Subsense.DEF: a small raised red mark on someone’s skin, especially on their face
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Becka was very self-conscious about her spots.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝卡很在意自己的粉刺。

Subsense.DEF: if you do something on the spot, you do it immediately, often without thinking about it very carefully
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He had to make a decision on the spot.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他得马上作出决定。

Subsense.DEF: if you are on the spot, you are in the place where something is happening
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We ought to find out the views of the people on the spot.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们应当了解一下在现场的那些人的看法。

Subsense.DEF: if you walk, run, or jump on the spot, you do it staying in the same place, without moving around
Subsense.EXAMPLE: If running outside doesn’t appeal, try jogging on the spot indoors.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果对室外跑步不感兴趣的话﹐可以试试在室内原地慢跑。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately ask someone a question that is difficult or embarrassing to answer
Sense.TRAN: 〔故意提出难以回答或尴尬的问题〕使某人难堪

Sense.DEF: a short period of time when someone can speak or perform on radio or television
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人在广播或电视中说话或表演的〕节目时段
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was given a 30-second spot just after the news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻之后﹐他有一段 30 秒钟的出镜时间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a guest spot on ‘The Tonight Show’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在《今夜秀》中的嘉宾时间

Sense.DEF: a position in a list of things or in a competition
Sense.TRAN: 〔在排序表﹑比赛中的〕位置﹔名次
Sense.EXAMPLE: The budget has a regular spot on the agenda.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预算是一项常规议程。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Manchester United are still in the top spot after today’s win.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天获胜后﹐曼联队继续位居榜首。

Subsense.DEF: a point at which someone or something is not very good
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I carried on with my questions, sensing a weak spot in his story.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得他的叙述中有个疑点﹐于是继续提问。

Subsense.DEF: if someone has a weak spot for something, they like it very much
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ve always had a weak spot for chocolate.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一向爱吃巧克力。

Sense.DEF: a difficult situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: This puts the chairman in a very tight spot .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这让主席陷入了非常难办的境地。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope you can help get me out of a tight spot .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你能帮助我脱离困境。

Sense.DEF: something that is good in a bad situation
Sense.TRAN: 亮点﹐困境中使人高兴的事
Sense.EXAMPLE: The computer industry is the one bright spot in the economy at the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 眼下﹐计算机产业是经济的唯一亮点。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The only bright spot of the evening was when the food arrived.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天晚上唯一令人高兴的是食物送到的时候。

Sense.DEF: a small amount of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you fancy a spot of lunch?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要吃一点午饭吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been having a spot of bother some problems with my car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的汽车出了点问题。

Sense.DEF: a few drops of rain
Sense.EXAMPLE: A few spots of rain began to fall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天空下起了几滴小雨。

Sense.DEF: a piece of paper money worth five dollars, ten dollars etc

Crossrefto.REFLEX: have a soft spot for sb

Sense.DEF: to notice someone or something, especially when they are difficult to see or recognize
Sense.EXAMPLE: I spotted a police car behind us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发现有辆警车在我们后面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It can be hard for even a trained doctor to spot the symptoms of lung cancer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使是训练有素的医生也很难看出肺癌的症状。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Meg spotted someone coming out of the building.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 梅格看到有个人从大楼里出来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Drug addicts are fairly easy to spot.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 瘾君子很容易辨认。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One of the station staff spotted that I was in difficulty, and came to help.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位车站工作人员看到我有困难﹐就过来帮忙。

Sense.DEF: to have small round marks or small pieces of something on the surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: The windscreen was spotted with rain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 挡风玻璃上点点滴滴全是雨水。

Sense.DEF: to give the other player in a game an advantage
Sense.TRAN: 〔在比赛中给对手〕让〔一定的分数等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He spotted me six points and he still won.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他让了我六分﹐但还是赢了。

Sense.DEF: for buying or paying immediately, not at some future time
Sense.EXAMPLE: They won’t take credit; they want spot cash .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不给赊账﹐要求付现。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He quoted us a spot price for the goods.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给我们报了商品的现货价格。

Sense.DEF: an examination of a few things or people from a group, to check whether everything is correct or satisfactory

GramExa.EXAMPLE: spot checks on quality
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 质量抽查

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We carry out spot checks on the vehicles before they leave the depot.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车离库之前我们要进行抽样检查。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对每个人的工作都进行抽查。

Sense.DEF: completely clean
Sense.TRAN: 一尘不染的﹐干干净净的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spotless white handkerchief
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块洁白的手帕
Sense.EXAMPLE: By the time she had finished, the house was absolutely spotless .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她清扫完之后﹐房子里一尘不染。

Sense.DEF:
if someone has a spotless
reputation
or record, people know or think they have never done anything bad
Sense.TRAN: 〔名誉﹑操行记录等〕毫无瑕疵的﹐无任何污点的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a company whose reputation was spotless until this scandal broke
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该丑闻传出之前名誉毫无瑕疵的一家公司

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The whole house was spotlessly clean .
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 整幢房子干干净净﹐一尘不染。

Sense.DEF: a light with a very bright beam which can be directed at someone or something. Spotlights are often used to light a stage when actors or singers are performing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The yard was lit by three huge spotlights.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 院子里亮着三盏巨大的聚光灯。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was sweating under the spotlights.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 聚光灯照得我出汗了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She stepped into the spotlight and began to sing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她走到聚光灯下﹐开始演唱起来。

Sense.DEF: a lot of attention in newspapers, on television etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Education is once again under the spotlight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教育问题再一次成了媒体关注的焦点。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A new report has turned the spotlight on the problem of poverty in the inner cities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一篇新的报道将媒体的关注点引向了旧城区的贫困问题。

Sense.DEF: to direct attention to someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 使显眼﹐使突出﹐使受注意
Sense.EXAMPLE: The article spotlights the problems of the homeless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文章专门探讨了无家可归者的种种问题。

Sense.DEF: to shine a strong beam of light on something
Sense.TRAN: 将聚光灯射向〔某物〕﹐聚光照明
Sense.EXAMPLE: She walked out onto the spotlit stage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她走出来﹐站到聚光灯下的舞台上。

Sense.DEF: exactly right
Sense.EXAMPLE: Judith is always spot-on with her advice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱迪丝的劝告总是对的。

Sense.DEF: having small round marks of a different colour on the surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: a red and white spotted blouse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 红底白点女式衬衫

Sense.DEF: a sweet food eaten in Britain that is like a cake containing dried fruit and is eaten hot at the end of a meal
someone who spends time watching birds, trains etc for pleasure and writes down the things that they see
someone whose job is to look for or notice a particular type of thing
Sense.TRAN: 〔以专门搜寻或注意某类事物为职业的〕探子
Sense.EXAMPLE: Football clubs send spotters to look for young talent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 足球俱乐部派出星探去寻找年轻的足球人才。

Sense.DEF: the activity of watching birds, trains etc for pleasure
someone who is spotty has small raised red marks on their skin, especially on their face
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tall, thin, spotty youth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个又高又瘦﹑脸上长着粉刺的年轻人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spotty face
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长粉刺的脸

Sense.DEF: good only in some parts, but not in other parts
Sense.TRAN: 〔质量〕有好有坏的﹐参差不齐的

Sense.DEF: a husband or wife
Sense.EXAMPLE: Spouses were invited to the company picnic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 配偶受到邀请参加公司的野餐会。

Sense.DEF: a small pipe on the side of a container that you pour liquid out through
a sudden strong stream of liquid which comes out of somewhere very fast
if something is up the spout, it is completely wrong or has failed completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: The computer’s up the spout!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这台电脑彻底坏了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: My plans for the weekend seem to have gone up the spout .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的周末计划看来已经泡汤了。

Subsense.DEF: if liquid or fire spouts from somewhere, it comes out very quickly in a powerful stream

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Blood was spouting from the wound in her arm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 血从她手臂的伤口涌出。

Subsense.DEF: to send out liquid or flames very quickly in a powerful stream
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a volcano spouting lava
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喷发着熔岩的火山

Sense.DEF: to talk a lot about something in a boring or annoying way
Sense.TRAN: 喋喋不休地说﹐滔滔不绝地说
Sense.EXAMPLE: My father was spouting his usual nonsense!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父亲又在没完没了地讲他那些废话了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hate it when he spouts off like that!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我讨厌他像那样讲个没完！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m tired of listening to Jim spouting about politics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听腻了吉姆大谈政治。

Sense.DEF:
if a
whale
spouts, it sends out a stream of water from a hole in its head
to damage a joint in your body by suddenly twisting it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I fell down the steps and sprained my ankle .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从台阶上摔下来﹐扭伤了脚踝。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I thought my wrist might be broken, but it was just a bad sprain.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以为我的手腕可能摔断了﹐但只是严重扭伤。

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
spring2
a small fish that is cooked and eaten whole
to lie or sit with your arms or legs stretched out in a lazy or careless way
Sense.TRAN: 〔懒洋洋地或漫不经心地〕摊开手脚躺[坐]着
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sprawled out on the sofa.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他摊开手脚躺在沙发上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I tripped on a stone and went sprawling on the pavement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我被一块石头绊了一下﹐四仰八叉地摔在人行道上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a blow which sent him sprawling
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打得他四脚朝天的一拳

Sense.DEF: if buildings sprawl, they spread out over a wide area in an untidy and unattractive way
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑群〕杂 乱地延伸[扩展]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The town seemed to sprawl for miles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座城市杂乱无章地向外扩展﹐绵延数英里。

Sense.DEF: a large area of buildings that are spread out in an untidy and unattractive way
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑群〕杂乱扩展的大片地区
Sense.EXAMPLE: We drove through miles of urban sprawl before we finally got out into the countryside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们开车行驶数英里﹐穿过向外无序扩展的城区﹐终于来到了乡间。

Sense.DEF: to be lying or sitting with your arms or legs stretched out in a lazy or careless way
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was sprawled in an armchair in front of the TV.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他摊开手脚坐在电视机前的扶手椅上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A girl lay sprawled across the bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个女孩摊开手脚躺在床上。

Sense.DEF: spreading over a wide area in an untidy or unattractive way
Sense.TRAN: 杂乱延伸的﹐无计划扩展的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a vast, sprawling city
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座无计划扩展的巨大城市

Sense.DEF: to force liquid out of a container so that it comes out in a stream of very small drops and covers an area

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She sprayed herself with perfume.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她往身上喷了香水。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Someone had sprayed blue paint over his car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人在他的汽车上喷了蓝色油漆。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Vandals had sprayed graffiti on the walls.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 破坏公物者在墙上喷涂了乱七八糟的图案和文字。

GramExa.GLOSS: cover them with liquid to protect them from insects or disease
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The fruit is sprayed every four weeks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 果实每四个星期喷一次药。

Sense.DEF: if liquids or small bits spray somewhere, they are quickly scattered through the air

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Champagne sprayed from the bottle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 香槟酒从瓶子里喷洒而出。

Sense.DEF: to shoot a lot of bullets towards a person or place very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gunmen sprayed the crowd with bullets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 持枪歹徒向人群开枪扫射。

Sense.DEF: liquid which is forced out of a special container in a stream of very small drops
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new hair styling spray
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种新的定型喷发剂
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most farmers use pesticide sprays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数农民都使用喷雾杀虫剂。

Sense.DEF: a container which forces liquid out in a stream of small drops
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mary took a perfume spray from her handbag.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽从手提包里拿出一瓶喷雾香水。

Subsense.DEF: water in very small drops that is blown from the sea etc or sent up by vehicles on a wet road
Subsense.EXAMPLE: spray from the waves
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海浪溅起的水雾
Subsense.EXAMPLE: My face was stinging from the salt spray.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的脸被盐雾刺痛了。

Subsense.DEF: liquid that comes quickly from somewhere in very small drops

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A spray of blood came from his mouth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片血雾从他嘴里喷出。

Sense.DEF: a small branch or stem with leaves or flowers on it, used for decoration

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a spray of holly
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一根冬青树枝

Sense.DEF: an attractive arrangement of flowers or leaves

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a spray of violets and primroses
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一簇紫罗兰和报春花花饰

Sense.DEF: a lot of bullets or very small objects moving quickly through the air
Sense.TRAN: 一阵雨点般的子弹/石子等

Sense.DEF: a can from which you can spray paint onto things
a piece of equipment that is used for spraying large amounts of liquid, especially over crops
a piece of equipment that you hold in your hand and use to spray liquid in very small drops
a spray-on substance can be sprayed from a container onto a surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spray-on water repellent for clothing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 衣物防水喷剂

Sense.DEF: paint that you spray from a can

a process in which someone is
sprayed
with a coloured substance so that their skin looks as if it has been turned brown by the sun
if something spreads or is spread, it becomes larger or moves so that it affects more people or a larger area

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fire quickly spread through the building.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 火势在楼里迅速蔓延。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He watched the dark stain spread over the gray carpet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看着深色污渍在灰色地毯上漫开。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The disease spread rapidly amongst the poor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 疾病在穷人中间迅速传播。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The cancer had spread to her liver.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 癌已经扩散到她的肝脏。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Revolution quickly spread from France to Italy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 革命迅速从法国蔓延到意大利。

Subsense.DEF: to become known about or used by more and more people
Subsense.EXAMPLE: News of the explosion spread swiftly.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发生爆炸的消息迅速传播开来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Buddhism spread to China from India.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 佛教从印度传到中国。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: The news spread like wildfire very quickly
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消息如野火般迅速传开。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Word spread quickly that she was leaving.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她要离开的消息迅速传开。

Subsense.DEF: to tell a lot of people about something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Andy loves spreading rumours about his colleagues.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安迪很喜欢散播关于同事的谣言。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They are spreading the word about the benefits of immunization.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在宣传注射疫苗的好处。

Sense.DEF: to open something out or arrange a group of things so that they cover a flat surface

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Papers and photos were spread across the floor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 地板上摊满了报纸和照片。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He spread the map out on the desk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在桌上摊开地图。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a table spread with a white cloth
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 铺着白色台布的桌子

Sense.DEF: to cover or exist across a large area

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the forest that spread over the whole of that region
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 将那一地区全部覆盖的森林

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company has more than 2,500 shops spread throughout the UK.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司有超过 2,500 家商店分布在英国各地。

Sense.DEF: to put a soft substance over a surface, or to be soft enough to be put over a surface

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He spread plaster on the walls.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他往墙上抹灰泥。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Spread the toast thinly with jam.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在烤面包片上抹一层薄薄的果 酱。

Sense.EXAMPLE: If you warm up the butter, it’ll spread more easily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果把黄油加热﹐抹起来就更容易。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Spread the nut mixture evenly over the bottom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把果仁混合料均匀地抹在底部。

Sense.DEF: if you spread your arms, fingers or legs, you move them far apart
Sense.TRAN: 张开﹐伸开〔手臂﹑手指或腿〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He shrugged and spread his hands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他耸耸肩﹐摊开双手。

Sense.DEF: to do something over a period of time, rather than at one time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Could I spread the repayments over a longer period?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可以把贷款在更长的时间里分期还清吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: There will be 12 concerts spread throughout the summer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今夏将有 12 场音乐会。

Sense.DEF: to share or divide something among several people or things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bills are sent out on different dates to spread the workload on council staff.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 议案于不同的日期分发﹐以便分散市政会工作人员的工作量。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They want the country’s wealth to be more evenly spread .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们希望国家财富分配更加平均。

Sense.DEF: if an expression spreads over someone’s face, it slowly appears on their face

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A slow smile spread over her face.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 笑容慢慢在她脸上绽放。

Subsense.DEF: to start to have an independent life and experience new things
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A year spent studying abroad should allow him to spread his wings a bit.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在国外留学一年可以让他独立一些。

Subsense.DEF: if a bird or insect spreads its wings, it stretches them wide
if money, effort etc is spread thin, it is being used for many things so there is not enough for each thing
Subsense.TRAN: 〔钱﹑精力等〕用得过于分散（而不够分配）
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They complained that resources were spread too thinly.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们抱怨资源使用过于分散。

Subsense.DEF: to try to do too many things at the same time so that you do not do any of them effectively

Sense.DEF:
to scatter seeds,
manure
etc on the ground
if a group of people spread out, they move apart from each other so that they cover a wider area
Sense.EXAMPLE: The search party spread out to search the surrounding fields.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 搜索队员四散开来搜查周围的田野。

Sense.DEF: to open something out or arrange a group of things on a flat surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sue spread out her notes on the kitchen table and began to write.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休把笔记本摊开放在厨房桌子上﹐开始写了起来。

Sense.DEF: to cover a large area
Sense.EXAMPLE: The city spread out below her looked so calm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城市在她下方绵延开来﹐看起来如此宁静。

Sense.DEF: to do something over a period of time, rather than at one time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The course is spread out over four days.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这门课程分四天进行。

Sense.DEF: when something affects or is known about by more people or involves a larger area

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an attempt to stop the spread of nuclear weapons
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 制止核武器扩散的努力

Sense.EXAMPLE: the rapid spread of cholera in Latin America
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 霍乱在拉丁美洲的迅速传播

Subsense.DEF: a soft substance made from vegetable oil that is used like butter
Subsense.EXAMPLE: one slice of toast with a low-fat spread
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片抹有低脂人造黄油的烤面包

Subsense.DEF: a soft food which you spread on bread

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 奶酪酱/巧克力 酱等

Sense.DEF: a range of people or things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We have a good spread of ages in the department.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们部门人员的年龄分布很合理。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a broad spread of investments
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 类型多样的投资

Sense.DEF: the total area in which something exists
Sense.EXAMPLE: the geographical spread of the company’s hotels
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司下属酒店的地理分布

Sense.DEF: a special article or advertisement in a newspaper or magazine, which covers two pages or covers the centre pages
Sense.TRAN: 〔报刊中〕横跨两版的/中间折页的文章[广告]
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a double-page spread in Sunday’s paper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期天的报纸上有一篇横跨两版的文章。

Sense.DEF: a large meal for several guests on a special occasion
Sense.TRAN: 〔特殊场合招待数位客人的〕丰盛的饭菜
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chris’s mum laid on a huge spread.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯的母亲摆上一桌丰盛的饭菜。

Sense.DEF: the area covered when the fingers of a hand, or a bird’s wings, are fully stretched
Sense.TRAN: 〔手指伸直时〕手的全长﹔〔鸟的〕翼展

Sense.DEF:
a
bedspread

the difference between the prices at which something is bought and sold, or the
interest
rates for lending and borrowing money
Sense.TRAN: 〔买卖价格或借贷利率的〕差额﹐差幅

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the spread between the city banks’ loan rates and deposit rates
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 城市银行贷款利率和存款利率之间的差额

Sense.DEF: the number of points between the scores of two opposing teams
Sense.TRAN: 〔两支对抗的运动队的〕比分差距
Sense.EXAMPLE: a four-point spread
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 四分的差距

Sense.DEF: an area of land or water

a large farm or
ranch

a type of
betting
on sports events in which someone says what they think the final score will be
Sense.TRAN: 差额投注﹐指数博彩〔一种体育博彩〕

Sense.DEF:
a way of buying and selling
shares
in which someone
bets
money on whether shares in a particular company will go up or down in value
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某一公司股票的〕点差交易

Sense.DEF: lying with arms and legs stretched out
Sense.EXAMPLE: He lay spreadeagled on the bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他伸开四肢躺在床上。

Sense.DEF: a computer program that can show and calculate financial information
Sense.TRAN: 电子表格程序〔一种能显示和计算财务数据的计算机程序〕

Sense.DEF:
a document that contains rows and
columns
of numbers that can be used to calculate something
a short period of time when you do a lot of one activity, especially spending money or drinking alcohol
Sense.TRAN: 作乐﹐狂欢〔尤指花钱或喝酒〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They went on a drinking spree .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们去痛痛快快地喝了一通。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a shopping spree
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 疯狂购物

Sense.DEF: a small stem or part of a branch with leaves or flowers on it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a sprig of parsley
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一小枝欧芹

Sense.DEF: sprigged cloth or a sprigged pattern is decorated with leaves or flowers on stems
Sense.TRAN: 〔布等〕饰有带叶[花]小枝图案的

Sense.DEF: an old person who is sprightly is still active and full of energy – used to show approval
Sense.TRAN: 〔老人〕活跃的﹐充满活力的〔含褒义〕

Sense.DEF: the season between winter and summer when leaves and flowers appear

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the spring of 1933
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 1933 年春季

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s due to open in the spring.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 预定在春天开放。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was a cold, sunny day in early spring.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是早春的一个晴朗的寒天。

Sense.EXAMPLE: spring flowers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 春花

Subsense.DEF: something, usually a twisted piece of metal, that will return to its previous shape after it has been pressed down
Subsense.EXAMPLE: an old armchair with broken springs
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一把弹簧已坏的旧扶手椅

Subsense.DEF: the ability of a chair, bed etc to return to its normal shape after being pressed down

Sense.DEF: a place where water comes up naturally from the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: spring water
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 泉水
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are several hot springs in the area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这地区有几处温泉。

Sense.DEF: if you walk with a spring in your step, you move quickly and happily
Sense.EXAMPLE: As he walked into the office that morning, there was a spring in his step.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天早上他迈着轻快的脚步走进办公室。

Sense.LEXUNIT: full of the joys of spring
Sense.DEF: happy and full of energy – used humorously
a sudden quick movement or jump in a particular direction
to move suddenly and quickly in a particular direction, especially by jumping

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tom sprung out of bed and ran downstairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆跳下床﹐冲到楼下。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Two men sprang out at me as I was walking through the park.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正在公园里走着﹐两名男子突然朝我冲来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He sprang to his feet stood up suddenly and rushed after her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他腾地站起身﹐冲过去追她。

GramExa.GLOSS: move quickly to help someone
GramExa.EXAMPLE: One of the young policemen sprang to her assistance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有个年轻的警察赶紧过去帮她。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Spring is used mostly in literature. In everyday English, people usually say jump .
F2NBox.TRAN: spring 主要用于文学作品。在日常英语中,人们通常说 jump
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He jumped out of bed.

Sense.DEF: if something springs back, open etc, it moves quickly, suddenly, and with force, especially after being pushed down or sideways

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The branch sprang back and hit him in the face.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 树枝弹回来﹐打在他的脸上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The gate sprang shut behind them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大门在他们身后弹回关上了。

Sense.DEF: if someone or something springs to mind, you immediately think of them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two questions spring to mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脑子里跳出了两个问题。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly become active, start moving, or start working
Sense.TRAN: 突然活跃[行动﹐工作]起来
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were prepared and ready to spring into action.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们已经做好准备随时开始行动。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Finally, the engine sprang to life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 引擎终于发动起来了。

Sense.DEF: to do something surprising
Sense.EXAMPLE: Roy is unlikely to spring any surprises.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗伊不大可能有什么惊人之举。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone starts to cry
to suddenly begin to exist
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of small businesses sprang into existence during the 1980s.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20 世纪 80 年代冒出了许多小公司。

Subsense.DEF: if an animal springs a trap, it is caught by the trap
to make someone say or do something by tricking them
Subsense.TRAN: 设圈套诱使某人说[干]出某事

Sense.DEF: if a boat or a container springs a leak, it begins to let liquid in or out through a crack or hole
Sense.TRAN: 〔船或容器〕出现裂缝〔开始漏水〕

Sense.DEF: to quickly defend someone who is being criticized
Sense.EXAMPLE: Charlene sprang immediately to her son’s defence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查伦马上站出来为儿子辩护。

Sense.DEF: if soldiers spring to attention, they stand suddenly upright
to help someone escape from prison
to pay for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll spring for the beer tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚的啤酒我买单。

Sense.DEF: to be caused by something or start from something
Sense.EXAMPLE: behaviour which springs from prejudices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因偏见而产生的行为

Sense.DEF: to tell someone something or ask them to do something when they do not expect it and are not ready for it
Sense.TRAN: 向〔某人〕突然说[要求]〔意料之外的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s not fair to spring this on her without any warning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 事先也不说一声就这样要求她﹐这是不公平的。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly appear or start to exist
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fast-food restaurants are springing up all over town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快餐店一家家地冒出来﹐遍布整个小镇。

Sense.DEF: something that helps you to start doing something
Sense.TRAN: 〔有助于开始做某事的〕起点﹐起步方法

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The TV soap has been a springboard for a lot of careers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视肥皂剧是许多人事业的起点。

Sense.DEF:
a strong board for jumping on or off, used when diving (
dive11
) or doing
gymnastics
Sense.TRAN: 〔跳水运动的〕跳板﹔〔体操运动的〕踏跳板

Sense.DEF:
a small
deer
that can run fast and lives in South Africa
Sense.TRAN: 跳羚〔南非的一种小羚羊〕

Sense.DEF: a holiday from college or university in the spring, usually two weeks long
Sense.TRAN: 春假〔大学在春天放的假﹐通常为两周〕

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is no longer young – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 某人已经不再年轻了〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: when you clean a house thoroughly, usually once a year
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常一年一度对房屋的〕彻底打扫﹐大扫除
Sense.EXAMPLE: Judith’s busy doing the spring-cleaning .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱迪思正忙着大扫除。

Sense.DEF: a sudden feeling of energy that you have in the spring
Sense.TRAN: 春躁症〔指在春季突然觉得精力充沛〕

Sense.DEF:
containing a metal
spring
that presses one part against another
Sense.TRAN: 弹簧承载的﹐用弹簧顶住的

Sense.DEF: a strong tasting onion with a small white round part and a long green stem, usually eaten raw

a type of Chinese food consisting of a piece of thin rolled
pastry
filled with vegetables and sometimes meat and cooked in oil

a large rise and fall in the level of the sea at the time of the
new moon
and the
full moon
Sense.TRAN: 〔新月和满月时的〕大潮﹐满潮﹐朔望大潮

Sense.DEF: the time of the year when it is spring

GramExa.EXAMPLE: when the snow melts in the springtime
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 春天积雪消融之际

Sense.DEF:
the period when a
baseball
team gets ready for competition
something that is springy is soft and comes back to its normal shape after being pressed or walked on
Sense.EXAMPLE: The grass was soft and springy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 草地松软有弹性。

Sense.DEF: a way of walking which is quick and full of energy
to scatter small drops of liquid or small pieces of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sprinkle the top with cheese.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在上面撒些干酪。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I sprinkled cocoa over my latte.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在我的拿铁咖啡上撒了点可可粉。

Sense.DEF: to be full of jokes etc
Sense.TRAN: 穿插着许多笑话/引语等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book is liberally sprinkled with clichés.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 书中使用了大量陈腐的套话。

Sense.DEF: if it is sprinkling, it is raining lightly
a small amount of something, especially scattered on top of something
Sense.TRAN: 少量﹐一点〔尤指撒在某地方的某物〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Add a sprinkle of salt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 加入少量的盐。

Sense.DEF: a light rain
a piece of equipment used for scattering water on grass or soil
a piece of equipment on a ceiling that scatters water if there is a fire
Sense.TRAN: 〔天花板上的〕自动喷水灭火装置

Sense.DEF: a small amount of something, especially scattered over an area
Sense.TRAN: 少量﹐一点〔尤指撒在某地方的某物〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hilltops were covered with a sprinkling of snow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 山顶上覆盖着薄薄的白雪。

Sense.DEF: to run very fast for a short distance

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bill sprinted up the steps.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 比尔飞奔着跑上台阶。

Sense.DEF: to ride, swim etc very fast for a short distance
Sense.TRAN: 〔骑车﹑游泳等短距离〕（全速）冲刺

Sense.DEF: a short race in which the runners, riders, swimmers etc move very fast over a short distance
Sense.TRAN: 短距离速度比赛﹔短跑比赛
Sense.EXAMPLE: the 100-metre sprint
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 100 米短跑

Sense.DEF: a short period of running or moving very fast
Sense.EXAMPLE: He made a desperate sprint for the train.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拼命地飞奔﹐追赶火车。

Sense.DEF: someone who runs in fast races over short distances

a
fairy1

to
spray
small amounts of a liquid on something

a drink made with
soda water
and white wine
Sense.TRAN: 〔用汽水和白葡萄酒调制的〕汽酒

Sense.DEF:
a wheel with
teeth parts along the edge
that fit into and turn a bicycle chain, a photographic film with holes etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔自行车的〕链轮﹔〔电影放映机的〕带齿卷轴﹐带齿卷盘

Sense.DEF: one of the teeth on a sprocket wheel
a child or baby – used humorously

if vegetables, seeds, or plants sprout, they start to grow, producing
shoots
,
buds
, or leaves
Sense.TRAN: 〔蔬菜﹑种子﹑植物〕发芽﹐抽芽﹔开始长出〔叶子〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Move the pots outside when the seeds begin to sprout.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 种子开始发芽时把盆搬到外面去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Trees were starting to sprout new leaves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 树上开始抽出新叶。

Sense.DEF: to appear suddenly in large numbers
Sense.TRAN: 突然大量出现﹐大量冒出
Sense.EXAMPLE: Office blocks are sprouting up everywhere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到处都有办公大楼冒出来。

Sense.DEF: if something such as hair sprouts or if you sprout it, it starts to grow
Sense.TRAN: 〔头发等〕开始长出﹔〔某人〕开始长〔毛发等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jim seemed to have sprouted a beard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆好像长出胡子了。

Sense.DEF:
a small green vegetable like a very small
cabbage
a new growth on a plant

an
alfalfa
seed which has grown a stem and is eaten

a
beansprout
a tree that grows in nor-thern countries and has short leaves shaped like needles
to make yourself or something look neater and tidier
Sense.TRAN: 把〔自己〕打扮得整齐干净﹔使〔某物〕整洁
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul went upstairs to spruce up before dinner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗在吃晚饭前上楼打扮了一下。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The cottage had been spruced up a bit since her last visit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她上次来过以后﹐小屋收拾得整洁些了。

Sense.DEF: neat and clean
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Bailey was looking very spruce in a white linen suit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝利先生穿着白色亚麻套装﹐看上去很整洁。

Sense.DEF:
a past tense and the past participle of
spring2
Sense.TRAN: spring2 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF:
supported or kept in shape by
springs
Sense.TRAN: 装有弹簧的﹐用弹簧支撑的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sprung mattress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弹簧床垫

Sense.DEF: a spry old person has energy and is active
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s still remarkably spry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他依然充满了活力。

Sense.DEF:
a
potato
the mass of bubbles that forms on the top of waves when the sea is rough

the past tense and past participle of
spin
Sense.TRAN: spin 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF: courage
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had a lot of spunk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很有胆量。

Sense.DEF: having a lot of courage, energy, or determination
Sense.TRAN: 勇敢坚定的﹔干劲十足的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spunky performance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充满活力的表演
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spunky heroine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 勇敢坚定的女主人公

Sense.LEXUNIT: on the spur of the moment
Sense.DEF: suddenly, without any previous planning or thought
Sense.EXAMPLE: We would often decide what to play on the spur of the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们经常是凭兴致临时决定表演内容。

Sense.DEF: a fact or event that makes you try harder to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It provided the spur to further research.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这对进一步的研究起到了鼓舞作用。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The crowd’s reaction only acted as a spur.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群的反应不过起了刺激作用。

Sense.DEF: a sharp pointed object on the heel of a rider’s boot which is used to encourage a horse to go faster
to show that you deserve to succeed because you have the right skills
Sense.TRAN: 〔因掌握正确技能而〕获得荣誉﹐赢得名望

Sense.DEF: a piece of high ground which sticks out from the side of a hill or mountain
a railway track or road that goes away from a main line or road
to encourage someone or make them want to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The band were spurred on by the success of their last two singles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐队因最近两张单曲唱片的成功而深受鼓舞。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His misfortunes spurred him to write.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的不幸遭遇激励着他写作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the coach who spurred him on to Olympic success
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 鞭策他在奥运会上取得成功的教练

Sense.EXAMPLE: It was an article in the local newspaper which finally spurred him into action .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是当地报纸上的一篇文章最终促使他行动起来。

Sense.DEF: to make an improvement or change happen faster
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lower taxes would spur investment and help economic growth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 降低税率将刺激投资﹐有助于经济增长。

Sense.DEF: to encourage a horse to go faster, especially by pushing it with special points on the heels of your boots
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指用马刺〕策（马）加速﹐（使）〔马〕快跑

Sense.DEF: a spurious statement, argument etc is not based on facts or good thinking and is likely to be incorrect
Sense.TRAN: 〔声明﹑论据等〕站不住脚的﹐谬误的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He demolished the Opposition’s spurious arguments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他推翻了反对党那些站不住脚的论点。

Sense.DEF: insincere
Sense.EXAMPLE: spurious sympathy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 假同情

Sense.DEF: to refuse to accept something or someone, especially because you are too proud
Sense.TRAN: 轻蔑地拒绝﹐对…不屑一顾
Sense.EXAMPLE: She spurned all offers of help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她骄傲地拒绝一切帮助。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spurned lover
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被轻蔑拒绝的爱慕者

Sense.DEF: a spur-of-the-moment decision or action is made or done suddenly without planning
Sense.TRAN: 一时冲动的﹐心血来潮的

Subsense.DEF: if liquid or flames spurt from something, they come out of it quickly and suddenly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Blood spurted from his nose.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 血从他的鼻子里喷涌而出。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Flames spurted through the roof.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火焰蹿出屋顶。

Subsense.DEF: to send out liquid or flames quickly or suddenly
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It boiled over, spurting hot water everywhere.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 煮潽了﹐热水喷得到处都是。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly start moving more quickly, especially for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: He suddenly spurted ahead of the others.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他突然冲到其他人的前面。

Sense.DEF: when an amount of liquid or flame suddenly comes quickly out of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a sudden spurt of flame
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然喷出的火焰

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The water came out of the tap in short spurts a small amount at a time .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 水一阵阵地从水龙头里喷出。

Sense.DEF: a short sudden increase of activity, effort, speed, or emotion
Sense.TRAN: 〔活动﹑努力﹑速度或情感的〕突然增加﹔迸发

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In a sudden spurt of anger, Ellen slammed the door shut.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃伦突然火冒三丈﹐砰的一声把门关上。

GramExa.GLOSS: when a child suddenly grows quickly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We weren’t consistent - we played in spurts.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们并不是一直都一个样﹐有时会疯玩一阵。

Sense.DEF: if something such as an engine or a fire sputters, it makes short soft uneven noises like very small explosions
Sense.TRAN: 发出噼噼啪啪声﹐毕毕剥剥作响
Sense.EXAMPLE: Suddenly the engine sputtered and stopped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然引擎啪啪响了几下就停了。

Sense.DEF: to talk quickly in short confused phrases, especially because you are angry or shocked
Sense.TRAN: 急促而慌乱地说﹐语无伦次地说〔尤因气愤或震惊〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What do you mean?’ sputtered Annabelle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你什么意思？”安娜贝勒语无伦次地问道。

Sense.DEF: liquid in your mouth which you have coughed up from your lungs
someone whose job is to find out secret information about another country, organization, or group
Sense.EXAMPLE: She worked as a spy for the American government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她为美国政府收集情报。

GramExa.GLOSS: an organized group of spies

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 间谍飞机/卫星

Sense.DEF: to secretly collect information about an enemy country or an organization you are competing against
Sense.TRAN: 从事间谍活动﹔秘密收集情报

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was charged with spying on British military bases.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被指控刺探英国军事基地情报。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He confessed to spying for Britain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他承认为英国刺探情报。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly see someone or something, especially after searching for them
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指经过寻找〕突然看见﹐突然发现
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ellen suddenly spied her friend in the crowd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃伦突然在人群中找到了她的朋友。

Sense.DEF: to watch someone secretly in order to find out what they are doing
Sense.EXAMPLE: She sent you to spy on me, didn’t she?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她派你来监视我﹐对不对？

Sense.DEF: to secretly find out information about something
to secretly find out more information about a situation before deciding what to do

a small
telescope
used by sailors in the past
a hole in a door, wall etc through which you can look at someone secretly
computer software that secretly records information about which websites you visit. This information is then used by advertising companies, who try to sell you products.

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= square 平方
Sense.EXAMPLE: 30 cm sq floor tiles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 30 平方厘米的地砖
Sense.EXAMPLE: 40 Merrion Sq., Dublin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 都柏林梅里恩广场 40 号

Sense.DEF: to argue about something unimportant

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’re always squabbling over money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们老是为钱争吵。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s squabbling with the referee.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在和裁判争吵。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: bitter squabbles between employers and unions
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 雇主和工会之间的激烈争吵

Sense.DEF: a group of players from which a team will be chosen for a particular sports event
Sense.TRAN: 〔为参加某体育比赛而组成的〕运动队﹔球队
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Italian World Cup squad
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 代表意大利参加世界杯的球队

Sense.DEF: the police department responsible for dealing with a particular kind of crime

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A controlled explosion was carried out by bomb squad officers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爆破小组的队员进行了一次控制爆破。

Sense.DEF: a small group of soldiers working together as a unit
Sense.EXAMPLE: a drill squad
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 操练小队

Sense.DEF:
a group of
cheerleaders
a car used by police on duty
BrE informal a soldier who is not an officer
a military force consisting of a group of aircraft or ships
Sense.TRAN: 飞行中队﹔海军分遣舰队

Sense.DEF:
an officer in the British
air force
below a
wing commander
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国的〕空军少校[中 队长]

Sense.DEF: very dirty and unpleasant because of a lack of care or money
Sense.TRAN: 〔因无人料理或缺钱而〕非常肮脏的
Sense.EXAMPLE: How can anyone live in such squalid conditions?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个人怎么能住在这样肮脏的环境中？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tiny squalid apartment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一套又小又脏的公寓

Sense.DEF: immoral or dishonest
Sense.TRAN: 道德败坏的﹔卑鄙的﹔不诚实的
Sense.EXAMPLE: squalid behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卑鄙的行为
Sense.EXAMPLE: a squalid affair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肮脏的勾当

Sense.DEF: a sudden strong wind, especially one that brings rain or snow
Sense.TRAN: 飑〔突起的狂风﹐尤指夹有雨或雪〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: snow squalls
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雪飑

Sense.DEF: if a baby or child squalls, it cries noisily
squally rain or snow comes with sudden strong winds
Sense.EXAMPLE: squally showers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狂风阵雨

Sense.DEF: the condition of being dirty and unpleasant because of a lack of care or money
Sense.EXAMPLE: We lived in squalor for a year and a half.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在肮脏的环境里住了一年半。

Sense.DEF: to carelessly waste money, time, opportunities etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The home team squandered a number of chances in the first half.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主队在上半场浪费了几次机会。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They squandered the profits on expensive cars.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把利润挥霍在昂贵的汽车上。

Sense.DEF: having four straight equal sides and 90˚ angles at the corners
Sense.EXAMPLE: a large square room
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个正方形的大房间

Sense.DEF: forming a 90˚ angle, or being close to or similar to a 90˚ angle
Sense.EXAMPLE: square corners
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 方角

Sense.DEF: an area of measurement equal to a square with sides a metre long, a mile long etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: about four square metres of ground
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大约四平方米的地面

Sense.DEF: having the shape of a square with sides that are five feet, two metres etc long
Sense.EXAMPLE: The room is six metres square.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个房间六米见方。

Sense.DEF: parallel with a straight line

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t think the shelf is square with the floor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得这块搁板与地面不 平行。

Sense.DEF: a good satisfying meal
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children should have three square meals a day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童应该吃好一日三餐。

Sense.DEF: if someone’s body or a part of their body is square, it looks broad and strong
Sense.EXAMPLE: a square jaw
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 方下巴

Sense.DEF: to have the same number of points as your opponent in a competition
Sense.EXAMPLE: The teams were all square at the end of the first half.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上半场结束时两队打成平局。

Sense.DEF: if two people are square, they do not owe each other any money
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here’s your £10 back, so that makes us square .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还你 10 英镑﹐这样我们谁也不欠谁了。

Sense.DEF: honest and fair treatment from someone, especially in business
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not getting a square deal here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在这里没有得到公平对待。

Sense.DEF: someone who is square is boring and old-fashioned

Sense.LEXUNIT: a square peg in a round hole
Sense.DEF: someone who is in a job or situation that is not suitable for them
Sense.TRAN: 不适宜做某工作的人﹔与周围环境格格不入的人

Sense.DEF: a shape with four straight equal sides with 90˚ angles at the corners
Sense.EXAMPLE: First of all, draw a square.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首先﹐画一个正方形。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a small square of cloth
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块小方布

Sense.DEF: a large open area in the centre of a town or city, usually in the shape of a square, or the buildings surrounding it
Sense.TRAN: 广场﹔广场周围的建筑物

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hotel is just off the main square of Sorrento.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒店就在索伦托的主广场附近。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She lives in Hanover Square.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她住在汉诺威广场。

Sense.DEF: the situation from which you started to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police are now back at square one in their investigation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方的调查工作现在又回到了起点。

GramExa.GLOSS: used when you start something again because you were not successful the first time
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Okay, let’s go back to square one and try again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 好吧﹐我们从头开始﹐再试一次。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve had to relearn the game from square one.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只好从头开始﹐重学这个游戏。

Sense.DEF: the result of multiplying a number by itself

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The square of 4 is 16.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 4 的平方是 16。

Sense.DEF:
a space on a board used for playing a game such as
chess
someone who is considered boring and unfashionable
a flat object with a straight edge, often shaped like an L, used for drawing or measuring 90˚ angles
to multiply a number by itself
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某数〕自乘一次﹔使〔某数〕成平方

Sense.DEF: to win a point or game so that you have now won the same number of points or games as the other team or player
Sense.TRAN: 把〔比分〕拉平﹐使〔比赛〕打成平局
Sense.EXAMPLE: India won the second match to square the series at one each.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 印度队赢了第二场﹐把循环赛积分扳为一平。

Sense.DEF: to stand straight and push your shoulders back, usually to show your determination
Sense.TRAN: 挺直肩膀﹐挺起胸膛〔通常以显示决心〕

Sense.DEF: to make something straight or parallel
to attempt something impossible
Sense.TRAN: 尝试做不可能的事﹐化圆为方

Sense.DEF: to finish something, especially by putting the last details in order
Sense.TRAN: 完成〔某事﹐尤指理清最后的细节〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Get your work squared away before you leave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在你离开之前妥善安排好你的工作。

Sense.DEF: to make something have neat corners
to get ready to fight someone
to pay money that you owe
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll pay for the drinks and you can square up later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来付饮料的钱﹐你可以回头再给我。

Sense.DEF: to get ready to fight someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The two lads squared up to each other.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两个少年各自摆好架势。

Sense.DEF: to deal with a difficult situation or person in a determined way
if you square two ideas, statements etc with each other or if they square with each other, they are considered to be in agreement
Sense.EXAMPLE: His story simply does not square with the facts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的说法和事实根本不符。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How do you square that with your religious beliefs?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你如何把它和你的宗教信仰调和起来呢？

GramExa.GLOSS: make yourself believe that what you are doing is morally right
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 使自己对某事感到心安理得

Sense.DEF: to persuade someone to agree to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll take the day off if I can square it with my boss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我能说动老板同意﹐我就休一天假。

Sense.DEF: directly and firmly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Look him square in the eye and say no.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要直视着他的眼睛说“不”。

Sense.DEF: at 90˚ to a line

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Wright passed the ball square to Brown.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 赖特把球径直传给了布朗。

Sense.DEF: one of the pair of signs [ ] that are used for enclosing information

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The words in square brackets should be deleted.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 方括号内的单词应该 删除。

Sense.DEF: divided into squares or marked with squares
Sense.EXAMPLE: squared paper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 方格纸

Sense.DEF: the number three, nine etc multiplied by itself
Sense.EXAMPLE: Three squared equals nine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 3 的平方是 9。

Sense.DEF: a type of traditional country dance in which four pairs of dancers face each other in a square, and someone calls out the movements they should do
a type of knot that will not come undone easily
Sense.TRAN: 方结﹐平结〔一种不易松脱的双结〕

Sense.DEF: directly and firmly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He turned and faced her squarely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他转过身来和她正面相对。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She hit him squarely on the nose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不偏不倚地打在他的鼻子上。

Sense.DEF: completely and with no doubt
Sense.EXAMPLE: The blame lies squarely on the shoulders of the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 责任全在警方身上。

Sense.DEF: straight on something and centrally
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dr Soames jammed his hat squarely on his head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 索姆斯博士把帽子端端正正戴在头上。

Sense.DEF: at 90˚ to a line
the square root of a number is the number which, when multiplied by itself, equals that number

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The square root of nine is three.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 9 的平方根是 3。

Sense.DEF: shaped almost like a square
to press something into a flatter shape, often breaking or damaging it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cake got a bit squashed on the way here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛋糕在送来这里的路上有点压坏了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her hair had been squashed down by her hat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的头发被帽子压得平平的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Move over - you’re squashing me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 挪过去点﹐你挤着我了。

PIC.HEADING: SQUASH 挤扁
PIC.PICCONTENT: squeeze 挤；squash 踩碎；crush 捏扁

Sense.DEF: to push yourself or something else into a space that is too small

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Seven of us squashed into the car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们七个挤进了汽车。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We can probably squash another couple of things in.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们也许还可以塞几件东西进去。

Sense.DEF: to use your power or authority to stop something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her suggestions were always squashed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的建 议总是受到压制。

GramExa.GLOSS: say that a rumour etc is not true
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 辟谣/粉碎希望/压制报道等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government was quick to squash any hopes of reform.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一有改革的苗头﹐政府马上就进行打压。

Sense.DEF: to control or ignore an emotion
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt anger rising but quickly squashed it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感到怒气往上冲﹐但很快就把它抑制住了。

Sense.DEF: to move closer together or closer to something, especially in order to make room for someone or something else
Sense.TRAN: 挤在一起〔尤为腾出地方给别人或别的东西〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The others squashed up against Jo.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他人都挤到乔这边来了。

Sense.DEF:
a game played by two people who use
rackets
to hit a small rubber ball against the walls of a square court
Sense.EXAMPLE: a squash court
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 壁球场

Sense.DEF: used to say that there is not enough space for everyone to fit in comfortably

one of a group of large vegetables with solid flesh and hard skins, such as
pumpkins
a drink made from fruit juice, sugar, and water
Sense.EXAMPLE: a glass of orange squash
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一杯橙汁

Sense.DEF: broken or made flat by being pressed hard
Sense.EXAMPLE: squashed tomatoes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 压扁了的番茄

Sense.DEF: in a space that is too small
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was squashed between Jan and Dave in the back seat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我坐在后座﹐被简和戴夫夹在中间。

Sense.DEF: soft and easy to press
to sit with your knees bent under you and your bottom just off the ground, balancing on your feet

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He squatted down beside the little girl.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在小女孩身边蹲了下来。

Sense.DEF: to live in a building or on a piece of land without permission and without paying rent
short and thick or low and wide, especially in a way which is not attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: squat stone cottages
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 矮而宽的小石屋
Sense.EXAMPLE: a squat little old man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个矮胖的小老头

Sense.DEF: a squatting position
a house that people are living in without permission and without paying rent
Sense.EXAMPLE: She lives in a squat in Camden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在卡姆登私占了一间房子住着。

Sense.DEF: nothing, or nearly nothing. Squat is often used in negative sentences for emphasis
Sense.TRAN: 没有﹐几乎没有〔常用于否定句中以示强调〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a job that paid him squat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有一份几乎不赚什么钱的工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You don’t know squat about it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你对此毫不知情。

Sense.DEF: someone who lives in an empty building or on a piece of land without permission and without paying rent
Sense.TRAN: 擅自占用空房[空地]的人

Sense.DEF: a word for a Native American woman, now usually considered offensive
Sense.TRAN: 美洲土著女子〔现在一般认为该词具有冒犯性〕

Sense.DEF: if a bird squawks, it makes a loud sharp angry sound
to complain loudly and angrily
to make a short high noise or cry that is not loud
Sense.TRAN: 发出吱吱声[短促的尖叫声]
Sense.EXAMPLE: A rat squeaked and ran into the bushes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一只老鼠吱吱叫着跑进了灌木丛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The door squeaked open.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门吱呀一声开了。

Sense.DEF: to say something in a very high voice, especially because you are nervous or excited
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因紧张或激动〕尖叫﹐尖声说（话）
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Too late!’ she squeaked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “太晚了！”她尖叫道。

Sense.DEF: to succeed, win, or pass a test by a very small amount so that you only just avoid failure
Sense.TRAN: 侥幸成功﹔险胜﹔勉强通过〔测试〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She just squeaked through her math test.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她数学测验只是勉强及格。

Sense.DEF: a very short high noise or cry

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a squeak of alarm
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 闹钟短促的响声
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the high-pitched squeak of a bat
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 蝙蝠的尖叫声

Sense.DEF: if there is not a squeak from someone, they do not say anything or communicate at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: We didn’t hear a squeak from him in months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们几个月都没有他的任何消息。

Sense.DEF: making very high noises that are not loud
Sense.TRAN: 发出短而尖的声音的﹔吱吱叫的﹐嘎吱作响的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a squeaky voice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 又高又尖的嗓音
Sense.EXAMPLE: squeaky floorboards
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘎吱作响的地板

Subsense.DEF: never having done anything morally wrong
Subsense.TRAN: 品行端正的﹐清清白白的
Subsense.EXAMPLE: politicians who are less than squeaky clean
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 并非品行完美的政治家

Subsense.DEF: completely clean
Subsense.EXAMPLE: squeaky clean hair
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 干干净净的头发

Sense.DEF: to make a long loud high sound or cry
Sense.TRAN: 发出长而尖锐的声音[叫声]﹔用长而尖的声音说

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The children squealed with delight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们高兴得尖叫起来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They drove off, tyres squealing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们开车走了﹐轮胎发出吱的一声。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Let me go!’ she squealed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “让我走！”她尖声叫道。

Sense.DEF: to tell the police or someone in authority about someone you know who has done something wrong
a long loud high sound or cry

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She gave a squeal of laughter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她发出了一声尖笑。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a squeal of brakes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 刹车时发出吱的一声。

Sense.DEF: easily shocked or upset, or easily made to feel sick by seeing unpleasant things
Sense.TRAN: 易受惊的﹔易恶心的﹔神经脆弱的

Sense.DEF: people who are squeamish
Sense.EXAMPLE: His new novel is not for the squeamish .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的新小说不是给神经脆弱的人看的。

Sense.DEF: a tool with a thin rubber blade and a short handle, used for removing or spreading a liquid on a surface
to press something firmly together with your fingers or hand
Sense.EXAMPLE: She smiled as he squeezed her hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他捏了捏她的手﹐她笑了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He squeezed the trigger, but nothing happened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他扣动扳机﹐但没有反应。

Sense.DEF: to get liquid from something by pressing it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Squeeze the oranges.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把橙子榨一榨。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Try to squeeze a bit more out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量再挤一点出来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Squeeze a bit of lemon juice onto the fish.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 挤点柠檬汁在鱼上。

Sense.DEF: to try to make something fit into a space that is too small, or to try to get into such a space

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Five of us squeezed into the back seat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们五个挤进了后座。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had squeezed through a gap in the fence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从围栏的一个缺口挤了过去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We could probably squeeze in a few more people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们也许还可以再挤进去几个人。

Sense.DEF: to close your eyes very tightly
to succeed, win, or pass a test by a very small amount so that you only just avoid failure
Sense.EXAMPLE: Greece just squeezed through into the next round.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希腊队勉强进入了下一轮比赛。

Sense.DEF: to strictly limit the amount of money that is available to a company or organization
Sense.TRAN: 严格限制〔公司或组织的资金〕﹔压缩
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government is squeezing the railways’ investment budget.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府在压缩铁路投资预算。

Sense.DEF: to manage to meet someone or do something although you are very busy
Sense.TRAN: 〔在很忙的时候〕设法见某人/安排做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: How do you manage to squeeze so much into one day?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一天里怎么能有时间做那么多事情？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can squeeze you in at four o’clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能挤出时间在四点钟见你。

Sense.DEF: to do something so that someone or something is no longer included or able to continue
Sense.TRAN: 把…挤出﹐使不再包括在内﹔使无法继续
Sense.EXAMPLE: If budgets are cut, vital research may be squeezed out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果预算减少﹐重要的研究项目就可能被 挤掉。

Sense.DEF: to squeeze something wet in order to remove the liquid from it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Squeeze the cloth out first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 先把布拧干。

Sense.DEF: to force someone to tell you something
Sense.EXAMPLE: See if you can squeeze more information out of them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看看你能否逼他们说出更多的 东西。

Sense.DEF: to move close to the person next to you to make space for someone else
Sense.TRAN: 挤紧〔以便腾出地方给别人〕

Sense.DEF: a situation in which there is only just enough room for things or people to fit somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’ll be a squeeze with six people in the car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆汽车坐六个人会很挤。

Sense.DEF: an act of pressing something firmly with your fingers or hand
Sense.EXAMPLE: Marty gave her hand a little squeeze .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马蒂轻轻地捏了一下她的手。

Sense.DEF: a small amount of juice obtained by squeezing a piece of fruit
Sense.TRAN: 挤出的少量柠檬汁/来檬汁等

Sense.DEF: a situation in which wages, prices, borrowing money etc are strictly controlled or reduced

GramExa.EXAMPLE: cuts due to the squeeze on public sector spending
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 由公共部门开支紧缩引起的削减

Sense.EXAMPLE: a credit squeeze
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 信贷紧缩
Sense.EXAMPLE: All manufacturers are feeling the squeeze noticing the effects of a difficult financial situation .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的生产商都感到资金紧张。

Sense.DEF: to try to persuade someone to do something

someone’s
boyfriend
or
girlfriend

an
accordion

an object used for squeezing juice from fruit such as
lemons
to make a sucking sound by walking or moving in something soft and wet
Sense.TRAN: 〔在湿软之物中行走或移动时〕发吧唧声
Sense.EXAMPLE: My hair was dripping and my shoes squelched as I walked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的头发在滴水﹐鞋子走起来咕叽咕叽地响。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We squelched across the field.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们吧唧吧唧地走过田野。

Sense.DEF: to stop something from continuing to develop or spread
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her creativity had been squelched.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的创造力受到了压制。

Sense.DEF: squelchy mud or ground is soft and wet and makes a sucking noise when you walk on it
Sense.TRAN: 〔烂泥或地面在人走动时〕吧唧吧唧作响的

Sense.DEF:
a small exploding
firework
a short amusing piece of writing that attacks someone
a sea creature with a long soft body and ten arms around its mouth
soft and easy to press
Sense.EXAMPLE: We don’t want soft squidgy sandwiches.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不要软塌塌的三明治。

Sense.DEF: slightly drunk
a line with irregular curves
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shorthand just looks like a series of funny squiggles to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 速记在我看来就像是一串扭来扭去的奇怪线条。

Sense.DEF: to look at something with your eyes partly closed in order to see better
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anna squinted in the sudden bright sunlight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太阳光突然变强﹐安娜眯起了眼睛。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stop squinting at the screen - put your glasses on.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别眯着眼睛看屏幕——把眼镜戴上。

Sense.DEF: to have each eye looking in a slightly different direction
a condition of your eye muscles that makes each eye look in a slightly different direction
to look at something
Sense.TRAN: 看一眼某物﹔瞟一眼某物

Sense.DEF: the man who in the past owned most of the land around a country village in England
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时英格兰乡村的〕大地主﹐乡绅

Sense.DEF:
a young man in the Middle Ages who learned how to be a
knight
by serving one
used by some men to address a man when they do not know his name
Sense.TRAN: 先生〔某些男人对不知道姓名的男性的称呼〕

Sense.DEF: to twist your body from side to side because you are uncomfortable or nervous, or to get free from something which is holding you
Sense.TRAN: 扭动﹔蠕动﹔扭来扭去〔因不舒服﹑紧张或想挣脱某物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Christine squirmed uncomfortably in her chair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯蒂娜坐在椅子上不自在地扭来扭去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The boy tried to squirm free.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那男孩想要挣脱开。

Sense.DEF: to feel very embarrassed or ashamed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He made me squirm with embarrassment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他令我窘得无地自容。

Sense.DEF: a small animal with a long furry tail that climbs trees and eats nuts
to keep something in a safe place to use later
Sense.EXAMPLE: By December I had $300 squirreled away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到十二月份的时候﹐我已经存了 300 美元。

Sense.DEF: not able to stay still
Sense.TRAN: 静不下来的﹔无法待着不动的
Sense.EXAMPLE: squirrely kids
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 静不下来的小孩子

Sense.DEF: if you squirt liquid or if it squirts somewhere, it is forced out in a thin fast stream

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Water suddenly squirted out from a hole in the pipe.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然有水从管子上的一个孔里喷射出来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Squirt some oil in the lock.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 往锁里面喷些油。

Sense.DEF: to hit or cover someone or something with a thin fast stream of liquid

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mom! Chad’s squirting me with the hose!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈！查德用水管喷我！

Sense.EXAMPLE: Some kids squirted a water pistol in her face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几个小孩用水枪朝她脸上喷水。

Sense.DEF: a fast thin stream of liquid

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a squirt of water
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 喷出的一股水柱

Sense.DEF: an insulting word for a short person, especially someone who is annoying you
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指使你气恼的〕小矮子﹐小东西 〔侮辱性用语〕

Sense.DEF:
a
water pistol
to make a soft sucking sound by moving in or through something soft and wet
Sense.TRAN: 〔在湿软之物中移动或穿过时〕发出吧唧声

Sense.DEF:
to
squash
something, especially something soft and wet, or to become squashed
soft and easy to press
Sense.EXAMPLE: squishy mud
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黏糊糊的泥

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= senior 年纪较大的﹐老〔父子同名时﹐用于父亲的姓名后〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Douglas Fairbanks, Sr.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老道格拉斯•费尔班克斯

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= señor 先生
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sr Lopez
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洛佩斯先生

Sense.TRAN:
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= Sister , used in front of the name of a
nun
修女〔用于修女名字前〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sr Bernadette
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝尔纳黛特修女

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写= steamship 汽船﹐大轮船
Sense.EXAMPLE: aboard the SS Great Britain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在“大英帝国”号轮船上

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= saints 【英】 圣徒
Sense.EXAMPLE: statues of SS Augustine and Thomas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣奥古斯丁和圣托马斯的雕像

Sense.DEF: used to ask people to be quiet
Sense.TRAN: 嘘〔用于要求别人保持安静〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ssh! You’ll wake everybody up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嘘！ 你会把大家都吵醒的。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= stone or 或 stones 英石
Sense.EXAMPLE: She weighs 9 st 8 lb.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她体重 9 英石 8 磅。

Sense.DEF:
forms written
ordinal
numbers with 1
Sense.TRAN: 〔加在数字 1 后构成序数词〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the 1st first prize
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一等奖
Sense.EXAMPLE: my 21st birthday
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的 21 岁生日

Sense.DEF:
another form of the suffix
-est2
Sense.TRAN: 后缀 -est 的另一种形式
Sense.EXAMPLE: thou dost you do
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你做

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= Street , used in addresses 街〔用于地址〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wall St.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 华尔街

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= saint 圣徒
Sense.EXAMPLE: St Luke’s Gospel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《圣路加福音》

Sense.DEF: to push a knife into someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was stabbed to death in a fight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在一次打斗中被捅死了。

GramExa.PROPFORM: stab sb in the heart/arm etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had been stabbed in the chest repeatedly.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她胸口被刺数刀。

Sense.DEF: to make quick pushing movements with your finger or something pointed
Sense.EXAMPLE: He raised his voice and stabbed the air with his pen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他提高嗓门﹐并用钢笔在空中比画。

Sense.DEF: to do something that harms someone who likes and trusts you
Sense.TRAN: 背后中伤某人﹔背叛某人

Sense.DEF: an act of stabbing or trying to stab someone with a knife
Sense.EXAMPLE: severe stab wounds
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 严重的刺伤
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stab victim
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个被刀捅了的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: He killed him with a stab to the heart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一刀刺中他心脏把他杀死了。

Sense.DEF: a sudden sharp feeling of pain or a strong emotion
Sense.EXAMPLE: He felt a stab of guilt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他感到一阵愧疚。

Sense.DEF: an attempt to do something, often not successfully

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll have one more stab at it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要再试一次。

Sense.DEF: when someone you thought was a friend tries to harm you
a stabbing pain is sharp and sudden
Sense.TRAN: 〔疼痛〕突然而剧烈的﹐如刀刺的

Sense.DEF: a crime in which someone is stabbed
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fatal stabbing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 持刀伤人致死

Sense.DEF: the condition of being steady and not changing
Sense.EXAMPLE: a period of relative stability
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 相对稳定的一段时期

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It could threaten the peace and stability of the region.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这可能威胁到该地区的和平与稳定。

Sense.DEF: the ability of a substance to stay in the same state
to become firm, steady, or unchanging, or to make something firm or steady
Sense.EXAMPLE: The patient’s condition has now stabilized.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 病人的情况现已稳定下来了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to stabilize the economy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 稳定经济的努力

Sense.DEF: a chemical that helps something such as a food to stay in the same state, for example to prevent it from separating into different liquids
a piece of equipment that helps make something such as a plane or ship steady
one of a pair of small wheels that are fastened to the back wheel of a child’s bicycle to prevent it from falling over
Sense.TRAN: 〔儿童自行车车后轮两侧的〕稳定轮

Sense.DEF: steady and not likely to move or change
Sense.EXAMPLE: A wide base will make the structure much more stable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宽大的底座会使结构牢固许多。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is said to be in a stable condition in hospital.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 据说他在医院里病情稳定。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Children like a stable environment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童喜欢稳定的环境。

Sense.DEF: calm, reasonable, and not easy to upset
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was clearly not a very stable person.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 显然他不是一个情绪很稳定的人。

Sense.DEF:
a stable substance tends to stay in the same chemical or
atomic
state
a building where horses are kept
a place where horses are kept and that often gives riding lessons
Sense.TRAN: 马场〔养马并常常教授骑术的地方〕

Sense.DEF: a group of racing horses that has one owner or trainer
Sense.TRAN: 〔一位马主或驯马师所拥有的〕一群赛马

Sense.DEF: a group of people working for the same company or with the same trainer
Sense.TRAN: 〔在同一家公司工作或受同一教练训练的〕一批人
Sense.EXAMPLE: actors from the same Hollywood stable
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 同一家好莱坞公司旗下的演员

Sense.LEXUNIT: shut/close the stable door after the horse has bolted
Sense.DEF: to try to prevent something when it is too late and harm has already been done
to put or keep a horse in a stable
a man or boy who works in a stable
a girl or woman who works in a stable
something produced by the same company, or someone who works for the same company
Sense.TRAN: 某人的同事/同机构的某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Daily Mirror’s Scottish stablemate, the Daily Record
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《每日镜报》的苏格兰姊妹报——《每日纪事报》

Sense.DEF: space in a building where horses can be kept
if music is played staccato, the notes are cut short
a neat pile of things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a stack of papers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一叠文件

Sense.EXAMPLE: stacks of dirty dishes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一摞摞脏盘子

Sense.LEXUNIT: a stack of sth/stacks of sth
Sense.DEF: a large amount of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s got stacks of money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有许多钱。

Sense.DEF: a chimney
the rows of shelves in a library where the books are kept
to make things into a neat pile, or to form a neat pile
Sense.EXAMPLE: The assistants price the items and stack them on the shelves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 售货员给商品标价﹐然后把它们叠放到货架上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stacking hi-fi system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 组合式高保真音响设备

Sense.DEF: to put neat piles of things on something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He went back to stacking the shelves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他继续把货物摆上货架。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The floor was stacked with boxes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 地板上堆满了箱子。

Sense.LEXUNIT: the odds/cards are stacked against sb
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is unlikely to be successful
to arrange cards dishonestly in a game
to make things into a neat pile
used to talk about how good something is compared with something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Parents want to know how their kids’ schools stack up against others.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 家长希望了解自己孩子的学校比起其他学校来如何。

Sense.DEF: if a number of things stack up, they gradually collect or get stuck in one place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Traffic stacked up behind the bus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共汽车后面的车排起了长龙。

Sense.DEF: used to describe a woman with large breasts
a building for public events, especially sports and large rock music concerts, consisting of a playing field surrounded by rows of seats
Sense.EXAMPLE: the new Olympic Stadium
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的奥林匹克体育场

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 英国英语中亦用复数动词
Sense.DEF: the people who work for an organization

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our department has a staff of seven.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们部门有 7 名员工。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The entire staff has done an outstanding job this year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年全体员工工作都非常出色。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They employ a total of 150 staff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们一共雇用 150 名员工。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The staff were very helpful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工非常配合。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a strike by ambulance staff
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 救护人员的罢工

Sense.EXAMPLE: one of our longest-serving staff members
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们中服务年资最长的员工之一

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’d like to welcome a new member of staff.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想要欢迎一名新的员工加入。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were both on the staff of the British Film Institute at the time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时候﹐我们两个都是英国电影协会的员工。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Joan is the only lawyer we have on staff.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼是我们雇员中唯一的律师。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a staff meeting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工会议

GramExa.GLOSS: a room for teachers in a school

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: In British English, staff is often used as a plural noun and followed by a plural verb.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在英国英语中, staff 常用作复数名词,后跟复数动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We need to recruit more staff.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要招募更多员工。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: All the teaching staff were women.
F2NBox.EXPL: In American English, staff is not often used in this way, and is never followed by a plural verb.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在美国英语中, staff 通常不这样使用,也不可跟复数动词。
F2NBox.EXPL: You never refer to a person as 绝不可以说 ‘a staff’. Say 要说 a staff member, a member of staff (BrE【英】), or 或 an employee.

Subsense.DEF: a long thick stick to help you walk
a long thick stick that an official holds in some ceremonies

Sense.DEF: the set of five lines that music is written on
bread
to be or provide the workers for an organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: The centre is staffed mainly by volunteers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在该中心工作的主要是志愿者。

Sense.DEF: someone who is paid to work for an organization

a British hospital nurse whose rank is just below a
sister4
or
charge nurse
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国〕医院护士〔职位仅次于护士长〕

Sense.DEF: a military officer whose job is to help an officer of a higher rank

a lower rank in the army or the US Air Force or
marines
, or someone who has this rank
Sense.TRAN: 〔陆军〕上士﹔〔美国空军的〕中士﹔〔海军陆战队的〕上士

Sense.DEF:
a fully grown male
deer
if a man goes stag, he goes to a party without a woman
Sense.TRAN: 〔男子〕不带女伴参加社交聚会

Sense.DEF: a particular time or state that something reaches as it grows or develops

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the early stages of a child’s development
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童成长的早期
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s a good move at this stage in his career.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在他事业的这个阶段﹐这是很好的一步。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re getting to the stage where we hardly ever go out together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们快要到几乎不一起外出的地步了。

Sense.DEF: one of the parts which something such as a competition or process is divided into
Sense.TRAN: 〔比赛或过程中的某一〕阶段﹐段

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The team reached the semi-final stage of the competition.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 球队进入了半决赛阶段。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re now reaching the end of stage three of the construction.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们现在到了施工第三阶段的收尾期。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The next stage is to complete an application form.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下一步是填申请表。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rest of the money will be paid in stages a small amount at a time .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 余款将分期支付。

Sense.DEF: the raised area in a theatre which actors or singers stand on when they perform

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She is on stage for most of the play.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这出戏的大部分时间里她都在台上。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She appeared on stage with George Michael.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和乔治•迈克尔同台演出过。

Sense.DEF: acting as a profession, especially in theatres
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wanted to go on the stage become an actor .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想去当演员。
Sense.EXAMPLE: stars of stage and screen theatre and cinema
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戏剧和电影明星

Sense.DEF: if someone or something is centre stage, it has everyone’s attention, or is very important
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anne’s sculpture took centre stage at the show.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安妮的雕塑作品成为展会上大家关注的焦点。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The UN has moved to the centre stage of world politics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国已经成为国际政治的核心。

Sense.DEF: a place or area of activity where something important happens
Sense.TRAN: 〔重大事件发生的〕地点﹐场所﹔〔活动的〕舞台

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s an experienced campaigner on the world stage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是国际舞台上一位经验丰富的活动家。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: important figures on the European political stage
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲政治舞台上的重要人物

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Geneva has been the stage for many such conferences.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 日内瓦已成为众多此类会议的举办地点。

Sense.DEF: to prepare for something or make something possible
Sense.TRAN: 为某事做准备﹔使某事成为可能
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will this agreement merely set the stage for another war?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个协议是否只会酿成另一场战争？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Sometimes there are problems in the early stages of a project.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 项目初期阶段有时会出现问题。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She was well cared for during the final stages of her life.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在生命的最后阶段得到了很好的照料。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He was in the lead at the halfway stage.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在中途处于领先。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Negotiations are at an advanced stage.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 谈判已进入后期阶段。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It marked the beginning of a new stage in my life.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这标志着我的人生开始进入一个新阶段。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very important because it affects the future success of something
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 关键的/至关重要的阶段

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when someone or something is developing

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We have reached the stage where no-one is safe to walk our streets at night.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已经到了没人能在夜间安全上街的地步了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He is entering a new stage of his career.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他正步入事业的新阶段。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Most young people go through a rebellious stage.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻人大多会经历一个叛逆期。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The election marks an important stage in the rebuilding of the country.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 选举标志着国家重建进入一个重要阶段。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We then took the experiment a stage further.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 然后我们将实验向前推进了一步。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We have several ideas in various stages of development.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在不同的发展阶段有多个想法。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: at a time in the past
Collocate.EXAMPLE: At one stage I had to tell him to calm down.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一度不得不叫他冷静下来。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Four out of ten people are likely to contract cancer at some stage in their lives.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 每十个人中有四个人可能在其一生的某个阶段罹患癌症。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: At this stage his wife did not realise he was missing.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这时候他妻子并没有意识到他失踪了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I can’t change my plans at this late stage.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我无法在如此接近尾声的阶段更改计划了。

Sense.DEF: to organize a public event

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Activists staged a protest outside the parliament.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 积极分子在议会外组织了一场抗议活动。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: exhibitions staged in Paris
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在巴黎举办的展览会
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The candidates’ public appearances were carefully staged not natural .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 候选人的公开露面都是经过精心安排的。

Sense.DEF: to start doing something again or being successful, after you had stopped or not been successful for some time
Sense.EXAMPLE: He staged an amazing comeback.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他奇迹般地复出了。

Sense.DEF: a vehicle pulled by horses that was used in past times for carrying passengers and letters
skill and experience in writing, or organizing the performance of, a play
Sense.TRAN: 编剧技巧﹔戏剧导演技巧

Sense.DEF: a written instruction to an actor to do something in a play
the side or back entrance to a theatre, used by actors and theatre workers
Sense.TRAN: 〔供演员及剧院工作人员使用的〕剧院入口

Sense.DEF: nervousness felt by someone who is going to perform in front of a lot of people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Den suffered terribly from stage fright .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 德恩非常怯场。
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attack of stage fright
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵怯场

Sense.DEF: someone who works on a theatre stage, getting it ready for a play or for the next part of a play

on the left side of a theatre stage from the view of an actor facing the people in the
audience
Sense.TRAN: 〔演员面对观众时〕在舞台左侧
Sense.EXAMPLE: He entered stage left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他由舞台左侧上场。

Sense.DEF: to organize a public event, such as a meeting, in a way that will give you the result that you want – often used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 精心安排﹐周密策划〔公开活动﹔常含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The press conference was cleverly stage-managed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 记者招待会安排得很巧妙。

Sense.DEF:
someone who is in charge of the technical parts of organizing a performance of a play, such as the
lighting
,
scenery
etc
a name used by an actor instead of his or her real name

on the right side of a theatre stage from the view of an actor facing the people in the
audience
Sense.TRAN: 〔演员面对观众时〕在舞台右侧
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had to exit stage right.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她必须从舞台右侧退场。

Sense.DEF: loving to see plays, or wanting very much to become an actor
Sense.TRAN: 爱看戏剧的﹔渴望当演员的

Sense.DEF:
a loud
whisper
used by an actor in a play, which the other actors on the stage seem not to hear
Sense.TRAN: 舞台上的低声旁白〔除了念白者其他演员装作听不见〕

Sense.DEF:
a loud
whisper
that is intended to be heard by everyone
Sense.TRAN: 故意让大家都能听见的悄悄话

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
stagy

an economic situation in which there is
inflation a continuing rise in prices
but many people do not have jobs and businesses are not doing well
Sense.TRAN: 停滞性通货膨胀﹐滞胀〔指出现通货膨胀﹐但许多人失业﹑商业萧条的一种经济状况〕

Sense.DEF: to walk or move unsteadily, almost falling over
Sense.EXAMPLE: He managed to stagger home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他好不容易才蹒跚着走回家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She staggered back a step.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她踉跄着后退了一步。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The old man staggered drunkenly to his feet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老汉醉醺醺地踉跄着站了起来。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel very surprised or shocked
Sense.EXAMPLE: What staggered us was the sheer size of her salary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令我们感到惊愕的是她的薪水之高。

Sense.DEF: to continue doing something when you seem to be going to fail and you do not know what will happen
Sense.TRAN: 〔在看来要失败或不知道结果的情况下〕硬撑﹐继续
Sense.EXAMPLE: He staggered on for another two years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他又硬撑了两年。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The company staggered from one crisis to the next.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司在一次又一次的危机中举步维艰。

Sense.DEF: to arrange people’s working hours, holidays etc so that they do not all begin and end at the same time
