Sense.EXAMPLE: Jim and his wife stagger their work hours so one of them can be at home with the kids.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆和妻子把工作时间错开﹐以便两个人中总有一个可以在家照料孩子。

Sense.DEF: to start a race with each runner at a different place on a curved track
Sense.TRAN: 使采用梯形起跑〔指环形跑道上运动员在不同的位置起跑〕

Sense.DEF: an unsteady movement of someone who is having difficulty in walking
extremely surprised
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was absolutely staggered when I saw the bill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到账单时﹐我大吃一惊。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was staggered by the directness of his question.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他直截了当的问题让她错愕。

Sense.DEF: extremely great or surprising
Sense.TRAN: 大得惊人的﹔令人吃惊的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cost was a staggering $10 million.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 费用竟高达 1,000 万美元。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The financial impact on the town was staggering.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对这个镇所造成的财政影响令人惊诧。

Sense.DEF: when a play is performed on stage
Sense.EXAMPLE: a modern-dress staging of ‘Hamlet’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿现代服装演出的《哈姆雷特》

Sense.DEF: a flat raised surface that is put up for a short time for people to stand and work on
a place where soldiers meet and where military equipment is gathered before it is moved to another place
a place where people, planes, ships etc stop on a long journey, for example to rest or get supplies
Sense.EXAMPLE: a staging post on the flight from Australia
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 澳大利亚出发航班的中途站

Sense.DEF: stagnant water or air does not move or flow and often smells bad
Sense.TRAN: 〔水或空气〕不流动的﹐污浊的﹐发臭的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stagnant pond
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 死水塘

Sense.DEF: not changing or making progress, and continuing to be in a bad condition
Sense.EXAMPLE: a government plan to revive the stagnant economy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府振兴低迷经济的计划

Sense.DEF: to stop developing or making progress
Sense.EXAMPLE: Growth is expected to stagnate next year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预计明年增长会停滞。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His career had stagnated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的事业停滞不前了。

Sense.DEF: a night before a man’s wedding, which he spends with his male friends, drinking or having a party
Sense.TRAN: 单身告别之夜〔指男子结婚前和男性朋友喝酒聚会的夜晚〕

Sense.DEF: a party for men only, especially on the night before a man’s wedding
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指男子结婚前一夜举办的〕单身告别聚会

Sense.DEF: behaviour that is stagy is not natural and is like the way an actor behaves on a stage
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为等〕不自然的﹐演戏似的﹐做作的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a very stagy manner
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常做作的举止

Sense.DEF: serious, old-fashioned, and boring
Sense.TRAN: 严肃呆板的﹔古板的﹔枯燥的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a staid old bachelor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个古板的老光棍

Sense.DEF: to accidentally make a mark on something, especially one that cannot be removed, or to be marked in this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Be careful you don’t stain the carpet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当心别把地毯弄脏了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This tablecloth stains very easily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这块桌布很容易脏。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her fingers were stained yellow from years of smoking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的手指因长年吸烟被熏黄了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a cowboy hat stained with dust and sweat
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沾满尘土和汗渍的牛仔帽

Sense.DEF: to change the colour of something, especially something made of wood, by using a special liquid
Sense.TRAN: 给〔某物﹐尤指木制品〕染色[着色]
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve decided to stain the shelves blue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们决定把架子涂成蓝色。

Sense.DEF: to damage the good opinion that people have about someone
Sense.TRAN: 玷污某人的名声/名誉等

Sense.DEF: a mark that is difficult to remove, especially one made by a liquid such as blood, coffee, or ink

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a dark red stain on the carpet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 地毯上有一处深红色的污迹。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: White vinegar is great for removing stains.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 白醋去污效果很好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How do you get wine stains out of a tablecloth?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如何去除桌布上的葡萄酒渍？

GramExa.GLOSS: ones that are very difficult to remove

Sense.DEF: a special liquid that you use to change the colour of something, especially wood
something that damages the good opinion that people have about someone
Sense.TRAN: 某人性格/名声/名誉等方面的污点

Sense.DEF: glass of different colours, used for making pictures and patterns in windows, especially in a church
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指教堂窗户上的〕彩色玻璃
Sense.EXAMPLE: stained glass windows
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彩色玻璃窗

Sense.DEF:
a type of steel that does not
rust
Sense.EXAMPLE: stainless steel cutlery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不锈钢餐具

Sense.DEF: a set of steps built for going from one level of a building to another

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jerry ran up the stairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰里跑上楼去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I left my briefcase at the top of the stairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把公文包遗忘在楼梯顶端了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Lisa,’ he cried from the foot of the stairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “莉萨。”他在楼梯脚喊道。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We walked up four flights of stairs sets of stairs .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们往上走了四段楼梯。

Sense.DEF: one of the steps in a set of stairs
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lucy sat down on the bottom stair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 露西在楼梯最下面的一级上坐了下来。

Sense.DEF:
a
staircase
in the servants’ part of a large house, in the past
a set of stairs inside a building with its supports and the side parts that you hold on to
a staircase, especially a large or impressive one
the space going up through all the floors of a building, where the stairs go up
Sense.TRAN: 楼梯井〔指建筑物内楼梯所占的空间〕

Sense.DEF: if something that you value very much is at stake, you will lose it if a plan or action is not successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: They have to win the contract – thousands of jobs are at stake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们必须拿下这份合同﹐这关系到数千个工作岗位。
Sense.EXAMPLE: National pride is at stake in next week’s game against England.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下星期对英格兰队的比赛关乎民族尊严。

Sense.DEF:
if you have a stake in a business, you have
invested
money in it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He holds a 51% stake in the firm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在这家公司拥有 51% 的股份。

Sense.DEF: if you have a stake in something, you will get advantages if it is successful, and you feel that you have an important connection with it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Young people don’t feel they have a stake in the country’s future.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻人觉得自己与国家的未来没有关系。

Sense.DEF: money that you risk as the result of a horse race, card game etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: For a dollar stake, you can win up to $1,000,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 押一美元赌注﹐最多可赢一百万美元。

Subsense.DEF: if the stakes are high when you are trying to do something, you risk losing a lot or it will be dangerous if you fail
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Climbing is a dangerous sport and the stakes are high .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爬山是一项危险的运动﹐风险很大。

Subsense.DEF: if the stakes are high when you are doing something such as playing a card game, you risk losing a lot of money
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We’re playing for high stakes here.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们现在正赌得很大。

Sense.DEF: a pointed piece of wood, metal etc, especially one that is pushed into the ground to support something or mark a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: tent stakes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帐篷桩

GramExa.EXAMPLE: two stakes into the ground about three feet apart.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 往地下打两根桩﹐相隔大约三英尺的 距离。

Sense.DEF: a post to which a person was tied in former times before being killed by burning
Sense.EXAMPLE: Suspected witches were burnt at the stake .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被怀疑是女巫的人被烧死在火刑柱上。

Sense.DEF: used when saying how popular, fashionable etc someone or something is
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ben wouldn’t score very highly in the popularity stakes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本的人缘不是很好。

Sense.LEXUNIT: (be prepared to) go to the stake for/over sth
Sense.DEF: to be willing to do anything to protect or defend an idea, or belief
Sense.TRAN: （准备）为保护[捍卫]某事物甘冒巨大风险
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s my opinion, but I wouldn’t go to the stake for it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是我的观点﹐但我也不会非要坚持。

Sense.DEF: to leave your job or home 【非正式】
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re going to pull up stakes and move to Montana.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们打算把家搬到蒙大拿州去。

Sense.DEF: to risk losing something that is valuable or important to you on the result of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kevin is staking his reputation on the success of the project.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯文把自己的名誉都押在这个项目上﹐赌它一定会成功。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jim staked his whole fortune on one card game.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆把自己的全部财产都押在一次牌局中。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I’d stake my life on it
Sense.DEF: used when saying that you are completely sure that something is true, or that something will happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sure that’s Jesse – I’d stake my life on it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我肯定那人就是杰西——我敢以性命打赌。

Sense.DEF: to support something with stakes
Sense.EXAMPLE: Young trees have to be staked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小树必须用桩子支撑。

Sense.DEF: to mark or enclose an area of ground with stakes
Sense.TRAN: 用标桩标出[围起]〔某一地区〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A corner of the field has been staked off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这块地的一角用标桩围了起来。

Sense.DEF: to say publicly that you think you have a right to have or own something
Sense.TRAN: 公开声明（对…）拥有所有权

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Both countries staked a claim to the islands.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两国都宣称对这些岛屿拥有主权。

Sense.DEF: to watch a place secretly and continuously
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police officers have been staking out the warehouse for weeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察对这座仓库已经监视好了几个星期。

Sense.DEF: to mark or control a particular area so that you can have it or use it
Sense.EXAMPLE: We went to the show early to stake out a good spot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们早早地去了表演地点﹐抢占一个好位置。

Sense.DEF: to state your opinions about something in a way that shows how your ideas are clearly separate from other people’s ideas
Sense.TRAN: 明确表明〔自己的观点〕﹐毫不含糊地说明〔自己的立场〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Johnson staked out the differences between himself and the other candidates.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰逊明确表明了自己与其他候选人之间的不同之处。

Sense.DEF:
someone who has
invested
money into something, or who has some important connection with it, and therefore is affected by its success or failure
Sense.TRAN: 参与人﹐投资者﹐有权益关系者

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Citizens should be stakeholders in the society they live in.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公民应该是与所处的社会休戚相关的一分子。

Sense.DEF: someone, usually a lawyer, who takes charge of a property during a quarrel or a sale
Sense.TRAN: 〔争执或出售时期的〕财产保管人〔一般为律师〕

Sense.DEF: someone chosen to hold the money that is risked by people on a race, competition etc and to give all of it to the winner
an economic system in a society that citizens feel they receive advantages from and have responsibilities to
when the police watch a place secretly and continuously in order to catch someone who is doing something illegal

a sharp pointed object hanging down from the roof of a
cave
, which is formed gradually by water that contains minerals as it drops slowly from the roof

a sharp pointed object coming up from the floor of a
cave
, formed by drops from a stalactite
bread or cake that is stale is no longer fresh or good to eat
Sense.EXAMPLE: French bread goes stale becomes stale very quickly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法式面包极易变味。
Sense.EXAMPLE: stale cake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不新鲜的蛋糕

Sense.DEF: air that is stale is not fresh or pleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: the smell of stale smoke
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 污浊的烟味

Sense.DEF: not interesting or exciting any more
Sense.TRAN: 不再有趣的﹐没有新意的﹐乏味的
Sense.EXAMPLE: stale jokes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老掉牙的笑话
Sense.EXAMPLE: Other marriages might go stale , but not theirs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别人的婚姻也许会变得平淡无味﹐但他们的婚姻不会。

Sense.DEF: if you get stale, you have no new ideas, interest, or energy, because you have been doing the same thing for too long
Sense.TRAN: 〔因长期从事同一工作而〕疲沓的﹐厌倦的﹐腻烦的
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you stay in the job for more than ten years, you get stale .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你做同一份工作超过十年﹐就会感到腻烦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was becoming stale and running out of ideas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他逐渐变得疲沓﹐没什么创意了。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which it seems impossible to settle an argument or disagreement, and neither side can get an advantage
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to break the stalemate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 打破僵局的努力
Sense.EXAMPLE: The discussions with the miners’ union ended in stalemate .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 同矿工工会的谈判以陷入僵局而告终。

Sense.DEF:
a position in
chess
in which neither player can win
Sense.TRAN: 〔国际象棋的〕无子可动﹐僵局﹐和棋

Sense.DEF: a long narrow part of a plant that supports leaves, fruits, or flowers
Sense.EXAMPLE: celery stalks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 芹菜茎

Sense.DEF: a thin upright object

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb’s eyes are out on stalks
Sense.DEF: if your eyes are out on stalks, you are very surprised or shocked
Sense.TRAN: 某人眼珠子都要掉出来了〔形容非常吃惊或震惊〕

Sense.DEF: to follow a person or animal quietly in order to catch and attack or kill them
Sense.TRAN: 〔为捉住并袭击或杀死某人或某动物而〕悄悄地跟踪﹐潜近
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tiger stalking its prey
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一只悄悄跟踪猎物的老虎
Sense.EXAMPLE: We know the rapist stalks his victims at night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们知道那个强奸犯在夜间偷偷地跟踪受害人。

Sense.DEF: to follow and watch someone over a long period of time in a way that is very annoying or threatening, and that is considered a crime in some places
Sense.TRAN: 〔以令人讨厌或生畏的方式〕跟踪﹐盯梢
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was stalked by an obsessed fan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被一名痴迷的崇拜者跟踪。

Sense.DEF: to walk in a proud or angry way, with long steps
Sense.TRAN: 〔高傲或气愤地〕高视阔步地走﹐大踏步走

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Yvonne turned and stalked out of the room in disgust.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊冯娜转过身﹐厌恶地大步走出房间。

Sense.DEF: if something bad stalks a place, you see or feel it everywhere in that place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fear stalks every dark stairwell and walkway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐惧笼罩着每个黑暗的楼梯井和走道。

Sense.DEF: someone who follows and watches another person over a period of time in a way that is very annoying or threatening
the crime of following and watching someone over a period of time in a way that is very annoying or threatening
Sense.TRAN: 〔对人造成骚扰或威胁的〕跟踪罪

Sense.DEF: someone or something that hides someone’s true purpose, especially a politician who says they want their leader’s job when the real plan is that another, more important politician should get it
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指竞选中的〕掩护性候选人﹔掩护者﹔障眼物

Sense.DEF: a table or a small shop with an open front, especially outdoors, where goods are sold
Sense.EXAMPLE: a market stall
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市场摊位

Sense.DEF: an enclosed area in a building for an animal such as a horse or cow
if a plane goes into a stall, its engine stops working
a seat in a row of fixed seats for priests and singers in some larger churches
Sense.TRAN: 〔一些大教堂中的〕牧师和唱诗班座位
Sense.EXAMPLE: choir stalls
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唱诗班席

Sense.DEF: a small enclosed private area for washing or using the toilet
the seats on the main level of a theatre or cinema
Sense.EXAMPLE: a good seat in the front row of the stalls
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正厅前排的好座位

Sense.DEF: if an engine or vehicle stalls, or if you stall it, it stops because there is not enough power or speed to keep it going
Sense.TRAN: （使）〔引擎或交通工具〕停止运转﹐熄火
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car kept stalling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆汽车老熄火。
Sense.EXAMPLE: An inexperienced pilot may easily stall a plane.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有经验的飞行员会很容易使飞机失速下降。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately delay because you are not ready to do something, answer questions etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Quit stalling and answer my question!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别拖延时间﹐快回答我的问题！
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was just stalling for time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只是在拖延时间。

Sense.DEF: to make someone wait or stop something from happening until you are ready
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maybe we can stall the sale until the prices go up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许我们可以拖到价格上涨时再出售。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve got to stall him somehow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须想办法拖住他。

Sense.DEF: to stop making progress or developing
Sense.EXAMPLE: While his career has stalled, hers has taken off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在他的事业停滞不前之际﹐她的事业却腾飞了。

Sense.DEF: someone who rents and keeps a market stall
a male horse that is fully grown, especially one that is used for breeding
someone who is very loyal to a particular organization or set of ideas, and works hard for them
Sense.TRAN: 〔某组织或思想的〕忠实拥护者﹐坚定分子
Sense.EXAMPLE: old party stalwarts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坚定的老党员

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rob’s a stalwart of the school’s chess club.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗布是学校国际象棋俱乐部的铁杆成员。

Sense.DEF: a very loyal and strong supporter etc
strong in appearance

the male part of a flower that produces
pollen
physical or mental strength that lets you continue doing something for a long time without getting tired
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need stamina to be a long-distance runner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当长跑运动员需要耐力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Elaine has the stamina and the determination to succeed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊莱恩具有成功所需的毅力和决心。

Sense.DEF: to speak with a lot of pauses and repeated sounds, either because you have a speech problem, or because you are nervous, excited etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whenever he was angry, he would begin to stammer slightly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一生气说话就开始有点结巴。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ben stammered out an apology.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本结结巴巴地道了个歉。

Sense.DEF: a speech problem which makes someone speak with a lot of pauses and repeated sounds
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jeff spoke with a slight stammer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰夫说话有点结巴。

Sense.DEF: a small piece of paper that you buy and stick onto an envelope or package before posting it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 29-cent stamp
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一枚 29 美分的邮票
Sense.EXAMPLE: Richard collects stamps.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 理查德集邮。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a second-class stamp
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张二类邮件的邮票

Sense.DEF: a tool for pressing or printing a mark or pattern onto a surface, or the mark made by this tool
Sense.EXAMPLE: a date stamp
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日期戳
Sense.EXAMPLE: a passport stamp
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 护照章

Sense.DEF: if something has the stamp of a particular quality, it clearly has that quality
Sense.TRAN: 具有某事物的特点[特征]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The speech bore had the stamp of authority.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此番讲话具有权威性。

Sense.DEF: a small piece of paper that is worth a particular amount of money and is bought and collected for something over a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: television licence stamps
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视许可证印花

Sense.DEF: a piece of paper for sticking to some official papers to show that British tax has been paid
Sense.TRAN: 印花税票〔在英国贴在正式文件上证明完税的票据〕

Sense.DEF: someone with a particular kind of character
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s clearly of a very different stamp.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他显然属于完全不同的一类人。

Sense.DEF: an act of stamping, especially with your foot
Sense.EXAMPLE: an angry stamp
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 气愤的跺脚

Sense.DEF: to put your foot down onto the ground loudly and with a lot of force
Sense.EXAMPLE: The audience stamped and shouted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 观众又是跺脚又是高声叫喊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I will not!’ Bert yelled and stamped his foot because he was angry .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我才不呢！”伯特跺着脚叫喊道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She stood at the bus stop stamping her feet because she was cold .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她站在公共汽车站头﹐不停地跺着脚。

GramExa.GLOSS: try to hurt or kill someone or something, by putting your foot down onto them
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Marta shrieked and started stamping on the cockroach.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛尔塔尖叫起来﹐并开始去踩那只蟑螂。

Sense.DEF: to walk somewhere in a noisy way by putting your feet down hard onto the ground because you are angry
Sense.TRAN: 〔因生气〕跺着脚走路﹐噔噔地走

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My mother stamped off down the stairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我妈妈噔噔地走下 楼去。

Sense.DEF: to put a pattern, sign, or letters on something, using a special tool
Sense.TRAN: 在…上面印盖〔图案﹑记号﹑字母等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The woman at the desk stamped my passport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坐服务台的那位女士在我的护照上盖了印。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Among the papers was a brown folder stamped ‘SECRET’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些文件中有一个盖有“机密”字样的棕色文件夹。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stamp the date on all the letters.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在所有的信件上加盖日期戳。

Sense.DEF: to have an important or permanent effect on someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 对…有重要[永久性]的影响
Sense.EXAMPLE: The experience remained stamped on her memory for many years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一经历多年来一直深深地印在她的记忆中。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His army years had stamped him with an air of brisk authority.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 军旅生涯使他养成了一种雷厉风行的作风。

Sense.DEF:
to stick a stamp onto a letter,
parcel
etc
Sense.TRAN: 在〔信封﹑包裹等〕上贴邮票

Sense.DEF: to show that someone has a particular type of character
Sense.TRAN: 表明〔某人〕是…﹐说明〔某人〕具有 〔某种特征〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was his manners that stamped him as a real gentleman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的举止表明他是一位十足的绅士。

Sense.DEF: to use force or your authority to stop someone from doing something, or stop something from happening, especially in an unfair way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Officers were given orders to stamp on any hint of trouble.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察奉命一有骚乱迹象就予以镇压。

Sense.DEF: to prevent something bad from continuing
Sense.EXAMPLE: We aim to stamp out poverty in our lifetimes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的目标是在有生之年消除贫困。

Sense.DEF: to stop a fire from burning by stepping hard on the flames
to make a shape or object by pressing hard on something using a machine or tool
the practice of collecting stamps from interest or because of their financial value
a tax that must be paid in Britain on particular legal documents that have to be officially checked, especially when buying a house
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国尤在买房时必须缴纳的〕印花税

Sense.DEF: an envelope with your name, your address and a stamp on it, which you send to a person or organization so that they can send you information
Sense.TRAN: 〔贴有邮票并写有自己姓名地址的〕回邮信封

Sense.DEF: when a group of people all want to do the same thing at the same time
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stampede to buy shares in high-tech companies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对高科技公司股票的抢购

Sense.DEF: when a group of large animals or people suddenly start running in the same direction because they are frightened or excited
Sense.TRAN: 〔人群的〕奔逃﹐蜂拥﹔〔动物的〕逃窜﹔狂奔
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cattle stampede
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛群的狂奔

Sense.DEF: if a group of large animals or people stampede, they suddenly start running together in the same direction because they are frightened or excited
Sense.EXAMPLE: a herd of stampeding buffalo
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群狂奔的水牛
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children came stampeding out of the school doors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们争先恐后地冲出校门。

Sense.DEF: to be made frightened or worried so that you do something too quickly, without thinking enough about it
Sense.TRAN: 〔因受惊吓或担心而〕仓促行事﹐草率行事

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t get stampeded into any rash decisions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要仓促行事﹐作出草率的决定。

Sense.DEF: a favourite place where someone often goes
an opinion that is stated publicly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What is your stance on environmental issues?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在环境问题上持什么立场？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a strong stance against abortion
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对堕胎的强硬立场

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The President has adopted a tough stance on terrorism.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统对恐怖主义采取强硬的立场。

Sense.DEF: a position in which you stand, especially when playing a sport
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fighting stance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 搏击姿势

Sense.DEF:
an American spelling of
staunch2
a strong upright bar used to support something
to support yourself on your feet or be in an upright position
Sense.EXAMPLE: It looks like we’ll have to stand – there are no seats left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看来我们只能站着——没有座位了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She stood in the doorway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她站在门口。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stand still do not move and listen to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 站好别动﹐听我说。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t just stand there stand and not do anything – help me!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要光站在那里﹐帮帮我！

GramExa.PROPFORM: stand on tiptoe/stand on your toes
GramExa.GLOSS: support yourself on your toes
GramExa.EXAMPLE: If he stood on tiptoe, he could reach the shelf.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他要是踮起脚尖﹐就能够到架子了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They just stood there laughing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们只是站在那里笑。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We stood watching the rain fall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们站着看雨点飘落。

Sense.DEF: to rise to an upright position
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smiling, she stood and closed the blinds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她微笑着站起来﹐关上百叶窗。

Subsense.DEF: to step a short distance

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She stood back to let him in.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她退后一步让他进来。

GramExa.GLOSS: step away from something in order to be safe
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stand clear of the doors, please.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 请别靠近门。

Subsense.DEF: to accidentally step on or in something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t stand in that puddle!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别踩在那个水坑里！

Sense.DEF: to be upright in a particular position, or to put something or someone somewhere in an upright position
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lamp stood on the table.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桌子上放着一盏灯。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Near the railway station stood a hotel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车站附近有家酒店。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some remains of the original house still stand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原先那所房子的残垣断壁依然还在。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you stand that pole in the corner for now?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能暂时把那根柱子竖在角落里吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I closed the lid and stood the case against the wall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我关上盖子﹐把盒子靠墙立好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stand Molly up on a chair so she can see.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 让莫莉站到椅子上﹐这样她就能够看见了。

Sense.DEF: to be or stay in a particular state or condition
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kitchen door stood open so she went in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厨房的门开着﹐于是她走了进去。

GramExa.GLOSS: not being used
GramExa.EXAMPLE: scores of derelict houses standing empty
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量闲置的废弃破房子

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not too thrilled with the way things stand the state that the situation is in at the moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对目前的情况感觉不是很兴奋。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The evidence, as it stands as it is now , cannot be conclusive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在的证据还不确凿。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to ask what is happening in a situation
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Where do things stand in terms of the budget?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 预算方面情况怎么样？

Sense.EXAMPLE: I will know within the next month or two how I stand what my situation is .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接下来的一两个月之内我就会知道自己的情况了。

GramExa.GLOSS: agree or disagree completely
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He urged the whole community to stand united and to reject terrorism.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他敦促整个社会团结起来抵制恐怖主义。

GramExa.GLOSS: be prepared to do something whenever it is necessary
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We should stand ready to do what is necessary to guarantee the peace.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们应该时刻准备着采取必要手段确保和平。

Sense.EXAMPLE: countries that have stood together stayed united in times of crisis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在危难时刻团结起来的国家

GramExa.GLOSS: admire them, be afraid of them, or both

Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not like someone or something at all, or that you think that something is extremely unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t stand bad manners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能容忍没有礼貌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know he can’t stand the sight of me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道他不喜欢看到我。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lily can’t stand working in an office.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莉莉受不了在办公室工作。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t stand people smoking around me when I’m eating.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我受不了吃饭时有人在我旁边抽烟。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She can’t stand to hear them arguing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她听不得他们吵架。

Sense.GRAM: T usually in questions and negatives
Sense.GRAMTRAN: 一般用于疑问句和否定句
Sense.DEF: to be able to accept or deal well with a difficult situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t stand the thought of leaving Danielle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到要离开丹妮尔我简直受不了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve had about as much as I can stand of your arguing!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们的争吵我受够了！
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t know if I can stand the waiting any longer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道我是否还能再等下去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How can you stand Marty coming home late all the time?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么受得了马蒂老是很晚回家？

Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a strong woman who stands no nonsense from anyone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是个很强势的女人﹐容不得任何人胡闹。

Sense.DEF: to be good or strong enough to last a long time or to experience a particular situation without being harmed, damaged, etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Linen can stand very high temperatures.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚麻织品能耐受很高的温度。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His poetry will stand the test of time stay popular .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的诗歌将经得起时间的考验。

Sense.DEF: to be likely to do or have something
Sense.TRAN: 很可能会做某事﹐可能有某物

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What do firms think they stand to gain by merging?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司认为通过合并会得到什么好处？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: After the oil spill, thousands of fishermen stand to lose their livelihoods.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 石油泄漏发生后﹐许多渔民很可能会失去生计。

Sense.DEF: to stay in a particular place without moving
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car’s been standing in the garage for weeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆汽车停在车库里好几个星期了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mixture was left to stand at room temperature for 15 minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 混合料在室温下放置了 15 分钟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The train was already standing at the platform.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车已经停靠站台。

Sense.DEF: to be a particular height
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trophy stands five feet high .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这奖杯高五英尺。
Sense.EXAMPLE: John stood six feet tall .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰身高六英尺。

Sense.DEF: to be at a particular level or amount

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His former workforce of 1,300 now stands at 220.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以前有 1,300 名职工﹐现在只有 220 人。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Illiteracy rates are still thought to stand above 50 percent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文盲比例仍被认为超过 50%。

Sense.DEF: to have a particular rank or position when compared with similar things or people
Sense.TRAN: 〔和同类相比〕位于﹐处于〔某种地位〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The president stands high in the public opinion polls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统在民意调查中排名很高。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How do their sales stand in relation to those of similar firms?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与同类公司相比较﹐他们的销售情况如何？
Sense.EXAMPLE: His book could stand alongside the best.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的书堪与最好的书比肩。

Sense.DEF: to try to become elected to a council, parliament etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She announced her intention to stand for parliament.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她宣布打算参加议员竞选。

Sense.DEF:
if a decision, offer etc stands, it continues to exist, be correct, or be
valid
Sense.EXAMPLE: Despite protests, the official decision stood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管有人抗议﹐官方决定仍维持不变。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My offer of help still stands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我说过愿意帮忙的话依然有效。

Sense.LEXUNIT: if you can’t stand the heat, get out of the kitchen
Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that they should leave a job or situation if they cannot deal with its difficulties
Sense.TRAN: 如果你应付不了就别干了

Sense.DEF: used to say very directly that it would be a good idea for someone to do something or for something to happen
Sense.TRAN: 某人最好做某事﹔某事应该发生
Sense.EXAMPLE: His smile exposed teeth that could stand a good scrubbing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一笑牙齿都露了出来﹐他的牙真该好好刷一刷了。

GramExa.PROPFORM: sb could stand to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: My doctor told me I could stand to lose a few pounds.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生说我的体重该减掉几磅了。

Sense.DEF: used to admit that your opinion or something that you just said was wrong
Sense.TRAN: 我接受批评﹐我承认错误〔用于承认自己的观点或刚才说过的话是错误的〕

Sense.DEF: someone’s opinion about something
Sense.TRAN: 某人（对某事）的看法[态度]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We still do not know where he stands on the matter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们仍然不知道他对此事的看法。

Sense.EXAMPLE: You must decide where you stand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你必须决定自己的立场。

Sense.DEF: according to what I know or feel
Sense.EXAMPLE: I knew from where I stood that the stocks were practically worthless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据我所知﹐这些股票实际上一钱不值了。

Sense.DEF: to know how someone feels about you, or what you are allowed to do in a particular situation
Sense.TRAN: 知道（某人）对你的看法﹐知道你被允许做什么
Sense.EXAMPLE: At least we know where we stand with Steven now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 至少我们现在知道史蒂文对我们的看法了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like to know where I stand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想知道我可以做什么。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It helps to know where you stand legally.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这有助于了解你可以合法地做些什么。

Sense.DEF: if soldiers stand to attention, they stand very straight and stiff to show respect
to support yourself on your head or hands, with your feet in the air
to wait in a line of people until it is your turn to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Customers stood in line for 20 minutes at the cash register.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 顾客在收银机前排了 20 分钟的队。

Subsense.DEF: to refuse to be forced to move backwards
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She stood firm, blocking the entrance.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她堵在入口处﹐不肯后退一步。

Subsense.DEF: to refuse to change your opinions, intentions, or behaviour
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The government continued to stand firm and no concessions were made.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府继续采取强硬态度﹐不作任何让步。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He stands firm on his convictions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坚持自己的信念。

Sense.DEF: to refuse to change a decision, plan etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Harry’s standing pat on his decision to fire Janice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈里坚持解雇贾尼丝的决定。

Subsense.DEF: to continue to do something alone, without help from anyone else
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Some of the Pacific islands are too small to stand alone as independent states.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 太平洋上的有些岛屿太小﹐无法单独作为独立的国家存在。

Subsense.DEF: to be much better than anything or anyone else
Subsense.EXAMPLE: For sheer entertainment value, Kelly stood alone.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纯粹从娱乐价值而言﹐凯利是出类拔萃的。

Sense.DEF: to not change or progress at all, even though time has passed
Sense.EXAMPLE: No industry can stand still.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何一种工业都不能止步不前。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Time seems to have stood still in this lovely hotel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这家宜人的酒店里﹐时间仿佛停顿了。

Sense.DEF: to be likely to be able to do something or to succeed
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll stand a better chance of getting a job with a degree.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有了学位﹐找到工作的机会就更大。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Maybe their relationship had never really stood a chance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许他们的恋情从来就是没有希望的。

Sense.DEF: to prevent someone from doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I always encouraged Brian. I didn’t want to stand in his way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我始终鼓励布赖恩﹐我不想妨碍他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t stand in the way of progress!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你无法阻挡前进的脚步！

Sense.DEF: to be able to do what you need to do, earn your own money, etc without help from others
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s never learned to stand on her own feet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从来都没学会自立。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something should be completely clear to anyone who is sensible
Sense.TRAN: 这是合乎情理的﹐这是自然的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It stands to reason that you cannot find the right person to do a job unless you know exactly what that job is.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你没有明确知道是什么工作﹐就找不到合适的人选﹐这是自然的。

Sense.DEF: to depend on something for success
Sense.EXAMPLE: The case against him will stand or fall on its own merits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 指控他的这个案子能否胜诉将取决于案子本身的情况。

Sense.DEF: a liquid that stands does not flow or is not made to move
Sense.EXAMPLE: standing pools of marsh water
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一潭潭沼泽积水

Sense.DEF: to watch someone or something so that they do not do anything wrong or so that nothing bad happens to them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Soldiers stand guard on street corners.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵守衞在街角上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You must stand guard over him at all times.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你必须一直看住他。

Sense.DEF: to promise to pay money if someone does not return to a court of law to be judged
to be brought to a court of law to have your case examined and judged

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gresham will stand trial for murder.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 格雷沙姆将因谋杀罪受审。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The accused was ordered to stand trial on a number of charges.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 被告被勒令为数项指控受审。

Subsense.DEF: to be the person in a court of law who is being judged for a crime
Subsense.TRAN: 被指控（某事）﹐被控告（某事）
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The former president stands accused of lying to the nation’s parliament.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前总统被指控对国会撒谎。

Subsense.DEF: if you stand accused of doing something bad or wrong, other people say that you have done it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The radio station stands accused of racism.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家电台被指责有种族歧视行为。

Subsense.DEF: to stand with your back straight and your head raised
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Stand tall with your feet comfortably apart.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身体站直﹐两脚自然分开。

Subsense.DEF: to be proud and feel ready to deal with anything
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We will stand tall and fight for issues of concern to our community.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将挺起胸膛﹐竭力解决关系到我们社区利益的问题。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb can do sth standing on their head
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is able to do something easily
Sense.TRAN: 某人能轻而易举地做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is basic stuff. I can do it standing on my head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是很初级的东西﹐我闭着眼睛也能做。

Sense.DEF: if something is stood on its head, it becomes the opposite of what it was before
Sense.EXAMPLE: One area of the business which has been stood on its head is internal communications.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家企业和以前完全不同的一个方面是内部通信。

Sense.DEF: to not worry about the formal rules of polite behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on, Mal. Don’t stand on ceremony here at home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 行啦﹐马尔﹐在家里就不必拘礼了。

Sense.DEF: to pay for something as a gift to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on, Jack, I’ll stand you a drink if you like.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来吧﹐杰克﹐你愿意的话﹐我来请你喝一杯。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: make sb’s hair stand on end
not have a leg to stand

Exponent.DEF: to be on your feet in an upright position
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There were no seats, so we had to stand.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有座位,所以我们只好站着。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: When we entered, Stephen was standing by his desk.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们进去的时候,斯蒂芬正站在他的书桌边。

Exponent.DEF: to be standing, especially for a long time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If you have young kids, you’re on your feet all day.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要是有小孩子,就得整天站着了。

Exponent.DEF: to stand after you have been sitting or lying down
Exponent.TRAN: 〔从坐或躺的姿势〕起来,站起身
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He got up and turned off the TV.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他站起身,把电视机关了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Mum fell in her flat and was unable to get up.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈在自己的公寓里摔了一跤,都站不起来了。

Exponent.DEF: to stand after you have been sitting, or to be in a standing position
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I stood up when she came in and shook her hand.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她走进来,我起身和她握手。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s generally better to do this exercise standing up.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一般来说,这套操站着做更好。

Exponent.DEF: to stand up, especially slowly or when it is difficult for you
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My attorney got slowly to his feet, breathing heavily.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的律师气喘吁吁地慢慢站起身。

Exponent.DEF: to stand after you have been sitting, especially at a formal event
Exponent.EXAMPLE: As the bride entered the cathedral, the congregation rose.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 新娘步入教堂,众人起立。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Audience members rose to their feet, cheering and clapping.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 观众起立,欢呼鼓掌。

Sense.DEF: to oppose a person, organization, plan, decision etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She hadn’t the strength to stand against her aunt’s demands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她无力反对她姑妈的要求。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are only a hundred of them standing against an army of 42,000 troops.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们只有 100 人﹐而要抗击 4.2 万人的军队。

Sense.DEF: to stand somewhere and not do anything
Sense.EXAMPLE: We stood around saying goodbye for a while.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们闲站了一会儿相互道别。

Sense.DEF: to not do anything to help someone or prevent something from happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not going to stand by and see her hurt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能袖手旁观眼看着她 受伤。

Sense.DEF: to keep a promise, agreement etc, or to say that something is still true
Sense.TRAN: 信守〔诺言〕﹔遵守〔协定〕﹔坚持某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: I stand by what I said earlier.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我坚持早先说的话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stood by his convictions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坚持自己的信仰。

Sense.DEF: to stay loyal to someone and support them, especially in a difficult situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在困难情况下〕继续忠于某人﹐支持某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: His wife stood by him during his years in prison.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坐牢的那几年里妻子一直对他不离不弃。

Sense.DEF: to be ready to do something if necessary
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rescue crews were standing by in case of a breakdown.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 救援人员随时待命抢修故障。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stand by for our Christmas competition.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 准备好参加我们的圣诞比赛活动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Police stood by to arrest any violent fans.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察随时准备逮捕闹事球迷。

Sense.DEF: to agree to leave your position or to stop trying to be elected, so that someone else can have a chance
Sense.TRAN: 〔为让出机会而〕辞职﹐退出竞选

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was obliged to stand down as a parliamentary candidate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被迫退出议员竞选。

Sense.DEF:
to leave the
witness box
in a court of law
if a soldier stands down or is stood down, he stops working for the day
if a letter or symbol stands for something, it represents a word or idea, especially as a short form
Sense.EXAMPLE: What does ATM stand for?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: ATM是什么意思？

Sense.DEF: to support a particular set of ideas, values, or principles
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s hard to tell what the party stands for these days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今这个党派的主张是什么很难说清楚。

Sense.DEF: to not allow something to continue to happen or someone to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s been lying about me, and I won’t stand for it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一直乱说我坏话﹐我不会容忍下去的。

Sense.DEF: to temporarily do someone else’s job or take their place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Would you mind standing in for me for a while?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你临时替我一会儿行吗？

Sense.DEF: to be very easy to see or notice
Sense.EXAMPLE: The outlines of rooftops and chimneys stood out against the pale sky.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 屋顶和烟囱的轮廓在灰暗的天空下显得很醒目。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She always stood out in a crowd .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在人群中总是显得很突出。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I am sure illnesses stand out in all childhood memories.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我相信﹐在所有的儿时记忆中﹐对生病的记忆一定是最深刻的。

Sense.DEF: to be much better than other similar people or things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: That day still stands out as the greatest day in my life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天仍是我一生中最美好的日子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Three of the cars we tested stood out among the rest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们测试的汽车中有三辆明显好于其他汽车。

Sense.DEF: to rise up from a surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: The veins stood out on his throat and temples.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喉咙和太阳穴上青筋凸出。

Sense.DEF: to be strongly opposed to an idea, plan etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: We must stand out against bigotry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须坚决反对顽固的偏见。

Sense.DEF: to stand very close behind someone and watch as they work to make sure they do nothing wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t concentrate with him standing over me like that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那样站在我身后看着﹐我无法集中注意力。

Sense.DEF: to order a soldier to move into a position so that they are ready for action, or to move into this position
Sense.TRAN: 命令〔士兵〕进入待命状态﹔〔士兵〕进入待命状态

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The men have been stood to.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵已受命进入待命状态。

Sense.DEF: to be on your feet, or to rise to your feet
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been standing up all day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经站了一天。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stand up straight and don’t slouch!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身体站直﹐别没精打采的！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jim stood up stiffly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆僵直地站了起来。

Sense.DEF: to stay healthy or in good condition in a difficult environment or after a lot of hard use

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most of the plants stood up well to the heat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些植物大多数都能耐高温。

Sense.DEF: to be proved to be true, correct, useful etc when tested
Sense.TRAN: 站得住脚﹔证明真实[正确﹐有用等]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The memoirs stand up well to cross-checking with other records.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本回忆录完全经得起与其他记录对照核实。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Without a witness, the charges will never stand up in court be successfully proved in a court of law .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有证人﹐这些指控在法庭上是绝对站不住脚的。

Sense.DEF: to not meet someone who you have arranged to meet
Sense.TRAN: 未与某人如约见面﹐使某人空等
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was supposed to go to a concert with Kyle on Friday, but he stood me up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我星期五本来要跟凯尔一起去听音乐会的﹐但他失约了﹐让我空等一场。

Sense.DEF: to make it very clear what you think about something when this is dangerous or might cause trouble for you
Sense.TRAN: 〔对危险或可能引起麻烦的事物〕公开表明立场[态度]

Sense.DEF: to support or defend a person or idea when they are being attacked
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s time we stood up for our rights.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该是我们维护自己权利的时候了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Silvia is capable of standing up for herself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西尔维娅能够维护自己的利益。

Sense.DEF: to refuse to accept unfair treatment from a person or organization
Sense.TRAN: 拒绝接受〔某人或组织〕的不公平对待﹐抵抗
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’ll respect you more if you stand up to him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你敢于抗拒﹐他会更尊重你。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cliff couldn’t stand up to bullying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克利夫不敢反抗别人的 欺侮。

Sense.DEF: a piece of furniture or equipment used to hold or support something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a music stand
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐谱架
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cake stand
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛋糕架
Sense.EXAMPLE: He adjusted the microphone stand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他调整了一下话筒架。

GramExa.GLOSS: for hanging coats or hats on

PIC.HEADING: STANDS 架﹔台﹔座
PIC.PICCONTENT: statue 雕像；coatstand 衣帽架；canvas 油画布；easel 画架；plinth especially BrE【尤英】底座；tripod 三脚架；music stand 乐谱架

Sense.DEF: a table or small structure used for selling or showing things
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hotdog stand
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热狗摊
Sense.EXAMPLE: an exhibition stand
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 展台
Sense.EXAMPLE: The shop was crowded with display stands and boxes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家商店里满是陈列台和盒子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: One week, three magazines hit the stands became available to buy with Peace Corps stories.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一星期有三份刊登维和部队故事的杂志上架。

Sense.DEF: a position or opinion that you state firmly and publicly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Republicans’ conservative stand on social and environmental issues
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 共和党在社会和环境问题上的保守立场

Sense.EXAMPLE: She was accused of not taking a stand on feminism or civil rights.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被指责在女权主义或人权问题上没有明确的立场。

Sense.DEF: a strong effort to defend yourself or to oppose something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We have to take a stand against racism.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须坚决反对种族歧视。

Sense.DEF: a building where people stand or sit to watch the game at a sports ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the stands, fifty of Jill’s friends and family have come to watch her last game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在看台上﹐吉尔的亲戚朋友共有50人前来观看她的最后一场比赛。

Sense.DEF:
a
witness box
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will the next witness please take the stand go into the witness box ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请下一位证人出庭作证。

Sense.DEF:
the period of time in which two
batsmen
are playing together in a game of
cricket
, or the points that they get during this time
Sense.TRAN: 〔两个击球员在一局内对三柱门的〕持续防守﹔持续防守得分

Sense.DEF: a place where taxis or buses stop and wait for passengers
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a taxi stand on Glen Road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格伦路上有个出租车站。

Sense.DEF: a group of trees of one type growing close together

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a stand of eucalyptus trees
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 桉树丛

Sense.DEF: a standalone computer works on its own without being part of a network
a standalone company is one that is not part of a larger company
the level that is considered to be acceptable, or the level that someone or something has achieved
Sense.EXAMPLE: Students have to reach a certain standard or they won’t pass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生必须达到某一标准﹐否则无法通过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The airline has rigorous safety standards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家航空公司有严格的安全标准。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The committee is assessing the standard of care in local hospitals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会正在评估当地医院的护理水准。

Sense.DEF: moral principles about what kind of behaviour or attitudes are acceptable
Sense.EXAMPLE: the recent decline in moral standards
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 近来道德水准的下降

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Standards have slipped since I was a boy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从我小时候起﹐行为标准就已经降低了。

Sense.DEF:
a fixed official rule for measuring weight,
purity
, value etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔重量﹑纯度﹑价值等的〕标准﹐基准
Sense.EXAMPLE: an official government standard for the purity of silver
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白银纯度的政府法定标准

Sense.DEF: a popular song that has been sung by many different singers
Sense.TRAN: 〔很多歌星演唱过的〕流行歌曲
Sense.EXAMPLE: popular jazz standards
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被多人翻唱过的爵士流行歌曲

Sense.DEF: a flag used in ceremonies
Sense.EXAMPLE: the royal standard
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 王室的旗帜

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Many food businesses fail to meet basic standards of hygiene.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多食品企业未能达到基本的卫生标准。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The government sets standards that all hospitals must reach.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府制定了所有医院都必须达到的标准。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We are determined to raise standards in our schools.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们决心提高我们各所学校的水准。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He refused to lower his standards.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拒绝降低自己的标准。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: keep them at a good level

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The standard of their work was generally very high.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的工作水准通常很高。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The report says the standard of children’s diet in Britain is poor.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 报道称英国儿童的饮食标准很低。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: All too often their behaviour has fallen below acceptable standards.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的行为有太多的时候都达不到可接受的标准。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: high standards that are difficult to reach
the level of comfort and the amount of money people have

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There has been an improvement in living standards.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活水准已有所提高。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her work was not up to standard.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的工作未能达到标准。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His performance yesterday was below standard.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他昨天的表现没有达到标准。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 按现代的标准/今天的标准
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The technology was crude by modern standards.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项工艺按现代的标准来看是粗糙的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: judging by what we are used to

Sense.DEF: accepted as normal or usual
Sense.TRAN: 正常的﹔标准的﹔普通的﹔普遍接受的
Sense.EXAMPLE: We paid them the standard rate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们付给他们标准工资。

GramExa.GLOSS: the usual way of doing things
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Searching luggage at airports is now standard practice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 机场的行李检查现在是例行做法了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The format is fairly standard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个格式是比较标准的。

Sense.DEF: regular and usual in shape, size, quality etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: We make shoes in standard and wide sizes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们制造标准码和加宽码的鞋子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: All these vans are made to a standard design.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些客货两用车均按标准设计制造。

Sense.DEF: a standard book, work etc is read by everyone studying a particular subject
Sense.TRAN: 〔书﹑作品等〕公认为标准的﹐权威的

Sense.DEF: the standard form of a language is the one considered to be correct and is used by most people
Sense.EXAMPLE: the standard spelling
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 规范的拼法
Sense.EXAMPLE: standard English pronunciation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 标准英语发音

Sense.DEF: an important leader in a moral argument or political group
Sense.TRAN: 领导者﹔倡导者﹔领袖﹔旗手

Sense.DEF:
a soldier in past times who carried the
standard flag
at the front of an army

a number in
statistics
that shows by how much members of a mathematical set can be different from the average set
a school examination in one of a range of subjects that is taken by students in Scotland, usually at the age of 16
Sense.TRAN: 〔苏格兰学生通常在 16 岁时参加的〕标准级别考试

Sense.DEF: a standard-issue thing is the common or usual type of that thing
included as an ordinary part of military equipment
Sense.TRAN: 〔军队装备〕标准配给的﹐统一分发的

Sense.DEF: to make all the things of one particular type the same as each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: Attempts to standardize English spelling have never been successful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 统一英语拼写的尝试从未成功过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: standardized tests
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 标准化测试

Sense.DEF: a tall lamp that stands on the floor
the amount of wealth, comfort, and other things that a particular person, group, country etc has

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a nation with a high standard of living
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个生活水准高的国家

Sense.DEF: the time to which all clocks in a particular area of the world are set

Subsense.DEF: ready to help immediately if you are needed
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A special team of police were kept on standby .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一支特警队随时待命。

Subsense.DEF: if you are on standby to do something, for example to travel by plane, you are on a list of people who may be allowed to do it if places become available
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We can put you on standby .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以让你候补待位。

Sense.DEF: something that is kept ready so that it can be used when needed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Powdered milk is a good standby in an emergency.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奶粉是很好的紧急备用食品。

Sense.DEF: a standby ticket is one that you can get only if places become available, for example if other people cannot use their tickets
the time during which a person or a machine is available to work but is not able to work because they are waiting to be given a specific job to do
Sense.TRAN: 〔人或机器的〕待命（时间）﹐待机（时间）

Sense.DEF: the period of time that passes while you wait for a computer to do what you have asked it to do
someone who does the job or takes the place of someone else for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gilbert failed to find a stand-in and so could not go to the party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉尔伯特找不到人临时替他﹐因此无法参加派对。

Sense.DEF: someone who takes the place of an actor for some scenes in a film

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a stand-in for Tom Cruise
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆•克鲁斯的替身

Sense.DEF: permanently agreed or arranged
Sense.TRAN: 永久的﹔长期有效的﹔常置的
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have to pay standing charges whether or not you use the service.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无论是否使用这项服务﹐你都必须一直付费。

GramExa.GLOSS: permission to visit someone whenever you like
a professional permanent army

Sense.EXAMPLE: A standing committee was established to coordinate the army and navy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成立了常务委员会以协调陆军和海军。

Sense.DEF: done from a standing position
Sense.EXAMPLE: The runners set off from a standing start .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 选手们以站姿起跑。

GramExa.GLOSS: when people stand up to clap after a performance

Sense.DEF: something that happens often and that people make jokes about
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole incident became a standing joke between us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整件事成了我们时常提起的笑料。

Sense.DEF: someone’s rank or position in a system, organization, society etc, based on what other people think of them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Barb’s work helped to improve her standing with her colleagues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴布的工作有助于提高她在同事中的地位。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The scandal damaged the governor’s standing in the polls.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一丑闻损害了州长在民意调查中的声望。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a lawyer of high standing
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 名望很高的律师

Sense.LEXUNIT: sth of five/many etc years’ standing
Sense.DEF: used to show the time during which something such as an agreement has existed
Sense.TRAN: 已经存在五年/多年等的某物〔如协议等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an arrangement of several years’ standing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多年的约定

Sense.DEF: an arrangement by which a bank pays a fixed amount of money from your account every month, year etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔要求银行定期付款的〕长期自动转账委托

Sense.DEF: space for standing in a theatre, sports ground etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was standing room only no seats were left in the courthouse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法院里只有站位了。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which neither side in a fight or battle can gain an advantage
rather unfriendly and formal
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was cold and stand-offish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她态度冷漠﹐不甚友好。

Sense.DEF: used about a person or thing in a group that is much better than all the rest
Sense.EXAMPLE: the standout track on the album
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 专辑中最出色的歌曲

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He was the standout in last Saturday’s game.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 在上周六的比赛中他表现突出。

Sense.DEF: a pipe that provides water in a public place in the street
Sense.TRAN: 〔在街上给公共场所供水的〕竖管

Sense.DEF: a way of thinking about people, situations, ideas etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Let’s look at the questions from an economic standpoint.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我们从经济的角度来看这些问题。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a discussion of marriage from the standpoint of women
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从女性角度对婚姻的探讨

Sense.DEF: a situation in which there is no movement or activity at all

GramExa.PROPFORM: come to a standstill/bring sth to a standstill
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Strikers brought production to a standstill.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罢工者使生产陷于停顿。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Traffic was at a standstill.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 交通堵塞了。

Sense.DEF:
stand-up
comedy
involves one person telling jokes alone as a performance
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stand-up comedian
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位单口喜剧演员

Sense.DEF: a stand-up meeting, meal etc is one in which people stand up
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had a stand-up buffet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们站着吃了一顿自助餐。

Sense.DEF: a stand-up fight, argument etc is one in which people shout loudly at each other or are violent
Sense.EXAMPLE: If it came to a stand-up fight, I wouldn’t have a chance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是硬打起来﹐我根本不是对手。

Sense.DEF: able to stay upright
Sense.EXAMPLE: a photo in a stand-up frame
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 立式相框中的照片
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stand-up collar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 立领

Sense.DEF:
stand-up
comedy
Sense.TRAN: 单人说笑喜剧﹐单口相声
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mark used to do stand-up at Roxy’s Bar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克曾在罗克西酒吧里表演单口喜剧。

Sense.DEF:
a
comedian
who does stand-up
comedy
Sense.TRAN: 单人说笑喜剧演员﹐单口相声演员

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
stink1

a prize given to the winner of the National Hockey League, which is made up of the highest level of professional
ice hockey
teams from Canada and the US
Sense.TRAN: 斯坦利杯〔加拿大和美国职业冰球联盟最高奖项〕

Sense.DEF:
a very sharp knife with a small
triangular
blade, that you use in activities such as decorating and
woodwork
Sense.TRAN: 史丹利刀〔装饰或木刻用﹐刀刃呈三角形﹐非常锋利〕

Sense.DEF: a group of lines in a repeated pattern forming part of a poem
a small piece of thin wire that is pushed into sheets of paper and bent over to hold them together
a small U-shaped piece of metal with pointed ends, used to hold something in place
a food that is needed and used all the time
Sense.EXAMPLE: staples like flour and rice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面粉和大米等主食

Sense.DEF: the main product that is produced in a country
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bananas and sugar are the staples of Jamaica.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 香蕉和糖是牙买加的主要产品。

Sense.DEF: to fasten two or more things together with a staple

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The handouts are all stapled together.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 课堂讲义都是装订在一起的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I stapled the order form to the invoice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把订单订在发票上。

Sense.DEF: forming the greatest or most important part of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oil is Nigeria’s staple export.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 石油是尼日利亚的主要出口产品。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a staple ingredient of comedy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喜剧最重要的成分

Subsense.DEF: the food that you normally eat

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They live on a staple diet of rice and vegetables.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们以大米和蔬菜为主食。

Subsense.DEF: something that is always being produced, seen, bought etc
Subsense.TRAN: 经常制作[看到﹐购买等]的东西

GramExa.EXAMPLE: television’s staple diet of soap operas and quiz shows
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 以肥皂剧和问答比赛为主的电视节目

Sense.DEF: used all the time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Marty’s staple excuses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马蒂惯用的借口

Sense.DEF: a tool used for putting strong staples into walls
a tool used for putting staples into paper
a large ball of burning gas in space that can be seen at night as a point of light in the sky
Sense.EXAMPLE: I lay on my back and looked up at the stars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我仰卧着看天上的星星。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sky was filled with stars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 满天繁星。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The stars were shining .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 群星闪烁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The stars were all out they were shining .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星耀天空。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The stars were twinkling overhead shining and quickly changing from bright to faint .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 头顶上星星闪烁。

GramExa.GLOSS: outdoors at night
GramExa.EXAMPLE: sitting around a campfire under the stars
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 围着营火坐在星光下

Sense.DEF: a famous and successful actor, musician, or sports player
Sense.EXAMPLE: By the age of 20, she was already a big star a very famous and successful performer .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她 20 岁时就已经是大明星了。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 流行乐/电影/电视/足球等明星

Sense.EXAMPLE: He is a rising star someone who is becoming famous and successful in the music world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是乐坛新星。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a good actress but she lacks star quality a special quality that could make someone a star .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是好演员﹐但缺乏明星气质。

Sense.SIGNPOST: MAIN PERSON IN A FILM/PLAY ETC
Sense.DEF: the person who has the main part, or one of them, in a film, play, show etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ray Grimes, the star of the television series ‘Brother John’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷•格兰姆斯﹐电视连续剧《强风吹来时》中的主角

Subsense.DEF: the person who gives the best performance in a film, play, show etc
Subsense.TRAN: 〔电影﹑戏剧﹑演出等中的〕明星﹐最出色者
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Laporte, as Ebenezer Scrooge, is undoubtedly the star of the show .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉波特﹐埃比尼泽•斯克鲁奇的扮演者﹐毫无疑问是这出戏中最闪亮的明星。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Shamu, the killer whale, is the show’s star attraction best and most popular person or thing .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杀人鲸晓穆是演出中最受人瞩目的明星。

Subsense.DEF: the best or most successful person in a group of players, workers, students etc
Subsense.TRAN: 〔选手﹑员工﹑学生等中的〕最优秀者﹐最佳者

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the team’s star player
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该队的明星球员
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the school’s star pupil
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所学校最优秀的学生
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the star columnist of ‘The Sunday Times’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 《星期日泰晤士报》的明星专栏作家

Subsense.DEF: a shape with four or more points, which represents the way a star looks in the sky
a mark in the shape of a star, used to draw attention to something written
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I put a star next to the items that we still need to buy.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在仍需购买的物品旁边打上星号。

Subsense.DEF: a piece of cloth or metal in the shape of a star, worn to show someone’s rank or position – used especially on military uniforms
Subsense.TRAN: 〔尤指用在军服上表示级别或地位的〕星章
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a four-star general
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位四星上将

Sense.DEF: a mark used in a system for judging the quality of hotels and restaurants
Sense.TRAN: 〔评判酒店和餐馆质量等级的〕星（级）

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a two-star hotel
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家二星级宾馆

Sense.DEF:
a description, usually printed in newspapers and magazines, of what will happen to you in the future, based on the position of the stars and
planets
at the time of your birth

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I never read my stars .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从来不看我的星象。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sth is written in the stars
Sense.DEF:
used to say that what happens to a person is controlled by
fate a power that is believed to influence what happens in people’s lives
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their marriage was surely written in the stars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的婚姻无疑是命中注定的。

Sense.DEF: to see flashes of light, especially because you have been hit on the head
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt a little dizzy and could see stars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得有点晕﹐眼冒金星。

Sense.DEF: to imagine that something you want to do is much more exciting or attractive than it really is
said when you are very grateful or pleased because of what someone has done
Sense.TRAN: 你太棒了！/太好了！〔表示感谢或高兴〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thanks, Mel. You’re a real star!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢谢﹐梅尔﹐你真是太好了！

Crossrefto.REFLEX: be born under a lucky/unlucky star

ThesBox.HEADING: THESAURUS 词语辨析 – MEANING 义项 2

Section.SECHEADING: A FAMOUS PERSON 著名人物

Exponent.DEF: a famous and successful actor, musician, or sports person
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She dreamed of becoming a movie star.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她梦想成为电影明星。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a talent show to find the stars of the future
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 寻找未来之星的选秀节目

Exponent.DEF: someone who often appears in newspapers, on television etc and is well-known to the public. Celebrities are often famous for being famous, not because they have any great talent.
Exponent.TRAN: 名人,名流〔经常出现在报纸﹑电视等上的公众人物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The magazine is full of gossip about celebrities.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本杂志上尽是些名流的八卦新闻。

Exponent.DEF: a famous person whose name is known by many people – used especially in the following expressions
Exponent.EXAMPLE: All the big names in football were at the awards dinner.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 足球界的大人物悉数现身颁奖宴会。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Giorgio Armani is one of the most famous names in fashion.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治 • 阿玛尼是时尚界最著名的人物之一。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He is yet to become a household name someone who everyone has heard of .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的大名尚未家喻户晓。

Exponent.DEF: an entertainer or sports player who is famous and often appears in the newspapers, on television etc – used especially in the following phrases
Exponent.TRAN: 〔娱乐界或体育界的〕名人〔尤用于以下短语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Many advertisers use TV personalities to promote their products.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多广告商都用电视名人推广产品。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was chosen as sports personality of the year.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被选为年度体育名人。

Section.SECHEADING: A VERY FAMOUS PERSON 赫赫有名的人物

Exponent.DEF: an extremely famous performer, especially a musician or film actor
Exponent.TRAN: 超级巨星〔尤指音乐家或电影演员〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The film made Tom Cruise an international superstar.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 本片令汤姆•克鲁斯成为国际巨星。

Exponent.DEF: someone who is famous and admired for being extremely good at doing something – used especially about people who are at the end of a long career or who have died
Exponent.TRAN: 传奇人物〔尤指事业即将结束或已经去世的人〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: blues legend John Lee Hooker
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 蓝调传奇人物约翰•李•胡克

Exponent.DEF: someone who was one of the best players or performers that there have ever been
Exponent.TRAN: 伟大人物〔指出类拔萃的运动员或演员〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was one of the all-time soccer greats.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是史上最伟大的足球运动员之一。

Sense.DEF: if someone stars in a film, television show etc, they are one of the main characters in it
Sense.TRAN: 〔在电影﹑电视节目等中〕担任主角﹐主演

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Eastwood starred in ‘The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊斯特伍德在《黄金三镖客》中担任主角。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: DeVito stars opposite Dreyfuss in the movie.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 德维托在这部影片中担任主角﹐与德莱弗斯演对手戏。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hugh Grant stars as the romantic hero.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 休·格兰特扮演那位浪漫的男主角。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘The Freshman’ was Brando’s first starring role the most important part in a film in ten years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《新鲜人》是白兰度十年里主演的首部影片。

Sense.DEF: if a film, television show, or play stars someone, that person is one of the main characters in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a film starring Meryl Streep
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 梅丽尔·斯特里普主演的一部电影

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The movie starred Orson Welles as Harry Lime.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片由奥森•威尔斯饰演哈里•利姆。

Sense.DEF:
to put an
asterisk a star-shaped mark
next to something written
Sense.EXAMPLE: The starred items are available.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带星号的物品都有售。

Sense.DEF: a small dried star-shaped fruit that is used as a spice, especially in Chinese cooking
Sense.TRAN: 八角茴香 〔一种香料﹐尤用于中餐烹调〕

Sense.DEF: the side of a ship or aircraft that is on your right when you are facing forwards
a substance which provides your body with energy and is found in foods such as grain, rice, and potatoes, or a food that contains this substance
Sense.EXAMPLE: He eats a lot of starch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他吃大量含淀粉的食物。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Avoid fatty foods and starches.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 避免食用高脂的和含淀粉的食物。

Sense.DEF: a substance that is mixed with water and is used to make cloth stiff
to make cloth stiff, using starch
Sense.EXAMPLE: a starched tablecloth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浆过的桌布

Sense.DEF: a group of people that meets secretly and makes important decisions
Sense.TRAN: 星室法庭〔秘密开会并作出重要决定的团体〕﹔专横暴虐的组织

Sense.DEF:
containing a lot of
starch11
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 含大量淀粉的食物

Sense.DEF: very formal and correct in your behaviour – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 古板的﹐拘谨的﹐生硬的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She spoke in a rather starchy manner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说话时态度很生硬。

Sense.DEF: being in a situation that prevents something happy or good happening

EXAMPLE.GLOSS: people who love each other but cannot be together

Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不幸的恋人

Sense.DEF: the state of being a famous performer
Sense.EXAMPLE: his rapid rise to stardom
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的迅速走红

GramExa.GLOSS: become famous very quickly
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ellen shot to stardom as a model last year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃伦去年一炮而红﹐成为名模。

Sense.DEF: an imaginary magic substance
Sense.TRAN: 星尘〔想象出来的具有魔力的物质〕

Sense.DEF: to look at something or someone for a long time without moving your eyes, for example because you are surprised, angry, or bored

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What are you staring at?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在盯着看什么？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She stared at me in disbelief.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不相信地看着我。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She sat there staring into space looking for a long time at nothing .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坐在那里﹐出神地凝视前方。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be staring sb in the face

Subsense.DEF: if something is staring you in the face, it is very clear or easy to notice but you have not noticed it
Subsense.TRAN: 就在某人眼前〔形容某事物非常明显﹐某人却注意不到〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The solution was staring me right in the face all along.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 解决办法其实一直就明摆在我的面前。

Subsense.DEF: to seem impossible to avoid
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Defeat was staring us in the face.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看来我们输定了。

Sense.DEF: to look at someone for so long that they start to feel uncomfortable and look away
when you look at something for a long time in a steady way
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave him a long hard stare .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她狠狠地盯了他好一会儿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She laughed, ignoring the stares of everyone around her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她大笑起来﹐不顾周围的人都在盯着她看。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His pleas were met by a blank stare a stare with no expression, understanding, or interest .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的请求得到的回应是茫然空洞的目光。

Sense.DEF: a flat sea animal that has five arms forming the shape of a star
a pale green tropical fruit that you can cut into pieces that have the shape of stars

someone who studies
astronomy
or
astrology
one of a series of exercise jumps that you do from a standing position with your arms and legs pointing out at each side
Sense.TRAN: 星状跳跃〔四肢叉开以站立姿势起跳〕

Sense.DEF: very plain in appearance, with little or no colour or decoration
Sense.TRAN: 〔外表〕简陋的﹔无修饰的﹐荒凉的
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the cold dawn light, the castle looked stark and forbidding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在寒冷的曙光中﹐城堡看上去了无生气﹐令人生畏。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the stark beauty of New Mexico
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新墨西哥州的荒凉之美

Sense.DEF: unpleasantly clear and impossible to avoid
Sense.EXAMPLE: The movie shows the stark realities of life in the ghetto.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片展示了贫民区生活的严酷现实。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The extreme poverty of the local people is in stark contrast to the wealth of the tourists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地居民的极度贫困和游客的富裕形成鲜明的对比。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are faced with a stark choice .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们面临残酷的选择。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stark reminder of life under colonial rule
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 殖民主义统治下生活的严酷见证

Sense.DEF: not wearing any clothes at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ben was standing there stark naked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本一丝不挂地站在那里。

Sense.DEF: completely crazy
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s gone stark raving mad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已经完全疯了。

Sense.DEF: not wearing any clothes
with no stars showing in the sky
Sense.EXAMPLE: a starless night
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有星光的夜晚

Sense.DEF: a young actress who plays small parts in films and hopes to become famous
Sense.TRAN: 尚未成名的年轻女演员

Sense.DEF: the light that comes from the stars in the night sky
a common bird with shiny black feathers that lives especially in cities
made brighter by light from the stars
Sense.EXAMPLE: a starlit night
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星光照耀的夜晚

Sense.DEF: a star with six points that represents the Jewish religion or Israel
Sense.TRAN: 大卫之星〔代表犹太教或以色列的六角星〕

Sense.DEF: having many stars
Sense.EXAMPLE: a starry winter sky
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 满天繁星的冬夜

Sense.DEF: starry eyes shine brightly
bright like a star or shaped like a star
Sense.EXAMPLE: white starry flowers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白色的星状花朵

Sense.DEF:
happy and hopeful about things in a way that is silly or
unrealistic
Sense.TRAN: 过分乐观的﹔不切实际的

Sense.DEF: the national flag of the US

one of the 12 signs of the
zodiac the system that uses people’s birth dates to say what will happen to them in the future

the
national anthem national song
of the US
Sense.TRAN: 《星条旗永不落》﹐《星条旗之歌》〔美国国歌〕

Sense.DEF: the national flag of the US
including many famous performers
Sense.EXAMPLE: a star-studded cast
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 明星荟萃的演员阵容

Tail.TailContent: This graph shows how common the different grammar patterns of the verb start are. 本图表所示为构成动词start 的不同语法模式的使用频率。

Sense.DEF: to do something that you were not doing before, and continue doing it
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s so much to do. I don’t know where to start.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有那么多的事情要做﹐我都不知道从哪里开始。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you started your homework?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你开始做家庭作业了吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Then the baby started crying.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 然后宝宝开始哭了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He got up and started running again .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他爬起来又开始跑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s starting to rain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 天开始下雨了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d better get started start doing something soon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最好马上就开始。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What Kerry said started me thinking made me start thinking .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里的话让我思考起来。

Sense.DEF: to begin happening, or to make something begin happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: What time does the film start?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电影什么时候开始放映？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lightning started a fire that burned 500 acres.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 闪电引起大火﹐烧毁了 500 英亩林地。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The party was just getting started when Sara arrived.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉到达时﹐派对刚刚开始。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You have two hours to complete the test, starting now.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在开始﹐你有两小时的时间完成考试。

Sense.DEF: to begin something in a particular way, or to begin in a particular way
Sense.EXAMPLE: A healthy breakfast is a good way to start the day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 健康早餐是一天很好的开始。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The festivities started with a huge fireworks display.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 庆祝活动以一场盛大的烟火表演揭开序幕。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The restaurant started as a small take-out place.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家餐厅是从一间小外卖店起家的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Any new exercise program should start slowly.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何新的锻炼计划开始时都应该慢慢来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Chao starts by explaining some basic legal concepts.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 查奥开始时先解释了一些基本的法律概念。

Sense.DEF: to make something begin to exist

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She wanted to start her own catering business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想自己创立一家餐饮公司。

Sense.DEF: to begin a new job, or to begin going to school, college etc
Sense.TRAN: 开始（从事新的工作﹑上学等）
Sense.EXAMPLE: When can you start?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你什么时候能开始上班？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I started college last week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 上周起我开始上大学了。

Sense.DEF: if you start a car or engine, or if it starts, it begins to work
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car wouldn’t start this morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天早上这辆车发动不起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He couldn’t get his motorbike started.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的摩托车发动不起来。

Sense.DEF: to begin travelling or moving in a particular direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll have to start early to get there by lunchtime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须早点出发﹐以便午饭前赶到那里。

Sense.DEF: to begin your life or profession in a particular way or place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She started as a dancer in the 1950s.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 20 世纪 50 年代她从一名舞蹈演员开始起步。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s difficult for new lawyers to get started in private practice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对新入行的律师来说﹐独立开办事务所起步很难。

Sense.DEF: if a river, road, path etc starts somewhere, it begins in that place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trail starts immediately behind the hotel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小径的起点就在酒店后面。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The race will start at the town hall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛起点将设在市政厅。

Sense.DEF: if prices, amounts, or rates start at or from a particular number, that is the lowest number at which you can get or buy something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Room prices start from £25 a night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房价每晚 25 英镑起。

Sense.DEF: to begin doing a job or activity completely from the beginning
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were no textbooks, so the teachers had to start from scratch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有课本﹐因此教师们只得从零开始。

Sense.DEF: to deliberately make something start happening, especially something bad
Sense.TRAN: 使发生﹐开始〔尤指不好的事情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I started a fire to warm the place up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我生了一堆火让周围暖和起来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Oh, don’t go trying to start an argument.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 噢﹐别去挑起争论。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Other girls were starting rumours about me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他女孩子在散布有关我的谣言。

Subsense.DEF: said when talking about the beginning of a situation, especially when it changes later
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I was pretty nervous to start with, but after a while I was fine.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开始时我很紧张﹐但过了一会儿就好了。

Subsense.DEF: said to emphasize the first of a list of facts or opinions you are stating
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There are problems. To start with, neither of us likes housework.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一些问题。首先﹐我们俩谁都不喜欢做家务。

Sense.DEF: to try to do something and fail, so that you finish in the same situation that you were in before
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of people who lose weight gain it back over time, and end up back where they started.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人减肥后经过一段时间体重又恢复到以前的水平﹐最后是前功尽弃。

Sense.DEF: if a player starts in a game, or if someone starts them, they begin playing when the game begins, especially because they are one of the best players on the team
Sense.TRAN: （使）出场﹐（使）上场〔尤用于球队中的最佳队员〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Astacio started for the Dodgers on Tuesday night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期二晚上阿斯塔西奥为道奇队首发上场。

Sense.DEF: to have your first baby
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re not ready to start a family yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们还没准备好生孩子。

Sense.DEF: to stop doing what you are doing and begin doing it again in a better or different way
Sense.EXAMPLE: She saw her new job as a chance to start afresh.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把自己的新工作视为重新开始的一次机会。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone else has caused an argument or problem
Sense.TRAN: 〔争论或问题〕是某人挑起来的！
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Don’t hit her!’ ‘But she started it!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “别打她！” “但这是她挑起来的！”

Sense.DEF: to begin causing trouble
Sense.EXAMPLE: It looks like Jess is trying to start something.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看来杰斯是在惹是生非。

Sense.DEF: to move your body suddenly, especially because you are surprised or afraid
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因吃惊或害怕〕突然移动﹔惊起﹐吓一跳
Sense.EXAMPLE: A loud knock at the door made her start.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巨大的敲门声吓了她一跳。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Emma started from her chair and rushed to the window.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃玛从椅子上惊跳起来﹐向窗口冲去。

Sense.DEF: to begin doing something when you are young, especially when it is unusual to do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Woods started young, and was coached by his father.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伍兹起步很早﹐由他父亲训练。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to stop complaining, arguing, or annoying you
Sense.TRAN: 别烦了！〔用于叫某人停止抱怨﹑争吵或骚扰〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Mum, I don’t like this ice cream.’ ‘Oh, don’t you start!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “妈妈﹐我不喜欢这个冰激凌。”“哦﹐你别烦了！”

Section.SECHEADING: TO START DOING SOMETHING 开始做某事

Exponent.DEF: to begin doing something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m starting a new job next week.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 下星期我开始做新工作。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s time we started.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们该开始了。

Exponent.DEF: to start doing something. Begin is more formal than start , and is used especially in written English.
Exponent.TRAN: 开始〔做某事﹔begin比 start正式,尤用于书面英语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He began to speak.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始讲话。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The orchestra began playing.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 管弦乐队开始演奏。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Shall we begin?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以开始了吗？

Exponent.DEF: to start doing something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The company will commence drilling next week.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司将于下周开始钻井。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Work was commenced on the next power station.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 下一个电站已经动工。

Exponent.DEF: to finally start doing something, especially your work
Exponent.TRAN: 终于开始做某事〔尤指工作〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Come on, Sam – it’s time you got down to some homework.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 赶快,萨姆,该做点作业了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We’d better get down to business .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们最好开始办正事吧。

Exponent.DEF: to start a journey
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What time do you have to set off in the morning?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 早上你得几点出发？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I usually set off for work at about 8.30.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我通常8点30分出门去上班。

Exponent.DEF: to start a long journey
Exponent.TRAN: 出发,动身〔踏上漫长的旅途〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The ship set out from Portsmouth on July 12th.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这艘船7月12日从朴次茅斯起航。

Exponent.DEF: to start something, especially something new, difficult, or exciting
Exponent.TRAN: 开始某事物〔尤指全新﹑困难或令人激动的事物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The Law Society has embarked on a major programme of reform.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 法律学会已启动重大改革项目。

Exponent.DEF: to start doing something again after stopping it or being interrupted
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Normal train services will be resumed on April 5th.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 列车营运将于4月5日起恢复正常。

Exponent.DEF: to start doing something or going somewhere
Exponent.TRAN: 开始〔做某事〕﹔出发〔去某地〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I think we should get cracking straightaway.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看我们这就动手吧。

Section.SECHEADING: TO START HAPPENING 开始发生

Exponent.DEF: to begin
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What time does the film start?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 电影几点开始？
