Exponent.DEF: to start. Begin is more formal than start and is used especially in written English.
Exponent.TRAN: 开始〔begin比start正式,尤用于书面英语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The trial began in March.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 审讯 3 月份开始。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Work on the new bridge will begin early next year.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 新大桥工程将于明年初动工。

Exponent.DEF: to start being shown to the public – used about a play, show, or exhibition
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A major exhibition of her work will open in New York in November.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的作品大展将于 11 月在纽约开幕。

Exponent.DEF: to start happening
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The voting has already commenced.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 投票业已启动。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The work is scheduled to commence in April.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 工程定于 4 月份启动。

Exponent.DEF: to start happening or being done – used especially about something that is likely to last a long time
Exponent.TRAN: 开始﹔动工〔尤用于长期工作〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Construction work is getting under way on a new train network.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个全新的列车网络建设即将动工。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Discussions concerning the plan got under way on April 2.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 围绕该计划的讨论已于4月2日开始。

Exponent.DEF: to start happening – used especially about a fire, a fight, war, or a disease
Exponent.TRAN: 开始﹔爆发〔尤用于火灾﹑打斗﹑战争或疾病〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Police were called in when fighting broke out in the crowd.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群中爆发争斗,警察奉命赶到。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The blaze broke out on the third floor of the hotel.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒店三楼起火了。

Exponent.DEF: to start – used especially about a football game or a meeting
Exponent.TRAN: 开始〔尤用于足球比赛或会议〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The match is due to kick off this afternoon at Wembley Stadium.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛定于今天下午在温布利球场开始。

Sense.DEF: to begin returning to the place you came from

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I started back down the mountain to camp.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我开始下山返回营地。

Sense.DEF: to begin doing something, especially with a lot of effort
Sense.EXAMPLE: I decided to just start in and see what I could do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决定开始试试﹐看看我能做些什么。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lilly started in on her burger.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莉莉开始吃汉堡包。

Sense.DEF: to begin criticizing someone or complaining to them about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mom turned away from Rose and started in on me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈丢下罗丝﹐开始数落起我来。

Sense.DEF: to begin something in a particular way, or to begin in a particular way

GramExa.PROPFORM: start sth ↔ off with sth/by doing sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The theater company started off their new season with a Shakespeare play.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家剧团以一出莎士比亚戏剧开始他们新一季的演出。

GramExa.PROPFORM: start off with sth/by doing sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I started off by drawing the flowers I had collected.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一开始先画我采集的花。

Sense.DEF: to be a particular thing or have a particular quality at the beginning of something, especially when this changes later
Sense.EXAMPLE: The puppies start off white, and get their black spots later.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幼犬开始是白色的﹐后来才长出黑色斑点。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The games start off as a social event, but players soon become competitive.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 运动会起先是一项社会活动﹐但选手们很快就想争个高低。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I started off as a drummer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 起初我是一名鼓手。

Sense.DEF: to make something begin happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re not sure what starts the process off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们无法确定变化过程的起因。

Sense.DEF: to help someone begin an activity

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He started me off with some stretching exercises.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他让我开始做一些伸展练习。

Sense.DEF: to begin going somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: I sat in the car for a few minutes before starting off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在汽车里坐了几分钟后才出发。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She started off to school in her new uniform.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她穿了新校服去学校。

Sense.DEF: to make someone get angry or start laughing, by saying something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t say that; that’ll just start him off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别那么说﹐他会生气的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He made her jump, and that started her off giggling.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他吓她一跳﹐惹得她咯咯笑起来。

Sense.DEF: to begin doing something or using something
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’d better start on your homework.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最好开始做作业吧。

Sense.DEF: to make someone start doing something regularly, especially because it will be good for them
Sense.TRAN: 使某人开始有规律地做某事〔尤指做对某人有益的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try starting your baby on solid foods at four months old.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宝宝四个月大时﹐试着给他喂固体食物。

Sense.DEF: to begin criticizing someone or complaining to them about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ray’s wife started on at him about spending too much time in the pub.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷的太太开始抱怨他花太多的时间泡酒吧。

Sense.DEF: to begin happening or existing in a particular way, especially when this changes later

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘The Star’ started out as a small weekly newspaper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 《星报》最初是一份小型周报。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The leaves start out a pale green, and later get darker.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叶子开始是淡绿色﹐后来颜色会逐渐变深。

Sense.DEF: to begin your life or profession, or an important period of time
Sense.TRAN: 开始〔生活﹑职业﹑重要阶段〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: When the band first started out, they played at small clubs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这支乐队刚开始时在小俱乐部里表演。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She started out as a model.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一开始是做模特的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The young couple were planning to get married and start out on their life together.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这对年轻人打算结婚﹐开始共同生活。

Sense.DEF: to begin going somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oliver started out at five, when it was still dark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五点钟天还没亮﹐奥利弗就出发了。

Sense.DEF: to start doing something again from the beginning, especially because you want to do it better
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you make a mistake, just erase it and start over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果做错了﹐就擦掉重来。

Sense.DEF: if you start up a business, company etc, or it starts up, it begins to exist
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tax breaks help new companies start up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 减免赋税有助于新公司的创立。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jordan started up a band of his own.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔丹组建了自己的乐队。

Sense.DEF: if an engine, car etc starts up, or you start it up, it begins working
Sense.EXAMPLE: The driver got back into the car and started up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 司机回到车上发动了引擎。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rory started up the engine and got the vehicle moving.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗里启动引擎﹐把车开了起来。

Sense.DEF: if a sound, activity, or event starts up, it begins to exist or happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: The crickets had started up now that it was evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了晚上﹐蟋蟀开始鸣叫。

Sense.DEF: the first part of an activity or event, or the point at which it begins to develop

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We arrived late and missed the start of the film.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们迟到了﹐错过了电影的开头。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ve had problems with this project right from the start.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个项目从刚一开始我们就遇到许多难题。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She read the letter from start to finish without looking up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她头也不抬地把信从头到尾看完。

GramExa.PROPFORM: get off to a good/bad etc start
GramExa.GLOSS: begin well or badly
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 有一个良好/糟糕等的开始
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a free bottle of wine to get your holiday off to a great start
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一瓶免费葡萄酒﹐让您的假日有个美好的开始

GramExa.GLOSS: a bad beginning
GramExa.EXAMPLE: After a rocky start, the show is now very popular.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这档节目一开始并不顺利﹐但现在已经很受欢迎了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He wanted an early start on his election campaign.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他希望早点开始自己的竞选活动。

Sense.DEF: the first part of a particular period of time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Since the start of 1992, the company has doubled in size.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 自 1992年年初以来﹐这家公司的规模已经扩大了一倍。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the start of an election year
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 选举年的开始

Sense.DEF: to begin doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll make a start on the washing-up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这就开始洗餐具。

Sense.DEF: a sudden movement of your body, usually caused by fear or surprise
Sense.TRAN: 〔因恐惧或吃惊的〕突然移动﹔惊起

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ted woke up with a start and felt for the light switch.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 特德猛然惊醒﹐摸索着找电灯开关。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She said his name, and Tom gave a start made a sudden movement .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说出他的名字﹐汤姆吓了一跳。

Sense.DEF: if you have a good etc start, you have all the advantages or opportunities that your situation, your parents etc could provide to help you succeed
Sense.TRAN: （人生中）良好/较好/健康等的起步
Sense.EXAMPLE: Good health care for the mother before birth gives babies a healthy start .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孕妇产前良好的保健能给婴儿一个健康的基础。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Naturally we want to give our kids the best possible start in life .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们当然想给自己的孩子尽可能好的人生起步条件。

Sense.DEF: the place where a race begins
Sense.EXAMPLE: The horses were all lined up at the start.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的马都在起跑线上一字排开。

Sense.DEF: the amount of time or distance by which one person is ahead of another, especially in a race or competition

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The prisoners had a three-hour start on their pursuers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 囚犯逃跑了三个小时后才开始追捕。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize the first of a list of facts or opinions you are stating
Sense.TRAN: 首先﹐第一〔用于强调一系列事实或观点的第一条〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, for a start, the weather was horrible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哦﹐首先﹐天气很糟。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something you have achieved may not be impressive, but it will help with a bigger achievement
Sense.EXAMPLE: One exercise class a week isn’t enough, but it’s a start .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一星期一节健身课是不够的﹐但这是个好的开始。

Subsense.DEF: the beginning of someone’s job, which they will develop in the future, especially a job that involves acting, writing, painting etc
Subsense.TRAN: 〔尤指表演﹑写作﹑绘画等事业的〕开始﹐起步
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Pacino got his start on the stage, before his success in films.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕西诺以舞台剧起步﹐后来才有电影上的成就。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I gave you your start , so remember me when you win the Pulitzer Prize.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给了你起步的机会﹐等你获得普利策奖时可别忘了我。

Subsense.DEF: a job that has just started, a business that has just been started, or someone who has just started a new job
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The number of business starts plummeted 10.5% during the second half of the year.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下半年新成立的公司数量锐减了 10.5%。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a training course for new starts
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新员工培训课程

Sense.DEF: when people begin to build a number of new houses

Subsense.DEF: a race or competition that someone has taken part in
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The horse Exotic Wood was unbeaten in five starts.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那匹名为“异国木”的赛马五场比赛保持不败。

Subsense.DEF: an occasion when a player plays when a sports match begins
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Jackson played in 353 games, with 314 starts.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克逊参加了353 场比赛﹐其中 314 场首发。

Sense.DEF: a small amount of food eaten at the start of a meal before the main part
Sense.TRAN: 〔一顿饭的〕第一道菜﹐开胃小吃
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had soup as a starter , followed by steak.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的第一道菜是汤﹐接下来是牛排。

Sense.DEF: a person, horse, car etc that is in a race when it starts
Sense.TRAN: 〔赛跑﹑赛马﹑赛车等的〕参赛者 [马﹐汽车等]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Of the seven starters, only three finished the race.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参赛的七名选手中﹐只有三名跑完全程。

Sense.DEF: someone who gives the signal for a race to begin
Sense.EXAMPLE: The starter fired his gun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发令员鸣枪了。

GramExa.GLOSS: about to begin the race
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 等待开始的号令﹐准备起跑

Sense.DEF: someone who begins doing something, especially a job, later in life than people generally do
used to emphasize the first of a series of facts, opinions, questions etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, for starters, you’ll need to fill out an application form.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嗯﹐首先﹐你需要填一张申请表。

Sense.DEF:
a
starter motor
a small house or apartment bought by people who are buying their first home
Sense.TRAN: 起步房﹐过渡房〔首次置业者购买的小房子或小公寓〕

Sense.DEF: an electric motor for starting an engine
the basic equipment and instructions that you need to start doing something
the pair of blocks fastened to the ground that a runner pushes their feet against at the start of a race
a gate or pair of gates that open to allow a horse or dog to start running in a race
the line where a race begins
an idea or situation from which a discussion, process etc can develop

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The article provides a starting point for discussion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这篇文章为讨论提供了一个起点。

Sense.DEF: a place from where a journey starts
the lowest possible price for a particular type of thing such as a car or house without any special features, or the lowest price you are willing to accept for something you are selling
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车﹑房子等买卖的〕最低价﹐起步价

Sense.DEF:
the final
odds
that are offered just before a horse or dog race begins
Sense.TRAN: 〔赛马或赛狗的〕临赛赔率[赌率]

Sense.DEF: to make someone suddenly surprised or slightly shocked
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某人〕吃惊﹔吓〔某人〕一跳
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry, I didn’t mean to startle you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抱歉﹐我不是故意吓你一跳的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was startled to see Amanda.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到阿曼达﹐我吃了一惊。

Sense.DEF: very unusual or surprising
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paddy’s words had a startling effect on the children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕迪的话在孩子们身上产生了惊人的效果。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a startling discovery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人震惊的发现

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is startling to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is startling to read that his father never visited him in hospital.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 读到他父亲从未去医院看望过他的事﹐真叫人吃惊。

Sense.DEF: connected with starting a new business
Sense.TRAN: 〔新企业的〕创办时的﹐起始 （阶段）的
Sense.EXAMPLE: start-up costs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 启动费用

Sense.DEF: a new small company or business, especially one whose work involves computers or the Internet
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指从事计算机或因特网的小型的〕新兴公司﹐新创办企业
Sense.EXAMPLE: an Internet start-up
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家新兴网络公司

Sense.DEF: the most successful person in a group of people of the same type, especially the most successful actor, musician, or sports player
Sense.TRAN: 主要演员[音乐家﹐运动员]﹔明星人物

Sense.DEF: suffering or death caused by lack of food
Sense.EXAMPLE: people dying of starvation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快饿死的人们

Sense.DEF: when you eat very little food, especially to become thinner
extremely low wages
Sense.TRAN: 不够维持基本生活的工资﹐极低的工资

Sense.DEF: to suffer or die because you do not have enough to eat
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thousands of people will starve if food doesn’t reach the city.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果食品不能运到那座城市﹐成千上万的人就要饿死。
Sense.EXAMPLE: pictures of starving children
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 饥饿儿童的照片
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ll either die from the cold or starve to death die from lack of food .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们要么会冻死﹐要么会饿死。

Sense.DEF: to prevent someone from having enough food to live
Sense.EXAMPLE: The poor dog looked like it had been starved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条可怜的狗看起来一直在挨饿。

Sense.DEF: to be very hungry
Sense.EXAMPLE: You must be starving!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你肯定饿坏了！

Sense.DEF: to not give something that is needed
Sense.TRAN: 使某人/某物缺乏所需要的某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The schools are starved of funding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些学校缺乏资金。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The poor kid’s just starved for attention.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这可怜的孩子非常缺少关怀。

Sense.DEF: to force someone to leave a place by preventing them from getting food
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某人〕挨饿而被迫离开〔某处〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If we can’t blast them out, we’ll starve them out!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果不能把他们炸出来﹐我们就把他们饿出来！

Sense.DEF: to store something secretly or safely somewhere

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has money stashed away in the Bahamas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把钱藏在巴哈马。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can stash your gear in here.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以把你的装备存放在这里。

Sense.DEF: an amount of something that is kept in a secret place, especially money, weapons, or drugs
Sense.TRAN: 一批贮藏物〔尤指钱﹑武器或毒品〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mike went into the bedroom to check on his stash.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克走进卧室去查看他藏的东西。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a stash of drugs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 藏匿的一批毒品

Sense.DEF: a state or period in which there is no change or development
the physical or mental condition that someone or something is in

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are fears for the state of the country’s economy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们担心国家的经济状况。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: When we bought the house, it was in a terrible state.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们买下这栋房子时﹐它的状况很糟糕。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Frankly, I wouldn’t trust his emotional state right now.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 坦白地说﹐我对他目前的情绪状态不太放心。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She was in an extremely confused state of mind .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她思绪纷乱。

GramExa.PROPFORM: in no fit state to do sth
GramExa.GLOSS: should not do something because you are not in a suitable condition
GramExa.EXAMPLE: David’s in no fit state to drive.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维现在的状态不宜开车。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She can’t go home now. Look at the state of her!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她现在不能回家。看看她这副样子！

GramExa.PROPFORM: be in a good/bad state of repair
GramExa.GLOSS: be in good condition and not need repairing, or be in bad condition
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The boat was in a good state of repair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这艘船保养得很好。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The country was in a state of war officially fighting a war .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家正处于战争状态。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Water exists in three states: liquid, gaseous, and solid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水有三种形态: 液态﹑气态和固态。

Sense.DEF: the government or political organization of a country
Sense.EXAMPLE: The state has allocated special funds for the emergency.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府已为紧急状况拨出专款。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: limits on salary increases for state workers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对政府职员加薪的限制

GramExa.GLOSS: owned, paid for etc by the government
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 国有的/政府出资的/政府补贴的等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a state-funded community housing project
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府资助的社区住宅项目

GramExa.GLOSS: the business of the government

Sense.DEF: a country considered as a political organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: a NATO member state a country belonging to NATO
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个北约成员国

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 民主/一党制/极权主义等政府

Sense.DEF: one of the areas with limited law-making powers that together make up a country controlled by a central government, such as the US and Australia
Sense.EXAMPLE: Queensland is one of the states of Australia.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昆士兰是澳大利亚的一个州。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the state of Iowa
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾奥瓦州

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the state government
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 州政府

Sense.EXAMPLE: state and federal taxes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 州政府和联邦政府征收的税

Sense.DEF: a word meaning the US, used especially by someone when they are outside the US
Sense.TRAN: 美国〔尤在美国境外时使用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Which part of the States would you suggest I visit?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你会建议我去美国的哪个地方？

Sense.LEXUNIT: be in a state/get into a state
Sense.DEF: to be or become very nervous, anxious, or excited
Sense.TRAN: 处于/陷入紧张[焦虑﹐兴奋]之中
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mum and Dad were in a right state when I got in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我进去的时候爸爸妈妈心情不错。

Sense.DEF: the official ceremonies and events connected with government or rulers
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Queen’s first state visit here in 17 years
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 17 年来女王首次对此地的国事访问
Sense.EXAMPLE: music for state occasions special public events
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 隆重仪式上使用的音乐

Sense.DEF: a situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I must say this is a very unsatisfactory state of affairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得说﹐目前的局势令人很不满意。

Subsense.DEF: the position reached in an activity or process that has not finished yet
Subsense.TRAN: 〔某一活动或过程的〕当前进展情况
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What is the state of play in the current negotiations?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前谈判进展如何？

Subsense.DEF: the score in a sports game

Sense.DEF: if the body of an important person who has just died lies in state, it is put in a public place so that people can go and show their respect
to formally say or write a piece of information or your opinion
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please state your name and address.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请说出你的姓名和地址。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rembert again stated his intention to resign from Parliament.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 兰伯特再次表明辞去议员职务的意向。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government needs to clearly state its policy on UN intervention.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府需要就联合国的干预清楚地阐明其政策。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The witness stated that he had not seen the woman before.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 证人说他以前并未见过那个女人。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Fine, but aren’t you just stating the obvious here?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没错﹐可你说的谁不知道呢？

Sense.DEF: if a document, newspaper, ticket etc states information, it contains the information written clearly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The price of the tickets is stated on the back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 票价写在背面。

Sense.DEF: a lawyer who represents a US state in court cases
money given by the government in Britain to people who are poor, without a job, ill etc

a court in the US which deals with legal cases that are concerned with state laws or a state’s
constitution
the US government department that deals with anything connected with foreign countries
the condition of being an independent nation
the condition of being one of the states that make up a nation such as the US
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国等国的〕州 [邦] 的地位

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Utah obtained statehood in 1896.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 犹他于1896 年成为一个州。

Sense.DEF: the building where people who make laws in a US state do their work
not officially being a citizen of any country
Sense.EXAMPLE: Millions of refugees remain stateless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数百万难民仍未取得国籍。

Sense.DEF: the border between two states in the US
Sense.EXAMPLE: We crossed the state line into Missouri.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们穿过州界线﹐进入密苏里州。

Sense.DEF: done slowly and with a lot of ceremony
Sense.EXAMPLE: the stately progress of the procession
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游行队伍缓慢而庄严的行进

Sense.DEF: impressive in style and size
Sense.EXAMPLE: stately buildings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宏伟的建筑

Sense.DEF: a large house in the countryside in Britain which has historical interest, especially one open to the public
Sense.TRAN: 豪华宅第〔英国具有历史价值的乡村大宅﹐尤向公众开放〕

Sense.DEF: something you say or write, especially publicly or officially, to let people know your intentions or opinions, or to record facts
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指公开或正式的〕陈述﹐声明
Sense.EXAMPLE: In an official statement, she formally announced her resignation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在一份官方声明中﹐她正式宣布辞职。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Prime Minister’s recent statements on Europe
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 首相最近关于欧洲问题的声明

Sense.DEF: a record showing amounts of money paid, received, owed etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: the company’s annual financial statements
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司的年度财务报表
Sense.EXAMPLE: I haven’t received my bank statement for last month yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还没有收到上个月的银行结算单。

Sense.DEF: something you do, make, wear etc that causes people to have a certain opinion about you
Sense.TRAN: 〔行为﹑穿着等对个性的〕表现﹐反映
Sense.EXAMPLE: The type of car you drive makes a statement about you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你驾驶的车型能反映出你的个性。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fashion statement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时尚宣言

Sense.DEF: the act of expressing something in words
Sense.EXAMPLE: presentation and clarity of statement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陈述的表达形式和清晰度

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The minister will make a statement on the matter tomorrow.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 明天部长将就此事发表声明。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make a statement, especially to the police
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He gave a statement to the police.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他向警方做了供述。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: give a written statement to newspapers, TV etc
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 〔在报纸﹑电视等上〕发表书面声明

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: say that a statement you gave is not true

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Police last night issued a brief statement about the incident.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚警方就该事件发表了一份简短声明。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The article was a clear statement of his beliefs.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这篇文章清楚地表明了他的信仰。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Researchers do not want to make any sweeping statements at this stage.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究者不想在这个阶段做任何笼统的声明。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one you must sign to show that it is true
one that is prepared and then read out
one that you officially promise is true
one that explains a government policy
one in which an organization states its aims

Sense.DEF: if an education authority statements a child who has special educational needs, they give a school additional money to help teach that child
Sense.TRAN: 〔教育部门〕为〔有特殊教育需要的儿童〕提供额外教育经费

Sense.DEF: statement pieces of jewellery, shoes etc are very noticeable and impressive – used especially in magazines
Sense.TRAN: 〔珠宝﹑鞋等〕引人注目的﹐抢眼的〔尤用于杂志〕

Sense.DEF: when a government gives itself special powers in order to try to control an unusually difficult or dangerous situation, especially when this involves limiting people’s freedom
Sense.EXAMPLE: After declaring a state of emergency , the government arrested all opposition leaders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宣布进入紧急状态后﹐政府逮捕了所有的反对派领导人。

Sense.DEF: using the most modern and recently developed methods, materials, or knowledge
Sense.TRAN: 使用最先进技术的﹐达到最新水平的
Sense.EXAMPLE: state-of-the-art technology
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最先进的技术
Sense.EXAMPLE: His new laptop is state-of-the-art.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那台新笔记本电脑是最先进的。

Sense.DEF: a large park owned and managed by a US state, often in an area of natural beauty
a private room or place for sleeping on a ship
one of the large rooms in a palace
a British school which receives money from the government and provides free education
a college or university that receives money from the US state it is in, to help pay its costs
if a criminal turns State’s evidence, they give information in a court of law about other criminals
Sense.TRAN: 〔罪犯向法庭〕提供对同案犯不利的证据﹔〔罪犯〕作为污点证人指控同党

Sense.DEF: a political or government leader, especially one who is respected as being wise and fair
Sense.EXAMPLE: a respected elder statesman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位受人尊敬的政界元老

Sense.DEF: showing the qualities of a statesman – used to show approval
Sense.TRAN: 有政治家风范的﹐像政治家的〔含褒义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: his statesmanlike handling of the crisis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他处理这场危机时表现出的政治家才干

Sense.DEF: a member of a police force that is controlled by one of the US state governments, who works anywhere in that state
a university in the US which receives money from a state to help pay its costs
affecting or involving the whole of a US state
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国〕影响全州的[地]﹔全州范围的[地]
Sense.EXAMPLE: a statewide poll
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 州民意测验
Sense.EXAMPLE: a model that could be used in towns statewide
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可在全州城镇采用的一个模式

Sense.DEF: not moving, changing, or developing
Sense.TRAN: 不动的﹔不变化的﹔不发展的﹔静（止）的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Economists predict that house prices will remain static for a long period.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济学家预测﹐房价将长期保持稳定。

Sense.DEF: noise caused by electricity in the air that blocks or spoils the sound from radio or TV
static electricity
complaints or opposition to a plan, situation, or action
Sense.TRAN: 〔对计划﹑状况或行动的〕抱怨﹐指责﹐反对
Sense.EXAMPLE: His promotion has caused a lot of static.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的晋升引起很多人不满。

Sense.DEF:
electricity that is not flowing in a current, but collects on the surface of an object and gives you a small
electric shock
the science dealing with the forces that produce balance in objects that are not moving

a drug that is used to lower
cholesterol
and reduce the risk of getting heart disease
Sense.TRAN: 胆固醇合成酶抑制剂﹐他汀类药物

Sense.DEF: a place where trains or buses regularly stop so that passengers can get on and off, goods can be loaded etc, or the buildings at such a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: I want to get off at the next station.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要在下一站下车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Grand Central Station
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中央火车站
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is there a waiting room in the station?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 车站里有候车室吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: the city bus station
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市内公共汽车站

Sense.SIGNPOST: CENTRE FOR A SERVICE OR ACTIVITY
Sense.DEF: a building or place that is a centre for a particular kind of service or activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: a police station
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察局
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fire station
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消防站

GramExa.PROPFORM: petrol station BrE【英】/gas station AmE【美】
GramExa.GLOSS: where petrol is sold
where you vote in an election

Sense.EXAMPLE: an Antarctic research station
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 南极考察站

Sense.DEF: an organization which makes television or radio broadcasts, or the building where this is done
Sense.EXAMPLE: New York jazz station WBGO
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纽约 WBGO 爵士乐广播电台
Sense.EXAMPLE: a local TV station
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家当地电视台

Sense.DEF: your position in society
Sense.EXAMPLE: Karen was definitely getting ideas above her station higher than her social rank .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡伦显然抱有超出自己身份的想法。

Sense.DEF: a place where someone stands or sits in order to be ready to do something quickly if needed
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re not to leave your station unless told.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有命令﹐不得离开岗位。

Sense.DEF: a large sheep or cattle farm in Australia or New Zealand
Sense.TRAN: 〔澳大利亚或新西兰的〕大牧场

Sense.DEF: a small military establishment
Sense.EXAMPLE: an isolated naval station
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一处偏远的海军基地

Sense.DEF: to send someone in the military to a particular place for a period of time as part of their military duty
Sense.TRAN: 部署〔某人〕于﹔安置﹔使驻扎
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was stationed overseas at the time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时候我被派驻在海外。

Sense.DEF: to move to a particular place and stand or sit there, especially in order to be able to do something quickly, or to cause someone to do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: A security guard was stationed near the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 近门处有一名保安站岗。

Sense.DEF: standing still instead of moving
Sense.EXAMPLE: How did you manage to drive into a stationary vehicle?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是怎么开车的﹐竟会撞上一辆停着的车子？
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not confuse with the noun stationery (=writing materials such as paper) . 不要与名词 stationery（文具）混淆。

Sense.DEF: a pause during a radio or television broadcast in the US, so that local stations can give their names or broadcast advertisements
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国电台﹑电视台的〕广播间歇〔用以插播台名或广告〕

Sense.DEF: a shop that sells stationery
someone in charge of a shop that sells stationery
paper for writing letters, usually with matching envelopes
Sense.TRAN: 〔一般指配有信封的〕信纸﹐信笺
Sense.EXAMPLE: a letter on hotel stationery
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用酒店信纸写的信

Sense.DEF: materials that you use for writing, such as paper, pens, pencils etc

PIC.HEADING: STATIONERY 文具
PIC.PICCONTENT: pencil sharpener 卷笔刀；marker 记号笔；scissors 剪刀；ruler 尺；stapler 订书机；tack AmE【美】工字钉；ring binder BrE【英】/binder AmE【美】活页夹；highlighter 荧光笔；rubber BrE【英】/eraser AmE【美】橡皮；drawing pin BrE【英】/thumbtack AmE【美】图钉；correction fluid 修正液；paperclips 回形针；folder 文件夹；pen 笔；punch 打孔器；Scotch tape 透明胶带；cap 笔帽；felt-tip pen 毡头笔；pencil 铅笔；fountain pen 钢笔；notebook 笔记簿；staple remover 起钉器；Bulldog clip BrE【英】/binder clip AmE【美】长尾夹；elastic band【英】/rubber band 橡皮筋

Sense.DEF: the local office of the police in a town, part of a city etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔城镇﹑市区等的〕警察（分）局﹐派出所

Sense.DEF: someone who is in charge of a railway station
a large car with extra space at the back, with a door there for loading and unloading

Subsense.DEF: a set of numbers which represent facts or measurements
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the official crime statistics
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 官方的犯罪统计数字

GramExa.EXAMPLE: statistics for injuries at work
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工伤统计数字

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Statistics show that 50% of new businesses fail in their first year.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 统计数据显示﹐50% 的新企业在第一年即倒闭。

Subsense.DEF: the science of collecting and examining such numbers
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Statistics is a branch of mathematics.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 统计学是数学的一个分支。

Sense.DEF: a single number which represents a fact or measurement
Sense.EXAMPLE: The statistic comes from a study recently conducted by the British government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项统计数据来自英国政府最近进行的一项研究。

Sense.DEF: if someone is just a statistic, they are just another example of someone who has died because of a particular type of accident or disease
Sense.TRAN: 一个数据〔指死于某种意外事故或疾病的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We can’t let these boys become just another statistic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不能让这些男孩成为另一项统计数字。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 以统计数字表明的证据

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The variation is not statistically significant.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一变化没有统计意义。

Sense.DEF: someone who works with statistics

a stative verb describes a state rather than an action or event, and is not usually used in
progressive13
forms, for example ‘belong’ in the sentence ‘this book belongs to me’
Sense.TRAN: 〔动词〕表示状态的 〔一般不用进行式﹐如 this book belongs to me 中的 belong〕

Sense.DEF: statues
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fine collection of Greek statuary
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一批精美的希腊雕塑藏品

Sense.DEF: an image of a person or animal that is made in solid material such as stone or metal and is usually large
Sense.EXAMPLE: Churchill’s statue stands outside the parliament building.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丘吉尔的塑像矗立在议会大厦外。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A bronze statue was erected in his honour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们立了一座铜像纪念他。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A statue of the queen was erected to mark the jubilee celebrations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为纪念这次周年庆典竖立起了一座女王塑像。

Sense.DEF:
a statue of a woman on Liberty Island, in New York Harbor, given to the US by France in 1884 to celebrate the American and French
revolutions
. The woman is holding up a
torch
in her right hand and she represents freedom.
large and beautiful in an impressive way, like a statue
Sense.TRAN: 高大漂亮的﹐雕像般端庄优美的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a statuesque woman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位端庄优雅的高挑女子

Sense.DEF: a very small statue that can be put on a table or shelf
Sense.TRAN: 〔放在桌子或架子上的〕小雕像﹐小塑像

Sense.DEF: the degree to which someone is admired or regarded as important

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Armstrong was a musician of world stature.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿姆斯特朗是一位享誉全球的音乐家。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He grew in stature became more admired or popular during the campaign.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这场宣传活动中﹐他的声望提高了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his growing stature as an artist
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他作为艺术家日益提高的声望

Sense.DEF: someone’s height or size
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bernard was short in stature, with a large head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伯纳德个子矮﹐头很大。

Sense.DEF: the official legal position or condition of a person, group, country etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔人﹑团体﹑国家等的〕法律地位﹔身份﹐状况
Sense.EXAMPLE: These documents have no legal status in Britain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些文件在英国并无法律效力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What is your marital status are you married or not ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的婚姻状况是什么？

Sense.DEF: your social or professional rank or position, considered in relation to other people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: low-status jobs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 地位低下的工作

Sense.EXAMPLE: Doctors have traditionally enjoyed high social status .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生历来享有很高的社会地位。

Sense.DEF: respect and importance that someone or something is given
Sense.EXAMPLE: the status given to education
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对教育的重视程度
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mandela’s status as a world leader
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 曼德拉作为世界领导人的重要地位

Sense.DEF: a situation at a particular time, especially in an argument, discussion etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在争论﹑讨论中〕某事物的状态[状况]
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s the status of the trade talks?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贸易谈判进行到何种程度了？

Sense.DEF: the state of a situation as it is

GramExa.GLOSS: not make any changes
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Will the West use its influence to maintain the status quo and not disrupt the flow of oil?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 西方会利用其影响来维持现状﹐而不切断石油运输吗？

Sense.DEF: something that you have or own that you think shows high social rank or position
Sense.EXAMPLE: A Rolls Royce is seen as a status symbol.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳斯莱斯轿车被视为社会地位的象征。

Sense.DEF: a law passed by a parliament, council etc and formally written down
Sense.EXAMPLE: Protection for the consumer is laid down by statute established by law .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保障消费者权益已有法律明文规定。

Sense.DEF: a formal rule of an institution or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: College statutes forbid drinking on campus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学校规禁止在校园内喝酒。

Sense.DEF: officially part of the law
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government would like to see this new law on the statute book as soon as possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府希望看到这项新法令尽快成为正式法律。

Sense.DEF: the whole group of written laws established by a parliament, council etc
a law which gives the period of time within which action may be taken on a legal question or crime
fixed or controlled by law
Sense.EXAMPLE: statutory employment rights
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法定就业权利
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s below the statutory age for school attendance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她还不到法定的入学年龄。

Sense.DEF: a crime that is described by a law and can be punished by a court
the crime of having sex with someone who is younger than a particular age
Sense.TRAN: 法定强奸罪〔指与小于某一法定年龄的人发生性关系〕

Sense.DEF: giving strong loyal support to another person, organization, belief etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a staunch conservative
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 忠实的保守党党员

GramExa.EXAMPLE: one of Bush’s staunchest supporters
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 布什最坚定的支持者之一

Sense.DEF: to stop the flow of liquid, especially of blood from a wound
Sense.TRAN: 止住〔液体〕的流出﹔使〔伤口〕止血
Sense.EXAMPLE: He used a rag to staunch the flow of blood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用一块破布来止血。

Sense.DEF: the set of five lines on which music is written

one of the thin curved pieces of wood fitted close together to form the sides of a
barrel
to break something inwards
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ship’s side was stove in when it went onto the rocks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船触礁﹐船舷被撞破。

Sense.DEF: to keep someone or something from reaching you or affecting you for a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: She brought some fruit on the journey to stave off hunger .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她旅途上带了些水果充饥。

Sense.DEF:
the plural of
staff12
to remain in a place rather than leave
Sense.EXAMPLE: They stayed all afternoon chatting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们待了整个下午聊天。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I decided to stay home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决定待在家里。

GramExa.PROPFORM: stay for a year/ten minutes/a week etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Isabel stayed for a year in Paris to study.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊莎贝尔在巴黎待了一年学习。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stay in bed and drink plenty of liquids.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卧床休息﹐多喝水。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She stayed late to finish the report.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了完成报告﹐她工作到很晚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stay right there! I’ll be back in a minute.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 就待在那里！我马上就回来。

GramExa.PROPFORM: stay to dinner/stay for lunch etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you stay for supper?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你干吗不留下来吃晚饭呢？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some of the students stayed after class remained after others had gone to talk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几个学生课后留下来说话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I should stay and help.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我应该留下来帮忙。

Sense.DEF: to continue to be in a particular position, place, or state, without changing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rollings will stay as chairman this year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗林斯今年将继续担任主席一职。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Eat right to stay healthy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要合理饮食以保持健康。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was hard to stay awake.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 困得快睁不开眼了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Nine women gained weight, and four stayed the same .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 九名女性体重增加﹐四名仍保持不变。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stay away from my daughter!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要缠着我女儿！
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You stay on this road for a mile before turning off.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 顺着这条路走一英里﹐然后拐弯。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Most of her boyfriends don’t stay around stay with her very long.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的男朋友大多数都没能和她维持多久。

Sense.DEF: to live in a place for a short time as a visitor or guest
Sense.EXAMPLE: How long are they going to stay?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们打算住多久？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My mother is staying with us this week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我母亲这星期来我们家住。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’re staying in the same hotel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们住在同一家酒店。

GramExa.GLOSS: stay from one evening to the next day
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did you stay the night at Carolyn’s?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在卡罗琳家里过夜了？

Sense.DEF: to remain in one place and not move
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stay put until I get back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 待在原地直到我回来。

Sense.DEF: to become accepted and used by most people
Sense.TRAN: 被普遍接受[使用]﹔成为风尚
Sense.EXAMPLE: Professional women’s basketball is here to stay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 职业女子篮球运动已得到普遍认可。

Sense.DEF: to remain at school after the day’s classes are finished, often as a punishment
Sense.TRAN: 放学后留校〔常作为惩罚〕

Sense.DEF: to finish something in spite of difficulties
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dieters should try hard to stay the course.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 节食者应该努力坚持到底。

Subsense.DEF:
to continue watching or listening to the same television
channel
or radio station
Subsense.TRAN: 继续收看〔同一电视频道〕﹔继续收听〔同一电台广播〕

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you should look or listen for more information about a particular subject at a later time
Subsense.TRAN: 继续留意〔信息〕﹐继续关注〔消息〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The project is still under discussion, so stay tuned.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 方案仍在讨论之中﹐请继续关注。

Sense.DEF: used to tell a dog not to move
to stop someone from doing something
law if a judge stays an order, ruling etc, they stop a particular decision from being used or a particular action from happening
Sense.TRAN: 暂缓[延缓]执行命令/判决/处决等

Exponent.DEF: to not leave a place, or to be in a place for a particular period of time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Stay where you are and don’t move.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 待在原地不要动。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: John only stayed at the party for a couple of hours.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰在派对上只待了几个小时。

Exponent.DEF: to stay somewhere. In written English, people often prefer to use remain rather than stay , because it sounds more formal.
Exponent.TRAN: 停留,留下〔在书面英语中,remain比stay更为常用,因为remain更正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Some 2,000 protesters remained outside the building and refused to leave.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 约2,000名抗议者守在大楼外拒绝离开。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The judge recommended that he remain in jail for the rest of his life.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官建议让他在监狱里度过余生。

Exponent.DEF: to stay in a place a little longer than you need to, because you are enjoying yourself, or because you hope to see someone or something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He lingered outside the lecture hall, hoping for a chance to talk to her.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在讲堂外徘徊,希望找到和她说话的机会。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There are plenty of small cafés where you can linger over a cappuccino.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有不少小咖啡馆,你可以坐坐喝杯卡布奇诺。

Exponent.DEF: to stay in a place not doing anything – used when you think someone is waiting for the chance to do something bad or illegal
Exponent.TRAN: 游荡〔伺机做坏事或违法的事〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The two men had been seen loitering in the area on the day that the car was stolen.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车被盗那天,有人看见两名男子在该地区游荡。

Exponent.DEF: to stay somewhere not doing anything
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There are gangs of boys hanging around on street corners.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几伙男孩在街角闲荡。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I don’t mind hanging around for a few minutes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我等一会儿没关系。

Exponent.DEF: to stay in the same place or situation for a period of time, especially while you are waiting for something to happen or someone to arrive
Exponent.TRAN: 待在…附近﹐继续处于…情况中〔尤指等待某事发生或某人到来〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I decided to stick around and see how it all turned out.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决定待一会儿,看看结果如何。

Sense.DEF: to spend the evening at home rather than go out
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was tired, so I decided to stay in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很累﹐因此决定晚上待在家里不出去了。

Sense.DEF: to continue to do a job or to study after the usual or expected time for leaving
Sense.TRAN: 〔在通常或预定的时间后〕继续留下来工作[学习]
Sense.EXAMPLE: He resigned as chairman, but stayed on as an instructor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他辞去了主席职务﹐但留下来做指导。

Sense.DEF: to remain away from home during the evening or night
Sense.EXAMPLE: He started staying out late , drinking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始夜不归宿﹐在外面喝酒。

Sense.DEF: to not get involved in an argument or fight
Sense.TRAN: 不介入﹐不干预〔争吵﹑打斗〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You stay out of it . It’s none of your business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你别掺和进去﹐这不关你的事。

Sense.DEF: to not go to bed at the time you would normally go to bed
Sense.EXAMPLE: We stayed up all night talking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们没睡觉﹐聊了一整夜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I let the kids stay up late on Fridays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我允许孩子们星期五晚点睡。

Sense.DEF: a limited time of living in a place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I met her towards the end of my stay in Los Angeles.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在洛杉矶的逗留快要结束的时候遇见了她。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a short stay in the hospital
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 短期住院

Sense.DEF: the stopping or delay of an action because a judge has ordered it

GramExa.GLOSS: a delay in punishing someone by killing them

Sense.DEF:
a strong wire or rope used for supporting a ship’s
mast
Sense.TRAN: 支索〔支撑船桅的钢索或绳索〕

Sense.DEF:
a short piece of plastic or wire used to keep a shirt
collar
stiff
staying at home, rather than working somewhere else, usually in order to take care of children
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常为了照顾孩子〕待在家里的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stay-at-home mom
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在家不上班的妈妈

Sense.DEF: a horse or person that is able to continue to the end of a long race, job etc
Sense.TRAN: 有耐力的马﹔有持久力的人

Sense.DEF: the ability or energy to continue doing something difficult until it is finished
Sense.EXAMPLE: a team with staying power
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有耐力的一支球队

Sense.DEF: a large strong dog that in the past was trained to help find people who were lost in the snow
Sense.TRAN: 圣伯纳犬〔一种瑞士大狗﹐过去被训练用来寻找雪地失踪者〕

Sense.DEF:
a disease that one person passes to another through having sex, such as
aids
or
herpes
Sense.TRAN: 性传播疾病〔如艾滋病﹑疱疹〕

Sense.DEF: to do something that someone else usually does or was going to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pearson was appointed to go in Harrison’s stead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮尔逊受命接替哈里森的工作。

Sense.DEF: to be very useful to someone when needed
Sense.EXAMPLE: His years of training were standing him in good stead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多年的训练对他很有好处。

Sense.DEF: faithful and very loyal
Sense.EXAMPLE: her father’s steadfast love for her
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她父亲对她永不改变的爱

Sense.DEF: being certain that you are right about something and refusing to change your opinion in any way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dr. Faraday remained steadfast in his plea of innocence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法拉第医生坚持自己无罪的抗辩。

Sense.DEF: continuing or developing gradually or without stopping, and not likely to change
Sense.TRAN: 平稳进行的﹔持续的﹔逐渐的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul is making steady progress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗逐渐在进步。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a steady rain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下个不停的雨

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Employment is holding steady at 96%.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 就业率平稳地维持在96%。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a steady stream of traffic
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 川流不息的来往车辆

Sense.DEF: firmly held in a particular position and not moving or shaking
Sense.TRAN: 稳定的﹐牢固的﹐不摇晃的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Keep the camera steady while you take a picture.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拍照时要端稳相机。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It takes a steady hand to perform surgery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做手术手要稳。

Sense.DEF: a job or work that will definitely continue over a long period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s hard to find a steady, well-paying job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 找一份稳定﹑收入又高的工作很不容易。

Sense.DEF: if someone’s voice is steady, or they look at you in a steady way, they seem calm and do not stop speaking or looking at you
Sense.TRAN: 〔嗓音〕沉稳的﹐平静的﹔〔目光〕镇定的﹐沉着的﹐凝视的
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were tears in her eyes, but her voice was steady.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她眼里含着泪水﹐但声音很平静。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He could not meet Connor’s steady gaze.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他无法面对康纳注视的目光。

Sense.DEF: someone who is steady is sensible and you can depend on them
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is a steady worker.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他工作踏实。

Sense.DEF: someone that you have been having a romantic relationship with for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 关系固定的男朋友/女朋友

Sense.DEF: a serious and strong relationship that continues for a long time

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The company’s exports have grown steadily .
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司的出口量在稳定增长。

Sense.DEF: to hold someone or something so they become more balanced or controlled, or to become more balanced or controlled

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He reached the chair and steadied himself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他伸手抓住椅子让自己站稳。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane steadied, and the passengers relaxed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机平稳后﹐乘客们松了一口气。

Sense.DEF: to stop increasing or decreasing and remain about the same
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dollar has steadied after early losses on the money markets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美元在货币市场经历早前下跌后﹐现在已经回稳。

Sense.DEF: to become calmer, or to make someone do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tamar took a deep breath to steady her nerves .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 塔马深吸了一口气让自己平静下来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jess is a steadying influence on the rest of the team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰斯对其他队员具有一种稳定情绪的影响力。

Sense.DEF: to have a long regular romantic relationship with someone

a
boyfriend
or
girlfriend
that someone has been having a romantic relationship with
used when you want to tell someone to be careful or not to cause an accident
Sense.EXAMPLE: Steady! You nearly knocked me over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小心点！ 你差点把我撞倒了。

Sense.DEF: used when you think that what someone is saying or doing is too extreme
Sense.TRAN: 说话当心点﹐注意点〔当某人说话太重或行为过分时用作提醒〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Steady on! That bottle’s got to last all night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 悠着点﹐那瓶酒是要喝一晚上的。

Sense.DEF: the idea that things in space have always existed and have always been moving away from each other as new atoms begin to exist
Sense.TRAN: 〔宇宙学中的〕稳恒态学说﹐定态理论

Sense.DEF:
good quality
beef
, or a large thick piece of any good quality red meat
a large thick piece of fish
Sense.TRAN: 鳕鱼排/三文鱼排/金枪鱼排等

Sense.DEF:
beef
that is not of very good quality and is used in making
casseroles
etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔质量一般﹑用来做炖锅菜的〕牛肉

Sense.DEF: a restaurant that serves steak
steak that is cut into very small pieces and eaten raw, usually with a raw egg
Sense.TRAN: 〔切成小块﹐通常配生鸡蛋供生吃的〕鞑靼碎牛排

Sense.DEF: to take something that belongs to someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Boys broke into a shop and stole £45 in cash.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男孩们闯进一家商店﹐盗走了45英镑现金。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He stole money from his parents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他偷了父母的钱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’d stolen the flowers from our garden.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他偷了我们花园里的花。

Sense.DEF: to use someone else’s ideas without getting permission or without admitting that they are not your own ideas
Sense.EXAMPLE: Inventors know that someone is always going to try to steal their designs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发明者知道总会有人设法窃取他们的设计。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A well-known scientist was accused of stealing his former student’s ideas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位著名科学家被指责剽窃他以前学生的观点。

Sense.DEF: to move quietly without anyone noticing you

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He dressed quietly and stole out of the house.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他悄悄地穿好衣服﹐溜出屋子。

Sense.DEF: to do something, especially when you are acting in a play, that makes people pay more attention to you than to other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: Elwood stole the show with a marvellous performance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃尔伍德的精彩表演大抢风头。

Sense.DEF: to look at someone or something quickly and secretly
Sense.TRAN: 偷偷地看一眼/瞥一眼等
Sense.EXAMPLE: She stole a glance at her watch while he was speaking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在他说话的时候﹐她偷偷地看了一眼手表。

Subsense.DEF:
to run to the next
base
before someone hits the ball in the sport of baseball

to suddenly take control of the ball,
puck
etc when the other team had previously had control of it, for example in
basketball
or
ice hockey
Subsense.TRAN: 〔在篮球或冰球比赛中〕断〔球〕﹐截〔球〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Roy steals the ball four times in the first half.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗伊在上半场断球四次。

Sense.DEF: to kiss someone quickly when they are not expecting it
to gain an advantage over someone by doing something that they had planned to do before them
Sense.TRAN: 抢先某人一步﹐抢占先机
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was afraid another scholar was going to steal a march on him and publish first.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他担心别的学者会抢在他前面首先发表。

Sense.DEF: to get the success and praise someone else should have got, by doing what they had intended to do
to make someone fall in love with you
Sense.TRAN: 偷走某人的心﹐使某人爱上自己

Exponent.DEF: to illegally take something that belongs to someone else
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The thieves stole over £10,000 worth of computer equipment.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 窃贼盗取了价值逾一万英镑的计算机设备。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Thousands of cars get stolen every year.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年都有数千辆汽车被盗。

Exponent.DEF: to steal something – used when it is clear from the situation that you mean that someone takes something dishonestly
Exponent.TRAN: 拿走,偷走〔用于从上下文可以明确知道是“偷”的意思时〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The boys broke into her house and took all her money.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那几个男孩闯进她家,把她的钱全拿走了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They didn’t take much – just a few items of jewellery.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们没偷多少东西——就几件首饰。

Exponent.DEF: to go into someone’s home and steal things, especially when the owners are not there
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Their house was burgled while they were away.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们外出期间家里被盗了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If you leave windows open, you are asking to be burgled.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 开着窗户就是招贼上门。

Exponent.DEF: to steal money or other things from a bank, shop, or person
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The gang were convicted of robbing a bank in Essex.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那伙人因抢劫埃塞克斯的一家银行被定罪。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: An elderly woman was robbed at gunpoint in her own home.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位老妇人在自己家里遭持枪抢劫。

Exponent.DEF: to attack someone in the street and steal something from them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: People in this area are frightened of being mugged when they go out.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区的人们都害怕外出时遭到抢劫。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Someone tried to mug me outside the station.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人试图在车站外抢劫我。

Exponent.DEF: to steal something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Someone’s nicked my wallet!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人扒走了我的钱包！
Exponent.EXAMPLE: When I came back, my car had been pinched.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我回来时发现我的车被偷了。

Exponent.DEF: to steal money from the organization you work for, especially money that you are responsible for
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Government officials embezzled more than $2.5 million from the department.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府官员从该部门侵吞了逾250万英镑。

Exponent.DEF: stealing things from a shop by taking them when you think no one is looking
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Shoplifting costs stores millions of pounds every year.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年店家都因商品被偷损失数百万英镑。

Exponent.DEF: the activity of dishonestly persuading people to give you their credit card details over the Internet, so that you can steal money from their bank account
Exponent.TRAN: 网上钓鱼〔指在网上骗取信用卡信息以盗取银行账户的不法行为〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Phishing is becoming very popular with computer criminals.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 网上钓鱼正在成为计算机犯罪分子惯用的手段。

Sense.DEF: to be very cheap
Sense.EXAMPLE: an excellent seafood dish that is a steal at $8.25
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一道 8.25 美元价廉物美的海鲜

Sense.DEF:
the act of suddenly taking control of the ball when the other team had previously had control of it, especially in
basketball
Sense.EXAMPLE: Johnson had ten points and a steal in the first half.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上半场约翰逊得 10 分﹐还有一次断球成功。

Sense.DEF:
the act of running to the next
base
before someone hits the ball in the sport of baseball
when you do something very quietly, slowly or secretly, so that no one notices you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cats rely on stealth to catch their prey.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猫科动物靠偷袭捕捉猎物。

Sense.DEF:
a system of making military aircraft that cannot be discovered by
radar
instruments

GramExa.GLOSS: a plane made using this system
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 隐形轰炸机/飞机/战斗机等

Sense.DEF: an extra tax or charge that a government introduces in such a way that people do not realize that they are paying more money – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 隐性税﹐隐藏的赋税〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: moving or doing something quietly and secretly
Sense.TRAN: 悄悄的﹐鬼鬼祟祟的﹐偷偷的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the stealthy approach of the soldiers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 士兵的悄悄靠近

Sense.DEF: the hot mist that water produces when it is boiled
Sense.EXAMPLE: Steam rose from the hot tub.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水蒸气从热腾腾的浴缸里升起。

Sense.DEF: the mist that forms on windows, mirrors etc when warm wet air suddenly becomes cold
power that is produced by boiling water to make steam, in order to make things work or move
Sense.EXAMPLE: The engines are driven by steam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些发动机是由蒸汽驱动的。

GramExa.GLOSS: an engine etc that works by steam power
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 蒸汽机/蒸汽火车/汽锤等

Sense.DEF: to get rid of your anger, excitement, or energy in a way that does not harm anyone by doing something active

Subsense.DEF: if an engine picks up steam, it gradually starts to go faster
if plans, beliefs etc pick up steam, they gradually become more important and more people become interested in them
Subsense.TRAN: 〔计划﹑观念等〕逐渐变得重要﹐逐渐得到关注
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The election campaign is picking up steam.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 竞选活动声势逐渐壮大。

Sense.DEF: to no longer have the energy or the desire to continue doing something, especially because you are tired
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因疲劳而〕泄气﹐失去动力
Sense.EXAMPLE: I usually just let her yell until she runs out of steam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我通常就任她叫喊到没有力气为止。

Sense.DEF: if you go somewhere under your own steam, you get there without help from anyone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll get to the restaurant under my own steam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会自己去餐馆的。

Sense.DEF: a railway system in which the trains use steam for power
Sense.EXAMPLE: the age of steam
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒸汽机车时代

Sense.DEF: if something steams, steam rises from it, especially because it is hot
Sense.EXAMPLE: A pot was steaming on top of the cooker.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 锅在炉子上冒着热气。

Sense.DEF: to cook something in steam
Sense.EXAMPLE: Steam the vegetables lightly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把蔬菜稍蒸一下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: steamed broccoli
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒸西蓝花

Sense.DEF: to travel somewhere in a boat or train that uses steam to produce power

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We steamed from port to port.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们乘汽船从一个港口到另一个港口。

Sense.DEF: to go somewhere very quickly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Geoff steamed in, ten minutes late.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰夫急匆匆地进来﹐迟到了十分钟。

Sense.DEF: to be very angry
to start doing something very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is steaming ahead with its investment programme.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司在迅速开展其投资计划。

Sense.DEF: to use steam to open an envelope or to remove a stamp from an envelope
Sense.TRAN: 用蒸汽把〔信封〕揭开/把〔邮票〕揭下来

Sense.DEF: to cover something with steam, or to become covered with steam
Sense.EXAMPLE: My glasses are all steamed up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的眼镜上全是水汽。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A pan was boiling on the stove, steaming up the windows.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 炉子上有个锅烧开了﹐窗户上都是水汽。

Sense.DEF: a boat that uses steam for power and is sailed along rivers and coasts
to clean something by using a machine that produces steam
excited and angry or worried
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t get so steamed-up about it – it’s not really important.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别为这事那么生气﹐没什么大不了的。

Sense.DEF:
a
steamship
a container used to cook food in steam
a member of a large group of young people who go into apublic place, surprise and frighten the people there, and then rob them
Sense.TRAN: 〔大批涌入公共场所﹐对人实施恐吓抢劫的〕结帮抢劫者﹐团伙抢劫者

Sense.DEF: very hot
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a steaming hot day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天天气无比炎热。

Sense.DEF: very drunk – used in Scotland and northern England
Sense.TRAN: 大醉的﹐烂醉的〔用于苏格兰和英格兰北部地区〕

Sense.DEF: a method of stealing in which a large group of young people go into a public place, surprise and frighten the people there, and then rob them

an electric
iron
that produces steam in order to make clothes easier to press smooth
to steamroller
Sense.TRAN: 〔以权势和影响力〕强迫﹐迫使﹔强行

Sense.DEF: a heavy vehicle with very wide wheels that is driven over road surfaces to make them flat
someone who uses their power and influence to make sure that something happens the way they want it to
Sense.TRAN: 以势压人者﹐使用高压手段者

Sense.DEF: to make sure something happens by using all your power and influence, or to defeat your opponents badly
Sense.TRAN: 〔以权势和影响力〕强迫﹐迫使﹔强行﹔打垮
Sense.EXAMPLE: He steamrollered the bill through Parliament against fierce opposition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不顾激烈反对﹐强行让议会通过这项法案。

Sense.DEF: a room filled with steam that people sit in to relax
a large ship that uses steam to produce power
a large machine that digs and moves earth
full of steam or covered in steam
Sense.TRAN: 充满蒸汽的﹔水汽覆盖的
Sense.EXAMPLE: steamy windows
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒙着水汽的窗户

Sense.DEF: sexually exciting and slightly shocking
Sense.EXAMPLE: a steamy love scene
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火爆的性爱镜头

Sense.DEF:
a steamy day or steamy weather feels hot and
humid
a strong fast horse

strong metal that can be shaped easily, consisting of iron and
carbon
Sense.EXAMPLE: a steel bridge
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钢铁大桥
Sense.EXAMPLE: stainless steel steel that does not change colour knives
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不锈钢小刀

Sense.DEF: the industry that makes steel
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sheffield is a major steel town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢菲尔德是主要的钢铁城市之一。

Sense.DEF: the ability to be brave and calm in a dangerous or difficult situation
Sense.TRAN: 超人的胆量﹐巨大的勇气

Sense.DEF: a thin bar of steel used for making knives sharp
to prepare yourself to do something that you know will be unpleasant or upsetting
Sense.TRAN: 使自己准备应付〔不愉快的事〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He steeled himself not to look away.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他硬下心不把目光移开。

Sense.DEF: a group of people who play music on steel drums

a type of drum from the West Indies, made from oil
barrels
, which you hit in different areas to produce different musical sounds
Sense.TRAN: 钢鼓〔西印度群岛一种用油桶制成的鼓〕

Sense.DEF:
a musical instrument with ten strings that is played using a steel bar and a
pedal a bar you press with your foot
Sense.TRAN: 夏威夷吉他﹐（踏板）钢棒吉他

Sense.DEF: a company that makes steel
a factory where steel is made
a rough material made of fine steel threads, that is used to make surfaces smooth, remove paint etc
Sense.TRAN: 钢丝球〔用于磨光表面﹑擦除油漆等〕

Sense.DEF: someone who works in a factory where steel is made
a factory where steel is made
extremely determined and very strong
Sense.EXAMPLE: a look of steely determination
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一副铁了心的样子

Sense.DEF: if someone has steely eyes or is steely-eyed, they look very determined
having a grey colour like steel
Sense.TRAN: 钢一样灰白的﹐灰蓝色的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a steely sky
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 灰蓝色的天空

Sense.DEF: a road, hill etc that is steep slopes at a high angle
Sense.EXAMPLE: The road became rocky and steep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 路变得崎岖陡峭起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a steep climb to the top
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到山顶的一段陡坡

Sense.DEF: steep prices, charges etc are unusually expensive
Sense.TRAN: 〔价格﹑收费等〕过高的﹐过分昂贵的
Sense.EXAMPLE: steep rents
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昂贵的 租金

Sense.DEF: involving a big increase or decrease
Sense.TRAN: 〔增加或减少〕大幅度的﹔急剧的
Sense.EXAMPLE: steep cuts in benefits
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 救济金的大幅度削减

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a steep increase in house prices
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房价的急剧上涨

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a steep drop in orders
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 订单的锐减

Sense.DEF: to have a lot of a particular quality
Sense.TRAN: 有丰富的历史/传统/政治等
Sense.EXAMPLE: a town steeped in history
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 历史悠久的小城

Sense.DEF: to put food in a liquid and leave it there, so that it becomes soft or has the same taste as the liquid, or so that it gives the liquid its taste
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leave the tea bag to steep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让茶包好好浸泡一下。

Sense.DEF: if a slope, road etc steepens, or if something steepens it, it becomes steeper
a tall pointed tower on the roof of a church
a long race in which horses jump over gates, water etc
a long race in which people run and jump over fences, water etc

someone whose work is repairing towers, tall
chimneys
etc
Sense.TRAN: 尖塔[高烟囱]修理工﹔高空修理工

Sense.DEF: to control the direction a vehicle is going, for example by turning a wheel
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was steering with only one hand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只用一只手在驾驶。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Steer toward the left.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 向左行驶。

Sense.DEF: to guide someone’s behaviour or the way a situation develops
Sense.TRAN: 引导﹐指导〔某人的行为〕﹔引领〔局势的发展〕

GramExa.PROPFORM: steer sb towards/away from/through etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Teachers try to steer pupils away from drugs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教师试图引导学生远离毒品。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Helen tried to steer the conversation away from herself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海伦设法把话题从自己身上引开。

Sense.DEF: to be in charge of an organization, team etc and make decisions that help it to be successful, especially during a difficult time
Sense.TRAN: 掌管﹐控制﹔〔尤指在困难时期〕带领…度过

GramExa.EXAMPLE: McKinney steered the company through the recession.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦金尼带领公司度过经济衰退。

Sense.DEF: to guide someone to a place, especially while touching them
Sense.TRAN: 带领﹐引导 〔尤指同时用手轻触某人〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Joel steered Don and Louise towards the backyard.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔尔领着唐和路易丝向后院走去。

Sense.DEF: to avoid someone or something unpleasant or difficult
Sense.TRAN: 避开（某人/某物）﹔从（某人/某物）处脱身
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jo tried to steer clear of political issues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔试图避开政治话题。

Sense.DEF: to choose a particular way of doing something
Sense.TRAN: 选择某种做法﹐采用某种方式
Sense.EXAMPLE: Managers were allowed to steer their own course.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经理可以自行决断。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government chose to steer a middle course between the two strategies chose a strategy that was not extreme .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府在这两种策略之间选择走折中路线。

Sense.DEF: a young male cow whose sex organs have been removed
the part of a passenger ship where people who had the cheapest tickets used to travel in the past
the parts of a car, boat etc that allow you to control its direction
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车﹑船等的〕转向装置﹐操纵装置
Sense.EXAMPLE: power steering
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 动力转向装置

Sense.DEF: a committee that guides or directs a particular activity
Sense.TRAN: 〔某项活动的〕指导委员会﹐程序委员会

Sense.DEF: a wheel that you turn to control the direction of a car
someone who steers a ship
a tall cup for drinking beer, often decorated and with a lid
Sense.TRAN: 〔常有装饰﹑带盖的〕大啤 酒杯

Sense.DEF: relating to the stars
extremely good
Sense.EXAMPLE: the company’s stellar growth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司辉煌的发展
Sense.EXAMPLE: McKellen gave a stellar performance .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦克凯伦的表演极为精彩。

Sense.DEF:
if a
pop
band, actor etc goes stellar, they become very popular and famous
Sense.TRAN: 〔流行乐队﹑演员等〕变得极受欢迎﹐出名
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a stand-up comedian, and my sources tell me he is about to go stellar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有个单口喜剧演员﹐据我所知他很快就要走红了。

Sense.DEF: the long thin part of a plant, from which leaves, flowers, or fruit grow

the long thin part of a wine glass,
vase
etc, between the base and the wide top
the narrow tube of a pipe used to smoke tobacco
having a long stem, a short stem etc
Sense.TRAN: 长茎的/短茎的﹔高脚的/矮脚的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: long-stemmed wine glasses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高脚酒杯

Sense.DEF: the part of a word that stays the same when different endings are added to it, for example ‘driv-’ in ‘driving’
Sense.TRAN: 词干〔如 driving 中的 driv-〕

Sense.DEF: to stop something from happening, spreading, or developing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The measures are meant to stem the tide of illegal immigration.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些措施旨在遏制非法移民潮。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an attempt to stem the decline in profits
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 遏制利润下滑的努力

Sense.DEF: to stop the flow of a liquid
Sense.TRAN: 阻止﹐堵住﹐止住〔液体的流动〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A tight bandage should stem the bleeding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 扎紧绷带可以止血。

Sense.DEF: to develop as a result of something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: His headaches stemmed from vision problems.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的头痛是由视力问题引起的。

Sense.DEF: a special type of cell in the body, that can divide in order to form other types of cells that have particular qualities or purposes
a very strong bad smell
Sense.EXAMPLE: the stench of urine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尿臭味

Sense.DEF: something unpleasant that makes you believe that something very bad and dishonest is happening

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a government filled with the stench of corruption
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 充斥着腐败风气的政府

Sense.DEF: a piece of plastic, metal, or paper in which designs or letters have been cut out, that you put over a surface and paint over, so that the design is left on the surface
Sense.TRAN: 〔镂有图案或文字的〕模版﹐蜡纸

Sense.DEF: a design made on something using a stencil
Sense.TRAN: 〔用模版﹑蜡纸印制的〕图案﹐文字

Sense.DEF: to make a design, letters etc using a stencil

a small British
submachine gun

Sense.TRAN:
the short form of 缩略式=
stenographer
速记员

the short form of 缩略式=
stenography
速记（法）

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to write down what someone else is saying, using stenography, and then type a copy of it
a fast way of writing in which you use special signs or short forms of words, used especially to record what someone is saying
a stentorian voice is very loud and powerful
the movement you make when you put one foot in front of or behind the other when walking
Sense.EXAMPLE: a video of baby’s first steps
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一盒婴儿学步的录像带
Sense.EXAMPLE: He took one step and fell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他走了一步就跌倒了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tom took a step back and held the door open.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆后退一步﹐把门撑开着。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I had to retrace my steps go back the way I came several times before I found the shop.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来回走了几次才找到那家商店。

Sense.DEF: one of a series of things that you do in order to deal with a problem or to succeed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This is the first step in reforming the welfare system.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是福利制度改革的第一步。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The president took immediate steps to stop the fighting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统立即采取措施阻止战斗。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an important step towards peace
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 通往和平的重要一步

Sense.DEF: a stage in a process, or a position on a scale
Sense.EXAMPLE: Each book goes up one step in difficulty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每本书的难度都加深一级。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Record your result, and go on to step 3.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把你的成绩记录下来﹐再接着进入步骤三。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the next step in the process
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 流程的下一步

Sense.EXAMPLE: Drug companies influence the scientific process every step of the way during every stage .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 制药公司影响着科研过程的每一步。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Describe step by step describing each stage how you went about achieving your goal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请你一步步来描述你是如何实现目标的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Moving to Cottage Grove represented a definite step up something that is better than you had before for my parents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 搬到卡蒂奇格罗夫对我父母来说绝对意味着一个改善。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He saw the job as a step down something that is worse than you had before .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他认为那份工作降了一个档次。

Sense.DEF: a flat narrow piece of wood or stone, especially one in a series, that you put your foot on when you are going up or down, especially outside a building
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jenny sat on the step in front of the house, waiting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮坐在房前的台阶上等着。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He climbed the wooden steps and rang the bell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他爬上木楼梯﹐按响门铃。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a flight of set of broad stone steps
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一段宽宽的石阶

Sense.DEF: the short distance you move when you take a step while walking
Sense.EXAMPLE: Roy was standing only a few steps away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗伊站在只有几步之遥的地方。

Sense.DEF: the sound you make when you put your foot down while walking
Sense.EXAMPLE: I heard a step in the corridor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到走廊里有脚步声。

Sense.DEF: a movement of your feet in dancing
Sense.EXAMPLE: the steps for the Charleston
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查尔斯顿舞的舞步

Subsense.DEF: having ideas or actions that are like those of other people
Subsense.TRAN: 〔与他人的观点或行为〕一致﹐相同

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He isn’t in step with ordinary voters.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和普通选民步调不一致。

Subsense.DEF: moving your feet so that your right foot goes forward at the same time as people you are walking with
having ideas or actions that are different from those of other people
Subsense.TRAN: 〔与他人的观点或行为〕不一致﹐不合拍

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This type of training is out of step with changes in the industry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种培训和该行业的变化不同步。

Subsense.DEF: moving your feet in a different way from people you are walking with
to be careful about what you say or how you behave
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You’d better watch your step – he’s the boss here.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你最好注意自己的言行——他是这里的老板。

Subsense.DEF: to be careful when you are walking
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Mind your step – the railing’s loose.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 走路当心——栏杆松动了。

Subsense.DEF: to start walking beside someone at the same speed as them
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Maggie fell into step beside her.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛吉在她身边和她齐步并行。

Subsense.DEF: to start thinking or doing the same as other people
Subsense.TRAN: 〔与他人的观点或行为〕开始保持一致[相同]
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The administration has fallen into step with its European allies on this issue.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这个问题上﹐政府已与其欧洲各盟国步调一致。

Subsense.DEF: to be better prepared for something or know more about something than someone else
Subsense.TRAN: （比某人）领先一步﹐（比某人）准备更充分[了解更多]
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A good teacher is always at least one step ahead of his students.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好老师总是比他的学生至少先行一步。

Subsense.DEF: to manage not to be caught by someone who is trying to find or catch you
Subsense.TRAN: 成功地躲避〔想要找到或抓到你的人〕

Sense.DEF: the way someone walks, which often tells you how they are feeling
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gianni’s usual bouncy step
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹尼一贯轻快的步伐

Sense.DEF:
a
stepladder

a type of exercise you do by walking onto and off a flat piece of equipment around 15-30
centimetres
high
Sense.EXAMPLE: a step class
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 踏板操班

Sense.DEF:
the difference in
pitch
between two musical notes that are separated by one
key
on the piano

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANING 义项 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The authority will take steps to reunite the child and his family.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 当局将会采取措施让孩子与家人团聚。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 一个重要/重大/很大的一步
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The move is seen as a major step forward for UK firms.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一举动对英国公司来说被认为是向前迈进了一大步。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The first step in resolving conflict is to understand what the other person wants.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 解决争端的第一步是要搞清对方想要什么。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He met in Washington with his campaign advisers to plan his next step.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在华盛顿会见竞选顾问,计划下一步行动。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: This is a small step in the right direction.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是朝着正确方向迈出的一小步。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an action that will have a good effect
Collocate.EXAMPLE: This is a positive step which gives cause for some optimism.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是积极的一步,引发了某种乐观情绪。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: something that is not usually done/has never been done before
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 不寻常/前所未有的一步
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Police last night took the unusual step of releasing photographs of him.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方昨晚采取了不寻常的行动,公开了他的照片。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We believe immediate steps could be taken to generate jobs.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们相信可以立即采取行动创造就业机会。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an action that makes things better
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The declaration which we have just signed is a big step forward for both of our nations.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们刚刚签署的公告对于我们两国来说都是向前迈进的重大一步。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an action that makes things worse
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A rationing system would be a major step backwards.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 实行配给制将是一个重大倒退。

Collocate.COLLOC: a step in the right direction
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an action that helps to improve things
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 朝正确方向迈出的一步
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Environmentalists said the law was a step in the right direction.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 环境保护主义者称该项法律是朝正确方向迈出的一步。

Sense.DEF: to raise one foot and put it down in front of or behind the other one in order to walk or move

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He stepped back to let me through.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他后退一步让我通过。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I stepped outside and closed the door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我走出去关上门。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr. Ives? Please step this way walk in the direction I am showing you .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 是艾夫斯先生吗？请这边走。

Sense.DEF: to bring your foot down on something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I accidentally stepped in a puddle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不小心踩进了水坑。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You’re stepping on my foot.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你踩到我的脚了。

Sense.DEF: to offend or upset someone, especially by trying to do their work
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因插手他人工作〕激怒[冒犯]某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not worried about stepping on anybody’s toes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不担心得罪任何人。

Sense.DEF: to behave badly by breaking rules or disobeying orders
Sense.TRAN: 行为出轨﹔违反规矩[命令]

Sense.DEF: to drive faster
to leave your job or official position, because you want to or because you think you should
Sense.EXAMPLE: Morris should step aside until the investigation is completed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫里斯应该停职直到调查结束。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Eve Johnson has stepped down as chairperson.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊夫·约翰逊已经辞去主席的职务。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was forced to step down from his post.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被迫下台。

Sense.DEF: to come and offer help, information etc
Sense.TRAN: 主动站出来〔提供帮助﹑信息等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police are appealing for witnesses to step forward.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方呼吁目击者主动站出来。

Sense.DEF: to become involved in an activity, discussion, or disagreement, sometimes in order to stop trouble
Sense.EXAMPLE: The military may step in if the crisis continues.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果危机持续下去﹐军方可能会介入。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Parents have stepped in to provide homework help in the afternoon program.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在下午的活动中﹐家长们参与进来帮助完成课后作业。

Sense.DEF: to start doing something, or become involved in a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sally stepped into the role of team leader.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨莉开始担任队长。

Sense.DEF: to leave your home or office for a short time
Sense.TRAN: 出去一会儿﹐暂时离开〔家或办公室〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s just stepped out for a few minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她就出去一会儿。

Sense.DEF: to increase the amount of an activity or the speed of a process in order to improve a situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The health department is stepping up efforts to reduce teenage smoking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 衞生部门正加大力度减少青少年吸烟人数。
Sense.EXAMPLE: stepped-up security at airports
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 升级了的机场安全措施

Sense.DEF: to agree to help someone or to be responsible for doing something
Sense.TRAN: 采取行动〔帮助某人或负责某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Residents will have to step up if they want to rid this area of crime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 居民如果想消除本地区的犯罪现象就必须行动起来。

Sense.DEF: used to show that someone is related to you not by birth but because a parent has married again
Sense.TRAN: 继的﹐后的〔无血缘关系﹐但因父母一方再婚而构成亲缘关系的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: her stepdad
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的继父
Sense.EXAMPLE: the problems of stepfamilies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 继亲家庭的种种问题

Sense.DEF:
a type of physical exercise in which you step on and off a small raised
platform
while doing movements with the upper part of your body
the son of your stepmother or stepfather
Sense.TRAN: 继兄﹐继弟〔继母或继父与过去的配偶所生的儿子〕

Sense.DEF: a step-by-step plan, method etc explains or does something carefully and in a particular order
Sense.TRAN: 一步接着一步的﹐循序渐进的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a step-by-step guide to making it in the music business
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对如何在音乐界获得成功的循序渐进的指导

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Take each lesson step by step .
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 循序渐进地上好每一 节课。

Sense.DEF: a big and important change in an organization or in society
Sense.TRAN: 〔机构或社会中的〕重大改革﹐重大变革

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The new law marks a step change in our programme for reforming public services.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条新法规标志着我们公共事业改革方案中的重大转变。

Sense.DEF: a stepdaughter or stepson
a daughter that your husband or wife has from a relationship before your marriage
a man who is married to your mother but who is not your father

a
horror film
, based on a book by Ira Levin, about a group of married women in a US village whose husbands secretly replace them with
robots
. The robots look exactly like the women, but they are designed to be interested only in cooking, cleaning their houses, and pleasing their husbands in every way. The phrase is sometimes used to describe women who behave in this way.
Sense.TRAN: 《复制娇妻》〔恐怖电影名﹐讲述美国某小镇上一群丈夫以机器人替换妻子的故事﹔该短语有时用于形容对丈夫百依百顺的女人〕

Sense.DEF:
a
ladder
which has two sloping parts that are joined at the top so that it can stand without support, and which can be folded flat
a woman who is married to your father but who is not your mother
a stepfather or stepmother
a large area of land without trees, especially in Russia, Asia, and eastern Europe
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指俄罗斯﹑亚洲和东欧的〕大草原﹐干草原

Sense.DEF: something that helps you to progress towards achieving something
Sense.TRAN: 成功的途径﹐进身之阶﹐敲门砖

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The course will be a stepping stone to another career.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这门课程将成为通向另一事业的踏脚石。

Sense.DEF: a row of large flat stones that you walk on to get across a stream
the daughter of your stepmother or stepfather
a son that your husband or wife has from a relationship before your marriage

a machine for playing records,
cds
etc that produces sound from two
speakers
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stereo with good speakers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 扬声器音质好的立体声音响

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was listening to the Beatles on the car stereo.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在听汽车立体声音响播放的披头士乐队的歌。

Sense.DEF: if sound is played or broadcast in stereo, it is directed through two speakers

using a recording or broadcasting system in which the sound is directed through two
speakers
Sense.EXAMPLE: stereo equipment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 立体声音响设备
