Sense.DEF: a stereoscopic picture, photograph etc appears solid when you look at it through a special machine
Sense.TRAN: 立体效果的﹐有立体感的

Sense.DEF: able to see the length, width, and depth of objects
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 立体视觉

Sense.DEF: a belief or idea of what a particular type of person or thing is like. Stereotypes are often unfair or untrue.
Sense.TRAN: 模式化的思想﹔老一套﹔旧框框

GramExa.EXAMPLE: racist stereotypes in the media
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 媒体中的种族主义成见

GramExa.EXAMPLE: women who don’t fit the stereotype of the good mother
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不符合人们心目中好母亲形象的女性

GramExa.EXAMPLE: stereotypes about the elderly
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对年长者的模式化观念

RunOn.EXAMPLE: the stereotypical Californian – tall, fit, and tanned
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 典型的加利福尼亚人——高挑﹑健壮﹑黝黑

Sense.DEF: to decide unfairly that a type of person has particular qualities or abilities because they belong to a particular race, sex, or social class

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Homeless people are stereotyped as alcoholics or addicts.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 无家可归者在人们心目中不是酗酒就是吸毒。

Sense.DEF: a person or animal that is sterile cannot produce babies

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Radiotherapy has left her permanently sterile.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 放射疗法造成她终身不育。

Sense.DEF:
completely clean and not containing any
bacteria
that might cause infection

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rinse the eye with sterile water.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用消过毒的水冲洗眼睛。

Sense.DEF: lacking new ideas, interest, or imagination
Sense.TRAN: 刻板的﹐缺乏新意[想象力]的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the increasingly sterile debate on political reform
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关政治改革的越来越俗套的辩论

Sense.DEF: a sterile building, room etc is not interesting or attractive and is often very plain
Sense.EXAMPLE: The classrooms are sterile, with no artwork on the walls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些教室毫无生气﹐墙上一张画都没有。

Sense.DEF: sterile land cannot be used to grow crops

to make something completely clean by killing any
bacteria
in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sterilize the bottles with boiling water.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用沸水把这些瓶子消毒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: sterilized milk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消过毒的牛奶
Sense.EXAMPLE: sterilizing solution
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消毒溶液

Sense.DEF: if a person or animal is sterilized, they have an operation to stop them producing babies
Sense.TRAN: 为…做绝育手术﹐使失去生殖能力

Sense.DEF: the standard unit of money in the United Kingdom, based on the pound
silver that is at least 92% pure
Sense.TRAN: 标准纯银〔至少达到 92%的纯度〕

Sense.DEF: very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ella has done some sterling work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃拉做了一些出色的工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has sterling qualities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他具备优秀的素质。

Sense.DEF: serious and strict, and showing strong disapproval of someone’s behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: sterner penalties for drug offences
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对毒品犯罪的更为严厉的惩罚

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Wait!’ I shouted in my sternest voice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “且慢！”我厉声喊道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His actions have earned him stern rebukes from human-rights organizations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的行为招致人权组织的严厉指责。

Sense.DEF: to have a strong character and be more determined than other people to succeed in a difficult situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔遇到困难时〕具有坚强的性格﹐有坚定的决心
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ann, made of sterner stuff than I, refused all offers of help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安比我性格坚强﹐她拒绝一切帮助。

Sense.DEF: the back of a ship

a
breastbone
a chemical that the body produces naturally or that can be made as a drug to treat illness and injuries. Steroids are sometimes used illegally by people doing sports to improve their performance.

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a body builder on steroids
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 服用类固醇的健美运动员

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is much bigger, stronger, more impressive etc than something else that is similar to it – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 某物大[强壮﹐出色等]得多〔幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They sell cinnamon rolls on steroids.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们出售超大的肉桂面包。

Sense.DEF: an instrument that a doctor uses to listen to your heart or breathing

a tall hat with a wide
brim edge
, worn especially in the American West
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在美国西部戴的〕斯特森高顶宽边帽﹐牛仔帽

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is loading and unloading ships
Sense.TRAN: 码头装卸工﹐码头搬运工

Sense.DEF: a hot meal made by cooking meat and vegetables slowly in liquid for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pot of stew
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一锅炖菜
Sense.EXAMPLE: beef stew
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炖牛肉

Sense.DEF: confused or worried about a difficult situation you are in
Sense.TRAN: 〔为处于困境而〕困惑的﹐焦虑的

Sense.DEF: to cook something slowly in liquid
Sense.EXAMPLE: stewed apples
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炖苹果

Variant.LEXVAR: let sb stew in their own juice

Sense.DEF: to leave someone to suffer the unpleasant results of their own actions instead of helping them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let him stew – I'm not going to help him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就让他自作自受——我才不会去帮他呢。

Sense.DEF: a man whose job is to serve food and drinks to passengers on a plane or ship
Sense.TRAN: 〔飞机﹑轮船上的〕男乘务员﹐男服务员

Sense.DEF: someone who is in charge of a horse race, meeting, or other public event
Sense.TRAN: 〔赛马﹑聚会或其他公共活动的〕负责人﹐管事﹐干事
Sense.EXAMPLE: race stewards
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛组织者

Sense.DEF: someone who protects something or is responsible for it, especially something such as nature, public property, or money
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指自然﹑公共财产或钱财等的〕保护者﹐负责人﹐主管

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kissinger was now chief steward of US foreign policy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 基辛格现在是美国外交政策的主要负责人了。

Sense.DEF: a man whose job is to manage a large property, such as a farm
a woman whose job is to serve food and drinks to passengers on a plane or ship
Sense.TRAN: 〔飞机﹑轮船上的〕女乘务员﹐女服务员

Sense.DEF: someone’s stewardship of something is the way that they control or protect it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some critics have doubts about his stewardship of the nation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些批评者对他管理国家的方式提出质疑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The farm was quite a different place under Mom’s stewardship.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在妈妈的管理下﹐农场完全变了样。

Sense.DEF: drunk
tea that is stewed tastes unpleasantly strong because it has been left in the pot too long
to attach something to something else using a substance, or to become attached to a surface

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Someone had stuck posters all over the walls.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人把海报贴满了墙。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I could feel my shirt sticking to my back.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能感觉到衬衫贴在了背上。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The oil keeps the pasta from sticking together.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 油可避免意大利面粘在一起。

Sense.EXAMPLE: This stamp won’t stick properly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这张邮票贴不牢。

Sense.DEF: if a pointed object sticks into something, or if you stick it there, it is pushed into it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: pins stuck in a notice board
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 插在布告板上的大头针

Sense.EXAMPLE: The boy stuck his finger up his nose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小男孩把手指塞到鼻孔里。

Sense.DEF: to put something somewhere quickly and without much care
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just stick it in the microwave for a few minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把它放进微波炉里加热几分钟就行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cards had been stuck through the letterbox.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡片被塞进信箱。

Sense.DEF: if you stick a part of your body somewhere, you put it in a position where other people can see it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Clara stuck her head around the door to see who was there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克拉拉从门后探出头来看看是谁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The baby stuck his legs in the air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宝宝把腿踢得高高的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t stick your tongue out . It’s rude!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别吐舌头﹐这很没礼貌！

Sense.DEF: if something sticks, it becomes fixed in one position and is difficult to move
Sense.EXAMPLE: This door keeps sticking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这扇门老是卡住。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wheels stuck fast stuck completely in the mud.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轮子牢牢地陷在泥里。

Sense.DEF: if something sticks in your mind, you remember it well because it is unusual or interesting
Sense.TRAN: 〔因不同寻常或有趣而〕深深留在某人的脑海里﹐令某人记忆犹新
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s the kind of name that sticks in your mind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是你听过就不会忘记的那种名字。

Subsense.DEF: to prove that something is true
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Is there enough evidence to make the charges stick ?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有足够的证据证明这些指控成立吗？

Subsense.DEF: to make a change become permanent
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The government has succeeded in making this policy stick.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府成功地使这项政策确定下来。

Sense.DEF: if a name that someone has invented sticks, people continue using it
Sense.EXAMPLE: One newspaper dubbed him ‘Eddie the Eagle’, and the name stuck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家报纸戏称他为“老鹰埃迪”﹐这个绰号就被叫开了。

Sense.DEF: used to say angrily that you do not want what someone is offering you
Sense.TRAN: 某人自己留着某事物吧〔用于生气地表示自己不要某人所给的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I told them they could stick their job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我叫他们还是自己留着那份工 作吧。

Sense.DEF: to continue to accept a situation or person, even though you do not like them
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t stick mum’s new boyfriend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我受不了我妈的新男友。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gerry can’t stick working for Featherstone’s any longer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 格里再也无法忍受继续为费瑟斯通工作了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know how you stick it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道你是怎么忍下来的。

Sense.DEF: if a situation or someone’s behaviour sticks in your throat, it is so annoying that you cannot accept it
Sense.TRAN: 〔某种处境或某人的行为〕使某人难以接受
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her criticism really stuck in my craw.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的批评我实在无法接受。

Sense.DEF: if words stick in your throat, you are unable to say them because you are afraid or upset
Sense.TRAN: 〔因害怕或生气〕使某人难以启齿[说不出口]

Sense.DEF: food that sticks to your ribs is very satisfying, so you are not hungry after you have eaten
to stay in a place a little longer, waiting for something to happen
Sense.TRAN: 〔在某处〕逗留﹐待在…附近〔等待某事发生〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Perhaps you’d like to stick around and watch?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要不要留下来看看？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tom will be sticking around for a while.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆要逗留一会儿。

Sense.DEF: to continue doing something in a determined way in order to achieve something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Revising with your friends may help you stick at it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和朋友一起温习功课也许能帮助你坚持下去。

Sense.DEF: to be willing to do anything, even if it is illegal, in order to achieve something
Sense.TRAN: 〔为了做成某事〕无所顾忌﹐不择手段

GramExa.PROPFORM: stick at nothing to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He will stick at nothing to make money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了赚钱﹐他会不择手段。

Sense.DEF: to remain loyal to a friend when they have done something wrong or have problems
Sense.TRAN: 〔当朋友做错事或遇到困难时〕继续支持﹐对…忠诚
Sense.EXAMPLE: I love him and, whatever happens, I’ll stick by him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我爱他﹐无论发生什么我都会在他身边。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jean has stuck by her husband through thick and thin .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼和丈夫甘苦与共。

Sense.DEF: to do what you promised or decided to do
Sense.TRAN: 坚持﹐信守﹐贯彻〔承诺﹑计划等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has stuck by his radical plans for economic reform.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坚持推行其激进的经济改革计划。

Sense.DEF: if something sticks out, you notice it because part of it comes out further than the rest of a surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children were so thin their ribs stuck out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些儿童瘦得肋骨都突出来了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Paul’s legs were sticking out from under the car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗的腿从汽车底下伸出来。

Sense.DEF: to continue doing something that is difficult, painful, or boring
Sense.TRAN: 〔把困难﹑棘手或枯燥的事〕坚持到底﹐忍受下去
Sense.EXAMPLE: It wasn’t a happy period of his life, but he stuck it out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是他生命中一段不愉快的日子﹐但他撑了过来。

Sense.DEF: to risk giving your opinion about something, even though you may be wrong or other people may disagree with you
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m going to stick my neck out with some predictions for the next two years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我冒昧来对今后两年作一个预测。

Sense.LEXUNIT: stick out to sb/stick out in sb’s mind
Sense.DEF: to seem more important to someone than other people or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: The thing that sticks out to me is that they need more help than they’re getting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得最主要的问题是他们需要更多的帮助。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: stick/stand out like a sore thumb

Sense.DEF: to refuse to accept less than what you asked for
Sense.EXAMPLE: They offered him £250 but Vic stuck out for £500.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们愿出 250 英镑﹐但维克坚持要价 500 英镑。

Sense.DEF: to do or keep doing what you said you would do or what you believe in, even when it is difficult
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you been sticking to your diet?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是否在坚持节食？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Miguel was determined to stick to his decision.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 米格尔决心坚持自己的决定。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It looks as if Nick will stick to his word this time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看来这一次尼克好像要说到做到了。

Sense.DEF: to keep using or doing one particular thing and not change to anything else
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you’re driving, stick to soft drinks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你如果要开车﹐只能喝软饮料。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Reporters should stick to investigating the facts.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 记者应该坚持调查事实。

Sense.DEF: to refuse to change your mind about something, even though other people are trying to persuade you that you are wrong
Sense.TRAN: 不听劝告﹐坚持自己的立场[观点]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Having made up his mind, he stuck to his guns.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他下定决心一意孤行。

Sense.DEF: to talk only about what you are supposed to be talking about or what is certain
Sense.EXAMPLE: Never mind whose fault it was. Just stick to the facts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别管是谁的错﹐如实说就行。

Sense.DEF: to do something exactly according to the rules
to stay on a marked path or road so that you do not get lost
Sense.TRAN: 沿着小径/大路等走〔以免迷路〕

Sense.DEF: to continue to say that what you have told someone is true, even though they do not believe you
Sense.TRAN: 坚持原来的说法〔尽管别人不肯相信〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You intend to stick to this story that she knew nothing of your financial prospects?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你还是坚称她对你未来的经济状况一无所知吗？

Sense.DEF: to continue paying attention to your own work and not to get involved with what other people are doing
Sense.TRAN: 专注于自己的工作〔不去介入别人在做的事情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish Mrs Reese would stick to her knitting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望里斯太太管好她自己的事情。

Sense.DEF: to make someone suffer, pay a high price etc
Sense.TRAN: 苛刻地对待某人﹐跟某人过不去
Sense.EXAMPLE: The politicians stick it to the tourists because the tourists don’t vote.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些政客就是跟游客过不去﹐因为他们不参加投票。

Sense.DEF: if people stick together, they continue to support each other when they have problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re a family, and we stick together no matter what.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们是一家人﹐无论发生什么都会相互支持。

Sense.DEF: if a part of something sticks up, it is raised up or points upwards above a surface

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Part of the boat was sticking up out of the water.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 部分船体露出水面。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to raise their hands when threatening them with a gun – used in films, stories etc
Sense.TRAN: 举起手来〔用枪械威胁他人时的用语﹐用于电影﹑小说等〕

Sense.DEF: to defend someone who is being criticized, especially when no one else will defend them
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re supposed to be sticking up for me!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该支持我的！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s always known how to stick up for herself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总是知道如何为自己辩护。

Sense.DEF: to continue doing something the way you did or planned to do before
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s stick with the original plans.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们还是按照原计划进行吧。

Sense.DEF: to stay close to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: You just stick with me. I’ll explain everything as we go along.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你就跟着我﹐途中我会向你解释一切的。

Sense.DEF: to continue doing something, especially something difficult
Sense.TRAN: 坚持〔做某事﹐尤指困难的事情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you stick with it , your playing will gradually get better.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你坚持练习﹐演奏水平会逐渐提高。

Sense.DEF: to be made to accept something, do something, spend time with someone etc, when you do not want to
Sense.TRAN: 被迫应付某事物/某人﹔被某事物/某人缠住
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bill left and I was stuck with the bill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比尔走了﹐只好我来付账。

Sense.DEF: to remain in someone’s memory
Sense.EXAMPLE: Those words will stick with me for the rest of my life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些话我一辈子都不会忘的。

Sense.DEF: a long thin piece of wood from a tree, which is no longer attached to the tree
Sense.EXAMPLE: They collected sticks to start the fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们捡来树枝生火。

Sense.DEF: a long thin piece of wood, plastic etc that you use for a particular purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pair of drum sticks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一对鼓槌
Sense.EXAMPLE: a measuring stick
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 量尺
Sense.EXAMPLE: Aunt Lou walks with a stick uses a stick to help her walk .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卢姑妈走路要拄拐棍。

Sense.DEF: a long thin or round piece of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: carrot sticks with dip
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带调味酱的胡萝卜条
Sense.EXAMPLE: a glue stick
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一管胶水

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a stick of chewing gum
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片口香糖

Sense.DEF: a long, specially shaped piece of wood, plastic etc that you use in some sports to hit a ball
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hockey stick
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 曲棍球杆

Sense.DEF: a long way from a town or city
Sense.TRAN: 在偏远乡村﹐在边远地区
Sense.EXAMPLE: They live out in the sticks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们住在偏远的乡村。

Sense.LEXUNIT: get (hold of) the wrong end of the stick
Sense.DEF: to understand a situation in completely the wrong way
Sense.EXAMPLE: People who think the song is about drugs have got the wrong end of the stick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人认为这首歌是关于毒品的﹐这些人完全误解了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: a stick to beat sb with
Sense.DEF: something that can be used as a reason for criticizing someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: These tests will just give politicians yet another stick to beat the teachers with.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些测试又会给政客们一个抨击教师的口实。

Sense.DEF: the handle you use to control a plane

a
stick shift
to start doing something you should be doing
if you give someone stick, you criticize them for something they have done
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s going to get some stick for this!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他得为这件事挨批了！

Sense.DEF: if you up sticks, you move to a different area
the ability to continue doing something that is difficult and tiring
a small piece of paper or plastic with a picture or writing on it that you can stick on to something
Sense.TRAN: 〔有图或文字的〕粘贴标签﹐贴纸
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children get stickers for good behaviour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 表现好的孩子可以得到贴纸。

GramExa.GLOSS: a sticker on the back of a car

Sense.DEF: the price of something, especially a car, that is written on it or given in advertisements, but that may be reduced by the person selling it
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指汽车车身上或汽车广告中的〕标价﹐标签价

Sense.DEF: a very simple drawing of a person
Sense.TRAN: 人物简笔画﹐人物线条画

Sense.DEF: something that a group of people cannot agree on and that stops them from making progress
Sense.EXAMPLE: DPRK’s refusal had long been a sticking point.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朝鲜的拒绝一直是症结所在。

Sense.DEF: a long thin insect that looks like a small stick
Sense.EXAMPLE: young models who look like stick insects are very thin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瘦得跟竹节虫似的年轻模特

Sense.DEF: someone who refuses to try anything new – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 守旧的人﹐墨守成规的人〔含贬义〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: be a stickler for detail/rules/accuracy etc
Sense.DEF: to think that rules etc are very important and that other people should think so too
Sense.TRAN: 非常注重细节/规则/准确性等

Sense.DEF:
a
stick figure
stick-on things have a sticky back so that you can attach them to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: stick-on sequins
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 粘贴性闪光饰片

Sense.DEF: a decorated pin worn as jewellery

a metal bar in a car that you move to control the
gears

a car that uses a stick shift system to control the
gears
the ability to continue doing something that is difficult or tiring

a
hold-up
made of or covered with a substance that sticks to surfaces
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s some sticky stuff in your hair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的头发上有什么黏糊糊的东西。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sticky floor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黏糊糊的地板

GramExa.GLOSS: tape etc that is made so it will stick to surfaces

Sense.DEF: weather that is sticky makes you feel uncomfortably hot, wet, and dirty
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was hot and sticky and there was nowhere to sit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气闷热潮湿﹐连个坐的地方都找不到。

Sense.DEF: a sticky situation, question, or problem is difficult or dangerous
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sticky political issue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个棘手的政治问题

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The business hit a sticky patch and lost £4.8 million.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家企业遇到麻烦﹐损失了 480 万英镑。

Sense.DEF: a website that is sticky is interesting to the people looking at it and makes them want to look at it for a long period of time
to be likely to steal something
Sense.TRAN: 好偷东西的﹐有偷东西习惯的

Sense.DEF: to die in a violent way
to be in a situation that will cause problems for you
Sense.TRAN: 处于困难的境遇﹐处于不利的形势

Sense.DEF: a small piece of paper, often yellow in colour, that you can stick to things. Stickies are often used for leaving messages.
if someone or a part of their body is stiff, their muscles hurt and it is difficult for them to move

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her legs were stiff from kneeling.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的双腿跪得僵硬了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her fingers were stiff with cold.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的手指冻僵了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Alastair woke with a stiff neck.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿拉斯泰尔醒来时感到颈部发僵。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I never felt stiff after training until I was in my thirties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三十岁之前﹐我训练后从不会感到身体发僵。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The next morning I was as stiff as a board very stiff .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第二天早上﹐我感到浑身僵直。

Sense.DEF: firm, hard, or difficult to bend
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shirt with a stiff collar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 领子挺括的衬衫

Sense.DEF: a stiff mixture is thick and almost solid, so that it is not easy to mix
Sense.EXAMPLE: Beat the egg whites until stiff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把蛋白打到发稠。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stiff dough
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 硬面团

Sense.DEF: difficult to do or deal with
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stiff test
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难的测验

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Graduates face stiff competition in getting jobs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学毕业生面临激烈的求职竞争。

Sense.DEF: a stiff punishment is great or severe

GramExa.EXAMPLE: calls for stiffer penalties for rapists
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要求对强奸犯处以更严厉刑罚的呼吁

Sense.DEF: difficult to move, turn, or open
Sense.TRAN: 难移动的﹔难转动的﹔难打开的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pull hard – that drawer’s very stiff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使劲拉——那个抽屉很紧。

Sense.DEF: if someone’s behaviour is stiff, they behave in a very formal or unfriendly way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their goodbyes were stiff and formal .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的道别生硬刻板。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Parsons gave a stiff performance in the main role.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕森斯把主要角色演得很生硬。

Sense.DEF: a stiff price etc is high, especially higher than the price etc of similar things
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stiff tax on cigarettes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高昂的香烟税

Sense.DEF: a fairly strong wind etc
a very strong alcoholic drink
the ability to stay calm and not show your feelings in a difficult or upsetting situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔面对困难时〕沉着坚强﹔不动声色
Sense.EXAMPLE: Men were taught to keep a stiff upper lip .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男人被教导要沉着坚强。

Sense.DEF: extremely bored, frightened, or worried
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a child, I was scared stiff of going down to the cellar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小时候﹐我非常害怕到地下室去。

Subsense.DEF: extremely cold
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Goodness, your hands are frozen stiff!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天哪﹐你的手都冻僵了！

Subsense.DEF: cloth that is frozen stiff is hard because the water in it has frozen
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 〔布〕冻得硬邦邦的

Sense.DEF: the body of a dead person
an ordinary person who works to earn enough money to live
Sense.TRAN: 〔依靠劳动挣钱谋生的〕普通工人

Sense.DEF: someone who you think is old-fashioned and too formal
Sense.EXAMPLE: His business tactics outraged the stiffs of the UK establishment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的经营策略激怒了英国当权派中的老古板。

Sense.DEF:
to cheat someone by not paying them, especially by not leaving a
tip
in a restaurant
Sense.TRAN: 不付钱给…﹔〔尤指〕不给…小费
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t believe that couple stiffed me!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不敢相信那对夫妇竟然不给我小费！

Sense.DEF: if a new product, film, show etc stiffs, it does not sell well or fails completely
Sense.TRAN: 〔新产品﹑电影﹑节目等〕不畅销﹐彻底失败
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had a hit in the 1990s, but their subsequent releases stiffed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20 世纪 90 年代时他们出过一张热门唱片﹐但后来的却不畅销。

Sense.DEF: if you stiffen, your body suddenly becomes firm, straight, or still because you feel angry or anxious
Sense.EXAMPLE: He touched her, and she stiffened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他碰到了她﹐她僵住了。

Sense.DEF: to become stronger, more severe, or more determined, or to make something do this
Sense.TRAN: （使）变坚强﹔（使）变强硬﹔（使）变严厉
Sense.EXAMPLE: a campaign to stiffen rules against drink-driving
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要求对酒后驾车严加管制的运动
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their opposition only stiffened my resolve .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的反对只是更加坚定了我的决心。

Sense.DEF: to become painful and difficult to move
Sense.EXAMPLE: His joints had stiffened .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的关节酸痛发僵。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My back had stiffened up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的背都僵了。

Sense.DEF: to make material stiff so that it will not bend easily
too proud, and refusing to change or obey

an
erection
to stop something from happening or developing
Sense.EXAMPLE: rules and regulations that stifle innovation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 压制创新的规章制度
Sense.EXAMPLE: How can this party stifle debate on such a crucial issue?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该党怎么可以压制对这么一个重要问题的辩论？

Sense.DEF: to stop a feeling from being expressed
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stifled an urge to hit her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他强忍住冲动﹐没有打她。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I tried to stifle my laughter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我竭力忍住不笑。

Sense.DEF: if you are stifled by something, it stops you breathing comfortably
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was almost stifled by the fumes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他差点被烟熏得窒息了。

Sense.DEF: a room or weather that is stifling is very hot and uncomfortable, so that it seems difficult to breathe
Sense.TRAN: 〔房间﹑天气〕闷热的﹐令人窒息的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stifling, crowded train
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 闷热拥挤的火车
Sense.EXAMPLE: the stifling heat of the tropics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热带地区的闷热

Sense.DEF: a situation that is stifling stops you from developing your own ideas and character
Sense.TRAN: 〔境况〕令人窒息的﹔压制个性发挥的
Sense.EXAMPLE: an emotionally stifling relationship
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人感到压抑的关系

Sense.DEF: a strong feeling in society that being in a particular situation or having a particular illness is something to be ashamed of
Sense.TRAN: 耻辱﹐羞辱﹐见不得人的感觉

GramExa.PROPFORM: the stigma of alcoholism/mental illness etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The stigma of alcoholism makes it difficult to treat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 酗酒的恶名令其很难治愈。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There is a social stigma attached to single parenthood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 单身父母在社会上的名声不光彩。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the US, smoking carries a stigma .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在美国﹐吸烟是不光彩的。

Sense.DEF:
the top of the centre part of a flower that receives the
pollen
which allows it to form new seeds
marks that appear on the hands and feet of some holy people, and which look like the wounds made by nails on the body of Christ
Sense.TRAN: 圣痕﹐圣伤〔某些圣徒手足上的伤痕﹐与耶稣身上的钉痕相似〕

Sense.DEF: to be treated by society as if you should feel ashamed of your situation or behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: Single mothers often feel that they are stigmatized by society.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 单身母亲常常觉得自己受社会歧视。

Sense.DEF: a set of steps that helps people climb over a fence in the countryside
Sense.TRAN: 〔乡间设于篱笆两侧供人跨越的〕梯磴﹐台阶

Sense.DEF: a woman’s shoe that has a very high thin heel
the heel of a stiletto shoe
a small knife with a thin blade
up to a particular point in time and continuing at that moment
Sense.EXAMPLE: I still haven’t finished painting the spare room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还没粉刷完那间空房间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you still have Julie’s phone number?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你还留着朱莉的电话号码吗？

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Still usually comes before the verb, unless the verb is a simple tense of ‘be’, or after the first auxiliary. still
F2NBox.TRAN: 通常置于动词之前（一般时态的 be 动词除外）,第一个助动词之后
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The system still works.
It was still dark outside.
I can still remember them.
F2NBox.EXPL: Still usually comes before any negative word or before ‘do not’. still
F2NBox.TRAN: 通常置于否定词或 do not 前
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She still isn’t ready.
They still can’t decide.
I’m still not tired.
We still do not know exactly what happened.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们还是不知道到底发生了什么。
F2NBox.TRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘still now’
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Inflation is still (NOT不说 still now) a problem.

Sense.DEF: in spite of what has just been said or done
Sense.TRAN: 虽然如此﹐尽管那样﹐然而
Sense.EXAMPLE: Clare didn’t do much work, but she still passed the exam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克莱尔虽然不怎么学习﹐但她还是通过了考试。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel was terrible. Still, we were lucky with the weather.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒店很糟糕﹐然而我们有幸遇上了好天气。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something increases more, there is more of something etc
Sense.TRAN: 还有更多/更进一步/另外一个/别的〔用于强调〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kevin grew still more depressed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯文变得更加消沉了。

Sense.DEF: even better, harder etc than something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dan found biology difficult, and physics harder still.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹觉得生物很难﹐物理更难。

Sense.DEF: not moving
Sense.EXAMPLE: We stood still and watched as the deer came closer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一动不动地站着﹐看那头鹿走近。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep still while I tie your shoe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别动﹐我给你系鞋带。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the still waters of the lake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 平静的湖面

Sense.DEF: quiet and calm
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house was completely still.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子里十分寂静。

Sense.DEF: not windy
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hot still day
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炎热无风的一天

Sense.DEF: a still drink does not contain gas
Sense.EXAMPLE: still or sparkling mineral water
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无气或有气矿泉水

PIC.HEADING: STILL 无气的
PIC.PICCONTENT: a still drink 无气饮料；a fizzy BrE【英】/carbonated drink 含气饮料／含二氧化碳的饮料

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone who is quiet may have very strong feelings or a lot of knowledge
Sense.TRAN: 静水流深〔指沉默寡言者可能有强烈的情感或丰富的知识〕

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Somewhere in the stillness of the night , an owl hooted.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 万籁俱寂的夜晚﹐一只猫头鹰在鸣叫。

Sense.DEF: a photograph of a scene from a film
a piece of equipment for making alcoholic drinks from grain or potatoes

Sense.LEXUNIT: the still of the night/evening etc
Sense.DEF: the calm and quiet of the night etc
to stop moving, or make something stop moving
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ground beneath them trembled, then stilled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们脚下的大地开始颤抖﹐然后平静了下来。

Sense.DEF: if a noise stills or is stilled, it stops
Sense.EXAMPLE: The murmurs stilled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低语声静了下来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stilled their protests with a wave of his hands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他挥手让他们的抗议声平静下来。

Sense.DEF: if a doubt or fear is stilled, it becomes weaker or goes away
a birth in which the baby is born dead
born dead
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stillborn baby
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 死产儿

Sense.DEF: completely unsuccessful from the beginning and not developing at all
Sense.TRAN: 夭折的﹐开始就不成功的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stillborn romance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夭折的恋情

Sense.DEF: a picture of an arrangement of objects, for example flowers or fruit
one of a set of poles that support a building above the ground or above water
Sense.TRAN: 〔将建筑物撑离地面或水面的〕支撑物﹐支材﹐桩子

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a house built on stilts
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 建在桩子上的房子

Sense.DEF: one of two poles which you can stand on and walk high above the ground
a stilted style of writing or speaking is formal and unnatural
Sense.TRAN: 〔文体﹑言谈〕呆板的﹐生硬的﹐不自然的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stilted conversation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生硬的对话

Sense.DEF: a type of English cheese that is white with grey-blue marks and has a strong taste
a drug or substance that makes you feel more active and full of energy
Sense.TRAN: 兴奋剂[药]﹔引起兴奋的物质
Sense.EXAMPLE: artificial stimulants
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人造兴奋剂

Sense.DEF: something that encourages more of a particular activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: economic stimulants
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济刺激因素

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Increases in new construction would be a stimulant to the economy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新建设项目的增加对经济可能是一种刺激。

Sense.DEF: to encourage or help an activity to begin or develop further

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the President’s plan to stimulate economic growth
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统刺激经济增长的计划

Sense.DEF: to encourage someone by making them excited about and interested in something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her interest in art was stimulated by her father.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对艺术的兴趣是她父亲激发的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: An inspiring teacher can stimulate students to succeed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位具启发能力的教师能够激励学生取得成功。

Sense.DEF: to make a plant or part of the body become active or stronger
Sense.EXAMPLE: Light stimulates plant growth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 光促进植物的生长。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子需要变点花样并给点刺激。

Sense.DEF: exciting or full of new ideas
Sense.TRAN: 使人兴奋的﹔饶有趣味的﹔充满新思想的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stimulating discussion of world politics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于世界政治趣味盎然的讨论

Sense.DEF: making you feel more active
Sense.TRAN: 增加活力的﹐让人兴奋的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the stimulating effects of coffee and tea
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 咖啡和茶的提神作用

Sense.DEF: something that helps a process to develop more quickly or more strongly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tax cuts provided the stimulus which the slow economy needed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 减税为不景气的经济带来了其所需的刺激。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The discovery of oil acted as a stimulus to industrial development.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 石油的发现对工业发展是一个促进因素。

Sense.DEF: something that makes someone or something move or react
Sense.TRAN: 〔使人或物产生反应的〕刺激﹐刺激物
Sense.EXAMPLE: At this age, the infant begins to react more to visual stimuli.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了这个年龄段﹐婴儿开始对视觉刺激有了更多的反应。

Sense.DEF: if an insect or a plant stings you, it makes a very small hole in your skin and you feel a sharp pain because of a poisonous substance
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was stung by a bee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被蜜蜂蜇了。
Sense.HINTTRAN: A bee, wasp, scorpion, or plant can sting you. For a mosquito or snake, use bite. 蜜蜂﹑黄蜂﹑蝎子或植物“蜇”人或“刺”人用 sting﹔蚊子或蛇“咬”人则用 bite。

Sense.DEF: to make something hurt with a sudden sharp pain, or to hurt like this
Sense.TRAN: （使）刺痛﹐（使）产生〔短时间的〕剧痛
Sense.EXAMPLE: Antiseptic stings a little.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消毒剂稍有刺痛感。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chopping onions makes my eyes sting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 切洋葱会让我的眼睛感到刺痛。

Sense.DEF: if you are stung by a remark, it makes you feel upset
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had been stung by criticism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 批评使她感到很气愤。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her harsh words stung him into action.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她严厉的批评刺激他采取了行动。

Sense.DEF: to charge someone too much for something
Sense.TRAN: 向〔某人〕索取过高的价钱﹐在…上敲〔某人的〕竹杠
Sense.EXAMPLE: The garage stung him for £300.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车修理厂敲了他 300 英镑竹杠。

Sense.DEF: to borrow money from someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can I sting you for a fiver?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能跟你借五英镑吗？

Sense.DEF: a wound or mark made when an insect or plant stings you
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bee sting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蜜蜂蜇伤

Sense.DEF: the sharp needle-shaped part of an insect’s or animal’s body, with which it stings you
a sharp pain in your eyes or skin, caused by being hit, by smoke etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt the sting of tears in her eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感觉泪水刺痛了眼睛。

Sense.DEF: if a story, event, or announcement has a sting in its tail, there is an unpleasant part at the end of it
Sense.TRAN: 〔指故事﹑事件﹑声明等的〕使人不快的结尾

Sense.DEF: the upsetting or bad effect of a situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔某种情况造成的〕不快﹐痛苦感受
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sting of rejection
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被拒绝的痛苦

GramExa.PROPFORM: take the sting out of sth
GramExa.GLOSS: make something less unpleasant or painful
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 减轻某事的不快[痛苦]程度
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She smiled to take the sting out of her words.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她微笑着﹐使自己的话不至于那么伤人。

Sense.DEF: a clever way of catching criminals in which the police secretly pretend to be criminals themselves
Sense.TRAN: 〔警察假扮罪犯以诱捕犯罪分子的〕圈套

Sense.DEF: the sharp needle-shaped part of an insect’s or animal’s body, with which it stings you
an attack, report, letter etc that very strongly criticizes someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 措辞激烈的抨击/报道/信件等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dr Forwell made a stinging attack on government policy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 福威尔博士对政府的政策进行了猛烈抨击。

Sense.DEF: a wild plant with leaves that sting and leave red marks on your skin
a large flat fish that has a long tail with sharp poisonous points on it
not generous, especially with money
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s too stingy to give money to charity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很小气﹐不愿捐钱行善。

Sense.DEF: a stingy amount of something, especially food, is too small
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stingy portion of vegetables
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极少的一份蔬菜

Sense.DEF: to have a strong and very unpleasant smell
Sense.EXAMPLE: It stinks in here!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里很臭！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His breath stank of alcohol.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他嘴里一股酒气。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The toilets stank to high heaven stank very much .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些厕所臭气熏天。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is bad, unfair, dishonest etc
Sense.TRAN: 让人感觉糟糕﹐令人厌恶
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t eat there – the food stinks!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别在那里吃﹐菜糟透了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole justice system stinks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个司法系统都腐败透了。

Sense.DEF: to fill a place with a very unpleasant smell
Sense.EXAMPLE: Those onions are stinking the whole house out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些洋葱弄得满屋子臭味。

Sense.DEF: a very bad smell

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the stink of burning rubber
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 橡胶燃烧发出的恶臭

Sense.DEF: to complain very strongly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Activists have raised a stink about the shipments of nuclear waste.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 积极分子就运送的几批核废物大做文章。

Sense.DEF: to work etc as fast and as well as you can
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had to work like stink to meet the deadline.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不得不拼命地赶工期。

Sense.DEF: a small container that produces an extremely bad smell when it is broken
someone or something that is very unpleasant or difficult
Sense.EXAMPLE: This cold I’ve got is a real stinker .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这次得的感冒真是令人难受。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You really are a stinker.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这个人真讨厌。

Sense.DEF: a film, book, performance etc that is very bad
Sense.TRAN: 质量低劣的事物〔极糟的电影﹑书﹑表演等〕

GramExa.GLOSS: play badly
GramExa.EXAMPLE: In the last game he had a stinker.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在最后一场比赛中﹐他的表现极差。

Sense.DEF: having a very strong unpleasant smell
Sense.EXAMPLE: stinking garbage cans
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 臭烘烘的垃圾箱

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize what you are saying when you are angry
Sense.TRAN: 令人讨厌的〔生气时用以加强语气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hate this stinking boring job!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我恨这讨厌的无聊工作！

Sense.DEF: very unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got a stinking cold .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感冒非常严重。

Sense.DEF: an angry letter in which you complain very strongly about something
extremely rich – used especially when you think this is unfair
Sense.TRAN: 十分富有的﹐非常有钱的〔尤用于表示这是不公平的〕

Sense.DEF: extremely drunk
Sense.TRAN: 酩酊大醉﹐醉得不省人事

Sense.DEF: smelling unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: stinky socks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 臭袜子

Sense.DEF: a period of time spent doing a particular job or activity
Sense.TRAN: 固定〔进行某项工作或活动的〕时期

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mark did a two-year stint in the army.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克服过两年兵役。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his stint as chairman
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的主席任期

Sense.DEF: to provide or use too little of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They didn’t stint on food and drink at their wedding.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在婚礼上毫不吝惜食物和饮料。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In order to avoid stinting yourself, make sure you have enough money to cover all your expenses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了不让自己过得紧巴巴的﹐你得确保有足够的钱来支付所有开销。

Sense.DEF: an amount of money paid regularly to someone, especially a priest, as a salary or as money to live on
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指给牧师的〕薪俸﹐生活津贴

Sense.DEF:
a
magistrate
in Britain who is paid by the state

to draw or paint a picture or pattern using short
strokes
or spots instead of lines
if an agreement, law, or rule stipulates something, it must be done
Sense.EXAMPLE: Laws stipulate the maximum interest rate that banks can charge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法律对银行可以收取的最高利率作了规定。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The regulations stipulate that everything has to comply to the relevant safety standards.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 条例规定凡事都要遵守相关的安全规范。

Sense.DEF: something that must be done, and which is stated as part of an agreement, law, or rule

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The agreement included a stipulation that half of the money had to be spent on housing for lower-income families.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 协议中包含一项条款﹐规定这笔钱有一半必须用于低收入家庭的住房供给。

Sense.DEF: to move a liquid or substance around with a spoon or stick in order to mix it together
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stir the paint to make sure it is smooth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将油漆搅拌至均匀。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She stirred her coffee with a plastic spoon.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她用塑料调羹搅拌咖啡。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stir a cup of cooked brown rice into the mixture.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在混合料中拌入一杯煮过的糙米饭。

Sense.DEF: to move slightly, or to make something move slightly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The crowd began to stir as they waited for the band to start.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在等待乐队开始演奏时﹐人群骚动起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A gentle breeze stirred the curtains.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵微风轻轻吹动窗帘。

Sense.DEF: to leave or move from a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: He hadn’t stirred from his chair all morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一上午都没离开过自己的椅子。

Subsense.DEF: to make someone have a strong feeling or reaction
Subsense.TRAN: 激发﹐激起〔强烈的感情〕﹔引起〔强烈的反应〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Looking at the photographs stirred childhood memories of the long hot summers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看着那些照片﹐对儿时那漫漫炎夏的回忆涌上心头。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: The poem succeeds in stirring the imagination .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这首诗能够激发起想象力。

Subsense.DEF: if a feeling stirs in you, you begin to feel it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Excitement stirred inside her.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 激动的情绪在她内心涌动。

Sense.DEF: to make someone start doing something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The incident stirred students to protest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一事件激起了学生的抗议。

Sense.DEF: to cause trouble between people by spreading false or secret information
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过散布谣言或秘密〕搬弄是非﹐挑拨
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ben’s always stirring!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本老是搬弄是非！

Sense.DEF: to deliberately try to cause arguments or bad feelings between people
Sense.EXAMPLE: John was always stirring up trouble in class.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰老是在班里惹是生非。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dave’s just trying to stir things up because he’s jealous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫是因为嫉妒﹐就想挑起点事来。

Sense.DEF: to make small pieces of something move around in the air or in water
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wind had stirred up a powdery red dust.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 风扬起一阵细细的红色尘土。

Sense.DEF: a feeling of excitement or annoyance

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Plans for the motorway caused quite a stir among locals.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 建造高速公路的计划在当地居民中激起了相当大的愤怒情绪。

Sense.DEF: an act of stirring something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Give that pan a stir , will you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把那锅东西搅一搅﹐好吗？

Sense.DEF: a prison
extremely nervous and upset, especially because you feel trapped in a place
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因感觉被困在某处而〕极度紧张的﹐神经失常的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m going to go stir-crazy if I don’t get out of this house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果不离开这幢房子﹐我就要疯了。

Sense.DEF: to cook small pieces of food quickly by moving them around continuously in very hot oil
Sense.EXAMPLE: stir-fried vegetables
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炒蔬菜

Sense.DEF: a dish made by stir-frying small pieces of food
someone who likes to cause trouble between people by spreading false or secret information – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 爱搬弄是非的人﹐喜欢制造事端者〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: an object shaped like a stick, that is used to mix liquids
producing strong feelings or excitement in someone
Sense.TRAN: 激动人心的﹐令人振奋的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stirring speech
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人振奋的演讲
Sense.EXAMPLE: stirring music
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 激动人心的音乐

Sense.DEF: an early sign that something is starting to happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the first stirrings of spring
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 春的萌动

Sense.DEF: one of the rings of metal in which someone riding a horse rests their feet
stretchy women’s trousers that have bands at the bottom of the legs which fit under your feet
a short piece of thread that has been sewn into a piece of cloth, or the action of the thread going into and out of the cloth
a piece of special thread which has been used to sew the edges of a wound together
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had to have ten stitches in his head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他头上不得不缝了十针。

Sense.DEF: a sharp pain in the side of your body, which you can get by running or laughing a lot
Sense.TRAN: 〔跑步或大笑引起的胁部的〕剧痛

Sense.DEF:
a small circle of wool that is formed around a needle when you are
knitting

GramExa.GLOSS: lose a stitch because the wool has come off the needle

Sense.DEF:
a particular way of sewing or
knitting
that makes a particular pattern
Sense.EXAMPLE: Purl and plain are the two main stitches in knitting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反针和平针是编织中的两种主要织法。

Sense.DEF: to be wearing no clothes
laughing a lot in an uncontrollable way

GramExa.GLOSS: make someone laugh
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her jokes had us all in stitches.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的笑话让我们大家笑破了肚皮。

Sense.DEF: used to say that it is better to deal with problems early than to wait until they get worse
Sense.TRAN: 一针及时﹐可省九针﹔及时处理﹐事半功倍

Sense.DEF: to sew two pieces of cloth together, or to sew a decoration onto a piece of cloth
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mary is stitching a bedspread.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽在缝床罩。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The jersey has his name stitched across the back.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 运动衫的后背缝着他的名字。

Sense.DEF: to put different things or parts of something together to make one larger thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: In ten years, they have been able to stitch together a national network of banks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十年内﹐他们已搭建起一个全国性的银行网络。

Sense.DEF: to get a deal or agreement arranged
to put stitches in cloth or a wound in order to fasten parts of it together
Sense.EXAMPLE: She stitched up the cut and left it to heal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把伤口缝好让它愈合。

Sense.DEF: to get a deal or agreement completed satisfactorily so that it cannot be changed
Sense.TRAN: 圆满地完成〔交易或协议〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The deal was stitched up in minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那笔交易很快就谈成了。

Sense.DEF: to deceive someone, especially in order to gain money from them
to make someone seem guilty of a crime by providing false information
a line of stitches in a piece of material
a situation in which someone is deliberately deceived

a British organization whose unpaid members are trained to give
first aid
to anyone who is hurt or becomes ill. They often attend sports and other public events.
Sense.TRAN: 圣约翰救护机构﹐圣约翰救伤会〔英国一义务性的急救组织﹐经常出现在运动会以及其他公共活动中〕

Sense.DEF:
a small wild anial, similar to a
weasel
, that has a long thin body and brown fur
a supply of a particular type of thing that a shop has available to sell
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have a huge stock of quality carpets on sale.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们备有大量优质地毯出售。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Buy now while stocks last!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 存货有限﹐欲购从速！

GramExa.GLOSS: unavailable or available in a particular shop
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m sorry, that swimsuit is completely out of stock in your size.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐那款泳衣你的尺寸缺货。

Subsense.DEF:
a
share
in a company
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the trading of stocks and shares
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 股票交易

Subsense.DEF:
the total value of all of a company’s
shares

Sense.DEF: the total amount of something that is available to be used in a particular area
Sense.TRAN: 可供利用的数量﹐总储备量
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cod stocks in the North Atlantic have dropped radically.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 北大西洋中鳕鱼的总量已大幅下降。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the stock of housing in rural areas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乡村地区的住房存量

Sense.DEF: a supply of something that you keep and can use when you need to

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He keeps a stock of medicines in the cupboard.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在柜子里存放了一些备用药品。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The country has been building up its stock of weapons.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家一直在增加武器储备。

Sense.DEF: to think carefully about the things that have happened in a situation in order to decide what to do next
Sense.TRAN: （对某事情）作出估计[判断]﹐估量
Sense.EXAMPLE: While in hospital, Jeremy took stock of his life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰里米住院期间思考了他的人生。

Sense.DEF:
a liquid made by boiling meat or bones and vegetables, which is used to make soups or to add
flavour
to other dishes
Sense.TRAN: 高汤﹐原汤〔如肉汤﹑骨头汤等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: chicken stock
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原汁鸡汤
Sense.EXAMPLE: vegetable stock
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蔬菜汤

Sense.DEF: the part of a gun that you hold or put against your shoulder, usually made of wood
farm animals, especially cattle

Subsense.DEF: a wooden structure in a public place to which criminals were fastened by their feet or hands in the past
Subsense.TRAN: 足枷﹐手枷〔旧时一种木制的刑具〕

Subsense.DEF: a wooden structure in which a ship is held while it is being built

Sense.DEF: if someone’s stock is high or low, they are very popular or very unpopular
Sense.TRAN: 某人很受人/不受人喜爱﹔某人的声望高/低
Sense.EXAMPLE: Simon’s stock is high in the network news business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西蒙在网络新闻行业中声望很高。

Sense.DEF: the jokes, knowledge etc that someone knows or has
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人所知道的〕一堆笑话/一套知识/〔某人所拥有的〕一股勇气等
Sense.EXAMPLE: John seems to have an inexhaustible stock of funny stories.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰似乎有讲不完的滑稽故事。

Sense.DEF: to belong to a family that in the past lived in Scotland, were Protestants, were respected etc
Sense.TRAN: 出身于苏格兰/新教徒/良好的等家庭[家族]

Sense.DEF: a plant with pink, white, or light purple flowers and a sweet smell
a thick part of a stem onto which another plant can be added so that the two plants grow together

a
stock company2
Sense.TRAN: 〔演出若干保留剧目的〕一群演员﹔保留剧目轮演剧团

Sense.DEF: if a shop stocks a particular product, it keeps a supply of it to sell
Sense.TRAN: 〔商店为销售而〕存有〔货物〕﹐备有
Sense.EXAMPLE: We stock a wide range of kitchen equipment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们备有各种厨房用品。

Sense.DEF: to fill something with a supply of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Our refrigerator at college was always stocked with beer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们上大学时的冰箱里一直备有啤酒。

Sense.DEF: to buy a lot of something in order to keep it for when you need to use it later

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have to stock up on snacks for the party.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得为派对备足点心。

Sense.DEF: an excuse etc that people often say or use, especially when they cannot think of anything more interesting or original – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 老一套的借口/问题/评论等〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: something that is available in a shop and does not have to be ordered
Sense.TRAN: 〔商店里〕常备的[库存的]商品/尺寸

Sense.DEF: a fence built from long thick pieces of wood pushed into the ground, used to defend a place
a farmer who breeds cattle
Sense.TRAN: 牲畜饲养人﹔养牛的农民

Sense.DEF:
a person or organization whose job is to buy and sell
shares
,
bonds
etc for people
a car that has been made stronger so that it can compete in a race where cars often crash into each other
Sense.TRAN: 〔经加固以参加比赛的〕改装赛车
Sense.EXAMPLE: stock car racing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 改装赛车竞速赛

Sense.DEF: a railway carriage for cattle

an official document that shows that you own
shares
in a company

a company whose money is divided into
shares
so that many people own a small part of it
a group of actors who work together doing several different plays
Sense.TRAN: 〔演出若干保留剧目的〕一群演员﹔保留剧目轮演剧团

Sense.DEF:
a small solid
cube
made from the dried juices of meat or vegetables that is mixed with boiling water to make
stock
Sense.TRAN: 〔经脱水的〕粒状汤料﹐固体汤料

Sense.DEF:
the business of buying and selling
stocks
and
shares

a place where
stocks
and
shares
are bought and sold

someone who owns
stocks
in a business

an official and public list of
stock
prices

a soft cotton material that stretches, used especially for
bandages
Sense.TRAN: 松紧棉织物﹐弹力棉织物〔尤用作绷带〕

Sense.DEF: a thin close-fitting piece of clothing that covers a woman’s leg and foot
a man’s sock
not wearing any shoes

a small present that you put in a
christmas stocking
Sense.TRAN: 〔放入圣诞袜中的〕圣诞小礼物

Sense.DEF: a stocking that someone wears over their face when they are doing something illegal such as robbing a bank
Sense.TRAN: 〔银行劫匪等用来遮住脸部的〕蒙面袜

Sense.DEF: something that is typical of a particular person or thing, especially what they say or do
Sense.TRAN: 惯用言辞﹔惯有行为﹔惯用手段[伎俩]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stewart’s stock-in-trade was the face-to-face interview.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯图尔特的习惯做法是面对面的采访。

Sense.DEF: the things you need to do your job
Sense.EXAMPLE: Vanessa’s looks have been her stock-in-trade as an actress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瓦妮莎的相貌是她当演员的本钱。

Sense.DEF: a person, shop, or company that keeps a particular product to sell
Sense.TRAN: 〔专卖某种商品的〕零售商﹐专营商店﹐专营公司
Sense.EXAMPLE: Call us to order or to get details of local stockists .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请来电订购或垂询当地零售商信息。

Sense.DEF: a man whose job is to take care of farm animals

the business of buying and selling
stocks
and
shares

a place where
stocks
and
shares
are bought and sold
Sense.TRAN: 证券[股票]交易所﹐证券市场

Sense.DEF:
stock
that a company offers to sell to an
employee
at a price that is lower than the usual price
Sense.TRAN: 〔公司以优惠价格提供给员工的〕认股权﹐股票期权

Sense.DEF: a large supply of things that is kept ready for use in the future

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a stockpile of nuclear weapons
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 核武器储备

Sense.DEF: to keep adding to a supply of goods, weapons etc that you are keeping ready to use if you need them in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: An enormous volume of explosives was stockpiled inside one of the buildings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中一栋大楼内贮存了大量的炸药。

Sense.DEF:
a pot in which you make
stock
a room for storing things in a shop or office
Sense.TRAN: 〔商店或办公室的〕仓库﹐储藏室

Sense.DEF: not moving at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oscar stood stock-still and listened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥斯卡站在那儿一动不动地听着。

Sense.DEF: when a company or shop checks the quantities of materials and goods that it has a supply of
a stocky person is short and heavy and looks strong
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stocky build
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 敦实的体格

Sense.DEF: a place where cattle, sheep etc are kept before being taken to a market and sold
Sense.TRAN: 〔在牛﹑羊等运往市场出售之前临时的〕牲畜围栏

Sense.DEF: heavy food that makes you feel full very quickly
Sense.TRAN: 易饱的食物﹐让人感觉撑的食物

Sense.DEF: if someone or something is stodgy, they are boring and formal or old-fashioned – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 墨守成规的﹐古板而乏味的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stodgy play
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 枯燥无味的戏剧

Sense.DEF: stodgy food is heavy and makes you feel full very quickly – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 〔食物〕易使人饱的﹐吃下后感觉撑的〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF:
a
cigar
, especially a thick cheap one
Sense.TRAN: 雪茄〔尤指廉价的粗雪茄〕

Sense.DEF: someone who does not show their emotions and does not complain when bad things happen to them
Sense.TRAN: 坚忍克己的人﹔不以苦乐为意的人

Sense.DEF: not showing emotion or not complaining when bad things happen to you
Sense.TRAN: 坚忍的﹔不以苦乐为意的

Sense.DEF: patience and calmness when bad things happen to you
Sense.TRAN: 坚忍（精神）﹔不以苦乐为意

Sense.DEF: to add more coal or wood to a fire
Sense.EXAMPLE: I stoked the furnace for the night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给火炉添煤让它烧过夜。

Sense.DEF: to cause something to increase
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rising oil prices stoked inflation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 油价上涨加剧了通货膨胀。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The scandal has stoked public outrage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一丑闻激起了公愤。

Sense.DEF: to add more coal or wood to a fire
Sense.EXAMPLE: We kept the fire stoked up high on cold nights.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在寒冷的夜晚﹐我们把火添得旺旺的。

Sense.DEF: if something stokes up fear, anger etc, it makes a lot of people feel frightened etc
Sense.TRAN: 煽起﹐激起〔恐惧﹑愤怒等情绪〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The leaflets stoked up fears of an invasion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些传单激起了很多人对侵略的恐惧。

Sense.DEF: to eat a lot of food, for example because you will not eat again for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: We stoked up on hot soup before going out in the snow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们冒雪出门之前喝了很多热汤。

Sense.DEF: very pleased and excited

someone whose job is to put coal or other
fuel
on a fire or into a
furnace
, for example on a
steamship
or a steam train

the past tense of
steal
a long straight piece of cloth or fur that a woman wears across her shoulders

the past participle of
steal
having been taken illegally
Sense.EXAMPLE: stolen cars
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被盗的汽车

Sense.DEF: someone who is stolid does not react to situations or seem excited by them when most people would react – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 不易激动的﹔麻木不仁的﹔无动于衷的〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF:
the organ inside your body where food begins to be
digested
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was so hungry my stomach hurt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我饿得胃都痛了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His stomach was full of food.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的胃里塞满了食物。

Sense.DEF: the front part of your body, below your chest
Sense.EXAMPLE: He turned round and punched Carlos in the stomach.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他转过身一拳打在卡洛斯的腹部。

Sense.LEXUNIT: do sth on an empty stomach
Sense.DEF: to do something when you have not eaten
Sense.EXAMPLE: You shouldn’t take the pills on an empty stomach.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不可以空腹吃这些药片。

Sense.DEF: to make you feel sick or upset
Sense.TRAN: 使某人感到恶心﹐令某人反胃
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sight of the slaughtered cow turned my stomach.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到被宰杀的牛我感到恶心。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have no stomach for a fight/task etc
Sense.DEF: to have no desire to do something difficult, upsetting, or frightening
Sense.TRAN: 不想打架/没兴趣干活等

Sense.DEF: to be able to see or do things that are unpleasant without feeling sick or upset
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t go and see this film unless you have a strong stomach.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果没有很强的承受力就不要去看这部电影。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A lot of these children don't know what it is like to have a full stomach.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些孩子中有许多人不知道吃饱是什么感觉。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It was 11 o'clock, and my stomach was empty.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 11 点了,我的胃都空了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Debbie was at home because she had an upset stomach.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 黛比在家,因为她胃不舒服。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I had terrible stomach ache last night.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天晚上我胃痛得厉害。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He complained of acute stomach pains.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说感到腹部剧痛。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an illness you have caught that affects your stomach
when your stomach is affected by illness
it makes a noise because they are hungry
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 某人的肚子〔饿得〕咕咕叫
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She felt her stomach rumble.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得肚子饿得咕咕叫。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: they feel sick because they are nervous or frightened
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 某人〔因紧张或害怕而〕反胃

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: it suddenly feels tight because they are frightened
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 某人〔因害怕而〕胃里翻腾/收紧

Sense.DEF: to be able to accept something, especially something unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: A 26% water rate increase is more than most residents can stomach .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水费涨 26% 让大多数居民无法接受。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rob found Cathy’s attitude hard to stomach.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗布觉得凯茜的态度让他受不了。

Sense.DEF: to eat something without becoming ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve never been able to stomach seafood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从来都吃不了海鲜。

Sense.DEF: pain in your stomach or near your stomach
if something is stomach-churning, it is extremely unpleasant and makes you feel sick
Sense.TRAN: 使人反胃的﹐令人恶心的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the stomach-churning extremes of physical torture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人反胃的极端肉体酷刑

Sense.DEF: a machine with a tube that doctors use to suck out food or liquid from someone’s stomach, especially after they have swallowed something harmful
to walk with heavy steps or to put your foot down very hard, especially because you are angry
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因生气〕踏着重步走﹔跺脚﹐重踩
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alex stomped angrily out of the meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚历克斯怒气冲冲地重步走出会场。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rogers was injured after being stomped on by another player.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗杰斯被另一名选手重重踩到﹐受了伤。

Sense.DEF: a favourite place where someone often goes
a hard solid mineral substance
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stone wall
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 石墙
Sense.EXAMPLE: stone steps
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 石台阶
Sense.EXAMPLE: The floors are made of stone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地面是石头铺成的。

Sense.DEF: a small piece of rock of any shape, found on the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: A handful of protesters began throwing stones at the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几个抗议者开始朝警察投掷石块。

Sense.DEF: a jewel

the large hard part at the centre of some fruits, such as a
peach
or
cherry
, which contains the seed

a ball of hard material that can form in organs such as your
bladder
or
kidneys
Sense.TRAN: 〔膀胱或肾脏等器官中的〕结石

Variant.LINKWORD: written abbreviation 书面缩写为 st

Sense.DEF: a British unit for measuring weight, equal to 14 pounds or 6.35 kilograms
Sense.TRAN: 英石〔英国的重量单位﹐等于14磅或6.35千克〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: a stone’s throw from sth/away (from sth)
Sense.DEF: very close to something
Sense.TRAN: 在（某物）投石可及的距离﹐非常靠近（某物）﹐ 在（某物）附近
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel is only a stone’s throw from the beach.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家酒店离海滩很近。

Sense.DEF: to not show any emotions or pity for someone
Sense.TRAN: 冷酷无情﹐有一副铁石心肠

Sense.DEF: used to say an idea or plan could change
Sense.EXAMPLE: John has several new ideas for the show, but nothing is etched in stone yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰对这个节目有一些新的构想﹐但现在还什么都没定。

Sense.DEF: to do everything you can in order to find something or to solve a problem
Sense.TRAN: 千方百计﹐想尽一切办法
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jarvis left no stone unturned in his search to find the ring.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贾维斯千方百计寻找那枚戒指。

PIC.HEADING: STONES 石头
PIC.PICCONTENT: pebbles 卵石；stones 石头；fossil 化石；precious stone宝石

Sense.DEF: to throw stones at someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rioters blocked roads and stoned vehicles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴徒们堵住道路﹐并朝汽车投掷石块。

Sense.DEF: to kill someone by throwing stones at them, used as a punishment
Sense.TRAN: 用石头砸死某人〔作为惩罚〕

Sense.DEF: to take the stone out of fruit
Sense.EXAMPLE: stoned dates
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去核海枣

Sense.DEF: used to express surprise or shock
Sense.TRAN: 哎呀！啊！〔表示惊讶或震惊〕

Sense.DEF: a very early time in human history, when only stone was used for making tools, weapons etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stone Age weapons
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 石器时代的武器
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Stone Age settlement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个石器时代的村落

Sense.DEF: a circle of big tall stones, built thousands of years ago
Sense.TRAN: 〔古代建造的〕巨石阵﹐巨石柱群

Sense.DEF: if something is stone-cold, it is completely cold even though it should be warm or hot
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dinner was stone-cold by the time I got home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我到家时﹐晚饭已经完全凉了。

Sense.DEF: having drunk no alcohol at all
Sense.TRAN: 完全清醒的﹐滴酒未沾的

Sense.DEF: if a player or sports team is stone-cold, they are not able to get any points

feeling very excited or relaxed because you have taken an illegal drug such as
marijuana
Sense.TRAN: 〔吸食毒品后〕极度兴奋[放松]的

Sense.DEF: very drunk
used to emphasize that a person or animal is dead
to completely destroy something or prevent it from being successful
Sense.TRAN: 彻底破坏某物﹔完全阻止某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wrong music can kill a commercial stone dead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不合适的音乐会把一个广告彻底毁掉。

Sense.DEF: completely unable to hear
showing no emotion or friendliness
Sense.TRAN: 面无表情的﹔态度冷冰冰的

Sense.DEF:
stone-ground flour is made by crushing grain between two
millstones

a group of very large tall stones that are arranged in a large circle with a smaller circle inside it, which stand on Salisbury Plain in Wiltshire, southern England. It is believed they were put there about 4,000 years ago and were used for studying the movements of the sun, moon, and stars. Some people also believe that they were used by the Druids ancient priests before the Christian period in religious ceremonies.
Sense.TRAN: 巨石阵〔位于英格兰南部的索尔兹伯里平原﹐相传立于约四千年前﹐用于观测日月星辰的运动。 也有人认为这个巨石阵是德鲁伊特人在宗教仪式上使用的〕

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is cutting stone into pieces to be used in buildings

a stone seat that was traditionally used in the ceremony for officially making someone king or queen of Scotland. It is also called the Stone of Destiny. The stone was taken from Scotland in 1296 and kept in Westminster Abbey in London, but Scottish Nationalists, who believed that the stone belonged in Scotland, tried to steal it. In 1996 it was officially returned to Scotland.
Sense.TRAN: 斯昆石﹐命运石〔为古时苏格兰君主加冕时使用〕

Sense.DEF:
someone who often smokes
marijuana
to delay a discussion, decision etc by talking a lot and refusing to answer questions
Sense.TRAN: 〔用冗长的发言和拒绝回答问题的办法〕拖延[阻碍]议事[作出决定]

Sense.DEF: pots, bowls etc that are made from a special hard clay

stone-washed
jeans
etc have been washed with small stones so that they look older and paler
the parts of a building that are made of stone
something that is very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stephen Carr scored a stonker of a goal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯蒂芬•卡尔进了漂亮的一球。

Sense.DEF: extremely good
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stonking performance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绝佳的表演

Sense.DEF: extremely
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stonking good time
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绝佳的时机

Sense.DEF: covered by stones or containing stones
Sense.TRAN: 铺着石头的﹔多石的﹔石质的
Sense.EXAMPLE: stony soil
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 石质土

Sense.DEF: not showing any friendliness or pity
Sense.TRAN: 冷酷的﹐无情的﹔无同情心的
Sense.EXAMPLE: stony faces
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冷酷的面孔
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stony silence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冷漠的沉默

Sense.DEF: if a request, suggestion, joke etc falls on stony ground, it is ignored or people do not like it
Sense.TRAN: 〔要求﹑提议﹑笑话等〕被忽视﹔不受喜欢﹔没有引起反响

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡米拉冷冷地盯着前方。

Sense.DEF: showing no emotion or friendliness
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tony stared at me in stony-faced silence .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 托尼面无表情﹐静静地盯着我看。

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and past participle of
stand
Sense.TRAN: stand 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF: someone who is used by someone else to do something unpleasant, dishonest, or illegal – used to show disapproval

one of two performers in a
comedy
show, who the other performer makes jokes about and makes look stupid
Sense.TRAN: 〔作为另一演员作弄打趣对象的〕配角﹐丑角

Sense.DEF: a seat that has three or four legs, but no back or arms
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bar stool
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒吧高凳

Sense.DEF:
a piece of solid waste from your
bowel s
someone, especially a criminal, who helps the police to catch another criminal, usually by giving them information
to bend your body forward and down
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had to stoop to pass through the low entrance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得弯腰通过那低矮的入口。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dave stooped down to tie his shoes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫俯身系鞋带。

Sense.DEF: to stand with your back and shoulders bent forwards
Sense.TRAN: 弓背站立﹐弯腰曲背站立

Sense.DEF: to do something bad or morally wrong, which you do not normally do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I didn’t expect you to stoop to lying.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没料到你竟然卑劣到会撒谎。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t stoop to her level.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别把自己降低到她的档次。

Sense.DEF: if you have a stoop, your shoulders are bent forward
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Hamilton was an odd, quiet man who walked with a stoop.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汉密尔顿先生是个怪人﹐不爱说话﹐走路时弓着背。

Sense.DEF: a raised area at the door of a house, usually big enough to sit on
bent forwards and down
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thin man with stooped shoulders
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个溜肩的瘦削男子

Tail.TailContent: This graph shows how common the different grammar patterns of the verb stop are. 本图表所示为动词 stop 构成的不同语法模式的使用频率。

Subsense.DEF: to not continue, or to make someone or something not continue
Subsense.EXAMPLE: By midday the rain had stopped.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了中午时分﹐雨停了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: This is where the path stops.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小路就到这里为止。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The referee stopped the fight.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 裁判终止了拳赛。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The doctor advised me to stop the medication.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生建议我停止用药。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: People are fighting to stop the destruction of the rain forests.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们正在努力阻止热带雨林受到破坏。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t stop her crying.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我无法让她停止哭泣。

Subsense.DEF: if you stop doing something, you do not continue to do it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I stopped digging and looked at him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我停下不再挖﹐看着他。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: What time do you stop work?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你几点下班？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been smoking for over ten years, and I can’t stop.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我抽了十多年的烟﹐戒不掉。

GramExa.GLOSS: stop doing something annoying
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Come on, you two. Stop it!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 好啦﹐你们俩﹐住手！

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Right, stop what you’re doing and come over here.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喂﹐你们停下手头的事﹐到这里来。
Subsense.HINTTRAN: In this sense, do not say ‘stop to do something’. Say stop doing something . Stop to do something means to stop moving along or stop what you are doing in order to do something else. 表达这个意思时不能说 stop to do something﹐而要说 stop doing something。 stop to do something 的意思是“停下来去做别的事”: She stopped to look at the map (=in order to look at the map) . 她停下来看地图。

Sense.DEF: to prevent someone from doing something or something from happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government tried to stop publication of the book.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府企图阻止这本书出版。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m leaving now, and you can’t stop me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我现在就要走了﹐你阻止不了我。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lay the carpet on paper to stop it sticking to the floor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把地毯铺在纸上﹐以免粘住地板。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rain didn’t stop us from enjoying the trip.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那场雨没有妨碍我们享受旅行的乐趣。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t stop myself laughing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我忍不住大笑起来。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She grabbed the rail to stop herself from falling.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她抓住扶手以免摔倒。

GramExa.PROPFORM: there’s nothing to stop sb (from) doing sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s nothing to stop you applying for the job yourself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你完全可以自己去申请这份工作。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘stop someone to do something’. Say 而要说 stop someone (from) doing something.

Sense.DEF: to not walk, move, or travel any more, or to make someone or something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stopped suddenly when he saw Ruth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一看到露丝﹐便突然停住了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop! Come back!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 停下﹐回来！
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stopped the car and got out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把车停住并下了车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was worried that the security guards would stop us at the gate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我担心警卫会把我们挡在门口。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She stopped outside the post office.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在邮局门外停了下 来。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A car stopped behind us.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆汽车在我们后面停了下来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sam stopped to give me a lift.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆停下来让我搭车。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He stopped and looked into her face.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他停下来看着她的脸。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I need to stop for a rest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得停下来休息一会儿。

GramExa.GLOSS: stop walking suddenly
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sally saw the ambulance and stopped short.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨莉看到救护车﹐就一下子停住了脚步。

GramExa.GLOSS: stop very quickly – used about cars
GramExa.EXAMPLE: This truck can stop on a dime!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆卡车刹车很灵！

Sense.DEF: to pause in an activity, journey etc in order to do something before you continue

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We stopped for a drink on the way home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在回家的路上停下来喝了一杯。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I stopped to tie my shoe.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我停下来系鞋带。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s time we stopped to think about our next move.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们该停下来想一想下一步的行动了。

Sense.DEF: to stay somewhere for a short time, especially at someone’s house
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在某人家里〕逗留﹐短时间停留
Sense.EXAMPLE: I won’t sit down – I’m not stopping.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不坐了﹐我不打算逗留。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Will you stop for a cup of tea?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你留下来喝杯茶好吗？

Sense.LEXUNIT: will/would stop at nothing (to do sth)
Sense.DEF: to be ready to do anything to achieve something that you want to achieve
Sense.TRAN: （做某事）尽最大努力﹔不择手段
Sense.EXAMPLE: We will stop at nothing to save our child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们要尽一切努力救我们的孩子。

Sense.DEF: to decide that you are not willing to do something wrong or dangerous, though you will do something similar that is less dangerous
Sense.TRAN: 决定不做﹐不愿做〔错误或危险的事情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The US government supported sanctions but stopped short of military action.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国政府支持制裁﹐但不愿采取军事行动。

Sense.DEF: if you stop an amount of money, you prevent it from being paid to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dad threatened to stop my pocket money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸威胁不给我零用钱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: £200 will be stopped from your wages next month to pay for the damage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 下个月将从你的工资里扣除 200 英镑赔偿损失。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I phoned the bank and asked them to stop the cheque not pay a cheque that I had written .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我打电话到银行要求他们止付那张支票。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My mother called the bank to stop payment on the check.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我母亲给银行打电话要求止付那张支票。

Sense.DEF: to block a hole or pipe so that water, smoke etc cannot go through it

Section.SECHEADING: TO STOP DOING SOMETHING 停止做某事

Exponent.DEF: to not do something any longer
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I wish she would stop talking.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望她别再说了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He waited for them to stop.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他等着他们停下来。

Exponent.DEF: to stop doing something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She needs to quit complaining about her life.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不应该再抱怨生活了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s too late for him to quit now.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他现在罢手太晚了。

Exponent.DEF: to stop doing something, especially something that you have been doing for a long time
Exponent.TRAN: 放弃做某事〔尤指长期做的事〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s so hard to give up smoking.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 戒烟真难。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She wants to give up her job.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想放弃这份工作。

Exponent.DEF: to stop doing something, especially because you feel tired or annoyed
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤因劳累或生气而〕停止做某事
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Sometimes I feel like packing in my job and starting again somewhere else.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候我很想放弃这份工作,换个地方重新开始。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Pack it in, will you!
Exponent.GLOSS: used when telling someone to stop doing something, because they are annoying you
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 别干了,行不行？

Exponent.DEF: to stop taking part in something that you have agreed to take part in
Exponent.TRAN: 从〔承诺参加的〕某事中退出
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The unions have pulled out of the negotiations.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会退出了谈判。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The US decided to pull out of the competition.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国决定退出竞争。

Exponent.DEF: to stop doing something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The company has decided to cease production of its film cameras.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司已决定停止生产胶片相机。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The US government ceased talks with DPRK.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国政府停止了与朝鲜的会谈。

Section.SECHEADING: TO STOP FOR A SHORT TIME 暂停

Exponent.EXAMPLE: Shall we stop for coffee now?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们歇会儿喝杯咖啡好吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I stopped to have a look at the map.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我停下来看地图。

Exponent.DEF: to stop speaking or doing something for a short time before starting again
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He paused for a moment to consider the question.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他沉吟片刻,思考这个问题。

Exponent.DEF: to stop working, studying, or driving for a short time in order to rest
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Okay, everyone. Take a ten-minute break.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 好吧,大家休息十分钟。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If you’re feeling tired, you should have a break.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你如果觉得累,就该歇一歇。

Section.SECHEADING: TO STOP HAPPENING 停止发生

Exponent.EXAMPLE: The noise suddenly stopped.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那声响突然停了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We waited for the rain to stop.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们等雨停下。

Exponent.DEF: to stop – used about something that has continued for a long time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The war finally came to an end in 1918.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争最终于 1918 年结束。

Exponent.DEF: to gradually stop – used about a pain, a feeling, or the effects of something
Exponent.TRAN: 〔疼痛﹑某种情感或某事物的效力〕逐渐消失
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The pain will soon wear off.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 疼痛会很快消失的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The excitement was beginning to wear off.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 兴奋感开始渐渐消退。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The anaesthetic took a long time to wear off.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 麻醉的效力过了很久才慢慢消失。

Exponent.DEF: to gradually stop happening or existing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The campaign petered out after only a few weeks.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 活动仅持续几个星期就偃旗息鼓了。

Exponent.DEF: to stop
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The fighting has ceased.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 战斗已经停止。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Production at the factory has ceased.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 工厂已经停产。

Section.SECHEADING: TO STOP MOVING 停止移动

Exponent.EXAMPLE: Can we stop soon? I’m tired.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们快点停下来好吗？我累了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The bus stops right in front of the hotel.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共汽车就停在酒店门前。

Exponent.DEF: to move more slowly and then stop – used about a vehicle
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The train slowly came to a halt just outside the station.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车慢慢在车站外停下。

Exponent.DEF: to move to the side of the road and stop – used about a vehicle or its driver
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The bus pulled over to the side of the road, with smoke coming out of its engine.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共汽车在路边停下,引擎冒着烟。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The police officer was waving at him to pull over.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察向他挥手示意他靠边停车。

Exponent.DEF: to stop close to something – used about a vehicle or its driver
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The taxi pulled up outside her house.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 出租车在她家门外停下。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He pulled up next to our car.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开到我们的车旁边停下。

Exponent.DEF: to go slower and then stop moving completely
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The road was blocked by an accident, and the traffic quickly came to a standstill.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一起车祸导致道路堵塞,交通很快停滞了。

Sense.DEF: to go back to a place you have been to earlier
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you stop back later? I’m busy right now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能过一会儿再来吗？ 我现在正忙。

Sense.DEF: to make a short visit to a place or person’s home, especially while you are going somewhere else
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll stop by this evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚我会顺路过来拜访。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Daniel stopped by the store on his way home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹尼尔在回家路上顺便去了那家商店。

Sense.DEF: to make a short visit to a place or person, especially while you are going somewhere else
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll stop in and see you on my way home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在回家路上会顺路来看你。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I need to stop in at the library.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要顺路去一下图书馆。

Sense.DEF: to stay at home
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m stopping in to wash my hair tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我今晚待在家里洗头。

Sense.DEF: to make a short visit to a place during a journey, especially to rest or to see someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: We can stop off and see you on our way back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以在回家的路上停下来去看你。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We stopped off in Santa Rosa for a day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们中途在圣罗莎停留了一天。

Sense.DEF: to stay out later than usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a real treat being allowed to stop out late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被允许晚回家真是很大的优待。

Sense.DEF: to stop somewhere and stay a short time before continuing a long journey, especially when travelling by plane
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plane stops over in Dubai on the way to India.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机飞往印度途中在迪拜经停。

Sense.DEF: to block a hole or pipe so that water, smoke etc cannot go through it
Sense.TRAN: 堵塞﹐堵住〔洞﹑管子﹐以防水﹑烟等通过〕

Sense.DEF: to stay up late
Sense.EXAMPLE: Joe stopped up till 3 o’clock to watch the boxing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔熬夜看拳击到3点钟才睡觉。

Sense.DEF: if a vehicle comes to a stop, it stops moving
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车〕停了下来/翻滚着/猛地一颠/打着滑等停了下来
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bus came to a stop outside the school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共汽车在学校外面停了下来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car skidded to a stop.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车打着滑停了下来。

Sense.DEF: if an activity comes to a stop, it stops happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: Work on the project has come to a stop because of lack of funding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于缺乏资金﹐这个项目已经停工。

Sense.DEF: to stop something moving or happening
Sense.TRAN: 使某物停下来﹔使某事结束
Sense.EXAMPLE: David brought the truck to a shuddering stop.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着一阵剧烈抖动﹐戴维住了卡车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The UN is trying to bring the war to a stop.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国试图结束这场战争。

Sense.DEF: a time or place when you stop during a journey for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our first stop was Paris.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的第一站是巴黎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll make a stop at the foot of the hill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们中途将在山脚下停留。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trip includes an overnight stop in London.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次旅行包括在伦敦停留一夜。

Sense.DEF: a place where a bus or train regularly stops for people to get on and off
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our next stop will be York.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们下一站是约克。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is your stop, isn’t it?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在这一站下车﹐对不对？

Sense.DEF: to prevent something from continuing or happening
Sense.TRAN: 制止某事﹐使某事停下来
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government is determined to put a stop to the demonstrations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府决心制止游行示威。

Sense.DEF: to do everything you possibly can to make something happen and succeed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hospital staff pulled out all the stops to make sure the children had a wonderful day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医院员工竭尽全力确保孩子们能过上愉快的一天。

Sense.DEF: the action or fact of telling your bank not to pay an amount of money to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: I put a stop on that check to the store.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我让银行止付给商店的那张支票。

Sense.DEF:
a handle that you push in or out on an
organ
to control the amount of sound it produces
