a consonant sound, like /p/ or /k/, that you make by stopping the flow of air completely and then suddenly letting it out of your mouth

a
tap
that controls the flow of a liquid or gas through a pipe
Sense.TRAN: 〔控制管道中液体或气体流量的〕管闩﹐活栓﹐阀门

Sense.DEF: something or someone that you use for a short time until you can replace them with something better
Sense.TRAN: 权宜之计﹔临时替代的物[人]
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s only a stopgap measure , not a long-term solution.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那只是权宜之计﹐不是长期的解决方案。

Sense.DEF:
a way of controlling the
economy
by restricting government spending for a period of time and then not restricting it so severely for a time
Sense.TRAN: 先紧缩后放宽的经济调控方法/政策等

Sense.DEF: a set of coloured lights used to control and direct traffic

an arrangement in which the person who buys and sells
stock s
for you agrees to buy or sell them when they reach a particular price
Sense.TRAN: 〔股票买卖的〕止损令〔授意经纪人在股票达到指定价格时即予买入或卖出的指令〕

Sense.DEF: a short stay somewhere between parts of a journey, especially on a long plane journey
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指长途飞行中的〕中途停留
Sense.EXAMPLE: a two-day stopover in Hong Kong
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中途在香港停留两天

Sense.DEF: a situation in which workers stop working for a short time as a protest
Sense.EXAMPLE: time lost in disputes and stoppages
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因纠纷和停工损失的时间
Sense.EXAMPLE: a work stoppage by government employees
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府雇员的停工

Sense.DEF: when something stops moving or happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had five minutes of stoppage time extra time played in a sports match because of pauses at the end of the first half.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上半场结束前我们补时五分钟。

Sense.DEF: something that blocks a tube or container
Sense.EXAMPLE: an intestinal stoppage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肠梗阻物

Sense.DEF: the thing that you put in the top part of a bottle to close it
the distance that a driver is supposed to leave between their car and the one in front in order to be able to stop safely
a train that stops at all stations, not just the main ones
late news added to a newspaper after the main part has been printed
Sense.TRAN: 〔报纸开印后〕临时加插的最新消息

Sense.DEF: a watch used for measuring the exact time it takes to do something, especially to finish a race
the process of keeping or putting something in a special place while it is not being used
Sense.EXAMPLE: the storage of highly radioactive material
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高放射性材料的存放

GramExa.GLOSS: space etc for keeping things in
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They moved to a house with lots of storage space.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们搬到了一栋有很大贮存空间的房子里。

Sense.DEF: when you pay to keep furniture or other goods in a special place until you need to use them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I put some of my things in storage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把我的一些东西存放起来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: storage costs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保管费用

Sense.DEF: the way that information is kept on a computer
Sense.EXAMPLE: data storage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数据存储

Sense.DEF:
a
heater
that stores heat at times when electricity is cheaper, for example at night

a place where goods are sold to the public. In British English, a store is large and sells many different things, but in American English, a store can be large or small, and sell many things or only one type of thing.
Sense.EXAMPLE: At Christmas the stores stay open late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在圣诞节期间﹐商店营业到很晚。

GramExa.GLOSS: one that sells one type of goods
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 鞋店/服装店/（食品）杂货店等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She worked in a grocery store before going to college.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她读大学前在一家杂货店打工。

GramExa.GLOSS: go to a store that sells food
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I need to go to the store for some milk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得去商店买些牛奶。

Sense.DEF: a supply of something that you keep to use later

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a store of wood
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 木料储备

Sense.EXAMPLE: fat stores in the body that your body keeps
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 体内储备的脂肪

Sense.DEF: a large building in which goods are kept so they can be used or sold later
Sense.EXAMPLE: a grain store
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 粮仓

Sense.DEF: if something unexpected such as a surprise or problem is in store for someone, it is about to happen to them
Sense.TRAN: 将要发生（在某人身上）﹐就要出现（在某人身上）
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a real treat in store for you this Christmas!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年圣诞节有好事等着你呢！
Sense.EXAMPLE: As we left, I wondered what the future held in store .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们走的时候﹐我不知道未来等待我们的将是什么。

Subsense.DEF: supplies of food and equipment that are used by an army, navy etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: medical stores
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医疗用品

Subsense.DEF: the building or room in an army camp, ship etc where these are kept
Subsense.TRAN: 〔军营中或轮船上等的〕补给品仓库

Sense.LEXUNIT: set great/considerable etc store by sth
Sense.DEF: to consider something to be important
Sense.EXAMPLE: Patrick has never set much store by material things.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕特里克对物质的东西向来不是很看重。

Sense.DEF: to put things away and keep them until you need them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Squirrels are storing up nuts for the winter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 松鼠正在为过冬贮存坚果。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Store the beans in an airtight jar.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把豆子贮存在密封罐内。

Sense.DEF: to keep facts or information in your brain or a computer
Sense.TRAN: 〔在头脑或计算机中〕储存〔事实或信息〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Standard letters can be stored on floppy discs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 标准信函可以储存在软盘内。

Sense.DEF: to behave in a way that will cause trouble for you later
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smokers may be storing up disease for their unborn children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸烟者可能会给自己未出生的子女带来疾病。

Sense.DEF: a type of product that is made for a particular shop and has the shop’s name on it
Sense.TRAN: 商店品牌商品﹐自有品牌商品〔专为某商店生产并标有该商店店名的商品〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Store brands are cheaper than name brands.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自有品牌商品比名牌商品便宜。

Sense.DEF: a card provided by a particular shop, that you can use to buy goods at that shop and pay for them at a later date
someone who is employed in a large shop to watch the customers and to stop them stealing
Sense.TRAN: 店铺侦探〔在大商店里专抓行窃者的雇员〕

Sense.DEF: the part of a store that faces the street
a small church etc in a shopping area
Sense.TRAN: 〔购物区内〕临街的教堂/小型律师事务所/学校等

Sense.DEF: something that contains a lot of information etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The local archives service offers a storehouse of material.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地的档案馆提供大量的资料。

Sense.DEF: a building where things are stored
someone who owns or manages a shop
a room where goods are stored
a floor or level of a building
Sense.EXAMPLE: A staircase leads to the upper storey .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一段楼梯通往上面一层。

GramExa.GLOSS: having two etc storeys

Sense.DEF: having two etc storeys
being the subject of many stories
Sense.TRAN: 广为流传的﹐尽人皆知的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sun Tzu, the storied Chinese leader and philosopher
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孙子﹐尽人皆知的中国军事家和哲人

Sense.DEF: a tall white bird with long legs and a long beak

a period of very bad weather when there is a lot of rain or snow, strong winds, and often
lightning
Sense.EXAMPLE: The weather forecast is for severe storms tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气预报说今晚有强暴风雨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Twenty people were killed when storms struck the Midwest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴风雨袭击中西部﹐造成20人死亡。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which people suddenly express very strong feelings about something that someone has said or done
Sense.EXAMPLE: The governor found himself at the center of a political storm .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 州长发现自己处于一场政治风暴的中心。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Government plans for hospital closures provoked a storm of protest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府关闭医院的计划激起了一片强烈的抗议声。

Subsense.DEF: to be very successful in a particular place
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The new show took London by storm.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部新剧在伦敦大获成功。

Subsense.DEF: to attack a place using large numbers of soldiers, and succeed in getting possession of it
Subsense.TRAN: 〔以优势兵力成功地〕突袭攻占某处

Sense.DEF: to experience a difficult period and reach the end of it without being harmed or damaged too much
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll stay and weather the storm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要留下来渡过难关。

Sense.DEF: an unnecessary expression of strong feelings about something that is very unimportant
Sense.TRAN: 茶杯里的风波﹐小题大做﹐大惊小怪

Sense.DEF: to do something with all your energy
Sense.TRAN: 起劲地跳舞/唱歌/烹调等
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were dancing up a storm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正在尽情地跳舞。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The tree had come down on the day of the big storm.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那棵树在下大暴雨那天倒了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: This was the worst storm for 50 years.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是 50 年来最严重的暴风雨。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He set out in a violent storm for Fort William.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他冒着狂风暴雨向威廉堡进发。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: the great storm of 1997
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 1997年的大风暴

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The tropical storm smashed through the Bahamas.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 热带风暴横扫巴哈马。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an unexpected and unusually violent one

Collocate.EXAMPLE: That night, a storm blew up.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那一夜,风雨大作。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: suddenly starts, after clouds have been increasing
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The storm broke at five o'clock.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 5 点钟,暴风雨降临。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He could feel that a storm was brewing.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他能感觉到暴风雨即将来临。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: By the time we reached the airfield, a tropical storm was raging.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到达机场时,热带风暴正在肆虐。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We should try to get home before the storm hits.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们应该尽量赶在暴风雨来临前到家。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We could see storm clouds in the distance.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们看到远处有风暴云。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A lot of buildings suffered storm damage.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多建筑物遭到暴风雨破坏。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘a strong storm’ or 或 ‘a hard storm’. Say 而要说 a big storm , a bad storm , or 或 a violent storm .

Exponent.DEF: a period of very bad weather when there is a lot of rain or snow, strong winds, and often lightning
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The ship sank in a violent storm.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那船在狂风暴雨中沉没。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They got caught in a storm on top of the mountain.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在山顶遭遇暴风雨。

Exponent.DEF: a storm in which there is a lot of thunder loud noise in the sky and lightning flashes of light in the sky
Exponent.EXAMPLE: When I was young I was terrified of thunderstorms.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我小时候很怕雷雨。

Exponent.DEF: a storm that has very strong fast winds and that moves over water – used about storms in the North Atlantic Ocean
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Hurricane Katrina battered the US Gulf Coast.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡特里娜飓风重创美国墨西哥湾沿岸。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the hurricane season
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 飓风季节

Exponent.DEF: a very violent tropical storm – used about storms in the Western Pacific Ocean
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A powerful typhoon hit southern China today.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天强台风袭击了中国南方。

Exponent.DEF: a severe storm affecting a large area, in which the wind moves around in a big circle
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Thousands of people died when a tropical cyclone hit Bangladesh.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 热带气旋袭击孟加拉国,数千人死亡。

Exponent.DEF: an extremely violent storm that consists of air that spins very quickly and causes a lot of damage
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The tornado ripped the roof off his house.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 龙卷风把他家的屋顶掀了。

Exponent.DEF: a storm with strong winds and a lot of snow
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A major snowstorm blew across Colorado.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 强暴风雪横扫科罗拉多州。

Exponent.DEF: a severe snowstorm in which the snow is blown around by strong winds, making it difficult to see anything
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We got stuck in a blizzard.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们被暴风雪困住了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Denver is bracing itself for blizzard conditions .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹佛正为暴风雪天气做准备。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly attack and enter a place using a lot of force
Sense.TRAN: 猛烈攻击﹐突然袭击〔某地〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: An angry crowd stormed the embassy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 愤怒的人群突然袭击大使馆。

Sense.DEF: to go somewhere in a noisy fast way that shows you are extremely angry

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Alan stormed out of the room.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾伦气呼呼地冲出房间。

Sense.DEF: to shout something in an angry way
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What difference does it make?’ she stormed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那有什么区别？”她怒吼道。

Sense.DEF: a place under a house where you can go to be safe during violent storms
Sense.TRAN: 暴风雨避难窖﹐防风地窖

Sense.DEF: a dark cloud which you see before a storm
Sense.TRAN: 风暴云〔暴风雨前的乌云〕

Sense.DEF: a sign that something very bad is going to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Storm clouds are gathering over the trade negotiations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乌云正逐渐笼罩着贸易谈判。

Sense.DEF: a second door that is fitted to the outside of a door in winter in the US to give protection against rain, snow etc
an opening at the side of a street that carries away rainwater during a storm
a lamp which has a cover to protect the flame against the wind, used in the past
a member of a special group of German soldiers in the Second World War
Sense.TRAN: 〔第二次世界大战中德国的〕冲锋队员﹐突击队员

Sense.DEF: a second window fitted to the outside of a window in winter in the US to give more protection against rain, snow etc
with strong winds, heavy rain, and dark clouds
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sky was starting to look stormy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开始变天了﹐看上去暴风雨将至。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dark and stormy night
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 漆黑的暴风雨之夜

Sense.DEF: a stormy relationship, meeting etc is full of strong and often angry feelings
Sense.TRAN: 〔关系﹑会议等〕充满激烈情绪的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stormy affair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充满波折的风流事

Sense.DEF: stormy seas are very rough, with big waves that are caused by strong winds
Sense.EXAMPLE: hostile, stormy seas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暗藏凶险﹑波涛翻滚的大海

Sense.DEF: a description of how something happened, that is intended to entertain people, and may be true or imaginary

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a story about a princess
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于一位公主的故事

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a detective story
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 侦探小说

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mommy, will you read me a story?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈﹐给我读个故事好吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: a book of short stories
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 短篇小说集
Sense.EXAMPLE: We cuddled together over a bedtime story .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们依偎在一起看睡前故事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film was based on a true story .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片是根据真实故事改编的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be frightened – it’s only a story it is imaginary .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别害怕﹐这只是一个故事。

Sense.DEF: a report in a newspaper or news broadcast about a recent event, or something that is reported on
Sense.EXAMPLE: a front-page story
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 头版新闻报道
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘The Observer’ ran a story about the scandal printed it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《观察家报》刊登了一则有关这一丑闻的报道。

GramExa.GLOSS: the main story in a magazine, which is about the picture on the cover

Sense.DEF: an account of something that has happened, usually one that people tell each other, and which may not be true
Sense.EXAMPLE: The full story of what happened has never been reported.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所发生的事情一直没有被全面报道过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her parents did not believe her story.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她父母不相信她的说法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: First, he wanted to hear Matthew’s side of the story his description of what happened .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 首先﹐他想听一听马修对这件事是怎么说的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was having an affair with Julie, or so the story goes people are saying this .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和朱莉有染﹐至少传闻是这么说的。

Sense.DEF: an excuse or explanation, especially one that you have invented
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where were you? And don’t give me some story about working late!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你去了哪里？ 不要找借口说晚上加班了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, that’s my story that is what I say happened , and I’m sticking to it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐这就是我要说的情况﹐而且我坚持这一说法。

Sense.DEF: a description of the most important events in someone’s life or in the development of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Charlie Parker Story
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《查利·帕克纪事》
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wanted to have his life story told on film.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他希望将他的生平事迹搬上银幕。

Sense.DEF: a floor or level of a building
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 50-story building
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一幢50层的大楼

Sense.DEF: what happens in a film, play, or book
Sense.EXAMPLE: The story is similar in all her books.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她所有小说中的情节都大同小异。

Sense.DEF: used to say the same thing is happening in another place
Sense.TRAN: 这里/那里/在…等也是同样的情况
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unemployment is falling in the US, and it’s the same story in Europe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国失业率在降低﹐欧洲也是如此。

Sense.DEF: used to say that the present bad situation has often happened before
Sense.TRAN: 又是那老一套〔表示目前糟糕的情况以前经常发生〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s the same old story – too much work and not enough time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 情况还是跟过去一样——工作太多,时间不够。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that you do not want to give them all the details that a full answer to their question would need

Sense.LEXUNIT: to cut a long story short

Variant.LEXVAR: to make a long story short

Sense.DEF: used when you only give the main point of something you are talking about, and not all the other details
Sense.TRAN: 长话短说﹔简而言之﹔总之

Sense.DEF: used when you have mentioned something that you are not going to talk about on this occasion
Sense.TRAN: 那是另一回事了〔表示不打算谈论所提及的某事〕

Sense.DEF: used to say that there are more details which people need to know in order to understand the situation
Sense.TRAN: 情况还不止这样,那还不是事情的全部

Sense.LEXUNIT: that’s the story of my life
Sense.DEF: used after a disappointing experience to mean that similar disappointing things always seem to happen to you
Sense.TRAN: 这就是我的命〔在经历失望的事情之后表示自己经常遭遇类似的不幸〕

Sense.DEF: used to say that there is nothing more to say about a particular subject
Sense.TRAN: 不必多说了,到此为止了〔表示对某话题再没有什么好谈论的了〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: As far as I’m concerned, Terry is still a friend – end of story.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对我来说,特里仍然是我的朋友,就是这样。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is not what you expect it to be
Sense.TRAN: 是另一回事﹐根本不像预料的那样
Sense.EXAMPLE: It looks like a big house, but inside it’s a different story.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它看上去像是一栋大房子﹐但里面却不是这么回事。

Sense.DEF: a lie – used by children or when speaking to children
Sense.EXAMPLE: You shouldn’t tell stories .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不该说谎。

Exponent.DEF: a description of how something happened that is intended to entertain people, and may be true or imaginary
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a ghost story
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 鬼故事
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a love story
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱情故事
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s a story about a man who loses his memory.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是关于一个失忆男人的故事。

Exponent.DEF: a story about strange imaginary events, or exciting events that happened in the past
Exponent.TRAN: 〔虚构且奇特的或过去发生的刺激的〕故事
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a fairy tale by Hans Christian Andersen
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 汉斯·克里斯蒂安·安徒生的一个童话故事
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I loved hearing tales of his travels.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我爱听他的旅行故事。

Exponent.DEF: a very old imaginary story about gods and magical creatures
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an ancient myth
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 古代神话
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Greek and Roman myths
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 希腊罗马神话

Exponent.DEF: an old story about brave people or magical events that are probably not true
Exponent.EXAMPLE: popular legends of the creation of the world
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 脍炙人口的创世传说
Exponent.EXAMPLE: According to legend, King Arthur was buried there.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 据传说亚瑟王就葬在那里。

Exponent.DEF: a traditional imaginary short story that teaches a moral lesson, especially a story about animals
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the fable of the tortoise and the hare
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 龟兔赛跑的寓言故事
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a Chinese fable
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 中国寓言

Exponent.DEF: a story told in a long book, film, or poem which is about great or exciting events, especially in history
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an epic about 13th-century Scottish hero William Wallace
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于 13 世纪苏格兰民族英雄威廉·华莱士的史诗

Exponent.DEF: a story about a series of events that take place over a long period of time, especially events involving one family
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a family saga beginning in the 1880s
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部始于 19 世纪 80 年代的家世小说

Exponent.DEF: a long exciting story that is not completely true
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The movie’s a rattling good yarn and full of action.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影情节曲折离奇。

Sense.DEF: a set of drawings that are done before a film is made in order to show what will happen in it

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I can't do any storyboarding until I get the script.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 拿到剧本我才能画剧情梗概图。

Sense.DEF: a book of stories for children
Sense.EXAMPLE: colourful storybooks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 彩色故事书

Sense.DEF: an ending etc that is so happy or perfect that it is like one in a children’s story
Sense.TRAN: 童话式的结局/浪漫史等
Sense.EXAMPLE: It would have been storybook stuff if he had won the competition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是他赢了这场比赛﹐那简直就是传奇故事了。

Sense.DEF: the main set of related events in a story
Sense.EXAMPLE: The play had a strong story line.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这出戏的故事情节很棒。

Sense.DEF: someone who tells stories, especially to children
a container for holy water near the entrance to a church
fairly fat and heavy, or having a thick body
Sense.EXAMPLE: a short, stout man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个矮胖的男人

Sense.DEF: strong and thick
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stout pair of shoes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一双厚实耐穿的鞋子

Sense.DEF: brave and determined

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He put up a stout defence in court.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在法庭上进行了顽强的抗辩。

Sense.DEF: strong dark beer
brave and determined

a piece of kitchen equipment on which you cook food in pots and pans, and that contains an
oven

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a pot of soup simmering on the stove
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在炉灶上煨着的一锅汤

Sense.DEF: a thing used for heating a room or for cooking, which works by burning wood, coal, oil, or gas
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wood-burning stove
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烧木柴的火炉

Sense.DEF:
a past tense and past participle of
stave
Sense.TRAN: stave 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF: to put or pack something tidily away in a space until you need it again
Sense.EXAMPLE: I stowed my bag under the seat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把包收好放到座位底下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: equipment stowed away in a closet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 收在贮藏室里的设备

Sense.DEF: to hide on a vehicle in order to travel secretly or without paying
Sense.EXAMPLE: A boy was caught trying to stow away on a plane.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个男孩试图逃票乘飞机被抓住。

Sense.DEF: space available in a vehicle, especially a boat, for storing things
someone who hides on a vehicle in order to travel secretly or to avoid paying
to sit or stand with your legs on either side of someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The photo shows him dressed in leather, straddling a motorbike.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 照片上他身穿皮衣﹐跨坐在摩托车上。

Sense.DEF: if something straddles a line, road, or river, part of it is on one side and part on the other side
Sense.TRAN: 横跨…的两边﹐跨越…的两边

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mount Elgon straddles the border between Kenya and Uganda.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃尔贡火山横跨肯尼亚和乌干达两国的边境。

Sense.DEF: to include different areas of activity, groups, time etc
Sense.TRAN: 包括﹐跨越〔不同的活动领域﹑团体﹑时间等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her research straddles mathematics and social sciences.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的研究跨越数学和社会科学两个领域。
Sense.EXAMPLE: immigrants straddling two cultures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跨越两种文化的移民

Sense.DEF: to attack a place from an aircraft by flying low and firing a lot of bullets
if the people in a group straggle somewhere, they go there fairly slowly and with large spaces between them
Sense.TRAN: 散乱地慢慢走﹐零星地走﹔落后

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The children were beginning to straggle in from the playground.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们开始陆陆续续地从操场上走进来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ali straggled behind, carrying the shopping.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿里拎着采购的物品落在后面。

Sense.DEF: to move, grow, or spread out untidily in different directions
Sense.EXAMPLE: thin, black, straggling hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 稀疏﹑散乱的黑发

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Unpainted wooden buildings straggle along the main road out of town.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿着镇外的大路零零落落地散布着一些尚未粉刷的木房子。

Sense.DEF: a person or animal that is behind the others in a group, because they are moving more slowly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wait for the stragglers to catch up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等那些掉队的人赶上来。

Sense.DEF: growing untidily and spreading out in different directions
Sense.EXAMPLE: straggly hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凌乱的头发

Sense.DEF: in a line or direction that is not curved or bent

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The book is on the table straight in front of you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那本书就在你面前的桌子上。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She was looking straight at me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她直直地看着我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Terry was so tired he couldn’t walk straight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特里累得路都走不直了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was sitting with his legs stretched straight out in front of him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坐着﹐两条腿向前伸得直直的。

Sense.DEF: in a level or correct position
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stopped in front of the mirror to put his tie straight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在镜子前停下来﹐把领带拉正。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sit up straight, don’t slouch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坐直了﹐别歪歪斜斜的。

Sense.DEF: immediately, without delay, or without doing anything else first

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I went straight up to bed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我直接上了床。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Go straight home and tell your mother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马上回家告诉你妈妈。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve got a meeting straight after lunch.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我午饭后马上得去开会。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I think I should get straight to the point .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我还是直接说正题吧。

Sense.DEF: happening one after the other in a series
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s been without sleep now for three days straight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已经连续三天没有睡觉了。

Sense.DEF: if you say or ask something straight, you say it in an honest direct way, without trying to hide your meaning
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just told him straight that I wouldn’t do it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就直接告诉他我不会做这事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She came straight out with it and said she was leaving.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她直截了当地说她要走了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope, for your sake, you’re playing it straight being honest .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了你自己﹐我希望你说实话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I told him straight to his face speaking directly to him what I thought of him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我当面告诉他我对他的看法。

Sense.DEF: if you cannot think or see straight, you cannot think or see clearly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Turn the radio down – I can’t think straight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把收音机的音量调小点﹐我没法好好思考了。

Sense.DEF: immediately or without delay
Sense.EXAMPLE: I phoned my mum straight away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我马上给妈妈打了电话。

Sense.DEF: to stop being a criminal and live an honest life
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tony’s been trying to go straight for about six months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大约六个月了﹐托尼一直在努力改邪归正。

Subsense.DEF: used to ask someone if they are telling the truth
Subsense.TRAN: 真的吗〔用于询问某人是否在说实话〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Straight up? Did you really pay that much for it?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真的吗？买这东西你真的花了那么多钱？

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize that what you are saying is true
Subsense.TRAN: 的确﹐真的〔用于强调自己说的是实话〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: No, straight up, I’ve never seen him before.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有﹐不骗你﹐我以前从没见过他。

Sense.DEF: if someone speaks straight from the shoulder, they say things in a very direct way, without trying to be polite
something that is straight does not bend or curve
Sense.EXAMPLE: a long, straight road
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条笔直的长路
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try to keep your legs straight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽量把腿伸直。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Always lift with a straight back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 提东西的时候﹐一定要把背挺直。
Sense.EXAMPLE: her long, straight black hair
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她又长又直的黑发
Sense.EXAMPLE: They sat down in a straight line .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们坐成一直溜儿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The road was dead straight completely straight .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条路是笔直的。

Sense.DEF: level or upright, and not leaning to one side
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is my tie straight?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的领带正不正？
Sense.EXAMPLE: straight white teeth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整齐洁白的牙齿

Sense.DEF: honest and truthful
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d like a straight answer please.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请给我一个诚实的回答。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just give me a straight yes or no.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坦白地回答我是或不是。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think it’s time for some straight talk now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为现在应该开诚布公地谈一谈了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wish you’d just be straight with me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你能对我说实话。

Sense.DEF: happening immediately one after another in a series
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team now has an amazing record of 43 straight wins.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个队现在保持着43场连胜的惊人纪录。

Sense.DEF: a room that is straight is clean and tidy and everything is in its proper place
Sense.TRAN: 整洁的﹐整齐的﹐有条理的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took me two hours to get the house straight .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我花了两小时才把屋子整理干净。

Sense.DEF: to understand the facts of a situation and be able to tell them correctly
Sense.TRAN: 清楚无误地了解情况﹔弄清楚某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wanted to get the facts straight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想把事实弄清楚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let me get this straight – Tom sold the car and gave you the money?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我先把这件事弄清楚——汤姆卖掉汽车﹐把钱给了你？

Sense.DEF: to make someone understand the true facts about a situation
Sense.TRAN: 使某人正确了解事实﹐使某人弄清楚情况
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tell him to ask Ruth – she’ll put him straight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叫他去问露丝——她会跟他说清楚的。

Sense.DEF: if you have a straight face, you are not laughing or smiling even though you would like to
Sense.TRAN: 严肃的表情〔指忍住不笑〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I found it very difficult to keep a straight face .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得很难板住脸不笑。

Sense.DEF: someone who is straight is attracted to people of the opposite sex
a straight alcoholic drink has no water or any other drink added to it
Sense.TRAN: 纯的﹐不加水[其他饮料]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a straight whisky
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不掺水的威士忌

Sense.DEF: if two people are straight, they no longer owe money to each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you give me £10, then we’re straight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你给我十英镑﹐我们就两不相欠了。

Sense.DEF: a straight choice or exchange is between only two possible choices or things
Sense.TRAN: 在两者之间作选择的﹐非此即彼的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a straight choice between my career or my family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在事业和家庭之间﹐我只能选择其一。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We did a straight swap – one of my cards for one of his.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们作了互换——我的一张牌换他的一张。

Sense.DEF: a straight fight or competition is between only two people
Sense.TRAN: 〔斗争或竞争〕仅在两人之间展开的﹐一对一的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The election is now a straight fight between Labour and the Conservatives.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场大选现在是工党和保守党之争。

Sense.DEF: someone who is straight behaves in a way that is accepted as normal by many people but which you think is boring
a straight actor or character does not try to make people laugh
completely one particular type of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s not a straight historical novel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 它不是纯粹的历史小说。

Sense.DEF: someone who is straight does not take illegal drugs

the straight part of a
racetrack
an honest and morally good way of life
Sense.TRAN: 循规蹈矩[安分守己]的生活

Sense.DEF: someone who is attracted to people of the opposite sex
someone who is very honest and moral and who never does anything exciting or unusual
Sense.TRAN: 循规蹈矩的人﹐安分守己的人

Sense.DEF: at once
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to start work straightaway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得马上开始工作。

Sense.DEF:
the straight part of a
racetrack
to become straight, or to make something straight
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you straighten your leg?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能把腿伸直吗？

Sense.DEF: to make your back straight, or to stand up straight after bending down
to make something tidy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mum told me to straighten my room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈让我把自己的房间整理干净。

Sense.DEF: to deal with problems or a confused situation and make it better, especially by organizing things
Sense.TRAN: 解决〔问题〕﹔整顿〔混乱情况〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are several financial problems that need to be straightened out quickly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几个财务问题需要迅速解决。

Sense.DEF: to become straight, or to make something straight
Sense.EXAMPLE: The path soon bends to the right, then straightens out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小路不久向右拐﹐然后就直了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She straightened out her legs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把腿伸直。

Sense.DEF: to improve your bad behaviour or deal with personal problems, or to help someone do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: He straightened out when he joined the army.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他参军后就改好了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her parents changed her school, hoping it would straighten her out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她父母给她换了学校﹐希望这样会使她改好。

Sense.DEF: to make your back straight, or to stand up straight after bending down
Sense.EXAMPLE: He remained bent over for several seconds before slowly straightening up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他保持弯腰姿势数秒﹐然后慢慢直起身来。

Sense.DEF: to make something tidy
to begin to behave well after behaving badly
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’d better straighten up, young lady!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小姑娘﹐你该学学好了！

Sense.DEF: without smiling or laughing, even though you are joking or saying something untrue
Sense.TRAN: 不露笑容的﹐绷着脸的〔即使在开玩笑或讲不真实的事时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘No, I really do love you,’ said Kim, straightfaced.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “不﹐我真的爱你。”金一本正经地说道。

Sense.DEF: simple and easy to understand

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Installing the program is relatively straightforward.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 安装这个程序相对来说比较简单。

Sense.EXAMPLE: This area of law is far from straightforward complicated .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法律的这个领域很复杂。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: For someone who can’t read, shopping is by no means a straightforward matter.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于不识字的人来说﹐购物绝不是一件简单的事情。

Sense.DEF: honest about your feelings or opinions and not hiding anything
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jack is tough, but always straightforward and fair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然杰克很严厉﹐但一向坦诚公正。

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
straitjacket

an entertainer who works with a
comedian
, providing him or her with opportunities to make jokes
an honest person who you can trust

a vote in which someone chooses all the
candidate s
from a particular political party in the US
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国〕支持同一政党所有候选人的选票

Sense.DEF: a film that is never shown in a cinema but is only available on video
Sense.TRAN: 直接录像制品〔从没有在电影院上映﹐仅以录像带发行的影片〕

Sense.DEF: worry that is caused by having to deal with a problem or work too hard over a long period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t look after him any more; the strain was too much for me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能再照看他了﹐压力太大。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you find the job a strain ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你觉得这份工作紧张吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: the stresses and strains of police life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察生活的紧张和压力

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The trial has been a terrible strain for both of us.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法庭审判令我们两人都非常焦虑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s quite a strain on me when he’s drinking heavily.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喝很多酒时﹐我就十分担心。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The long working hours put a severe strain on employees.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 长时间工作使雇员严重焦虑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I know you’ve been under a lot of strain lately.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道你最近压力很大。

GramExa.GLOSS: become unable to deal with a problem or work
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I could see that she was beginning to crack under the strain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能看出她开始承受不了压力了。

Sense.DEF: a difficulty or problem that is caused when a person, relationship, organization, or system has too much to do or too many problems to deal with

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dry summer has further increased the strain on water resources.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 干旱的夏季加剧了水资源紧张的情况。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The flu epidemic has put a huge strain on the health service.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 流感爆发给卫生部门带来巨大的压力。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The attack has led to strains in the relationship between the two countries.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 袭击事件导致两国关系紧张。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His marriage was under strain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的婚姻关系很紧张。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The party split under the strain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在重压之下﹐这个政党分裂了。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which something is being pulled or pushed, or is holding weight, and so might break or become damaged

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The strain on the cables supporting the bridge is enormous.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些支撑桥梁的钢缆所承受的拉力很大。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some of these exercises put too much strain on the back muscles.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些健身动作中有些令背部肌肉负担过重。

Sense.EXAMPLE: These four posts take the strain of the whole structure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这四根柱子承受着整个结构的压力。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rope snapped under the strain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 绳子被拉断了。

Sense.DEF: an injury to a muscle or part of your body that is caused by using it too much
Sense.TRAN: 〔肌肉或人体部位的〕拉伤﹔扭伤﹔劳损
Sense.EXAMPLE: Long hours working at a computer can cause eye strain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 长时间用电脑工作会引起眼睛疲劳。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The goalkeeper is still out of action with a knee strain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 守门员由于膝伤仍无法参加比赛。

Sense.DEF: a type of animal, plant, or disease

GramExa.EXAMPLE: different strains of wheat
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不同品种的小麦
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a new strain of the flu virus
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种新型的流感病毒

Sense.DEF: a particular quality which people have, especially one that is passed from parents to children
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指遗传的〕性格倾向﹐气质﹐性情

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s a strain of madness in his family.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的家族有疯癫的倾向。

Sense.DEF: an amount of a feeling that you can see in the way someone speaks, writes, paints etc
Sense.TRAN: 表达方式﹔口吻﹐语气﹔笔调
Sense.EXAMPLE: a strain of bitterness in Young’s later work
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杨后期作品中怨愤的笔调

Sense.DEF: the sound of music being played
Sense.EXAMPLE: We sipped wine to the strains of Beethoven.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一边听贝多芬的旋律一边抿着葡萄酒。

Sense.DEF: to injure a muscle or part of your body by using it too much or making it work too hard
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve strained a muscle in my leg.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的腿有一处肌肉拉伤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll strain your eyes trying to read in this light.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这样的光线下看书会伤眼睛的。

Sense.DEF: to try very hard to do something using all your strength or ability

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was straining to keep her head above the water.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她竭尽全力将头露出水面。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bill choked and gasped, straining for air.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 比尔噎住了﹐喘着气﹐拼命呼吸着。

GramExa.GLOSS: try very hard to hear or see
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I strained my ears, listening for any sound in the silence of the cave.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我侧耳倾听寂静的山洞里有些什么声音。

Sense.DEF: to separate solid things from a liquid by pouring the mixture through something with very small holes in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: She strained the pasta.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把意大利面滤干水。

Sense.DEF: to cause difficulties for something by making too much work or too many problems which it cannot deal with easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: The increased costs will certainly strain our finances.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开支增加当然会使我们财务紧张。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The incident has strained relations between the two countries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该事件使两国之间的关系紧张起来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt that my patience was being strained to the limit .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感到我的耐心已经到了极限。

Sense.DEF: to pull hard at something or push hard against something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Buddy’s huge gut strained against the buttons on his shirt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴迪的大肚子把衬衫纽扣绷得紧紧的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a dog straining at its lead
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一只使劲拽着牵绳的狗

Sense.DEF: to try as hard as possible to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was straining every nerve to impress the judges.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他竭尽全力给评判员留下好印象。

Sense.DEF: to be eager to be allowed to do something
Sense.TRAN: 急欲获准做某事﹐跃跃欲试
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are 30,000 troops in the area, all straining at the leash.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区有三万名士兵﹐全都在枕戈待旦。

Sense.DEF:
to not work too hard or do too much physical activity – often used in an
ironic
way
Sense.TRAN: 使自己不要过度劳累〔常用于讽刺〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t strain yourself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别把自己累坏了。

Sense.DEF: a strained situation or behaviour is not relaxed, natural, or friendly
Sense.TRAN: 紧张的﹔不自然的﹔不友好的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t stand the strained atmosphere at dinner any more.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我再也忍受不了饭桌上的那种紧张气氛了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the increasingly strained relations between the French and German governments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国政府和德国政府之间日趋紧张的关系

Sense.DEF: showing the effects of worry or too much work
Sense.TRAN: 心力交瘁的﹔焦虑的﹔疲惫的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nina’s voice sounded strained.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼娜的声音听起来很疲惫。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alex’s pale, strained face
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚历克斯苍白而疲惫的脸庞

Sense.DEF: a kitchen tool with lots of small holes in it, that is used for separating solids from liquids
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tea strainer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 滤茶器

Sense.DEF: a narrow passage of water between two areas of land, usually connecting two seas
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Bering Strait
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 白令海峡

Sense.DEF: to be in a very difficult situation, especially a financial one
Sense.TRAN: 陷于极度的困境中〔尤指财务困境〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the war, the country’s economy was in dire straits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战后该国的经济陷入困境。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The firm is now in dire financial straits .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司目前财务状况极度困难。

Sense.DEF: if you are living in straitened circumstances, you do not have enough money, especially not as much as you had before
Sense.EXAMPLE: the straitened circumstances of post-war Japan
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日本战后窘迫的经济状况

Sense.DEF: a special piece of clothing that prevents someone from moving their arms, used to control someone who is being violent or, in the past, someone who was mentally ill
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于束缚行为暴力者或过去束缚精神病人的〕约束衣﹐紧身衣

Sense.DEF: something such as a law or set of ideas that puts very strict or unfair limits on someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: the straitjacket of censorship
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 审查制度的桎梏

Sense.DEF: having strict, old-fashioned ideas about moral behaviour
Sense.TRAN: 〔道德方面〕一本正经的﹔守旧的﹐古板的
Sense.EXAMPLE: straitlaced Victorian society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 维多利亚时代守旧的社会

Sense.DEF: a single thin piece of thread, wire, hair etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He reached out and brushed a strand of hair away from her face.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他伸手拂去她脸上的一缕头发。

Sense.DEF: one of the parts of a story, idea, plan etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Plato draws all the strands of the argument together.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 柏拉图把各个论点归结到一起。

Sense.DEF: a person or vehicle that is stranded is unable to move from the place where they are
Sense.TRAN: 〔人或交通工具〕被滞留的﹔〔船〕搁浅的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Air travellers were left stranded because of icy conditions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机乘客因冰冻天气而滞留。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There I was, stranded in Rome with no money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我当时就那样身无分文地被困在罗马。

Sense.DEF: unusual or surprising, especially in a way that is difficult to explain or understand
Sense.TRAN: 奇怪的﹐不寻常的﹔不可思议的
Sense.EXAMPLE: strange noises
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奇怪的噪声
Sense.EXAMPLE: Does Geoff’s behaviour seem strange to you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你觉得杰夫的行为反常吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt there was something strange about Dexter’s voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得德克斯特的声音有点奇怪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Isn’t it strange how animals seem to sense danger?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 动物似乎能感觉到危险﹐这不是很奇怪吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s strange that we’ve never met before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很奇怪﹐我们以前居然从来没有碰见过。
Sense.EXAMPLE: For some strange reason, I slept like a baby despite the noise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很奇怪﹐不知为什么﹐尽管很吵闹﹐但我仍睡得很香。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Strange as it may seem, I actually prefer cold weather.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听上去也许很奇怪﹐我竟然喜欢冷天。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s strange. I was sure Jude was right here a second ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真奇怪﹐我肯定祖德刚刚还在这儿的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The strange thing is all four victims had red hair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人奇怪的是﹐四名受害者都是红头发的。

GramExa.GLOSS: strangely
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Strange to say, I was just thinking that myself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 说来奇怪﹐我自己刚才也是那么想的。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is strange is not familiar because you have not seen or met them before
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a child, she’d been taught never to speak to strange men.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从小就受到教育绝对不要和陌生男人说话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was just 20, a young girl in a strange city.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只有20岁﹐一个小姑娘待在一座陌生的城市里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was all strange to him, but he’d soon learn his way around.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一切对他来说都很陌生﹐但他很快就会适应的。

Sense.DEF: to feel as if something is slightly wrong or unusual, either physically or emotionally
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you get me a glass of water? I feel a bit strange.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能帮我拿杯水吗？ 我觉得有点不舒服。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It felt strange to be back in Dublin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 重回都柏林﹐我感到有点不自在。

Exponent.DEF: unusual or surprising, especially in a way that is difficult to understand, or that is a little frightening
Exponent.TRAN: 奇怪的,不寻常的,不可思议的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What’s that strange noise downstairs?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 楼下那怪声是怎么回事？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: That’s strange – I’m sure I left my keys on the table.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 真奇怪,我肯定把钥匙放在桌上的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a strange old man
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 奇怪的老汉

Exponent.DEF: a little strange and making you feel slightly surprised or worried
Exponent.TRAN: 古怪的〔令人有点吃惊或担忧的〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There’s a funny smell in the kitchen.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 厨房里有股怪味。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s odd that you can’t remember him at all.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 真奇怪,你竟然一点都不记得他了。

Exponent.DEF: strange, especially in an interesting way. Curious is a little more formal than strange .
Exponent.TRAN: 古怪的〔尤指怪得有趣的﹔curious 比 strange 稍显正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a curious fact
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个奇怪的事实
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There’s something rather curious about small-town America.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国小镇颇有奇趣。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She remembered curious little details.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她记得一些奇怪而有趣的小细节。

Exponent.DEF: strange – used about something that people know little about and are unable to explain or understand
Exponent.TRAN: 神秘的,难以解释[理解]的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He had disappeared in mysterious circumstances.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他神秘失踪了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There were reports of mysterious lights in the sky.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人报告发现空中出现神秘亮光。

Exponent.DEF: strange in a way that seems slightly crazy and amusing – used about people and their behaviour
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He lived completely alone and had some slightly eccentric habits.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一个人生活,还有一些怪癖。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an eccentric old lady
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 古怪的老妇人

Exponent.DEF: slightly strange, and different from what you would normally expect – used especially when this is either amusing or worrying
Exponent.TRAN: 奇怪的,异常的〔尤指令人好笑或担忧的〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She sometimes wears rather peculiar clothes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有时候会穿得很怪。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He had a peculiar expression on his face.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脸上有一种古怪的表情。

Exponent.DEF: very strange or very different from what you are used to
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I had a weird dream last night.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天晚上我做了一个怪梦。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s a weird and wonderful place.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是个古怪而奇妙的地方。

Exponent.DEF: extremely strange and different from what is usually considered normal
Exponent.TRAN: 极为奇怪的,极不寻常的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was a bizarre situation.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那情形太奇怪了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Mark’s behaviour was really bizarre.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克的行为真是奇怪。

Exponent.DEF: extremely strange and unconnected with real life or normal experiences, like something out of a dream
Exponent.TRAN: 超现实的,离奇的,梦幻般的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His paintings are full of surreal images.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的画作中充满了超现实的意象。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There is something surreal about the climate change talks in Bali.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴厘岛气候变化谈判中有些事情匪夷所思。

Exponent.DEF: very strange – used especially about someone having an unusual ability to do something, or looking surprisingly similar to someone
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指某人做某事的超常能力或与他人的相像程度〕离奇的,不可思议的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She had an uncanny knack (=ability) of putting her finger right on a problem.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她竟能一下子指出问题所在,真不可思议。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Alice had an uncanny resemblance to Josie.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾丽斯竟和乔茜这么相像,真奇怪。

Sense.DEF: in a way that is unusual or surprising
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cat’s been acting really strange – I wonder if it’s sick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这只猫行为怪怪的﹐不知道是不是病了。

Sense.DEF: in an unusual or surprising way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mick’s been acting very strangely lately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米克最近的行为相当怪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: strangely shaped hills
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奇形怪状的小山
Sense.EXAMPLE: The crowd fell strangely silent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群奇怪地安静下来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Strangely enough, I wasn’t that disappointed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真奇怪﹐我并没有那么失望。

Sense.DEF: someone that you do not know
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children must not talk to strangers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子千万不要同陌生人说话。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to emphasize that you do not know them
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Julie finds it easy to speak to complete strangers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱莉觉得和素不相识的人讲话不是难事。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not use stranger to mean ‘a person from another country’. Use foreigner or, more politely, say that someone is from abroad/overseas. 不要用 stranger 指外国人﹐而要用 foreigner﹐更为礼貌的说法是 someone is from abroad/overseas。

Sense.DEF: to have had a lot of a particular kind of experience
Sense.TRAN: 有过很多某事的经历﹐对某事并不陌生
Sense.EXAMPLE: a politician who is no stranger to controversy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对争论习以为常的政客

Sense.DEF: someone in a new and unfamiliar place
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Where’s the station?’ ‘Sorry, I’m a stranger here myself.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “车站在哪里？”“对不起﹐我也是外地人。”

Sense.DEF: used to greet someone who you have not seen for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 你好﹐陌生人！ 嗨﹐久违了！〔用于跟好久不见的人打招呼〕

Sense.DEF: used when someone is leaving to invite them back to see you soon
Sense.TRAN: 别一走就杳无音讯！尽快回来聚聚！

Sense.DEF: a prison in Manchester in northwest England, known especially as the place where prisoners took control and did a lot of damage in 1990, as a protest against bad conditions in British prisons
Sense.TRAN: 斯特兰韦斯监狱〔位于英格兰曼彻斯特﹐1990年囚犯为抗议监狱条件恶劣曾发生暴动﹐造成严重毁损〕

Sense.DEF: to kill someone by pressing their throat with your hands, a rope etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The victim had been strangled with a belt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 受害者是被人用皮带勒死的。

Sense.DEF: to limit or prevent the growth or development of something
Sense.TRAN: 限制 [阻止]…的成长[发展]﹔扼杀
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mills argues that high taxation strangles the economy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米尔斯认为高税收会阻碍经济的发展。

Sense.DEF: a cry or other sound that is suddenly stopped before it is finished
Sense.TRAN: 突然止住的喊叫/喘息/说话声等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ed gave a strangled cry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃德刚喊了一声便顿住了。

Sense.DEF: complete control over a situation, organization etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Just a few firms have a stranglehold on the market for this software.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有少数几家公司完全控制着这种软件的市场。

GramExa.GLOSS: stop someone having complete control
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 挣脱某人的完全控制﹐使某人放松束缚

Sense.DEF: a strong hold around someone’s neck that stops them from breathing

if a part of your
bowel
is strangulated, it becomes tightly pressed or twisted so that the flow of blood stops
Sense.EXAMPLE: a strangulated hernia
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绞窄性疝

Sense.DEF: if someone’s voice sounds strangulated, they sound as though their throat is being pressed
Sense.TRAN: 嗓子被扼住似的﹐哽塞的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Clearly terrified, he let out a strangulated whimper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他显然被吓着了﹐发出哽塞的呜咽声。

Sense.DEF: the act of killing someone by pressing on their throat, or the fact of being killed in this way
a narrow band of strong material that is used to fasten, hang, or hold onto something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bra strap
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 胸罩肩带
Sense.EXAMPLE: The strap of my bag is broken.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我包上的带子断了。

Sense.DEF: to fasten something or someone in place with one or more straps

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was only ten when he strapped on a guitar for the first time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他第一次背上吉他时才十岁。

Sense.EXAMPLE: soldiers with grenades strapped to their belts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 腰带上绑着手榴弹的士兵

GramExa.GLOSS: have a belt fastened around you in a car
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are the kids strapped in?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们系好安全带了吗？

Sense.DEF:
to tie
bandage s
firmly round a part of your body that has been hurt
one that does not have straps over the shoulders
Sense.TRAN: 无肩带连衣裙/礼服/胸罩

Sense.DEF: having little or no money at the moment
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you lend me ten dollars? I’m a little strapped for cash.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能借我十美元吗？ 我手头有点紧。

Sense.DEF: a strapping young man or woman is strong, tall, and looks healthy and active
Sense.EXAMPLE: a strapping young lad
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个魁梧的小伙子

Sense.DEF:
the plural of
stratum

a plural form sometimes used instead of
stratum
Sense.TRAN: 有时用来代替stratum的复数形式

Sense.DEF: a trick or plan to deceive an enemy or gain an advantage
Sense.TRAN: 〔蒙蔽敌人或谋取利益的〕计谋﹐策略﹐花招

Sense.DEF: done as part of a plan, especially in a military, business, or political situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: UN forces made a strategic withdrawal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合国部队作了战略性撤退。
Sense.EXAMPLE: strategic planning meetings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战略计划会议
Sense.EXAMPLE: a strategic decision to move production to Hungary
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把生产转至匈牙利的战略决定

Sense.DEF: useful or right for a particular purpose
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某特定目的〕有用的﹐合适的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Marksmen were placed at strategic points along the president’s route.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在总统所经路线的要害地点上安排了神枪手。

Sense.DEF: relating to fighting wars
Sense.TRAN: 战略性的﹐战略上的〔与作战有关〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Marseilles was of great strategic importance .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马赛的战略地位十分重要。

GramExa.GLOSS: weapons designed to reach an enemy country from your own
GramExa.EXAMPLE: strategic nuclear missiles
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 战略核导弹

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Strategically placed video cameras can alert police to any trouble.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 安装在关键位置上的摄像机能在问题出现时提醒警方。

Sense.DEF: someone who is good at planning things, especially military or political actions
Sense.TRAN: 善于策划的人﹔〔尤指军事或政治行动的〕战略家

Sense.DEF: a planned series of actions for achieving something
Sense.TRAN: 〔为实现某目标的〕计谋﹐策略﹔行动计划
Sense.EXAMPLE: the government’s long-term economic strategy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府的长期经济策略
Sense.EXAMPLE: a company’s business strategy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的经营策略

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a strategy for dealing with crime
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对付犯罪的行动计划

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a strategy to attract younger audiences to jazz
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸引年轻观众喜爱爵士乐的策略

Sense.DEF: the skill of planning the movements of armies in a war, or an example of this
Sense.EXAMPLE: military strategies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军事战略
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is the general’s role to develop overall strategy .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 制定整体战略是将军的责任。

Sense.DEF: skilful planning in general
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company must first resolve questions of strategy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司首先必须解决规划问题。

Sense.DEF: when society is divided into separate social classes
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Indian caste system is an example of social stratification .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 印度的种姓制度是社会阶层化的一个例子。

Sense.DEF: the way in which earth, rocks etc form layers over time
having different social classes
Sense.TRAN: 有不同社会等级的﹐分层的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stratified society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等级社会

Sense.DEF: having several layers of earth, rock etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: stratified rock
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成层岩

Sense.DEF: the outer part of the air surrounding the Earth, from 10 to 50 kilometres above the Earth
a very high position, level, or amount
Sense.TRAN: 极高档﹔极高层﹔极高水平﹔极大量
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oil prices soared into the stratosphere .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 石油价格飙升。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s now at the top of the political stratosphere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他现在身处政界高层。

Sense.DEF: relating to the outer part of the air surrounding the Earth
a stratospheric price, amount, level etc is extremely high or great
Sense.TRAN: 极高的﹔极大量的﹔极高水平的
Sense.EXAMPLE: stratospheric house prices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高企的房价

Sense.DEF: a layer of rock or earth
a social class in a society
Sense.EXAMPLE: people of different social strata
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各个社会阶层的人

Subsense.DEF: the dried stems of wheat or similar plants that animals sleep on, and that are used for making things such as baskets, hats etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a straw hat
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 草帽

Subsense.DEF: a single dried stem of straw

Sense.DEF: a thin tube of paper or plastic for sucking up liquid from a bottle or a cup
Sense.EXAMPLE: She sipped her lemonade through a straw.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她用吸管吸着柠檬水。

Variant.LEXVAR: the straw that breaks the camel’s back

Sense.DEF: the last problem in a series of problems that finally makes you give up, get angry etc
Sense.TRAN: 压垮骆驼的最后一根稻草﹐〔一系列问题中〕最终使人无法承受的事﹐终于使人不堪重负的因素
Sense.EXAMPLE: Making me work late on Friday was the last straw.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要我周五加班到很晚终于让我不堪忍受了。

Sense.DEF: to be trying everything you can to succeed, even though the things you are doing are not likely to help or work
Sense.TRAN: 〔在危难中〕抓救命稻草﹐不放过任何微小的机会

Sense.DEF: a sign of what might happen in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: There have been a few straws in the wind suggesting things might be getting a little better.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已经有些迹象表明情况可能会稍稍好转。

Sense.DEF: a weak opponent or imaginary argument that can easily be defeated
Sense.TRAN: 稻草人﹔不堪一击的对手﹔不值一驳的虚妄论点

Sense.DEF: a soft red juicy fruit with small seeds on its surface, or the plant that grows this fruit
someone, especially a girl or woman, with light reddish﹣yellow hair
Sense.TRAN: 头发金色中略带红色的人〔尤指女孩或女人〕

Sense.DEF: light yellow
an informal test of several people’s opinions to see what the general feeling about something is

a
boxer
who weighs less than 47.63 kilograms, and who belongs to the lightest weight class of boxers
Sense.TRAN: 草量级拳击手〔体重低于47.63公斤﹐属于最轻的级别〕

Sense.DEF: to move away from the place you should be

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Three of the soldiers strayed into enemy territory.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 三名士兵误入敌军阵地。

Sense.DEF: to begin to deal with or think about a different subject from the main one, without intending to

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re straying into ethnic issues here.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们现在已偏离主题﹐讨论起种族问题了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: This meeting is beginning to stray from the point .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议开始偏离主题了。

Sense.DEF: if your eyes stray, you begin to look at something else, usually without intending to

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her eyes strayed to the clock.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的目光移到了钟上。

Sense.DEF: to start doing something that is wrong or immoral, when usually you do not do this
Sense.TRAN: 入歧途﹔犯错误﹔犯罪﹔堕落

Sense.DEF: a stray animal, such as a dog or cat, is lost or has no home
accidentally separated from other things of the same kind
Sense.EXAMPLE: One man was hit by a stray bullet and taken to hospital.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名男子遭流弹击中﹐被送往医院。

Sense.DEF: an animal that is lost or has no home
someone or something that has become separated from others of the same kind
Sense.TRAN: 离开同类的人﹔离开原位的东西

Sense.DEF: a coloured line, especially one that is not straight or has been made accidentally
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sue has blonde streaks in her hair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休的头发里夹杂着几缕金发。

Sense.DEF: a part of someone’s character that is different from the rest of their character
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mean streak
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吝啬的个性

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His serious nature was lightened by a streak of mischief.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他严肃的个性中带着一丝顽皮。

Sense.DEF: a period of time during which you continue to be successful or to fail
Sense.TRAN: 〔不断成功或失败的〕一段时期

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Celtic are on a six-game winning streak.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯尔特人队六连胜。

Sense.DEF:
a long straight flash of
lightning
, fire etc
to run or fly somewhere so fast you can hardly be seen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Two jets streaked across the sky.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两架喷气式飞机在空中迅速飞过。

Sense.DEF: to cover something with lines of colour, liquid etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sky was streaked yellow and purple.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天空被染成一条一条的黄色和紫色。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His hands and arms were streaked with paint.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他手上和胳膊上全是一道道的漆印。

Sense.DEF: to run across a public place with no clothes on as a joke or in order to shock people
someone who runs across a public place with no clothes on as a joke or in order to shock people
marked with streaks
Sense.EXAMPLE: streaky grayish marks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一道道浅灰色的痕迹

Sense.DEF: smoked or salted meat from a pig that has lines of fat going through it
a natural flow of water that moves across the land and is narrower than a river
a long and almost continuous series of events, people, objects etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔事件﹑人﹑物等的〕一连串﹐一系列﹐流

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a stream of traffic
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 川流不息的车辆
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a stream of abuse
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一连串的辱骂

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A steady stream of visitors came to the house.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 游客络绎不绝地来参观这所房子。

Sense.DEF: a flow of water, air, smoke etc, or the direction in which it is flowing
Sense.EXAMPLE: A stream of cold air rushed through the open door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一股冷气穿过敞开的门直冲进来。

Sense.DEF: to start working or producing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new factory will come on stream at the end of the year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新工厂将于年底投入使用。

Sense.DEF: a level of ability within a group of students of the same age
Sense.TRAN: 〔同龄学生按能力水平划分的〕班﹐组
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kim’s in the top stream.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 金在最好的班里。

Sense.DEF: to flow quickly and in great amounts

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Water came streaming out of the burst pipe.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 水从爆裂的水管中涌出来。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tears streamed down her cheeks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 泪水顺着她的脸颊流下来。

Sense.DEF: to move in a continuous flow in the same direction

GramExa.EXAMPLE: People streamed past us on all sides.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群从四面八方不断涌过我们身边。

Sense.DEF: to produce a continuous flow of liquid

GramExa.EXAMPLE: When I got up, my face was streaming with blood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我站起来的时候﹐脸上流血不止。

GramExa.GLOSS: an illness in which a lot of liquid comes out of your nose

Sense.DEF: if light streams somewhere, it shines through an opening into a place or onto a surface

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The first rays of morning sunlight streamed through the open doorway.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 早晨的第一缕阳光从敞着的门道照射进来。

Sense.GRAM: I always + adv/prep, usually in progressive
Sense.DEF: to move freely in a current of wind or water
Sense.TRAN: 〔在风或水中〕自由飘动﹐自由流动

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Elise ran, her hair streaming out behind her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃莉斯跑着﹐头发在身后飘动。

Sense.DEF:
if you stream sound or video, you play it on your computer while it is being
download ed
from the Internet, rather than saving it as a
file
and then playing it
Sense.TRAN: 用串流[流式传播]收听[收看]

Sense.DEF: to put school children in groups according to their ability
Sense.TRAN: 将〔学生〕按能力水平分组[分班]

Sense.DEF: a long narrow piece of coloured paper, used for decoration on special occasions
a long narrow flag

when you play sound or video on your computer while it is being broadcast over the Internet, instead of
download ing
it and saving it into a
file
so that you can listen to it or watch it later
sound and video that are sent over the Internet in a continuous way
to make something such as a business, organization etc work more simply and effectively
Sense.TRAN: 精简〔企业﹑组织等〕﹐简化…使效率更高
Sense.EXAMPLE: efforts to streamline the production process
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简化生产过程的努力

Sense.DEF: to form something into a smooth shape, so that it moves easily through the air or water
Sense.EXAMPLE: All these new cars have been streamlined.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有这些新汽车都被设计成流线型。

Sense.DEF: the expression of thoughts and feelings in writing exactly as they pass through your mind, without the usual structure they have in formal writing
a public road in a city or town that has houses, shops etc on one or both sides
Sense.EXAMPLE: We moved to Center Street when I was young.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在我小时候﹐我们搬到了中心大街。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She lives just a few streets away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的住处就在几条街外。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I walked on further down the street .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我继续沿着马路走。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone just moved in across the street .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 街对面有人刚刚搬进来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a car parked on the other side of the street
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 停在街对面的一辆车

Sense.DEF: the busy public parts of a city where there is a lot of activity, excitement, and crime, or where people without homes live
Sense.TRAN: 〔热闹的﹑罪案时有发生的或无家可归者居住的〕街头

GramExa.EXAMPLE: young people living on the streets
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 流落街头的年轻人

Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt quite safe walking the streets after dark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得天黑以后走在街上挺安全的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children as young as five are left to roam the streets walk around the streets at night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在夜里年仅五岁的孩子被任由在街头游荡。

GramExa.GLOSS: ones who play on the street

Sense.EXAMPLE: She has written about the realities of street life living on the streets .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她描写过街头生活的真实景象。

Sense.DEF: the average person, who represents the general opinion about things
Sense.EXAMPLE: The man on the street assumes that all politicians are corrupt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老百姓认为政客都腐败。

Sense.DEF: exactly right for you
much better than someone or something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: James is streets ahead of the rest of the class at reading.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯在阅读方面远远超过班里的其他同学。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: with a lot of traffic or people
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The house faces onto a busy street.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子正对着一条繁忙的街道。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The streets get very crowded at weekends.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 周末街上非常拥挤。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It was late and the streets were quiet.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 很晚了,街上静悄悄的。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: As he walked home, the street was deserted.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他步行回家,街上空无一人。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: an old city with quaint narrow streets
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有许多古色古香小街的老城

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the biggest street in a town or village
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They drove slowly along the main street.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们开车沿着大街缓缓行驶。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: in which you can only drive in one direction
a small quiet street near the main street
streets that turn in many directions
with a surface made from round stones

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She crossed the street and walked into the bank.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她穿过马路,走进银行。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Youths were standing around on street corners.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 几个年轻人站在街角。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It was getting dark, and the street lamps were already on.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 天色渐暗,街灯已经亮起。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when people are attacked in the street

Sense.DEF: a type of bus that runs on electricity along metal tracks in the road
children who live or work on the streets
Sense.TRAN: 流落街头的儿童﹐街头流浪儿

Sense.DEF: the qualities in a young person that other young people admire, especially because of their knowledge and experience of real life
Sense.TRAN: 街头信誉〔尤指因实际生活的知识和经验而受到其他年轻人尊重〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’ll wreck your street cred if you’re seen helping the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你被看到在帮助警察﹐你的街头信誉就完了。

Sense.DEF: a light at the top of a tall post in the street
people who have no home and live on the streets
Sense.TRAN: 无家可归的人﹐露宿街头的人
善于在街头营生的﹔在城市街头混得开的

Sense.DEF: the price for which something, especially drugs, can be sold illegally
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指毒品的〕街头黑市行情[价格]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Detectives seized drugs with a street value of almost £300,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 侦探们查获了黑市价格近30万英镑的毒品。

Sense.DEF:
a
prostitute
able to deal with the dangerous situations and people that are common in some cities and towns
Sense.TRAN: 善于在街头营生的﹔在城市街头混得开的

Sense.DEF: the physical power and energy that makes someone strong

GramExa.PROPFORM: have/find the strength to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She didn’t even have the strength to stand up.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她甚至连站起来的力气都没有了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m trying to build up my strength .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在努力增强体力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jo hit him with all her strength .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔用尽全力打他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He never ceased to be amazed by her physical strength .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直对她的体力感到惊诧。

Sense.DEF: the quality of being brave or determined in dealing with difficult or unpleasant situations

GramExa.PROPFORM: have/find the strength to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jenny didn’t have the strength to end the relationship.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮没有勇气结束这段关系。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She had enormous strength of character strong ability to deal with difficult situations .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她意志很坚强。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sea was very cold and it required great strength of mind to get in.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 海水很冷﹐需要有很大的勇气才能下去。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I think you have to find an inner strength in order to feel good about yourself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得只有找到内心的力量才能有自信。

Sense.DEF: how strong a feeling, belief, or relationship is

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Governments cannot ignore the strength of public opinion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府不能忽视公众舆论的力量。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We understand the strength of feeling against the proposal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们知道对该建议有强烈的反对情绪。

Sense.DEF: the political, military, or economic power of an organization, country, or system

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the strength of the US economy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国的经济实力

Sense.EXAMPLE: The socialists organized a show of strength when a country or organization shows how strong it is .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会主义者组织了一场实力展示。

Sense.DEF: a particular quality or ability that gives someone or something an advantage
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her main strength is her critical thinking ability.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的最大长处在于她具有批判性思考的能力。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The great strength of our plan lies in its simplicity.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们这个计划的最大长处在于它简单易行。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Be aware of your own strengths and weaknesses .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要清楚你自己的长处和短处。

Sense.DEF: how strong an object or structure is, especially its ability to last for a long time without breaking

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a device for testing the strength of concrete structures
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 测试混凝土结构强度的设备

Sense.DEF: how strong a substance or mixture is
Sense.EXAMPLE: Add water to dilute the solution to the required strength.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在溶液中加水稀释至规定浓度。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Young plants can be fed with half-strength liquid fertilizer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 幼株可以施一半浓度的液体肥料。

Sense.DEF: the number of people in a team, army etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔球队﹑军队等的〕人力﹐人数﹔兵力
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Edinburgh team are now at full strength .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱丁堡队现在是最佳阵容。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police force is below strength at the moment there are fewer police than there should be .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前警力不足。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Security forces were out in strength in large numbers but did not intervene.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 安全部队大量出动﹐但没有进行干预。

Sense.DEF: the value of a country’s money when compared to other countries’ money

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the strength of the dollar on the international money markets
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美元在国际货币市场上的坚挺程度

Sense.DEF: because of something
Sense.TRAN: 基于某事物﹔受某事物的鼓励
Sense.EXAMPLE: I bought the book on the strength of your recommendation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于你的推荐﹐我才买了这本书。

Sense.DEF: a position where you have an advantage over someone, especially in a discussion
Sense.EXAMPLE: We must negotiate from a position of strength.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须从一个优势地位来进行谈判。

Sense.DEF: to become more and more successful
Sense.TRAN: 不断取得成功﹔日益壮大
Sense.EXAMPLE: For several years, the business went from strength to strength.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几年来﹐该企业日益壮大。

Sense.DEF: how strong a natural force is
Sense.EXAMPLE: the strength of the sunlight
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日光的强度

Sense.DEF: how strong a colour, taste etc is
used when you are annoyed or angry about something
Sense.TRAN: 给我力量吧﹐真叫人受不了 〔用于表示烦恼或生气〕

Sense.DEF: to not realize how strong you are
Sense.TRAN: 没有意识到自己的力量

Sense.DEF: to become stronger or make something stronger
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our friendship has steadily strengthened over the years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的友谊逐年加深。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Steve’s opposition only strengthened her resolve to go ahead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 史蒂夫的反对反而坚定了她继续下去的决心。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The university hopes to strengthen its ties with the local community.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所大学希望加强和当地社区的联系。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The company plans to strengthen its hand make itself more powerful in Europe by opening an office in Spain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司计划在西班牙设立办事处﹐以此增强在欧洲的实力。

Sense.DEF: to make an organi-zation, army etc more powerful, especially by increasing the number or quality of the people in it
Sense.TRAN: 增强〔某组织﹑军队等〕的实力
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team has been strengthened by the arrival of two new players.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球队因为两名新球员的到来而增强了实力。

Sense.DEF: if the financial situation of a country or company strengthens or is strengthened, it improves or is made to improve
Sense.EXAMPLE: measures to strengthen the economy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 改善经济的措施

Sense.DEF: to increase in value, or to increase the value of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pound has strengthened against other cur-rencies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英镑对其他货币的比值有所上升。

Sense.DEF: to make something such as your body or a building stronger
Sense.EXAMPLE: Metal supports were added to strengthen the outer walls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加装了金属支架以加固外墙。

Sense.DEF: to help prove something
Sense.TRAN: 为…提供更有力的理由[证据]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fresh evidence has greatly strengthened the case against him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的证据使对他不利的论据变得更加充分。

Sense.DEF: to increase in force
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wind had strengthened during the night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜里风力加大了。

Sense.DEF: needing a lot of effort or strength
Sense.EXAMPLE: a strenuous climb
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艰难的攀登
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctor advised Ken to avoid strenuous exercise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生建议肯避免剧烈运动。

Sense.DEF: active and determined
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sherry’s been making a strenuous effort to lose weight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢里在努力减肥。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Barrett strenuously denied rumors that he would resign.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴雷特竭力否认他要辞职的传言。

Sense.DEF: an illness in which your throat is very painful
Sense.TRAN: 链球菌性咽喉炎﹐脓毒性咽喉炎

Sense.DEF:
bacteria
that cause infections, especially in the throat
continuous feelings of worry about your work or personal life, that prevent you from relaxing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your headaches are due to stress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的头痛是压力造成的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Janet’s been under a lot of stress since her mother’s illness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮特自从母亲生病以来承受了很大的压力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: all the stresses of public life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公众生活的所有压力
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of illnesses are stress-related.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多疾病与压力有关。

Sense.DEF: the physical force or pressure on an object
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shoes with high heels put a great deal of stress on knees and ankles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高跟鞋对膝盖和脚踝产生很大的压力。

Sense.DEF: the special attention or importance given to a particular idea, fact, or activity

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pugh laid particular stress on the need for discipline.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮尤特别强调了纪律的必要性。

Sense.DEF: the degree of force or loudness with which a part of a word is pronounced or a note in music is played, which makes it sound stronger than other parts or notes
Sense.TRAN: 重音﹐重读﹔〔音乐中的〕加强（音）

Collocate.EXAMPLE: If you are suffering from stress, you may be more likely to become ill.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你有压力,就更有可能得病。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Moving house often causes stress.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 搬家常会造成压力。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: People find different ways of dealing with stress.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们找到各种不同方法来应对压力。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 巨大的/相当大的/极大的
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Staff experienced considerable stress as a result of the changes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 变革导致员工承受相当大的压力。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It was a time of great emotional stress for me.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那段时间我的情绪压力非常大。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She’s been under a lot of stress lately.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 近来她承受着很大压力。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Balancing work and family is the main cause of stress for many people.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 保持工作与家庭的平衡是给许多人造成压力的主要原因。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Exercise reduces stress levels.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 锻炼能减轻压力。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a lot of different worries that are caused by something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: the stresses and strains of everyday life
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 日常生活的压力和紧张

Sense.DEF: to emphasize a statement, fact, or idea

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The report stressed that student math skills need to improve.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告着重指出学生的数学能力需要提高。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Crawford stressed the need for more housing downtown.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克劳福德强调市中心需要建更多的住宅。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She stressed the importance of a balanced diet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她强调了均衡饮食的重要性。

Sense.DEF: to pronounce a word or part of a word so that it sounds louder or more forceful
Sense.EXAMPLE: The word ‘machine’ is stressed on the second syllable. machine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个单词第二个音节重读。

Sense.DEF: to make someone so worried or nervous that they cannot relax
Sense.TRAN: 使极度焦虑﹐使非常紧张﹐使压力大
Sense.EXAMPLE: Studying for exams always stresses me out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 复习迎考总是使我非常焦虑。

Sense.DEF: so worried and tired that you cannot relax
Sense.TRAN: 焦虑的﹐紧张的﹐无法放松的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I always eat when I’m feeling stressed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我总是一紧张就吃东西。

Sense.DEF: an object, especially a metal object, that is stressed has had a lot of pressure or force put on it
Sense.TRAN: 〔物体﹐尤指金属物〕受重压的﹐受应力的

Sense.DEF: a job, experience, or situation that is stressful makes you worry a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: Moving to a new house is a very stressful experience.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 搬新家是件很劳心的事。

Sense.DEF: a mark (') that shows which part of a word you emphasize when you pronounce it

Subsense.DEF: to make something bigger or looser by pulling it, or to become bigger or looser as a result of being pulled
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A spider’s web can stretch considerably without weakening.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蜘蛛网能拉得相当长而韧性不减。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Where can I buy those things that stretch your shoes?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在哪儿能买到把鞋撑大的东西？

Subsense.DEF: if a material stretches, it can become bigger or longer when you pull it and then return to its original shape when you stop

Sense.DEF: to straighten your arms, legs, or body to full length
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carl sat up in bed, yawned, and stretched.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡尔从床上坐起来﹐打了个呵欠﹐伸了伸懒 腰。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Always stretch before exercising.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 锻炼之前都要做伸展运动。

Sense.DEF: to reach a long way for something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ann stretched across the couch and grabbed the phone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 安向长沙发那头探过身﹐抓起电话。

Sense.DEF: to pull something so that it is tight
Sense.EXAMPLE: The canvas is stretched over a wooden frame.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 画布紧绷在木框上。

Sense.DEF: to continue over a period of time or in a series, or to make something do this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Berg’s career as a government official stretched over 20 years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伯格的政府官员生涯延续了二十多年。

Sense.EXAMPLE: With a goal in the second half, Spurs stretched their lead to 3-0.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下半场进了一球后﹐热刺队把领先的优势扩大到三比零。

Sense.DEF: to spread out or cover a large area of land

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Row after row of orange trees stretched to the horizon.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一排又一排的橙树一直绵延到地平线。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a line stretching around the block
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 排起来绕过街区的一列队伍

Sense.DEF: to go for a walk, especially after sitting for a long time
to be almost beyond the limits of what someone can accept or believe
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kids stretch my patience to the limit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们把我的耐心耗尽了。

Sense.DEF: to allow something that would not normally be allowed by a rule or limit
Sense.EXAMPLE: This once, I’ll stretch the rules and let you leave work early.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就这一次我破例让你早点下班。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll stretch a point allow a rule to be broken and let the baby travel free this time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们这次破例让这个婴儿免费乘坐。

Sense.DEF: to say or write something that is not completely true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Reporters sometimes stretch the facts to make a point.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 记者为了说明问题﹐有时会夸大事实。

Sense.DEF: to make something seem more important, bigger etc than it really is
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a good player, but ‘world class’ is stretching it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是一位优秀的选手﹐但要说是“世界级的”就有点夸张了。

Sense.DEF: if you make an amount of money, food etc stretch or it stretches, you use less of it than you usually would so that you have it for a longer time
Sense.TRAN: 省着用〔有限的钱或物〕以延长使用时间
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m going to have to stretch this $20 until payday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得省着点用﹐让这 20 美元用到发工资那天。

Sense.DEF: to have hardly enough money, supplies, time etc for your needs
Sense.TRAN: 手头拮据﹔供应紧张﹔时间不足
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re stretched at the moment, otherwise we’d go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们目前手头紧﹐否则会去的。

Sense.DEF: if someone’s money will not stretch to something, they cannot afford it
Sense.TRAN: 〔钱〕不够买某物﹐不够支付某物的费用
Sense.EXAMPLE: The budget won’t stretch to a new car this year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年预算不够﹐买不了新车。

Sense.DEF: to make someone use all of their skill, abilities, or intelligence
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某人〕施展才华﹐使充分发挥能力
Sense.EXAMPLE: The work’s too easy. The students aren’t being stretched enough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作业太简单﹐没有让学生充分发挥能力。

Sense.DEF: to lie down, usually in order to sleep or rest
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m just going to stretch out on the couch for ten minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就在长沙发上躺十分钟。

Sense.DEF: to put out your hand, foot etc in order to reach something
