Sense.EXAMPLE: Jimmy stretched out his hand to take the candy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉米伸手去拿糖果。

Sense.DEF: an area of land or water, especially one that is long and narrow
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指狭长的〕一片地域﹐一片水域

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a beautiful stretch of countryside
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一片美丽的乡村

Sense.DEF: a continuous period of time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a stretch of three weeks without sunshine
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一连三个星期没有阳光

Sense.EXAMPLE: She doesn’t leave the house for long stretches of time .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不会长时间离开这房子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She rarely sleeps for eight hours at a stretch without stopping .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很少连续睡八小时。

Sense.DEF: the action of stretching a part of your body out to its full length, or a particular way of doing this
Sense.TRAN: 〔肢体的〕伸展﹐伸开﹐张开﹔伸展动作
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ski instructor showed us some special stretches.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 滑雪教练给我们示范了几个特别的伸展动作。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that a negative statement is true
Sense.TRAN: 无论怎样想象都（不）﹐再怎么说也（不）〔用于强调某个否定说法是真的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: My family wasn’t wealthy by any stretch of the imagination.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我家再怎么说也算不上富裕。

Subsense.DEF: the last part of a track before the end of a race
the last part of an activity, trip, or process
Subsense.TRAN: 〔活动﹑旅程或进程的〕最后一部分
Subsense.EXAMPLE: As they enter the home stretch of the campaign, the president’s lead has grown.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 竞选活动将近尾声时﹐总统的领先优势扩大了。

Sense.DEF: the ability a material has to increase in length or width without tearing

Subsense.DEF: using everything that is available
Subsense.EXAMPLE: With staff shortages and appalling weather conditions, the emergency services were at full stretch.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人员短缺﹐加之天气恶劣﹐应急服务机构在尽全力应付。

Subsense.DEF: with your body or part of your body stretched as far as possible
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He dived and caught the ball at full stretch.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一个鱼跃伸手把球接住。

Sense.DEF: a period of time spent in prison
stretch clothes or material stretch if you pull them, and then return to their original shape
Sense.EXAMPLE: stretch Levis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 李维斯弹性牛仔裤

Sense.DEF: a type of bed used for carrying someone who is too injured or ill to walk
to carry someone on a stretcher

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ward was stretchered off early in the game.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛开始不久﹐沃德就被人用担架抬下场。

Sense.DEF: someone, usually a soldier, who carries one end of a stretcher
Sense.TRAN: 抬担架的人〔一般为士兵〕

Sense.DEF: a very large comfortable car that has been made longer than usual
Sense.TRAN: 加长豪华轿车﹐特大豪华轿车

Sense.DEF:
a mark left on your skin as a result of it stretching too much, especially during
pregnancy
material that is stretchy can stretch when you pull it and then return to its original shape
Sense.EXAMPLE: stretchy cotton leggings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女式棉质弹性紧身裤

Sense.DEF: to scatter things around a large area

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The street was strewn with broken glass.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 街上满是碎玻璃。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: clothes strewn across the floor
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 散落在地板上的衣服

Sense.DEF: containing a lot of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: conversation liberally strewn with swear words
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 满是脏话的交谈

Sense.DEF: to lie scattered over something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Flowers strewed the path.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 落花铺满小径。

Sense.DEF: used to express surprise, annoyance etc
Sense.TRAN: 哎呀﹐天哪〔表示惊讶﹑恼怒等〕

Sense.DEF: having narrow lines or bands of colour
very badly affected by trouble, illness, unhappiness etc
Sense.TRAN: 受灾的﹔患病的﹔受困扰的﹔受苦的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fire broke out on the stricken ship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失事船只起火了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a country stricken by severe economic problems
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 受到严重经济问题困扰的国家

GramExa.EXAMPLE: drought-stricken farmers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 深受干旱困扰的农场主

Sense.DEF: expecting people to obey rules or to do what you say
Sense.EXAMPLE: a strict teacher
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 严格的老师

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This company is very strict about punctuality.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司严格要求守时。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Stuarts are very strict with their children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯图尔特夫妇待子女很严。

Sense.DEF: a strict order or rule is one that must be obeyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: You had strict instructions not to tell anybody.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得到过严格指示﹐不得告诉任何人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are strict limits on presidential campaign contributions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于总统竞选活动捐款是有严格限制的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s under strict orders from his doctor to quit smoking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生严令他戒烟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m telling you this in the strictest confidence it must be kept completely secret .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我告诉你这事﹐你要严加保密。

Sense.DEF: exact and correct, often in a way that seems unreasonable
Sense.EXAMPLE: Amy was attractive, although not beautiful in the strictest sense of the word .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃米很迷人﹐虽然严格来说她并不漂亮。

Sense.DEF: obeying all the rules of a religion or set of principles
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was raised a strict Catholic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被培养成一名严守教规的天主教徒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a strict vegetarian
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纯粹的素食主义者

Exponent.DEF: expecting people to obey rules or to do what you say – used especially about parents, teachers, or organizations
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指父母﹑教师或团体〕严格的,严厉的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Our teachers were very strict.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们老师非常严格。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Most schools are quite strict about the way students dress.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数学校对学生的着装要求十分严格。

Exponent.DEF: showing that you are in control of the situation and will not change your opinion, especially when you are telling someone what to do
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You have to be firm with young children.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 对小孩子一定要态度坚决。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ll be firm with him and tell him he can’t have any more money.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要坚决地告诉他不会再给他钱了。

Exponent.DEF: determined that your orders or decisions will be obeyed, especially in order to make sure that a situation improves – used especially when you think that someone is right to be strict
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤为了改善某事而合理地〕严厉的,强硬的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We need a government that is tough on crime.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要一个严厉打击犯罪的政府。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She can be quite tough with her students, but they respect her for it.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对学生很严厉,但学生反而因此而尊敬她。

Exponent.DEF: strict in a serious, disapproving, and rather unfriendly way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her grandfather was a stern man who rarely smiled.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她祖父是个严厉﹑不苟言笑的人。

Exponent.DEF: punishing or criticizing someone in a way that seems very severe, often too severe
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Don’t be too harsh on her – she’s only a child.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 别对她太苛刻了——她还只是个孩子。

Exponent.DEF: very strict about forcing people to obey rules or laws, and punishing them very severely if they fail to do this – used about people and governments
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her father was very authoritarian and insisted on total obedience.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她父亲非常专制,要求绝对服从。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an authoritarian government
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 独裁政府

Sense.DEF: in a way that must be obeyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alcohol is strictly forbidden on school premises.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 校内严禁喝酒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ban on hunting is not strictly enforced .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狩猎禁令并未严格执行。

Sense.DEF: exactly and completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: That isn’t strictly true.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那并不完全正确。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is true if you are going to be very exact and correct about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Strictly speaking, spiders are not insects.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 严格地说﹐蜘蛛不是昆虫。

Sense.DEF: only for a particular person, thing, or purpose and no one else
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is strictly between us. Nobody else must know.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 此事仅限于你我之间﹐不得告诉其他任何人。

Sense.DEF: a rule that strictly limits what you can do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: religious strictures on marriage
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对婚姻的宗教约束

Sense.DEF: a severe criticism
a long step you make while you are walking
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paco reached the door in only three strides.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕科三大步就走到了门口。

Sense.DEF: an improvement in a situation or in the development of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government has made great strides in reducing poverty.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府在减少贫困方面已经取得巨大进展。

Sense.DEF: to not allow something to annoy, embarrass, or upset you
Sense.EXAMPLE: When the boss asked Judy to stay late, she took it in stride.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老板要求朱迪留到很晚﹐朱迪也坦然接受。

Sense.DEF: to start doing something confidently and well
Sense.TRAN: 〔做某工作〕开始上轨道﹐驾轻就熟
Sense.EXAMPLE: Once I get into my stride, I can finish an essay in a few hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一旦进入状态﹐几个小时就能完成一篇文章。

Sense.DEF: the way you walk or run
Sense.EXAMPLE: the runner’s long, loping stride
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跑步者轻快的大步

Subsense.DEF: to begin moving more slowly or to stop when you are running or walking
if you break your stride, or if someone or something breaks it, you are prevented from continuing in what you are doing
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Collins dealt with the reporters’ questions without breaking stride .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 柯林斯从容应付记者的提问。

Sense.DEF: to make someone unable to do something effectively, by not allowing them to give all their attention to it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shea’s testimony threw the defense off stride.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢伊的证词使辩护律师乱了阵脚。

Sense.DEF: to manage to be just as fast, strong, skilled etc as someone else, even if they keep making it harder for you
Sense.TRAN: （设法与某人）并驾齐驱﹔尽量不落后 （于某人）

Sense.DEF: to walk quickly with long steps

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He strode toward her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他大步向她走去。

Sense.DEF: forceful and determined, especially in a way that is offensive or annoying
Sense.TRAN: 强烈的﹔坚定的﹔咄咄逼人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: strident criticism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猛烈的抨击

Sense.DEF: a strident sound or voice is loud and unpleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: the strident calls of seagulls
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海鸥尖厉的叫声

Sense.DEF: trouble between two or more people or groups
Sense.TRAN: 〔两个或两个以上的人或团体之间的〕冲突﹐纠纷﹐争斗

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a time of political strife
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治纷争四起的时代

Sense.DEF: to hit or fall against the surface of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She fell heavily, striking her head against the side of the boat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她重重地摔倒﹐头撞在船舷上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A snowball struck him on the back of the head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个雪球打中他的后脑勺。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several cars were struck by falling trees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几辆车被倒下的树砸中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The last rays of the setting sun struck the windows.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 落日的最后一缕阳光照在窗户上。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say hit rather than strike .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们通常说 hit ,而不说 strike
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I hit my head on the shelf.
He was hit by a rock.

Sense.DEF: to deliberately hit someone or something with your hand or a weapon
Sense.EXAMPLE: She struck him hard across the face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她重重打了他一记耳光。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The victim had been struck with some kind of wooden implement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 受害人遭到某种木器的击打。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul struck him a blow to the head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗在他头上一击。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The assassin’s bullet struck home hit exactly where it should .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暗杀者的子弹正中目标。

Sense.DEF: if something strikes you, you think of it, notice it, or realize that it is important, interesting, true etc
Sense.TRAN: 突然出现〔在脑子里〕﹐突然被意识到[想到]
Sense.EXAMPLE: A rather worrying thought struck me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我脑子里突然出现一个颇令我担忧的想法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The first thing that struck me was the fact that there were no other women present.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我首先意识到没有其他女性到场。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It struck her that losing the company might be the least of her worries.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她突然意识到失去公司或许是她最不用担心的一件事。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can’t help being struck by her kindness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你禁不住要为她的善良而感动。

Sense.DEF: to seem to have a particular quality or feature
Sense.EXAMPLE: His jokes didn’t strike Jack as being very funny.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的笑话并没让杰克觉得很好笑。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it strikes sb as strange/odd etc that
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It struck me as odd that the man didn’t introduce himself before he spoke.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感到很奇怪﹐那个男人在讲话之前竟然不作自我介绍。

Sense.DEF: if a group of workers strike, they stop working as a protest against something relating to their work, for example how much they are paid, bad working conditions etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: In many countries, the police are forbidden to strike.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在很多国家﹐警察是禁止罢工的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’re striking for the right to have their trade union recognized in law.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正在罢工争取让他们的工会在法律上得到承认。

Sense.DEF: to attack someone, especially suddenly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The killer might strike again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凶手可能会再次作案。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Guerrillas struck a UN camp, killing 75.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游击队突袭了一个联合国难民营﹐造成75人死亡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Opponents of the war say that civilian villages have been struck several times.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反战人士说平民村庄屡遭袭击。

Sense.DEF: to damage or harm someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The law would strike at the most basic of civil rights.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项法令会侵犯最基本的公民权利。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Such prejudices strike right at the heart of any notions of a civilized society.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样的偏见直接伤及文明社会理念的核心。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The scandal seemed to have struck a mortal blow to the government’s chances of re-election.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这桩丑闻似乎已给政府连任的希望造成致命的打击。

Sense.DEF: if something bad strikes, it suddenly happens or suddenly begins to affect someone
Sense.TRAN: 突然发生〔某种不幸〕﹔突然对（某人）有坏的影响
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plague struck again for the third time that century.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瘟疫再次爆发﹐是那个世纪的第三次了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everything seemed to be going fine when suddenly disaster struck .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一切看起来都很正常﹐但这时灾难突然发生了。

Sense.DEF: to give the correct amount of importance or attention to two separate things
Sense.TRAN: 在…之间达到平衡﹐两者兼顾
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was finding it difficult to strike a balance between his family and his work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他觉得家庭和工作两者很难兼顾。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It isn’t always easy to strike the right balance .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做到两者兼顾并非总是很容易。

Sense.DEF: to agree to do something for someone if they do something for you
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are rumors that the president struck a private deal with the corporation’s chairman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有传言称总裁和公司董事长已经私下里达成协议。

Sense.DEF: to express a particular feeling or attitude
Sense.TRAN: 表达出高兴/振奋/谨慎等的感情[态度]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The article struck a conciliatory note.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那篇文章表达了和解的姿态。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Moderate Republicanism appeared to strike exactly the right note with the voters be what the people wanted .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 温和的共和党政纲似乎正好符合选民的心意。

Sense.DEF: to say or do something that other people agree with or have sympathy with

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their story is bound to strike a chord with all parents.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的故事一定会引起所有父母的共鸣。

Sense.DEF: to produce a flame from a match by rubbing it hard across a rough surface
to find a supply of gold, oil etc in the ground or under the sea
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指经过挖掘〕找到黄金/石油等
Sense.EXAMPLE: If they strike oil, drilling will begin early next year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果他们找到石油﹐明年年初就要开始钻井。

Sense.DEF: to do something that makes you a lot of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jackie eventually struck gold with her third novel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰姬终于靠她的第三本小说发了大财。

Sense.DEF:
if
lightning
strikes something, it hits and damages it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The temple burned down after it was struck by lightning last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那座庙宇去年遭雷击后烧毁了。

Sense.DEF: to do something to help achieve a principle or aim
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s time we struck a blow for women’s rights.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们该起来维护妇女权利了。

Subsense.DEF: to be close enough to reach a place easily
Subsense.EXAMPLE: By now, they were within striking distance of the shore.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在他们离海岸很近了。

Subsense.DEF: to be very close to achieving something
Subsense.TRAN: 非常靠近 〔某物〕﹔即将实现〔某目标〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The French team are within striking distance of the world record.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国队离世界纪录只有咫尺之遥。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly make a lot of money
to be very lucky, especially when you were not expecting to
Sense.EXAMPLE: We struck it lucky in Bangkok, where we were told there were some extra seats on the plane that night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在曼谷运气很好﹐他们告诉我们当晚飞机上还有一些座位。

Sense.DEF: if a clock strikes one, two, six etc, its bell makes a sound once, twice, six times etc according to what time it is
Sense.EXAMPLE: The church clock began to strike twelve.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 教堂的钟开始敲响12点。

GramExa.GLOSS: strike when it is exactly one o’clock, two o’clock etc

Sense.DEF: to do something that gives you an advantage over your opponent in a fight, competition etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brazil struck first with a goal in the third minute.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴西队第三分钟先射入一球取得先机。

Sense.DEF: if something that you say strikes home, it has exactly the effect on someone that you intended
Sense.EXAMPLE: She saw the emotion in her father’s face and knew her words had struck home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看到父亲脸上的表情﹐就知道她的话奏效了。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel very frightened
Sense.EXAMPLE: The word ‘cancer’ still strikes terror into many hearts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “癌症”一词仍然使很多人心生恐惧。

Sense.DEF: to stand or sit with your body in a particular position
Sense.TRAN: 以某种姿势站[坐]﹔摆姿势
Sense.EXAMPLE: Malcolm struck his usual pose: hands in pockets, shoulders hunched.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马尔科姆摆出惯常的姿势: 双手插在口袋里﹐耸起双肩。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly be unable to talk, usually because you are very surprised or shocked
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常因为吃惊或震惊而〕说不出话来

Sense.DEF: to suddenly feel very afraid, shocked etc
Sense.TRAN: 突然感到惊恐/恐惧/敬畏等
Sense.EXAMPLE: As she began to speak to him, she was struck with shyness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她开口和他说话时﹐感到十分害羞。

Sense.LEXUNIT: strike while the iron is hot
Sense.DEF: to do something immediately rather than waiting until a later time when you are less likely to succeed
Sense.TRAN: 趁热打铁﹐把握时机行事

Sense.DEF: to kill someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: May God strike me dead if I’m telling a lie!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我在说谎﹐上帝让我不得好死！

Sense.DEF: to attack or criticize someone who attacked or criticized you first
Sense.EXAMPLE: We instruct our staff never to strike back, however angry they feel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们教育员工﹐不论多生气都不要回击。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The prime minister immediately struck back at his critics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 首相立即对他的批评者进行反击。

Sense.DEF: to kill someone or make them extremely ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: Over 50 nurses at the clinic have been struck down with a mystery virus.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诊所里五十多名护士因感染一种神秘的病毒而病倒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They would rob the bodies of those struck down in battle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们会偷盗阵亡者身上的财物。

Sense.DEF: to hit someone so hard that they fall down
to say that a law, decision etc is illegal and officially end it
Sense.TRAN: 〔宣称某法规﹑决定等为非法而〕废除﹐取消

Sense.DEF: if a doctor, lawyer etc is struck off, their name is removed from the official list of people who are allowed to work as doctors, lawyers etc
to remove someone or something from a list
Sense.EXAMPLE: Terri was told to strike off the names of every person older than 30.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特里被告知把全部30岁以上者的名字删去。

Sense.DEF: to discover something or have a good idea about something
to attack or criticize someone suddenly or violently

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Unhappy young people will often strike out at the people closest to them.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻人心里不高兴就往往会攻击身边最亲近的人。

Sense.DEF: to draw a line through something written on a piece of paper
to start walking or swimming in a particular direction, especially in a determined way
Sense.EXAMPLE: She struck out for the side of the pool.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她奋力朝池边游去。

Sense.DEF: to start doing something or living independently
Sense.TRAN: 开始独立做某事﹔开始独立生活

Sense.DEF: to not hit the ball in baseball three times, so that you are not allowed to continue trying, or to make someone do this
Sense.TRAN: 〔棒球〕（使）三振出局﹐三击不中出局

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He struck out the first batter he faced.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他直接使自己遇到的第一个击球手三振出局。

Sense.DEF: to not be successful at something
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Did she say she’d go out with you?’ ‘No, I struck out.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “她说愿意跟你约会吗？”“没有﹐我碰了钉子。”

Sense.DEF: to say officially that something cannot be considered as proof in a court of law
Sense.TRAN: 宣布某事物不能成为证据

Sense.DEF: to start to become friendly with someone, to start talking to them, etc
Sense.TRAN: 建立友谊/建立关系/交谈起来等
Sense.EXAMPLE: I struck up a conversation with the girl sitting next to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和坐在旁边的女孩交谈起来。

Sense.DEF: to begin playing a piece of music
Sense.EXAMPLE: The band struck up a tango.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乐队奏起一支探戈舞曲。

Sense.DEF: a period of time when a group of workers deliberately stop working because of a disagreement about pay, working conditions etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government has promised that the army will be called in to help if there is a firemen’s strike.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府承诺﹐如消防员罢工﹐就将调军队来协助。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a six-week strike by railway workers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 铁路工人为期六周的罢工

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a strike over pay cuts
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为减薪引起的罢工

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a national strike against mine closures
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 反对矿场关闭的全国大罢工

Sense.DEF: a military attack, especially by planes dropping bombs

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a surprise air strike on military targets
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对军事目标的突然空袭

Sense.EXAMPLE: American aircraft carriers have launched several strikes .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国的航空母舰发动了数次袭击。

Sense.DEF: the discovery of something valuable under the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: an oil strike
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 石油的发现

Sense.DEF: a condition or situation that makes it extremely difficult for someone or something to be successful
Sense.TRAN: 某人/某事处于十分不利的地位﹔某人/某事很难获得成功
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children from poor backgrounds have two strikes against them by the time they begin school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贫困家庭的孩子在入学时便处于劣势。

Sense.DEF:
an attempt to hit the ball in baseball that fails, or a ball that is thrown to the
batter
in the correct area but is not hit

a situation in
bowling
in which you knock down all the
pin s bottle-shaped objects
with a ball on your first attempt

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Teachers are on strike again this week.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 本周教师再次罢课。

Collocate.COLLOC: go on strike/come out on strike
Collocate.EXAMPLE: An estimated 70,000 public sector workers went on strike.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 约有七万名公营部门工作人员举行罢工。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Dock workers began a 24-hour strike last night.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚码头工人开始了24小时罢工。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The union threatened to call a strike.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会威胁要号召工人罢工。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Health workers will stage a two-day strike next week.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 下周医护人员将组织为期两天的罢工。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: decide not to continue with it

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 为期一天的/两周等的罢工
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A three-day strike is planned for next week.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 计划下周举行为期三天的罢工。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Workers at the processing plant have begun an indefinite strike.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 加工厂工人开始无限期罢工。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when workers from most industries strike
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They threatened to call a general strike.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们威胁要发动大罢工。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 铁路/煤矿/邮政等工人罢工
矿工罢工/教师罢课/飞行员罢飞等

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not organized by a trade union
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 非正式罢工,非工会支持的罢工

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Hospital workers have voted in favour of strike action.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 医院职工投票赞成罢工。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when a group asks people to strike
when workers vote on whether to strike

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘go on a strike’. Say 而要说 go on strike .

Sense.DEF: someone who continues working during a strike – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 破坏罢工者﹐工贼〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF:
in baseball, an occasion when the
batter
is not allowed to try to hit the ball any more, because he has three strikes
Sense.TRAN: 〔棒球比赛中击球手〕三振出局﹐三击不中出局

Sense.DEF:
money paid by a union to workers who are on
strike
Sense.TRAN: 〔工会在罢工期间发给工人的〕罢工津贴

Sense.DEF:
someone who is not working because they are on
strike

a player in football whose main job is to score
goal s
unusual or interesting enough to be easily noticed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a striking contrast between wealth and poverty
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 显著的贫富差异

Sense.DEF: attractive in an unusual way that is easy to notice
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dark man with striking features
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 相貌出众﹑肤色黝黑的男子

Sense.DEF:
not working because of being on
strike
Sense.EXAMPLE: striking auto workers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正在罢工的汽车工人

Sense.DEF: in a way that is very easy to notice

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The two experiments produced strikingly different results.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个实验得出截然不同的结果。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that someone or something is beautiful in a way that is easy to notice
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of the most strikingly attractive regions in Britain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国风景异常美丽的地区之一

Sense.DEF: a strong thread made of several threads twisted together, used for tying or fastening things
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her key hung on a string around her neck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的钥匙穿了根绳子挂在脖子上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ball of string
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一团细绳
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need a piece of string to tie this package.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要一根绳子来捆这个包裹。

Subsense.DEF: a number of similar things or events coming one after another

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a string of hit albums
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一系列热门专辑

Subsense.DEF: a group of similar things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She owns a string of health clubs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拥有多家健身俱乐部。

Subsense.DEF: a group of letters, words, or numbers, especially in a computer program
Subsense.TRAN: 〔尤指计算机程序中的〕字符串

Sense.DEF: having no special conditions or limits on an agreement, relationship etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔协议﹑关系等〕无附带条件的﹐无任何限制的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The policy offers 15% interest, with no strings attached.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份保单提供 15% 的利息﹐没有任何附带条件。

Sense.DEF: several objects of the same type connected with a thread, chain etc

Subsense.DEF:
one of the long thin pieces of wire,
nylon
etc that are stretched across a musical instrument and produce sound

the people in an
orchestra
or band who play musical instruments that have strings, such as
violin s
Subsense.TRAN: 〔管弦乐团或乐队的〕弦乐器部﹐弦乐器组

Sense.DEF: relating to or being a member of a team or group with the highest, second highest etc level of skill
Sense.TRAN: 最高水平的/次高水平的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: a first-string quarterback
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个一流的四分卫

Sense.DEF: to be able to make someone do whatever you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: Susie has her mother on a string.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏茜竟能任意支使她的妈妈。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have more than one string to your bow
Sense.DEF: to have more than one skill, idea, plan etc that you can use if you need to

Crossrefto.REFLEX: how long is a piece of string?

Sense.DEF: to put things together onto a thread, chain etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: beads strung on a silver chain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 穿在银链上的珠子

Sense.DEF: to hang things in a line, usually high in the air, especially for decoration

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Christmas lights were strung from one end of Main Street to the other.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 梅因街从这头到那头都悬挂着圣诞节彩灯。

Sense.DEF: to be spread out in a line
Sense.EXAMPLE: The houses and shops were strung out along the bay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 住宅和店铺沿海湾排成一行。

Sense.DEF: to put a string or a set of strings onto a musical instrument
to deceive someone for a long time by making them believe that you will help them, that you love them etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s just stringing you along.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只是哄哄你而已。

Sense.DEF: to go somewhere with someone for a short time, especially because you do not have anything else to do
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因没有别的事情干而〕跟随﹐暂与〔某人〕结伴

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you’re going into town, I’ll string along with you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你要进城﹐我就跟你去。

Sense.DEF: to make something continue longer than it should
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rebel leaders attempted to string out negotiations to avoid reaching a settlement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叛军首领企图拖延谈判﹐避免达成协议。

Sense.DEF: to manage to say or write something that other people can understand
Sense.TRAN: 说出[写出]让人听懂的话/句子
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was so drunk he could hardly string two words together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他醉得几乎说话都不成句了。

Sense.DEF: to combine things in order to make something that is complete, good, useful etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: They string together image after image until the documentary is completed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把画面一幅一幅拼接起来﹐直到做成完整的纪录片。

Sense.DEF: to kill someone by hanging them
a type of long thin green bean

a musical instrument such as a
violin
, that produces sound from a set of
string s

PIC.HEADING: STRINGED INSTRUMENTS 弦乐器
PIC.PICCONTENT: violin 小提琴；viola 中提琴；cello 大提琴；double bass 低音提琴；lute 琉特琴；mandolin 曼陀林；banjo 班卓琴；harp 竖琴；guitar 吉他；balalaika 巴拉莱卡琴

Sense.DEF: a stringent law, rule, standard etc is very strict and must be obeyed
Sense.TRAN: 〔法律﹑规章﹑标准等〕严格的﹐严厉的
Sense.EXAMPLE: stringent anti-noise regulations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 严格的防噪音条例

Sense.DEF: stringent economic conditions exist when there is a severe lack of money and strict controls on the supply of money
someone who regularly sends in news stories to a newspaper, but who is not employed by that newspaper
Sense.EXAMPLE: He worked as a stringer for ‘The New York Times’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他担任《纽约时报》特约记者。

Sense.DEF: a thick string worn around your neck and held in place by a decorative object, worn especially by men in the western US
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤为美国西部男士戴的〕狭领结[带]﹐绳领带

Sense.DEF: stringy meat, fruit, or vegetables are full of long thin pieces that are difficult to eat
Sense.TRAN: 〔肉﹑水果或蔬菜〕纤维多的﹔有筋的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Scoop out the pumpkin’s stringy fibres.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用勺子把南瓜里的筋挖出来。

Sense.DEF: stringy hair is very thin and looks like string, especially because it is dirty
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指毛发因脏而〕细长而稀疏的﹐呈一缕缕的

Sense.DEF: tall and thin

Subsense.DEF: to take off your clothes or take off someone else’s clothes
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Jack stripped and jumped into the shower.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克脱掉衣服﹐冲进淋浴间。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The prisoner was stripped and beaten.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯人被剥光衣服暴打。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He stripped off his sweater and threw it onto the couch.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脱掉毛衣﹐扔到长沙发上。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Eric stood in the hot sun, stripped to the waist not wearing any clothes on the top half of his body .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃里克赤裸着上身站在炽热的骄阳下。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Terry stripped down to her bra and pants removed all her clothes except her bra and pants and tried on the dress.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特里脱得只剩下胸罩和内裤﹐然后试穿连衣裙。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The boys stripped naked and jumped in the pond.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男孩子们脱得精光﹐跳进池塘里。

Subsense.DEF: to take off your clothes in a sexually exciting way as entertainment for someone else

Sense.DEF: to remove something that is covering the surface of something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Strip the beds and wash the sheets.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把床单撤下来清洗。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We need to strip the wallpaper off the walls first.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得先把墙纸铲掉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: tall windows stripped of curtains
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卸掉窗帘的高大窗户

Sense.DEF: to separate an engine or piece of equipment into pieces in order to clean or repair it
Sense.TRAN: 拆卸〔引擎或设备以进行清洁或检修〕

Sense.DEF: to remove everything that is inside a building, all the equipment from a car etc so that it is completely empty
Sense.TRAN: 搬走〔建筑物﹑汽车等中〕的所有东西﹐将…搬空
Sense.EXAMPLE: The apartment had been stripped bare .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公寓已被搬空。

Sense.DEF:
to damage or break the
gear s
of something or the
thread raised line
on a screw so that it does not work correctly any more
Sense.TRAN: 损坏…的齿轮﹔磨损〔螺钉〕的螺纹

Sense.DEF: to remove something, especially something that hides or protects someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: His book aims to strip away the lies and show the world as it really is.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的书旨在揭露谎言﹐展示一个真实的世界。

Sense.DEF: to take away something important from someone as a punishment, for example their title, property, or power
Sense.EXAMPLE: Captain Evans was found guilty and stripped of his rank.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上尉埃文斯被判有罪﹐被剥夺了军衔。

Sense.DEF: a long narrow piece of paper, cloth etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a strip of paper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张纸条

Sense.DEF: a long narrow area of land
Sense.EXAMPLE: a strip of sand between the cliffs and the sea
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 悬崖和大海之间的一块狭长沙地

Sense.DEF: to take your clothes off, especially in a sexually exciting way as a form of entertainment
a road with a lot of shops, restaurants etc along it
Sense.TRAN: 〔沿途有许多商店﹑餐馆等的〕商业街
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Las Vegas strip
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉斯维加斯商业街

Sense.DEF: the clothes worn by a sports team
Sense.EXAMPLE: Liverpool’s famous red strip
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利物浦队著名的红色队服

Sense.DEF:
a
strip cartoon
a series of drawings inside a row of small boxes that tells a short story
a place where people go to see performers who take off their clothes in a sexually exciting way
a line of colour, especially one of several lines of colour all close together
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shirt with black and white stripes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑白条纹衬衫

Sense.DEF: of all different types
Sense.EXAMPLE: Politicians of all stripes complained about the plan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各个派别的政客都抱怨这项计划。

Sense.DEF: a narrow piece of material worn on the arm of a uniform as a sign of rank
Sense.TRAN: 〔制服袖子上表示级别的〕臂章

Sense.DEF: having lines or bands of colour
Sense.EXAMPLE: a blue and white striped shirt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蓝白条纹的衬衫

Sense.DEF:
another spelling of
stripy

a
strip club

an electric light that consists of a long white
fluorescent
tube

lighting provided by long white
fluorescent
tubes
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常在公共建筑中的〕荧光灯管照明

Sense.DEF: a boy who is almost a young man – sometimes used humorously about a man who is quite old
Sense.TRAN: 青年男子﹐小伙子〔有时幽默地指年龄相当大的人〕

Sense.DEF: a row of shops built together, with a large area for parking cars in front of it
Sense.TRAN: 〔门前有停车场的〕小型购物中心

Sense.DEF: a very large hole that is made in the ground to remove metal, coal etc from the earth
someone whose job is to take off their clothes in a sexually exciting way in order to entertain people
a tool or liquid chemical used to remove something from a surface
Sense.TRAN: 剥离表面物的器具﹔清除表层物的液体
Sense.EXAMPLE: paint stripper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除漆剂

Sense.DEF:
a game of
poker card game
in which players that lose must take off pieces of their clothing
Sense.TRAN: “剥猪猡”扑克牌戏〔输者被罚脱去衣服〕

Sense.DEF: a process in which you have to remove your clothes so that your body can be checked, usually for hidden drugs
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常为寻找隐藏的毒品而进行的〕裸身搜查

Sense.DEF: a form of entertainment where people take off their clothes in a sexually exciting way
a performance in which someone takes off their clothes in a sexually exciting way

Sense.EXAMPLE: He was wearing jeans and a stripy T-shirt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他穿着牛仔裤和条纹T恤衫。

Sense.DEF: to make a great effort to achieve something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was still striving to be successful.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我仍在努力争取成功。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We must continue to strive for greater efficiency.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须继续为提高效率而努力。

Sense.DEF: a light that flashes on and off very quickly, often used in places where you can dance
Sense.TRAN: 〔常用于跳舞场所的〕频闪闪光灯

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
stride

if someone has a stroke, an
artery tube carrying blood
in their brain suddenly bursts or becomes blocked, so that they may die or be unable to use some muscles
Sense.EXAMPLE: She died following a massive stroke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她重度中风后去世了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I looked after my father after he had a stroke.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父亲中风后由我照看他。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a stroke patient
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中风患者

Subsense.DEF:
one of a set of movements in swimming or rowing in which you move your arms or the
oar
forward and then back
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She swam with strong steady strokes.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她游泳时的划水动作平稳有力。

Subsense.DEF: a style of swimming or rowing
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the breast stroke
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛙泳

Sense.DEF:
the action of hitting the ball in games such as tennis,
golf
, and
cricket
Sense.TRAN: 〔网球﹑高尔夫球﹑板球等的〕击球﹔一击﹐一抽
Sense.EXAMPLE: a backhand stroke
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一记反手击球

Subsense.DEF: a single movement of a pen or brush when you are writing or painting
Subsense.TRAN: 〔书写或绘画时的〕一挥﹐挥笔动作
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A few strokes of her pen brought out his features clearly.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她寥寥数笔就清晰地勾画出了他的容貌特征。

Subsense.DEF: a line made by a pen or brush
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the thick downward strokes of the characters
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些字向下的粗笔画

Sense.DEF: with a single sudden action
Sense.EXAMPLE: At one stroke, the country lost two outstanding leaders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家一下子失去了两位杰出的领导人。

Sense.LEXUNIT: on the stroke of seven/nine etc
Sense.DEF: at exactly seven o’clock etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: She arrived home on the stroke of midnight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她午夜 12 点整才到家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The only goal of the match came on the stroke of half time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛中唯一一次进球是在上半场正好结束的时候。

Sense.DEF: something lucky that happens to you unexpectedly
Sense.EXAMPLE: In a stroke of luck, a suitable organ donor became available.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正巧﹐有了合适的器官捐献者。

Sense.DEF: a very good idea about what to do to solve a problem
Sense.TRAN: 聪明之举/巧妙的主意等
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a stroke of genius to film the movie in Toronto.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在多伦多拍摄这部影片真是高明之举。

Sense.DEF: an action of hitting someone with something such as a whip or thin stick
Sense.EXAMPLE: He cried out at each stroke of the whip.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鞭子每抽一下﹐他就大叫一声。

Sense.DEF: a gentle movement of your hand over something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I gave her hair a gentle stroke .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我轻轻地抚摸了一下她的头发。

Sense.LEXUNIT: with/at a stroke of the pen
Sense.DEF: if someone in authority does something with a stroke of the pen, they sign an official document to make a decision with important and serious results
Sense.TRAN: 大笔一挥〔签署重要文件〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had the power to order troops home with a stroke of his pen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有权力大笔一挥就让军队回家。

Sense.DEF: to not do any work at all
a bright flash of lightning, especially one that hits something

a single sound made by a clock giving the hours, or by a bell,
gong
etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔时钟﹑铃﹑锣等报时的〕一次鸣响﹐敲击声

Sense.DEF: to make someone stop giving all their attention to what they are doing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Seeing Frank watching me put me off my stroke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发现弗兰克在看我﹐我分神了。

Sense.DEF: used when you are saying a number written with the mark (/) in it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The serial number is seventeen stroke one 17/1 .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 序列号是 17/1。

Sense.DEF: to move your hand gently over something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He reached out and stroked her cheek tenderly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他伸出手﹐温柔地抚摸她的脸颊。

Sense.DEF: to move something somewhere with gentle movements of your hand
Sense.EXAMPLE: He lifted her face and stroked her hair from her eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他抬起她的脸﹐轻轻拂去她眼睛上的头发。

Sense.DEF:
to hit or kick a ball with a smooth movement in games such as tennis, golf, and
cricket
Sense.TRAN: 〔网球﹑高尔夫球﹑板球等中〕轻触﹐轻击
Sense.EXAMPLE: He stroked the ball into an empty net, with a minute to go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还剩一分钟时﹐他把球轻轻击入空网。

Sense.DEF: to say nice things to someone to make them feel good, especially because you want something from them
Sense.TRAN: 拍某人马屁﹐对某人阿谀奉承

Sense.DEF: to walk somewhere in a slow relaxed way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were strolling along, laughing and joking.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有说有笑﹐信步走着。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: They went for a stroll in the park.

Sense.DEF: a small chair on wheels, in which a small child sits and is pushed along
someone who is strolling
Sense.EXAMPLE: evening strollers on the promenade
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 傍晚在滨海大道散步的人

Sense.DEF: a strolling entertainer travels around the country giving performances in different places
a strolling musician plays music while walking among people who are listening to them

Sense.SIGNPOST: ABLE TO LIFT HEAVY THINGS/DO HARD WORK
Sense.DEF: having a lot of physical power so that you can lift heavy things, do hard physical work etc
Sense.TRAN: 强健的﹐健壮的﹐力气大的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a big strong man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他高大健壮。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jack was tall and strong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克又高又壮。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He picked her up in his big strong arms.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用粗壮的双臂将她抱起来。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not strong enough to fight him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和他打我还不够强壮。

Sense.DEF: not easily broken or damaged
Sense.TRAN: 坚固的﹐结实的﹐不易损坏的
Sense.EXAMPLE: good strong shoes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 结实的好鞋子
Sense.EXAMPLE: The locks on the doors were solid and strong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门上的锁都很坚固结实。

Sense.DEF: determined and able to deal with a difficult or upsetting situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not strong enough to take insults and hatred.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不够坚强﹐承受不了侮辱和仇恨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Laura had a strong character.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳拉个性坚强。

Sense.DEF: having a lot of power or influence
Sense.TRAN: 强大的﹐强有力的﹐影响力大的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Fifth French Republic was established with a strong president in 1958.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法兰西第五共和国成立于1958年﹐其总统权力很大。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a strong national army
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 强大的国家军队
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our party is the strongest as we come up to the election.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们党在参选时实力最强。

Sense.DEF: strong emotions, opinions, beliefs etc are ones that you feel or believe a lot and are very serious about
Sense.TRAN: 〔感情﹑观点﹑信仰等〕强烈的﹐坚定的﹐不会动摇的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a strong sense of responsibility to his vocation of preaching.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对自己的布道使命有强烈的责任感。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There has been strong support for the strike.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次罢工得到了强有力的支持。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The proposal has met with strong opposition from local people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 提议遭到当地民众的强烈反对。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many people have strong feelings about the issue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多人在这个问题上都反应强烈。

Sense.DEF: a strong desire, influence etc affects you very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a strong desire for power.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有很强的权力欲。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Such feelings may have a strong influence over your decisions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种情感可能对你的决定有很大影响。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The temptation is very strong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诱惑很大。

Sense.DEF: a strong relationship, friendship etc is very loyal and likely to last a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: He maintained strong links with the world of the deaf.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他与聋人圈子保持着紧密的联系。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She still has a strong relationship with her mother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和母亲的关系依旧十分密切。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have a strong commitment to the quality of teaching.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对教学质量抱有强烈的责任心。

Sense.DEF: likely to persuade other people that something is true or the correct thing to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is a strong case for an energy conservation programme.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 制订能源节约计划是有充分理由的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They need strong evidence to secure a conviction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们需要有力的证据才能定罪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a strong argument
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 强有力的论据

Sense.DEF: likely to succeed or happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a strong candidate for the party leadership.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是一个强有力的党魁候选人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A year ago, there was a strong possibility that he wouldn’t live.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一年前﹐他大有可能活不成了。

Sense.DEF: healthy, especially after you have been ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t think her heart is very strong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为她的心脏不太好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve been blessed with a strong constitution you are healthy and do not easily become ill .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你幸福地拥有强健的体格。

Sense.DEF: to be in a situation where you have power over other people or are likely to get what you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company have gained a strong position in the cheese market.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司在奶酪市场上占据了优势地位。

Sense.DEF: wind, water etc that moves with great force
Sense.EXAMPLE: A strong wind was blowing across the lake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵强风刮过湖面。

Sense.DEF: very good at something
Sense.EXAMPLE: His writing was strong on description.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的作品以描写见长。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We beat a team that was much stronger than ourselves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们打败了一支远比我们强大的球队。

GramExa.GLOSS: the thing that someone is especially good at
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tact never was my strong point.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 讲究策略从来不是我所擅长的。

Sense.DEF: having a taste or smell that you notice easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: strong coffee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浓咖啡
Sense.EXAMPLE: This cheese has a very strong flavour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这奶酪味道很浓。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a strong smell of petrol
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浓烈的汽油味

Sense.DEF: having a lot of a substance, such as alcohol, that gives something its effect
Sense.EXAMPLE: extra strong beer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特浓啤酒
Sense.EXAMPLE: strong painkillers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 强效止痛药
Sense.EXAMPLE: I haven’t touched strong drink alcoholic drinks for years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很多年没碰烈性酒了。

Sense.DEF: bright and easy to see
Sense.EXAMPLE: The light was not very strong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 光线不是很强。

Sense.DEF: speech or writing that contains a lot of swearing
Sense.EXAMPLE: This film is not suitable for children under 12 as it contains strong language.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影里有脏话﹐不适合 12 岁以下的儿童观看。

Sense.DEF: the way that someone pronounces words that shows clearly that they come from a particular area or country
Sense.EXAMPLE: a strong German accent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浓重的德国口音

Sense.DEF: a nose etc that is large and noticeable, especially in an attractive way
Sense.TRAN: 轮廓分明的鼻子/下巴/容貌
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has the same strong features as her mother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和她母亲一样﹐有一张轮廓分明的面孔。

Sense.DEF:
a strong
currency the type of money used in a country
does not easily lose its value compared with other currencies
used to give the number of people in a crowd or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: the company’s 2,200 strong workforce
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的 2,200 名员工
Sense.EXAMPLE: The crowd was 10,000 strong.

Sense.DEF: to continue to be active or successful, even after a long time
Sense.TRAN: 〔长时间后〕仍然强壮﹔继续保持成功
Sense.EXAMPLE: He celebrated his ninetieth birthday this month, and he’s still going strong .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他这个月刚刚庆祝过90岁生日﹐身体仍然很硬朗。

Section.SECHEADING: HAVING A STRONG BODY 体格健壮的

Exponent.DEF: having a lot of physical strength
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It took four strong men to lift the piano.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 四个壮汉才把那架钢琴抬起来。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You open it – you’re stronger than I am.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你来打开它——你力气比我大。

Exponent.DEF: very strong – used about someone’s body, arms, muscles etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔身体﹑手臂﹑肌肉等〕强健的,结实的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: his big powerful shoulders
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那宽阔有力的肩膀
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was a tall man with a powerful physique.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他身材高大﹑体格健壮。

Exponent.DEF: having big muscles and looking strong
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She liked men who were big and muscular.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她喜欢身材魁梧﹑肌肉发达的男人。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He had a firm muscular body.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一身结实的肌肉。

Exponent.DEF: a well-built man is strong and tall and has a big body
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Police say the man they are looking for is 36 years old, 6 feet tall, and well-built.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方称他们正在寻找的男子36岁,身高6英尺,体格健壮。

Exponent.DEF: strong and attractive
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She married hunky Hollywood star Brad Pitt.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她嫁给了好莱坞性感男星布拉德·皮特。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He looks hunky, but he’s not really my type.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他健壮英俊,但实在不是我喜欢的类型。

Section.SECHEADING: NOT EASILY BROKEN OR DAMAGED 不易破碎或损坏的

Exponent.DEF: not easily broken or damaged
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The bags are made of strong black plastic.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些袋子用结实的黑色塑料制成。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We need a strong rope for this job.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 干这活得有一根结实的绳子。

Exponent.DEF: strong – used especially about something that can be used a lot without damaging it or making it weaker
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a pair of tough leather boots
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一双结实耐穿的皮靴
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Kitchen floors need to be tough enough to withstand heavy use.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 厨房地面必须非常坚固耐用,再怎么用也不会坏。

Exponent.DEF: extremely strong – used about materials, tools, machines etc that are made especially to be used a lot without being easily damaged
Exponent.TRAN: 〔材料﹑工具﹑机器等〕经久耐用的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: heavy-duty rubber gloves
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 耐用的橡胶手套
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a heavy-duty carpet for the hallway
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 铺在门厅的耐磨地毯

Exponent.DEF: strong and often thick, and not likely to fall over or get broken
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a fence made with sturdy wooden posts
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 用牢固的木桩扎成的篱笆
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The furniture is simple but sturdy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些家具简单而结实。

Exponent.DEF: extremely strong and impossible to break
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Babies need to have unbreakable dishes and cups.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 婴儿要用打不碎的杯盘。

Exponent.DEF: impossible to break, damage, or destroy, and lasting forever
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Gold is virtually indestructible.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 黄金几乎是不会损坏的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The pyramids were built as indestructible tombs for the Pharaohs.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 金字塔是为法老而建的坚不可摧的陵墓。

Exponent.DEF: used about materials and products that will remain in good condition for a long time – often used on product labels
Exponent.TRAN: 经久耐用的〔常用于产品标签〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The jacket has a durable nylon lining.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件夹克的尼龙衬里十分耐穿。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Varnish is more durable than paint.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 清漆比涂料更耐久。

Exponent.DEF: strongly made – used especially about the structure of something, for example a vehicle or machine
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a mountain bike with a robust frame
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 车架坚固的山地自行车

Sense.DEF: the use of force or violence, especially when this is not necessary
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指不必要的〕暴力策略/手段等

Sense.DEF: a box, usually made of metal, that can be locked and that valuable things are kept in
an area where there is a lot of support for a particular way of life, political party etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔某一生活方式﹑政党等〕备受支持的地方﹔据点﹐大本营
Sense.EXAMPLE: The area is a Republican stronghold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个地区是共和党的大本营。

Sense.DEF: an area that is strongly defended by a military group
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fighters moved south to their mountain stronghold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战士们向南行进﹐到达他们在山上的据点。

Sense.DEF: an area where there are large numbers of a rare animal
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of the last strongholds of the European wolf
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲狼最后的主要栖息地之一

Sense.DEF: if you feel or believe in something strongly, you are very sure and serious about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m strongly opposed to capital punishment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我坚决反对死刑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We strongly believe that she is innocent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们坚信她是无辜的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m strongly in favour of marriage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我强烈支持婚姻。

Sense.DEF: in a way that is meant to persuade someone to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Before taking action, you are strongly recommended to consult an accountant.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在采取行动之前﹐强烈建议你咨询一下会计师。

Sense.DEF: in a way that is easy to notice
Sense.TRAN: 浓重地﹔强烈地〔指容易感觉到〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house smelt strongly of food.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子里满是食物的气味。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘hold/grip something strongly’. Use 而要用 firmly or 或 tightly: He gripped my arm tightly. 他紧紧地抓住我的胳膊。

Sense.DEF: a politician or leader who uses violence or threats to get what they want

a very strong man who performs in a
circus
not easily influenced by other people to change what you believe or want
Sense.TRAN: 意志坚强的﹐果断的﹐坚定的
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were both strong-minded women.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她们两个都是意志坚强的女人。

Sense.DEF: a special room in a bank, shop etc where valuable objects can be kept safely
Sense.TRAN: 〔银行﹑商店等贮藏贵重物品的〕保险库

Sense.DEF: knowing exactly what you want to do and being determined to achieve it, even if other people advise you against it
Sense.TRAN: 意志坚强的﹔坚持己见的

Sense.DEF:
a soft silver-white metal that is used to make
firework s
. It is a chemical
element : symbol Sr
Sense.TRAN: 锶〔一种化学元素﹐符号为 Sr〕

Sense.DEF:
a narrow piece of leather used for making a
razor
sharp
annoyed about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a nice person but she just gets in a strop so easily.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她人很好﹐但是太容易生气。

Sense.DEF: bad-tempered and easily offended or annoyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: I try not to get stroppy, but sometimes I just can’t help it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我尽量不让自己生气﹐但有时就是忍不住。

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
strive

the past tense and past participle of
strike
Sense.TRAN: strike 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF: to think that someone or something is very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: She seemed rather struck on Vincent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她似乎对文森特印象很好。

Sense.DEF: connected with the structure of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: structural changes in the computer industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电脑行业的结构性改变
Sense.EXAMPLE: The earthquake caused minor structural damage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次地震造成了轻微的结构破坏。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Is the building structurally sound in good condition ?
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这栋建筑物的结构状况还好吗？

Sense.DEF: an engineer skilled in planning the building of large structures such as bridges
Sense.TRAN: 〔设计桥梁等大型建筑的〕结构工程师

Sense.DEF: a method of studying language, literature, society etc in which you examine the relationships of the different parts or ideas in order to determine their meaning
Sense.TRAN: 结构主义〔指语言学﹑文学﹑社会学等学科中通过分析不同部分或观点之间的关系以确定其含义的研究方法〕

Sense.DEF: the way in which the parts of something are connected with each other and form a whole, or the thing that these parts make up

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the social structure of organizations
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 组织的社会结构

Sense.EXAMPLE: challenges to the existing power structure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对现有权力结构的挑战
Sense.EXAMPLE: A new management structure has been introduced.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已推行一种新的管理结构。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the structure of the brain
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大脑的结构

Sense.EXAMPLE: molecular structures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 分子结构

Sense.DEF: something that has been built, especially something large such as a building or a bridge
Sense.EXAMPLE: a high wooden structure with a curved roof
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带拱顶的高大木结构建筑物

Sense.DEF: a situation where activities are carefully organized and planned
Sense.EXAMPLE: These kids require a lot of structure and stability.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些孩子需要有序和稳定的生活。

Sense.DEF: to arrange the different parts of something into a pattern or system in which each part is connected to the others
Sense.EXAMPLE: The exhibition is structured around three topics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 展览是围绕三个主题精心安排的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: software that helps users structure their work and their data
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可以帮助用户整理文件和数据的软件

Sense.DEF: carefully organized, planned, or arranged
Sense.TRAN: 有组织的﹔有条理的﹔精心安排的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The interviews were highly structured .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 采访安排得很有条理。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a structured approach to teaching
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 周密的教学方法

Sense.DEF:
a type of Austrian or German cake, made of
pastry
with fruit inside
Sense.TRAN: 果馅卷〔奥地利或德国的一种糕点〕

Sense.DEF: to try extremely hard to achieve something, even though it is very difficult

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s struggling to bring up a family alone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她独自一人艰难地养活一家人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The airline is struggling with high costs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 航空公司在努力应付高成本。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Millions of people are struggling for survival.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 千千万万的人在挣扎求生。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Firms are struggling against a prolonged recession.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 各公司在经济长期衰退的情况下苦苦挣扎。

Subsense.DEF: to fight someone who is attacking you or holding you, especially so that you can escape

GramExa.EXAMPLE: James was hit in the mouth as he struggled with the burglars.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯在和入室盗贼搏斗时嘴部被击 中。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She struggled to free herself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她极力想挣脱开去。

Subsense.DEF: if two people struggle, they fight each other for something, especially something one of them is holding

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They struggled for possession of the gun.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们拼命争抢那把枪。

Sense.DEF: to move somewhere with great difficulty

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Walkers were struggling up the dusty track.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 行人在满是尘土的小径上艰难行走。

Sense.DEF: to be likely to fail, even though you are trying very hard
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team has been struggling all season.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个赛季球队都打得很艰难。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 挣扎求生的艺术家/作家/公司

Sense.DEF: to continue doing something that you find very difficult or tiring
Sense.EXAMPLE: He struggled on despite his condition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管处于这样的状况﹐他仍然努力坚持下去。

Sense.DEF: a long hard fight to get freedom, political rights etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔为争取自由﹑政治权利等而进行的〕斗争﹐奋斗

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a struggle for survival
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为生存而奋斗

Sense.EXAMPLE: a power struggle between forces favoring and opposing change
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赞成改革和反对改革的两股势力之间的权力斗争

Sense.DEF: a long period of time in which you try to deal with a difficult problem

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She spoke of her struggles with shyness.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她谈到了自己是如何努力克服羞怯的。

Sense.DEF: a fight between two people for something, or an attempt by one person to escape from the other
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police said there were no signs of a struggle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方说没有搏斗的迹象。

Sense.DEF: if something is a struggle, you find it very difficult to do
Sense.TRAN: （对某人而言）是困难[费劲]的事

Sense.DEF:
to play an instrument such as a
guitar
by moving your fingers up and down across its strings
Sense.TRAN: 弹奏﹐拨弄〔吉他等弦乐器〕

Sense.DEF: an insulting word meaning a woman who has sex for money

the past tense and past participle of
string
Sense.TRAN: string 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF: strongly affected by a drug, so that you cannot react normally

GramExa.EXAMPLE: strung-out on drugs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸了毒神志恍惚

Sense.DEF: extremely tired and worried
Sense.TRAN: 精疲力竭的﹔极其焦虑的

Sense.DEF: very nervous, worried, or excited
to walk proudly with your head high and your chest pushed forwards, showing that you think you are important
Sense.TRAN: 趾高气扬地走﹐架子十足地走

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I strutted around Chicago as if I were really somebody.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在芝加哥街头昂首阔步﹐好像自己真是个人物似的。

Sense.DEF: to show your skill at doing something, especially dancing or performing
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤在跳舞或表演方面〕展示自己的本领
Sense.EXAMPLE: The band strutted their stuff in a free concert.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那支乐队在一场免费音乐会上一显身手。

Sense.DEF: a long thin piece of metal or wood used to support a part of a building, the wing of an aircraft etc
a proud way of walking, with your head high and your chest pushed forwards
Sense.TRAN: 趾高气扬的步态﹐昂首阔步的样子

Sense.DEF: a very poisonous substance sometimes used in small amounts as a medicine
Sense.TRAN: 士的宁﹐马钱子碱〔有剧毒﹐微量可作药用〕

Sense.DEF:
an imaginary British private school for girls in humorous
cartoon
stories of the 1950s and later in a number of humorous films. The girls are very badly behaved and the teachers cannot control them, and they have many amusing and exciting adventures, often involving illegal activities.
schoolgirl s
who behave badly are sometimes compared to the girls of St Trinian’s.
Sense.TRAN: 乌龙女校〔20世纪50年代英国卡通故事及其后多部幽默电影中的女子学校﹔行为顽劣的女生常被比作乌龙女校的学生〕

Sense.DEF: the short part of something long and thin, such as a cigarette or pencil, that is left when the rest has been used
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pencil stub
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铅笔头

Sense.DEF: the part of a ticket that is given back to you after it has been torn, as proof that you have paid
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ticket stub
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 票根

Sense.DEF: a piece of a cheque left in a cheque book as a record after the main part has been torn out
Sense.EXAMPLE: a check stub
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 支票存根

Sense.DEF: to hurt your toe by hitting it against something
to stop a cigarette from burning by pressing the end of it against something

short stiff hairs that grow on a man’s face if he does not
shave
short stiff pieces left in the fields after wheat, corn etc has been cut
Sense.TRAN: 〔作物收割后遗留在地里的〕残茎﹐茬 （子）

Sense.DEF: determined not to change your mind, even when people think you are being unreasonable
Sense.TRAN: 固执的﹐顽固的﹐执拗的﹔倔强的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why are you so stubborn?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么这么固执？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got a very stubborn streak a tendency to be stubborn .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的个性很固执。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul can be as stubborn as a mule very stubborn .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保尔有时倔得像头驴。

Sense.DEF: a very strong and determined refusal etc
Sense.TRAN: 顽强的抵抗/固执的拒绝/难以改变的决心等
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stubborn refusal to face reality
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拒不愿意面对现实

Sense.DEF: difficult to remove, deal with, or use
Sense.TRAN: 难以去除[对付﹐使用]的﹐顽固的
Sense.EXAMPLE: stubborn stains
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 顽固的污渍

Sense.DEF: short and thick or fat
Sense.EXAMPLE: stubby fingers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 又短又粗的手指

Sense.DEF:
a type of
plaster
that is used especially to cover the outside walls of buildings

the past tense and past participle of
stick
Sense.TRAN: stick 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF: impossible or unable to move from a particular position
Sense.TRAN: 卡住的﹐无法移动的﹐动不了的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sara tried to open the window but it was stuck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉想打开窗户﹐但窗户卡住了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They got stuck in a traffic jam.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们遇到了交通堵塞。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The boat was stuck in the mud.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 船陷在泥里了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve got something stuck in my throat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的喉咙里卡了什么东西。

Sense.DEF: unable to escape from a bad or boring situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mum resented being stuck at home with two young kids.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈讨厌整天困在家里照看两个幼小的孩子。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We could be stuck in this place for days.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可能会被困在这个地方好几天。

Sense.DEF: unable to do any more of something that you are working on because it is too difficult
Sense.TRAN: 被难倒的﹐难住的﹔没法进行下去的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you help me with my homework, Dad? I’m stuck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸﹐你能辅导我做一下家庭作业吗？ 我不会做了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you get stuck on a difficult word, just ask for help.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果遇到难的单词﹐就请求帮助。

Sense.DEF: to have something you do not want because you cannot get rid of it
Sense.TRAN: 不得不接受某事物﹔无法摆脱某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are, unfortunately, stuck with this huge, ugly building.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不幸的是﹐我们只得接受这幢又大又丑的楼房。

Sense.DEF: to have to spend time with someone or have a relationship with them, even though you do not want to
Sense.TRAN: 摆脱不了某人﹐甩不掉某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: They are stuck with each other with no end in sight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们俩互相都被对方拖住﹐看不到出头之日。

Sense.DEF: to be unable to think what to say or do
Sense.EXAMPLE: For once Anthony was stuck for words did not know what to say .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就这一次安东尼无话可说了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: get stuck in/get stuck into sth
Sense.DEF: to start doing something eagerly and with a lot of energy
Sense.TRAN: 积极地开始做某事﹐急切地做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Take your jacket off and get stuck in!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脱下夹克﹐甩开膀子开始干吧！

Sense.DEF: to be attracted to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: He says he’s stuck on me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说他被我迷住了。

Sense.DEF: proud and unfriendly because you think you are better and more important than other people – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 傲慢的﹐自以为了不起的 〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: His wife was a bit stuck-up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的妻子有点自以为是。

Sense.DEF: the use of animals, especially horses, for breeding, an animal that is used in this way, or a place where this is done
Sense.TRAN: 种畜﹔种马﹔种畜场﹔种马场
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stud dog
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 种犬

Sense.DEF: a man who has a lot of sexual partners and who is very proud of his sexual ability
Sense.TRAN: 风流男子﹐乱搞性关系的男人

Sense.DEF: one of a set of small pointed pieces of metal or plastic that are attached to the bottom of a running shoe, football boot etc to stop you from slipping
Sense.TRAN: 〔跑鞋﹑足球鞋等鞋底的〕鞋钉﹐防滑钉

Sense.DEF:
a small round
earring
Sense.TRAN: 圆形小耳环﹐螺栓式耳环﹐耳钉

Sense.DEF: a round piece of metal that is stuck into a surface for decoration
a small thing for fastening a shirt or collar, that consists of two round flat pieces of metal joined together by a bar
a board that is used to make the frame of a house
decorated with a lot of studs or small jewels etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: studded leather jackets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 镶满饰钉的皮夹克
Sense.EXAMPLE: a diamond-studded watch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 镶钻手表

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a belt studded with jewels
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条镶满宝石的皮带

Sense.DEF: covered or filled with a lot of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The sky was clear and studded with stars.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜空晴朗﹐繁星点点。

Sense.DEF: someone who is studying at a university, school etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a first-year student at the University of Oslo
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥斯陆大学的一名一年级学生

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are plenty of job opportunities for engineering students.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学工程的学生有许多工作机会。

GramExa.GLOSS: someone who is studying to be a teacher, nurse etc
a student who always gets A’s, B’s etc for their work
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 成绩总是得 A/B/C 的学生

Sense.DEF: to be very interested in a particular subject
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s obviously an excellent student of human nature.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 显然他对人性的研究很深入。

Exponent.DEF: someone who is studying at a university or school. In British English, student is not usually used to refer to a child at primary school.
Exponent.TRAN: 学生,学员〔英国英语中通常不指小学生〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a student at Moscow University
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫斯科大学的一名学生
Exponent.EXAMPLE: How many students are there in your class?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你班上有多少学生？

Exponent.DEF: someone who is being taught in a particular school or by a particular teacher
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The school has 300 pupils.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所学校有300名学生。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He received a letter from one of his former pupils.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他收到以前的一个学生写来的信。

Exponent.DEF: a child who goes to school
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The play was performed by a group of local schoolchildren.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这出戏由一群当地的小学生演出。

Exponent.DEF: a boy or girl who goes to school – used especially when talking about how they behave, or that time in someone’s life
Exponent.TRAN: 〔中小学的〕男生/女生〔尤用于谈论其行为或学生时代〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They were behaving like naughty schoolgirls.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她们的行为就像调皮的小女生似的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: When he was a schoolboy, no one had heard of computers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他还是小学生的时候,没有人听说过电脑。

Exponent.DEF: someone who is learning a foreign language
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Learners often have problems with pronunciation.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生常有发音问题。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a book for foreign learners of English
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本为学英语的外国人写的书

Sense.DEF:
all of the students in a
high school
, college, or university, considered as a group
Sense.TRAN: 〔一所中学或大学的〕全体学生

Sense.DEF:
an elected group of students in a
high school
, college, or university who represent the students in meetings and who organize school activities
Sense.TRAN: 学生自治会 〔指中学或大学里推选出来代表学生参加会议并组织学校活动的学生团体〕

Sense.DEF: an amount of money that you borrow from the government or a bank to pay for your education at a college or university
the period of time during which students who are learning to be teachers practise teaching in a school
a building where students go to meet socially
an association of students in a particular college or university
a studied way of behaving is deliberate and often not sincere, because it has been planned carefully
Sense.EXAMPLE: She spoke with studied politeness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说话的时候故意装得很客气。

Sense.DEF: a room where television and radio programmes are made and broadcast or where music is recorded
Sense.TRAN: 〔制作电视或广播节目的〕录音室﹐播音室﹐演播室﹔（音乐）录音室
Sense.EXAMPLE: a TV studio
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视演播室
Sense.EXAMPLE: a recording studio in Nashville
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在纳什维尔的一间录音室

Sense.DEF: a film company or the buildings it owns and uses to make its films
Sense.TRAN: 电影公司﹔摄影棚﹔电影制片厂
Sense.EXAMPLE: Depardieu is making a film with one of the big Hollywood studios.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 德帕迪约正在为好莱坞的一家大制片公司拍摄一部电影。

Sense.DEF: a room where a painter or photographer regularly works
Sense.EXAMPLE: a photographer’s studio
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摄影师的工作室

Sense.DEF: a room where dancing lessons are given or that dancers use to practise in
a small apartment with one main room
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tiny studio
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一套很小的单室公寓房

Sense.DEF: a group of people who watch and are sometimes involved in a radio or television programme while it is being made
Sense.TRAN: 〔广播或电视节目的〕演播室现场观众

Sense.DEF: spending a lot of time studying and reading
Sense.EXAMPLE: a quiet, studious young man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个文静好学的年轻人

Sense.DEF: an attractive man who is very good at sex and who has sex with a lot of people
a piece of work that is done to find out more about a particular subject or problem, and usually includes a written report
Sense.EXAMPLE: Recent studies show that women still get paid a lot less than men.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近的调查表明﹐女性的薪水仍比男性的要低很多。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a study of Australian wild birds
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对澳大利亚野生鸟类的研究

Sense.EXAMPLE: The study was carried out between January and May 2008.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项研究是在 2008 年1月到5月间进行的。

Sense.DEF: when you spend time learning, especially at home or by yourself rather than during school
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在家里或放学后的〕学习
Sense.EXAMPLE: Set aside a period of time specifically for study.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 留出一段时间专门用于学习。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ways to improve study skills skills that help you study efficiently and be successful in school
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 提高学习技巧的种种方法

Sense.DEF: a subject that people study at a college or university

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Linguistics is the study of language.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 语言学是研究语言的一门学科。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Environmental Studies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 环境学

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the scientific study of earthquakes
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对地震的科学研究

Sense.DEF: the work that someone does in order to learn about a particular subject, especially the courses they take at a college or university
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在大学期间〕某人的功课[课业﹐学业]
Sense.EXAMPLE: How are your studies coming along?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的功课怎么样？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I gave up my studies when I had the baby.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我生了孩子就放弃了学业。

Sense.DEF: when you examine or consider something very carefully and in detail
Sense.TRAN: 仔细的考虑﹔仔细的检查﹔审视
Sense.EXAMPLE: a report that deserves careful study
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 值得仔细研究的报告

Sense.DEF: a room in a house that is used for work or study
a small detailed drawing, especially one that is done to prepare for a large painting
Sense.EXAMPLE: Renoir’s studies of small plants and flowers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷诺阿的花草习作

Sense.DEF: a piece of music, usually for piano, that is often intended for practice
to try to find out more about a subject
to be a perfect example of something
Sense.TRAN: 是…的最佳例子﹐是某事物的典型
Sense.EXAMPLE: His face was a study in fear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他脸上完全是一副害怕的表情。

Sense.DEF: someone who learns things quickly

Collocate.COLLOC: do a study/carry out a study
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The scientists are carrying out a study into the effects of global warming.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学家正在研究全球变暖所带来的影响。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The study found that men were more likely to take risks.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究发现男性更有可能冒险。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Studies have shown that the drug works.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究显示这种药物有效。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A British study suggests that older drivers are safer drivers.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国一项研究表明年纪大的人开车更谨慎。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 研究揭示某事〔尤指令人惊讶的事〕

Collocate.COLLOC: a study aims to do sth

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: ask someone to carry out a study

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Research studies have found that young people are drinking no more than they were 20 years ago.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究发现现在年轻人的饮酒量没有比20年前多。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They carried out a detailed study into the effects of the disease on mice.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们详尽研究了这种疾病对于鼠类的影响。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 历时两年/三个月等的研究
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They are engaged in a five-year study into the effects of calcium on bone health.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正在进行一项为期五年的研究,研究钙对骨骼健康的影响。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The journal published the results of a massive study of 87,000 women.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该期刊发表了一项基于87,000名女性的大规模研究的结果。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one done to find out if something will be successful
one done to find out if something is possible or practical

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The aims of this study are to examine the reliability of current techniques.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 本研究旨在检查现行技术的可靠性。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The results of this study suggest that the drug is effective in over 80% of cases.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 本研究表明这种药物对超过80%的病例有效。

Sense.DEF: to learn about a subject at school, university etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve been studying English for six years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我学英语已有六年了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t study with that music playing all the time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那音乐老这么放着﹐我无法学习。

GramExa.GLOSS: study a subject at a school or university
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Anna is studying French literature.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 安娜在攻读法国文学。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stephen is currently studying at Exeter University.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯蒂芬目前在埃克塞特大学学习。

GramExa.PROPFORM: study to be a doctor/lawyer etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: My brother’s studying to be an accountant.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我弟弟在读会计。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve only got three weeks left to study for my exams.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只剩三个星期复习迎考了。

GramExa.GLOSS: be trained by a famous teacher
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 师从某人﹐跟某名师学习
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a psychologist who studied under Jung in Zurich
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 曾在苏黎世师从荣格的一位心理学家

Sense.DEF: to try to find out more about a subject or problem, using scientific methods
Sense.EXAMPLE: Goodall was studying the behavior of chimpanzees in the wild.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古多尔在研究野生大猩猩的行为。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The scientists were studying the action of a protein called ubiquitin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学家正在研究一种被称为泛素的蛋白质的作用。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’re studying how stress affects body chemistry.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在研究压力对人体化学成分的影响。

Sense.DEF: to look at something carefully
Sense.EXAMPLE: She studied his face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她端详着他的脸。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They got out of the car and studied the map.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们下车仔细看地图。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I haven’t had time to study the proposals yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还没有时间去细看那些提议。

Exponent.DEF: to learn about a subject at school, university etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If you study hard, you’ll get a good job.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 努力学习就能找个好工作。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He studied law at Harvard University.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在哈佛大学攻读法律。

Exponent.DEF: to study a subject that you have chosen at school, college etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What classes are you taking next semester?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 下学期你要修哪些课？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: In my final year, I decided to take English and economics.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后一年我决定选修英语和经济学。

Exponent.DEF: to study a particular subject at school or university
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I can’t decide whether to do German or Spanish next year.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我拿不定主意明年学德语还是西班牙语。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Did you do computing at school?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你在学校里学过电脑吗？

Exponent.DEF: to study something as your main subject at a college or university
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Diane majored in psychology at the University of Washington.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 黛安娜在华盛顿大学主修心理学。

Exponent.DEF: to study to prepare for an examination
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s best to start revising early.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 最好早点开始复习。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s revising for his final exams.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在复习迎接期末考试。

Exponent.DEF: to study very hard and try to learn a lot of information just before an examination
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Everyone’s cramming for their final exams.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人人都在为期末考试拼命准备。

Exponent.DEF: to study something in a very detailed way, especially in order to discover new information about it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He does research at Oxford University.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在牛津大学做研究。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m doing research into second language learning.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正在研究第二语言习得。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s difficult to do research on humans.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人体研究很难。

Sense.DEF: a period of time during the school day when students must go to a room to study, instead of going to a lesson
used when you are talking about things such as substances, materials, or groups of objects when you do not know what they are called, or it is not important to say exactly what they are
Sense.TRAN: 东西﹔物品〔用于事物名称不详或不重要时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got some sticky stuff on my shoe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我鞋子上有什么黏糊糊的东西。
Sense.EXAMPLE: How do you think you’re going to fit all that stuff into the car?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你说这么多东西你怎么装进车里？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt sorry for the ones who had to eat the awful stuff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很同情那些只能吃这种难吃东西的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where’s all the camping stuff?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 野营用的东西都在哪儿？

Sense.DEF: the things that belong to someone
Sense.TRAN: 某人的物品﹐某人的所有物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you get the rest of your stuff?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的其他东西都拿了吗？

Sense.DEF: used when talking about different activities, subjects, or ideas, when you do not say exactly what these are
Sense.EXAMPLE: What kind of stuff do you like to read?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你喜欢读什么样的书？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got so much stuff to do this weekend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这个周末有好多事情要做。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a lot of interesting stuff in this book.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书里有很多有趣的东西。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s talked to me about all that stuff too.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些事情他也都对我说了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He does mountain biking and skiing, and stuff like that .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从事山地自行车﹑滑雪之类的运动。

Sense.DEF: used when you are talking about what someone has done or made, for example writing, music, or art
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t like his stuff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不喜欢他的作品。
Sense.EXAMPLE: John Lee was getting ready to play his stuff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰·李正准备演奏他的曲子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He did some great stuff in his early films.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他早期的电影里有一些好东西。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to tell someone that their work is good
GramExa.EXAMPLE: This is good stuff.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这东西不错。

Sense.DEF: used to say that there are other things similar to what you have just mentioned, but you are not going to say what they are
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s some very good music there, CD systems and stuff, and laser disks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那儿有些很好的音乐﹑激光唱片播放设备什么的﹐还有激光光盘。

Sense.DEF: exactly the kind of thing that dreams etc consist of
Sense.EXAMPLE: an enchanting place – the very stuff of dreams
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个迷人的地方——犹如梦境

Sense.DEF: the qualities of someone’s character
Sense.EXAMPLE: Does he have the right stuff qualities that make you able to deal with difficulties ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有那本事吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Surely you’re not going to give up? I thought you were made of sterner stuff were more determined .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你总不会要放弃吧？ 我原以为你很坚强。

Sense.DEF: to do what you are good at when everyone wants you to do it
Sense.TRAN: 拿出自己的本领﹐显身手
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on Gina, get on the dance floor and do your stuff!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来吧﹐吉娜﹐到舞池里来显显你的身手！

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Stuff is an uncountable noun and has no plural form. Use a singular verb after it.
F2NBox.TRAN: stuff是不可数名词,没有复数形式,后接单数动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Most of my stuff is still in packing cases.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的东西大多还在包装箱里。

Sense.DEF: to push or put something into a small space, especially in a quick careless way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She stuffed two more sweaters into her bag.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她又往她的袋子里塞了两件毛线衫。

Sense.DEF: to fill something until it is full
Sense.EXAMPLE: Volunteers were busy stuffing envelopes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 志愿者正忙着装信封。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a pillow stuffed with feathers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用羽毛填充的枕头

Sense.EXAMPLE: boxes stuffed full of papers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 装满文件的箱子

Sense.DEF: to fill a chicken, pepper etc with a mixture of bread or rice, onion etc before cooking it
Sense.TRAN: 给〔鸡﹑甜椒等〕填馅﹐填料于〔食物〕

Sense.DEF: to fill the skin of a dead animal in order to make the animal look still alive
Sense.TRAN: 填塞〔动物尸体〕以制作标本
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stuffed owl
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猫头鹰标本

Sense.DEF: to eat so much food that you cannot eat anything else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The kids have been stuffing themselves with candy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们一直在一个劲儿地吃糖。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone very rudely and angrily that you do not want to talk to them or accept their offer
Sense.TRAN: 走开﹐不要烦了﹐去你的吧〔以非常粗鲁和生气的语气表示不想与某人交谈或拒绝接受某人的提议〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He only offered me £10 for it, so I told him to get stuffed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只想出十英镑买这个东西﹐所以我叫他滚开。

Sense.DEF: used to say very angrily or rudely that you do not want what someone is offering
Sense.TRAN: 让某人的某物见鬼去吧〔非常气愤或粗鲁地表示不接受某人给的东西〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘All right. You can stuff your money!’ Reynolds exploded.
