Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “得了。 让你的钱见鬼去吧！”雷诺兹勃然大怒道。

Sense.DEF: used to say angrily or rudely that you do not care about something or do not want something
Sense.TRAN: 管他呢﹐去他的〔气愤或粗鲁地表示不在乎或不想要〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought, stuff it, I’ll do what I want.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想﹐管他呢﹐我想做什么就做什么。

Sense.DEF: completely full, so that you cannot eat any more
Sense.EXAMPLE: No, no dessert – I’m stuffed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不﹐不要甜点了﹐我吃饱了。

Sense.DEF: a toy animal covered and filled with soft material
someone who behaves in a very formal way and thinks that they are important
Sense.TRAN: 神气十足的人﹐妄自尊大的人

Sense.DEF: unable to breathe properly through your nose because you have a cold
a mixture of bread or rice, onion etc that you put inside a chicken, pepper etc before cooking it
Sense.TRAN: 〔烹饪前塞入鸡﹑甜椒等中的〕填料
Sense.EXAMPLE: sage and onion stuffing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洋苏叶和洋葱填料

Sense.DEF:
soft material that is used to fill something such as a
cushion

Crossrefto.REFLEX: knock the stuffing out of sb

Sense.DEF: a room or building that is stuffy does not have enough fresh air in it
Sense.TRAN: 〔房间或建筑物〕通风不好的﹐空气不新鲜的﹐憋闷的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s getting stuffy in here – do you mind if I open the window?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里越来越闷了﹐我开开窗行吗？

Sense.DEF: people, occasions, or places that are stuffy are too formal and old-fashioned – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 一本正经的﹐古板的﹐守旧的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their wedding was stuffy and formal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的婚礼古板而正式。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stuffy old family
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古板守旧的古老家族

Sense.DEF: so boring that you feel as though you are losing your ability to think
Sense.TRAN: 使人厌倦的﹔使人呆滞[迟钝]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stultifying office environment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人呆滞的办公环境

Sense.DEF: to hit your foot against something or put your foot down awkwardly while you are walking or running, so that you almost fall
Sense.EXAMPLE: In her hurry, she stumbled and spilled the milk all over the floor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 匆忙中她绊了一下﹐把牛奶洒得满地都是。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Vic stumbled over the step as he came in.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 维克进来时在台阶上绊了一下。

Sense.DEF: to walk in an unsteady way and often almost fall

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He stumbled upstairs and into bed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他踉踉跄跄地走上楼﹐一头倒在床上。

Sense.DEF: to stop or make a mistake when you are reading to people or speaking

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I hope I don’t stumble over any of the long words.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 希望我说那些长单词不会结结巴巴。

Sense.DEF: to find or discover something by chance and unexpectedly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Researchers have stumbled across a drug that may help patients with Parkinson’s disease.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究人员偶然发现了一种或可治疗帕金森病的药物。

Sense.DEF: a problem or difficulty that stops you from achieving something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The main stumbling block to starting new research is that we lack qualified people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 开始新研究的主要障碍是我们缺少合格的人员。

Sense.DEF: the bottom part of a tree that is left in the ground after the rest of it has been cut down
Sense.TRAN: 〔树被砍倒后留下的〕树桩﹐树墩
Sense.EXAMPLE: an old tree stump
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老树墩

Sense.DEF: the short part of someone’s leg, arm etc that remains after the rest of it has been cut off
the small useless part of something that remains after most of it has broken off or worn away
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was only a stump of the candle left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只剩下蜡烛头了。

Sense.DEF:
one of the three upright sticks in
cricket
that you throw the ball at
a speech made by a politician who is travelling around in order to gain political support, or the politician who gives this speech
to be travelling around an area, making speeches in order to gain political support
if you are stumped by a question or problem, you are unable to find an answer to it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a case that has stumped the police
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难倒警察的案子
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctors were stumped and had to call in a specialist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生们被难倒了﹐只好请来专家。

Sense.DEF: to walk with heavy steps
Sense.TRAN: 迈着沉重的步子走﹔跺着脚走

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He stumped down the hall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他迈着重重的步子在过道里走。

Sense.DEF:
to put a
batsman
out of the game in
cricket
by touching the stumps with the ball when he is out of the hitting area
Sense.TRAN: 〔板球〕以球触三门柱而使〔击球手〕出局

Sense.DEF: to travel around an area, meeting people and making speeches in order to gain political support
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alexander has been stumping in New Hampshire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚历山大一直在新罕布什尔州作巡回政治演说。

Sense.DEF: to pay money, even if it is difficult or when you do not want to
Sense.EXAMPLE: We stumped up eight quid each.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们每个人勉强凑了八英镑。

Sense.DEF: unable to find an answer or think of a reply
Sense.EXAMPLE: The question had me completely stumped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题把我彻底问倒了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Travis seemed absolutely stumped for words.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 特拉维斯似乎完全不知说什么好。

Sense.DEF: stumpy legs, fingers etc are short and thick in an unattractive way
to surprise or upset someone so much that they do not react immediately
Sense.EXAMPLE: Redfern stunned the crowd with a last-minute goal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷德芬在最后一分钟进球﹐使观众很是震惊。

Sense.DEF: to make someone unconscious for a short time
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某人〕短暂失去知觉﹐使晕过去
Sense.EXAMPLE: The impact of the ball had stunned her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那一球把她打昏了。

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and past participle of
sting
Sense.TRAN: sting 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF: a weapon that produces a very strong electric current and can be used to make animals or people unconscious
Sense.TRAN: 〔使被击中者失去知觉的〕电击枪

Sense.DEF:
the past participle of
stink
too surprised or shocked to speak
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked completely stunned.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去完全惊呆了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The audience sat in stunned silence .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 观众们坐在那里﹐惊愕得哑然无声。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is very attractive, especially a woman
Sense.TRAN: 极具吸引力的人[物]﹔〔尤指〕极漂亮的女人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lucy was a real stunner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 露西十分美丽动人。

Sense.DEF: a situation or event that surprises you
extremely attractive or beautiful
Sense.TRAN: 极具吸引力的﹐极漂亮的
Sense.EXAMPLE: You look absolutely stunning in that dress.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你穿那件连衣裙非常迷人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stunning view
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极为美丽的景色

Sense.DEF: very surprising or shocking
Sense.TRAN: 令人惊奇的﹔令人震惊的
Sense.EXAMPLE: stunning news
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人震惊的新闻

Sense.DEF: a dangerous action that is done to entertain people, especially in a film
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指电影中的〕特技表演﹐特技
Sense.EXAMPLE: Not many actors do their own stunts .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不是很多演员亲自表演特技动作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stunt flying show
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特技飞行表演

Sense.DEF: something that is done to attract people’s attention, especially in advertising or politics
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指广告或政治中的〕噱头﹐引人注目的花招
Sense.EXAMPLE: Todd flew over the city in a hot-air balloon as a publicity stunt .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为一种宣传噱头﹐托德乘坐热气球飞越城市上空。

Sense.DEF: to do something that is silly or that is slightly dangerous
Sense.EXAMPLE: Next time you pull a stunt like that don’t expect me to get you out of trouble.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下次你要再做那样的蠢事﹐别指望我帮你解围。

Sense.DEF: to stop something or someone from growing to their full size or developing properly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lack of sunlight will stunt the plant’s growth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缺乏阳光会阻碍植物的生长。

Sense.DEF: not developing properly or to full size
Sense.TRAN: 发育不足的﹐生长不良的﹔未能充分发展的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s emotionally stunted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的情感不健全。

Sense.DEF: a man who is employed to take the place of an actor when something dangerous has to be done in a film
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影中受雇替代男演员做危险动作的〕男替身演员

Sense.DEF: a woman who is employed to take the place of an actress when something dangerous has to be done in a film
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影中受雇替代女演员做危险动作的〕女替身演员

Sense.DEF: so surprised, tired, or bored that you cannot think clearly
Sense.TRAN: 〔因吃惊﹑疲劳或厌倦而〕呆呆的﹐茫然的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I stared up at Keith in stupefied amazement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我目瞪口呆地盯着基思看。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We sat there stupefied.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们怔怔地坐在那儿。

Sense.DEF: making you feel extremely surprised, tired, or bored
Sense.TRAN: 令人非常吃惊[疲劳﹐厌倦]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stupefying amount of money
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人瞠目结舌的一大笔钱

Sense.DEF: surprisingly large or impressive
Sense.TRAN: 巨大的﹔惊人的﹔了不起的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stupendous achievement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 了不起的成就

Sense.DEF: showing a lack of good sense or good judgment
Sense.EXAMPLE: stupid mistakes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 愚蠢的错误
Sense.EXAMPLE: That was a stupid thing to say.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那样说可真傻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t believe Kate was stupid enough to get involved in this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我简直不能相信凯特这么傻﹐会介入这件事情。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Whose stupid idea was this?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是谁的蠢主意？

Sense.EXAMPLE: It was stupid of me to lose my temper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我大发脾气﹐真是太愚蠢了。

Sense.DEF: having a low level of intelligence, so that you have difficulty learning or understanding things
Sense.EXAMPLE: He understands – he’s not stupid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他明白——他又不笨。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t do it, and it made me feel stupid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件事我做不来﹐这让我感到自己很愚蠢。

Sense.DEF: used when you are talking about something or someone that makes you annoyed or impatient
Sense.TRAN: 恼人的﹐讨厌的〔用以表示气恼或不耐烦〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t get this stupid radio to work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没办法弄响这台讨厌的收音机。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What is that stupid idiot doing?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个蠢蛋在做什么？

Sense.DEF: unable to think clearly because you are extremely cold, tired etc
Sense.TRAN: 冷得迷糊/睡得迷糊/震惊得发傻等

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I stupidly agreed to organize the party.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我愚蠢地应下了组织派对的任务。

Exponent.DEF: showing a total lack of good sense or good judgment. Stupid sounds very strong and is often used when you are annoyed or strongly criticizing someone’s behaviour.
Exponent.TRAN: 愚蠢的,傻的〔stupid语气强烈,常用于表达愤怒或强烈指责某人的行为〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I wish you’d stop asking stupid questions.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你别再问愚蠢的问题了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was stupid of me to leave the door unlocked.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没把门锁好,真是太蠢了。

Exponent.DEF: doing or saying things that are not sensible or serious, and that may make you feel embarrassed later. Silly sounds much gentler than stupid .
Exponent.TRAN: 没头脑的,傻的〔silly的语气比stupid温和许多〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a silly mistake
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 愚蠢的错误
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Don’t be so silly! There’s nothing wrong with you.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 别傻了！你什么问题都没有。

Exponent.DEF: not sensible, often in a way that is also amusing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Is this another of your daft ideas?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这又是你的一个傻主意？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Don’t be daft! Of course you’re not too old to go clubbing.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 别傻了！你当然没有老到不可以去夜总会了。

Exponent.DEF: stupid
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a dumb question
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 愚蠢的问题
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was dumb enough to believe her.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他够蠢的,居然相信她。

Exponent.DEF: stupid. Foolish sounds rather formal and is used mainly in written English. The usual words to use in everyday English are silly or stupid .
Exponent.TRAN: 愚蠢的〔foolish 相当正式,主要用于书面英语,日常英语中通常用silly或stupid〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was a foolish thing to say.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 说这话真蠢。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They did not want to look foolish.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不想显得傻乎乎的。

Exponent.DEF: done without thinking carefully enough about the possible disadvantages that may result
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She knew the marriage was unwise.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她知道这桩婚事很草率。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an unwise choice of words
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 不明智的措辞

Exponent.DEF: not at all sensible or reasonable – used when you are very surprised by someone’s behaviour or what they have said
Exponent.TRAN: 失去理智的,发疯的〔尤用于对某人的行为或言语感到非常惊讶〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Ian’s got some crazy plan to drive across Africa.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊恩疯了,打算驾车穿越非洲大陆。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She looked at me as if I was crazy!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她看我的样子就像我疯了似的！

Exponent.DEF: extremely stupid
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You look ridiculous in that hat.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你戴那顶帽子很可笑。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Some people spend a ridiculous amount of money on cars.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些人花好多钱买车﹐太荒唐了。

Exponent.DEF: extremely stupid – used especially when an idea or situation seems strange or illogical
Exponent.EXAMPLE: How can a return ticket cost less than a single? It’s totally absurd!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 怎么往返票比单程票还便宜？这太荒谬了！
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was a ludicrous idea.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这主意很荒唐。

Exponent.DEF: so stupid that you cannot believe someone is telling the truth or being serious
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The accusations were almost laughable.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些指控简直是可笑。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a laughable suggestion
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 可笑的建议

Sense.DEF: an insulting way of talking to someone who you think is being stupid
Sense.EXAMPLE: No, stupid, don’t do it like that!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不﹐笨蛋﹐不要那样做！

Sense.DEF: behaviour or actions that show a lack of good sense or good judgment
Sense.EXAMPLE: all the horrors and stupidities of war
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争的种种恐怖和愚蠢

Sense.DEF: the quality of being stupid
a state in which you cannot think, speak, see, or hear clearly, usually because you have drunk too much alcohol or taken drugs
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤因过量喝酒或吸毒引起的〕昏迷﹐恍惚﹐不省人事
Sense.EXAMPLE: We found him lying at the bottom of the stairs in a drunken stupor .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们发现他躺在楼梯口﹐醉得不省人事。

Sense.DEF: an object that is sturdy is strong, well-made, and not easily broken
Sense.EXAMPLE: That chair doesn’t look very sturdy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那把椅子看上去不太结实。
Sense.EXAMPLE: sturdy comfortable shoes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 结实而舒适的鞋子

Sense.DEF: someone who is sturdy is strong, short, and healthy looking
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sturdy young man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 健壮的小伙子
Sense.EXAMPLE: sturdy legs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 结实的双腿

Sense.DEF: determined and not easily persuaded to change your opinions
Sense.TRAN: 坚定的﹐坚决的﹐不易改变主意的
Sense.EXAMPLE: They kept up a sturdy opposition to the plan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们一直坚决反对那项计划。

Sense.DEF:
a large fish, from which
caviar
is obtained, or the meat of this fish
Sense.TRAN: 鲟（鱼）〔其卵可制鱼子酱〕﹔鲟鱼肉

Sense.DEF:
to speak with difficulty because you cannot stop yourself from repeating the first
consonant
of some words
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m D-d-david,’ he stuttered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我叫戴……戴……戴维。”他结结巴巴地说道。

Sense.DEF: if a machine stutters, it keeps making little noises and does not work smoothly
Sense.TRAN: 〔机器〕发出突突的噪声﹐不顺畅地运转
Sense.EXAMPLE: a refrigerator which stuttered and hummed
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一台发出突突声且嗡嗡作响的冰箱

Sense.DEF: an inability to speak normally because you stutter
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nervous stutter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 紧张引起的口吃

Sense.DEF: a place where pigs are kept

an infected place on the edge of your
eyelid
, which becomes red and swollen
unpleasantly dark, and making you feel nervous or afraid
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Stygian gloom
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阴森黑暗

Sense.DEF: a particular way of doing, designing, or producing something, especially one that is typical of a particular place, period of time, or group of people
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指某个地方﹑某个时期或某个群体的〕风格﹐作风
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to use Japanese management style in a European business
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将日本的管理方式用于欧洲企业的尝试

GramExa.EXAMPLE: different styles of handwriting
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不同的书写风格

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cuban-style black beans and rice
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 古巴特色的黑豆和稻米
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a Colonial﹣style house
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 殖民地时期风格的房子
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dinner will be served buffet﹣style.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚餐将是自助式的。

Sense.DEF: the particular way that someone behaves, works, or deals with other people
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人行为﹑工作或待人的〕方式﹐特点
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children have different styles of learning: some learn by seeing, some by hearing, some by doing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童的学习方式各不相同: 有的通过观察﹐有的通过聆听﹐有的通过动手。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that you prefer something
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 才是某人所喜欢的﹔适合某人
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t think the parachuting weekend is for me – the art class is more my style.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为周末去跳伞不适合我﹐上美术课才是我喜欢的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I like your style approve of the way you do things , Simpson.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢你做事的方式﹐辛普森。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t ask a man out – it’s not my style it is not the way I usually behave .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不会约男人出去﹐那不是我的作风。

Sense.DEF: a typical way of writing, painting etc that is used by a particular person or during a particular period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The paintings are in an expressionistic style.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些画作是表现主义风格的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hemingway’s direct style
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海明威的直白风格

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a play in the style of classical Greek tragedy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 希腊古典悲剧风格的戏剧

Subsense.DEF: a particular design or fashion for something such as clothes, hair, furniture etc
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Car styles have changed radically in the past 20 years.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在过去 20 年里﹐汽车的款式彻底改变了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rooms are furnished in a modern style.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些房间是以现代风格布置的。

Subsense.DEF: the quality of being fashionable
Subsense.EXAMPLE: young women interested in style rather than comfort
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 注重款式而非舒适性的年轻女性

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Long skirts are back in style.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 长裙子又流行起来了。

Sense.DEF: a confident and attractive quality that makes people admire you, and that is shown in your appearance, or the way you do things
Sense.EXAMPLE: You may not like her, but she certainly has style .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你也许不喜欢她﹐但她确实有风度。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team played with style .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球队打得很有气势。

Sense.DEF: a way of using words or spelling that is considered correct
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s not good style to use abbreviations in an essay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在文章里用缩略语不够规范。

Sense.DEF: done in a way that people admire, especially because it is unusual, shows great determination, or involves spending a lot of money

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nadal won the match in fine style, not losing a single game.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 纳达尔一局未失﹐赢得非常潇洒。

Sense.DEF: to design clothing, furniture, or the shape of someone’s hair in a particular way
Sense.TRAN: 设计﹐把…制作成某种式样
Sense.EXAMPLE: These shoes have been styled for maximum comfort.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这双鞋子设计力求舒适。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has her hair styled by Giorgio.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她请乔治奥为她做头发。

Sense.DEF: to give yourself a particular title or name
Sense.EXAMPLE: They style themselves ‘the terrible twins’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们自称“可怕的双胞胎”。

Sense.DEF: to make an effort to appear relaxed and confident, especially when you have done something embarrassing
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指做了难堪的事之后〕故作镇定

Sense.DEF:
a set of instructions that states what the
typeface
and colours of an electronic document should be
Sense.TRAN: 〔说明电子文件字体及颜色的〕样式表﹐体例说明表

Sense.DEF: the design and appearance of an object, especially a car
Sense.EXAMPLE: I like the new Audi in terms of styling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢这辆新奥迪的款式。

Sense.DEF: substances you use to make your hair look attractive
Sense.TRAN: 定型产品/摩丝/喷发胶等

Sense.DEF: attractive in a fashionable way
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stylish woman in her forties
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名40多岁的时髦女子
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jack is quite stylish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克很时髦。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stylish restaurant in the West End
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 位于伦敦西区的一家有格调的饭店

Sense.DEF: someone who cuts or arranges people’s hair as their job
Sense.EXAMPLE: Renee was the top stylist at the salon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 勒妮是这家美发厅最好的发型师。

Sense.DEF: someone who has carefully developed a good style of writing
Sense.TRAN: 文体家﹐追求优美写作风格的人

Sense.DEF: someone who has their own typical way of singing or playing music
Sense.TRAN: 〔唱歌或演奏音乐〕具有独特风格者﹐自成流派者
Sense.EXAMPLE: Billie Holiday, one of jazz’s most distinctive stylists
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比利·霍利戴﹐爵士乐界最具独特风格的歌手之一

Sense.DEF: relating to the particular way an artist, writer, musician etc makes or performs something, especially the technical features or methods they use
Sense.TRAN: 文体上的﹔艺术风格上的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sculptor’s stylistic development
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位雕刻家艺术风格上的发展

GramExa.EXAMPLE: stylistic features of the story
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 故事的文体特色

Sense.DEF: the study of style in written or spoken language
drawn, written, or performed in an artificial style that does not look natural or real, but that is still pleasant to look at
Sense.EXAMPLE: a stylized picture of the sun
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用非写实手法画的太阳

Sense.DEF:
the small pointed part of a
record player
, that touches the record

a thing shaped like a pen, used for writing on
wax
, making marks on metal, writing on a special computer screen etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔在蜡板﹑钢板上刻字的〕尖笔﹐铁笔﹔〔在特殊的计算机屏幕上写字的〕触笔

Sense.DEF: to prevent someone from doing what they have planned or want to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Investigators have been stymied by uncooperative witnesses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于目击者不合作﹐调查人员的工作受阻。

Sense.DEF: a soft light plastic material that prevents heat or cold from passing through it, used especially to make containers
Sense.TRAN: 舒泰龙聚苯乙烯〔一种轻型泡沫塑料﹐有隔热保温作用﹐尤用于制造器皿〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Styrofoam cup
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 聚苯乙烯泡沫塑料杯

Sense.DEF: someone who is suave is polite, confident, and relaxed, sometimes in an insincere way
Sense.TRAN: 温文尔雅的﹔自信而世故的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a suave and sophisticated gentleman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 温文尔雅﹑精明练达的绅士

Sense.DEF:
a
submarine

a
substitute
in sports such as football
Sense.TRAN: 〔足球等体育运动的〕替补队员

Sense.DEF:
a
subscription
part of your wages that you receive earlier than usual because you need money
a long bread roll, split open and filled with meat, cheese etc
Sense.TRAN: 潜艇[大型]三明治〔长面包纵向切开﹐中间夹肉﹑奶酪等〕

Sense.DEF:
a
substitute teacher

a
sub-editor

to act as a
substitute
for someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Roy’s subbing for Chris in tonight’s game.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚的比赛罗伊要给克里斯当替补。

Sense.DEF: to give someone part of their wages earlier than usual or lend them money
Sense.TRAN: 预支工资给…﹐预付﹔借钱给…
Sense.EXAMPLE: I subbed Fenella a tenner to get a decent bunch of flowers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我借给费奈拉十英镑﹐去买一束像样的鲜花。

Sense.DEF:
to
subedit
something
Sense.TRAN: 审校〔文稿〕﹐对〔稿件〕作文字加工

Sense.DEF: under or below a particular level or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: sub-zero temperatures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 零度以下的温度
Sense.EXAMPLE: subsoil

Sense.DEF: less important or powerful than someone or something, or of lower rank than someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sublieutenant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海军中尉

Sense.DEF: part of a bigger whole
Sense.EXAMPLE: a subsection
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 分部
Sense.EXAMPLE: a subcommittee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 〔委员会下设的〕专门小组

Sense.DEF: not as good as other people or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: substandard housing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低于标准的住宅
Sense.EXAMPLE: subnormal intelligence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低于正常的智力

Sense.DEF: almost
Sense.EXAMPLE: subtropical heat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚热带的高温

Sense.DEF: a middle rank in the British army, or someone who has this rank
relating to sports that take place under water
Sense.EXAMPLE: sub-aqua diving
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 潜泳

Sense.DEF: smaller than an atom or existing within an atom
Sense.EXAMPLE: subatomic particles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚原子粒子

Sense.DEF: a small group formed from a committee to deal with a particular subject in more detail
a type of very small and inexpensive car
subconscious feelings, desires etc are hidden in your mind and affect your behaviour, but you do not know that you have them
Sense.TRAN: 〔感觉﹑欲望等〕下意识的﹐潜意识的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a subconscious fear of failure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对失败下意识的恐惧

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Subconsciously, he blames himself for the accident.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他潜意识里为那次事故自责。

Sense.DEF: the part of your mind that has thoughts and feelings you do not know about
Sense.EXAMPLE: anger buried deep in the subconscious
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 深深埋藏在潜意识里的愤怒

Sense.DEF:
a very large area of land that is part of a
continent
the area of land that includes India, Pakistan, and Bangladesh
Sense.TRAN: 南亚次大陆〔包括印度﹑巴基斯坦和孟加拉国〕

Sense.DEF: if a company subcontracts work, they pay other people to do part of their work for them
Sense.TRAN: 将〔已签合约的工作〕分包[转包]给他人
Sense.EXAMPLE: We will be subcontracting most of the electrical work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将把大部分的电工活转包出去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some of the work will be subcontracted to another company.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中一部分工作将分包给另一家公司。

Sense.DEF: someone who does part of the work of another person or company
a particular group of people within a society and their behaviour, beliefs, and activities – often used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 亚文化群﹔亚文化〔常含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the drug subculture of the inner city
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旧城区的吸毒亚文化群

Sense.DEF: beneath your skin
Sense.EXAMPLE: subcutaneous fat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮下脂肪

Sense.DEF:
an area in a computer where
file s
are stored inside another directory, in order to keep the files organized
to divide into smaller parts something that is already divided
Sense.TRAN: 把〔分过的东西〕再分﹐细分
Sense.EXAMPLE: Over time, developers subdivided the land.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开发商们渐渐地把这块土地进行了再分割。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The house was subdivided into apartments.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子又被分割成几个套间。

Sense.DEF: when something is subdivided, or the parts that result from doing this
Sense.TRAN: 再分﹐细分﹔进一步分成的部分

Sense.DEF: an area of land that has been subdivided for building houses on
to defeat or control a person or group, especially using force
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police managed to subdue the angry crowd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察设法控制住了愤怒的人群。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Napoleon subdued much of Europe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拿破仑控制了大半个欧洲。

Sense.DEF: to prevent your emotions from showing or being too strong
Sense.EXAMPLE: an excitement she could not subdue
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她无法抑制的兴奋

Sense.DEF: subdued lighting, colours etc are less bright than usual
Sense.TRAN: 〔照明﹑颜色等〕柔和的﹐不强烈的

Sense.DEF: a person that is subdued is unusually quiet and possibly unhappy
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕抑郁的﹔沉默寡言的﹔闷闷不乐的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Richard seems very subdued tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 理查德今晚好像很沉默。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a subdued manner
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 闷闷不乐的样子
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Oh,’ she said in a subdued voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “噢。”她低声地说。

Sense.DEF: an activity that is subdued does not have as much excitement as you would expect
Sense.EXAMPLE: The housing market is fairly subdued.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 住宅市场相当低迷。

Sense.DEF: a sound that is subdued is quieter than usual
to examine other people’s writing for mistakes and correct them
Sense.TRAN: 审校〔文稿〕﹐对…作文字加工

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to examine other people’s writing, such as a newspaper article, and to correct mistakes
a separate, smaller, and sometimes less important part of a group
a short phrase used as a title for a small part within a longer piece of writing
not having all the qualities a normal human being has
Sense.TRAN: 不齿于人类的﹔低于人类的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The enemy was regarded as subhuman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些敌人被认为是没有人性的。

Sense.DEF: subhuman conditions are very bad or cruel
Sense.EXAMPLE: The refugees were living a subhuman existence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难民们过着非人的生活。

Sense.DEF: the thing you are talking about or considering in a conversation, discussion, book, film etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔对话﹑讨论﹑书﹑电影等的〕主题﹐题目﹔话题
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul has strong opinions on most subjects.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗在大多数问题上观点激烈。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The subjects covered in this chapter are exercise and nutrition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本章涵盖的主题是运动和营养。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Truffaut’s childhood memories were the subject of his first film.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 特吕弗的童年记忆是他第一部电影的主题。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: While we’re on the subject of money, do you have the $10 you owe me?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 既然我们谈到钱这个话题﹐那你欠我的十美元﹐现在有吗？

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘the subject is about...’: The subject of the poem is war. 该诗的主题是战争。 | The poem is about war. 这首诗写的是战争。

Sense.DEF: an area of knowledge that you study at a school or university
Sense.EXAMPLE: My favourite subject is math.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最喜欢的学科是数学。

Sense.DEF: the thing or person that you show when you paint a picture, take a photograph etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Monet loved to use gardens as his subjects.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫奈喜欢以花园作为题材。

Sense.DEF:
a person or animal that is used in a test or
experiment
Sense.TRAN: 实验对象﹐接受实验的人[动物]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The subjects were all men aged 18-35.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实验对象均为 18 至 35 岁的男性。

Sense.DEF:
a noun, noun phrase, or
pronoun
that usually comes before a main verb and represents the person or thing that performs the action of the verb, or about which something is stated, for example ‘she’ in ‘She hit John’ or ‘elephants’ in ‘Elephants are big’
Sense.TRAN: 主语〔如 She hit John 中的 she﹐或 Elephants are big 中的 elephants〕

Sense.DEF: someone who was born in a country that has a king or queen, or someone who has a right to live there
Sense.EXAMPLE: a British subject
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国国民

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Have you discussed the subject with your husband?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你和你丈夫讨论过这个问题吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She tried to change the subject.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她试图改变话题。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The subject was not mentioned again.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题没有再提到。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The subject is dealt with in great detail in his previous book.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题在他前一本书中有详尽论述。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: say or write a little about it
happen to start talking about it
start talking about a sensitive subject
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 开始谈论某一敏感话题

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Fame is a fascinating subject.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 名誉是个极有趣的话题。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Immigration is a complex subject.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 移民是一个复杂的话题。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The content of the curriculum has become a controversial subject.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 课程内容已变成一个有争议的话题。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that people may get upset about
one that it is not acceptable to mention

Collocate.EXAMPLE: TV is a favourite subject for discussion.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视是一个特别受欢迎的讨论主题。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She searched for a new subject of conversation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她寻找新的话题。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a subject people discuss and disagree about
a subject people disagree about strongly

Subsense.DEF: if someone or something is subject to something, especially something bad, it is possible or likely that they will be affected by it
Subsense.TRAN: 易受某人[某事]影响﹔可能会…的
Subsense.EXAMPLE: All flights are subject to delay.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有航班都有可能延误。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Prices are subject to change .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 价格有可能变化。

Subsense.DEF: if something is subject to something such as approval, it depends on that thing happening before it can happen
Subsense.TRAN: 取决于某人[某事]﹐视某人[某事]而定
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The funding is subject to approval by the Board of Education.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拨款有待教育委员会批准。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be subject to a rule/law/penalty/tax etc
Sense.DEF: if you are subject to a rule, law, penalty etc, you must obey the rule or pay an amount of money
Sense.TRAN: 须遵守规则/须遵守法令/须缴纳罚款/须缴纳税款等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Violators are subject to a $100 fine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 违者罚款 100 美元。

Sense.DEF: a subject country, state, people etc are strictly governed by another country
Sense.TRAN: 〔国家﹑人民等〕被他国统治的﹐受人管辖的
Sense.EXAMPLE: subject peoples
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被他国统治的民族

Sense.DEF: to force a country or group of people to be ruled by you, and control them very strictly
to force someone or something to experience something very unpleasant, especially over a long time
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指长期〕使遭受﹐使经历﹐使蒙受
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police subjected him to hours of questioning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察对他进行了长时间的盘问。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Barker subjected his victim to awful abuse.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴克对其受害者进行了残酷的虐待。

Sense.DEF: when a person or a group of people are controlled by a government or by another person

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government used brute force to keep people in subjection.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府使用暴力让民众臣服。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a period of subjection to Assyrian rulers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 臣服于亚述统治者的一段时期

Sense.EXAMPLE: the subjection of women
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妇女的从属地位

Sense.DEF: a state-ment, report, attitude etc that is subjective is influenced by personal opinion and can therefore be unfair
Sense.EXAMPLE: As a critic, he is far too subjective.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作为评论家﹐他过于主观。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a highly subjective point of view
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 相当主观的看法

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The ratings were based on the subjective judgement of one person.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些等级是基于个人的主观判断而定的。

Sense.DEF: existing only in your mind or imagination
Sense.TRAN: 主观想象的﹐只存在于想象之中的
Sense.EXAMPLE: our subjective perception of colours
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对色彩的主观感知

Sense.DEF: relating to the subject in grammar

RunOn.EXAMPLE: His work was judged objectively as well as subjectively.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 对他的作品有主观的评判﹐也有客观的评判。

Sense.DEF: what is being talked about in speech or writing, or represented in art
Sense.TRAN: 〔讲话﹑著作或艺术作品的〕题材﹐内容
Sense.EXAMPLE: The movie has been rated ‘R’ due to adult subject matter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片因涉及成人题材而被列为限制级。

Sense.DEF: a legal case being considered sub judice is now being dealt with by a court, and therefore is not allowed to be publicly discussed, for example in a newspaper
Sense.TRAN: 〔司法案件〕在审理中﹐尚未裁决﹔〔因尚未裁决〕不准公之于众

Sense.DEF: to defeat a person or group and make them obey you
Sense.EXAMPLE: The native population was subjugated and exploited.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 土著人被征服﹐并遭受剥削。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 被征服的人民/民族/国家

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her own needs had been subjugated to not considered as important as the needs of her family.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她自己的需要服从于她家庭的需要。

Sense.DEF: a verb form or a set of verb forms in grammar, used in some languages to express doubt, wishes etc. For example, in ‘if I were you’, the verb ‘to be’ is in the subjunctive.
Sense.TRAN: 〔语法中的〕虚拟语气〔如在 if I were you 中﹐ be 动词是虚拟语气〕

Sense.DEF: to rent to someone else a property that you rent from its owner
Sense.TRAN: 将〔租来的物业〕转租﹐分租

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I sublet my apartment to my sister, packed my van, and headed west.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把公寓转租给姐姐﹐将行李装了车﹐西行而去。

Sense.DEF: a middle rank in the Royal Navy, or someone who has this rank
to use the energy that comes from sexual feelings to do something, such as work or art, that is more acceptable to your society
Sense.TRAN: 使升华﹐使高尚化〔指把性欲冲动转移到艺术创作等更能被社会认可的行为中去〕

Sense.DEF: something that is sublime is so good or beautiful that it affects you deeply
Sense.TRAN: 卓越的﹐超群的﹔令人赞叹的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The view was sublime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 景色十分迷人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her songs are a sublime fusion of pop and Brazilian music.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的歌曲是流行乐和巴西音乐的巧妙融合。

Sense.DEF: used to describe feelings or behaviour that are very great or extreme, especially when someone seems not to notice what is happening around them
Sense.EXAMPLE: an air of sublime contentment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极为满足的神态

Sense.DEF: something that is so good or beautiful that you are deeply affected by it
Sense.TRAN: 高尚﹐崇高﹔壮丽﹐宏伟﹔庄严
Sense.EXAMPLE: The works on display range from the mainstream to the sublime.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 展出的作品有主流的﹐也有非凡出众的。

Sense.LEXUNIT: from the sublime to the ridiculous
Sense.DEF: used to say that a serious and important thing or event is being followed by something very silly, unimportant, or bad
Sense.TRAN: 〔指事物或事件〕从高超到荒谬﹐从一个极端到另一个极端

Sense.DEF: affecting your mind in a way that you are not conscious of
Sense.TRAN: 潜意识的﹐下意识的﹔潜在的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a subliminal message
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 潜在的含义

GramExa.GLOSS: with hidden messages and pictures in it

Sense.DEF:
a type of
machine gun
that is light and easily moved
a ship, especially a military one, that can stay under water
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nuclear submarine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 核潜艇

Sense.DEF: growing or used under the sea
Sense.TRAN: 生于海底[海中]的﹔海底使用的
Sense.EXAMPLE: submarine plant life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海生植物

Sense.DEF: a sailor living and working in a submarine
a long bread roll which is split open and filled with meat, cheese etc
Sense.TRAN: 潜艇[大型]三明治〔长面包纵向切开﹐中间夹肉﹑奶酪等〕

Subsense.DEF: to cover something completely with water or another liquid
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The tunnel entrance was submerged by rising sea water.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 隧道入口被涨起的海水淹没。

Subsense.DEF: to go under the surface of the water and be completely covered by it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The submarine submerged.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 潜艇潜入水中。

Sense.DEF: to hide feelings, ideas, or opinions and make yourself stop thinking about them
Sense.TRAN: 掩盖﹐遮掩〔感情﹑想法或观点〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Feelings she thought she’d submerged were surfacing again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她以为已经抑制住的情感再一次涌上心头。

Sense.DEF: to make yourself very busy doing something, especially in order to forget about something else
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤为了忘记别的事而〕让自己沉浸在某事中﹐埋头于某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alice submerged herself in work to try and forget about Tom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艾丽斯埋头工作﹐试图忘记汤姆。

Sense.DEF: a small vehicle that can travel under water, especially one that travels to very great depths in the ocean for scientific purposes
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指用于科研目的的〕深潜器﹐潜水器

Sense.DEF: the action of going under water, or the state of being completely covered in liquid
the state of being completely controlled by a person or group, and accepting that you have to obey them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Napoleon threatened to starve the country into submission.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拿破仑扬言要让这个国家挨饿到屈服。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His head was bowed in submission.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他顺从地低着头。

Sense.DEF: when you give or show something to someone in authority, for them to consider or approve
Sense.EXAMPLE: The deadline for the submission of proposals is May 1st.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 呈交提案的最后期限是 5 月 1 日。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Plans were drawn up for submission to the housing council.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计划已起草﹐要提交给住房委员会。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Submissions will not be accepted after May.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过了5月再提交将不予接受。

Sense.DEF: an opinion or thought that you state
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is important, in my submission , that a wider view of the matter be taken.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为﹐对待这件事一定要有更加宽阔的视野。

Sense.DEF: a request or suggestion that is given to a judge for them to consider
Sense.TRAN: 提交仲裁的要求﹔提请考虑的建议

Sense.DEF: always willing to obey someone and never disagreeing with them, even if they are unkind to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: In those days, women were expected to be quiet and submissive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时的妇女都要寡言恭顺。

Sense.DEF: to give a plan, piece of writing etc to someone in authority for them to consider or approve

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All applications must be submitted by Monday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有申请必须在星期一前递交。

Sense.DEF: to agree to obey someone or something or to go through a process, especially when you have no choice
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指无可选择时〕同意服从[遵守﹐接受]﹐顺从

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Derek has agreed to submit to questioning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 德雷克同意接受讯问。

Sense.DEF: to suggest or say something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I submit that the jury has been influenced by the publicity in this case.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为﹐在本案的审理过程中﹐陪审团受到了媒体报道的影响。

Sense.DEF: less or lower than normal
Sense.TRAN: 比正常少的﹐低于正常的
Sense.EXAMPLE: subnormal temperatures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低于正常的温度

Sense.DEF: in a less important position than someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: a subordinate officer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下级官员

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Women were subordinate to men.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女人以前是从属于男人的。

Sense.DEF: less important than something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These aims were subordinate to the main aims of the mission.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 和这次任务的主要目标相比﹐这些目标是次要的。

Sense.DEF: someone who has a lower position and less authority than someone else in an organization
to put someone or something in a less important position
Sense.TRAN: 使处于次要地位﹐使从属于

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Why subordinate your wishes to those of your family?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你为什么把自己的愿望置于家人的愿望之下？

Sense.DEF:
a
dependent clause
to persuade someone to tell lies in a court of law or to do something else that is illegal, especially for money
Sense.TRAN: 唆使﹔收买〔某人〕作伪证[做其他非法的事]
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to suborn a witness
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 收买证人的企图

Sense.DEF:
a
plot set of events
that is connected with but less important than the main plot in a story, play etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔小说﹑剧本等的〕次要情节﹐从属情节
Sense.EXAMPLE: the novel’s romantic subplot
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小说的爱情支线

Sense.DEF:
a written order to come to a court of law and be a
witness

to order someone to come to a court of law and be a
witness
Sense.TRAN: 用传票传唤〔某人〕出庭作证
Sense.EXAMPLE: James was subpoenaed as a witness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯被传唤出庭作证。

Sense.DEF: a small British post office that has fewer services than a main post office

a subprime
loan
is an amount of money that is lent to someone who may not be able to pay it back, usually at a higher than normal rate of interest
Sense.EXAMPLE: Subprime mortgages loans to buy a home are granted to individuals who would not qualify for a conventional mortgage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 次级贷款贷给不符合常规贷款条件的个人。

Sense.DEF: to pay money, usually once a year, to have copies of a newspaper or magazine sent to you, or to have some other service
Sense.TRAN: 订阅〔报纸或杂志〕﹐订购〔服务〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You can subscribe to the magazine for as little as $32 a year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一年只需 32 美元就可以订阅这份杂志。

Sense.DEF: to pay money regularly to be a member of an organization or to help its work
Sense.TRAN: 定期缴纳会员费﹔定期捐款

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She subscribes to an environmental action group.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她定期捐款给一个环境行动组织。

Sense.DEF:
to agree to buy or pay for
share s

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Each employee may subscribe for up to £2,000 worth of shares.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每位员工最高可以认购价值 2,000 英镑的股份。

Sense.DEF: if you subscribe to an idea, you agree with it or support it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have never subscribed to the view that schooldays are the happiest days of your life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从未赞同过这样的看法﹐以为学生时代是一生中最快乐的日子。

Sense.DEF: someone who pays money, usually once a year, to receive copies of a newspaper or magazine, or to have a service
Sense.TRAN: 〔报纸或杂志的〕订阅者﹐订户﹔〔某项服务的〕消费者﹐用户
Sense.EXAMPLE: cable television subscribers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有线电视用户

Sense.DEF: someone who pays money to be part of an organization or to help its work
an amount of money you pay, usually once a year, to receive copies of a newspaper or magazine, or receive a service, or the act of paying money for this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are you interested in taking out a subscription to ‘Newsweek’ arranging to buy it on a regular basis ?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有兴趣订阅《新闻周刊》吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: You may cancel your subscription at any time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你随时可以取消订阅。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve decided not to renew my subscription .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决定不再续订了。

Sense.DEF: an amount of money you pay regularly to be a member of an organization or to help its work, or the act of paying money for this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a subscription to Amnesty International
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 向大赦国际缴纳的会费

Sense.DEF: when people in a country or place give money in order to pay for something to be done
Sense.EXAMPLE: The church’s 120-foot Gothic spire was paid for by public subscription in 1939.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座教堂 120 英尺高的哥特式尖塔是 1939 年由公众捐资建成的。

Sense.DEF:
a part of a
section
, especially in a legal document
happening or coming after something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: These skills were passed on to subsequent generations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些技能代代相传。
Sense.EXAMPLE: subsequent pages of the book
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接下去的书页

GramExa.EXAMPLE: events that happened subsequent to the accident
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那场事故之后发生的事情

Sense.DEF: after an event in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book was subsequently translated into 15 languages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该书后来被译成 15 种语言。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Subsequently, the company filed for bankruptcy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随后﹐该公司申请了破产。

Sense.DEF: always obeying another person and doing everything they want you to do – used when someone seems too weak and powerless
Sense.TRAN: 恭顺的﹐屈从的﹐卑躬屈膝的〔用于表示某人太软弱无能〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don remained entirely subservient to his father.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 唐一直对他父亲百依百顺。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His wife refused to accept a traditional subservient role.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的妻子不愿接受事事顺从的传统角色。

Sense.DEF: less important than something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the rights of the individual are made subservient to the interests of the state.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 个人权利被要求服从于国家利益。

Sense.DEF: a group of people or things that is part of a larger group of people or things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a small subset of the city’s immigrant population
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该城市移民人口中的一小部分

Sense.DEF: if a feeling, pain, sound etc subsides, it gradually becomes less and then stops
Sense.TRAN: 〔感情﹑痛苦﹑声音等〕逐渐减弱﹔平静下来﹐平息
Sense.EXAMPLE: Simon waited until the laughter subsided.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西蒙一直等到笑声平息下来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pains in his head had subsided, but he still felt dizzy and sick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的头痛已经减轻﹐但仍感到眩晕和恶心。

Sense.DEF: if a building or an area of land subsides, it gradually sinks to a lower level
Sense.EXAMPLE: After the heavy rains, part of the road subsided.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大雨过后﹐部分路面塌陷了。

Sense.DEF: if bad weather conditions subside, they gradually return to a normal state
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wind gradually subsided, and all was quiet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 风逐渐平息﹐一切又恢复了平静。

Sense.DEF: if water, especially flood water, subsides, it gradually goes underground or back to a normal level
Sense.EXAMPLE: When the floods subsided, the streets were littered with bodies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 洪水渐退﹐尸横大街。

Sense.DEF: the process by which an area of land sinks to a lower level than the land surrounding it, or a building begins to sink into the ground
Sense.TRAN: 〔土地的〕塌陷﹐下陷﹔〔建筑物的〕沉降
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is your house insured against subsidence?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你给房子投保沉降险了吗？

Sense.DEF:
a word meaning a political
policy 1
in which power to make decisions is given to a smaller group – used especially about the European Union giving power to its member countries
Sense.TRAN: 权力下放政策﹐权力自主（原则）〔尤指欧盟给予各成员国更多自主权的政策〕

Sense.DEF: a company that is owned or controlled by another larger company
Sense.EXAMPLE: a subsidiary of a US company
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家美国公司的子公司
Sense.EXAMPLE: one of our Japanese subsidiaries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在日本的附属公司之一

Sense.DEF: connected with, but less important than, something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: a subsidiary hypothesis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个附带假设

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All other issues are subsidiary to this one.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他所有问题都是这个问题连带出来的。

Sense.DEF: if a government or organization subsidizes a company, activity etc, it pays part of its costs
Sense.EXAMPLE: Farming is heavily subsidized subsidized a lot by the government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 农业得到政府的大量补贴。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 受到大量补贴的出口农产品

Sense.DEF: money that is paid by a government or organization to make prices lower, reduce the cost of producing goods etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔政府或组织为平抑物价﹑降低生产成本等而提供的〕津贴﹐补贴﹐补助金

GramExa.EXAMPLE: international disagreement over trade subsidies
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关贸易补贴的国际纠纷

Sense.DEF: to stay alive when you only have small amounts of food or money
Sense.TRAN: 〔以很少的食物或钱〕维持生活﹐生存下去

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We had to subsist on bread and water.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不得不靠面包和水维持生命。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Old people often have to subsist on very low incomes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 老人往往不得不依靠很低的收入来维持生计。

Sense.DEF: to continue to exist
the condition of only just having enough money or food to stay alive
Sense.TRAN: 〔以仅仅足够的食物或钱〕维持生活﹔生存﹐生计
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many of the families are forced to live at the subsistence level.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多家庭被迫生活在基本生活水准线上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The land provided subsistence and little more.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这块土地只能提供人们的基本生活所需﹐别无富余。

Sense.DEF: farming that produces just enough food for the farmer to live on, but does not produce enough food to sell to other people
Sense.TRAN: 〔收成仅够维持生存的〕生存农耕/农业等

Sense.DEF: money that is paid to someone so that they can buy meals, pay for a place to stay etc
Sense.TRAN: 仅够维持生存的补助/金额等

Sense.DEF: the layer of soil between the ground’s surface and the lower layer of hard rock
slower than the speed of sound

a group of similar plants or animals that is smaller than a
species
a particular type of solid, liquid, or gas
Sense.EXAMPLE: The leaves were covered with a strange sticky substance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 树叶上覆着一层黏糊糊的怪东西。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: harmful substances in the atmosphere
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大气中的有害物质
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Plutonium 238 is one of the most toxic substances known to man.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 钚238是人类已知毒性最强的物质之一。

GramExa.GLOSS: used especially about illegal drugs
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 非法/违禁/管制品〔尤指毒品〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Police found an illegal substance in his car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察在他的车里发现了违禁品。

Sense.GRAM: U usually in questions and negatives
Sense.GRAMTRAN: 一般用于疑问句和否定句
Sense.DEF: if something has substance, it is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is no substance to the rumours they are untrue .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些传闻毫无根据。

GramExa.GLOSS: untrue
GramExa.EXAMPLE: O’Connell’s remarks are completely without substance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥康奈尔的话完全站不住脚。

Sense.DEF: the most important ideas contained in an argument or piece of writing
Sense.TRAN: 〔论点﹑文章的〕主旨﹐主要内容﹐要义
Sense.EXAMPLE: The substance of his argument was that people on welfare should work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他论点的主旨是享受社会福利的人应该去工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What she said, in substance, was that the mayor should resign.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她所说的话的中心意思是市长应该辞职。

Sense.DEF: importance
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was an entertaining speech, but it lacked substance there was no important information in it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 演讲很有趣味﹐但缺乏实质性的内容。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We should be discussing matters of substance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们应该讨论重要的事情。

Sense.DEF: a rich man or woman
the habit of taking too many illegal drugs, in a way that harms your health
Sense.TRAN: 药物滥用﹔〔对毒品的〕成瘾

Sense.DEF: not as good as the average, and not acceptable
Sense.EXAMPLE: substandard housing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低于标准的住宅

Sense.DEF: large in amount or number
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have the support of a substantial number of parents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有相当多家长的支持。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a substantial salary
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丰厚的薪水
Sense.EXAMPLE: a substantial breakfast
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丰盛的早餐
Sense.EXAMPLE: The document requires substantial changes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 文件需要作大量修改。

Sense.DEF: large and strongly made
Sense.TRAN: 大而坚固的﹐大而结实的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a substantial piece of furniture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一件又大又结实的家具

Sense.DEF: very much or a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: substantially higher prices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高出许多的价格
Sense.EXAMPLE: The deer population has increased substantially in recent years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 近几年﹐鹿的数量大幅增长。

Sense.DEF: used to say that in many ways something is true, the same, different etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are one or two minor differences, but they’re substantially the same text.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些文本有一两处细微差异﹐但大体上是一样的。

Sense.DEF: to prove the truth of something that someone has said, claimed etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Katzen offered little evidence to substantiate his claims .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡曾拿不出什么证据来证明他的说法。

Sense.DEF: dealing with things that are important or real

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The State Department reported that substantive discussions had taken place with Beijing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国国务院称已经和北京方面进行了实质性的商谈。

Sense.DEF: a noun
a place where electricity is passed on from the place that produces it into the main system
someone who does someone else’s job for a limited period of time, especially in a sports team or school
Sense.TRAN: 代替者﹔〔尤指〕替补队员﹔代课老师
Sense.EXAMPLE: Germany brought on a substitute at half time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 德国队在比赛半场时换上一名替补队员。
Sense.EXAMPLE: substitute goalkeeper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 替补守门员

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The coach has to find a substitute for Tim.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 教练得找人替代蒂姆。

Sense.DEF: a person or thing that you use instead of the one that you usually have, because the usual one is not available
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sugar substitute
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 糖替代品
Sense.EXAMPLE: a father substitute
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父亲的替身

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is not as good as another thing
Sense.TRAN: 不能替代某事物〔用于强调某一事物没有另一事物好〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Vitamin pills are no substitute for a healthy diet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 维生素片不能替代健康饮食。

Sense.DEF: to use something new or diffe-rent instead of something else
Sense.TRAN: 用〔新的或不同的事物〕代替

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The recipe says you can substitute yoghurt for the sour cream.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 食谱说可以用酸奶替代酸味奶油。

Sense.DEF: to do someone’s job until the person who usually does it is able to do it again

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bill substituted for Larry, who was off sick.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉里生病请假﹐由比尔替代。

Sense.DEF: to replace someone with another person, especially another player
Sense.EXAMPLE: Michael Owen had to be substituted after 20 minutes on the field.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克尔·欧文上场 20 分钟后﹐不得不被换下。

Sense.DEF: a teacher who teaches a class when the usual teacher is ill
when someone or something is replaced by someone or something else, or the person or thing being replaced
Sense.TRAN: 〔人或物的〕代替﹐替换﹔替代品﹐替代的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Coach Ross made two substitutions in the second half.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗斯教练在下半场两次换人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the substitution of English for French as the world’s common language
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英语取代法语﹐成为世界通用语言

Sense.DEF: a layer that lies beneath another layer, especially in the earth
Sense.EXAMPLE: a substratum of rock
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 底层岩石
Sense.EXAMPLE: a social substratum
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社会底层

Sense.TRAN: 〔组成社会或机构的〕基础﹐下层结构

Sense.DEF: a solid base under the ground, that supports a building above the ground
Sense.TRAN: 〔支持地面建筑的〕基础﹐下层结构﹐地下建筑﹐根基

Sense.DEF: to include someone or something as a member of a group or type, rather than considering it separately

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A wide range of offences are usually subsumed under the category of robbery.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多犯罪行为通常都被归入抢劫罪的范畴。

Sense.DEF: someone who pays rent for an apartment, office etc to the person who is renting it from the owner
Sense.TRAN: 〔公寓﹑办公室等的〕转租承租人﹐次承租人

Sense.DEF: a secret trick or slightly dishonest way of doing something, or the use of this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sereni was lured to Moscow by subterfuge.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢雷妮被人骗到了莫斯科。

Sense.DEF: beneath the surface of the earth
Sense.EXAMPLE: subterranean passage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地下通道

Sense.DEF: a hidden or second meaning behind someone’s words or actions
Sense.TRAN: 潜在含义﹐字面下的意思﹐潜台词
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s the subtext here? What’s the writer really saying?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这里的潜台词是什么？ 作者到底想说什么？

Sense.DEF: the words printed over a film in a foreign language to translate what is being said by the actors
Sense.EXAMPLE: a French film with English subtitles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 附有英语字幕的法国电影

Sense.DEF: a second title below the main title in a book, which gives more information about what is in the book, show etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The opera’s subtitle is ‘The School for Lovers’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这出歌剧的副标题是“情人学校”。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The book is subtitled ‘A Psychology of Masculinity’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书的副标题是“男性心理”。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: a subtitled version of the film

Sense.DEF: not easy to notice or understand unless you pay careful attention
Sense.TRAN: 难以察觉[理解]的﹔微妙的﹐细微的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pictures are similar, but there are subtle differences between them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些图片很相似﹐但它们之间有细微的差别。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The warning signs of the disease are so subtle that they are often ignored.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种疾病的警示征兆不易察觉﹐因而往往被忽视。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a subtle form of racism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 隐性的种族歧视

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The flavour of the dried berries is more subtle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 浆果干的味道要淡一些。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The dish had a subtle hint of ginger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这道菜微微带点姜的味道。

Sense.DEF: behaving in a skilful and clever way, especially using indirect methods or language to hide what you are trying to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think we need a more subtle approach.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为我们需要采用一种更含蓄的方式。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a subtle plan
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巧妙的计划

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She wasn’t very subtle about it. She just said she didn’t love him any more.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没有拐弯抹角﹐直说不再爱他了。

Sense.DEF: very clever in noticing and understanding things
Sense.TRAN: 敏感的﹐敏锐的﹔有辨识力的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a subtle mind
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 敏锐的头脑

Sense.DEF: the quality that something has when it has been done in a clever or skilful way, with careful attention to small details
Sense.EXAMPLE: The play lacks subtlety.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部戏不够精细。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She argued her case with considerable subtlety.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她非常巧妙地为自己的论点辩护。

Sense.DEF: a thought, idea, or detail that is important but difficult to notice or understand
Sense.TRAN: 〔想法﹑观点﹑细节中的〕微妙之处

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some of the subtleties of the language are lost in translation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 语言中的一些微妙之处在翻译过程中丢失了。

Sense.DEF: the total of a set of numbers, especially on a bill, that is added to other numbers, such as a tax, to form a complete total
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指账单上的〕小计﹐部分累计数

Sense.DEF: to take a number or an amount from a larger number or amount

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If you subtract 30 from 45, you get 15.

Sense.DEF: the process of taking a number or amount from a larger number or amount
related to or typical of an area that is near a tropical area
Sense.EXAMPLE: subtropical vegetation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亚热带植被

Sense.DEF: an area where people live which is away from the centre of a town or city
Sense.EXAMPLE: a London suburb
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个伦敦郊区

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a suburb of Los Angeles
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 洛杉矶的一个郊区

Sense.EXAMPLE: a kid from the suburbs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自郊区的小孩子

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t you get bored living out here in the suburbs?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你住在这郊区难道不觉得无聊吗？

Sense.DEF: related to a suburb, or in a suburb
Sense.EXAMPLE: a quiet, suburban street
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一条安静的郊区街道

Sense.DEF: boring and typical of people who live in the suburbs
Sense.TRAN: 乏味的﹔古板的﹔有郊区人特点的
Sense.EXAMPLE: narrow-minded, suburban attitudes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狭隘古板的态度

Sense.DEF: someone who lives in a suburb – often used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 郊区居民﹐住在郊区的人〔常含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Patsy’s father is a typical suburbanite.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕奇的父亲是个典型的郊区人。

Sense.DEF: suburbs in general, and the behaviour, opinions, and ways of living that are typical of people who live there – often used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 郊区﹔郊区人的行为﹑观念和生活方式﹔郊区习俗 〔常含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: middle-class suburbia
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 郊区中产阶级的生活状态

Sense.DEF: a gift of money, usually from a government, for a special use
Sense.TRAN: 〔特殊用途的﹑通常由政府提供的〕资助金﹐补贴费﹐津贴

Sense.DEF: secret activities that are intended to damage or destroy the power or influence of a government or established system
Sense.TRAN: 〔对政府的〕颠覆﹔〔对现有制度的〕暗中破坏
Sense.EXAMPLE: Murray was jailed for subversion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 默里因从事颠覆活动而入狱。

Sense.DEF: subversive ideas, activities etc are secret and intended to damage or destroy a government or an established system
Sense.TRAN: 〔观点﹑活动等对政府或现有制度具有〕颠覆性的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was engaged in subversive activities .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他参与了颠覆活动。

Sense.DEF: someone who secretly tries to damage or destroy the government or an established system
Sense.EXAMPLE: a known subversive
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出名的破坏分子

Sense.DEF: to try to destroy the power and influence of a government or the established system
Sense.TRAN: 颠覆﹐暗中破坏〔现政府或现有制度〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: an attempt to subvert the democratic process
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 颠覆民主进程的企图

Sense.DEF: to destroy someone’s beliefs or loyalty
Sense.TRAN: 腐蚀﹔败坏﹔使放弃〔信念或忠诚〕

Sense.DEF: a railway system that runs under the ground below a big city
Sense.EXAMPLE: the New York City subway
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纽约市的地铁
Sense.EXAMPLE: a crowded subway station
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拥挤的地铁站
Sense.EXAMPLE: Boston has the oldest subway system in the US.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 波士顿拥有美国最老的地铁运输系统。

Sense.DEF: a path for people to walk under a road or railway
Sense.TRAN: 〔公路或铁路下的〕地下通道﹐地下人行道

Sense.DEF: below zero in temperature

GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 零度以下的天气/温度

Sense.DEF: to do what you tried or wanted to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wanted to be the first woman to climb Mount Qomolangma, and she almost succeeded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她本想成为第一位登上珠穆朗玛峰的女性﹐而且差一点就成功了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Scientists claim they have succeeded in finding a cure for cancer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学家声称他们发现了一种治疗癌症的方法。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Very few people succeed in losing weight and keeping it off.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很少有人能减肥成功不反弹的。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘succeed to do something’. Say 而要说 succeed in doing something.

Sense.DEF: to have the result or effect something was intended to have
Sense.TRAN: 达到目的﹐取得预期效果
Sense.EXAMPLE: The drug therapy has not succeeded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 药物治疗没有成功。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often say that a method or treatment works rather than succeeds .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们表示某个方法或疗法有效时,通常说 work ,而不说 succeed
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We tried rebooting the computer, but that didn’t work .
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们试过重新启动电脑,但没有用。

Sense.DEF: to do well in your job, especially because you have worked hard at it for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 〔在事业上〕取得成功﹐功成名就

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m not sure he has the determination to succeed as an actor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不敢肯定他是否有决心当一名成功演员。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a woman who succeeded in politics
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在政界很有成就的一位女性

Sense.DEF: to be the next person to take a position or job after someone else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Reeves will succeed Segal as Speaker of the House.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 里夫斯将接替西格尔担任议院议长。

GramExa.GLOSS: to be the next king or queen after someone else
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Who will succeed him to the throne?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁将继承他的王位？

Sense.DEF: to come after or replace something else, especially another product
Sense.EXAMPLE: This car is intended to succeed the popular Fiesta.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这款汽车旨在取代广受欢迎的福特嘉年华。

Sense.DEF: used to say that success often leads to even greater success
Sense.TRAN: 一事成﹐事事成﹔一顺百顺

Sense.DEF: used when someone does the opposite of what they intended to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: It seems I’ve only succeeded in upsetting you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看起来我反倒让你伤心了。

Section.SECHEADING: SUCCEED IN DOING STH 做成某事

Exponent.DEF: to do something you tried or wanted to do
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Will they succeed in winning the election?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们会赢得选举吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He wanted to make her jealous, and he succeeded.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想要让她嫉妒,而且他做到了。

Exponent.DEF: to succeed in doing something difficult, after trying hard. Manage to do sth is very commonly used instead of succeed in doing sth in everyday English.
Exponent.TRAN: 设法完成〔困难的事﹔日常英语中常用manage to do sth,而不用succeed in doing sth〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He finally managed to find an apartment near his office.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他终于在办公室附近找到了一间公寓。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry – I’m sure we’ll manage somehow.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 别着急——我肯定我们会有办法的。

Exponent.DEF: to succeed in doing something good or important
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’s achieved a lot in the short time she’s been with the company.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她进公司不久就已取得很大成绩。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If we are to achieve our goals , we have to plan properly.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们如想实现目标,就必须好好规划。

Exponent.DEF: to achieve something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The government accomplished its objective of reducing violent crime.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府实现了减少暴力犯罪的目标。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: What do you hope to accomplish this year?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年你希望实现什么目标？

Exponent.DEF: to be successful in your career, or to succeed in reaching a place or part of a competition
Exponent.TRAN: 获得成功﹔到达某处﹔进入比赛的某个阶段
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Only a few people make it to the top and become professional singers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有少数人能脱颖而出,成为职业歌手。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We finally made it to Chicago.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们终于赶到了芝加哥。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Which two teams will make it to the final?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 哪两支队伍将进入决赛？

Exponent.DEF: to succeed in doing something, especially when you could easily have not succeeded. Pull off sounds rather informal.
Exponent.TRAN: 成功完成〔困难的事﹔pull off较为不正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Italy pulled off a great victory over Germany.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 意大利大胜德国。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’d never performed on my own before, and wasn’t sure if I could pull it off.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以前从来没有独立表演过,不确定自己能否成功。

Sense.DEF: coming after something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Over the succeeding weeks things went from bad to worse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接下来的几周﹐事情越来越糟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: succeeding generations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 后代

Sense.DEF: when you achieve what you want or intend
Sense.EXAMPLE: The experiment was a big success.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实验非常成功。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I tried to contact him, but without success.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我试图联系他﹐但没有成功。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did you have any success in persuading Alan to come?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你劝动艾伦过来了吗？

Sense.DEF: when a lot of people like something, buy something, go to see something etc
Sense.TRAN: 成功的事﹐达到目的的事

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The film was a great success.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影大获成功。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Her book has enjoyed a lot of success it has been very successful .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的书十分成功。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The play was a box-office success many people went to see it .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该剧十分卖座。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The show was an overnight success it was immediately successful .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该演出一炮打响。

Sense.DEF: when someone achieves a high position in their job, on a course, in a sport, in society etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔工作﹑课程﹑体育运动﹑社会等方面的〕成功
Sense.EXAMPLE: Success isn’t everything, you know.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要知道﹐成功并不意味着一切。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has already had a lot of success in his career.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在事业上已经取得了很大的成功。

GramExa.GLOSS: be successful in a particular job
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She wasn’t much of a success as a lawyer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她当律师没干出什么大名堂。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s determined to make a success of be successful in her career.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她下决心要在事业上干出些成绩来。

Sense.DEF: when a business makes a lot of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: the success of his latest business venture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他最近一个经营项目取得的成功

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The firm wasn’t a great success.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司不是十分成功。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is successful
Sense.TRAN: 大获成功的人[事物]﹔成功的范例
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company has been a major success story.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司取得了巨大的成功。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Everyone agreed the picnic was a great success.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个人都认为那次野餐很成功。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The government claimed the policy was a major success.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府声称这项政策取得了巨大成功。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Financially, the event was a resounding success.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 从经济收入来说,这个活动非常成功。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: This plant can be grown by the absolute beginner with great success.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种植物连一窍不通的新手都能种得非常好。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The group is already achieving some success.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个团体已取得一定成功。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 商业/经济/财政上的成就

Collocate.EXAMPLE: China has had considerable success in conserving water since 1983.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 1983 年以来,中国在节水方面取得了相当大的成功。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They have a good chance of success.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们成功的希望很大。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A visitor asked Connie the secret of her success with growing roses.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名访客向康妮询问她种植玫瑰成功的秘诀。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: what percentage of actions are successful

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘make success’ or 或 ‘make a success’. Say 而要说 have success or 或 achieve success .

Sense.DEF: achieving what you wanted, or having the effect or result you intended
Sense.TRAN: 成功的﹔如愿以偿的﹐达到目的的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The operation was successful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 手术成功了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a highly successful very successful meeting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十分成功的会议

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Were you successful in persuading him to change his mind?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你说服他改变主意了吗？

Sense.DEF: a successful business, film, product etc makes a lot of money
Sense.TRAN: 〔公司﹑影片﹑产品等〕成功的﹐利润丰厚的﹐非常赚钱的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The show’s had a pretty successful run.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这演出相当成功﹐已连演多场。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a highly successful very successful product
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很成功的产品

Sense.DEF: a successful person earns a lot of money or is very well known and respected
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕有成就的﹐赚钱多的﹐出人头地的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Arthur was a highly successful very successful businessman.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿瑟是个非常成功的商人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He later became successful in politics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他后来在政坛上取得了很大成就。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I think she’ll be successful as a photographer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为她会成为一名成功的摄影师。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He successfully completed a master’s degree.

Exponent.DEF: achieving what you wanted, or having the effect or result you intended
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He applied for a visa three times and in the end he was successful.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他三次申请签证,最后如愿以偿。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The treatment was successful.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 治疗很成功。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was a highly successful campaign.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场运动相当成功。

Exponent.DEF: having the effect or result that was wanted – used especially about treatments, drugs, or methods
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指治疗﹑药物和方法〕有效的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The drug is effective against a range of diseases.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种药对多种疾病有效。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We still haven’t found an effective way to solve the problem.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们仍然没有找到解决这个问题的有效方法。

Exponent.DEF: successful as a result of winning in a game, election, war etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the captain of the victorious team
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 获胜球队的队长
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She emerged victorious in the second round of voting.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她最终在第二轮投票中胜出。

Exponent.DEF: likely to be very successful in the future, used especially about someone who is good at a job, sport, art etc
Exponent.TRAN: 大有希望的,很有前途的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a promising young athlete
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 很有前途的年轻运动员
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He gave up a promising career in banking.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他放弃了很有前途的银行事业。

Exponent.DEF: very successful – used about a company, industry, or organization that is doing well at a particular time
Exponent.TRAN: 〔公司﹑行业或团体在某一时期〕兴旺发达的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The area has a thriving tourist industry.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该地区旅游业发达。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The school is thriving academically.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该校学术成绩斐然。

Exponent.DEF: extremely successful – used about an economy, or when business or trade is increasing
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the booming economy in China
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 中国繁荣的经济
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Business is booming.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 生意很兴隆。

Sense.DEF: happening one after the other without anything diffe-rent happening in between
Sense.EXAMPLE: She won the championship four times in succession.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她连续四次夺得冠军。

GramExa.GLOSS: quickly one after the other
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He fired two shots in quick succession.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他迅速连发两枪。

Sense.DEF: a number of people or things of the same kind, following, coming, or happening one after the other
Sense.EXAMPLE: A succession of visitors came to the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 登门造访者接踵而至。

Sense.DEF: the act of taking over an official job or position, or the right to be the next to take it
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the prince dies, the succession passes to his son.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 王子如果去世﹐就由他的儿子继承。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the queen’s succession to the throne
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女王对王位的继承

Sense.DEF: coming or following one after the other
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team has had five successive victories.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这支球队已经连胜五场了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Successive governments have tried to deal with this issue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 历届政府都试图解决这个问题。

Sense.DEF: someone who takes a job or position previously held by someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: His successor died after only 15 months in office.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的继任者就任仅15个月就去世了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sure she will be a worthy successor someone who is very good and deserves to be someone’s successor .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我确信她会是个当之无愧的接班人。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: her successor to the post
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 接替她职位的人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sloan will be Barrett’s successor as treasurer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯隆将接替巴雷特担任财务主管。

Sense.DEF: a machine, system etc that exists after another one in a process of development
Sense.TRAN: 〔机器﹑操作系统等的〕换代产品﹐接替的事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: the transistor’s successor, the microchip
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晶体管的换代产品——微晶片

Sense.DEF: clearly expressed in a few words – use this to show approval
Sense.TRAN: 言简意赅的﹐简明扼要的﹐简练的〔含褒义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a succinct explanation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简明扼要的解释

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Anderson put the same point more succinctly.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 安德森把同样这一点解释得更加简明扼要。

Sense.DEF:
a dish made from corn, beans, and
tomato es
cooked together
Sense.TRAN: 青玉米粒煮利马豆〔用玉米﹑豆子和番茄一起煮成的食品〕

Sense.DEF: help and sympathy that is given to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: They give succour to the victims of war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们向战争受害者提供援助。

Sense.DEF: to give help and sympathy to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: succouring the needy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 救济穷苦的人

Sense.DEF: a female devil that in the past was believed to have sex with a sleeping man
Sense.TRAN: 〔传说中与睡眠中男子性交的〕梦淫女妖

Sense.DEF: juicy and good to eat
Sense.EXAMPLE: a succulent steak
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美味多汁的牛排

Sense.DEF:
a plant such as a
cactus
, that has thick soft leaves or stems that can hold a lot of liquid
Sense.TRAN: 肉质植物〔茎叶肥厚多水分的植物〕

Sense.DEF: to stop opposing someone or something that is stronger than you, and allow them to take control

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Succumbing to pressure from the chemical industry, Governor Blakely amended the regulations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 屈服于化工行业的压力﹐布莱克利州长修改了条例。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gina succumbed to temptation and had a second serving of cake.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉娜抵挡不住诱惑﹐吃了第二份蛋糕。

Sense.DEF: if you succumb to an illness, you become very ill or die of it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: About 400,000 Americans succumb each year to smoking-related illnesses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年大约有 40 万名美国人死于吸烟引起的疾病。

Sense.DEF: of the same kind as the thing or person which has already been mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 上述一类﹐诸如此类﹐这种﹐这类〔用于指已提到的人或事物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Such behavior is just not acceptable in this school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这类行为在本校绝不允许。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The rules make it quite clear what should be done in such a situation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 条例中明确规定了在这种情况下应当如何处理。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A victory for Brazil had been predicted, and such indeed was the result.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们预测巴西队获胜﹐结果果真如此。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She needs to see a psychiatrist or some such person.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她得去找个心理医生之类的人看看。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You said you’d be finished by today.’ ‘I said no such thing!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你说过你今天能完成的。”“我从来没这样说过！”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There is now a greater awareness of problems such as these.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在大家对这类问题的意识提高了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Birth is a natural process, and should be treated as such.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 分娩是一个自然的过程﹐也应该自然对待。

Sense.DEF: used when giving an example of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cartoon characters such as Mickey Mouse and Snoopy are still popular.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米老鼠﹑史努比等卡通人物仍然流行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: large electrical goods such as television sets and washing machines
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视机和洗衣机等大型电器

GramExa.GLOSS: used to ask someone to give an example
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘There are lots of useful things you could do.’ ‘Such as?’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “有很多有益的事你可以做。”“举例来说呢？”

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize your description of something or someone
Sense.TRAN: 这样﹐如此﹐非常〔用于强调〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re such nice people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们真是好人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s such a long way from here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离这儿太远了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt such an idiot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得自己太傻了。

Subsense.DEF: used to mention the result of a quality that something or someone has
Subsense.TRAN: 如此﹐这么〔用于谈到某个品质带来的结果〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s such a tiny kitchen that I don’t have to do much to keep it clean.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么小的厨房我不用怎么收拾就干净了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He came to such a sudden stop that we almost hit him.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他突然停下来﹐我们差点撞上他。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that something is so great, so bad etc that something else happens

GramExa.PROPFORM: be such that/as to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The force of the explosion was such that windows were blown out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 巨大的爆炸力震得窗户都碎了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: His manner was such as to offend nearly everyone he met.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他态度很恶劣﹐几乎见谁得罪谁。

GramExa.PROPFORM: in such a way/manner that/as to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He lectured in such a way that many in the audience found him impossible to understand.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他这样讲课﹐听众中有许多人都觉得很难懂。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her condition deteriorated to such an extent that a blood transfusion was considered necessary.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的病情恶化到了被认为有必要输血的地步。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you think that something is not good enough or that there is not enough of it
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于表示你认为某事不够好或不够多〕

GramExa.PROPFORM: such as it is/such as they are etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We will look at the evidence, such as it is, for each of these theories.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们会仔细研究这每一个说法的证据﹐虽然这些证据都不怎么样。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Such food as they gave us was scarcely fit to eat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们给我们的那些食物简直无法下咽。

Sense.DEF: used to refer only to people or things of a particular group or kind

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Such individuals who take up this role often find life frustrating.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 承担这种角色的人常常觉得生活令人沮丧。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Such of you as wish to leave may do so now.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们想走的现在可以走了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: there’s no such person/thing etc as sb/sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that a particular person or thing does not exist
Sense.TRAN: 没有如某人/某物这样的人/物等
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no such thing as magic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 魔法这类东西是不存在的。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that the word you are using to describe something is not exactly correct
Subsense.TRAN: 并不是真正的…﹐并非名副其实的…
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There isn’t a garden as such, just a little vegetable patch.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哪有什么花园﹐只是一块小小的菜地而已。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that something does not include or is not related to all things or people of a particular type
Subsense.TRAN: 〔用于表示并不包括全部某类人或物﹐或并非与全部某类人或物有关〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We have nothing against men as such.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对这样的男人并不反感。

Sense.DEF: used to say that other people or things like the ones you have just mentioned are included
Sense.EXAMPLE: It won’t be anything special – just a few cakes and sandwiches and such.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不会是什么特别的东西﹐就是几块蛋糕﹑几个三明治之类的。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: When using such with a singular noun, put such before ‘a’. such
F2NBox.TRAN: 与单数名词连用时,置于 a 前
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She’s such a lovely person (NOT 不说 a such lovely person).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她真是一个很亲切的人。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I doubt if such a promise has any value.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我怀疑这样的承诺有什么价值。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about a particular thing, time, amount etc without saying exactly what it is
Sense.TRAN: 某某﹔这样那样的〔表示未具体指明的事物﹑时间﹑数量等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They will ask you to come on such and such a day, at such and such a time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们会让你在某天﹑某个时间过来。

Sense.DEF: and things of that kind
Sense.TRAN: 这一类的事物﹐诸如此类的东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: money for food, clothes, and suchlike
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 购买食品﹑衣服之类的钱

Sense.DEF: to take air, liquid etc into your mouth by making your lips form a small hole and using the muscles of your mouth to pull it in

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Michael put the cigarette to his lips and sucked in the smoke.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克尔把香烟放到唇边吸了一口。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a baby sucking at its mother’s breast
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个在吸吮母乳的婴儿

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jennie sucked up the last bit of milkshake with her straw.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹妮用吸管喝完最后一点奶昔。

Sense.DEF: to hold something in your mouth and pull on it with your tongue and lips
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t suck your thumb, dear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要吮大拇指﹐宝贝。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a picture of Lara sucking on a lollipop
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉拉吸吮棒棒糖的照片

Sense.DEF: to pull someone or something with great power and force into or out of a particular place
Sense.TRAN: 〔以强大的力量〕抽﹐吸﹔吞没﹐把…卷入

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A bird was sucked into one of the jet’s engines.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有只鸟被吸进喷气式飞机的一个引擎里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The river sucked him under.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 河水吞没了他。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The fluid was sucked from his lungs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他肺里的积水被抽出来。

Sense.DEF: used when you dislike something very much or think something is very bad
Sense.TRAN: 某事物真差劲﹐某事物糟透了
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you ask me, the whole thing sucks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要我说的话﹐整件事糟透了。

Sense.DEF: to use something or do something for a short time, to find out if it works, if you like it etc
