to become involved in a situation, especially a bad situation, when you do not want to
Sense.EXAMPLE: The US has no intention of getting sucked into another war in Europe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国无意卷入欧洲的又一场战争。

Sense.DEF: to say or do a lot of nice things in order to make someone like you or to get what you want – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 奉承﹐巴结﹐拍马屁 〔含贬义〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s always sucking up to the boss.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他老是拍老板的马屁。

Sense.DEF: an act of sucking
someone who is easily tricked or persuaded to do something
Sense.TRAN: 容易上当受骗的人﹔傻瓜
Sense.EXAMPLE: You fell for that old line? Sucker!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你居然相信那种骗人的老话？ 傻瓜！

Sense.DEF: to like someone or something very much, especially so that you cannot refuse them
Sense.TRAN: 对某人/某事物入迷﹐非常喜欢某人/某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m a total sucker for seafood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对海鲜来者不拒。

Sense.DEF: a part of an insect or of an animal’s body that it uses to hold on to a surface

a
lollipop
a part of a plant that grows from the root or lower stem to become a new plant
Sense.TRAN: 根出条﹐吸根〔从植物的根部或底部长出的新枝〕

Sense.DEF:
a flat round piece of rubber that sticks to a surface by
suction
to persuade someone to do something they do not want to do, especially by tricking them or lying to them
to hit someone very quickly when they do not expect to be hit
to feed a baby or young animal with milk from the breast
Sense.TRAN: 给〔婴儿或小动物〕喂奶﹐哺乳
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sheep suckling her lamb
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一只给羊羔喂奶的绵羊

Sense.DEF: if a baby or young animal suckles, it sucks milk from a breast
a young human or animal still taking milk from its mother
the most common form of sugar
the process of removing air or liquid from an enclosed space so that another substance is sucked in, or so that two surfaces stick together
Sense.TRAN: 〔对空气或液体的〕吸﹐抽吸﹐吸出
Sense.EXAMPLE: My vacuum cleaner has very good suction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的真空吸尘器吸力很强。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a suction pump
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 抽吸泵

Sense.DEF: the force that causes a substance to be sucked into a closed space when the air or liquid already present is removed
happening, coming, or done quickly or when you do not expect it
Sense.TRAN: 突然的﹐忽然的﹐迅速而意外的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sudden change in the weather
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气的突然变化
Sense.EXAMPLE: Life is cruel, she thought, with a sudden rush of anger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活真残酷﹐她想﹐心头突然涌上一股怒气。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sudden movement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然的一动
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her death was sudden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的死很突然。

Sense.DEF: suddenly
Sense.EXAMPLE: All of a sudden the lights went out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然﹐灯都灭了。

Sense.DEF: a way of deciding the winner of a game when the scores are equal at the end. The game goes on until one player or team gains the lead.
Sense.TRAN: 突然死亡法〔加时赛中以先得分者为胜的决胜方法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sudden death play-off
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然死亡法加时赛

Sense.DEF: when a baby stops breathing and dies while it is sleeping, for no known reason
quickly and unexpectedly
Sense.TRAN: 突然﹐迅速而意外地﹐突如其来地
Sense.EXAMPLE: I suddenly realized that there was someone following me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我突然意识到有人跟着我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: George died very suddenly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治死得非常突然。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Suddenly, the eagle opened its wings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然﹐鹰展开翅膀。

Exponent.DEF: used when something happens very quickly and unexpectedly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Suddenly, there was a loud bang.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然间嘭的一声巨响。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I suddenly realized what had happened.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我突然意识到出了什么事。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Her husband died suddenly at the age of 64.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她丈夫 64 岁时突然去世。

Exponent.DEF: suddenly – used especially in stories or descriptions of past events
Exponent.TRAN: 突然〔尤用于讲述故事或描写过去的事情〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: All of a sudden, he takes a gun out of his pocket and shoots.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然,他从口袋里掏出一把枪射击。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He just all of a sudden decided to leave.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他突然就决定要走。

Exponent.DEF: suddenly and with no signs that it was going to happen – used about bad or dangerous things
Exponent.TRAN: 突然,没有警告〔用于坏事或危险情况〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: One day, he collapsed without warning.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一天,他毫无征兆就倒下了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Then, without warning, her husband left her.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 然后,她丈夫没有任何预兆地就离开了她。

Exponent.DEF: suddenly and unexpectedly – used especially when you hear from someone you have not seen for a long time or when someone tells you something that surprises you
Exponent.TRAN: 出乎意料地,突如其来地
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She turned up on my doorstep, out of the blue.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她出人意料地出现在我家门口。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The offer had come completely out of the blue.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 机会来得完全出乎意料。

Exponent.DEF: suddenly, so that there is not much time to prepare or change arrangements
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He came into the side at short notice, when another player was injured.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 另一个球员受伤,他立刻被招进球队。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Occasionally, tours may have to be cancelled at short notice.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅行偶尔会被临时取消。

Exponent.EXP: on the spur of the moment
Exponent.DEF: used when talking about things you decide to do suddenly, without planning them beforehand
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We all buy things on the spur of the moment.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都会心血来潮地买东西。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: On the spur of the moment, I decided to go and talk to her about it.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一时兴起决定去和她谈这件事。

Sense.DEF: a game in which you have to write numbers in a large square which is made up of 81 smaller squares. Each line of squares across and down, and each of the nine groups of nine squares, must contain the numbers 1 to 9 once only.
the mass of bubbles formed on the top of water with soap in it
to make a legal claim against someone, especially for money, because they have harmed you in some way
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为要求赔偿金而〕控告﹐起诉﹐告…的状
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the builders don’t fulfil their side of the contract, we’ll sue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果建筑商不履行合同﹐我们就要提出起诉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company is suing a former employee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司正在起诉一名前雇员。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Miss James could not afford to sue for libel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹姆斯小姐没钱提出诽谤诉讼。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was suing doctors for negligence over the loss of her child.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她正在为她孩子的死控告医生失职。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The railway may sue for damages in order to get money because of loss of revenue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铁道部门可能会因收入损失而提出起诉﹐要求赔偿。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is being sued for divorce in order to end a marriage by his wife.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的妻子对他提出起诉﹐要求离婚。

Sense.DEF: if a country or army sues for peace, they ask for peace, especially because there is no other good choice
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had hoped to force the North to sue for peace.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们原本是希望能迫使北方求和的。

Sense.DEF: soft leather with a slightly rough surface
Sense.TRAN: 〔外表略粗糙而料子柔软的〕绒面革﹐软皮革
Sense.EXAMPLE: suede shoes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绒面革皮鞋
Sense.EXAMPLE: a suede jacket
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绒面革夹克

Sense.DEF:
hard fat from around an animal’s
kidney s
,used in cooking in Britain
Sense.TRAN: 〔动物腰部的〕板油﹐硬脂肪油〔在英国用于烹调〕

Sense.DEF: to experience physical or mental pain
Sense.TRAN: 〔身体或精神上〕受苦﹔遭受（痛苦）
Sense.EXAMPLE: At least he died suddenly and didn’t suffer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 至少他死得突然﹐没有遭罪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s suffering a lot of pain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她遭受着巨大的痛苦。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m suffering from a bad back.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我背疼。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mary’s suffering from ill health at the moment.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 玛丽眼下身体不好。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that someone has a medical condition, rather than suffers from it.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们表达某人生病时,通常用 has 而不用 suffer from
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Both her children have asthma.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的两个孩子都有哮喘。

Sense.DEF: if someone suffers an unpleasant or difficult experience, or is in a difficult situation, it happens to them or they experience it
Sense.TRAN: 遭受（困难）﹔吃苦头﹐受损害

GramExa.EXAMPLE: London employers were suffering from a desperate shortage of school-leavers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦敦的雇主正面临中学毕业生严重短缺的困境。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of us have suffered the consequences of stupid decisions taken by others.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们大多数人都承受过因他人的愚蠢决定而造成的后果。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In June 1667, England suffered a humiliating defeat by the Dutch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1667 年 6 月﹐荷兰让英格兰遭受了耻辱性的失败。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They are unlikely to suffer any further loss of business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不太可能再遭受经营亏损。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He suffered head injuries in the crash.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在车祸中头部受伤。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A man who suffered serious brain damage during an operation is suing the hospital.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名在手术中大脑严重受损的男子正在起诉医院。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Small businesses have suffered financially during the recession.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小公司在经济衰退期间资金紧缺。

Sense.DEF: to become worse in quality because a bad situation is affecting something or because nobody is taking care of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Safety might suffer if costs are cut.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果削减成本﹐可能会影响安全。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m worried and my work is beginning to suffer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我忧心忡忡﹐工作开始受到影响。

Sense.DEF: to not be patient with people you think are stupid
Sense.TRAN: 对愚蠢的人没有耐心﹐不能耐着性子与蠢人相处
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a perfectionist who didn’t suffer fools gladly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个完美主义者﹐对笨人没有耐心。

Sense.DEF: if you live or work somewhere on sufferance, you are allowed to do it by someone who would prefer you did not do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was never going to let her forget she was only here on sufferance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他决不会让她忘记她是被勉强准许留在这儿的。

Sense.DEF: someone who suffers, especially from a particular illness
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指某种疾病的〕患者﹔受害者﹐受苦者

GramExa.EXAMPLE: sufferers from headaches
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 头痛患者

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a support group for cancer sufferers
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个帮助癌症患者的组织

Sense.DEF: serious physical or mental pain
Sense.TRAN: 〔肉体或精神上的〕痛苦﹐苦难﹐折磨
Sense.EXAMPLE: the suffering of the refugees after the war
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战后难民所遭受的苦难
Sense.EXAMPLE: the pain and suffering caused by road accidents
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 交通事故造成的痛苦

Sense.DEF: to be enough
Sense.EXAMPLE: A light lunch will suffice .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简单的午餐就够了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A few brief observations will suffice for present purposes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 简单的几回观察就足以满足现时的目的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A few more statistics will suffice to show the trends of the time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 再有一些统计数字就足以看出目前的趋势。

Sense.DEF: used to say that the statement that follows is enough to explain what you mean, even though you could say more
Sense.TRAN: 无须多说﹐只要说…就够了
Sense.EXAMPLE: Suffice it to say that they’re having marital problems.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的婚姻遇到了问题﹐无须多言。

Sense.DEF: the state of being or having enough
Sense.EXAMPLE: The war has affected the country’s economic sufficiency.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争已经影响到了这个国家的经济富足。

Sense.DEF: a supply that is enough
Sense.TRAN: 某物足够的供应﹔某物足够的量
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sufficiency of raw materials
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充足的原材料

Sense.DEF: as much as is needed for a particular purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: We can only prosecute if there is sufficient evidence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有了足够的证据﹐我们才能提出起诉。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Unauthorized absence is sufficient reason for dismissal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旷工足以成为解雇的理由。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need sufficient time to deal with the problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要足够的时间来处理这个问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The money is not sufficient to cover everything that needs doing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些钱不足以支付所有要做的事情。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The recipe is sufficient for six people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这份食谱的量足够六个人吃。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Students must reach a sufficiently high standard to pass.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生必须达到足够高的水准才能通过。

Sense.DEF: a letter or letters added to the end of a word to form a new word, such as ‘ness’ in ‘kindness’ or ‘ly’ in ‘suddenly’
Sense.TRAN: 后缀﹐词尾〔如kindness中的ness或suddenly中的ly〕

Sense.DEF: to die or make someone die by preventing them from breathing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The animal seizes its prey by the throat and suffocates it to death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种动物会抓住猎物的喉咙﹐使其窒息而死。
Sense.EXAMPLE: One of the puppies suffocated inside the plastic bag.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其中一只小狗在塑料袋里闷死了。

Sense.DEF: to feel uncomfortable because there is not enough fresh air
Sense.TRAN: 感到窒息﹐感到呼吸困难
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you open a window? I’m suffocating.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能开扇窗吗？ 我觉得很闷。

Sense.DEF: to prevent a relationship, plan, business etc from developing well or being successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jealousy can suffocate any relationship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嫉妒可以扼杀任何人际关系。

Sense.DEF: to feel as if you are not free or do not have enough space
Sense.EXAMPLE: He feels suffocated by London and longs to escape to the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他觉得在伦敦很压抑﹐渴望逃到乡下去。

Sense.DEF:
a suffragan
bishop
helps another bishop of higher rank in their work
the right to vote in national elections
a woman who tried to gain the right to vote for women, especially as a member of a group in Britain or the US in the early 20th century
Sense.TRAN: 为妇女争取选举权的女子〔尤指 20 世纪初英国或美国争取妇女选举权团体的成员〕

Sense.DEF: if warmth, colour, liquid etc suffuses something or someone, it covers or spreads through them
Sense.TRAN: 〔温暖﹑颜色﹑液体等〕充满﹐布满﹐弥漫于
Sense.EXAMPLE: The light of the setting sun suffused the clouds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 落日的霞光映红了云层。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hot colour suffused her cheeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的脸涨得又红又烫。

Sense.DEF: if someone is suffused with a feeling, they are full of that feeling
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was suffused with happiness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她心中充满喜悦。

Sense.DEF: a sweet white or brown substance that is obtained from plants and used to make food and drinks sweet
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you take sugar in your coffee?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的咖啡加糖吗？

Sense.DEF: the amount of sugar that a small spoon can hold
Sense.EXAMPLE: How many sugars do you want in your tea?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的茶里要放几茶匙糖？

Sense.DEF: one of several sweet substances formed in plants
Sense.TRAN: 糖〔植物中所形成的甜味物质〕

Sense.DEF: used to address someone you like very much
Sense.TRAN: 亲爱的﹐心肝﹐宝贝〔用于称呼自己非常喜爱的人〕

Sense.DEF: to add sugar or cover something with sugar
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you sugar my coffee?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你给我的咖啡加糖了吗？

Sense.DEF: a vegetable that grows under the ground, from which sugar is obtained
a tall tropical plant from whose stems sugar is obtained
covered with sugar
Sense.EXAMPLE: sugar-coated cereals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 裹糖的谷类食品

Sense.DEF: used to describe something that is made to seem better than it really is
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of the information is sugar-coated to stop people worrying about climate change.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多消息都被粉饰了﹐以免人们担心气候变化。

Sense.DEF: a sugar lump
an older man who gives a young person presents and money in return for their company and often for sex
Sense.TRAN: 〔以礼物和金钱换取年轻女人陪伴或性好处的〕老色迷﹐阔干爹﹐甜爹

Sense.DEF: a way of removing hair in which a sticky substance containing sugar is spread on the skin and then quickly removed
a square piece of solid sugar
containing sugar, or tasting like sugar
Sense.EXAMPLE: sugary foods
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 含糖食品

Sense.DEF: language, emotions etc that are sugary are too nice and seem insincere
Sense.TRAN: 〔语言﹑情感等〕过于甜蜜的﹐媚人的﹐甜言蜜语的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She said goodbye in a sickeningly sugary tone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她用一种甜得腻人的语调道别。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone your ideas about what they should do, where they should go etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The zoo asked its visitors to suggest a name for the new baby panda.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 动物园请游客提建议﹐给刚出生的大熊猫起一个名字。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her mother suggested that she should go and see the doctor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她妈妈建议她去看医生。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I suggest you call him first.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我建议你先给他打电话。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It has been suggested that the manager will resign if any more players are sold.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人提议﹐如果再有球员被出售﹐球队主教练就辞职。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tracey suggested meeting for a drink after work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 特雷西提议下班后一起喝一杯。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can you suggest what kind of tool I should use?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我该用哪种工具﹐你能不能给点建议？

GramExa.GLOSS: used to politely suggest a different idea
GramExa.EXAMPLE: May I suggest that you think carefully before rushing into this?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我建议你三思而后行﹐好吗？

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘suggest (someone) to do something’. Say 而要说 suggest doing something or 或 suggest that someone (should) do something.

Sense.DEF: to make someone think that a particular thing is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: Trends in spending and investment suggest a gradual economic recovery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消费和投资趋势显示经济在逐渐复苏。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Opinion polls suggest that only 10% of the population trust the government.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 民意调查显示只有10% 的人口信任政府。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The evidence suggests that single fathers are more likely to work than single mothers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 证据显示﹐单身父亲比单身母亲更有可能去工作。

Sense.DEF: to tell someone about someone or something that is suitable for a particular job or activity
Sense.TRAN: 推荐〔某职务或活动的合适人选〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: John Roberts has been suggested for the post of manager.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰·罗伯茨被推荐担任经理一职。

Sense.DEF: to state something in an indirect way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you suggesting my husband’s been drinking?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你言下之意是说我的丈夫一直在喝酒吗？

Sense.DEF: to remind someone of something or help them to ima-gine it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The stage was bare, with only the lighting to suggest a prison.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 舞台上空无一物﹐只有灯光表明这是监狱。

Sense.DEF: if an idea suggests itself, you think of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll look at my cookbooks and see if anything suggests itself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来看看食谱﹐有没有什么可以考虑的。

Sense.DEF: used to say that what you have said is not exactly what you intended to say
Sense.TRAN: 我并不是说〔用于表示自己所说的并非完全是原来想表达的意思〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not suggesting for one moment that these changes will be easy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我绝不是说作这些变革很容易。

Exponent.DEF: to tell someone your ideas about what they should do
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘Why don’t you come with us?’ Alan suggested.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “你为什么不和我们一起去呢？”艾伦建议道。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was a sunny afternoon and so I suggested going to the beach.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那天下午天气晴朗,所以我提议去海滩。

Exponent.DEF: to suggest that someone goes somewhere, tries something etc because you know that it is good and you think they will like it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Can you recommend a good restaurant near here?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能推荐一家附近的好餐厅吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s a brilliant book – I’d recommend it to anyone.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书非常好——我愿意向所有人推荐。

Exponent.DEF: to formally suggest a plan or course of action, especially at a meeting
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The government has proposed building a new town just north of the city.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府已提出在城市以北建一个新镇。

Exponent.DEF: to suggest an idea, plan, reason etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The party has put forward new proposals to reduce the number of cars in the town centre.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该党提出了一些减少市中心车流量的新提议。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The idea was first put forward by Aristotle.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个观点最早是亚里士多德提出的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A number of reasons have been put forward to explain these negative results.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 已提出多项理由来解释这些负面结果。

Exponent.DEF: to officially suggest someone for an important job or position, or a person, film etc for a prize, especially when people will vote to make a decision
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s been nominated for the Nobel Prize in Literature several times.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他多次获得诺贝尔文学奖提名。

Sense.DEF: easily influenced by other people or by things you see and hear

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At that age, kids are highly suggestible.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩在那个年龄非常容易受影响。

Sense.DEF: an idea, plan, or possibility that someone mentions, or the act of mentioning it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Any suggestions would be welcome.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何建议都欢迎。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The committee rejected the suggestion that houses should be built on this site.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 委员会否决了在这个位置建造房屋的提议。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Here are some suggestions for further activities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 以下是有关更多活动的一些建议。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My suggestion about menus was ignored.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我提出的有关菜单的建议没人理睬。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She took a seat at his suggestion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她听他的建议坐了下来。

Sense.DEF: a sign or possibility of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was never any suggestion of criminal involvement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有任何迹象表明有犯罪活动。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government have denied any suggestion of involvement in her death.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府否认与她的死有任何关联。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s some suggestion that the intruder was the same person that killed Angie.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一些迹象表明闯入者和杀死安吉的凶手是同一个人。

Sense.DEF: a slight amount of something
Sense.TRAN: 微量的某事物﹔某事物的细微迹象
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was just a suggestion of a smile on her face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她脸上只有微微的一丝笑意。

Sense.DEF:
an indirect way of making you accept an idea, for example by
hypnotism
Sense.EXAMPLE: the power of suggestion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暗示的力量

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Can I make a suggestion?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能提个建议吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A few suggestions were put forward.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人提了几条建议。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I have a suggestion for you.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对你有条建议。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We’ve come up with five suggestions.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已想出了五条建议。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be willing to listen to suggestions
be keen to listen to suggestions

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I think that’s an excellent suggestion.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为那条建议太好了。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 有益/有用/有价值的建议
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He made various helpful suggestions.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他提出了许多有益的建议。

Sense.DEF: similar to something
Sense.TRAN: 暗示的﹔示意的﹔启发的﹐引起联想的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her symptoms are suggestive of a panic disorder.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的症状类似于某种惊恐症。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was a huge sound, suggestive of whales calling each other.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 声音很大﹐就像是鲸鱼在互相召唤。

Sense.DEF: a remark, behaviour etc that is suggestive makes you think of sex
Sense.TRAN: 〔话语﹑行为等〕挑动情欲的﹐有色情意味的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He kept giving me suggestive looks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直用挑逗的目光看我。

Sense.DEF: wanting to kill yourself
Sense.TRAN: 想自杀的﹐有自杀倾向的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was depressed and almost suicidal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很抑郁﹐几乎想自杀。
Sense.EXAMPLE: For many years before treatment, Clare had suicidal tendencies behaviour that showed she wanted to kill herself .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在治疗前的许多年里﹐克莱尔都有自杀倾向。

Sense.DEF: likely to lead to death
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was suicidal trying to put out that fire.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 试图去扑灭那火是去找死。

Sense.DEF: likely to lead to a lot of damage or trouble
Sense.TRAN: 可能造成大破坏[麻烦] 的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her economic policies would prove suicidal for our economy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的经济政策最终可能会对我们的经济造成很大的破坏。

Sense.DEF: the act of killing yourself
Sense.EXAMPLE: More people commit suicide at Christmas than at any other time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣诞节期间自杀的人比其他任何时候都多。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My mother attempted suicide on many occasions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我母亲多次试图自杀。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He apparently left a suicide note letter explaining his reasons for killing himself on his desk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他显然在桌上留了封绝笔信。

Sense.DEF:
something you do that ruins your good position in politics or the
economy
Sense.TRAN: 断送政治前程/经济发展之举
Sense.EXAMPLE: He said a vote for Labour would be a vote for economic suicide.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说投工党的票等于是自毁经济。

Sense.DEF: an attack etc in which the person who carries out the attack deliberately kills himself or herself in the process of killing other people
Sense.TRAN: 自杀性攻击/任务/爆炸等

Sense.DEF: an occasion when someone deliberately threatens a police officer in order to make the police officer shoot, as a way of committing suicide
someone who hides a bomb on their body and explodes it in a public place, killing himself or herself and other people, usually for political reasons
Sense.TRAN: 〔一般出于政治目的的〕自杀性爆炸者

Sense.DEF: an arrangement between two or more people to kill themselves at the same time
Sense.TRAN: （集体）自杀协议〔指两人或两人以上约定一起自杀〕

Sense.DEF: a set of clothes made of the same material, usually including a jacket with trousers or a skirt
Sense.TRAN: 套装﹐一套衣服〔通常包括用相同衣料做的短上衣和裤子或裙子〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a grey lightweight suit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轻薄灰色套装
Sense.EXAMPLE: a business suit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 商务套装
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tweed suit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 粗花呢套装
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was wearing a black trouser suit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她穿着一套黑色裤装。

Sense.DEF: a piece of clothing or a set of clothes used for swimming, running etc
a problem or complaint that a person or company brings to a court of law to be settled
Sense.EXAMPLE: Johnson has filed suit against her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰逊对她提起了诉讼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a civil suit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民事诉讼

Sense.DEF: a man, especially a manager, who works in an office and who has to wear a suit when he is at work
Sense.TRAN: 〔上班时必须穿套装的〕办公室职员〔尤指经理〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I bought myself a mobile phone and joined the other suits on the train to the City.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给自己买了一部手机﹐和其他上班族一起坐火车到伦敦商业区去 上班。

Sense.DEF: one of the four types of cards in a set of playing cards
Sense.TRAN: 〔一副纸牌中﹐四种花色牌中的一种〕同花 色牌

Sense.DEF: something that you are good at
Sense.TRAN: 某人擅长的事﹐某人的专长﹐某人的特长
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sympathy is not Jack’s strong suit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克不太会同情别人。

Sense.DEF:
to be acceptable, suitable, or
convenient
for a particular person or in a particular situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Whatever your reason for borrowing, we have the loan that suits your needs .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管您因何贷款﹐我们都会有满足您需要的贷款。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a range of restaurants to suit all tastes .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有各种各样的餐馆可以满足所有口味。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are countryside walks to suit everyone .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有适合每个人的乡村步行路径。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We have gifts to suit every pocket of all prices .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有各种价格的礼物。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Either steak or chicken would suit me fine .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛排或鸡肉我都可以。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The climate there will suit you down to the ground suit you very well .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那儿的天气你会非常满意。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had the ability to suit her performances to the audience.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有能力使自己的表演迎合观众的口味。

Sense.DEF: clothes, colours etc that suit you make you look attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: That coat really suits Paul.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那件外套非常适合保罗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Red suits you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 红色适合你。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jill’s new hairstyle doesn’t really suit her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉尔的新发型不太适合她。

Sense.DEF: to have the right qualities to do something
Sense.TRAN: 非常适合做某事﹔具备做某事的特质
Sense.EXAMPLE: The activity holidays on offer are really best suited to groups.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前推出的活动度假产品最适合团体出游。
Sense.EXAMPLE: land well suited for agriculture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非常适合农耕的土地
Sense.EXAMPLE: the candidate most ideally suited to doing the job
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最适合做这项工作的人选

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone they can do whatever they want to, even though it annoys you or you think they are not doing the right thing
Sense.TRAN: 随你的便吧﹔你想怎样就怎样吧
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Mind if I sit here?’ he said gently. ‘Suit yourself.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我坐在这儿行吗？”他轻声说。“随便。”

Sense.DEF: to fit well into someone’s plans
Sense.TRAN: 适合某人的计划﹐合某人的心意

Sense.DEF: the degree to which something or someone has the right qualities for a particular purpose

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s no doubt about Christine’s suitability for the job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 毫无疑问﹐克里斯蒂娜适合做这份工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his suitability as a father
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他作为父亲的称职

Sense.DEF: having the right qualities for a particular person, purpose, or situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are hoping to find a suitable school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望能找到一所合适的学校。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The house is not really suitable for a large family.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所房子并不适合大家庭居住。

GramExa.PROPFORM: suitable place/time etc to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a suitable place to rear young children
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 适合养育幼儿的地方

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These crayons are not suitable to use in very hot weather.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些彩色蜡笔不适合在非常炎热的天气使用。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that someone or something is the right person or thing for them, instead of using suitable .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中,人们表达某人或某物适合某人时,通常说 the right person/thing ,而不用 suitable
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We think this is the right school for our child.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们认为这所学校很适合我们的孩子。

Exponent.DEF: having the right qualities for a particular purpose or person
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a suitable place for a picnic
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个适合野餐的地方
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They don’t consider him a suitable husband for their daughter.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们认为他不适合做他们女儿的丈夫。

Exponent.DEF: completely suitable in every way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s a nice house, but it isn’t right for us.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房子很好,但不适合我们。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We’ll tell her when the time is right.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们会在恰当的时候告诉她。

Exponent.DEF: suitable for a particular purpose. Appropriate is more formal than suitable .
Exponent.TRAN: 适合的,恰当的〔appropriate 比 suitable 正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She filled out all the appropriate forms.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把所有适用的表格都填好了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It may not be an appropriate time to ask him about it.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在问他这件事恐怕时间不合适。

Exponent.DEF: the proper tool, piece of equipment, or way of doing something is the one that most people think is most suitable
Exponent.TRAN: 〔工具﹑设备﹑方法等〕正确的,适当的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You can’t change a wheel without the proper tools.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有合适的工具没法换轮胎。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the proper procedure for hiring staff
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 聘用员工的正确程序

Exponent.DEF: if someone is suited to something, he or she has the right qualities to do it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’d be well suited to the job.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他能胜任这个工作。

Sense.DEF: wearing the right clothes, having the right information, equipment etc for a particular situation
Sense.TRAN: 衣着得体/准备妥当/装备完善等
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were relieved that Gordon had arrived at the wedding suitably dressed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到戈登穿着得体的衣服来参加婚礼﹐我们都松了一口气。

Sense.DEF: having the amount of a feeling or quality you would hope for in a particular situation
Sense.TRAN: 合乎情理地﹔如常人所期望地
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘He owns three hotels.’ The others looked suitably impressed .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他拥有三家酒店。”其他人都相应地露出了钦佩之情。

Sense.DEF: a large case with a handle, used for carrying clothes and possessions when you travel
a set of rooms, especially expensive ones in a hotel
Sense.TRAN: 套房〔尤指酒店豪华套房〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a honeymoon suite
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蜜月套房
Sense.EXAMPLE: a suite of rooms for palace guests
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 王室贵宾套房

Sense.DEF: a set of matching furniture for a room
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pink bathroom suite
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一套粉红色浴室家具

GramExa.GLOSS: a large seat and two chairs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 三件套家具〔一张长椅或沙发加两张单座椅或 沙发〕

Sense.DEF:
a group of related computer
program s
a piece of music made up of several short parts
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Nutcracker Suite
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《胡桃夹子组曲》

Sense.DEF: the people who work for or help an important person
material used for making suits, especially woven wool
a man who wants to marry a particular woman

the American spelling of
sulphate

the American spelling of
sulphide

the American spelling of
sulphur

the American spelling of
sulphur dioxide

the American spelling of
sulphur acid

the American spelling of
sulphurous
to be silently angry and refuse to be friendly or discuss what is annoying or upsetting you – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nicola sulked all morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼古拉一早上都在生闷气。

Sense.DEF: a time when someone is sulking

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mike could go into a sulk that would last for days.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克会连续好几天生闷气。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s having a sulk .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在生闷气。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a fit of the sulks
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵怒

Sense.DEF: sulking, or tending to sulk
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sulky child
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生闷气的孩子
Sense.EXAMPLE: He put on a sulky expression.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他板起了脸。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Katherine sat in a sulky silence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯瑟琳闷闷不乐地坐着﹐一声不吭。

Sense.DEF: angry and silent, especially because you feel life has been unfair to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bill sat in sullen silence and refused to eat his lunch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比尔一声不响﹐闷闷不乐地坐着﹐不肯吃午饭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a look of sullen resentment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 愤懑的眼神

Sense.DEF: a sullen sky or sea is dark and looks as if bad weather is coming
Sense.TRAN: 〔天空或大海〕灰蒙蒙的﹐阴沉的

Sense.DEF: to spoil or reduce the value of something that was perfect
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scandal that sullied his reputation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 玷污了他名誉的丑闻

Sense.DEF:
a
salt
formed from
sulphuric acid
Sense.EXAMPLE: copper sulphate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 硫酸铜

Sense.DEF: a mixture of sulphur with another substance
a common light yellow chemical substance that burns with a very strong unpleasant smell, and is used in drugs, explosives, and industry. It is a chemical element :symbol S
Sense.TRAN: 硫〔一种化学元素﹐符号为 S〕

Sense.DEF:
a poisonous gas that is a cause of air
pollution
in industrial areas
Sense.TRAN: 二氧化硫〔污染空气的有毒气体〕

Sense.DEF: a powerful acid
related to, full of, or used with sulphur
a ruler in some Islamic countries
Sense.TRAN: 苏丹〔一些伊斯兰国家统治者的称号〕

Sense.DEF:
a small pale
raisin dried fruit
without seeds, used in baking
the wife, mother, or daughter of a sultan
Sense.TRAN: 苏丹的女眷〔指其妻子﹑母亲或女儿〕

Sense.DEF: a country ruled by a sultan
Sense.TRAN: 苏丹统治的国家﹐苏丹国
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sultanate of Oman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿曼苏丹国

Sense.DEF: the position of a sultan, or the period of time during which he rules
Sense.TRAN: 苏丹的职位﹔苏丹的统治期

Sense.DEF: weather that is sultry is hot with air that feels wet
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hot and sultry day
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 又热又闷的一天
Sense.EXAMPLE: Since the rain, the air had become heavy and still and sultry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下雨后﹐空气变得凝重而闷热。

Sense.DEF: a woman who is sultry makes other people feel strong sexual attraction to her
Sense.EXAMPLE: She threw Carlo a sultry glance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她向卡洛抛了个媚眼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sultry film star
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 性感迷人的电影明星

Sense.DEF: an amount of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: He owes me a large sum of money .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他欠我一大笔钱。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the sum of £4,000
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 4,000 英镑金额

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bill wants to spend a large sum on modernizing the farm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 比尔想花一大笔钱将农场现代化。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We should be happy to buy it for a modest sum.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是能花不太多的钱就把它买下来﹐我们会很高兴。

Sense.DEF: the total produced when you add two or more numbers or amounts together
Sense.EXAMPLE: You will have to pay the sum of the two sets of costs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得支付那两笔费用的总和。

Sense.LEXUNIT: greater/more/better etc than the sum of its parts
Sense.DEF: having a quality or effectiveness as a group that you would not expect from the quality of each member
Sense.TRAN: （总体）大于部分之和﹐个体相加不如集体的力量大
Sense.EXAMPLE: The team is greater than the sum of its parts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 球队只有团结起来才最强大。

Sense.DEF: a simple calculation by adding, multiplying, dividing etc, especially one done by children at school
Sense.TRAN: 简单的计算﹐算术〔尤指小学生的加减乘除运算〕

Sense.DEF: to calculate whether you have enough money to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do your sums first before you decide how much to spend.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 算一算你有多少钱再决定花多少钱。

Sense.DEF: used before a statement that gives the main information about something in a few simple words
Sense.EXAMPLE: In sum, soul music is important to the record industry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总之﹐灵乐对于唱片业十分重要。

Sense.DEF: to give the main information in a report, speech etc in a short statement at the end
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gerald will open the debate and I will sum up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰拉尔德将第一个开始辩论﹐而我将进行总结。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: To sum up, for a healthy heart you must take regular exercise and stop smoking.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总之﹐为了心脏健康﹐你必须经常锻炼并戒烟。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In your final paragraph, sum up your argument.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在最后一段﹐总结一下你的论点。

Sense.DEF:
when a judge sums up or sums up the case at the end of a
trial
, he or she explains the main facts of the case
to describe something using only a few words
Sense.EXAMPLE: The city’s problem can be summed up in three words: too many people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个城市的问题可以用三个字来概括: 人太多。

Sense.DEF: to show the most typical qualities of someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 说明某事物的典型特征
Sense.EXAMPLE: That image sums up the whole film.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那幅画面概括了影片的全部内容。

Sense.DEF: to form a judgment or opinion about someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 对某人/某事物作出判断﹔对某人/某事物形成意见
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pat summed up the situation at a glance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕特一眼就看清了当时的情势。

Sense.DEF: used to say that a description of a situation is correct
Sense.TRAN: 主要情况 （差不多）就是这样
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘So you want us to help you change but you don’t believe change is possible?’ ‘That about sums it up.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “这么说你是想让我们帮助你改变﹐却又觉得不可能改变﹐是吧？”“差不多就是这个意思。”

Sense.DEF: having achieved the highest level in your college or university degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: He graduated summa cum laude in 1968.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1968 年他以优异的成绩毕业。

Sense.DEF: immediately, and without following the normal process
Sense.TRAN: 即刻﹔速决地﹐草草地〔未遵循惯常的程序〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was summarily dismissed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被立即开除。

Sense.DEF: to make a short statement giving only the main information and not the details of a plan, event, report etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The authors summarize their views in the introduction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 作者在序言里概述了他们的观点。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: To summarize, in most cases the schools were achieving the standards set.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总的说来﹐在大多数情况下这些学校都达到了所定的标准。

Sense.DEF: a short statement that gives the main information about something, without giving all the details
Sense.EXAMPLE: A brief summary is given on a separate sheet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摘要另写一页。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The group produces a monthly summary of their research.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该小组每个月出一份研究总结。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In summary, do not sell your shares.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总之﹐不要卖掉你的股份。

Sense.DEF: done immediately, and not following the normal process
Sense.TRAN: 立即的﹔速决的〔未遵循惯常的程序〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a summary execution
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 立即处决

Sense.DEF: a summary report, statement etc gives the main facts in a report etc without any of the details or explanations
Sense.TRAN: 总结性的﹐概括的﹐概要的

Sense.DEF: something – used in northern England
Sense.TRAN: 某事﹐某物﹐某种东西〔英格兰北部用语〕

Sense.DEF:
a
summary
or
summing-up
Sense.TRAN: 总结﹐概要﹔〔法官在审判结束时作的〕总结

Sense.DEF: the total amount or number when two or more things are added together
the time of the year when the sun is hottest and the days are longest, between spring and autumn
Sense.EXAMPLE: the long hot summer of 1976
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1976 年炎热漫长的夏天
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children play on the beach during the summer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏天孩子们在海滩上玩耍。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Miriam likes to relax in her garden in summer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏天米丽娅姆喜欢在她的花园里休息。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re going to Italy next summer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 明年夏天我们要去意大利。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a hot summer’s day
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个炎热的夏日
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sunny summer afternoon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个晴朗的夏日午后
Sense.EXAMPLE: a three-week summer vacation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为时三周的暑假

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The tourist season lasts through late summer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅游季节一直持续到夏末。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Parts of Spain are extremely hot in high summer the hottest part of summer .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盛夏时节﹐西班牙的部分地区极其炎热。

Sense.DEF: 20, 50 etc years of age
Sense.TRAN: 二十岁/五十岁等﹐二十个/五十个春秋等
Sense.EXAMPLE: a child of 11 summers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 11 岁的孩童

Sense.DEF: to spend the summer in a particular place
a place where children in the US can stay during the summer, and take part in various activities
the period of time during the summer when schools and universities are closed
a small building in your garden, where you can sit in warm weather
a British sweet dish made from pieces of bread and fruit such as berries
Sense.TRAN: 夏令布丁〔用浆果等水果和面包片做成的英式甜点〕

Sense.DEF: courses you can take in the summer at a school, university, or college
Sense.TRAN: 暑期课程﹐暑期学校﹐暑期班

Sense.DEF:
the longest day in the northern
hemisphere top half of the Earth
, around June 22nd
Sense.TRAN: 夏至〔北半球白昼最长的一天﹐在 6 月 22 日前后〕

Sense.DEF: the season when it is summer

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It doesn’t rain much in the summertime.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏季不常下雨。

Sense.DEF: the period of time during the summer when schools and universities are closed
suitable for or reminding you of the summer
Sense.EXAMPLE: a light summery dress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 轻薄的夏裙
Sense.EXAMPLE: a summery breeze
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏日微风

Sense.DEF:
a statement giving the main facts but not the details of something, especially made by a judge at the end of a
trial
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指法官在审判结束时所作的〕总结﹐总括性陈述
Sense.EXAMPLE: In his summing-up, the judge said that it was dangerous to convict on this evidence alone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官在总结中说﹐单凭这条证据就宣判有罪是危险的。

Sense.DEF: an important meeting or set of meetings between the leaders of several governments
Sense.TRAN: 首脑会议﹐最高级会议﹐峰会
Sense.EXAMPLE: the European summit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲首脑会议
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two presidents agreed to hold a summit in the spring.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两位总统商定在春天举行一次首脑会议。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a five-nation summit meeting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 五国峰会

Sense.DEF: the top of a mountain

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many people have now reached the summit of Mount Qomolangma.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在已有很多人成功登顶珠穆朗玛峰。

Sense.DEF: the greatest amount or highest level of something
Sense.TRAN: 某事物的顶峰﹐某事物的极点
Sense.EXAMPLE: His election as President represented the summit of his career.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他当选总统意味着他到达了事业的顶峰。

Sense.DEF: to order someone to come to a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Robert summoned the waiter for the bill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗伯特召唤服务员结账。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The president summoned Taylor to Washington.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统把泰勒召到华盛顿。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was summoned to attend an emergency meeting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被召去参加一个紧急会议。

Sense.DEF: to officially order someone to come to a court of law
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hugh was summoned to appear before the magistrate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休被传唤到地方法院出庭。

Sense.DEF: to try very hard to have enough of something such as courage, energy, or strength, because you need it
Sense.TRAN: 鼓起〔勇气〕﹔振作〔精神〕﹔使出〔力气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had to summon the energy to finish the race.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不得不拼尽全力跑完比赛。

Sense.DEF: to arrange for a meeting to take place and order people to come to it
Sense.EXAMPLE: He summoned a meeting of business leaders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他召集了一次商界领袖会议。

Sense.DEF: if something summons up a memory, thought, or image, it makes you remember it or think of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The smell summoned up memories of family holidays by the sea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这气味使人想起全家在海边度假的情景。

Sense.DEF: to try very hard to have enough courage, energy, or strength, because you need it
Sense.TRAN: 鼓起〔勇气〕﹔振作〔精神〕﹔使出〔力气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ruth took a deep breath, summoned up her courage, and told him the truth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 露丝深吸一口气﹐鼓起勇气﹐把真相告诉了他。

Sense.DEF: an official order to appear in a court of law
Sense.EXAMPLE: The judge must issue a summons .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官必须发出传票。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had been accused of a drug offence but police had been unable to serve a summons on him officially order him to appear in court .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被指控贩卖毒品罪﹐但警方一直无法把传票送达给他。

Sense.DEF: to order someone to appear in a court of law
Sense.TRAN: 发传票给〔某人〕﹐传唤﹐传讯
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has been summonsed to appear in court.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被传唤出庭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Basil was summonsed for wounding a police officer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴兹尔因袭警致伤受到传唤。

Sense.DEF:
a Japanese form of
wrestling
, done by men who are very large

the lowest part of a
drainage
system, where liquids or wastes remain
the part of an engine that contains the supply of oil
very impressive and expensive
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sumptuous feast
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盛宴
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sumptuous palace
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座富丽堂皇的宫殿

Sense.DEF: the whole of an amount
Sense.TRAN: 全部（东西）﹔总数﹐总量﹐总额

GramExa.EXAMPLE: That’s the sum total of my knowledge about it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是我对此事所知道的全部了。

Sense.DEF: the large bright object in the sky that gives us light and heat, and around which the Earth moves
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sky was blue and the sun was shining.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天空蔚蓝﹐阳光明媚。

Sense.DEF: the heat and light that come from the sun
Sense.TRAN: 太阳的热和光﹐阳光﹐日光
Sense.EXAMPLE: Too much sun is bad for you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过度日晒对身体不好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We sat in the sun, eating ice cream.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们坐在阳光下﹐吃着冰激凌。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the warmth of the afternoon sun
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 午后阳光的暖意

Sense.DEF:
any star around which
planet s
move
used to emphasize that you are talking about a large range of things
Sense.TRAN: 世上一切﹐天下万物〔用于强调范围很广〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can buy jeans in every colour under the sun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可以买到天底下任何颜色的牛仔裤。

Sense.DEF: if someone catches or gets the sun, they become slightly red or brown because they have been outside in the sun

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANINGS 义项 1 & 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: When I woke, the sun was shining.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我醒来的时候,阳光明媚。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: shines with a lot of light and heat
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The sun beats down on us as we work.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 干活的时候,太阳火辣辣地照在我们身上。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The rain stopped and the sun came out.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨停了,太阳出来了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: appears at the beginning of the day
Collocate.EXAMPLE: As the sun rises, the birds take flight.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 太阳一升起,鸟儿都飞了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: disappears at the end of the day
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It is a good place to sit and watch the sun go down.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一个坐看落日的好地方。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: gradually disappears at the end of the day

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The hot sun beat down on the men working.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 炎热的阳光直晒在干活的人们身上。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Tourists trudge around in the blazing sun.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 游客疲惫地在酷日底下行走。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It was a warm day with a bright sun overhead.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 明媚的阳光当空照耀,天气十分暖和。

Collocate.COLLOC: the sun is high/low in the sky
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They walked until the sun was low in the sky.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们一直走到太阳西沉。

Sense.DEF: to sit or lie outside when the sun is shining
Sense.EXAMPLE: The beaches were full of families sunning themselves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海滩上全都是在晒太阳的家庭。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= Sunday 星期日

Sense.DEF: made very hard and dry by the sun
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sun-baked ground
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被太阳烤干的土地

Sense.DEF: to sit or lie outside in the sun, especially in order to become brown
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her mother was sunbathing in the back garden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她母亲在后花园晒太阳。
Sense.HINTTRAN: There is no noun ‘sunbath’. 没有 sunbath 这个名词: Let’s go and sunbathe/do some sunbathing (NOT 不说 have a sunbath). 我们去晒晒太阳吧。

Sense.DEF: a beam of light from the sun
a metal structure the size of a bed that you lie on to make your skin brown using light from special lamps

a
sun lounger
the southern and southwestern parts of the US, from Virginia to South California. The name comes from the hot sunny climate in this area.
Sense.TRAN: 阳光地带〔指美国南部和西南部阳光充足的地带〕

Sense.DEF: cream or oil that you rub into your skin, in order to completely stop the sun’s light from burning you
red and painful skin that you can get from spending too much time in the sun
Sense.TRAN: 晒伤﹐〔日晒过量而引起的〕皮肤灼痛

Sense.DEF: having a red and painful skin as a result of spending too much time in the sun
Sense.TRAN: 晒伤的﹐〔日晒过量而引起〕皮肤灼痛的

Sense.DEF: having skin that is attractively brown as a result of spending time in the sun
a cream that you rub into your skin to stop the sun from burning you too much

a dish made from
ice cream
, fruit, sweet sauce, nuts etc
Sense.TRAN: 圣代冰激凌〔一种加水果﹑糖浆﹑果仁等的冰激凌〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a chocolate sundae
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巧克力圣代冰激凌

Sense.DEF: the day between Saturday and Monday

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re going to a match on Sunday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们星期天要去看场比赛。

Sense.EXAMPLE: What are you doing Sunday?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你星期天做什么？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sunday nights are usually pretty quiet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期天晚上通常都很安静。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was our wedding anniversary last Sunday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 上个星期天是我们的结婚纪念日。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s another antiques market this Sunday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 本周日还有一场古玩交易集市。

GramExa.GLOSS: Sunday of next week
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ll announce the winners next Sunday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们将于下周日宣布获胜者名单。

GramExa.GLOSS: one of the Sundays in the year
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Finding a dentist on a Sunday can be very difficult.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期天要找牙医会很困难。

Sense.DEF: your best clothes, worn only for special occasions or for church
an insulting expression meaning someone who annoys other people by driving too slowly
Sense.TRAN: 星期日司机〔侮辱性用语﹐指开车慢得令人生气的人〕

Crossrefto.REFLEX: never/not in a month of Sundays

Sense.DEF: a place where children are taught about Christianity on Sundays
Sense.TRAN: 主日学校〔星期日儿童接受基督教教育的场所〕

Sense.DEF: a part of a ship where people can sit in the sun
Sense.TRAN: 〔大船上供乘客坐在阳光下的〕日光甲板

Sense.DEF: to break something into parts, especially violently
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指猛烈地〕将〔某物〕分开﹔使碎开﹔割开﹔切开

Sense.DEF: an object used in the past for telling the time. The shadow of a pointed piece of metal shows the time and moves round as the sun moves.
an alcoholic drink drunk in the evening
a sun-drenched place is one where the sun shines most of the time – used especially in advertisements, magazines etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔地方〕阳光充足的﹐充满阳光的 〔尤用于广告﹑杂志等中〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: sun-drenched tropical islands
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阳光充沛的热带岛屿

Sense.DEF: a dress that you wear in hot weather, which does not cover your arms or shoulders
Sense.TRAN: 太阳裙〔一种热天穿的无袖或露肩连衣裙〕

Sense.DEF: sun-dried food has been left in the sun to dry in order to give it a particular taste
Sense.EXAMPLE: sun-dried tomatoes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晒干的番茄

Sense.DEF: small objects that are not important enough to be named separately
everyone, not just a few carefully chosen people
Sense.TRAN: 每个人〔而不是精心挑选的几个人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want you telling our private business to all and sundry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不希望你把我们的私事到处乱讲。

Sense.DEF: not similar enough to form a group
Sense.TRAN: 各种各样的﹐杂七杂八的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He makes films about animals, plants and sundry other subjects.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拍摄动物﹑植物﹐还有其他各种题材的影片。

Sense.DEF: a fish that lives in the sea and has a large round body
Sense.TRAN: 太阳鱼﹐棘臀鱼〔一种海鱼﹐体大身圆〕

Sense.DEF: a very tall plant with a large yellow flower, and seeds that can be eaten

the past participle of
sing
dark glasses that you wear to protect your eyes when the sun is very bright
a god in some ancient religions who represents the sun or has power over it
Sense.TRAN: 〔古代某些宗教信仰中的〕太阳神

Sense.DEF: a hat that you wear to protect your head from the sun

the past tense and past participle of
sink
Sense.TRAN: sink 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF: having fallen to the bottom of the sea, a lake, or a river
Sense.TRAN: 沉没的﹐沉在海[湖﹐河]底的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the wrecks of sunken ships
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沉船的残骸
Sense.EXAMPLE: sunken treasure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沉在水底的财宝

Sense.DEF: cheeks or eyes that have fallen inwards, especially because of age or illness
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因年老或患病所致〕凹陷的双颊/双眼等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her eyes looked dull and sunken.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她目光呆滞﹐眼窝深陷。

Sense.DEF: built or placed at a lower level than the surrounding floor or ground
Sense.TRAN: 低于周围地面的﹐沉降式的﹐下沉式的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Steps led down to a sunken garden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 台阶通向一个下沉式花园。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sunken bath
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嵌入地面的浴缸

Sense.DEF: sunny
Sense.EXAMPLE: the famous sun-kissed resort of Acapulco
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿卡普尔科一处阳光明媚的著名度假胜地

Sense.DEF: sun-kissed skin or hair has been made an attractive colour by the sun
a lamp that produces a special light used for making your skin brown
having no light from the sun
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sunless depths of the ocean
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阳光照不到的海洋深处

Sense.DEF: natural light that comes from the sun
Sense.EXAMPLE: The water sparkled in the bright sunlight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水面在灿烂的阳光下闪闪发亮。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The garden looked lovely in the evening sunlight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 暮色下的花园显得十分秀丽。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Sunlight streamed came in large amounts through the windows.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阳光从窗户流泻进来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shaft of sunlight beam of sunlight
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一束阳光

Sense.DEF: made brighter by light from the sun
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sunlit garden
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阳光灿烂的花园

Sense.DEF: a room with large windows and often a glass roof, designed to let in a lot of light
Sense.TRAN: 日光房﹐阳光房〔窗户很大﹐房顶常用玻璃建造以透光〕

Sense.DEF: a light chair like a folding bed, which you can sit or lie on outside
Sense.TRAN: 〔室外用的〕轻便折椅﹐日光浴椅

Sense.DEF: a Muslim who follows one of the two main branches of the Muslim religion
having a lot of light from the sun
Sense.EXAMPLE: a warm sunny day
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 温暖晴朗的一天
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sunny morning
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 艳阳高照的上午
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nice sunny room
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阳光充足的房间
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope it’s sunny tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望明天天晴。

GramExa.GLOSS: periods when it is sunny
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tuesday will be dry with sunny spells.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 周二无雨﹐间晴。

Sense.DEF: happy and friendly
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sunny smile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 灿烂的微笑

Sense.DEF: an egg that is cooked sunny-side up is cooked in hot fat on one side only, and not turned over in the pan
a room with large windows and often a glass roof, designed to let in lots of light
Sense.TRAN: 日光房﹐阳光房 〔窗户很大﹐房顶常用玻璃建造以透光〕

Sense.DEF: the time when the sun first appears in the morning

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A farmer’s day begins at sunrise.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 农民日出而作。

Sense.DEF: the coloured part of the sky where the sun is appearing in the morning
Sense.EXAMPLE: a picture of sunrise over Mount Fuji
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 富士山日出的照片

Sense.DEF:
an industry, such as
electronics
or making computers, that uses modern processes and takes the place of older industries
Sense.TRAN: 朝阳工业﹐新兴工业〔如电子工业或计算机制造业〕

Sense.DEF: a part of the roof of a car that you can open to let in air and light
a cream or oil that you rub into your skin to stop the sun from burning you
the time of day when the sun disappears and night begins

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We take the flag down at sunset.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们黄昏时降旗。

Sense.DEF: the coloured part of the sky where the sun is disappearing at the end of the day
Sense.EXAMPLE: a glorious sunset
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 壮丽的日落景象

Sense.DEF: an industry that uses old equipment and methods, usually in an area that once had many industries like it, and that is becoming less successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: sunset industries such as steel
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钢铁业等夕阳工业

Sense.DEF:
an object shaped like an
umbrella
, used especially in the past as protection from the sun
the light and heat that come from the sun when there is no cloud
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had three days of spring sunshine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们享受了三天的春日阳光。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Couples strolled in the afternoon sunshine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一对对男女在午后的阳光下漫步。

Sense.DEF: happiness
Sense.EXAMPLE: She brought sunshine into our lives.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她给我们的生活带来了阳光。

GramExa.GLOSS: a person or thing that makes you happy
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was the only ray of sunshine in her life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是她生命中唯一的一抹阳光。

Sense.DEF: used when speaking to someone you are annoyed with
Sense.TRAN: 哥们﹐老兄〔和让你生气的人说话时所用的称呼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Look, sunshine, I’ve had just about enough of you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喂﹐老兄﹐我受够你了！

Sense.DEF: a small dark area on the sun’s surface
fever, weakness etc caused by being outside in the sun for too long
brown skin that someone with pale skin gets after they have spent time in the sun
Sense.TRAN: 晒黑的皮肤﹐古铜色皮肤

Sense.DEF: a cream or oil that you rub into your skin to stop the sun from burning you too much
a place that is sheltered and gets a lot of heat and light from the sun

someone who likes to lie in the sun to get a
suntan
to drink something
to eat supper
extremely good
Sense.EXAMPLE: an old car in super condition
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆状况极好的旧车
Sense.EXAMPLE: That sounds super.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那听起来棒极了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What a super idea!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个主意太妙了！

Sense.DEF:
a
superintendent 4
extremely
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry, I’m super tired, I have to turn in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我累得很﹐得上床睡觉了。

Sense.DEF: more, larger, greater, or more powerful
Sense.EXAMPLE: the super-rich
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极富有的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: super-efficient
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 效率极高的
Sense.EXAMPLE: super-fit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极其强健的

Sense.DEF: more than enough of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a superabundance of cars in our streets
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们街道上过多的车辆

Sense.DEF: old and no longer useful or no longer able to do things
Sense.TRAN: 陈旧的﹔过时无用的﹔老弱无能的
Sense.EXAMPLE: superannuated sportsmen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 走下坡路的运动员
Sense.EXAMPLE: superannuated computing equipment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过时的计算机设备

Sense.DEF:
money paid as a
pension 1
,especially from your former employer
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指由前雇主支付的〕退休金﹐养老金

Sense.DEF:
a type of
pension plan
that is paid for by your employer
Sense.TRAN: 〔由雇主支付的〕退休金方案﹐养老金方案

Sense.DEF: extremely good
Sense.EXAMPLE: The food was superb.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 食物好吃极了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: superb weather
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极好的天气

Sense.DEF: a football game played in the US each year, usually in late January on a Sunday, known as Super Bowl Sunday. The game decides which team is the winning team of the year in the NFL the American National Football League .
Sense.TRAN: 超级杯〔美国国家橄榄球联盟的年度冠军赛〕

Sense.DEF:
a type of
bacteria
that cannot be killed by traditional drugs
Sense.TRAN: 〔不能用传统药物消灭的〕超级病菌

Sense.DEF:
a supercharged engine is very powerful because air or
fuel
is supplied to it at a higher pressure than normal
behaving as if you think that other people are less important than you – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 高傲的﹐傲慢的﹐目中无人的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: supercilious wine waiters
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 傲慢的侍酒师

Sense.DEF: a computer that is more powerful than almost all other computers
the ability of some substances to allow electricity to flow through them very easily, especially at very low temperatures
a substance that allows electricity to flow through it very easily, especially at very low temperatures
extremely good
Sense.TRAN: 极好的﹐极棒的﹐了不起的

Sense.DEF:
used in Freudian
psychology
to refer to the part of your mind that tells you whether what you are doing is morally right or wrong
not studying or looking at something carefully and only seeing the most noticeable things
Sense.TRAN: 肤浅的﹐浅薄的﹐不深入的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Even a superficial inspection revealed serious flaws.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 即使是粗略的检查都发现了严重的缺陷。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They only have the most superficial understanding of prison life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们对监狱生活只有最粗浅的了解。

Sense.DEF: seeming to have a particular quality, although this is not true or real

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Despite their superficial similarities, the two novels are, in fact, very different.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这两本小说尽管表面上有相似之处﹐但实际上大不一样。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Beneath his refined manners and superficial elegance lay something treacherous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在他温文尔雅﹑貌似高贵的举止下隐藏着某种奸诈。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At a superficial level, things seem to have remained the same.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从表面上看﹐似乎一切都没变。

Sense.DEF: affecting only the surface of your skin or the outside part of something, and therefore not serious
Sense.EXAMPLE: She escaped with only superficial cuts and bruises.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她侥幸躲过一劫﹐只受了点皮外伤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: superficial damage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 表面的损坏

Sense.DEF: someone who is superficial does not think about things that are serious or important – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the other girls seemed silly and superficial to Darlene.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有其他女孩在达琳看来都是又愚蠢又肤浅。

Sense.DEF: superficial changes, difficulties etc are not important and do not have a big effect
Sense.TRAN: 〔变化﹑困难等〕不重要的﹐影响不大的
Sense.EXAMPLE: superficial changes in government policies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府政策的细微变动

Sense.DEF: existing in or relating to the top layer of something, especially soil, rock etc
a larger amount of something than is necessary
more than is needed or wanted
Sense.TRAN: 多余的﹐过剩的﹐不必要的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a modern building with no superfluous decoration
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一栋没有多余装饰的现代建筑

Sense.DEF: a food that is believed to contain a lot of substances that make you healthy
Sense.TRAN: 〔据说富含营养素的〕超级食物
Sense.EXAMPLE: These berries are considered a superfood because they are rich in vitamin C.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些浆果被认为是超级食物﹐因为它们富含维生素 C。

Sense.DEF:
a race in which competitors
ski
as fast as possible down a course with turns in it
a very strong glue that sticks very quickly and is difficult to remove
a criminal who gives the police information about many other criminals, in order to get a less severe punishment
Sense.TRAN: 〔为获得从轻处罚而〕向警方告密的罪犯﹐告发同伙的罪犯

Sense.DEF: a character in stories who uses special powers, such as great strength or the ability to fly, to help people
Sense.TRAN: 〔故事中以特异本领助人的〕超级英雄

Sense.DEF: a very large road on which you can drive fast for long distances
much greater than ordinary human powers or abilities
Sense.TRAN: 超人的﹐超出常人能力的﹔非凡的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It will require a superhuman effort to get the job done on time.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要按时完成这项工作需要付出非凡的努力。

Sense.DEF: to put one picture, image, or photograph on top of another so that both can be partly seen
Sense.TRAN: 使〔图画﹑图像﹑照片〕重叠﹐使叠加

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A photo of a cup of cappuccino had been superimposed on a picture of Venice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一杯卡布奇诺咖啡的照片叠加在威尼斯风景照上。

Sense.DEF: to combine two systems, ideas, opinions etc so that one influences the other
Sense.TRAN: 使〔两种制度﹑思想﹑意见等〕相结合﹐使融合

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Eastern themes superimposed onto Western architecture
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 融入西方建筑的东方主题

Sense.DEF: to be in charge of something, and control how it is done
a high rank in the British police, or someone who has this rank
someone who is in charge of all the schools in a particular area in the US
someone who is officially in charge of a place, job, activity etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a young park superintendent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻的公园负责人
Sense.EXAMPLE: the superintendent of the Methodist Church in Hawaii
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏威夷卫理公会负责人

Sense.DEF: someone who is in charge of an apartment building and is responsible for making repairs in it
better, more powerful, more effective etc than a similar person or thing, especially one that you are competing against
Sense.TRAN: 更好的﹔更强的﹔更有效的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fletcher’s superior technique brought him victory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗莱彻更胜一筹的技术使他取得了胜利。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Your computer is far superior to mine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的电脑比我的强多了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He loves making fun of women. It makes him feel superior .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喜欢取笑女人﹐这样让他感觉高她们一等。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a vastly superior very much better, stronger etc army
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一支强大得多的军队

Sense.DEF: thinking that you are better than other people – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 有优越感的﹐高傲的﹐傲慢的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had that superior tone of voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她带着那种傲慢的语气。

Sense.DEF: having a higher position or rank than someone else
Sense.TRAN: 职位[级别]更高的﹔上级的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t you usually salute a superior officer ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你难道平时不向上级军官敬礼的吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a superior court
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上级法院

Sense.DEF: of very good quality – used especially in advertising
Sense.TRAN: 质量上乘的﹐优质的〔尤用于广告〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a superior wine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 优质[上等]葡萄酒

Sense.DEF: someone who has a higher rank or position than you, especially in a job
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a good working relationship with his immediate superior the person directly above him .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他和他的顶头上司工作关系很融洽。

Sense.DEF: the quality of being better, more skilful, more powerful etc than other people or things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the supposed superiority of the male sex
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所谓的男性优越

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the intellectual superiority of humans over other animals
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人类相比其他动物所具有的智力优势

GramExa.EXAMPLE: US superiority in air power
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国在空中力量上的优势

Sense.DEF: an attitude that shows you think you are better than other people – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 优越感﹐骄傲自大〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Janet always spoke with an air of superiority.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 珍妮特说话时总显得盛气凌人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: his sense of superiority
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的优越感

Sense.DEF: excellent
Sense.EXAMPLE: a superlative performance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精彩绝伦的表演

Sense.DEF: a superlative adjective or adverb expresses the highest degree of a particular quality. For example, the superlative form of ‘tall’ is ‘tallest’.
Sense.TRAN: 〔形容词或副词〕最高级的〔如 tall 的最高级形式是 tallest〕

Sense.DEF: the superlative form of an adjective or adverb. For example, ‘biggest’ is the superlative of ‘big’.
Sense.TRAN: 〔形容词或副词的〕最高级（形式）〔如 biggest 是 big 的最高级形式〕

Sense.DEF: a word that shows that you think someone or something is very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: an actress who deserves superlatives
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位理应享有盛誉的女演员

Sense.DEF: extremely
Sense.EXAMPLE: superlatively happy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极为高兴的

Sense.DEF: a very big indoor shopping and entertainment centre, built outside a city centre
a man of unusually great ability or strength
Sense.TRAN: 超人〔具有超常能力或力量的人〕

Sense.DEF: a very large shop that sells food, drinks, and things that people need regularly in their homes
a very famous fashion model
a mother who takes care of her children, cooks, cleans the house etc, in addition to having a job outside the house, and is admired because of this
Sense.TRAN: 超级妈妈﹐超级母亲〔除了工作之外还照看孩子﹑做家务并因此受人钦佩的妈妈〕

Sense.DEF: impossible to explain by natural causes, and therefore seeming to involve the powers of gods or magic
Sense.TRAN: 超自然的﹔奇异的﹔神奇的
Sense.EXAMPLE: supernatural powers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 超自然力量

Sense.DEF: events, powers, and creatures that cannot be explained, and seem to involve gods or magic
Sense.TRAN: 超自然事件﹔超自然力量﹔超自然体
Sense.EXAMPLE: belief in the supernatural
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 相信超自然力量

Sense.DEF: a very large exploding star
a nation that has very great military and political power
written or printed above a number, letter etc
Sense.TRAN: 上角标的〔写或印在数字﹑字母等上方或上角的〕

Sense.DEF: if a new idea, product, or method supersedes another one, it becomes used instead because it is more modern or effective
Sense.TRAN: 〔新的想法﹑产品或方法〕替代﹐取代
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their map has since been superseded by photographic atlases.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的地图从此被摄影地图册取代。

Sense.DEF:
a supersize drink or meal in a
fast food
restaurant is the largest size that the restaurant serves
Sense.TRAN: 〔快餐店提供的饮料或饭食〕最大份的﹐超级份量的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Could I get a supersize fries with that?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我买那个可以配超大份薯条吗？

Sense.DEF:
to give someone a larger meal or drink in a
fast food
restaurant
Sense.TRAN: 〔在快餐店〕供应〔超大份饭食或饮料〕

Sense.DEF: faster than the speed of sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: supersonic aircraft
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 超音速飞机

Sense.DEF: an extremely famous performer, especially a musician or film actor
Sense.TRAN: 超级巨星〔尤指音乐家或电影演员〕

Sense.DEF: a group of countries that are connected very closely politically, and who often act as if they were one country
Sense.TRAN: 〔由几个国家组成或进行合作的〕超级强国﹔超国家﹐政治共同体
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was totally against the idea of a European superstate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坚决反对成立欧洲政治共同体的构想。

Sense.DEF: a belief that some objects or actions are lucky or unlucky, or that they cause events to happen, based on old ideas of magic
Sense.EXAMPLE: the old superstition that walking under a ladder is unlucky
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 认为从梯子下面穿过不吉利的古老迷信

Sense.DEF: influenced by superstitions
Sense.EXAMPLE: a superstitious woman
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个迷信的女人

Sense.DEF: a very large shop that sells a large variety of or one type of product
Sense.EXAMPLE: a DIY superstore
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自助超市

Sense.DEF: a structure that is built on top of the main part of something such as a ship or building
Sense.TRAN: 〔船﹑建筑物等的〕上部结构﹐上部[层]建筑

Sense.DEF: a political or social system that has developed from a simpler system
Sense.TRAN: 〔政治或社会制度的〕上层建筑
Sense.EXAMPLE: the whole superstructure of capitalism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 资本主义的整个上层建筑

Sense.DEF: an extremely large ship that can carry large quantities of oil or other liquids
to happen unexpectedly, especially in a way that stops or interrupts an event or situation
to be in charge of an activity or person, and make sure that things are done in the correct way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Griffiths closely supervised the research.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 格里菲思密切指导该项研究。

Sense.DEF: when you supervise someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The baby needs constant supervision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宝宝时刻都要有人照看。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Costumes and sets were also made under his supervision.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 服装和布景也由他负责。

Sense.DEF: someone who supervises a person or activity

someone who is a member of the city,
county
etc government in some parts of the US
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国某些地方的市﹑县等政府中的〕监督人

Sense.DEF: a woman who is successful in her job and also takes care of her children and home
Sense.TRAN: 〔事业成功又能照料子女和家庭的〕超级女人﹐里外都很能干的女人

Sense.DEF: lying on your back
Sense.EXAMPLE: in a supine position
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以仰卧的姿势

Sense.DEF: allowing other people to make decisions instead of you, in a way that seems very weak
Sense.TRAN: 无所作为的﹔消极的﹔软弱的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a supine and cowardly press
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 懦弱无能的新闻界

Sense.DEF: the meal that you have in the early evening
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why don’t you come over for supper on Friday?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 周五为什么不过来吃晚饭呢？
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had supper in a small Italian place.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在一家意大利小餐馆吃了晚饭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you eaten supper ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你吃过晚饭了吗？

Sense.DEF: the very light meal, for example a drink and a piece of cake, that you have just before you go to bed
to take the place of a person or thing so that they are no longer used, no longer in a position of power etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Barker was soon supplanted as party leader.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴克在党内的领导地位很快就被人取代了。

Sense.DEF: someone who is supple bends and moves easily and gracefully
Sense.EXAMPLE: She exercises every day to keep herself supple.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她每天锻炼以保持身体柔韧。

Sense.DEF: leather, skin, wood etc that is supple is soft and bends easily
Sense.TRAN: 〔皮革﹑皮肤﹑木料等〕柔软易弯的﹔柔韧的

Sense.DEF: something that you add to something else to improve it or make it complete
Sense.EXAMPLE: vitamins and other dietary supplements
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 各种维生素和其他膳食补充剂

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The payments are a supplement to his usual salary.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些钱是他平常工资之外的补充。

Sense.DEF: an additional part at the end of a book, or a separate part of a newspaper, magazine etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔书的〕附录﹔补编﹔补遗﹔〔报纸﹑杂志的〕增刊
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Sunday supplements
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期天的增刊

Sense.DEF: an amount of money that is added to the price of a service, hotel room etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Single rooms are available at a supplement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有单人房﹐费用另计。

Sense.DEF: to add something, especially to what you earn or eat, in order to increase it to an acceptable level

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kia supplements her regular salary by tutoring in the evenings.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 基亚晚上做家庭教师来帮补固定的薪水。

Sense.DEF: provided in addition to what already exists
Sense.EXAMPLE: supplementary information
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 补充信息

Sense.DEF: a supplicant
someone who asks for something, especially from someone in a position of power or from God
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指向当权者或上帝请求的〕恳求者﹐哀求者﹐祈求者

Sense.DEF: when someone asks for help from someone in power or from God
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指向当权者或上帝的〕恳求﹐哀求﹐祈求

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Paolo knelt and bowed his head in supplication.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗跪下来低头祈求。

Sense.DEF: a company or person that provides a particular product

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the UK’s largest supplier of office equipment
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国最大的办公设备供应商

Sense.DEF: an amount of something that is available to be used

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve only got a week’s supply of tablets left.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 剩下的药片只够我一周的量了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a plentiful supply of cheap labour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有大量廉价劳动力。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The nation’s fuel supplies will not last forever.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个国家的燃料供应不会无穷无尽。
Sense.EXAMPLE: To protect the food supply , the government ordered the slaughter of affected cattle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为保护食品供应﹐政府下令宰杀被感染的牛。

Sense.DEF: food, clothes, and things necessary for daily life or for a particular purpose, especially for a group of people over a period of time
Sense.TRAN: 日用（必需）品〔尤指供一群人在一段时间内用〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Supplies were brought in by air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 补给品通过空运送来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: trucks loaded with emergency supplies
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 载满紧急救援物资的卡车

GramExa.EXAMPLE: foreign aid used to buy medical supplies
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用于购买医药物资的外国援助款项

Sense.DEF: a system that is used to supply gas etc
Sense.TRAN: 煤气/电力/自来水等供应（系统）
Sense.EXAMPLE: the public water supply
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共供水系统
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you fail to pay your bill, you run the risk of having your electricity supply cut off stopped .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你不付账单﹐就有可能被断电。

Sense.DEF: when you supply something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The military government is trying to stop the supply of guns to the rebels.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 军政府试图切断叛军的枪支补给。

Sense.DEF: a ship etc used for bringing or storing supplies
to provide people with something that they need or want, especially regularly over a long period of time
Sense.TRAN: 供应﹐供给﹐提供〔所需物品〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paint for the project was supplied by the city.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该项目所用油漆由市政府提供。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: An informer supplied the police with the names of those involved in the crime.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有告密者向警方提供了涉案者的名字。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were arrested for supplying drugs to street dealers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们因向街头毒品贩子提供毒品而被逮捕。

Sense.DEF: to have a lot of something, a little of something etc
Sense.TRAN: 某物供应充分/不足/充足
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lounge was well supplied with ashtrays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休息室备有大量烟灰缸。

Sense.DEF: the relationship between the quantity of goods for sale and the quantity of goods that people want to buy, especially the way it influences prices
Sense.EXAMPLE: the law of supply and demand
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 供求法则

Sense.DEF: the different ways, places etc that an army uses to send food and equipment to its soldiers during a war
Sense.EXAMPLE: the threat to supply lines
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对补给线的威胁

Sense.DEF: the idea that if the government reduces taxes, people will be able to make more goods and this will improve a country’s economic situation
Sense.TRAN: 供应经济学〔主张政府通过减税以刺激生产从而改善国家经济形势的理论〕

Sense.DEF: a teacher who works at different schools doing the work of other teachers who are ill, on courses etc
to say that you agree with an idea, group, or person, and usually to help them because you want them to succeed
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bill was supported by a large majority in the Senate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项法案得到参议院绝大多数人的支持。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We need to support our teachers in their efforts to raise standards.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须支持我们的教师为提高教学水准所作的努力。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We strongly support the peace process.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们大力拥护和平进程。

Sense.DEF: to help someone by being sympathetic and kind to them during a difficult time in their life
Sense.TRAN: 支持﹐帮助﹐援助〔处于困难时期的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: My wife supported me enormously.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我妻子给了我极大的支持。

Sense.DEF: to provide enough money for someone to pay for all the things they need
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have a wife and two children to support .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要养活妻子和两个孩子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She supports her family by teaching evening classes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她靠教夜课养家。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have no idea how I am going to support myself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道如何来养活我自己。

Sense.DEF: to give money to a group, organization, or event etc to encourage it or pay for its costs
Sense.TRAN: 出钱帮助﹐为…提供资金﹐资助
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are a handful of charities which I support regularly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几家慈善机构我经常赞助。

Sense.DEF: to hold the weight of something, keep it in place, or prevent it from falling
Sense.EXAMPLE: The middle part of the bridge is supported by two huge towers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桥的中部由两个巨型桥塔支撑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: During sleep, our spine no longer needs to support the weight of our body.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 睡觉时﹐我们的脊柱不用再支撑体重。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I got to my feet, supporting myself on the side of the table.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我站起来﹐身体靠在桌子边上。

Sense.DEF: if results, facts, studies etc support an idea or statement, they show or prove that it is correct
Sense.EXAMPLE: The results support our original theory.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些结果证明了我们原先的理论。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is little evidence to support such explanations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几乎没有证据支持这样的解释。

Sense.DEF: to like a particular sports team and go to watch the games they play
Sense.EXAMPLE: Which team do you support ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你支持哪个球队？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve supported Liverpool all my life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我毕生都在支持利物浦队。

Sense.DEF: to provide information and material to improve a computer program or system, or to make it keep working
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t think they support that version of the program anymore.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为他们不再支持这个版本的程序了。

Sense.DEF: if land can support people or animals, it is of good enough quality to grow enough food for them to live
Sense.EXAMPLE: This land can’t support many cattle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这块土地养不了很多牛。

Sense.DEF: if water, air, or earth can support life, it is clean enough, has enough oxygen etc to keep animals or plants alive
Sense.EXAMPLE: Because of pollution, this lake is now too acid to support fish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为受到污染﹐这片湖泊现在酸性太强﹐无法维持鱼类生存。
Sense.EXAMPLE: healthy soil that can support plant life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可维持植物生长的健康土壤

Sense.DEF: to get money in order to pay for a bad habit, especially taking drugs
Sense.TRAN: 支付（不良）习惯的花费﹐用钱维持（不良）习惯〔尤指吸毒〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He turned to crime to support his habit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了维持自己的恶习﹐他走上了犯罪道路。

Section.SECHEADING: TO AGREE WITH AND HELP SB/STH赞成并支持某人/某事物

Exponent.DEF: to say that you agree with a person or idea, and usually help them because you want them to succeed
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We will support your decision.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们会支持你的决定。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Thanks to everyone who supported us throughout the trial.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 感谢所有在审理过程中支持我们的人。

Exponent.DEF: to support a person or plan by providing money or practical help – used about governments or other powerful groups
Exponent.TRAN: 资助﹐支持〔政府或其他权力团体〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The £100 million scheme is backed by the British government.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个耗资一亿英镑的计划由英国政府资助。

Exponent.DEF: to formally and officially say that you support a person, plan, or idea
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Agriculture ministers refused to endorse the Commission’s proposals.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 农业部长们拒绝支持该委员会的提议。

Exponent.DEF: to support a person or plan and help them be successful – used especially about a group of people
Exponent.TRAN: 支持某人/某事物〔尤指一群人〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The England fans really got behind the team.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格兰球迷大力支持这支球队。

Exponent.DEF: to say that you support someone or something when they are being attacked
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You were the only person who stood up for me at the meeting.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是唯一一个在会议上支持我的人。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He stood up for what he believed in.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他捍卫自己的信念。

Exponent.DEF: to support one of the people or groups involved in an argument – used especially when you disapprove of this or think it is unfair
Exponent.TRAN: 〔在争论中〕支持某人,站在某人一边〔尤用作贬义〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I felt she was siding with her mother rather than standing up for me.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得她并不支持我,而是站在她妈妈一边。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The jury often side with the defendant in these situations.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在此类情形中陪审员常常支持被告。

Sense.DEF: approval, encouragement, and perhaps help for a person, idea, plan etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Local people have given us a lot of support in our campaign.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地人对我们的活动给予了大力支持。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was widespread support for the war.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们普遍支持这场战争。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They signed a petition in support of the pay claim.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在请愿书上签名支持加薪要求。
