GramExa.EXAMPLE: He had the full support of the general committee.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他获得总会的全力支持。

Sense.DEF: sympathy and help that you give to someone who is in a difficult situation or who is very unhappy
Sense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t have made it through those times without the support of my boyfriend Rob.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有男朋友罗布的支持﹐我是不可能熬过那些日子的。

Sense.DEF: money that you give a person, group, organization etc to help pay for their costs
Sense.EXAMPLE: The European Union is considering whether to provide financial support for the expedition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧盟正在考虑是否要为这次探险提供资助。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: With your support, we can help these youngsters.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有了你们的资助﹐我们就能帮助这些年轻人。

Sense.DEF: something that presses on something else to hold it up or in position
Sense.EXAMPLE: The roof may need extra support.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 屋顶可能需要再加点支撑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the wooden supports of the bridge
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座桥的木桥墩

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She grabbed at his shoulders for support.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她抓住他的肩膀作支撑。

Sense.DEF: facts that show that an idea or statement is correct

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My own research provides some support for this view.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我自己的研究为这一观点提供了一些证据。

Sense.DEF: the help or information that you receive to improve a computer system, make it continue working, or use it correctly
Sense.EXAMPLE: our technical support team
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的技术支持小组

Sense.DEF: a band, singer, or performer that performs for a short time at the same concert as a more famous and popular band etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: We played support to a band called Shallow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们为一个名叫“沙洛”的乐队助演。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the support band
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 助演乐队
Sense.EXAMPLE: the support act the support band
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 助演乐队

Sense.DEF: help or protection that is given by one group of soldiers to another group who are fighting in a battle
Sense.EXAMPLE: logistical support
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 后勤支援

GramExa.GLOSS: help or protection that comes from people in aircraft or people on the ground

Sense.DEF: something that you wear to hold a weak or damaged part of your body in the right place
Sense.TRAN: 〔用以支撑身体的虚弱或受伤部位的〕支持 器﹐托

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The extreme right-wing parties don’t have much popular support.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 极右翼党派没有获得多少公众支持。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The American people gave him their enthusiastic support.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国人给予他热情支持。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: say that you will support someone or something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Both the opposition parties pledged full support for the new administration.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个反对党均承诺全力支持新政府。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The plan drew wide support from parents.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个计划获得了家长的广泛支持。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Try to win the support of local shopkeepers.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 争取赢得当地店主的支持。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His views were too extreme to command general support.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的观点太极端,无法得到普遍支持。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: get people’s support by making an effort
ask for and get their support
get people to support something in an active way

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He’s decided to withdraw his support for the project.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已决定收回对这个项目的支持。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There seemed to be no popular support for war.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 似乎民众并不支持战争。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is widespread support for the Government’s proposal.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府的这项计划得到了广泛支持。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A survey found strong support for the project among hospital staff.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 一项调查发现该项目获得医院员工的大力支持。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We have massive public support.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有公众的极大支持。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: That view deserves the full support of all farmers.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个观点值得所有农场主全力支持。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 全心全意的/热情的支持
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I want you to know that you have my whole-hearted support.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你知道我全心全意支持你。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when all members of a group support something

Sense.DEF: someone who supports a particular person, group, or plan

GramExa.EXAMPLE: one of Bush’s staunchest supporters
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 布什最忠实的支持者之一

GramExa.EXAMPLE: supporters of animal rights legislation
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 支持为动物权利立法的人

Sense.DEF: someone who likes a particular sports team, and often goes to watch them play
Sense.EXAMPLE: Manchester United supporters
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 曼彻斯特联队的支持者

Sense.DEF:
a group of people who meet to help each other with a particular problem, for example
alcoholism
a small part in a play or film, or the actor who plays such a part
a wall etc that supports the weight of something
giving help or encouragement, especially to someone who is in a difficult situation – used to show approval
Sense.TRAN: 支持的﹔给予帮助[鼓励]的〔含褒义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: My family were very supportive throughout the divorce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离婚过程中我的家人自始至终都很支持我。

Subsense.DEF: used to say you think something is true, although you are uncertain about it
Subsense.TRAN: 我想,我认为〔用于认为某事属实,但不敢肯定〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I suppose you’re right.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想你是对的。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: So things worked out for the best, I suppose.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那么,我想事情有了最好的结果。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Aren’t you pleased?’ ‘Yes, suppose so.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你不高兴吗？” “不,我想我很高兴。”

Subsense.DEF: used when agreeing to let someone do something, especially when you do not really want to
Subsense.TRAN: 我想〔尤用于表示勉强同意某人做某事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Can we come with you?’ ‘Oh, I suppose so.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们可以跟你一起去吗？”“噢,我看可以吧。”

Subsense.DEF: used when saying in an angry way that you expect something is true
Subsense.TRAN: 我看〔用于生气地表示预料某事属实〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I suppose you thought you were being clever!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看你是自作聪明！

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you think that something is probably true, although you wish it was not and hope someone will tell you it is not

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I suppose it’s too late to apply for that job now.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕现在申请那份工作已经太晚了。

Subsense.DEF: used when guessing that something is true
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She looked about 50, I suppose.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看她大约 50 岁左右。

Subsense.DEF: used to ask a question in an indirect way, especially if you think the answer will be ‘no’
Subsense.TRAN: 〔用于婉转地提出问题,尤用于认为得到的回答为否定回答时〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I don’t suppose you have any idea where my address book is, do you?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想你不知道我的通讯录在哪儿,是吧？

Subsense.DEF: used to ask for something in a very polite way
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I don’t suppose you’d give me a lift to the station?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能否顺便搭你的车去车站？

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you think it is unlikely something will happen
Subsense.TRAN: 我以为不会〔用于表示某事不大可能发生〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I don’t suppose I’ll ever see her again.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我再也不会见到她了。

Sense.DEF: used to ask someone their opinion about something, although you know that it is unlikely that they have any more information about the situation than you do
Sense.TRAN: 你认为…吗？〔用于征询意见,虽然知道对方不大可能掌握更多的信息〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you suppose this is the exact spot?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你觉得就是这个地方吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Who on earth do you suppose could have done this?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认为这事到底会是谁干的？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: How do you suppose he got here?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你认为他是怎么来这儿的

Sense.DEF: used when you are annoyed by what someone has just said
Sense.TRAN: 这是什么意思？〔用于表示对某人刚说的话感到生气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘It sounds like things aren’t going too well for you lately.’ ‘What’s that supposed to mean?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “听上去你近来情况不是太好。”“这是什么意思？”

Sense.DEF: used when talking about a possible condition or situation, and then imagining the result
Sense.TRAN: 假设,假定〔用于谈论可能发生的情况,并设想结果〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Look, suppose you lost your job tomorrow, what would you do?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哎,假设你明天丢掉了工作,你会怎么办呢？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Supposing it really is a fire!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要真是一场火灾呢！

Subsense.DEF: used to say what someone should or should not do, especially because of rules or what someone in authority has said
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We’re supposed to check out of the hotel by 11 o’clock.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们应该在 11 点之前从酒店退房。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’m not supposed to tell anyone.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能告诉任何人的。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: What time are you supposed to be there?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该几点到那儿？

Subsense.DEF: used to say what was or is expected or intended to happen, especially when it did not happen
Subsense.TRAN: 本应[本该]做某事/是某事物〔用于表示某事本应发生而没有发生〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: No one was supposed to know about it.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不应该有人知道此事的。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The meeting was supposed to take place on Tuesday, but we’ve had to postpone it.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会议本应该在周二召开的﹐但我们不得不将它推迟了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The new laws are supposed to prevent crime.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些新法令本该起到预防犯罪的作用。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that something is believed to be true by many people, although it might not be true or you might disagree
Subsense.TRAN: 被相信[被认为]做某事/是某事物
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The castle is supposed to be haunted.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座城堡据说闹鬼。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Dirty Harry’ is supposed to be one of Eastwood’s best films.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《辣手神探夺命枪》被认为是伊斯特伍德的最佳影片之一。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Mrs Carver is supposed to have a lot of money.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据说卡弗夫人很有钱。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.TRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘be suppose to do something’. Use 而要用 be supposed to
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: You’re supposed to take your shoes off.
He’s supposed to be very clever.

Sense.DEF: to think that something is probably true, based on what you know
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were many more deaths than was first supposed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 死亡人数远远超过最初的预料。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What makes you suppose we’re going to sell the house?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你凭什么认为我们准备卖掉这栋房子？

Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no reason to suppose it is unlikely that he’s lying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有理由认为他在说谎。

Sense.DEF: to expect that something will happen or be true, and to base your plans on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company’s plan supposes a steady increase in orders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的这个计划前提是订单会稳定地增加。

Sense.DEF: claimed by other people to be true or real, although you do not think they are right
Sense.EXAMPLE: gossip about Emma’s supposed affair with Peter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃玛和彼得所谓有私情的谣传

Sense.DEF: used when saying what many people say or believe is true, especially when you disagree with them
Sense.TRAN: 据说﹐据称﹔一般相信﹐一般看来
Sense.EXAMPLE: How could a supposedly intelligent person be so stupid?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个所谓的聪明人怎么会这么愚蠢？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anne is coming for a visit in March, supposedly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据说安妮3月份要来探访。

Sense.DEF: something that you think is true, even though you are not certain and cannot prove it
Sense.EXAMPLE: His version of events is pure supposition .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对事情的说法纯属推测。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police are acting on the supposition that she took the money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方的做法是假定她拿了钱。

Sense.DEF:
a small piece of solid medicine that is placed in someone’s
rectum
or
vagina
Sense.TRAN: 〔放入直肠或阴道内的〕栓剂﹐坐药

Sense.DEF: to stop people from opposing the government, especially by using force
Sense.EXAMPLE: The uprising was ruthlessly suppressed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 起义受到了残酷的镇压。

Sense.DEF: if important information or opinions are suppressed, people are prevented from knowing about them, even if they have a right to know
Sense.TRAN: 禁止发表﹐查禁﹐封锁〔消息或言论〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police were accused of suppressing evidence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方被指责隐瞒证据。

Sense.DEF: to stop yourself from showing your feelings
Sense.EXAMPLE: Harry could scarcely suppress a smile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈里忍俊不禁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: suppressed anger
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 强压的怒火

Sense.DEF: to prevent something from growing or developing, or from working effectively
Sense.TRAN: 抑制〔生长﹑发展﹑起作用等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The virus suppresses the body’s immune system.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种病毒抑制身体的免疫系统。

Sense.DEF: a drug or medicine that makes you less hungry, cough less etc
Sense.TRAN: 食欲/咳嗽/疼痛等抑制剂

Sense.DEF: involving more than one country
Sense.EXAMPLE: a supranational organization
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个多国组织

Sense.DEF: someone who believes that their own particular race or group is better than any other
the position in which you are more powerful or advanced than anyone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: Japan’s unchallenged supremacy in the field of electronics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日本在电子领域无人挑战的领先地位

Sense.DEF: having the highest position of power, importance, or influence
Sense.TRAN: 〔权力﹑重要性或影响力〕最高的﹐至高无上的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Supreme Allied Commander in Europe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲盟军最高指挥官
Sense.EXAMPLE: a country where the car reigns supreme is the most important thing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车占绝对优势地位的国家

Sense.DEF: the greatest possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: supreme courage in the face of terrible danger
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面对可怕危险时的极大勇气
Sense.EXAMPLE: It required a supreme effort to stay awake.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要保持清醒需要极大的努力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a matter of supreme importance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极其重要的事情

Sense.DEF: to die for your country, for a principle etc
Sense.TRAN: 为国捐躯﹔〔为原则等〕作出牺牲

Sense.DEF: God
the most important court of law in some countries or some states of the US
Sense.TRAN: 〔一些国家或美国一些州的〕最高法院

Sense.DEF: extremely or to the greatest possible degree
Sense.EXAMPLE: a supremely talented player
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 极有天赋的选手

Sense.DEF: someone who controls a particular activity, organization, or industry, and has unlimited powers
Sense.TRAN: 〔具有无限权力的〕最高权威﹐最高领导人
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= superintend-ent 〔英国的〕警司

Sense.DEF: money that you have to pay in addition to the basic price of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a 10% surcharge on airline tickets
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机票 10% 的附加费

Sense.DEF: to make someone pay an additional amount of money
confident that you know something or that something is true or correct
Sense.TRAN: 肯定的﹐确信的﹐有把握的
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘That’s Sarah’s cousin.’ ‘Are you sure?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那是萨拉的表妹。”“你肯定吗？”
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What time does the show start?’ ‘I’m not sure.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “表演什么时候开始？”“我说不准。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m sure there’s a logical explanation for all this.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我确信这一切都是有合理解释的。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are you sure that you know how to get there?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你肯定知道怎样到那里去吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: My mother, I felt sure , had not met him before.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我敢肯定我妈妈以前从未见过他。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Henry wasn’t sure how to answer this.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 亨利不清楚该如何回答这个问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m not sure if I’m pronouncing this correctly.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不太清楚这个音我发得对不对。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He wasn’t even sure of his mother’s name.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他甚至连他妈妈的名字都搞不清。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were talking about her, she was sure of that .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在谈论她﹐她很肯定。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘That’s the man I saw in the building last night.’ ‘Are you quite sure completely sure about that?’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “那就是我昨晚在大楼里看见的那个男人。”“你确定吗？”

Subsense.DEF: to find out if something is true or to check that something has been done
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Did you lock the front door?’ ‘I think so, but I’d better make sure.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “前门你锁了吗？”“我想是锁了﹐但我最好还是去查看一下。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wanted to make sure you were all right.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想确认一下你是否没事。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: First, make sure the printer has enough paper in it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 首先﹐确保打印机里有足够的纸张。

Subsense.DEF: to do something so that you can be certain of the result

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll walk you home, just to make sure no one bothers you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我陪你走回家﹐就为确保没人骚扰你。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Spain made sure of their place by holding Japan to a 1-1 draw.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 和日本队踢成 1 比 1 平让西班牙确保了自己的排名。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: Thomas would be sorry – she would make sure of that .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 托马斯会后悔的——她一定要叫他后悔。

Sense.DEF: certain about what you feel, want, like etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔对自己的感觉﹑想法﹑喜好等〕肯定的﹐确实的﹐无疑的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Are you sure you really want a divorce?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你肯定真的想要离婚吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Carla says she is very sure of her love for Tony.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡拉说她非常确定自己爱托尼。

Sense.DEF: certain to be true

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One thing’s for sure, we’ll never be able to move this furniture on our own.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一点是肯定的﹐我们自己绝对搬不动这家具。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Those black clouds are a sure sign of rain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些乌云表明肯定要下雨。

Sense.DEF: certain to happen, succeed, or have a particular result
Sense.TRAN: 肯定会〔发生﹑成功或得到某结果〕的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s sure to get nervous and say something stupid.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他肯定会紧张﹐说出一些愚蠢的话来。

GramExa.PROPFORM: sure way to do sth/of doing sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was only one sure way of finding out – and that was to visit him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有一种方法肯定能查明真相——就是去拜访他。

GramExa.GLOSS: something that will definitely happen, win, succeed etc
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定会发生的事﹔肯定会赢[成功]的事

Sense.DEF: to be certain to get something or be certain that something will happen
Sense.TRAN: 某事肯定会发生﹔一定会做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: United must beat Liverpool to be sure of winning the championship.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 曼联队必须打败利物浦队才能稳拿冠军。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can be sure of one thing – there’ll be a lot of laughs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一点可以肯定——将会笑声不断。

Sense.DEF: confident in your own abilities and opinions, sometimes in a way that annoys other people
Sense.TRAN: 有自信心的﹔（过分）自信的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kids nowadays seem very sure of themselves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今的小孩都显得很自信。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to remember to do something
Sense.TRAN: 一定要做某事﹐务必要做某事〔用于告诉某人记住做某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Be sure to ring and let us know you’ve got back safely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定要来个电话﹐让我们知道你已经平安返回。

Subsense.DEF: certainly or definitely
Subsense.EXAMPLE: No one knows for sure what really happened.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有人确切知道到底发生了什么事。

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize that something is true
Subsense.TRAN: 这是肯定的﹐毫无疑问 〔用于强调某事真实〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We’ll always need teachers, that’s for sure .
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们永远都需要教师﹐这是肯定的。

Subsense.DEF: used to agree with someone
Subsense.TRAN: 当然﹐肯定〔用于表示同意〕

Sense.DEF: used to agree to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Can you pick me up later?’ ‘Sure thing.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你过一会儿能来接我吗？”“没问题。”

Sense.DEF: used to admit that something is true, before saying something that is the opposite
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was difficult, to be sure, but somehow we managed to finish the job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项工作固然困难﹐但不管怎样我们终于完成了。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize a statement
Sense.EXAMPLE: If I could get you out of there, I sure as hell would.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我能让你离开那里﹐我一定会这么做。

Sense.DEF: if you have a sure hold or footing, your hands or feet are placed firmly so they cannot slip

Exponent.DEF: believing that something is definitely true or correct
Exponent.TRAN: 〔对某事物的真实性或正确性〕确信的,有把握的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m sure that you’re right.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我确信你是对的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘The car was a BMW.’ ‘Are you sure?’
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “那辆车是宝马。”“你肯定吗？”
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m not sure what the best thing to do is.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我说不准怎么做才最好。

Exponent.DEF: completely sure. Certain is more formal than sure , and it is very commonly used in writing.
Exponent.TRAN: 确定的,无疑的〔certain 比 sure 更正式,在书面语中很常用〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The police were certain that they had found the killer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方确定他们找到了凶手。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I think he’s married, but I’m not certain about it.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想他结婚了,但我不能肯定。

Exponent.DEF: sure that something is true, even though you cannot prove it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She became convinced that her boyfriend was seeing someone else.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她确信她男友在和其他人交往。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Brown’s wife was convinced of his innocence.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 布朗的妻子坚信他是清白的。

Exponent.DEF: completely sure that something is true, especially when other people are not sure
Exponent.TRAN: 确信的,肯定的〔尤用于他人不肯定时〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She said she was positive that the exam was next Tuesday.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她说她肯定下周二会考试。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m absolutely positive I haven’t made a mistake.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我非常确信我没弄错。

Exponent.DEF: sure that you know the truth about something that has happened, because you have enough information
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The authorities are now satisfied that her death was an accident.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前当局确信她死于意外。

Exponent.DEF: sure that something good will happen or that you will achieve something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Doctors are confident that he’ll make a full recovery.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生肯定他能完全康复。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A spokesman said the government was confident of winning the vote.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 发言人表示政府对赢得选举很有信心。

Exponent.DEF: to have no doubts in your mind about something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I have no doubt that his story is true.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我确信他说的是真的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was in no doubt about what he should do next.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他明确知道下一步该怎么办。

Exponent.DEF: to have a strong feeling that something is true or correct
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I just know that she will love this necklace.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就是知道她会喜欢这条项链。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: When the phone rang, we knew something terrible must have happened.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话一响,我们就知道一定出了什么不好的事。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something did actually happen in the way that you said it would
Sense.TRAN: 果真﹐果然（如此） 〔表示发生的事与预料的相符〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sure enough, Mike managed to get lost.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 果然﹐迈克迷路了。

Sense.DEF: used to say ‘yes’ to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Can you give me a ride to work tomorrow?’ ‘Sure.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “明天我可以搭你的车去上班吗？”“当然可以。”

Sense.DEF: used as a reply when you accept thanks from someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Thanks for your help, Karen.’ ‘Sure.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “谢谢你帮忙﹐卡伦。”“不用谢。”

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize a statement
Sense.EXAMPLE: It sure is hot out here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外面真热。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I sure hope they get there all right.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我当然希望他们安全到达那里。

Sense.DEF: used at the beginning of a statement admitting that something is true, especially before adding something very different
Sense.TRAN: 的确﹐没错〔用于陈述的开始﹐承认某事属实﹐尤用于随后补充不同看法时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sure Joey’s happy now, but will it last?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 的确﹐乔伊现在是快乐的﹐但这能持久吗？

Sense.DEF: certain to succeed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Children soon learn that bad behaviour is a surefire way of getting attention.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童很快就知道﹐捣蛋准能引起注意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a surefire recipe for success
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 万无一失的成功秘诀

Sense.DEF: able to walk without sliding or falling, in a place where it is not easy to do this
used to show that you think something must be true, especially when people seem to be disagreeing with you
Sense.TRAN: 想必﹐谅必〔尤用于当别人似乎不同意时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You must have heard about the riots, surely?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 想必你已经听说骚乱的事了吧？
Sense.EXAMPLE: There must surely be some explanation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肯定有某种解释吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Surely we can’t just stand back and let this happen?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们总不能袖手旁观﹐任由这种事发生吧？

Sense.DEF: used to show you cannot believe that something is true
Sense.TRAN: 绝不可能﹐绝对不会〔用于表示不相信〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘The chairman’s just handed in his resignation.’ ‘Surely not.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “主席刚递交了辞呈。”“不可能吧。”

Sense.DEF: certainly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Such sinners will surely be punished.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样的罪人必定会受到惩罚。

Sense.DEF: used to say ‘yes’ to someone or to express agreement with them
Sense.TRAN: 当然﹔可以﹔没错 〔用于表示同意〕

Sense.DEF: someone who will pay a debt, appear in court etc if someone else fails to do so
be responsible for paying a debt, appearing in court etc if someone else fails to do so
money someone gives to make sure that someone will appear in court
Sense.TRAN: 〔交给法院保证出庭的〕保证金

Sense.DEF: to ride on waves while standing on a special board
to look quickly through information on the Internet for anything that interests you
the white substance that forms on top of waves as they move towards the shore
the top layer of an area of water or land

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dead leaves floated on the surface of the water.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凋落的树叶漂浮在水面。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Nearly 10% of the Earth’s surface is covered by ice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地球表面将近 10% 被冰层覆盖。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gas bubbles in any liquid tend to rise to the surface .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在任何液体中气泡往往都会浮到表面。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The tunnel was some 300 feet below the surface.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 隧道在地表以下约 300 英尺深处。

Sense.DEF: the outside or top layer of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the surface of the vase
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 花瓶的表面

Sense.EXAMPLE: The road surfaces tend to be worse in the towns than in the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城镇里的路面往往比乡村的差。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a frying pan with a non-stick surface
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 表面不粘的平底煎锅

GramExa.EXAMPLE: mold growing on the cheese’s surface
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 长在干酪表面的霉菌

Sense.DEF: the qualities, emotions etc of someone or something that are easy to notice, but which are not the only or not the real qualities, emotions etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: On the surface, it seems a simple story.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从表面看﹐这似乎是一个简单的故事。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Half an hour later, Enid had calmed down, at least on the surface .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 半小时后伊妮德平静下来了﹐至少表面上是这样。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I sensed a lot of tension and jealousy beneath the surface.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感觉到表面上平静无事﹐但暗藏着重重的紧张和猜忌。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Prejudice is never far beneath the surface often appears in the region.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这个地区﹐偏见时常都存在。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Violence has risen to the surface in the inner city.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴力活动已在旧城区浮现。

Sense.DEF: a flat area on the top of a cupboard, table, desk etc, that you use for cooking or working on

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Keep kitchen surfaces clean and tidy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 保持厨房台面干净整洁。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Work on a clean, flat surface.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在干净平整的桌面上操作。

Sense.DEF: one of the sides of an object
Sense.EXAMPLE: How many surfaces does a cube have?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个立方体有几个面？

Sense.DEF: if information, feelings, or problems surface, they become known about or easy to notice
Sense.TRAN: 〔信息﹑情感或问题〕显露﹐暴露﹔公开

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rumors about the killings have begun to surface in the press.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关这些杀人事件的传闻开始见诸报端。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the jealousy that had surfaced in her
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她表现出来的嫉妒

Sense.DEF: if someone or something surfaces, they suddenly appear somewhere, especially after being gone or hidden for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤在消失或隐藏一段长时间后〕露面﹔重新出现﹔显露
Sense.EXAMPLE: Last year Toole surfaced again in Cuba.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年图尔再次在古巴露面。

Sense.DEF: to rise to the surface of water
Sense.EXAMPLE: divers surfacing near the boat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在小船附近浮出水面的潜水者

Sense.DEF: to get out of bed, especially late
Sense.EXAMPLE: Joe never surfaces before midday on Sunday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔在星期天不睡到中午是绝不会起床的。

Sense.DEF: to put a surface on a road
relating to the part of the army, navy etc that travels by land or on the sea, rather than by air or under the sea
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Navy’s surface forces
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海军海上部队

Sense.DEF: appearing to be true or real, but not representing what someone really feels or what something is really like
Sense.EXAMPLE: Beneath the surface calm, she felt very insecure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她表面平静﹐但内心感到非常不安。

Sense.DEF: the area of the outside of an object that can be measured
the system of sending letters or packages by land or sea, rather than by air
Sense.TRAN: 陆路[水路]邮件﹐平（寄）邮（件）

Sense.DEF:
the way the
molecule s
in the surface of a liquid stick together so that the surface is held together

a
missile
that is fired at planes from the land or from a ship

a
missile
that is fired from land or a ship at another point on land or at another ship
Sense.TRAN: 地对地[舰]导弹﹔舰对地[舰]导弹

Sense.DEF: a long piece of plastic, wood etc that you stand on when you go surfing
an amount of something that is too large or that is more than you need
Sense.EXAMPLE: a surfeit of food and drink
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过量的食物和饮料

Sense.DEF: someone who rides on waves while standing on a special board
someone who looks quickly through information on the Internet to find information that interests them
the activity or sport of riding over the waves on a special board
Sense.EXAMPLE: When we were in Hawaii, we went surfing every day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在夏威夷时每天都去冲浪。

Sense.DEF: the activity of looking quickly through information on the Internet to find something that interests you

a meal that includes
seafood
and meat, usually
steak
, on the same plate
to suddenly move very quickly in a particular direction

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The taxi surged forward.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 出租车突然往前冲。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The crowd surged through the gates.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群蜂拥着通过大门。

Sense.DEF: if a feeling surges or surges up, you begin to feel it very strongly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She could feel anger surging inside her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她感到怒火中烧。

Sense.DEF: if a large amount of a liquid, electricity, chemical etc surges, it moves very quickly and suddenly
Sense.TRAN: 〔大量液体〕汹涌﹔〔电流〕浪涌﹔〔化学物等〕突然涌动
Sense.EXAMPLE: A wave surged up towards them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个浪头向他们涌来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Adrenalin surged through her veins.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她血脉偾张。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly increase
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oil prices surged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 油价暴涨。

Sense.DEF: a sudden large increase in a feeling
Sense.EXAMPLE: a surge of excitement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵兴奋

Sense.DEF: a sudden increase in amount or number

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a surge in food costs
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 食品成本的急剧增加
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a surge of reporters’ interest in his finances
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 记者对他财务状况的突然关注

Sense.DEF: a sudden movement of a lot of people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a surge of refugees into the country
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 涌入这个国家的难民潮

Sense.DEF: a sudden quick movement of a liquid, electricity, chemical etc through something
Sense.TRAN: 〔液体的〕汹涌﹔〔电流的〕浪涌﹔〔化学品等的〕突然涌动
Sense.EXAMPLE: a device that protects your computer against electrical surges
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一台计算机电涌保护设备

Sense.DEF: a doctor who does operations in a hospital
medical treatment in which a surgeon cuts open your body to repair or remove something inside

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She required surgery on her right knee.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的右膝需要做手术。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He underwent surgery for lung cancer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因肺癌接受了手术。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was in surgery for two hours Thursday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 周四她做了两小时的手术。

Sense.DEF: the place where operations are done in a hospital
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dr. Hanson is in surgery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汉森医生在手术室。

Sense.DEF:
a place where a doctor or
dentist
gives treatment

a regular period each day when people can see a doctor or
dentist
Sense.EXAMPLE: Surgery is from 9 am to 1 pm on weekdays.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门诊时间为周一至周五上午 9 点至下午 1 点。

Sense.DEF:
a special period of time when people can see a
member of parliament
to discuss problems

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Leslie had surgery on her toe last year.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 莱斯莉去年脚趾做了手术。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He underwent surgery to remove a bullet from his chest.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他接受手术,取出了胸腔内的子弹。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A San Antonio doctor has volunteered to perform the surgery at no cost.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣安东尼奥的一位医生主动提出免费做手术。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He is likely to need surgery in the near future.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他可能不久就需要接受手术。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The surgery was successful and he’s recovering well.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 手术很成功,他恢复得很好。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He will require major surgery to remove the lump.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他将需要接受大手术来切除肿块。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She is now fit again after knee surgery.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 膝盖手术后她已恢复了健康。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: surgery done through a very small hole in the skin

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say ‘make surgery’. For a doctor, say perform surgery or carry out surgery . For the patient, say have surgery or undergo surgery . 不要说 make surgery。医生做手术,说 perform surgery 或 carry out surgery。病人做手术,说 have surgery 或 undergo surgery。

Sense.DEF: relating to or used for medical operations
Sense.EXAMPLE: surgical techniques
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外科技术

GramExa.EXAMPLE: scalpels and other surgical instruments
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 手术刀和其他外科手术器械

Sense.DEF:
a
stocking
etc that someone wears to support a part of their body that is injured or weak
Sense.TRAN: 外科用袜子/领圈[护颈]等

Sense.DEF: done very carefully and in exactly the right place
Sense.EXAMPLE: With surgical precision he cut four inches off the legs of the jeans.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他以外科手术般的精准从牛仔裤上剪下四英寸长的裤管。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个肿块通过手术切除了。

Sense.DEF: a type of alcohol used for cleaning wounds or skin
Sense.TRAN: 〔用以清洗伤口或皮肤的〕消毒用酒精﹐医用酒精

Sense.DEF: a carefully planned quick military attack intended to destroy something in a particular place without damaging the surrounding area
Sense.TRAN: 外科手术式打击﹐精确的军事攻击

Sense.DEF: bad-tempered and unfriendly
Sense.EXAMPLE: a surly teenager
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个脾气暴躁的少年

Sense.DEF: to guess that something is true, using the information you know already

GramExa.EXAMPLE: When he came in, he didn’t look up, so she surmised that he was in a bad mood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他进来时低着头﹐因此她猜想他心情不好。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Charles was glad to have his surmise confirmed.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 查尔斯很高兴他的推测得到了证实。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in dealing with a problem or difficulty
Sense.EXAMPLE: He has had to surmount immense physical disabilities.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不得不克服严重的身体残疾。

Sense.DEF: to be above or on top of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tower surmounted by a dome
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座穹顶塔楼

Sense.DEF: the name that you share with your parents, or often with your husband if you are a married woman, and which in English comes at the end of your full name
to be even better or greater than someone or something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had surpassed all our expectations .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他超越了我们所有的预期。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The number of multiple births has surpassed 100,000 for the first time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多胎产首次突破了 10 万例。

GramExa.GLOSS: do something better than you have ever done before
GramExa.EXAMPLE: With this painting he has surpassed himself.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凭借这幅画﹐他实现了自身绘画水平的突破。

Sense.DEF: much better than that of other people or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: a picture of surpassing beauty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一幅优美绝伦的画作

Sense.DEF: a piece of clothing made of white material, worn over other clothes by priests or singers in church
Sense.TRAN: 〔教士或唱诗班成员穿的〕白色罩袍﹐白色法衣

Sense.DEF: an amount of something that is more than what is needed or used
Sense.TRAN: 剩余﹐过剩﹔剩余额﹐多余的量
Sense.EXAMPLE: Any surplus can be trimmed away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多出来的部分可以修剪掉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a surplus of crude oil
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 原油过剩

Sense.DEF: the amount of money that a country or company has left after it has paid for all the things it needs
Sense.EXAMPLE: a huge budget surplus of over £16 billion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 超过 160 亿英镑的巨额预算盈余

Sense.DEF: more than what is needed or used
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ethiopia has no surplus food.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃塞俄比亚没有多余的食物。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Surplus cash can be invested.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 多余的钱可以进行投资。

Sense.DEF: to be no longer necessary
Sense.EXAMPLE: He found out he was surplus to requirements in London and left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他发现自己留在伦敦是多余的﹐于是就离开了。

Sense.DEF: an unexpected or unusual event
Sense.TRAN: 意想不到的事﹔不同寻常的事
Sense.EXAMPLE: What a surprise to find you here!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真想不到啊﹐在这儿碰到你！
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had a big surprise when we found out the truth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们知道真相后大吃一惊。

Sense.DEF: the feeling you have when something unexpected or unusual happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: The man had a look of surprise on his face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那人脸上一副惊讶的表情。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bill looked at him in surprise.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 比尔诧异地看着他。

GramExa.GLOSS: in a way that surprises someone
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Much to his surprise, she gave him her phone number.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 令他颇感意外的是﹐她把电话号码给了他。

Sense.DEF: to happen unexpectedly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The question took her by surprise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个问题使她猝不及防。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly attack a place or an opponent when they are not ready
Sense.TRAN: 出其不意地袭击某人/某地
Sense.EXAMPLE: The guerrillas were killed when army troops took them by surprise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游击队员在遭到军队突袭时被杀。

Sense.DEF: an unexpected present, trip etc which you give to someone or organize for them, often on a special occasion
Sense.TRAN: 令某人惊喜的事物〔如礼物﹑旅行等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘I’ve got a surprise for you,’ she said.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “我要给你一个惊喜。”她说道。

Sense.DEF: someone who arrives somewhere unexpectedly
used when you are just about to show someone something that you know will surprise them

Subsense.DEF: used when saying in a joking way that you expected something to happen or be true
Subsense.TRAN: 不足为怪〔玩笑语﹐用于表示自己预料到某事将会发生或属实〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The American TV networks are, surprise, surprise, full of stories about the election.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国电视网毫无意外地全是有关竞选的报道。

Subsense.DEF: used when you suddenly appear in front of someone who you know is not expecting to see you
Subsense.TRAN: 想不到吧〔出其不意地突然出现在某人面前时说的话〕

Sense.DEF: the use of methods which are intended to cause surprise
Sense.TRAN: 出其不意[出人意料]的方法
Sense.EXAMPLE: An element of surprise is important to any attack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出其不意在任何进攻中都很重要。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His decision to marry was a complete surprise.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他要结婚的决定完全出人意料。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The announcement came as a surprise to most people.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个通告出乎大多数人的意料。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We got a surprise when we got home and found him waiting for us.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们到家看见他在等我们,吃了一惊。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She wanted to give him a surprise.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她想给他一个惊喜。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be planning to give someone a surprise

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The results were a big surprise.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 结果大大出人意料。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The news came as a complete surprise.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这消息完全出人意料。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It’s a lovely surprise to see you.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 见到你真让人又惊又喜。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 令人不快/令人厌恶的意外

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It came as no surprise when Lester got the job.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 莱斯特得到了这份工作不让人感到意外。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be going to have a surprise

Collocate.COLLOC: there’s a surprise in store (for sb)
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: something unexpected is going to happen
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 将有意想不到的事（等待某人）

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Environmental health inspectors made a surprise visit to the restaurant.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 环境卫生检查员突然到访这个餐馆。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His friends had planned a surprise party for him.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的朋友们策划了一个聚会,要给他一个惊喜。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘a bad surprise’. Say 而要说 an unpleasant surprise or 或 a nasty surprise .

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel surprised
Sense.TRAN: 使惊奇﹐使诧异﹐使感到意外
Sense.EXAMPLE: His strange question surprised her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他那奇怪的问题令她感到意外。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it surprises sb to see/find/know etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It had surprised me to find how fussy he was about some things.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发现他在有些事情上大惊小怪﹐感到很吃惊。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t know you two knew each other. Mind you, it doesn’t surprise me .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道你们俩认识。 尽管如此﹐我并不感到意外。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What surprised me most was that she didn’t seem to care.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最令我感到意外的是﹐她好像毫不在乎。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Looking back, does it surprise you that she left?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 回过头看看﹐她的离开让你吃惊吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: It wouldn’t surprise me if he married Jo.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是他和乔结婚﹐我不会吃惊的。

Sense.DEF: to find, catch, or attack someone when they are not expecting it, especially when they are doing something they should not be doing
Sense.TRAN: 出其不意地发现 [抓获]﹔突然袭击
Sense.EXAMPLE: A security guard surprised the burglars in the storeroom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名保安在储藏室当场抓住小偷。

Sense.DEF: having a feeling of surprise
Sense.TRAN: 吃惊的﹐惊奇的﹐惊讶的﹐诧异的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked surprised to see Cassie standing by the front door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看到卡西站在前门旁﹐显得很吃惊。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were greatly surprised at the news.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们听到这个消息后大感意外。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was surprised that no one was there to greet her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很惊讶竟然没有人在那儿迎接她。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I bet she’ll be really surprised to see me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我打赌她看到我会感到很意外。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a surprised look on his face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一脸惊讶。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be surprised if the interviewer is rather direct.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果采访的人说话比较直接﹐也不要吃惊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t be surprised if she married that fellow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是她嫁给那家伙﹐我不会感到意外。

Exponent.DEF: having the feeling you get when something happens that you did not expect
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was surprised to see her again so soon.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么快又见到她,我很惊讶。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m really surprised that he remembered my birthday.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真的很吃惊他竟记得我生日。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Nobody was surprised when they split up.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们分手了,没人感到意外。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a surprised expression
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 惊讶的表情

Exponent.DEF: extremely surprised, especially by something good or by something that seems hard to believe
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤因好的或难以相信的事物〕极为惊讶的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m amazed that he survived.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很惊讶他竟活下来了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You’ll be amazed when you see the difference.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 等你看到变化就会大吃一惊。

Exponent.DEF: extremely surprised
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was astonished by how much she had changed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她变化这么大真让他惊讶。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an astonished look
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 惊异的表情

Exponent.DEF: extremely surprised or shocked. Astounded sounds a little more formal and a little stronger than astonished .
Exponent.TRAN: 震惊的〔astounded比astonished稍显正式,语气更强烈些〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was astounded by how much it cost.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件东西价格不菲,令她大为震惊。

Exponent.DEF: extremely surprised or shocked
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘What?’ I said, utterly staggered by his answer.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “什么？”我说,他的回答让我大为惊讶。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She just sat there looking flabbergasted.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她就坐在那里,目瞪口呆。

Exponent.DEF: so surprised that you do not know what to do or say
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was too stunned to protest.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我惊愕得都不知如何抗议了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Everyone seemed stunned by his outburst.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他暴跳如雷,似乎让每个人都大吃一惊。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They listened in stunned silence.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们听着,惊讶得默不作声。

Exponent.DEF: so surprised that you cannot speak
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was speechless when I heard that I’d won.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 当我听说自己获胜了,惊讶得话都说不出来。

Exponent.DEF: surprised by what someone says or does, so that you are not sure how to react
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was a little taken aback by her question.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的问题让我有点猝不及防。

Exponent.DEF: surprised and a little confused
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She was nonplussed by such an odd question.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么奇怪的问题让她不知所措。

Sense.DEF: unusual or unexpected
Sense.TRAN: 令人惊奇的﹐使人吃惊的﹐出人意料的
Sense.EXAMPLE: She told me a surprising thing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她告诉我一件令人吃惊的事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A surprising number of his paintings have survived.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的存世画作多得出奇。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is not surprising that most parents experience occasional difficulties.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数父母偶尔都会遇到困难﹐这不足为奇。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s surprising how quickly you get used to things.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的适应速度令人称奇。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It is hardly surprising that new mothers often suffer from depression.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 初为人母者常患上抑郁症是不足为奇的。

Exponent.DEF: making you feel surprised
Exponent.TRAN: 令人惊讶的,出人意料的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s surprising how quickly you get used to it.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这么快就适应了,真令人惊讶。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We got some very surprising results.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得到一些非常出人意料的结果。

Exponent.DEF: very surprising. Astounding sounds a little more formal and a little stronger than astonishing .
Exponent.TRAN: 令人惊讶的〔astounding 比 astonishing 稍显正式,语气更强烈些〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The results of the tests were astounding.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 测试结果令人震惊。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Things are changing at an astonishing speed .
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 情况在以惊人的速度发生变化。

Exponent.DEF: very unusual and surprising
Exponent.TRAN: 异乎寻常的,令人惊讶的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It is extraordinary that such a young boy should be so good at maths.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么小的孩子数学这么好,真不寻常。

Exponent.DEF: very surprising – used especially about good or impressive things
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指好的或令人印象深刻的事物〕令人惊讶的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an amazing achievement
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人惊叹的成就
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s amazing what you can do when you really try.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 当你真正去尝试的时候,你的能力是令人惊讶的。

Exponent.DEF: very surprising, especially by being so large
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The project cost a staggering $8 million.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个项目花费了惊人的 800 万美元巨资。

Exponent.DEF: so surprising that you can hardly believe it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It is unbelievable that she is only the same age as me.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 让人难以置信的是,她只和我同年。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The incredible thing is that he thinks he is ugly.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 真不敢相信,他竟然认为自己很丑。

Sense.DEF: unusually or unexpectedly
Sense.TRAN: 惊人地﹐使人吃惊地﹐出人意料地
Sense.EXAMPLE: The exam was surprisingly easy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 考试出奇地简单。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Not surprisingly, with youth unemployment so high, some school-leavers with qualifications fail to find jobs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年轻人失业率如此之高﹐难怪一些具备专业资格的中学毕业生会找不到工作。

Sense.DEF: a situation or experience that is surreal is very strange and difficult to understand, like something from a dream
Sense.TRAN: 〔情况或经历〕超现实的﹔离奇的﹐荒诞的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The house was a surreal mixture of opulence and decay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座房子破落中透着奢华﹐犹如幻梦一般。

Sense.DEF: a style of 20th-century art or literature in which the artist or writer connects unrelated images and objects in a strange way
Sense.TRAN: 〔20 世纪艺术或文学的〕超现实主义

Sense.DEF: seeming very strange because of a combination of many unusual unrelated events, images etc
Sense.TRAN: 梦幻般的﹔离奇的﹔超现实的

Sense.DEF: relating to surrealism
to say officially that you want to stop fighting, because you realize that you cannot win
Sense.EXAMPLE: Germany surrendered on May 7th, 1945.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 德国于 1945 年 5 月 7 日投降。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The terrorists were given ten minutes to surrender.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怖分子被限定在十分钟之内投降。

Sense.DEF: to go to the police or the authorities, and say that you want to stop trying to escape from them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He immediately surrendered himself to the authorities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他立刻向当局自首了。

Sense.DEF: to give up something or someone, especially because you are forced to
Sense.EXAMPLE: They agreed to surrender their weapons.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们同意交出武器。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was reluctant to surrender her independence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不愿意放弃自己的独立。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Marchers who had cameras were forced to surrender their film.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带照相机的游行示威者被迫交出胶卷。

Sense.DEF: to allow yourself to be controlled or influenced by something
Sense.TRAN: 听任某事物摆布﹔屈服于某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Colette surrendered to temptation and took out a cigarette.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科利特经不住诱惑﹐拿出了一根香烟。

Sense.DEF:
to give something such as a ticket or a
passport
to an official

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Steir voluntarily surrendered his license to the State.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯泰尔主动向政府交出执照。

Sense.DEF: when you say officially that you want to stop fighting because you realize that you cannot win
Sense.EXAMPLE: the humiliation of unconditional surrender accepting total defeat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无条件投降的耻辱

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the Nazis’ surrender to the Allied forces
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 纳粹向盟军的投降

Sense.DEF: when you give away something or someone, usually because you are forced to

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a surrender of power
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 放弃权力
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the surrender of all illegal weapons
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 交出所有非法武器

Sense.DEF: when you allow yourself to be controlled or influenced by something
Sense.EXAMPLE: total surrender to drug addiction
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 放任自己染上毒瘾

Sense.DEF: done secretly or quickly because you do not want other people to notice
Sense.TRAN: 秘密的﹐偷偷摸摸的﹐鬼鬼祟祟的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rory tried to sneak a surreptitious glance at Adam’s wristwatch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗里试图偷偷看一眼亚当的手表。

Sense.DEF: a light carriage with two seats, which was pulled by a horse and was used in the past
a surrogate person or thing is one that takes the place of someone or something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: William was acting as a surrogate father for his brother’s son.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威廉替代兄弟为他的儿子担当起父亲的职责。

Sense.DEF: a person or thing that takes the place of someone or something else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bright-light therapy is used as a surrogate for sunshine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 强光疗法用于替代太阳光。

Sense.DEF: a surrogate mother
a woman who has a baby for another woman who cannot have one, and then gives her the baby after it is born
to be all around someone or something on every side

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The field was surrounded by trees.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 田边树木环绕。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He glared at the people who surrounded the tent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他怒视着围住帐篷的那些人。

Sense.DEF: to have a lot of a particular type of people or things near you
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s always been surrounded by people who adore him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他时时刻刻被崇拜者包围。

Sense.DEF: if police or soldiers surround a place, they arrange themselves in positions all the way around it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Armed police surrounded a house in the High Street.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 武装警察包围了大街上的一栋房子。

Sense.DEF: to be closely related to a situation or event
Sense.TRAN: 与〔某情况或事件〕密切相关
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the issues surrounding alcohol abuse are very complex.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关酗酒的一些问题十分复杂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Silence and secrecy surround the murder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沉默和神秘围绕着这桩谋杀案。

Sense.DEF: to choose to have certain people or things near you all the time
Sense.TRAN: 和某人/某事物在一起﹐与某人/某事物为伍
Sense.EXAMPLE: The designer surrounded himself with exquisite objects.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位设计师在自己身边摆满了精美的物品。

Sense.DEF: an area around the edge of something, especially one that is decorated or made of a different material
Sense.EXAMPLE: a solid mahogany fire surround
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 结实的红木壁炉边饰

Sense.DEF: near or around a particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Troops sealed off the surrounding area .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队封锁了周围地区。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We decided to explore the surrounding countryside .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们决定去附近的乡间走走看看。

Sense.DEF: the objects, buildings, natural things etc that are around a person or thing at a particular time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He switched on the light and examined his surroundings.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打开灯﹐查看了周围的情况。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I need to work in pleasant surroundings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要在舒适的环境下工作。

Sense.DEF:
a system of four or more
speaker s pieces of equipment that sound comes out of
used so that sounds from a film or television programme come from all directions
an additional tax on money you earn if it is higher than a particular amount
Sense.TRAN: 〔对超过一定数额的收入征收的〕附加税

Sense.DEF: when the police, army etc watch a person or place carefully because they may be connected with criminal activities
Sense.TRAN: 〔对可疑的人或场所的〕监视﹐盯梢

GramExa.EXAMPLE: 24-hour surveillance of the building
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对大楼的 24 小时监视

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were under constant close surveillance day and night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们日夜不间断地受到严密监视。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The suspects were kept under surveillance .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 嫌疑犯受到监视。

Sense.EXAMPLE: electronic surveillance equipment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电子监控设备

Sense.DEF: when one country watches the military activities of another country to see what they are planning to do
Sense.TRAN: 监视﹐侦察〔指一个国家监视另一个国家的军事行动来判断其动向〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a surveillance mission
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 侦察任务
Sense.EXAMPLE: surveillance aircraft
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 侦察机

Sense.DEF: when doctors, health departments etc watch an ill person or watch the development of a disease in a population
Sense.TRAN: 监视﹐监察 〔病人情况或某一疾病在人群中的发展〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Diane was placed under psychiatric surveillance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 黛安娜被安排接受精神病科观察。

Sense.DEF: a set of questions that you ask a large number of people in order to find out about their opinions or behaviour

GramExa.GLOSS: do a survey
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We conducted a survey of parents in the village.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对这个村子的孩子父母作了一次调查。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a survey of US businesses
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对美国企业的调查

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The survey showed that Britain’s trees are in good health.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 调查显示英国的树木状况良好。

Sense.DEF: an examination of an area of land in order to make a map of it
Sense.TRAN: 〔绘制地图前对某地的〕勘测﹐测量﹐测绘

Sense.DEF: an examination of a house or other building done especially for someone who wants to buy it
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为购房者作的〕房屋鉴定[查勘]

Sense.DEF: a general description or report about a particular subject or situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某一专题或形势的〕概论﹐概述
Sense.EXAMPLE: a survey of modern English literature
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代英国文学概论

Sense.DEF: to ask a large number of people questions in order to find out their attitudes or opinions
Sense.EXAMPLE: Of the 100 companies surveyed, 10% had a turnover of £50 m to £99 m.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被调查的 100 家公司中﹐10% 的公司营业额在 5,000 万到 9,900 万英镑之间。

Sense.DEF: to look at or consider someone or something carefully, especially in order to form an opinion about them
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为形成某种意见而〕审视﹐仔细考虑
Sense.EXAMPLE: She turned to survey her daughter’s pale face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她转过头审视女儿苍白的面容。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They got out of the car to survey the damage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们下车查看受损情况。

Sense.DEF: to examine the condition of a house or other building and make a report on it, especially for people who want to buy it
to examine and measure an area of land and record the details on a map
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were many voyages to survey the ocean depths in the nineteenth century.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 19 世纪有过多次勘测海洋深度的航行。

Sense.DEF: a university course that gives an introduction to a subject for people who have not studied it before
Sense.TRAN: 〔大学里介绍某一门学科的〕概论课程

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to examine the condition of a building, or to measure and record the details of an area of land
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑物的〕鉴定人﹐房产检视员﹔〔土地〕测量员﹐勘测员

Sense.DEF: the state of continuing to live or exist

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Illegal hunting is threatening the survival of the species.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 非法狩猎正威胁着物种的生存。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctors gave him a one in ten chance of survival .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生说他有十分之一的生存希望。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of small companies are having to fight for survival work hard in order to continue to exist .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多小公司不得不挣扎求生。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which only the strongest and most successful people or things continue to exist
something that has continued to exist from a much earlier period, especially when similar things have disappeared
Sense.TRAN: 某事物的残存物 [遗风﹐遗迹]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cult is a survival from the old Zoroastrian religion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种膜拜仪式是古老的拜火教遗留下来的。

Sense.DEF: a set of things in a special container that you need to help you stay alive if you get hurt or lost
Sense.TRAN: 救生包﹐救生箱〔装有受伤或迷路时维持生命所必需的救生用品〕

Sense.DEF: to continue to live after an accident, war, or illness
Sense.TRAN: 〔经历事故﹑战争或疾病后〕活下来﹔幸存
Sense.EXAMPLE: Only 12 of the 140 passengers survived.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 140 名乘客中只有 12 人生还。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She survived the attack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在袭击中幸免于难。
Sense.EXAMPLE: people who survive cancer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 癌症幸存者

Sense.DEF: to continue to live normally in spite of many problems
Sense.TRAN: 从〔困难〕中挺过来﹐艰难渡过
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sure she will survive this crisis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我相信她会渡过这个难关的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve had a tough few months, but I’ll survive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这几个月十分艰苦﹐但我会挺过去的。

Sense.DEF: to manage to live a normal life even though you have very little money

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t know how you all manage to survive on Jeremy’s salary.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真不知道你们只靠杰里米的薪水是怎样生活的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the amount that a family needs each week just to survive
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个家庭每周维持基本生活所需要的花费

Sense.DEF: to continue to exist after a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: A few pages of the original manuscript still survive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几页原始手稿依然存世。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Several buildings in the town have survived from medieval times.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 镇上有几座建筑物是从中世纪时期留存下来的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an old custom which has survived into the twenty-first century
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 留存到21世纪的一个古老习俗

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The main building was demolished, but the library still survives as a museum.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 主楼被毁﹐但图书馆仍留存至今﹐用作了博物馆。

Sense.DEF: to continue to be successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: The car industry cannot survive without government help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有政府的扶持﹐汽车行业是无法生存的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of smaller firms did not survive the recession.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多较小的企业没从经济衰退中挺过来。

Sense.DEF: to live longer than someone else, usually someone closely related to you
Sense.TRAN: 比〔通常指亲人〕活得更长﹐比〔某人〕长寿
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is survived by his wife Sue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他妻子休比他活得长久。

Sense.DEF: someone who continues to live after an accident, war, or illness
Sense.TRAN: 〔事故﹑战争或疾病的〕生还者﹐幸存者

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Emergency help is needed for survivors of the earthquake.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 地震的幸存者需要紧急援助。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was the sole survivor only survivor of the massacre.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是大屠杀唯一的幸存者。

Sense.DEF: someone who manages to live normally in spite of many problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry about Kurt; he’s a survivor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不用担心库尔特﹐他是个坚强的人。

Sense.DEF: someone who continues to live after other members of their family have died
Sense.TRAN: 〔家庭其他成员死后〕还活着的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was the last survivor of the family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 家里只剩她一个人还活着。

Sense.DEF: a company that continues to be successful in spite of many problems
Sense.TRAN: 幸存者〔指虽然有很多困难但仍存活的公司〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company hopes to be one of the survivors of this recession.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司希望成为这次经济衰退的幸存者之一。

Sense.DEF: how easily someone or something is affected by something
Sense.TRAN: 敏感﹔易受影响（的状况）﹔过敏性

GramExa.EXAMPLE: One of the side effects of the drug is an increased susceptibility to infections.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种药物的一个副作用是会增加感染几率。

Sense.DEF: someone’s feelings, especially when they are easily offended or upset
Sense.TRAN: 某人易受伤害的感情﹐某人的敏感心理
Sense.EXAMPLE: I knew I would have to be careful not to offend their susceptibilities .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道我得小心﹐不能伤害他们脆弱的感情。

Sense.DEF: likely to suffer from a particular illness or be affected by a particular problem

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Older people are more susceptible to infections.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 年长者更易受感染。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Soil on the mountain slopes is very susceptible to erosion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 山坡上的土壤很容易受到侵蚀。

Sense.DEF: a susceptible person is easily influenced or attracted by someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of TV advertising is aimed at susceptible young children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多电视广告瞄准了易受影响的幼儿。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was very susceptible to flattery.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很爱听恭维话。

Sense.DEF: if something is susceptible of an action, that action can be done to it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Working conditions are susceptible of improvement by legislation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作条件可以通过立法加以改善。

Sense.DEF: a Japanese dish that consists of small cakes of cooked rice served with raw fish
to think that something is probably true, especially something bad
Sense.TRAN: 猜想﹐怀疑﹐觉得〔某事可能真实﹐尤指坏事〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I suspected that there was something wrong with the engine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我怀疑发动机出了什么故障。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She strongly suspected he was lying to her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她非常怀疑他在对她撒谎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s not going to be very happy about this, I suspect .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想对于此事她不会太高兴。

Sense.DEF: to think that something bad has happened or is happening
Sense.TRAN: 怀疑〔坏事已发生或正在发生〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctors suspected pneumonia.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生怀疑是肺炎。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The position of the body led the police to suspect murder.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尸体的姿势让警方怀疑是谋杀。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He never suspected anything.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从不存疑心。

Sense.DEF: to think that someone is probably guilty of a crime
Sense.TRAN: 怀疑 〔某人〕有罪﹐认为〔某人〕有犯罪嫌疑
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who do you suspect?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怀疑谁？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s suspected of murder.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有杀人嫌疑。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Pilcher was suspected of giving away government secrets to the enemy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮尔彻被怀疑向敌人透露政府机密。

Sense.DEF: to think that something is not honest or true
Sense.EXAMPLE: I began to suspect his motives in inviting me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我开始怀疑他邀请我的动机。

Sense.DEF: someone who is thought to be guilty of a crime
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two suspects were arrested today in connection with the robbery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有两名与劫案有关的嫌疑人今天被逮捕。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police have issued a description of the murder suspect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方公布了凶杀案嫌疑犯的特征。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the two suspects for the robbery
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 抢劫案的两名嫌疑犯

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a suspect in a burglary case
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一宗入室盗窃案的疑犯

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Davies is still the chief suspect.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维斯仍是首要嫌疑人。

Sense.DEF: the people or things that are usually involved in or responsible for a particular activity
Sense.TRAN: 通常涉及的人[物]﹔常备物品
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wine shop stocking all the usual suspects: wines from California, France, Australia
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家存有各种常备酒的酒铺﹐包括加利福尼亚﹑法国﹑澳大利亚等地产的葡萄酒

Sense.DEF: not likely to be completely honest
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve always thought he was a bit of a suspect character.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直认为他这个人有点靠不住。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company was involved in some highly suspect business dealings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司参与了一些相当可疑的交易。

Sense.DEF: not likely to be completely true
Sense.TRAN: 可疑的﹔不可信任的﹔不可靠的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two men were convicted on the basis of some highly suspect evidence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名男子被定了罪﹐而定罪证据尚有很大疑点。

Sense.DEF: likely to have problems and not work well
Sense.EXAMPLE: The engine sounded a bit suspect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 引擎听上去有点问题。

Sense.DEF: likely to contain a bomb or something illegal or dangerous
Sense.TRAN: 〔因含炸弹﹑违禁物品或危险物品〕可疑的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police were called in to check out a suspect van.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察奉命来检查一辆可疑货车。

Sense.DEF: someone who is thought to be guilty of a crime
Sense.TRAN: 被疑为入室盗窃/恐怖分子/间谍等的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a suspected child﹣killer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被怀疑杀害儿童的人

Sense.DEF: if you have a suspected illness or injury, doctors think that you might have it but do not know for certain
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was taken to hospital after a suspected heart attack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他疑似心脏病发作﹐被送进了医院。

Sense.DEF: to officially stop something from continuing, especially for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sales of the drug will be suspended until more tests are completed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种药品在完成进一步检验之前将暂停销售。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Talks between the two countries have now been suspended.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两国间的对话现已中止。

Sense.DEF: to make someone leave their school or job for a short time, especially because they have broken the rules
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因违规〕使…暂时停学[停职]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two police officers have been suspended until an enquiry is carried out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那两名警察被暂时停职﹐直到调查完毕。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Dave was suspended from school for a week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫被停学一周。

Sense.DEF: to attach something to a high place so that it hangs down

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A large light was suspended from the ceiling.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 天花板上悬挂着一盏大灯。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was suspended by his feet and beaten with metal bars.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被吊起双脚﹐用金属棒殴打。

Sense.DEF: to decide not to make a firm decision or judgment about something until you know more about it
to try to believe that something is true, for example when you are watching a film or play
Sense.TRAN: 〔看电影﹑戏剧等时〕停止怀疑﹐暂不质疑

Sense.DEF: if something is suspended in a liquid or in air, it floats in it without moving
a state in which a person or creature is unconscious and their body works very slowly, but from which they can wake up when the situation is right
a feeling that you cannot do anything because you are waiting for something to happen
a punishment given by a court, in which a criminal is told they will be sent to prison if they do anything else illegal within the time mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: a two-year suspended sentence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两年缓刑

Sense.DEF:
a part of a piece of women’s underwear that hangs down and can be attached to
stocking s
to hold them up
two bands of cloth that go over your shoulders and fasten to your trousers to hold them up
a piece of women’s underwear with suspenders joined to it
a feeling of excitement or anxiety when you do not know what will happen next

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They kept us in suspense for over two hours.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们让我们提心吊胆了两个多小时。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on then, tell me what happened; the suspense is killing me I feel very excited or anxious because I do not know what will happen next .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快来﹐告诉我发生了什么事。急死我了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She couldn’t bear the suspense a moment longer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样提心吊胆﹐她再也受不了了。

GramExa.GLOSS: one which is exciting because you do not know what will happen next

Sense.DEF: when something is officially stopped for a period of time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Both sides are now working towards a suspension of hostilities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在双方都在朝着消除敌意的方向努力。

Sense.DEF: when someone is not allowed to go to school, do their job, or take part in an activity for a period of time as a punishment
Sense.TRAN: 〔作为处分〕暂时停学[停职]﹐暂时除名
Sense.EXAMPLE: He received a six-month suspension for unprofessional behaviour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因有违职业道德的行为被停职六个月。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The fight led to his suspension from school.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那次打架导致他被勒令停学。

Sense.DEF: a part attached to the wheels of a vehicle that makes it more comfortable on roads that are not smooth
Sense.TRAN: 〔装在车轮上以减少震动的〕悬架﹐减震装置
Sense.EXAMPLE: a car with an excellent suspension system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆拥有出色减震装置的汽车

Sense.DEF: a liquid mixture in which very small pieces of solid material are contained but have not combined with it
a bridge that has no supports under it, but is hung from strong steel ropes fixed to towers
a feeling you have that someone is probably guilty of doing something wrong or dishonest
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t say for definite who did it, but I certainly have my suspicions .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能确切说是谁干的﹐但我肯定有怀疑的对象。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police suspicions were confirmed when the stolen property was found in his flat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 失窃物品在他公寓里找到﹐警方的怀疑得到了证实。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wondered how I could leave early without arousing anyone’s suspicions .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道怎么才能早点离开而又不引起别人的怀疑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was arrested on suspicion of murder.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因涉嫌谋杀而被捕。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He felt he was still under suspicion.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他感到自己仍受怀疑。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mitchell later came under suspicion of assaulting two young girls.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 米切尔后来涉嫌侵犯两名小女孩。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She felt that she ought to be above suspicion so honest that no one could think that she had done anything wrong .
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得自己不应受到怀疑。

Sense.DEF: a feeling that you do not trust someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: She always treated us with suspicion .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总是对我们持怀疑态度。
Sense.EXAMPLE: People moving into the area are often regarded with suspicion .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 搬到这个地区的人常常不被信任。

Sense.DEF: a feeling you have that something is true, especially something bad
Sense.TRAN: 疑心﹐怀疑〔尤指认为不好的事情是真的〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have a suspicion that the local authority may be planning to close the school.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我怀疑当局可能计划要关闭这所学校。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She was left with a sneaking suspicion a small suspicion that Steven was not telling the truth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她隐隐觉得史蒂文没有说实话。

Sense.DEF: a very small amount of something that you can only just see, hear, or taste
Sense.TRAN: 一点某事物﹐些微某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could see the faintest suspicion of a tear in her eyes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看到她眼中隐约有泪光。

Sense.DEF: thinking that someone might be guilty of doing something wrong or dishonest

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Some of his colleagues at work became suspicious of his behaviour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的一些同事开始怀疑他的行为。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were suspicious about my past.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们怀疑我的过去。

Sense.EXAMPLE: His reluctance to answer my questions made me suspicious .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不愿回答我的问题﹐这引起我的怀疑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gave him a suspicious glance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她向他投去怀疑的一瞥。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve got a very suspicious mind!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真是疑心太重！

Sense.DEF: making you think that something bad or illegal is happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: They found a suspicious package under the seat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在座位下发现了一个可疑包裹。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a suspicious death
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蹊跷的死亡
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was behaving in a highly suspicious manner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的举止十分可疑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a suspicious-looking character
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个模样可疑的人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Call the police if you see anything suspicious.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 发现可疑情况请报警。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Her mother had died in suspicious circumstances .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她母亲死得蹊跷。

Sense.DEF: feeling that you do not trust someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 感到怀疑的﹐认为有问题的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was always suspicious of strangers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一向对陌生人有戒心。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was deeply suspicious of the legal system.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对司法体系深感怀疑。

Sense.DEF: in a way that shows you think someone has done something wrong or dishonest
Sense.EXAMPLE: Meg looked at me suspiciously.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 梅格怀疑地看着我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What do you want it for?’ he asked suspiciously.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你要它做什么用？”他怀疑地问。

Sense.DEF: in a way that makes people think that something bad or illegal is happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: He saw two youths acting suspiciously .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他发现两个年轻人形迹可疑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He seemed to be taking a suspiciously long time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他好像用了很长时间﹐令人怀疑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This sounded suspiciously like an attempt to get rid of me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这听上去让人怀疑像是要除掉我。

Sense.DEF: in a way that shows you do not trust something or someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: They eyed the food suspiciously.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们不放心地打量着食物。

Sense.DEF: to realize or discover something, or to find out the things that you need to know about someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He finally sussed out the truth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他最终弄清了真相。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I soon sussed that she wasn’t telling the truth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很快就发现她没说真话。

Sense.DEF: knowing all about someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: These boys are sussed and streetwise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些男孩什么都懂﹐精明得很。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry, I’ve got him sussed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不用担心﹐我把他琢磨透了。

Sense.DEF: to make something continue to exist or happen for a period of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: She found it difficult to sustain the children’s interest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她发现很难保持孩子们的兴趣。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was incapable of sustaining close relationships with women.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他无法和女人维持亲密关系。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the policies necessary to sustain economic growth
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 维持经济增长必需的政策

Sense.DEF: to suffer damage, an injury, or loss of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two of the firefighters sustained serious injuries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有两名消防员受了重伤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some nearby buildings sustained minor damage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 附近一些建筑物遭受到轻微损坏。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company has sustained heavy financial losses this year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司今年遭受了严重的经济损失。

Sense.DEF: if food or drink sustains a person, animal, or plant, it makes them able to continue living
Sense.EXAMPLE: They gave me barely enough food to sustain me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们给我的食物几乎都不够我活命。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel strong and hopeful
Sense.TRAN: 使保持强壮﹔使保持信心[希望]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The thought of seeing her again was all that sustained me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 再见到她的念头是让我支撑下去的全部力量。

Sense.DEF: to hold up the weight of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He leant against her so heavily that she could barely sustain his weight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他重重地靠在她身上﹐让她几乎撑不住了。

Sense.DEF: to support an idea or argument, or prove that it is right
Sense.EXAMPLE: This argument is difficult to sustain.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个论点难以证明。

Sense.DEF: able to continue without causing damage to the environment
Sense.TRAN: 可持续的﹐不破坏环境的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government should do more to promote sustainable agriculture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府应该做更多工作来推动可持续农业的发展。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sustainable use of rainforest resources
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雨林资源的可持续利用
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cycling is a totally sustainable form of transport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 骑自行车是一种绝对环保的交通方式。
Sense.EXAMPLE: environmentally sustainable development
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生态环境的可持续发展

Sense.DEF: able to continue for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: The party is promising low inflation and sustainable economic growth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该政党承诺将保持低通胀﹐促进经济的可持续增长。

Sense.DEF: continuing for a long time
Sense.EXAMPLE: a period of sustained economic development
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济持续发展的时期
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sustained attack on the government
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对政府的不断攻击

Sense.DEF: food that people or animals need in order to live
Sense.EXAMPLE: Without sustenance, the animals will soon die.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有食物﹐动物很快就会死亡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Potatoes were their only means of sustenance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马铃薯是他们唯一的食物。

Sense.DEF: when something is made to continue
Sense.EXAMPLE: Elections are necessary for the sustenance of democracy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 选举是维持民主制度所必需的。

Sense.DEF: the ancient custom in the Hindu religion of burning a wife with her husband when he dies
Sense.TRAN: 殉夫自焚〔印度教中丈夫去世后妻子自焚殉夫的古老习俗〕

Sense.DEF: a stitch that is used to sew a wound together
a type of vehicle that is bigger than a car and is made for travelling over rough ground
the right of a country or leader to rule over another country
thin and graceful
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was slim, svelte, and sophisticated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她身材苗条﹐气质优雅﹐而且人情练达。

Sense.DEF: a man who has the power to control people’s minds and make them do bad or immoral things
Sense.TRAN: 控制别人思想并令其作恶的人﹐斯文加利式人物
the written abbreviation of书面缩写= southwest or 或 southwestern 西南（方）﹔西南部的﹔来自西南方的

Sense.DEF: a small piece of material used to clean a wound or take a small amount of a substance from someone’s body in order to test it
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cotton swab
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 棉签

Sense.DEF: a small amount of a substance that is taken from someone’s body with a swab in order to test it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctor took a throat swab to check for infection.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生用拭子从咽喉取样检查是否有感染。

Sense.DEF: to clean something using a large amount of water
Sense.EXAMPLE: a girl who was swabbing the tiled floor with a mop
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个正在用拖布拖洗地砖的女孩

Sense.DEF: to clean a wound with a small piece of special material
to wrap a baby tightly to keep it warm and protect it
large pieces of cloth that people used to wrap around babies to keep them warm and protect them
goods that someone has stolen

Subsense.DEF: a large piece of material that is hung above a window as decoration

a rope covered with flowers or fruit that is hung somewhere as decoration, or
carve d
or painted on something

Sense.DEF: clothes and possessions that someone who is travelling on foot carries wrapped in a cloth
to walk proudly, swinging your shoulders in a way that shows you are very confident – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 昂首阔步﹐大摇大摆地走﹐趾高气扬地走〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He swaggered over towards me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他趾高气扬地向我走来。

Sense.DEF: a way of walking, talking, or behaving that shows you are very confident – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 趾高气扬﹔狂妄自大﹔自鸣得意〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He walked in with a swagger.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他趾高气扬地走了进来。

Sense.DEF: a young man from the country who loves a woman
to make food or drink go down your throat and towards your stomach
Sense.EXAMPLE: He swallowed the last of his coffee and asked for the bill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他喝完最后一口咖啡﹐要求结账。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most snakes swallow their prey whole .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数蛇都是把猎物囫囵吞下。

Sense.DEF: to make some of the liquid in your mouth go down your throat because you are frightened or nervous
Sense.TRAN: 〔因恐惧或紧张〕做吞咽动作﹐咽口水
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leo swallowed hard and walked into the room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 利奥使劲咽了一下口水﹐然后走进房间。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She swallowed nervously before beginning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开始之前她紧张地咽了一下口水。

Sense.DEF: to believe a story, explanation etc that is not actually true
Sense.TRAN: 轻信﹐轻易接受〔不真实的说法﹑解释等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do they really think we are stupid enough to swallow that?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们真的认为我们会愚蠢到轻易相信那种事吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I found his story a bit hard to swallow difficult to believe .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得他的说法有点叫人难以置信。

Sense.DEF: to stop yourself from showing a feeling, especially anger
Sense.TRAN: 使不流露﹐抑制〔尤指愤怒〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She swallowed her anger and turned to face him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她忍住怒 气﹐转过身来面对着他。

Sense.DEF: to do something even though it is embarrassing for you, because you have no choice
Sense.EXAMPLE: I swallowed my pride and phoned him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我放下自尊给他打了电话。

Sense.DEF: if a company or country is swallowed up by a larger one, it becomes part of it and no longer exists on its own
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hundreds of small companies have been swallowed up by these huge multinationals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数百家小公司都被这些大型跨国企业吞并了。

Sense.DEF: if something is swallowed up, it disappears because something covers it or hides it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jane was soon swallowed up in the crowd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简很快淹没在人群中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The countryside is gradually being swallowed up by new developments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乡村地区正逐渐被新建住宅区吞噬。

Sense.DEF: if an amount of money is swallowed up, you have to spend it to pay for things
Sense.EXAMPLE: The extra cash was soon swallowed up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这笔额外的钱很快就花光了。

Sense.DEF: a small black and white bird that comes to northern countries in the summer
an action in which you make food or drink go down your throat
Sense.EXAMPLE: He downed his whisky in one swallow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一口喝下威士忌。

Sense.DEF:
the past tense of
swim
a Hindu religious teacher
land that is always very wet or covered with a layer of water
to suddenly give someone a lot of work, problems etc to deal with
Sense.TRAN: 使陷入〔大量工作〕﹔使面临〔大量问题〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ve been swamped with phone calls since the advert appeared.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 自从广告出来后﹐电话多得使我们应接不暇。

Sense.DEF: to go somewhere or surround something in large numbers, especially in a short period of time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In the summer the village is swamped by visitors.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏天﹐村子里挤满游客。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly cover an area with a lot of water
Sense.EXAMPLE: Huge waves swamped the vessel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巨浪吞没了那艘船。

Sense.DEF: a large white bird with a long neck that lives on rivers and lakes
to enjoy yourself and behave in a relaxed way that is annoying to other people
Sense.TRAN: 悠闲地享受﹔马马虎虎地做事

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s gone swanning off to Rome for the weekend!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他到罗马潇洒度周末去了！

Sense.DEF: the Suwannee, a river in the south of the US, flowing through Georgia and Florida to the Gulf of Mexico
Sense.TRAN: 萨旺尼河〔美国南部河流﹐经佐治亚州和佛罗里达州汇入墨西哥湾〕

Sense.DEF: if a plan goes down the Swanee, it fails or does not happen in the way you intended
to speak or behave in a way that shows you think you are better than other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish you’d stop swanking!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你别再吹了！

Sense.DEF: proud confident behaviour that shows you think you are better than other people
very fashionable and expensive
Sense.EXAMPLE: eating meals at swanky hotels
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在豪华酒店吃饭

Sense.DEF: the last piece of work that an artist or writer produces, or the last time someone gives a performance
Sense.TRAN: 〔艺术家﹑作家等的〕最后一个作品﹔〔某人的〕最后一次表演
Sense.EXAMPLE: This concert will be her swansong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场音乐会将是她的告别演出。

Sense.DEF: to give something to someone and get something in return
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you want to swap umbrellas?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想交换雨伞吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He swapped his watch for a box of cigars.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用手表换了一盒雪茄。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The girls chatted and swapped clothes with each other.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 姑娘们聊着天﹐互相交换衣服穿。
