Sense.DEF: to tell information to someone and be given information in return
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to get together to swap ideas and information.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得碰碰头﹐交换一下想法和信息。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They sat in a corner and swapped gossip.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们坐在一个角落里﹐聊闲话。

Sense.DEF: to do the thing that someone else has been doing, and let them do the thing that you have been doing
Sense.EXAMPLE: They decided to swap roles for the day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们决定当天互换角色。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You start on the windows and I’ll do the walls, then we can swap over after an hour or so.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你先从窗户开始﹐我来弄墙﹐过一个小时左右我们可以换过来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She ended up swapping jobs with her secretary.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她最后和她的秘书换了工作。

Sense.DEF: to stop using or get rid of one thing and put or get another thing in its place
Sense.EXAMPLE: The driver announced that we would have to swap buses.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 司机通知我们必须换乘公共汽车。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had swapped her long skirts for jeans and T-shirts.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她已经换下长裙﹐穿上了牛仔裤和T恤衫。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He swapped his London home for a cottage in Scotland.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他用伦敦的房子换了一栋在苏格兰的小别墅。

Sense.DEF: to move one thing and put another in its place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone had gone into the nursery and swapped all the babies around.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人进过婴儿室﹐把所有婴儿都调换了位置。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Why don’t we swap the TV with the bookcase?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们为什么不把电视机和书橱换个位置呢？

Sense.DEF: to let someone sit or stand in your place, so that you can have their place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can we swap places, please?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们换一下位置好吗？

Sense.DEF: a situation in which you give something to someone and get another thing in return
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fair swap
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公平交换
Sense.EXAMPLE: We can do a swap if you like.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你愿意我们可以交换。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which people each do the job that the other usually does
an occasion when people meet to buy and sell used goods, or to exchange them
Sense.TRAN: 〔买卖或交换旧货的〕二手货集市

Sense.DEF: an area of land covered with grass

a large group of insects, especially
bee s
,moving together
Sense.TRAN: 成群移动的昆虫﹔〔尤指〕蜂群

Sense.DEF: a crowd of people who are moving quickly

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Swarms of tourists jostled through the square.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群群游客推推搡搡地穿过广场。

Sense.DEF: if people swarm somewhere, they go there as a large uncontrolled crowd
Sense.TRAN: 成群结队地移动﹐蜂拥﹐涌往
Sense.EXAMPLE: Photographers were swarming around the princess.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摄影师们一窝蜂地围在公主身边。

Sense.DEF:
if
bee s
swarm, they leave a
hive place where they live
in a large group to look for another home
Sense.TRAN: 〔蜜蜂〕成群飞离蜂巢〔寻觅新巢〕

Sense.DEF: to be full of a moving crowd of people or animals
Sense.TRAN: 挤满〔移动的人群或动物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The museum was swarming with tourists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 博物馆里挤满了观光客。

Sense.DEF: someone who is swarthy has dark skin
Sense.EXAMPLE: a small, swarthy man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个个子矮小﹑皮肤黝黑的男人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a swarthy complexion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黝黑的肤色

Sense.DEF: relating to adventures in which people do brave exciting things and fight against their enemies with swords
Sense.EXAMPLE: a swashbuckling hero
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个传奇英雄
Sense.EXAMPLE: a swashbuckling tale of pirates
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个关于海盗的传奇故事

Sense.DEF: a sign consisting of a cross with each end bent at 90°, used as a sign for the Nazi Party in Germany
Sense.TRAN: 卐字﹐万字符〔德国纳粹党的党徽〕

Sense.DEF: to hit an insect in order to kill it
Sense.EXAMPLE: He calmly swatted a couple of flies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他冷静地拍死了几只苍蝇。

Sense.DEF: a small piece of cloth that people can look at when they are choosing cloth for clothes or for their home
a long thin area of something, especially land

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bomb had left a swathe of the town centre in ruins.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 爆炸在镇中心留下了一片长长的废墟。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A swathe of sunlight lay across the floor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一道阳光照射在地板上。

Sense.DEF: a long thin area of grass or plants that has been cut down
Sense.TRAN: 〔割下草或植物后的〕一长条田地
Sense.EXAMPLE: We cut a swathe through the dense undergrowth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在浓密的灌木丛中劈开一条道。

Sense.DEF: to destroy a large amount or part of something
Sense.TRAN: 把某物夷为平地﹔严重损毁某物

Sense.DEF: to wrap or cover something in something
Sense.EXAMPLE: women swathed in expensive furs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身穿名贵皮草的女人
Sense.EXAMPLE: The moon was swathed in mist.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 月亮笼罩在薄雾之中。

Sense.DEF: a specially trained group of police who deal with the most dangerous and violent situations
Sense.TRAN: 特种武器和战术小分队﹐特警队

Sense.DEF: to move slowly from one side to another
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trees swayed gently in the breeze.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 树木在和风中轻轻摇曳。

Sense.DEF: to influence someone so that they change their opinion
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t allow yourself to be swayed by his promises.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可不要听了他的许诺就改变主意呀。

Sense.DEF: power to rule or influence people
Sense.EXAMPLE: These old attitudes still hold sway in the church.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些旧观念在教会中仍占支配地位。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was now completely under his sway.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她现在完全受他的支配。

Sense.DEF: a swinging movement from side to side
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sway of the ship
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 船的摇晃

Sense.DEF: curved downwards or inwards in the middle
to use rude and offensive language
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t swear in front of the children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要在孩子们面前说粗话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He turned round and swore at me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他转过身来骂我。

Sense.DEF: to promise that you will do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Victor swore he would get his revenge.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 维克托发誓要报仇。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mona swore never to return home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫娜发誓再也不回家。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you swear on your honour promise very strongly that you will never tell anyone?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能以你的名誉发誓绝不告诉任何人吗？

Sense.DEF: to say very strongly that what you are saying is true
Sense.TRAN: 发誓保证﹔郑重声明〔自己说的是真话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I never touched your purse, I swear!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我绝对没有碰过你的钱包﹐我发誓！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He says he was there all the time, but I swear I never saw him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说他一直在那儿﹐但我发誓我根本没见到他。

GramExa.GLOSS: say very strongly
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She swore blind that she had never seen him before.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一口咬定以前从未见过他。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I never touched her, I swear to God .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从未碰过她﹐我敢向上帝起誓。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think it was about ten o’clock when we left, but I couldn’t swear to it I am not certain .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我们离开时大约10点﹐但我不能肯定。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone was sure about something but now they think they were wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could have sworn I had my keys.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我明明记得我带着钥匙。

Sense.DEF: to make a public official promise, especially in a court of law

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Witnesses have to swear on the Bible.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 证人须手按《圣经》宣誓。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Remember that you have sworn an oath and so must tell the truth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 记住你已经宣过誓了﹐所以必须讲真话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Presidents must swear allegiance to the US constitution.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统必须宣誓效忠美国宪法。

Sense.DEF: to make someone promise not to tell anyone what you have told them
to have great confidence in how good or effective something is
Sense.EXAMPLE: He swears by vitamin C pills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很相信维生素 C 片的效用。

Sense.DEF: if someone with a new public job or position is sworn in, they make an official promise to do their duty well
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new governor will be sworn in next week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新州长将于下星期宣誓就职。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The jury have not yet been sworn in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陪审团还没有宣誓就任。

Sense.DEF: a ceremony in which someone with a new public job or position officially promises to do their duty well
a word that is considered to be rude, offensive, and shocking by most people
using or containing a lot of rude or offensive words
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the songs are a bit sweary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几首歌带了点脏字眼。

Sense.DEF: to have drops of salty liquid coming out through your skin because you are hot, ill, frightened, or doing exercise
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was sweating a lot despite the air conditioning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管开着空调﹐我仍是满头大汗。

GramExa.GLOSS: sweat a lot
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Within minutes she was sweating profusely.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不一会儿她就大汗淋漓了。

GramExa.GLOSS: sweat a lot
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 汗流浃背﹐浑身臭汗﹐大汗淋漓
GramExa.EXAMPLE: basketball players sweating buckets
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汗如雨下的篮球运动员

Sense.DEF: to work hard
Sense.EXAMPLE: They sweated and saved for ten years to buy a house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们拼命工作﹐攒十年钱买了一幢房子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’d sweated over the plans for six months.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他为这些计划苦干了六个月。

GramExa.GLOSS: work very hard
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I sweated blood to get that report finished.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我为了完成那份报告不要命地干。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ve been sweating our guts out here!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一直在这里累死累活地干！

Sense.DEF: to be anxious, nervous, or worried about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let them sweat a bit before you tell them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你让他们着着急再告诉他们。

GramExa.GLOSS: be very anxious
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Workers are sweating bullets over the possibility of job losses.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工人们十分担心可能会丢掉工作。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone not to worry about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t sweat it, I’ll lend you the money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心﹐我会借给你钱的。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone not to worry about unimportant things
if something such as cheese sweats, fat from inside appears on its surface
to heat food gently in a little water or fat
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sweat the vegetables until the juices run out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用文火把蔬菜熬出汁来。

Sense.DEF: to lose weight by sweating a lot
Sense.TRAN: 通过大量流汗减轻〔体重〕

Sense.DEF: to wait anxiously for news that is very important to you
Sense.TRAN: 焦急地等待〔重要的消息〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Charles is sweating it out while the coach decides which players he’s taking to the Olympics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查尔斯在焦急地等待教练决定带哪些队员去参加奥 运会。

Sense.DEF: to work very hard on something, especially something difficult
Sense.TRAN: 拼命干〔尤指困难的事情〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: kids sweating out a test
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埋头考试的孩子们

Sense.DEF: to do hard physical exercise
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were sweating it out in the gym.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们正在健身房里拼命锻炼。

Sense.DEF: to get rid of an illness by making yourself sweat a lot
drops of salty liquid that come out through your skin when you are hot, frightened, ill, or doing exercise
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ian came off the squash court dripping with sweat .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊恩大汗淋漓地离开壁球场。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Beads of sweat appeared on his forehead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的额头上冒出了汗珠。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sweat poured down his face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他满头大汗。

Sense.DEF: the condition of sweating
Sense.EXAMPLE: Symptoms include fatigue and night sweats.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 症状包括疲倦和盗汗。

GramExa.GLOSS: do physical exercise or hard work that makes you sweat
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 因锻炼[辛苦工作]而流汗

Sense.DEF: a state of nervousness or fear, especially one in which you are sweating
Sense.TRAN: 〔由于精神紧张或害怕而出的〕一身（冷）汗

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I woke up from the nightmare in a cold sweat.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从噩梦中惊醒﹐出了一身冷汗。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t get into such a sweat about it! It’s only a test.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不用这么紧张！这不过是一个测验。

Sense.LEXUNIT: break into a sweat/break out in a sweat

Subsense.DEF: to start sweating
to become very nervous or frightened
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Drops in stock market prices have investors breaking out into a sweat.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 股市大跌使投资者陷入恐慌。

Sense.DEF: to start sweating because you are making an effort
Sense.EXAMPLE: Karen was on the exercise bikes, just beginning to break a sweat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡伦在骑健身单车﹐刚开始出汗。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you can do something easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Are you sure you can do it on time?’ ‘Yeah, no sweat!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你有把握按时完成吗？” “嗯﹐没问题！”

Subsense.DEF: clothes made of thick soft cotton, worn especially for sport
trousers of this type

Sense.DEF: hard work, especially when it is boring or unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指枯燥或不愉快的〕艰苦工作﹐累活

Sense.DEF: the hard effort that someone has made in their work
a narrow band of cloth that you wear around your head or wrist to stop sweat running down when you are doing sport
Sense.TRAN: 〔运动时缠在头部或手腕的〕吸汗带

Sense.DEF: a narrow piece of cloth that is sewn on the inside of a hat
hard work done for very low wages, especially in a factory
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指工厂的〕艰苦而工资低微的工作﹐血汗劳动

Sense.DEF: the people who do this work
a piece of warm wool or cotton clothing with long sleeves, which covers the top half of your body
Sense.TRAN: 〔长袖〕毛线衣﹐羊毛衫﹐针织（套）衫

Sense.DEF: a small organ under your skin that produces sweat
loose warm trousers, worn especially for sport or relaxation
a loose warm piece of clothing which covers the top part of your body and arms and is worn especially for sport or relaxation
a small business, factory etc where people work hard in bad conditions for very little money – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 血汗工厂〔工作条件恶劣而工资低微的小企业﹑工厂等﹐含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: a set of loose warm clothes, worn especially for sport or relaxation

covered or wet with
sweat
Sense.TRAN: 满是汗的﹔被汗水湿透的
Sense.EXAMPLE: We came home hot and sweaty after the day’s work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一天工作之后﹐我们回到家时热得满身是汗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: sweaty palms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汗津津的掌心

Sense.DEF:
unpleasantly hot or difficult, so that you
sweat
Sense.TRAN: 闷热得[困难得]使人出汗的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sweaty August day
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个热得让人汗流浃背的8月天
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sweaty job
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吃力的工作

Sense.DEF: a round yellow vegetable that grows under the ground
someone from Sweden
relating to Sweden, its people, or its language
Sense.TRAN: 瑞典的﹔瑞典人的﹔瑞典语的

Sense.DEF: people from Sweden
the language used in Sweden
to clean the dust, dirt etc from the floor or ground, using a brush with a long handle
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bert swept the path in front of the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伯特清扫了屋前的小路。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Will you sweep the leaves off the patio?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把露台上的落叶扫掉好吗？

Sense.DEF: to move things from a surface with a brushing movement
Sense.EXAMPLE: I swept the papers quickly into the drawer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我迅速把那些文件扫进抽屉里。

Sense.DEF: to force someone or something to move in a particular direction
Sense.EXAMPLE: The windsurfer was swept out to sea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个玩风帆冲浪的人被卷入大海。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jessie was swept along by the angry crowd.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰西被愤怒的人群裹着向前走。

Sense.DEF: if a group of people or animals sweep somewhere, they quickly move there together
Sense.TRAN: 〔人群或动物群〕迅速移动﹐冲过

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The crowd swept through the gates of the stadium.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群蜂拥通过体育场的大门。

Sense.DEF: if winds, waves, fire etc sweep a place or sweep through, across etc a place, they move quickly and with a lot of force
Sense.TRAN: 〔风﹑浪﹑火等迅猛地〕扫过﹐掠过〔某地〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thunderstorms swept the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷暴横扫全国。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ninety-mile per hour winds swept across the plains.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 时速 90 英里的强风横扫平原。

Sense.DEF: if an idea, feeling, or activity sweeps a group of people or a place, it quickly becomes very popular or common

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a wave of nationalism sweeping the country
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 席卷全国的民族主义浪潮

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the latest craze sweeping through the teenage population
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 风靡青少年的最新时尚

Sense.DEF: if a feeling sweeps over you, you are suddenly affected by it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A feeling of isolation swept over me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 忽然有一种孤独的感觉向我袭来。

Sense.DEF: if someone sweeps somewhere, they move quickly and confidently, especially because they are impatient or like to seem important

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Eva swept into the meeting and demanded to know what was going on.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊娃大步冲进会场﹐要求知道正在发生什么事情。

Sense.DEF: to win an election easily and in an impressive way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nixon and Agnew swept to victory with 47 million votes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼克松和阿格纽以4,700万张选票大获全胜。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Herrera was swept into office on the promise of major reforms.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赫雷拉因承诺推行重大改革而一举掌权。

Sense.DEF: to win all of the games in a series of games against a particular team
Sense.EXAMPLE: Houston swept Orlando to become NBA champions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休斯敦火箭队以全胜战绩击败奥兰多魔术队﹐成为 NBA 冠军。

Sense.DEF: to win everything that can be won, especially very easily
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指轻易地〕大获全胜﹐囊括全部奖项

Sense.DEF: to form a long curved shape

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The hills swept down to the sea.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 山丘一直绵延到海边。

Sense.DEF: to look quickly at all of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The general’s eyes swept the horizon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将军的目光扫过地平线。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the beam from the lighthouse sweeping across the sea
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在海面上扫掠的灯塔光束

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel suddenly and strongly attracted to you in a romantic way
Sense.TRAN: 把某人一下子迷住﹐使某人神魂颠倒
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jill’s been swept off her feet by an older man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉尔被一位年长的男子迷住了。

Sense.DEF: to try to keep something a secret, especially something you have done wrong
to pull your hair back from your face

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kerry swept her hair back into a ponytail.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 克丽把头发往后梳成了一个马尾辫。

Sense.DEF:
to
sweep
someone
away
to refuse to pay attention to something someone says
Sense.EXAMPLE: Branson swept all the objections aside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布兰森对所有反对意见都置之不理。

Sense.DEF: to completely destroy something or make something disappear
Sense.EXAMPLE: houses swept away by the floods
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被洪水摧毁的房屋
Sense.EXAMPLE: A sudden feeling of grief swept all my anger away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵突如其来的悲伤使我怒气全消。

Sense.DEF: if a feeling or idea sweeps you away or along, you are so excited that you do not think clearly or you forget about other things
Sense.TRAN: 〔感情﹑思想〕令某人着迷﹐使某人深受影响
Sense.EXAMPLE: We couldn’t help being swept away by Bette’s enthusiasm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都不禁被贝特的热情打动了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nineteenth-century scientists were swept along on the tide of Darwin’s theories.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 19 世纪的科学家深受达尔文理论思潮的影响。

Sense.DEF: to clean the dust, dirt etc from the floor or ground using a brush with a long handle
Sense.EXAMPLE: The janitor was just sweeping up as I left the building.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我离开大楼时﹐看门人正在打扫。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jan was sweeping up the bits of paper and broken glass.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 简在清扫纸屑和碎玻璃。

Sense.DEF: to pick someone up in one quick movement
Sense.EXAMPLE: Harriet swept the child up in her arms and hugged her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈丽雅特一把抱起孩子﹐紧紧搂住她。

Sense.DEF: a long swinging movement of your arm, a weapon etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: With a single sweep of his sword, he cut through the rope.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只一挥剑﹐就砍断了绳索。

Sense.DEF: the act of cleaning a room with a long-handled brush
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kitchen needs a good sweep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厨房需要好好扫一扫了。

Subsense.DEF: a long curved line or area of land
Subsense.TRAN: 长而弯曲的地带﹔连绵弯曲的土地
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the wide sweep of lawn
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大片草坪

Subsense.DEF: the many different and important ideas, events, or qualities of something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the broad sweep of history
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浩瀚的历史

Sense.DEF: a search or attack that moves over a large area
Sense.EXAMPLE: He watched the helicopter make a sweep over the beach.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看着直升机在海滩上空搜索。

Sense.DEF: a period of time during the year when television stations try to find out which shows are the most popular
a series of several games that one team wins against another team

a
chimney sweep
someone or something that sweeps
Sense.EXAMPLE: a road sweeper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马路清洁工﹔马路清扫机

Sense.DEF: a football player who plays in a position behind other defending players
affecting many things, or making an important difference to something
Sense.TRAN: 影响大的﹔范围广的﹔彻底的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They want to make sweeping changes to education policies.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们想要对教育政策进行大刀阔斧的改革。

Sense.DEF: including a lot of information about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sweeping look at European history
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲历史面面观

Sense.DEF: a statement etc that is too general and that does not consider all the facts – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 一概而论的说法/笼统的概括〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: sweeping generalizations about women drivers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对女性司机一概而论的看法

Sense.DEF: forming a curved shape
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sweeping curve of the driveway
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 车道上的大弯
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sweeping gesture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大幅度的挥手动作

Sense.DEF: the winning of an election by a large number of votes
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sweeping victory for Labour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工党的大胜

Sense.DEF: dirt, dust etc that is left to be swept up

a type of
bet ting
in which the winner receives all the money risked by everyone else
a type of competition in which you have the chance to win a prize if your name is chosen
Sense.TRAN: 抽彩〔名字被选中便赢得奖品〕

Sense.DEF: a competition, election etc in which no one knows who will be the winner
Sense.TRAN: 胜负难料的比赛[竞选等]
Sense.EXAMPLE: the presidential sweepstakes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 胜负难料的总统竞选

Sense.DEF: containing or having a taste like sugar
Sense.EXAMPLE: This tea is too sweet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这茶太甜了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: sweet juicy peaches
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 味甜多汁的桃子
Sense.EXAMPLE: sweet wine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 甜葡萄酒

Sense.DEF: kind, gentle, and friendly
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sweet smile
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和蔼的微笑
Sense.EXAMPLE: How sweet of you to remember my birthday!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真好﹐还记得我的生日！

Sense.DEF: looking pretty and attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your little boy looks very sweet in his new coat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你儿子穿上他那件新外套真好看。

Sense.DEF: making you feel pleased, happy, and satisfied
Sense.TRAN: 令人愉悦的﹐惬意的﹔使人满足的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Revenge is sweet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报仇真痛快。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sweet smell of success
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成功的喜悦
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sweet taste of victory
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 胜利的美妙滋味
Sense.EXAMPLE: Goodnight, Becky. Sweet dreams .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚安﹐贝姬。做个美梦。

Sense.DEF: having a pleasant smell
Sense.EXAMPLE: sweet-smelling flowers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 芬芳的花朵
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sickly sweet unpleasantly sweet smell of rotting fruit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烂水果那令人恶心的甜腻气味

Sense.DEF: pleasant to listen to
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has a very sweet singing voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的歌声十分甜美。

Sense.DEF: to like things that taste of sugar
if you describe water or air as sweet, you mean that it is fresh and clean
Sense.EXAMPLE: She hurried to the door and took great gulps of the sweet air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她冲到门边﹐大口大口地呼吸新鲜空气。

Sense.DEF: to behave in a pleasant friendly way towards someone, because you want them to help you later
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m trying to keep Mum sweet so that she’ll lend me the car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在讨好妈妈﹐好让她把车借给我。

Sense.DEF: if you do something in your own sweet way or time, you do it in exactly the way that you want to or when you want to, without considering what other people say or think
Sense.TRAN: 只凭自己的意愿﹔不考虑别人﹔自私地
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t just go on in your own sweet way; we have to do this together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不能我行我素﹐我们得配合着干才行。

Sense.DEF: a business or financial deal in which you get an advantage, pay a low price etc
Sense.TRAN: 赚钱的交易﹔合算的买卖
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got a sweet deal on the car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆车我买得很合算。

Sense.DEF: nothing at all – used when someone wants to avoid saying a swear word directly
Sense.TRAN: 一点也没有〔用于避免直接说出脏话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘How much did they pay you for that job?’ ‘Sweet FA!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “干那件工作他们给了你多少报酬？” “一分钱也没有！”

Sense.DEF: things that lovers say to each other
Sense.TRAN: 〔情侣之间的〕卿卿我我的话﹐情话
Sense.EXAMPLE: a couple whispering sweet nothings to each other
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 互诉喁喁情话的一对情侣

Sense.DEF: to be very attracted to or in love with someone
used to say that you think that something is very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I got four tickets to the concert.’ ‘Sweet!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我弄到四张音乐会门票。” “太棒了！”

Exponent.DEF: sweet food or drink has had sugar added or contains natural sugars
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Italian oranges are very sweet.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 意大利橙非常甜。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a cup of hot sweet tea
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一杯甜甜的热茶

Exponent.DEF: sweet because a lot of sugar has been added
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Sugary foods are bad for your teeth.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 甜食对牙齿不好。

Exponent.DEF: tasting unpleasantly sweet
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The dessert was rather sweet and sickly.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那道甜点都甜得叫人恶心了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a sickly sweet fruit drink
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一杯甜腻的果汁饮料

Exponent.DEF: tasting or smelling unpleasantly sweet
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I find strawberry and peach drinks too cloying.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得草莓饮品和桃子饮品都太甜腻了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the cloying smell of fish oil
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 鱼油的甜腻味

Sense.DEF: a small piece of sweet food made of sugar or chocolate
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eating sweets is bad for your teeth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吃糖对牙齿不好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sweet shop
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 糖果店
Sense.EXAMPLE: a packet of boiled sweets hard sweets that taste of fruit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一袋果味硬糖

Sense.DEF: sweet food served after the meat and vegetables part of a meal
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you like a sweet, or some cheese and biscuits?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要来点甜食﹐还是干酪和饼干？

Sense.DEF: used when speaking to someone you love
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t cry, my sweet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亲爱的﹐不要哭。

Sense.DEF: a sweet-and-sour dish in Chinese cooking has both sweet and sour tastes together
Sense.EXAMPLE: sweet-and-sour pork
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 糖醋里脊

Sense.DEF:
meat from the
pancreas
of a young sheep or cow
Sense.TRAN: 〔从小羊或小牛身上取下供食用的〕胰脏

Sense.DEF:
the soft yellow seeds from
maize
that are cooked and eaten
to make something sweeter, or become sweeter
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sweeten the mixture with a little honey.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 往混合料里加点蜂蜜。

Sense.DEF: to try to persuade someone to do what you want, by giving them presents or money or promising them something
Sense.TRAN: 〔通过送礼物﹑金钱或作出许诺〕笼络﹐讨好
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cash bonus to sweeten the deal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 疏通交易的奖励金

Sense.DEF: to make someone kinder, gentler etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Old age had not sweetened her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上了年纪并没让她变得平和。

Sense.DEF: a substance used to make food or drink taste sweeter
Sense.EXAMPLE: No artificial sweeteners are used in this product.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本产品未使用人造甜味剂。

Sense.DEF: something that you give to someone to persuade them to do something, especially to accept a business deal
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为使某人接受商业交易而给予的〕甜头﹐笼络物
Sense.EXAMPLE: These tax cuts are just a pre-election sweetener.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些减税措施只不过是选举前用来笼络人心的东西。

Sense.DEF:
a tree with hard wood and groups of seeds like
prickly
balls, common in North America
Sense.TRAN: 胶皮枫香树〔常见于北美〕

Sense.DEF: a way of speaking to someone you love
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come here, sweetheart.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过来﹐亲爱的。

Sense.DEF: an informal way of speaking to a woman you do not know, which some women find offensive
Sense.TRAN: 亲爱的〔对陌生女子的非正式称呼﹐有些女子认为这种称呼带有冒犯性〕

Sense.DEF: an agreement that is unfair because it gives an advantage to people who know each other well or to people who have a lot of influence
Sense.TRAN: 私下签订的合同〔指不公正的合同〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Members of the council had arranged a sweetheart deal with CTS.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地方议会议员和 CTS 公司私下签订了一份合同。

Sense.DEF: the person that you love
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were childhood sweethearts .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们是青梅竹马。

Sense.DEF:
a
sweet
– used by children or when speaking to children
someone who is kind and easy to love
Sense.EXAMPLE: Guy’s father is such a sweetie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 盖伊的父亲非常讨人喜欢。

Sense.DEF: a way of speaking to someone you love
a way of speaking to someone you love

a
sweet
, or any food made of or preserved in sugar
how sweet something tastes or smells
Sense.EXAMPLE: the sweetness of the wild rose
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 野玫瑰的芬芳

Sense.DEF: how pleasant something is
Sense.EXAMPLE: a smile of great sweetness
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十分甜蜜的微笑

Subsense.DEF: to behave in a way that is very pleasant and friendly, especially when you do not normally behave like this
Subsense.TRAN: 〔尤指一反常态地〕和蔼可亲﹐亲切友善
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She’s all sweetness and light when Paul’s around.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有保罗在﹐她就表现得特别甜美可爱。

Subsense.DEF: to be enjoyable and without problems
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Life is not all sweetness and light.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活并不总是一帆风顺的。

Sense.DEF: a climbing plant with sweet-smelling flowers in pale colours
a green, red, or yellow vegetable that is hollow with many seeds
a vegetable that looks like a red potato, is yellow inside, and tastes sweet

a small sweet
pastry
to persuade someone to do something by talking to them nicely and making them feel good

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I managed to sweet-talk her into driving me home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我说了一堆好话终于让她开车送我回家。

Sense.DEF: having a character that is kind and gentle
a plant with sweet-smelling flowers
to become larger and rounder than normal – used especially about parts of the body
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her ankle was already starting to swell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的脚踝已经开始肿起来了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The window frame was swollen shut.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗框膨胀变形﹐关得死死的。

Sense.DEF: to increase in amount or number

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The crowd swelled to around 10,000.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人群增加到一万人左右。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The river was swollen with melted snow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 积雪融化﹐河水上涨。

GramExa.GLOSS: increase the number of people in a particular situation
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 扩大…的队伍﹐增加…的人数
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Large numbers of refugees have swollen the ranks of the unemployed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量的难民壮大了失业队伍。

Sense.DEF: to feel very proud, angry etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: His heart swelled with pride as he watched his daughter collect her prize.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看着女儿领奖﹐心中充满了自豪。

Sense.DEF: to curve or make something curve
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wind swelled the sails.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 风鼓起了船帆。

Sense.DEF: to become louder
Sense.EXAMPLE: Music swelled around us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音乐声在我们四周越来越响。

Sense.DEF: to move suddenly and powerfully upwards
the way the sea moves up and down
Sense.EXAMPLE: The sea wasn’t rough, but there was a heavy swell large movements of the water .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海面不算是波涛汹涌﹐但起伏很大。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which something increases in number or amount

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the growing swell of anti-government feeling
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 反政府情绪的日益高涨
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a swell of pride
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 自豪感的增强

Sense.DEF: an increase in sound level, especially in music
the roundness or curved shape of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: the firm swell of her breasts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她挺拔的乳峰

Sense.DEF: a fashionable or important person
Sense.TRAN: 时髦人物﹔头面人物﹐要人

Sense.DEF: very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: You look swell!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看上去漂亮极了！

Sense.DEF: thinking that you are more important or clever than you really are
an area of your body that has become larger than normal, because of illness or injury
Sense.TRAN: 〔身体因患病或受伤产生的〕肿块﹐肿胀处

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a painless swelling in his neck
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他颈部的一个无痛肿块

Sense.DEF: the condition of having swelled
Sense.EXAMPLE: The spider’s bite can cause pain and swelling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蜘蛛叮咬可能会引起肿痛。
Sense.EXAMPLE: These tablets should reduce the swelling .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些药片应该能消肿。

Sense.DEF: to feel extremely hot and uncomfortable
Sense.EXAMPLE: Crowds of shoppers sweltered in the summer heat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在夏日的高温下﹐成群的购物者都感到酷热难当。

Sense.DEF: extremely hot and uncomfortable
Sense.EXAMPLE: sweltering August days
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酷热难耐的八月天

Sense.DEF:
the past tense and past participle of
sweep
Sense.TRAN: sweep 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF: hair that is swept-back is brushed backwards from your face
swept-back wings on an aircraft look like the letter v
Sense.TRAN: 〔飞机机翼〕后掠的﹐后掠成 V 字形的

Sense.DEF: to make a sudden sideways movement while moving forwards, usually in order to avoid hitting something
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常为了避免碰撞〕突然转向一边

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The car swerved sharply to avoid the dog.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 车子猛地急转﹐以避开那条狗。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bus swerved off the road.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共汽车突然转向驶离了马路。

Sense.DEF: to change from an idea, course of action, purpose etc
Sense.TRAN: 改变﹔背离〔主意﹑做法﹑目的等〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He would never swerve from the truth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他绝不会违背真理。

Sense.DEF: happening or done quickly and immediately
Sense.EXAMPLE: My letter received a swift reply.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的信很快就得到了回复。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She shot a swift glance at Paul.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她迅速瞥了保罗一眼。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were swift to deny the accusations.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们立刻否认这些指控。

Sense.DEF: moving, or able to move, very fast
Sense.TRAN: （能）迅速移动的﹔速度非常快的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a swift runner
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跑得飞快的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: She wiped her tears away in one swift movement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她迅速擦去眼泪。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is not very intelligent

a small brown bird that has pointed wings, flies very fast, and is similar to a
swallow
to drink something in large mouthfuls, especially from a bottle
Sense.EXAMPLE: He sat swigging beer and smoking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坐着﹐一边大口喝啤酒一边抽烟。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She took a long swig of coke.

Sense.DEF: to wash something by pouring a lot of water over it or into it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Get a bucket to swill the yard down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 去拿个桶来把院子冲洗一下。

Sense.DEF: if a liquid swills around or you swill it around, it moves around something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He swilled his brandy gently round his glass.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他轻轻晃动玻璃杯里的白兰地。

Sense.DEF: to drink something in large amounts
Sense.EXAMPLE: He does nothing but swill beer all day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他整天什么事也不干﹐就是拼命喝啤酒。

Sense.DEF: food for pigs, mostly made of unwanted bits of human food
the act of washing something by pouring a lot of water over it
to move yourself through water using your arms and legs

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We swam in the chilly water.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在冰冷的水里游泳。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She could swim across the lake.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她能游到湖对岸去。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s go swimming this afternoon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天下午我们游泳去吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: kids learning to swim the backstroke
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学习仰泳的孩子们
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was the first woman to swim the Channel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是第一个游过英吉利海峡的女性。

PIC.HEADING: SWIM 游泳
PIC.PICCONTENT: breaststroke 蛙泳；backstroke 仰泳；crawl 自由泳；butterfly 蝶泳

Sense.DEF:
when fish, ducks etc swim, they move around the water using their tails and
fin s
,their feet etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tropical fish swam slowly around in the tank.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热带鱼在鱼缸里慢慢地游来游去。

Subsense.DEF: if your head swims, you start to feel confused or that everything is spinning around
Subsense.EXAMPLE: My head was swimming after looking at that screen all day.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我整天盯着那屏幕﹐头都晕了。

Subsense.DEF: if something you are looking at swims, it seems to be moving around, usually because you are ill, tired, or drunk
Subsense.TRAN: 〔生病﹑疲劳或喝醉时眼前物体〕晃动﹐旋转
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The numbers swam before my eyes.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些数字在我眼前晃动。

Sense.DEF: to be covered by a lot of liquid
Sense.EXAMPLE: potatoes swimming in thick gravy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 浸在浓稠肉汁里的马铃薯

Sense.DEF: to do or say things which are different from what most people do or say, because you do not mind being different
a period of time that you spend swimming
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s go for a swim .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们游泳去吧。

Sense.DEF: knowing about and involved in what is happening in a particular situation
Sense.TRAN: 了解并融入某种形势的﹔不脱离潮流的

Subsense.DEF: someone who swims well, often as a competitor
Subsense.TRAN: 会游泳的人﹔游泳运动员

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Peter’s a very strong swimmer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 彼得游泳游得很好。

Subsense.DEF: someone who is swimming
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We watched the swimmers heading out across the lake.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们看着游泳的人向湖对岸游去。

Sense.DEF: the sport of moving yourself through water using your arms and legs
Sense.EXAMPLE: Swimming is great exercise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游泳是很好的锻炼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a swimming club
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游泳俱乐部
Sense.EXAMPLE: We went swimming on Saturday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们周六去游泳了。

Sense.DEF: a public swimming pool, usually indoors
a tight-fitting rubber hat that you wear when you are swimming to keep your hair dry
a piece of clothing worn for swimming, especially the type worn by women
if something you plan goes swimmingly, it happens without problems
a structure that has been built and filled with water for people to swim in

a piece of clothing like
shorts
, worn by men and boys for swimming
a piece of clothing worn for swimming
clothing used for swimming
to get money from someone by deceiving them

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a businessman who swindled investors out of millions of pounds
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个诈骗了投资者数百万英镑的商人

Sense.DEF: a situation in which someone gets money by deceiving someone else
Sense.EXAMPLE: a big tax swindle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巨额税款诈骗

Sense.DEF: someone who behaves very rudely or unpleasantly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leave her alone, you filthy swine!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不许你再缠着她﹐你这无耻的下流坯！

Sense.DEF: a pig
someone who looks after pigs
to make regular movements forwards and backwards or from one side to another while hanging from a particular point, or to make something do this
Sense.TRAN: （使）〔前后〕摆动﹐（使）摇 摆﹐（使）摇荡
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let your arms swing as you walk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 边走边摆动双臂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sign swinging in the wind
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在风中摇摆的指示牌
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was swinging his bag back and forth .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他前后甩动着他的包。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She swung her legs from side to side .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她左右晃动着两条腿。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He marched around, swinging the gun by its handle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他快步走来走去﹐手握枪把挥动着。

Sense.DEF: to move quickly in a smooth curve in one direction, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: A black car swung into the drive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆黑色汽车拐进了车道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kate swung her legs out of bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯特一甩腿下了床。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The heavy door swung shut.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那扇沉重的门关上了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Swinging her bag over her shoulder, she hurried on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把包往肩上一甩﹐快步向前走去。

Sense.DEF: to move your arm or something you are holding to try and hit something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She swung her bag at him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她挥着包朝他打去。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Garson swung at the ball and missed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 加森挥拍击球﹐但没打中。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He started swinging at me with his fists.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始挥起拳头打我。

Sense.DEF: if emotions or opinions swing, or if something swings them, they change quickly to the opposite of what they were

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His mood could swing from joy to despair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的情绪可以瞬间从高兴变成绝望。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Do campaign gifts swing votes ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 竞选礼品能拉到选票吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The war had begun to swing in Britain’s favor .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 战争局势已开始朝着有利于英国的方向转变。

GramExa.GLOSS: in politics
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 转而支持右翼政党/左翼政党

Sense.DEF: to suddenly begin work that needs doing, using a lot of energy and effort
Sense.TRAN: 立即行动起来﹔马上大干起来
Sense.EXAMPLE: Politicians have already swung into action.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政界人士已经开始行动了。

Sense.DEF: to sit on a swing and make it move backwards and forwards by moving your legs
to arrange for something to happen, although it takes a lot of effort to do this
Sense.TRAN: 设法做成﹐想法办妥〔需要花大力气做的事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We managed to swing it so that they will travel together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们想了办法安排他们一起旅行。

Sense.DEF:
someone who swings both ways is
bisexual
Sense.TRAN: 对男女两性都有性欲﹐是双性恋

Sense.DEF: to avoid work by pretending to be ill

Crossrefto.REFLEX: there’s not enough room to swing a cat

Sense.DEF: to turn around quickly, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: She swung around to face him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她突然转过身来面对着他。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He swung the boat around and headed for the shore.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他掉转船头﹐朝岸边驶去。

Sense.DEF: to visit a place or person for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll swing by the grocery store on my way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会顺路去一下杂货店。

Sense.DEF: a seat hanging from ropes or chains, usually used by children to play on by moving it forwards and backwards using their legs
Sense.EXAMPLE: kids playing on the swings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 荡秋千的孩子们
Sense.EXAMPLE: a porch swing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 门廊上的秋千

Sense.DEF: a curved movement made with your arm, leg etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He took a swing at tried to hit my head and missed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他挥拳向我头部打来﹐但没有打中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the swing of her hips as she walked
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她走路时臀部的摇摆

Sense.DEF: a noticeable change in opinions or emotions

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a big swing towards right-wing ideology
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 向右翼意识形态的大转变

Sense.EXAMPLE: She suffers from mood swings .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她常有情绪波动。

Sense.DEF:
the movement you make when you hit the ball in
golf
, baseball, or some other sports
Sense.TRAN: 〔高尔夫球﹑棒球等的〕挥杆[棒]动作
Sense.EXAMPLE: I spent months correcting my swing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我花了几个月时间纠正挥杆动作。

Sense.DEF:
a type of dance music played by a big band in the 1930s and 1940s that is similar to
jazz
Sense.TRAN: 摇摆乐〔20 世纪 30 和 40 年代大型乐队演奏的舞曲﹐与爵士乐类似〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: get into the swing of it/things
Sense.DEF: to become fully involved in an activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: Once we got into the swing of it, it took no time at all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一旦全力投入﹐根本不用花多少时间。

Sense.DEF: if an event or process is in full swing, it has reached its highest level of activity
Sense.TRAN: 〔活动或进程〕达到高潮﹐进入最高层次
Sense.EXAMPLE: By midnight, the end-of-course party was in full swing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了半夜﹐庆祝课程结束的聚会掀起高潮。

Sense.DEF: if a party or activity goes with a swing, it is enjoyable and successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: everything you need to make your party go with a swing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要把晚会办好所需要的一切

Sense.DEF: used to say that two choices have an equal number of gains and losses, so there is little difference between them
Sense.TRAN: 有得也有失﹐得失相抵〔因此如何在两个选择之间决断无关紧要〕

Sense.DEF: a bridge that can be pulled up for tall ships to go under it
a door that you can push open from either side, which swings shut afterwards
very severe reductions in spending, especially by a government or organization
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指政府或组织的〕大幅开支削减
Sense.EXAMPLE: swingeing cuts in public spending
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公共开支的大幅削减

Sense.DEF: someone who is fashionable and goes to a lot of parties
Sense.TRAN: 活跃而时髦的人﹐常参加社交聚会的人

Sense.DEF: someone who has sexual relationships with many people, especially someone who exchanges sexual partners with other people
Sense.TRAN: 滥交的人﹐放荡的人﹐性开放的人

Sense.DEF: exciting and enjoyable
Sense.EXAMPLE: a swinging social life
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人兴奋的社交生活

Sense.DEF: a door that you can push open from either side, which swings shut afterwards
the 1960s, a time when social and sexual freedom increased
Sense.TRAN: 放纵不羁的六十年代〔指社会自由和性自由高涨的 20 世纪 60 年代〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dad grew up in the swinging sixties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸成长于开放的 20 世纪 60 年代。

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment used in television programmes to show how many votes each political party is getting during an election
Sense.TRAN: 选票显示器〔电视节目播放选举情况时使用的一种装置﹐用以显示各政党所得票数〕

Sense.DEF:
a tall metal frame with
swing s
hanging from it, for children to play on
workers who work from three or four o’clock in the afternoon until 11 or 12 o’clock at night, or the system of working these times
Sense.TRAN: 〔三班制的〕中班工人﹔中班〔时间通常为下午 3 点或 4 点至晚上 11 点或 12 点〕

Sense.DEF: extremely unpleasant or difficult to deal with
Sense.TRAN: 极讨厌的﹔可鄙的﹔难对付的

Sense.DEF: to hit or to try to hit someone or something by swinging your arm or an object very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She swiped me across the face.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她扬起手打了我一个耳光。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He jumped forward, intending to swipe at her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他扑向前去想打她。

Sense.DEF: to steal something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The photos were probably swiped by an employee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些照片很可能是被哪个员工偷走了。

Sense.DEF: to pull a plastic card through a machine that can read the electronic information on it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Swipe your card to open the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刷卡开门。

Sense.DEF: a criticism of someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His comments were a sarcastic swipe at the police.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的评论是对警方尖刻的批评。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: In her latest article, she takes a swipe at criticizes her critics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在最近一篇文章中﹐她对批评她的人进行了抨击。

Sense.DEF: when you hit or try to hit someone or something by swinging your arm very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She took a swipe at the ball.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她朝着球打去。

Sense.DEF: a special plastic card that you slide through a machine in order to get into a building or open a door
to move around quickly in a twisting circular movement, or to make something do this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Smoke swirled around her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她周围烟雾缭绕。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He swirled the brandy around in his glass.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他旋动杯中的白兰地酒。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The river had become a swirling torrent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 河水变成了翻滚的洪流。

Sense.DEF: if stories or ideas swirl around a place, a lot of people start to talk about them – used especially in news reports

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Rumours of a takeover began to swirl around the stock markets.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 收购传言开始在股票市场上流传。

Sense.DEF: a swirling movement or amount of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a swirl of dust
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 滚滚飞扬的尘土

Sense.DEF: a twisting circular pattern
to move or make something move quickly through the air with a quiet sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her skirt swished as she walked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她走动时裙子窸窣作响。

Sense.DEF: fashionable and expensive
Sense.EXAMPLE: a swish new apartment block
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一栋新的豪华公寓大楼

Sense.DEF: relating to Switzerland or its people
people from Switzerland
a large plastic ball that you sit on or lie against in order to do special exercises
a vegetable with large green leaves

a long thin cake that is rolled up with
jam
or cream inside
Sense.TRAN: 〔夹有果酱或奶油的〕卷筒夹心蛋糕﹐瑞士卷

Sense.DEF:
a thick flat piece of
beef
covered in flour and cooked in a sauce
Sense.TRAN: 〔外蘸面粉加调味汁烹调而成的〕瑞士牛排

Sense.DEF: to change from doing or using one thing to doing or using another

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She worked as a librarian before switching to journalism.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在转行从事新闻工作前是图书馆管理员。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Duval could switch easily from French to English.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杜瓦尔可以在法语和英语之间自如切换。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He switches between TV and theatre work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的工作在电视业和戏剧界之间不断变换。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The terrorists will switch tactics .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怖分子会改变战术。

GramExa.GLOSS: start supporting a different person, party etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 转换立场/改变拥戴对象
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He switched sides just days before the election.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 就在竞选的前几天他改变了立场。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We want to switch focus away from criticism.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们想把重点从批评上转移开。

Sense.DEF: to replace one thing with another, or exchange things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tim may switch his BMW for something else.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂姆可能会把他的宝马车换成别的什么车。

GramExa.PROPFORM: switch sth from sth to sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ve switched the meeting from Tuesday to Thursday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把会议从周二改到了周四。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s not easy to switch clerical workers around.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 想调换办公室工作人员并不容易。

Sense.DEF: if you switch with someone who does the same job as you, you exchange your working times with theirs for a short time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tom said he’d switch with me on Saturday.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆说他周六会和我调班。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He asked if we could switch shifts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他问我们是否可以调班。

Sense.DEF: to change the way a machine operates, using a switch
Sense.TRAN: 〔用开关〕改变〔机器的运转〕﹐转换

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Switch the freezer to ‘defrost’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把冷冻柜调到“除霜”模式。

Sense.DEF: to turn off a machine, light, radio etc using a switch

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The burglar alarm was switched off.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 防盗警报器被关上了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t forget to switch off before you go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离开之前别忘记关掉开关。

Sense.DEF: to stop listening to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: He just switches off and ignores me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他就是不听﹐不理我。

Sense.DEF: to relax for a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: Switch off by listening to music.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 听听音乐放松一下。

Sense.DEF: to turn on a machine, light, radio etc using a switch

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He switched the torch on.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打开了手电筒。

Sense.EXAMPLE: When a tape is put in the VCR, it switches on automatically .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 录像带放进录像机后﹐它会自动播放。

Sense.DEF: to change from one method, product etc to another

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ve switched over to telephone banking.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已经改用电话银行服务了。

Sense.DEF:
to change the television
channel
you are watching or the radio station you are listening to

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Switch over to BBC 2.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 换到英国广播公司二台。

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment that starts or stops the flow of electricity to a machine, light etc when you push it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where’s the light switch ?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电灯开关在哪儿？
Sense.EXAMPLE: an on-off switch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开关键

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tom flicked the switch, but nothing happened.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆按了下开关﹐但什么反应也没有。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She claims she is willing to throw the switch of the electric chair.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她表示她愿意按下电椅开关。

GramExa.PROPFORM: at the flick of a switch
GramExa.GLOSS: very quickly and easily, by pressing a switch
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Petrol can be chosen at the flick of a switch.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要按一下按钮就可以选择汽油。

Sense.DEF: a complete change from one thing to another
Sense.EXAMPLE: an important policy switch
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一项重要的政策改变

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the switch from agriculture to dairy production
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从农业向乳品生产的转变

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a switch in emphasis
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 重点的转移

Sense.EXAMPLE: More shoppers are making the switch to organic food.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 更多顾客开始改买有机食品。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that someone’s behaviour is different from usual
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Ed’s the only one who’s not eating.’ ‘That’s a switch!’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “只有埃德没在吃。”“这真少见！”

Sense.DEF: a piece of railway track that can be moved to allow a train to cross over from one track to another
a thin stick that bends easily
a road or track that goes up and down steep slopes and around sharp bends
Sense.TRAN: 〔陡坡上公路或铁路的〕之字形爬坡路段﹔多急转弯的道路

Sense.DEF: a knife with a blade inside the handle which springs out when you press a button
a system used to connect telephone calls in an office building, hotel etc, or the people who operate the system
Sense.TRAN: 电话交换台﹐电话总机﹔总机接线员
Sense.EXAMPLE: switchboard operators
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话总机接线员
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hundreds of callers jammed the switchboard trying to win the tickets there were too many calls for the switchboard to deal with .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几百个电话打进来想赢取门票﹐总机应接不暇。

Sense.DEF: a plastic card from your bank that you use to pay for things and that allows the money to be taken straight from your account
Sense.TRAN: Switch卡﹐代支卡〔由银行发放﹑供购物付款使用的一种塑料磁卡〕

Sense.DEF: quick to notice new ideas and fashions
Sense.TRAN: 紧跟时尚的﹐对新观念[时尚]敏感的

Sense.DEF: to turn around quickly and face a different direction, or to make something do this
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anna swivelled round to face him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安娜转过身来面对着他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She swivelled her head round to watch what was happening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她转过头来察看发生了什么事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Danny swiveled his chair away from me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹尼把椅子从我身边转开了。

Sense.DEF: an object that joins two parts of something and helps it to turn around
a chair whose seat part can be turned while the legs remain in the same position
something that makes you feel disappointed and as though you have been deceived
Sense.TRAN: 令人失望的东西﹔骗人的东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: The packet’s half empty – what a swizz!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 包装盒里一半是空的——真是骗人！

Sense.DEF: a small stick for mixing drinks

the past participle of
swell
a part of your body that is swollen is bigger than usual, especially because you are ill or injured
Sense.EXAMPLE: swollen glands
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肿胀的腺体
Sense.EXAMPLE: a badly swollen ankle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肿得厉害的脚踝
Sense.EXAMPLE: His eyes were swollen from crying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的眼睛哭肿了。

Sense.DEF: a river that is swollen has more water in it than usual
to be too proud and think you are very clever or important
Sense.TRAN: 骄傲自满﹐自负﹐自高自大

Sense.DEF: to be extremely excited and unable to control yourself because you admire someone so much

GramExa.EXAMPLE: crowds of teenage girls swooning over pop stars
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一群群痴迷流行乐歌星的少女

Sense.DEF: to fall to the ground because you have been affected by an emotion or shock
if a bird or aircraft swoops, it moves suddenly down through the air, especially in order to attack something
Sense.TRAN: 〔鸟或飞机〕向下猛冲﹐向下猛扑
Sense.EXAMPLE: The eagle hovered, ready to swoop at any moment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鹰在天空盘旋﹐随时准备俯冲下来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A helicopter suddenly swooped down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一架直升机突然俯冲下来。

Sense.DEF: if the police, army etc swoop on a place, they go there without any warning in order to look for someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 〔警方﹑军队等〕突然袭击﹔突然搜查

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Drug officers swooped on several addresses in London last night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 缉毒警察昨晚对伦敦的几处住所进行了突击搜查。

Sense.DEF: a sudden surprise attack on a place in order to get something or take people away – used especially in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 突然袭击﹔突击搜查〔尤用于新闻报道〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Police arrested a man in a swoop on his house last night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方昨晚突击搜查一名男子的住所﹐将他逮捕。

Sense.DEF: a swooping movement or action
to make a sound by moving quickly through the air
Sense.TRAN: 〔在空中移动时〕发出嗖嗖声﹐嗖嗖作响

Sense.DEF:
a British spelling of
swap
a weapon with a long pointed blade and a handle
a bad thing that might happen at any time
Sense.TRAN: 达摩克利斯之剑〔喻指随时可能发生的坏事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The treaty hung like a sword of Damocles over French politics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个条约好像一把达摩克利斯之剑悬在法国政坛之上。

Sense.DEF: to kill someone with a sword
to start using money, equipment, and skills for peaceful purposes rather than for fighting
a dance in which people dance over swords or using swords
Sense.TRAN: 剑舞〔在刀剑之上或挥舞刀剑起舞〕

Sense.DEF: a large fish with a very long pointed upper jaw
someone who is good at fighting with a sword
a man who has sex very often and with a lot of different women
skill in fighting with a sword

the past tense of
swear

the past participle of
swear
two people or groups of people who will always hate each other
a statement etc that someone makes after officially promising to tell the truth
Sense.TRAN: 宣誓后的陈述/证据/证词等

Sense.DEF: someone who spends too much time studying and seems to have no other interests – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 只知道读书的人﹐书呆子〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: to study a lot in a short time, especially for an examination
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为准备考试〕临时死记硬背

GramExa.EXAMPLE: students swotting for exams
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 临阵磨枪﹑准备考试的学生

Sense.DEF: to learn as much as you can about a subject, especially in order to prepare for an examination
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为准备考试〕拼命复习﹐死记硬背〔某学科〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s worth swotting up on all the different types of computer before you buy one.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 买电脑之前﹐把不同型号的电脑了解一遍是值得的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I spent all last night swotting up German verbs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我昨晚整晚都在拼命复习德语动词词汇。

Sense.DEF: a system for examining the way a company is run or the way someone works, in order to see what the good and bad features are
Sense.TRAN: 强弱机危综合分析法﹐SWOT分析法
Sense.EXAMPLE: a SWOT analysis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 强弱机危综合分析法

Sense.DEF:
the past participle of
swim

the past tense and past participle of
swing
Sense.TRAN: swing 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF: wanting or enjoying expensive pleasures and comforts
Sense.TRAN: 贪图享受的﹔骄奢淫逸的

Sense.DEF: a European tree that has leaves with five points and seeds with two parts like wings, or the wood of this tree
a North American tree with broad leaves, or the wood of this tree
someone who praises powerful people too much because they want to get something from them – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 阿谀奉承者﹐谄媚者﹐拍马屁者〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dictator surrounded by sycophants
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被阿谀奉承者包围的独裁者

Sense.DEF: praising important or powerful people too much because you want to get something from them – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 溜须拍马的﹐阿谀奉承的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: sycophantic journalists
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好溜须拍马的新闻记者
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sycophantic letter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一封阿谀奉承的信

Sense.DEF:
based on or relating to
syllable s
Sense.TRAN: 音节的﹔分音节的﹔由音节组成的
Sense.EXAMPLE: syllabic stress
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 音节重音

Sense.DEF:
a syllabic consonant forms a whole
syllable
, for example the /l/ in ‘battle’
a word or part of a word which contains a single vowel sound
a sweet food made by mixing cream with sugar and wine or fruit juice
Sense.TRAN: 乳酒冻〔一种用奶油加糖﹑酒或果汁混合而成的甜食〕

Sense.DEF: a plan that states exactly what students at a school or college should learn in a particular subject

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Two Shakespeare plays are on this year’s English syllabus.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年的英语课程大纲上有两部莎士比亚剧作。

Sense.DEF: a statement with three parts, the first two of which prove that the third part is true, for example ‘all men will die, Socrates is a man, therefore Socrates will die’
Sense.TRAN: 三段论法〔由两个前提引出结论的推理﹐如“凡人必死﹐苏格拉底是人﹐因此苏格拉底终将会死”〕

Sense.DEF: an attractively thin woman
an imaginary female creature who lived in the air, according to ancient stories
Sense.TRAN: 气精﹐气仙〔古代传说中空气里的女精灵〕

Sense.DEF: a sylphlike woman is attractively thin and graceful
relating to a forest or trees

the form used for
syn-
before the letters b, m, or p
Sense.TRAN: 〔用于字母 b, m 或 p 前代替 syn- 的形式〕

Sense.DEF: a relationship between people or organizations that depend on each other equally
Sense.TRAN: 〔人与人之间或机构之间平等的〕互相依赖（关系）

Sense.DEF: the relationship between different living things that depend on each other
a symbiotic relationship is one in which the people, organizations, or living things involved depend on each other
Sense.TRAN: 〔人﹑组织或生物〕互相依赖的﹐共生的

Sense.DEF: a picture or shape that has a particular meaning or represents a particular organization or idea
Sense.EXAMPLE: The symbol on the packet is a guarantee that the food has been produced organically.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 包装盒上的这个标识保证这种食物是有机生产的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dove is a symbol of peace.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸽子是和平的象征。

Sense.DEF: a letter, number, or sign that represents a sound, an amount, a chemical substance etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fe is the chemical symbol for iron.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: Fe是铁的化学符号。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that represents a particular quality or idea
Sense.TRAN: 〔某一特性或思想的〕代表﹐代表性的人[物]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Space exploration provides a symbol of national pride.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 太空探索是民族自豪感的一种象征。

Sense.DEF: a symbolic action is important because of what it represents but may not have any real effect

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The protest was a symbolic gesture of anger at official policy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次抗议是对官方政策极度不满的一种表示。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a meeting of symbolic importance
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 具有重要象征意义的一次会议

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was a largely symbolic gesture from a government trying to win support.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这在很大程度上是政府希望赢得支持所作出的象征性姿态。

Sense.DEF: representing a particular idea or quality
Sense.EXAMPLE: Each element of the ceremony has a symbolic meaning .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仪式的每一个元素都具有象征意义。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Today’s fighting is symbolic of the chaos which the country is facing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天的冲突体现了国家所面临的混乱局面。

Sense.DEF: using or involving symbols
Sense.EXAMPLE: A map is a form of symbolic representation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 地图是一种符号呈现物。

Sense.DEF: the use of symbols to represent ideas or qualities
Sense.EXAMPLE: religious symbolism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宗教象征主义

Sense.DEF: if something symbolizes a quality, feeling etc, it represents it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Crime often symbolizes a wider social problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯罪问题往往反映出更广泛的社会问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Growing discontent has been symbolized by the protests.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与日俱增的不满通过一次又一次的抗议表现出来。

Sense.DEF: an object or design that is symmetrical has two halves that are exactly the same shape and size
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pattern was perfectly symmetrical.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该图案完全对称。

Sense.DEF: the quality of being symmetrical

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the symmetry of the design
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 图案的对称性

Sense.DEF: the quality that a situation has when two events or actions seem to be balanced or equal in some way
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a certain symmetry to coming back to New York, where I started my artistic life all those years ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人生的经历似乎是对称的﹐我又回到了纽约﹐那里是我早年开始艺术生涯的地方。

Sense.DEF: caring and feeling sorry about someone’s problems
Sense.TRAN: 表示同情的﹔有同情心的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sympathetic friend
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个有同情心的朋友
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sympathetic attitude
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种同情的态度

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m sympathetic to parents who are worried about what their children see on television.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很同情那些担心孩子所看电视内容的家长。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We hope always to provide a friendly sympathetic ear someone willing to listen to someone else’s problems .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望总能做到友善地倾听。

Sense.DEF: willing to give approval and support to an aim or plan
Sense.TRAN: 〔对某目的或计划〕赞成的﹐支持的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Senator Capp is very sympathetic to environmental issues.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 参议员卡普对环境问题十分支持。

Sense.DEF: someone in a book, play etc who most people like
Sense.TRAN: 〔书﹑戏剧等中〕令人喜爱的人物/角色

Sense.DEF: providing the right conditions for someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sympathetic environment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 合适的环境

Exponent.DEF: kind to someone who is having problems
Exponent.TRAN: 表示同情的,有同情心的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My friends were very sympathetic when I lost my job.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我失业后,朋友们都非常同情我。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Jill was a very sympathetic listener.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉尔常满怀同情地倾听别人诉说。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a sympathetic attitude
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 同情的态度

Exponent.DEF: wanting to help people who are suffering or having problems
Exponent.TRAN: 充满怜悯的,表示同情的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The doctor was a compassionate man who always acted in his patients’ best interests.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位医生很有同情心,总是从病人的最大利益出发实施治疗。

Exponent.DEF: not getting angry with someone or criticizing them, because you can see that they have problems
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I have had a lot of time off work, but my boss is very understanding.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有很长时间没上班,好在老板十分理解。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an understanding look
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 理解的表情

Exponent.DEF: caring about other people’s feelings and wanting to help them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I have very caring parents.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的父母很体贴。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Most of the nurses are very caring.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 护士大多非常有爱心。

Sense.DEF: to feel sorry for someone because you understand their problems
Sense.EXAMPLE: I sympathize, but I don’t know how to help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很同情﹐但不知道如何帮忙。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can sympathize with those who have lost loved ones.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我同情那些失去至爱的人。

Sense.DEF: to support someone’s ideas or actions

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The public sympathized with the miners’ strike.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公众支持矿工罢工。

Sense.DEF: someone who supports the aims of an organization or political party
Sense.EXAMPLE: The anti-abortion rally attracted many sympathizers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 反堕胎集会吸引了很多支持者。

Sense.DEF: the feeling of being sorry for someone who is in a bad situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have a lot of sympathy for her; she had to bring up the children on her own.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我非常同情她——她得独自把孩子抚养成人。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have absolutely no sympathy for students who get caught cheating in exams.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对考试作弊被抓到的学生绝不同情。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Our sympathies are with the families of the victims.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们向受害者家庭表示慰问。

Sense.DEF: belief in or support for a plan, idea, or action, especially a political one

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Willard is in sympathy with many Green Party issues.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 威拉德对许多绿党的议题表示支持。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Her sympathies lie firmly with the Conservative Party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坚决支持保守党。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Matheson is known for his pro-socialist sympathies.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马西森以支持社会主义著称。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sullivan expressed sympathy for the striking federal workers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 沙利文对正在罢工的联邦政府雇员表示支持。

Sense.DEF: a feeling that you understand someone because you are similar to them
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was no personal sympathy between them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们之间全无相投之处。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It’s hard not to feel sympathy for the losing team.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 很难不同情输掉的球队。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Everyone there expressed their sympathy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那儿的每一个人都表达了同情。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I thought at least I’d get some sympathy from you.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想至少能得到你的同情。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He doesn’t deserve any sympathy – it's his own fault.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他根本不值得同情——那是他自己的错。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make someone feel sorry for you in order to get an advantage for yourself
used when someone is upset after a death
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: （最）深切的同情〔用于死者亲友〕
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We’d like to offer our deepest sympathy to Hilda and her family.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们谨向希尔达及其家人表达最深切的慰问。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I have great sympathy for the people affected by the housing crisis.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我非常同情那些受楼市危机影响的人。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We are grateful for all the messages of sympathy we have received.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于收到的所有慰问信,我们心怀感激。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: feel very sorry for someone – often used when you have had a similar experience yourself
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I have every sympathy for people who find it hard to give up smoking.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于那些难以戒烟的人,我感同身受。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used when saying that you feel sorry for someone
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It must be difficult – you have my sympathy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一定很难——我真同情你。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’d like to extend my deepest sympathy to the victim’s family.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我谨向受害者的家人表示最深切的慰问。

Collocate.COLLOC: my/our sympathy goes out to sb

Sense.DEF:
a long piece of music usually in four parts, written for an
orchestra
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bruckner’s Fifth Symphony
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布鲁克纳的《第五交响曲》

Sense.DEF:
a large group of
classical
musicians led by a
conductor
a formal meeting in which people who know a lot about a particular subject have discussions about it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a symposium on women’s health
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 女性健康研讨会

Sense.DEF: a group of articles on a particular subject collected together in a book
something wrong with your body or mind which shows that you have a particular illness

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Common symptoms of diabetes are weight loss and fatigue.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 糖尿病的常见症状是消瘦和疲劳。

Sense.DEF: a sign that a serious problem exists

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The disappearance of jobs is a symptom of a deeper socioeconomic change.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作岗位减少是社会经济发生进一步变化的一个征兆。

Sense.DEF: if a situation or type of behaviour is symptomatic of something, it shows that a serious problem exists

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The rise in unemployment is symptomatic of a general decline in the economy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业率上升是经济全面衰退的征兆。

Sense.DEF: showing that someone has a particular illness
together
Sense.EXAMPLE: a synthesis
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 综合体

Sense.DEF: a medical condition which makes people experience a mixture of feelings from two of their five senses at the same time, for example seeing numbers as colours or experiencing colours as a smell
Sense.TRAN: 联觉〔跨越感官的感知现象〕

Sense.DEF: a building where Jewish people meet for religious worship
the place where nerve cells meet, especially in the brain

Subsense.DEF: if things are in sync, they are working well together at exactly the same time and speed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The two mechanisms have to work in sync.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 两台机械装置必须同步工作。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The soundtrack is not quite in sync with the picture.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 音轨和画面不太同步。

Subsense.DEF: matching or in agreement
Subsense.TRAN: （与某事物/某人）协调的﹐一致的
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a celebrity who is in sync with young people’s lifestyles
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活方式和年轻人同步的一位名人
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The President is in sync with Thompson’s views on many issues.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统在很多问题上都和汤普森观点一致。

Subsense.DEF: if things are out of sync, they are not working well together at exactly the same time and speed
not matching or not in agreement
Subsense.TRAN: （与某事物/某人）不协调的﹐不一致的

Sense.DEF: to arrange for two or more things to happen at exactly the same time, or to happen at the same time or in the same way as something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hardest part was syncing the music to the video.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最难的部分就是使音乐和图像同步。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wait for the computer to synch up with your command.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等待电脑执行你的指令。

Sense.DEF: when two or more events happen at the same time or place and seem to be connected in some way
to happen at exactly the same time, or to arrange for two or more actions to happen at exactly the same time

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Businesses must synchronize their production choices with consumer choices.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 企业的产品品类必须与消费者的选择保持一致。

Sense.DEF: to make two or more watches show exactly the same time
Sense.TRAN: 校准〔两个或多个〕钟表﹔对表

Sense.DEF: a sport in which swimmers move in patterns in the water to music
if two or more things are synchronous, they happen at the same time or work at the same speed

syncopated music has a
rhythm
in which the beats that are usually weak are emphasized
Sense.TRAN: 切分的﹐切分音乐的〔节拍强弱倒置〕

Sense.DEF:
a
rhythm
in a line of music in which the beats that are usually weak are emphasized
a political system in which workers control industry, or a belief in this type of system
a group of people or companies who join together in order to achieve a particular aim
Sense.TRAN: 辛迪加﹐商业财团﹐企业联合组织

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a syndicate of banks
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 银行财团

Sense.DEF: to arrange for written work, photographs etc to be sold to a number of different newspapers, magazines etc
Sense.TRAN: 安排出售〔文章﹑照片等〕给多家报刊发表
Sense.EXAMPLE: His column is syndicated throughout America.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的专栏文章在全美各地的报刊发表。

Sense.DEF: an illness which consists of a set of physical or mental problems – often used in the name of illnesses
Sense.TRAN: 综合征 〔常用于疾病名称〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: people who suffer from irritable bowel syndrome
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 患有肠道过敏综合征的人

Sense.DEF: a set of qualities, events, or types of behaviour that is typical of a particular kind of problem
Sense.TRAN: 〔标明某类问题的〕一组典型特征[事件﹐行为]
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘The underdog syndrome’ is a belief that things are beyond your control.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “弱者综合征”就是认为凡事不由自己控制。

Sense.DEF: the additional effectiveness when two or more companies or people combine and work together
an important meeting of church members
a word with the same meaning as another word in the same language

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Shut’ is a synonym of ‘closed’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: shut是closed的同义词。

Sense.DEF: something that is synonymous with something else is considered to be very closely connected with it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nixon’s name has become synonymous with political scandal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼克松的名字成了政治丑闻的代名词。

Sense.DEF: two words that are synonymous have the same meaning
a short description of the main events or ideas in a book, film etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a synopsis of the play
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 剧情梗概

Sense.DEF: relating to syntax
Sense.EXAMPLE: syntactic structure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 句法结构

Sense.DEF: the way words are arranged to form sentences or phrases, or the rules of grammar which control this
the rules that describe how words and phrases are used in a computer language
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机语言中使用的〕句法规则﹐语法

Sense.DEF: a synthesizer
something that has been made by combining different things, or the process of combining things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a synthesis of Eastern and Western philosophical ideas
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 东西方哲学思想的结合

Sense.DEF: the act of making a chemical or biological substance

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the synthesis of proteins
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 蛋白质的合成

Sense.DEF: the production of sounds, speech, or music electronically
Sense.TRAN: 〔用电子方式对声音﹑语音或音乐的〕合成
Sense.EXAMPLE: speech synthesis software
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 语音合成软件

Sense.DEF: to make something by combining different things or substances
Sense.EXAMPLE: DDT is a pesticide that was first synthesized in 1874.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 滴滴涕是最初合成于1874年的杀虫剂。

Sense.DEF: to combine separate things into a complete whole
to produce sounds, speech, or music electronically
Sense.TRAN: 〔用合成器〕合成〔声音﹑语音或音乐〕

Sense.DEF: an electronic instrument that produces the sounds of various musical instruments
Sense.TRAN: 〔电子〕音响合成器﹔电声合成器

Sense.DEF: an actor who seems like a real person, but who is an image made using a computer
produced by combining different artificial substances, rather than being naturally produced
Sense.EXAMPLE: synthetic chemicals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 合成化学品

Sense.DEF: substances or materials, especially cloth, that are made using a chemical process
Sense.TRAN: 合成物﹔合成剂﹔合成纤维[织物]

Sense.DEF: a very serious disease that is passed from one person to another during sexual activity

a British spelling of
siphon
an instrument for taking blood from someone’s body or putting liquid, drugs etc into it, consisting of a hollow plastic tube and a needle
to clean something with a syringe, for example your ears
a thick sticky sweet liquid, eaten on top of or mixed with other foods
Sense.EXAMPLE: ice cream and maple syrup
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 枫糖浆冰激凌

Sense.DEF: sweet liquid made from sugar and water, used in cans of fruit
thick and sticky like syrup, or containing syrup
Sense.EXAMPLE: a syrupy liquid
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 糖浆般黏稠的液体

Sense.DEF: too nice or kind in a way that seems insincere – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 太甜蜜的﹔过于多情的〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a syrupy speech
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一番煽情的话

Sense.DEF:
a
system administrator
a group of related parts that work together as a whole for a particular purpose
Sense.EXAMPLE: an alarm system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警报系统
Sense.EXAMPLE: a well-designed heating system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 设计良好的供暖系统
Sense.EXAMPLE: the digestive system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消化系统
Sense.EXAMPLE: the railway system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铁路系统

Sense.DEF: an organized set of ideas, methods, or ways of working
Sense.TRAN: 体制﹐制度﹔一套办法﹐一套工作方法

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’ve got a good system for dealing with complaints from customers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有一套处理顾客投诉的良好制度。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t understand your filing system.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不明白你们的归档方法。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Under the present system, we do not have any flexibility.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在现行体制下﹐我们没有一点灵活性。

Sense.DEF: a group of computers that are connected to each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: The system has crashed stopped working .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 系统崩溃了。

Sense.DEF: someone’s body – used when you are talking about its medical or physical condition
Sense.TRAN: 某人的身体（状况） 〔用于谈论病情或身体状况〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: All this overeating is not good for my system.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么大吃大喝对我的身体不好。

Sense.DEF: used, sometimes humorously, to say that you are ready to do something or that something is ready to happen
Sense.TRAN: 一切就绪〔有时为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: the official rules and powerful organizations that restrict what you can do
Sense.TRAN: 〔限制个人自由的〕既成秩序﹐现行体制﹐制度
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can’t beat the system .
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你无法超越现行体制。

Sense.LEXUNIT: get sth out of your system
Sense.DEF: to do something that helps you get rid of unpleasant strong feelings
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was furious, so I went for a run to get it out of my system.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我非常愤怒﹐便去跑步来消气。

Sense.DEF: the use of sensible and organized methods
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need a bit more system in the way we organize our files.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的档案管理应该更有条理些。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANING 义项 2

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It was a highly effective system of communication.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一套高效的通信系统。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He described the tax system as inefficient and unfair.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说这套税收系统效率低下﹐有失公平。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The Australian health care system is extremely complex.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 澳大利亚的医疗保健体系极为复杂。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The Environment Agency has developed a new national flood warning system.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 环境署已开发了一套新的全国洪灾预警系统。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The government has introduced a system of student loans.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府已开始实施一套助学贷款制度。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They decided to adopt the electoral system used in Britain.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们决定采用英国使用的选举制度。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They use a system of grades to evaluate each hospital’s performance.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们使用一套分级系统来评估每家医院的情况。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He tried to explain how the planning system operates.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他试图解释这套规划系统是如何运作的。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 使系统现代化/改革系统
一套政府/教育/司法等体制
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Why was Britain so slow to develop a national system of education?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 为什么英国发展全国教育体制的速度如此缓慢？

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to look after a computer system which has many users, for example a LAN
organized carefully and done thoroughly
Sense.TRAN: 系统化的﹐有条理的﹐细致周到的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a systematic approach to solving the problem
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对这个问题采取的有条不紊的解决方法
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a systematic way of organizing your work
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 井然有序的工作安排方式

Sense.DEF: to put facts, numbers, ideas etc into a particular order
affecting the whole of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: a systemic disease
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一种全身性疾病
Sense.EXAMPLE: a systemic insecticide
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 内吸杀虫剂
Sense.EXAMPLE: Corruption in the police force is systemic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察部门集体腐败。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to study a company’s computer needs and provide them with suitable software and equipment

the place where the clock and some
icon s small pictures that are used to start a particular operation
are shown on a computer screen
Sense.TRAN: 系统托盘〔计算机屏幕上显示时钟和一些图标的地方〕
